Reviews.Title: “Top Notch Resort”
Reviews.Author: Blake99
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have stayed here and once again it was amazing. Your first impression in the lobby will blow your mind. Open, spacious and a live band playing on the second level over looking you as you walk in. The grounds and buildings are immaculate. A great view of the Magic Kingdom's firework show across the water. (probably even better than standing in the crowd in the park) The "turn down service" at night was provided to us by a great lady named Latoya. She always left the best towel creatures that brought a smile to our face each night. Nice that they have a place open 24 hours so you can get that late night snack. Rates are a little steep, but if we find the right deal, we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Laura is a jewel :)”
Reviews.Author: FrederikK
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to WDW and staying at the Grand Floridian made our trip even more memorable! The atmosphere is really extraordinary and the settings are beautiful. Laura, our concierge was extremely helpful and had our room made ready 4 hours before check in time. Her professionalism, kindness, humour just made our day :) Thank you Laura and Disney -keep up the good work.

Reviews.Title: “A "Magical" Time”
Reviews.Author: 145Barb
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a week at the Grand Floridian with our 4 year old twin grandchildren. A lovely representative met us at the door of the hotel and escorted us to our rooms and provided us with a packet of information and cards to admit us to the parks. The staff was gracious, friendly, and efficient, without being obtrusive. Our room was cleaned twice a day. We booked a concierge room, which worked out beautifully for the kids. We were able to get quick breakfasts and be on our way to the parks. Having the monorail in the resort was a plus. The kids also loved the pools. We also hired a guide for the Magic Kingdom, who was wonderful! We rented strollers from Orlando Stroller Company that were perfect for our grandchildren and easy to use. They were waiting for us at the hotel when we arrived. Disney Destinations took care of our luggage and provided transport to and from the airport. We had a fantastic time! Our travel arrangements were made by Jennifer at TripGuy <jennifer@tripguy.com>

Reviews.Title: “Better Service and Improved Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Fomc
Reviews.Content: We stayed here some 12 years ago and loved this hotel but were very dissapponited when we returned 5 years ago, as rooms just looked shabby and hotel had the feel of just needing a good cleanup/refurb. I was very relucktant to stay here again but as all the other hotels on my list were fully booked due to this being a last minute addistion to our holiday.I was not expecting much and really annoyed at having to spend so much money on a hotel that I felt was way too expensive, in terms of quality and service we had previuosly experienced. What a pleasant surprise to find our rooms totally refurbished and the staff back to being extremely friendly, helpful and courteous. The Resort looked spick and span, service was excellent and the food great. I would go back to recommending this hotel as it certainly is VERY convenient for those whose main attraction at Disney is Magic Kingdom, as you get there in 2 minutes on the monorail. It is quite far away from Downtown Disney and other theme parks but there is a free bus service to these and this rums every 20 minutes from Hotel, making everything accessible. A most enjoyable stay..

Reviews.Title: “Disney Experience”
Reviews.Author: Liz S
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped off the plane in Orlando, with our parents and two children, our trip was wonderful. The hotel and travel agent, Jennifer Toren at jennifer@tripguy.com took care of everyting for us from the baggage, to the transportation, to the great service and amazingly friendly staff. They were so accomodatng and every request we made was met promptly and with a smile. The pools were perfect for a late afternoon swim with the kids, and the property was impeccably manicured. In my opinion, the food was simply average but I went into the trip knowing not to expect too much from the meals. I was able to truly appreciate the proximity to the monorail and the Disney parks. Having strollers with us everywhere we went, this was a must. I would definitely reccommend The Grand Floridian to anyone who is planning a family vacation to DisneyWorld in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Grandest Hotel at WDW”
Reviews.Author: MalOVision
Reviews.Content: If the pricing of the monorail resorts weren't so steep, I would stay at the Grand Floridian every year at Christmastime. The decorations were gorgeous. The cast members were pleasant and helpful, and you can't beat the location. It's only one monorail stop from Magic Kingdom and an easy 10 minute walk to the Polynesian resort and 15 minute walk to the Transportation and Ticket Center for Epcot monorail access. I know that many travelers are not impressed with the theming at the Grand, but I like it a lot. It's classic, pretty, and light.

Reviews.Title: “Define Grand..”
Reviews.Author: hippiemoose
Reviews.Content: I see a lot of other reviews on here and see many people talking about it's great proximity and easy access to the Magic Kingdom. That is wonderful but does not say much about the property itself. There are also other resorts that have pretty easy access to the MK like any resort that is on the monorail system but again, that does not tell me about the resort. We been there on a couple of occasions as for the past 20+ years we have gone to Disney almost every year. I think you see the small things that change over time when you go more often then when you have time spaced out between visits. It's like planting a seed. Seeing it a month later and then seeing the whole plant a year later. This resort USED to be for the elite only. You would see children but they were not your average run of the mill children, they would be walking around with their GF bathrobes on and the lobby would even have that "richness" about it. No so much anymore. It has become just another resort except you pay a lot more. I feel very highly that you should get what you pay for and I do not feel that you get this with the GF. If you took the time to stay at other disney resorts or just visited them you would see what I was talking about. Things are not as clean and pristine as they once were. Sure the outside of this resort is Grand and picturesque, but inside you will find soiled and torn carpet, walls that need to be repainted and rooms that have certainly seen there day and are in need of a complete overhaul. There are many choices that one can stay at on Disney property if one chooses. All come with some benefits. Just know that if you are going to pay the prices of the GF and think you are going to have more of a quiet vacation or upscale vacation than staying at say the Polynesian or Wilderness Lodge for that matter it is not going to happen. It has become a park inside itself as it is.. noisy and kids running all about. One would think for this kind of money that you would not find that, but you will. Just be aware and if you don't mind that then your fine. But the rooms and such do need some upkeep work for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful common areas, rooms need help”
Reviews.Author: Brycesmommy
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently enjoyed a week in DisneyWorld, staying at The Grand Floridian. The common areas (lobby, restaurants, etc) are stunning! The rooms...not so much. Our room was tiny and VERY dated. Furniture was banged up, bath fixtures were old, carpet was stained. Just REALLY needs an update! It's too bad because this is a gorgeous property and supposedly, the cream of the crop as far as Disney hotels in Orlando. We had a blast on our vacation but I would not recommend this resort considering the price.

Reviews.Title: “Great place, great times”
Reviews.Author: LCMORENO
Reviews.Content: I went to this place on april 2012 for my sisters birthday. We are a family of 5 with my parents, me (25) my sister (21) and the birthday girl, who turned 11. The staff is friendly all the time and they will do almost about everything to make the most of your stay. When we got to the front desk they gave us all I'm celebrating buttons and a birthday button for my sister. When we asked for an upgrade they checked and gave it to me for free!! I had lake view at no extra cost. They gave us a resort map and took us to our room in a very nice cart. There are hidden mickeys and disney characters everywhere and you get a lot of fun looking for them. Once at our room (we chose to stay all together like the old times) we got two queen beds and a duvet, so we were all comfortable. And a little balcony too. For my surprise, there was NO minibar, just a fridge. I had no idea that they emptied every mini room at disneys resorts. I love getting in the room and taking an ice cold beer, didn't happened. But the room itself was pretty and the turndown service was great too. There are two pools, one of them works 24 hours, which is great to swim after doing the parks. There are specialty shops and restaurants, which you have to book really in advance. You get all disney transportation buses, monorail and boat to go everywhere disney. We ate at the 1900 cafe and it was pretty decent, but not a top breakfast. You get disney characters to take pictures and stuff, which is really funny. I don't have much of a complaint but I like more movement and people seeing, so I preferred the contemporary resort.

Reviews.Title: “Well at least you are on the property....”
Reviews.Author: duggifresh
Reviews.Content: Ok.... so Disney is all about the kid’s right? It's a good thing because if you are looking for a high end hotel experience like the Ritz don’t stay here. We did 4 nights club level in the main building for about $800 a night. We decided to do club level (see fireworks every night) so we could let our young children snack on and off without having to do the meal plan and have them waste a bunch of fried food..My kids are not the best eaters. The club level food and drink was nice and they also usually had healthy choices available. 2 big gripes about club level..Why are there cans of soda etc available but no bottled water and why is there only beer and wine available for 3 hours a day? Hint-by any adult beverages you would like for your room or poolside from the gift shop not the bar. We stayed in the main building club level which is kinda weird. They figured out after the place was built that you could see the castle from this area. It was originally supposed to be offices so there is a separate entrance and elevator. The rooms are fine I guess. You can tell they are in constant use and a bit run down by any ordinary higher end hotel standard but hey you are on property right? The main areas of the hotel are a big step up from the actual rooms. Pools are nice and music at night in the very large main lobby is nice to relax and listen. I would also say the staff was very friendly and offered to help at all times with any requests we had. My wife did use the club level concierge quite a bit ahead of time and while we were there to get us in places to eat and activities for our kids that we would normally have had trouble getting into-Princess Breakfast anyone? It is convenient being on the monorail and the boat back to the hotel was also very nice. Friends went 3 weeks before us and stayed at the contemporary and said it was just dreadful compared to when they visited the GF for a day. So I would say if staying on the property is your goal (there are benefits, magic hours etc.) this is the place to stay. Yes the GF was more expensive than the other properties but I couldn’t see spending all this money at Disney in general and being in a lower level hotel. One big thing I’d like to mention. They give you a card to charge all your stuff on during your stay anywhere at Disney what they don’t tell you is they set some arbitrary limit not based on the credit card you give them limit etc. We charged everything on it and we basically hit the limit the night before we left at dinner. Not that big a deal but it would have been nice to know-suppose we were not carrying other forms of payment when the dinner bill arrived? My feelings about the whole Disney experience is best left to another review but hey it’s all about the kids. Next time we go in a few years we will be staying off site so as to enjoy more of the resorts amenities. By then at least my kids will be older than 2½ and 5½.

Reviews.Title: “amazing hotel in superb location”
Reviews.Author: DAVID H
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this hotel twice and it is perfectly situated for an amazing time in Disney. The hotel itself is absolutely amazing, the staff, rooms, pool area and location make it the must stay place in a visit to Disney. We found that you could visit one of the parks, come back to the hotel to eat and laze by the pool and then freshen up before visiting another park, everything was so convenient and the staff were fantastic and couldn't do enough for you...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Quick Access to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: IllinoisLovetotravel
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled with our son, his wife and our two young grandchildren to Disney World this April. We chose to stay at the Grand Floridian because of its close proximity to the Magic Kingdom. We had adjoining rooms - which was perfect for us because the parents could be in our room while the children napped. The rooms were clean, well-appointed and spacious enough for our needs. A small refrigerator in the room was a big plus for us. The climate control and shower were great - and we loved having double sinks. The hotel and property itself was lovely - many nice amenities, including two pools. The spa is being rebuilt, so that was not available. All staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. We visited three of the restaurants at the Grand Floridian - Park Faire (for a buffet character breakfast - characters get an "A", food was a "C"); Gasparilla (a cafeteria-style eatery with snacks, sandwiches, fresh fruit, ice cream, drinks, including beer & wine, available - very handy; perfect for an easy, quick breakfast); and the Floridian Cafe (table service, good salads, sandwiches, drinks - in my opinion, the best lunch spot on the property). Easy one-stop to get to the Magic Kingdom on the monorail (which stops at the front door). Especially nice was a great view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks at 10pm from a table in front of the Gasparilla Grille. We've stayed at the Yacht Club, Beach Club, Polynesian and Grand Floridian - in our opinion, this is the nicest of those four Disney properties...but if you will mostly visit Epcot, stay at the Beach or Yacht Club because those are nice, and you can walk into Epcot from those hotels. If you are with young ones who will spend most of the time at the Magic Kingdom, then the Polynesian, Contemporary or Grand Floridian are the best choices...once you are there and staying on property, you really want to minimize the time it takes to travel from your hotel to the theme park of your choice...because it can consume a lot of time, especially during crowded times.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what to expect from Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: travel-happy08
Reviews.Content: Return visit. Great location, BOOK ALL RESTAURANTS IN ADVANCE!!!! 3 nights plenty. Needs updating. Beds are on the small side. Sleep 4, 5 is a push!

Reviews.Title: “Just ok”
Reviews.Author: disney43
Reviews.Content: Went here for my wife's birthday and parents anniversary ... Had to change rooms twice ... Very grand but not worth the money ... Went to beach club last time will return there again ..

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Craigzzz
Reviews.Content: Stayed here first week of January with the family. Nice hotel, but as always with Disney room is pretty standard compared to other chains. Very clean room though and you are paying for location, which can't be beat here. Only advice is to avoid marathon weekend at all costs. You basically can't move around to the parks until around 11. Our concierge gave us some advice on how to get around the marathon traffic and get to Animal Kingdom, and it couldn't have been more wrong. 2.5 hours wasted making that trip...

Reviews.Title: “Not so Grand?”
Reviews.Author: JLands
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 day stay and I have very mixed feelings. Should expectations be really high for a Disney property? I really didnt know, We made these plans two weeks prior to our visit so we had no idea what to expect. I will say that upon arrival the Valet staff to the bell staff, front desk/check in to housekeeping, Management etc... Everyone could not have been nicer and more professional. The grounds are beautiful and the hotel itself is really nicely manicured and clean. In fact, spotless. The location was also ideal for a 2 stop ride on the monorail too. Now the down side. The rooms are cramped with very outdated furniture, carpet and bathroom facility. Yes you dont spend much time in the room but at least you want to feel good about coming back to your room. The shower/bath tub was not only dangerous but the water pressure was next to nil and the shower head was gross. The carpet needs to be changed, it is very out dated. The curtains and bed spread? Awful. In fact we told house keeping to take the spreads away and not bring them back. The beds were pretty comfortable and sheets clean but not that inviting. I understand that the hotel gets an enormous amount of traffic and wear and tear but all of this should be upgraded. The whole package was not cheap but the whole Disney experience for the kids is worth it. The pool area was pretty large and plenty of chairs. The bar area was great too. We did not eat in any of the restaurants. Breakfast room service for the kids was great. We are pretty spoiled vacationers so I have to say this was not the lap of luxury but a great Disney experience

Reviews.Title: “Service was Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: summersue
Reviews.Content: This review is a little late so I apoligize for that! My then boyfriend (now husband) and I travelled here this past May. We stayed in the Sugarloaf building which is a concierge building. I couldn't have been happier with our room and location. The food selection and beverages were great to have all day - especially the happy hour which provided wine, champagne, beer, cheese, etc. This was a very special trip for us b/c we got engaged here!! My boyfriend actually proposed on the Grand One (Grand Floridian's yacht) during the fireworks. It was so magical for me as I am a Disney buff and have been to Disneyworld more than 10 times. The concierge staff was so helpful to him (I later learned!) and for that we were very grateful. After the engagment, when we returned to our room, there were rose petals leading up to the doorway. Once inside, there was a note from Mickey and a small bottle of champagne. It was just perfect. Kent, Denny and Janice were so fabulous to both of us. My husband was so happy with the assistance he received, he sent an email to WDW communications to let them know. I can not comment too much on the restaurants there as we mostly ate in the parks or the food in the concierge building. I have stayed here before tho and mostly everywhere was great. If there are any questions, I would be happy to help out. I like to think I know alot about Disneyworld! LOL.I have stayed also at the Wilderness Lodge which is one of my favorites, the Swan and the Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience but Pricey”
Reviews.Author: ReedDw
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel, we noted there was a lot of staff to assist us with check-in, far more than the numbers of guests actually checking in which was pretty impressive. The clerk could have asked us if this was our first stay and given us more info about the property. The room is not fancy but very comfortable. The staff at the counter service restaurant was very friendly and helpful, but I wish there were more counter service locations on the property that just the one. The property is very clean and well-maintained. It feels like there is more staff than guests which gives it a more luxurious feel. If you are visiting Magic Kingdom, it is the best location possible due to the monorail stop at the property that is literally 2 minutes to the park. I wish I had known we could walk to the transportation center and back to save a little time when traveling to and from Epcot. The night before check-out we asked if we could check out a little late but were told "no" as they were booked the next night. That did not quite make sense to me. Half way through our visit we discovered a 2nd pool with slide were not informed of and found it odd that this pool has lifeguards but the main pool does not. The biggest issue I have with this property is that it is very expensive for even the lowest priced room. Due to our schedule our stay was during high season for 5 nights beginning March 28 so that made the room even more expensive. If i had an unlimited budget I would definitely stay here again, but next time we will probably stay at the one of the lower priced properties since we spend most of our time in the parks and not at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed feelings”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBeans
Reviews.Content: Any review of a Disney property always needs to be looked at in the context of "is this the best way to spend $5,000+ to go to DisneyWorld" and not in the context of "is this the best vacation I can get for $5,000+". I can name dozens of places where your money gets you better value, but I can't think of too many places that get you the Disney experience a Disney property provides. However, even with that lens, it remains hard for me to understand why so many people like this place. I get it, location, location, location. But it comes at a huge price. Let's start with the good, which must begin with location. The property is across the lake from Magic Kingdom and every major Disney attraction is a short monorail or bus ride away. You also get early or late access to certain parks on certain days - that might be worth the price alone. The resort grounds are impeccable. Nothing remains cleaner than a Disney property. You want magical? Go to a Disney washroom and try and figure out how they are kept so clean! The people are great - friendly doesn't begin to describe it (5 star friendliness actually). And admit it, spending your day looking for Disney characters in the tiles, carpets, draperies and linens is kind of fun. The resort also makes it fairly easy to access other activities and services. For example, we were able to book decent tee times at the Palm golf course with only 24 hours notice. Club rentals were free for resort guests, as was the cab ride there and back (although you can walk to the course - it's not more than a mile walk from door to door). Renting a car was easy too - we called up the concierge, they made the arrangements and a van came to pick us up to take us to the car centre (and dropped us back at the resort when we were done). If you happen to have one of the few rooms that overlooks the park you will get a great view of the nightly fireworks. The downside? Room decor is tacky. We're not big fans of Victorian to begin with but this resort looked like some bad, trippy 1980's version of Victorian. The rooms show the wear and tear with furnishings and carpets looking faded and tired. Whoever thinks the linens and pillows are luxurious hasn't stayed in a luxury resort - the sheets weren't quite scratchy but they were close and you could make a better pillow by throwing some old rags in a potato sack. Regular rooms are cramped and you can hear your neighbours! We stayed one evening in a regular room at Sugar Loaf and were kept up fairly late by people coming into the lobby area (the lobby is open to all four floors - if your room is adjacent to that area, even four floors up, you will hear everything that happens in the lobby). We stayed the rest of the week in an one bedroom suite in Sago Cay. Generous sized room but for over $1,000 a night it's very pricey based on furnishings alone (think motelish like furnishings!). Other disappointments? Food for one. Average at best and very pricey. The two pools were okay, although the large pool has little shade. Hence the mixed feelings. If you want to excite the kids, make them feel special and have quick and easy access to Disney's parks - it's hard to beat the Floridian. But if you want luxurious furnishings and world-class service, well, I can think of many places where your money is better spent. It all comes down to 5 star people and location and 2 star food and furnishings. Sum it up and it's really a 3.5 star place for us but I'd have to admit that it would likely be hard to create a better overall Disney experience if that's what you are looking for.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful surroundings, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: Karen0101
Reviews.Content: Our first visit for 10 years and having traveled widely in that time we were a bit concerned that the hotel may have lost some of it's shine. However the surroundings, location, food and welcome were as good as ever. The elegance and relaxed environment were wonderful after a busy day out. We probably got the worst rooms in the house, in the lobby of one of the outlying buildings, right next to the lift. I guess someone has to have them but I can't help but feel that they should be offered at a lower price. Nevertheless the room itself was clean, comfortable and well cared for. We did not really notice the lift and guest noise as we were out most of the time but a family with young children needing an early bedtime should ask to avoid these. The hotel and grounds provide a beautiful location and the proximity to the monorail and Magic Kingdom is perfect. There is some building work going on at the moment but it does not impact on the hotel, also the spa is closed for a while. I hope some of the building will include some expansion of pool areas, these were attractive and well kept but usually the loungers were all occupied. Staff were brilliant, friendly, welcoming and helpful. Pleased to get a turndown service, this was most welcome when we returned late and tired. Prices are high here and yes,you can go elsewhere in the world and get an excellent hotel for a lower price but of course it will not be right next to the Magic Kingdom! We had a wonderful time and will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for a business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Susanne B
Reviews.Content: I just came back from a 4 night stay at the Grand Floridian for a business meeting. I thought it was just perfect. Lovely property, great meeting spaces, nice location for those who brought the family, attentive staff (as is to be expected at Disney), easy bus transportation to lots of sights. The rooms are a little old fashioned - but that goes with the style of the hotel. I loved it and could have stayed another week!

Reviews.Title: “oooh dear!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Simon W
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival at the Hotel we were really pleased and our children said "Wow". Upon checking in we were told that our room wasn't ready so we went off to Hollywood Studios. once we arrived in our room it's fair to say we were disappointed to find all 5 of us sleeping in the same room within an 8 feet area. my daughter had to sleep on a fold down bed which is not ideal. so we booked for 5 people....3 adults and 2 children as we checked our room we found only 2 coffee cups and only enough coffee for 2. Add the fact we only had 2 bath gowns/dressing gowns clearly the room wasn't prepared as I should have been. oh and one of the bedside light bulbs had died. I'm getting bored typing now.....suffice to say we paid just under £1000 for two nights in this hotel and were very disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: pelican33
Reviews.Content: We had a balcony room in the main building with a view of the Magic Kingdom Castle and fireworks. They have a great pool. And the monorail stops here frequently. The service was great. The food at Narcoossee's was also great. The only negative was that the carpet could have fresher; possibly shampooed.

Reviews.Title: “Can't Beat the Location”
Reviews.Author: MNtoAnywhere
Reviews.Content: This is our second stay at the Grand Floridian. It is a great hotel and you really can't beat the location. We had an amazing room this time on the 4th floor of the Conch Key building with a view of the Magic Kingdom. Something to be said for watching the fireworks from your balcony then putting the young ones straight to bed without having to fight the crowds leaving the park. We were able to get such a great room because we were using some complimentary nights we received from Disney because of some significant issues with our trip a year ago. Disney did a great job of responding to our issues last year, and instead of defending they listened and provided more then enough compensation between comped hotel rooms and park passes. They really did a great job of making me satisfied customer again. Overall the hotel is very nice. Although we did have an amazing room, overall I think the rooms are a bit dated. As with most Disney hotel rooms, they aren't top of the line with amenities, but who is hanging out in their rooms while they're at Disney. The pools are nice, but can be crowded depending on the time of year. The food at the restaurants is OK, but nothing too spectacular. The way that Disney properties differentiate themselves is with the experience. The hotel design and atmosphere are amazing. We've been there during several different seasons, and it's great to see how they decorate and create a holiday ambiance. This year they had a series of these incredible large candy & chocolate eggs on display in the lobby. The whole place seems to adapt with each season. All of the staff are friendly and very helpful. It's hard to describe the atmosphere a resort creates until you are there, but Disney does an incredible job at the Floridian. The other differentiating factor for the Floridian is obviously it's location. I can't tell you how much of a difference it makes to be on the monorail and the lake. It is so quick to get to and from the Magic Kingdom or Epcot. Although the bus transportation at other properties is good, it does add a lot of time to your day getting to and from the parks. Also, all the views from the property and the amenities such as boat rentals make such a difference. One thing to note to all the runners out there. I never was able to find a good running route around the hotel. The route the hotel provides is rather short (about 1.5 miles) and confusing as it takes you through the Polynesian Resort (which is not easy to navitgate). I know it's expensive, but I think the Grand Floridian is worth the price for overall experience and convenience. Where Disney si

Reviews.Title: “A few minor issues - still a world class reosrt!”
Reviews.Author: AMToronto29
Reviews.Content: This resort was great - the staff were friendly, the food was great and the location was amazing if you are planning on spending time at The Magic Kingdom. The pool area was huge, with one side offering a kiddie pool and hottub, and the other side a waterside and waterfall. Our only complaint was that there some minor plumbing issues. The cold water tap in the sink took a while to turn on, and the shower water was cold unless it was run for about 5-10 minutes first. When we asked if they could fix the hot water situation we were told to just run the water for a while before we wanted a shower. Not an ideal fix, but I don't think that should detract from the overall quality of this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Trapped in a time warp”
Reviews.Author: Tadr1
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Grand Floridian for 2 night at the end of March We were traveling with our children ages 9, 16 and 20. We have stayed at the grand Floridian at least 10 times in the past 18 years with friends and family. Our "go to spot" has always been the G/F. The location is the absolute best, one stop from Magic Kingdom via the tram, or there is a boat ride option running directly between the resort and the Magic Kingdom. Location, location, location!!! We booked a 2 bedroom club level suite. The front desk was very efficient when greeting us, but said we were not being put in main building, but an outside building next to a building that had club the club features. Our kids are a bit older, so walking between building is not a big problem, except when it rained The 2 bedroom suite was large enough for us, but, much to my surprise it looks the same as it did the first time we visited 18 years ago. The rooms feel very tired, and the decorating could use some serious updating!!! Really serious updating. As for the "club level" extras, not exactly what expected for the extra cost. Breakfast is busy time, and the waiting around for tables is frustrating. There is no real place for a patron to clear garbage, so there is a bit of waiting around for staff to clean up. The food at breakfast, was the best offering of the day! At other times you could find soda pop or cookies or cans of beer and a few other bottles of alcohol. There were other food offerings like fruit and ???, but often times I felt we were waiting to have things restocked Another thing I was a bit disappointed by during our stay was not being informed about the changes being made to beach area. Seeing cranes and trucks on the sand was not great, but we spent little time at hotel, as we enjoyed the parks while we were there. Our family loves Disney and hope to enjoy it for years to come. Grand Floridian seems to have lost some luster and the perks of the club level suites are very questionable. Great location, and that's why we pick to stay there

Reviews.Title: “I expected perfection for the price”
Reviews.Author: SingaNickel
Reviews.Content: I went for a "milestone" birthday. We booked the castle view room so we paid a bit more. Upon arrival our registration person spoke VERY broken English and was not very proficient in her position. Perhaps she was new. We had several bags and were not assisted at all to our room. After some time wandering around the grounds like pack mules in the 95 degree heat, we discovered it was in the furthest area of the complex.The maps we were given could have been a bit more detailed. The view from the room was not as clear as the photos take for the web. The trees needed to be topped. The balcony was full of baby recluse spiders so it was difficult to be out there to watch the lagoon parade and night firework show over the castle. Even the people in the room next to us were complaining about their balcony experience. We ordered room service also to celebrate. We had 2 crab cakes, fries a club sandwich and a hamburger for a whopping $65. The burger was cold and over cooked and the club toast was rock hard. The crab cakes were great! The room itself had many Disney details in the comforter, the drapes and even the furniture. These were fun to try and find.The pillows were very high and we both had neck aches the next day. Maybe that is a way for them to try and get you to use the spa for a message. They also offer for you to buy their bedding products. The bathroom faucets were pitted, which I never expected to see at Disney and the phone in the bathroom did not work. On our departure, the MOD at the valet area did ask us how our experience was and I said "ok at best". He listened to our disappointments and was kind enough to comp our dinner. Just as a word of CAUTION. Do not get too close to the lake at night. There are several large gators about. There are signs informing you not to swim do to deep water..... I guess that seems more positive than" watch out for the child/man eating gators".They shouldn't come towards you on land but, just be aware as you wander the grounds at evening and night. The positives are that the grounds and common areas are amazing. The restaurants are beautiful ( but be prepared to pay). The spa is located slightly away from the hotel and closer to the wedding chapel.The Concierge level is excellent, but you get what you pay for with Disney most of the time. I would stay there again, but for a steeply discounted price.I expected perfection for the price of over $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sorry, is that pot?”
Reviews.Author: LLWK
Reviews.Content: Let's start off with the TERRIBLE...As I was packing up the night before we left, I was emptying our hamper and when I dumped everything out - along with our dirty laundry appeared a small baggie with a small amount of marijuana and a lighter. Really, Disney, really? When my husband brought this to the attention of the hotel management he was asked "and, how do we know it's not yours?" We had 2 small kids in our room hotel management were accusatory rather than conciliatory. The whole ordeal was not handled how we would have expected it to be in Disney World. Having said that the overall hotel okay but not worth the price. Will we go back - NEVER, EVER - And that is a shame because the food at the hotel was really wonderful and for having spent as much time as we did at Magic Kingdom - you really can't beat the location and view of the nightly fireworks. We stayed concierge level - it was okay good for snacking or picking up a beverage. Room service was also good. Nightly entertainment was also lively and entertaining. Dining at Citricos is a MUST (delicious!). The pools are great and there is space for kids to run and play.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its best”
Reviews.Author: glyndab
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is a beautiful hotel with grade A service. You don't feel like you are in a Disney Hotel until you see the castle in the Magic Kingdom. The grounds are beautiful and well kept, the pools are warm and clean and the rooms are spacious. Best of all is the location - you are a quick trip to the Magic Kingdom and not too far from the other parks. We loved this hotel as three adults traveling there and for a special occasion will go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: KashifMarvi
Reviews.Content: Stayed there recently for 7 nights with my family. What a fabulous place !!. Very close to parks, specially Magical Kingdom. Staff members are extremely friendly and caring. Pool is excellent, specially the Hot pool whcih is opened till 11pm, so that you can have an excellent warm spa after a tiring day at the parks. Transportation to the parks is extremely efficient and professionally maintained, and kids will love going there sometimes thru monorail and sometimes thru the boat. We were extremely pleased that on our departure we were cheked in and handed out our flight boarding passes at the hotel and our lugage taken, tagged and transported without hassle. Imagine when dropped off at the airport you simply walk in to the boarding gate without waiting in the line for boarding ... an amazing service. Hidden secret is an excellent view of the fire works at Magic Kingdom evey evening at 10pm from the hotel, it has an fabulous view you will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Disney vacation”
Reviews.Author: asdl
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a family vacation to Disney. We always stay at the Grand Floridian. This is our 14th year in a row! Atmosphere: Top notch. Love the feel of the resort. It is truly beautiful. Staff: The best of the best. The last two years, we have stayed in Sugar Loaf. Before that, we always stayed in the main building. Every person who has ever helped us has been perfect. Thank you, Disney. Pools: Large and clean. Not many extras, but the children always enjoy them. Food: We ate at breakfast in the Sugar Loaf each morning, though my two boys went next door to the express food area too. Dinner at Citricos was good. Lunch at The Grand Floridian Cafe was good too. Rooms: This is the week spot of the resort. The rooms are very small with a lot of furniture crammed in. It is hard to put your luggage anywhere. A bigger problem are the bathrooms. They are tiny! They still have step in tubs with bad shower curtains. One can barely shut the door when in the bathroom. The sinks are outside the bathroom with dirty carpet around them. I just don't understand how the flagship of Disney can have these conditions. The rooms are worse than a $69 a night highway motel. The rooms never seemed clean. I think its the dated furnishings and carpet that seems so old and used. I couldn't wait to get out of the room every day. Thankfully we had the lobby to escape to. I love this resort, though I am feeling that it is getting too dated. The problem is not the overall property, nor the employees. The problem are the rooms. I do not think I can pay over $700 a night again for the level of rooms at the hotel. This makes me quite sad! I can't wait for the new Four Seasons to open. That will probably be the next time we visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: Alison E
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian in March, 2012. What an amazing place! Very beautiful, very close to the parks, and super clean. The staff members were so friendly and happy! I traveled in a group of 10, with 4 children under the age of 4. The experience was great for all members of our group. We requested a room facing the castle, and were able to see the fireworks nightly. The food was great (especially at Citricos) at the resort! The kids LOVED the pool, as it had a water slide that was the perfect size for our children. I just wish we had spent a little more time in the pool!! A great time had by all and highly recommended!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: Michelle L
Reviews.Content: This is a fantastic hotel and resort. The atmosphere is wonderful especially in the lobby when the six piece band or pianist plays in the late afternoon and evening. The staff can't do enough for you very polite and attentive. The whole resort is very very clean and very well tended. It's position so close to the Magic Kingdom really makes it. It was everything I had hoped for and more. I recommend it for couples and families alike.

Reviews.Title: “Best time ever!”
Reviews.Author: Ariel B
Reviews.Content: I've been going to Disney World since it's beginning, and have been there 30+ times. I have stayed at many hotels on and off Disney property. The Disney resorts are the best because of the free bus transportation, and proximity to the parks. The Grand Floridian, has always been one of the hotels I love to visit, walk around, eat at their restaurants, but I had never had a chance to stay there. It was one of the places I always wanted to, but it was too pricey for me...just a dream. Well guess what? For my 50th birthday, my daughter booked the room, and arranged the stay for two nights. Our view was on the water, we could see the castle from our window. The bed and linens were so comfy. The food was good at the Grand Floridian Cafe. The pool, the hot tub, the beautifully landscaped gardens, the white sandy beach, and even the ducks were wonderful, but as an experienced Disney traveler, stay here when you are not visiting the parks, the resort itself is too nice to leave. We stayed in the Boca Chica building, which I highly recommend over the noisy main building. Go here for luxury and relaxation. Don't waste any time leaving this resort, it is too wonderful! If your trip mostly includes visiting the parks day and night, I recommend the more affordable POP Century Resort.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful exterior, excellent staff, interiors a bit worn in our building”
Reviews.Author: whitelegsofthenorth
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay. Beautiful hotel that reminds of the Del Coronado in San Diego. Stayed in one of the outlying buildings. Our room was a bit worn but very clean. Lots of dents in the furniture. Small room with too much furniture. Had to move an ottoman/bench placed at the end of the bed as space was too tight. Finding space for it was a bit of a challenge. Beds were reasonably comfortable. Linens were good. Had to call to get feather pillows as the supplied pillows were not unlike a rock. Turn down service was nice. Unfortunately, can hear your neighbors. Used an Ipod/app (had a docking station) for white noise. Two pools-not as large as they look in the pics but were still nice. Beautiful outdoor space. Small beach outside on the lake. Light show on the lake at night but we missed it! Easy access to theme parks. Monorail to Epcot (with a transfer at one of the stations). Monorails were down between noon and around 6 during our visit. There are buses that can take you to the parks as well/very convenient and pick you up near the front of the hotel. Also boat transportation that we did not try, sadly. Several dining choices at the hotel. A 24 hour option/ a buffet (we didn't try) and a couple of others that were more mid to fine dining. Good food-not spectacular and spendy, of course. Nice lounge on the second floor. A band plays nearby (just outside of the lounge) which is fun to observe but when in the lounge, makes it hard to have a conversation. Easy to park-valet is $12.00 per day and there is free parking across the street which translates to about a block or two walk to the hotel. BTW, our GPS was not navigating the DW area very well. Others were having the same problem. Did not give you and idea which way to bear when the road forked. Kind of frustrating. Would recommend a map. Don't ask for recommendations of restaurants off of the DW property-they will work to keep you on the property. Dinner reservations can be tough to come by. Open Table worked for us for reservations and there are decent restaurants within a 15 minute drive from the hotel that are not related to DW. In DW would recommend the California Grill at the top of the nearby DW Contemporary Resort. We were able to go outside and watch the fireworks complete with music and 3 D glasses. Spendy but worth it, I think. Food was good. Universal Studios is about a 20-30 minute drive away. A decent upscale outlet mall is about a 15 minute drive away. Very happy with our stay.

Reviews.Title: “A very grand holiday”
Reviews.Author: Shelly P
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at Disney before, but this was our first stay at a Deluxe resort. We had very high expectations, all of which I'm pleased to say were exceeded. The room was clean and comfortable with all the home comforts I would expect in a deluxe resort. The beds were comfy and always beautifully turned down for us in the evening. The domestic staff were polite and efficient. All the staff we encountered were friendly and welcoming, addressing us by name each time we returned to the Hotel. Concierge desk were helpful, managing to help us change our plans and make us dining reservations at short notice. Pools were wonderful, though avoid the beach pool if you are looking for a quieter swim! The larger pool is great if you want to enjoy a cocktail in the hot tub between dips. The location is great, close to Magic Kingdom and on the monorail route making transfers to other parks and resorts less tedious. Choice of bars is good though more limited later in the evening. Mizners lounge is nice and the Ultimate Long Island Iced Tea is highly recommended. The restaurants were fantastic with exceptional food and service, however the food is pricey so the dining plan is well worth the money for the budget conscious. We got a phone call from the manager of Citricos the day after we ate there thanking us for our custom. The only negative was that the spa closed for refurbishment half way through our stay so we had to go to Saratoga Springs instead. We are returning to Disney this year and can't wait.

Reviews.Title: “It was Grand”
Reviews.Author: jet0969
Reviews.Content: Honestly, the best property to stay on if you want to be close to the Magic Kingdom .Researched a ton of WDW hotels and chose this one partly because of the location. We were on the concierge level and it was well worth it. Breakfast, afternoon tea, appies and drinks before dinner, and after dinner drinks and snacks were all included. So nice to have a healthy breakfast that we could help ourseleves to. Had a glass or two of champagne every night before dinner. The hotel is well layed out, the rooms could use a bit of a touch up but they were clean. Ours had a nice deck that had a great view of the fireworks! Kids had a great time @ the pool, spa was fantastic. I had a wonderful massage by someone who actually knew what they were doing. We were all fascintated by the wife of the piano player who sat in the lobby every time he played- with her buggy of stuffed dogs....Would have liked the background on that lol. Having said that, it is a beautiful lobby and hearing the piano just adds to the experience. Staff @ Mizner's Lounge was great and bent over backwards for our kids the first night we arrived, which was quiet late. Citrico's food was fantastic, the Grand Floridian Cafe was average.

Reviews.Title: “It's WDW so expect motel standards”
Reviews.Author: Tania_Chris
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at WDW hotels 8 times in 10 years and we are from Australia. Love Disney- love the parks and the feeling of being there at Xmas. We have always found the Disneyworld accommodation to be incongruously expensive, but after many trips have come to expect this and appreciate the fact that we are in Disney and the room doesn't matter that much. You have to stay in the hotels to get extra time in Parks and getting in and out of the resort if you stay off site is so hard as to be impossible. We have stayed at several hotels in WDW and the Grand Floridian is probably the best so far, but every one has been basically a motel standard room. These are not five star properties by world standards and so you should not enter into them expecting them to be. When we go to Disneyland we often stay at the Disneyland hotel and it is only marginally better than the GF even with its recent refurb. We used to stay at the Carousel Inn across the road from Disneyland because it had basically the same standards as either of these Disney hotels, but for far less money. In WDW you are paying for the convenience, not a plush room! (When I saw the room we had at the Contemporary four years ago I was speechlessly upset because we had paid so much money and it was a brown motel room- but we had a great view of the fireworks on New Year's Eve- incidentally they have a practice New Year Fireworks the day before to film it, so a great view!) In WDW you are going to be in a huge Vegas sized resort where there is a huge hike to facilities and your room or the transportation. The workers are going to be harried and you will probably be lucky to get a Bell Hop to help you with anything. But you will be in WDW and there is Disney magic to be had. So, if you go with clear expectations that you will pay for a first class hotel, but probably get a motel style room but with the convenience of being in the resort and having access to WDW then you won't be disappointed and you will have a magical trip. As for me, this year I am thinking Yacht Club so that I can walk to Epcot or Studios.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice but not special”
Reviews.Author: WandererfromAZ
Reviews.Content: We had two connecting rooms which were very nice and spacious but they didn't have any special features to distinguish them from a very nice room at any other very nice hotel in the world. So, while we enjoyed staying there and having great transportation which was important with small children, I much preferred my stay with adult friends at the log cabin in the Fort Wilderness area some years ago. The Grand Floridian is elegant and the service is wonderful and as another reviewer says, it is not too branded. I've also read that the GF has the feel of 'Old Florida' but I didn't get that at all.

Reviews.Title: “Not too Disney”
Reviews.Author: Trickyriffs
Reviews.Content: Really nice hotel, not too branded, in centre of Disneyworld. Rooms good (especially Concierge rooms), on site restaurants good too, but so well connected to rest of Disney by monorail its easy to get out to other sites.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable”
Reviews.Author: G-Money-TX
Reviews.Content: View of the Magic Kingdom from the lagoon view room gives you a private show of the fireworks right from your balcony. Also, you get to see the light parade on the lagoon. The rooms are very nice, clean and spacious. The Monorail stop that is just one station away from the Magic Kingdom is priceless. Food at the Grand Floridian is excellent. Narcooses is really a treat. The breakfast/snack bar/cafe is open just when you need it, especially if you are the meal plan. Get up early and send someone to retrieve a few breakfast items before you leave the room. It will pay off in your long day. The water taxi ride is great from the Magic Kingdom to the Grand Floridian. From the Grand Floridian to the Magic Kingdom it takes too long and makes too many stops. The monorail is the only way to go the Magic Kingdom. On the way back, choose the water taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Much better hotels in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: Kjw108
Reviews.Content: Unimpressed. My credit card was also fraudently charged as was a previous review I just read. We returned from the park at 12am one night and discovered our "clean sheets" had yellow stains on them. I called downstairs and was not even offered and apology and our sheets didn't get replaced until the next day. Not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “If money is no object.....”
Reviews.Author: dansee
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice but is too pricy. The rooms are "old floridian" style when in fact they just seem outdated. They seem to get away with not updating as dictating theme. The pools were ok . The actual beach part for my older kids was really a joke. The restaurants here are none of my favorites but at least Chef Mickey's and Ohanas are on the monorail. Need a really good price to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: Watrbaby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian before our Disney cruise. Magic express was great. The hotel staff greeted us by name at the bus. Checked-in online and the room was ready for us before noon. Transportation to and from the hotel is very easy. I enjoyed going to MK on the monorail and returning on the boat. The service and facilities were great. Food just OK. Our luggage was picked up from our room and delivered to the ship without any problems. Would recommend staying at a Disney property if you are planning a Disney cruise.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT PLACE TO STAY. HOTEL AND STAFF ARE FANTASTIC”
Reviews.Author: tapow
Reviews.Content: we visit Disney often and have stayed at several of the other Disney hotel's. ( beach Club, Board Walk, S&D, etc) This has ben the best yet. we stayed here for 7 days at the end of January. we stayed in the Sugar Loaf Bldg and the Staff wasa excellent and the rooms were very clean. I would recommend this hotel to everyone. It is worht the $$$$

Reviews.Title: “Fantasy land meets fantasy!!”
Reviews.Author: lucyA123
Reviews.Content: Beautiful setting, beautiful experience. Loved being a child again!

Reviews.Title: “Elegant property.”
Reviews.Author: RRM1020
Reviews.Content: We had an extended family trip to Disney. The hotel, grounds, pools and especially location were awesome. We even saw Disney fireworks from our porch. A quick bus, monorail or boat ride to the park. Personally this hotel was a tad "stuffy" for the kids and, in my opinion, didn't give the full Disney feel. Pools were opened and occupied till late at night. The holiday decorations were nice especially the huge Christmas tree and life size gingerbread house were cool. Definitely a great job creatin the holiday feel. I would return if only with adults. With kids I would chose a different resort.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good ...”
Reviews.Author: Shirtisred
Reviews.Content: I just dislike the entire theme and layout of this resort. The service was minimal, the rooms were mediocre. To be honest, this hotel is one of my least favorites in all of the ones I've been to. And it's on the expensive side! I don't think it's worth the price you pay ...

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian is fine for the right price”
Reviews.Author: rdougperry
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney with a 8yr old and 1yr old and thought it would be nice to use the monorail for the kids. Reality is that if you go to the magic kingdom it's great but if you go to any other park ... not so much. Epcot you have to go to the transfer station and Hollywood/Animal Kingdom you are on the bus. I found it was quicker to take a taxi -- took 7 mins from Hollywood versus 45 on bus and cost only $15.00. So to the most important point of all this. The Hotel is nice and has great ammenities, however the rooms aren't any bigger or better then Port Orleans, Allstar, Swan, etc. I have been to DisneyWorld every year for last 6 years and stayed in a variety of hotels. If the Grand Floridian is on sale by all means stay there but it's not worth $500 a night. On a side note: the cafe is way too small and never has seats and they take forever to make your food. The pool with waterslide though is awesome. Stay somewhere nice and take taxis. You can get anywhere you want in about 20 mins in taxis so stay off disney property figure $30 bucks each way. So your transportation cost each day is $60. If you just want to go to Magic Kingdom and Epcot....Grand floridian is fine.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful classy but expensive resort”
Reviews.Author: travisanti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian in the outer building Sugar Loaf (concierge level) building from Feb 7th to Feb 11th. From there we went to the Yacht Club for one night, the Polynesian for one night and requested to go back to the Grand Floridian Sugar Loaf building for 3 more nights. Our first room was on the first floor with two queen beds. It was immaculate. We enjoyed this room very much. We were on the courtyard side and saw the courtyard pool area. The rooms are VERY quiet, the most quiet of any resort we have stayed at. Once we shut the door, that was it for noise. We only got one towel animal (Mickey) the first day, that would be my only disappointment as I so look forward to seeing a towel animal every day after housekeeping is there. When we went to the Yacht Club we were disappointed as the rooms were loud and the concierge offerings were far less. The same at the Polynesian so we requested to come back to the Grand Floridian. We were put in a room with a parlor in a turet! They told me it was "luck of the draw" as they only have 3 of those rooms. What a treat (see pictures). It was much larger and had two TV's and a large balcony. Once again, our room was immaculate and we again received a Mickey towel animal but that was again the only one we received. Ok, the club lounge. It gets a little crowded in the morning but for the most part it was fine. You are able to get beverages all day which is a real plus. That did not happen at the Yacht Club. The food offerings were amazing and worth the extra 100$ per day cost. Breakfast consisted of oatmeal, 3 cold cereal offerings, ham, turkey, croissants, many muffins, carmel rolls, several different breads, bagels, cream cheese, jelly, a large fruit bowl - wow. The snacks during the day consisted of crackers and several dips a long with a great large vege tray that included asparagus. There were some other offerings at snack time also but not "meal" replacement foods so we ate lunch out every day. At "tea time" they put out sconces and at times a devonshire cream desert that was fabulous. From 5-7 at night they had appetizers and we never had to eat dinner as there are several different ones to try and we were full after trying each one. They also had something for the "kids" like chicken nuggets, mini corn dogs etc. Every appetizer was fabulous - a new and exciting treat every night. From 8-10 pm they had deserts and WOW those were our favorites. I tried to try just a couple but they have at least 4 different little deserts to try and they were all excellent. They offer beer and wine also. We were there for our anniversary and received a rose and a bottle of champaigne on our anniversary - pretty cool. We would take the monorail to the Magic Kingdom and it is the last stop before the MK so that was nice. On the way back we would take the boat as it always seemed to be there (come every 7 minutes) and we were the first stop. The main building was perfectly immaculate as always, they have a "scent" in the main building that I find quite comforting - I am sensitive to smells but this did not bother me. We enjoyed the shopping in the main building and the piano player and the orchestra in the evenings. I have seen reviews where people said it wasn't very clean etc but those seemed to be the other out buildings and we did not see that at all. The concierge staff were nice but not overly so like at the Yacht club. We didn't have any trouble with any of them but I thought they could have been more outgoing and friendly. There is laundry in all of the out buildings except the Sugar Loaf building where we walked to the next building to do laundry. Having visited Disney many times having close laundry was a nice plus as I like to keep up on our laundry. We have stayed at Port Orleans Riverside, All Star sports, music and movies, Port Orleans French Quarter, the Wilderness (which I love very much also), the Polynesian and the Yacht Club. I enjoy the Grand Floridian the most but it is VERY expensive. We only go when we get a discount rate but it is still very expensive. Next year I think we will stay at Port Orleans Riverside again since they are remodeling all of the rooms as it did cost a lot of money to stay at the Grand Floridian. Also, there are plenty of kids/families/couples/seniors. It is not just couples - it is family friendly. They have a conference center there and we did see a lot of business people but that was fine also. This is an incredible resort that I wish I could live at. Alas, I cannot so now we are back to earth.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Grandness”
Reviews.Author: adisneyrental
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is one of the resorts situated closely to Magic Kingdom. It is Disney's most expensive resort in Florida. The resort has nicely appointed rooms with wonderful views regardless of your room. The resort is a short monorail ride in to the park and offers a spectacular view of the fireworks at the pier. The pools are not spectacular but are nice and convenient. The dining is upscale and is among the best among the resorts. All in all, a very good value in spite of the price.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't even remotely live up to expectations...”
Reviews.Author: katmar13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian on a Disney trip in February. I expected so much more based on photos and reviews. I was disappointed. First the pros: the lobby was gorgeous and the live music was very good. I liked the convenience of catching the monorail or bus to all Disney attractions. The grounds and our room was clean, and we were kept well stocked in fluffy towels. The cons: check in was a mess. I had my confirmation number, but the baffled woman checking me in kept asking about my other three rooms. After explaining to her that two people really only need one room, she got her supervisor to straighten it out. The concierge desk misdirected me on two separate occasions. The worst was when we were directed to WALK to the Polynesian for a restaurant that was located at a completely different resort. Luckily we didn't make that trek, certain he was mistaken. The room, though nice, was not resort quality. I'd put it at Hampton Inn standard (nothing against the Hampton, I like to stay there on business, just prefer a little luxury when vacationing) with one exception--Hampton Inn provides amenities such as shower caps and Q tips, this hotel does not. Hampton Inn also replaces the tea and coffee consumed for each morning, this hotel did once in a four night stay. Want hot water? Turn on the shower and read the newspaper while it heats up (I promise I'm not exaggerating). Want a quiet night's sleep? Not going to happen. I realize every hotel has noisy residents, but these walls are paper thin. Want to know how they keep the grounds so neat and clean? At a ridiculously early hour (5am) they're pressure washing the side walks using carts with head jarringly loud compressors. I mentioned to a hotel employee that I couldn't sleep in this hotel and he made a joke that I couldn't sleep because of the bill and laughed at me. I'll never stay at The Grand Floridian again, and I recommend that everyone else avoid it as well. This is merely a hotel, devoid of the luxury they promise. If you're going to spend that kind of money on a hotel, stay at The Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Best all around choice for DW”
Reviews.Author: captainTexas
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by saying that I am not a Disney World fanatic in the least bit, however; I have been visiting Walt Disney World yearly for the past five years and have stayed at all three higher-end resorts on the monorail (Contemporary, Polynesian, and of course Grand Floridian. I also have stayed at the lower priced resort (All Star Movies) and middle priced (Caribbean Beach) so I have good insight into the differenent priced hotels of DW. Having said all of this, I prefer the Grand Floridian and really feel its the nicest hotel in WDW and probably worth the extra money when compared to Polynesian and Contemporary. On a side note, staying at either of the three on the Monorail saves you an invaluable amount of time especially if visiting the Magic Kingdom frequently or nighttime dining at some of the best restaurants of DW (California Grill, Citrico's, Narcoossee's or Victoria and Albert's). The staff at GF was most accommodating with a smooth check in and baggage arriving in our room. Our only complaint is that the conceirge cannot be called from your room (requires a visit to desk in lobby) and to me that is fairly unacceptable for a premier hotel. The guest rooms were very nice for the most part and go along with the theme of the Grand Floridian (pastel colors, flowered bed spreads, and wall sconces etc). The beds were comfortable with decent thickness to linens and the towels were noted to be thicker and more plush than those of previous stays at the Polynesian. Honestly, I think the rooms are very nice in DW standards but are not at the level of a Four Seasons, Ritz,, or Waldorf Astoria; more like a Marriott, Hyatt or Omni. I understand that the flowered bedspreads go along with the hotels theme but they are reminiscent of the Holiday Inn era of the 80's and should be repaced with white sheet/flowered duvet (more clean feel). As far as the GF restaurants, I will not even comment on the quick service restuarant. It is similar to every other DW hotel with airport type salads, mediocre burgers and an abundance of sugar laden beverages for the youngsters.. We did eat at Citrico's (as we do every year) and it was a very nice meal with great service and a good view of the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom. We also had dinner at Narcoossee's and had a comparable meal to Citrico's ( good fish and wine selections). California Grill is probably our favorite restaurant of WDW (though not at the Grand Floridian); we had a wondeful meal of sushi, flat bread pizza, along with other delightful selections. In summary, I believe the Grand Floridian is the nicest hotel on the Monorail . Its a nice break from the over stimulation that you receive from the theme parks. It also feels as though there are less undisciplined, unwatched kids running around compared to the other hotels quite possibly because it seems like many conventions are staying at the GF as well as smaller families (probably due to price). Any questions on hotel specifics on either of the three properties on the Monorail are welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: janmariePittsburghPA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at all the 4and 5 stars hotels, but The Floridian did not meet my expectations. Considering the price I paid for this hotel, I was not satisfied with the rooms, amenities, nor the service. My next visit will not be this hotel. I have visited WDW 25 times and hoped this, The Floridian, would be the ultimate, I was wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Adults without kids should stay here.”
Reviews.Author: sjreviewer
Reviews.Content: We went as adults without the kids for a medical conference at the GF. The rooms were large and the staff was friendly. They took us in a golf cart on a tour to show us our rooms. We did none of activiites at the hotel but for wathcing the fireworks and the boat show parade. All rooms had good views and were close to the conference center. We saw many happy little princesses all decked out and little pirates with face paint. It is a much more calm sedate hotel than the Boardwalk where we stayed the last time and way more low key and less noisy than the Contemporary.For hstle and bustle, the Boardwalk and Contemporary are btter. But for relaxing, the GF all the way. The pool was good but not huge compared to Moon Place, Atlantis, and Beaches. It had one waterslide which we left alone for others vacationing with kids. The hotel was not spectaular but I have no complaints. All Disney employees had warm smiles and there was so much less wait time at the GF that it seemed effortless. The sound proof rooms were great so I did not hear other people's children. We had a great time. The access to the parks, downtown disney, and the other hotels was a breeze. If you want instant access to the Magic Kingdom you are set. The bus transport to the other parks was pretty is easy too. We ate in Citricos and loved it. We had a snack of flat bread pizza etc in the snackbar area and it was fine. We prefered to eat in Downtown Disney at the Fulton Crab House and the Irish pub. All the food was excellent. My only regret is that we did not get to eat in Epicot but for the quick service restaraunts because we wanted to the all the rides that we could not do when we went with our kids after the conference. i would do it again with the kids because it was less stress than other resorts.

Reviews.Title: “A not so magical experience”
Reviews.Author: MCO_Addict
Reviews.Content: After several visits to WDW staying off property my wife and I decided to splurge and booked several days at the Grand Floridian for Valentines Day. While the overall atmosphere is nice the details just don't live up to their reputation. The service at check in was great but the house keeping as a real pain. The rooms weren't well cleaned with the same soap mark on the bathtub the entire time we were there. House keeping seemed to take forever to clean the rooms and they left bags on dirty linen outside each room for hours every day. These were inconveniences and could have been over looked except for the experience we had at lunch on our last day. We had the deluxe dining plan (way too much food!) and were using our last meal to go to the Grand Floridian Cafe for lunch. We sat down at the table and a COCKROACH ran across the table! My wife killed it in the napkin and the waitress grabbed the napkin from here and ran into the kitchen with it. I was beyond horrified and totally disgusted. We were really excited about this trip and were glad to spend the extra money because we thought we were going to get a special level of service and quality. Instead we were left disappointed and feeling ripped off. We won't make this mistake again. From now on we will be staying off property in a cleaner more up to date hotel with a stack of cash in my pocket from all the money we saved.

Reviews.Title: “I was not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Marinaviewresident
Reviews.Content: We stayed at what we thought was Disney's finest Resort and Spa. When we arrived it was pouring rain. We drove up to the hotel and not a soul was to be found. My husband stayed with the car and I went into check in. We were given our room key and walking directions to our building. In the meantime, he found a bellman for our luggage. So we walked to our building IN THE POURING RAIN!!! Got to the room and waited OVER AN HOUR for our luggage to be delivered. It was around 10:30 at night on a Friday night. I did let the hotel know that we would be there at that time when I did the online check in. Since we all have such busy lives, I had no time to get a manicure and a pedicure so I thougth no big deal, I'm going to the Grand Floridian Resort and Spa. Would have been nice to have knnown the Spa was closed for renovations!! Restaurants were great! The room looked a bit dated. Hotel lobby was stunning. I just was expecting better service.

Reviews.Title: “Getting a little tired”
Reviews.Author: Annie92
Reviews.Content: We generally enjoyed our recent stay at the Grand Floridian, but while it may be deluxe by Disney standards, our experience does not really compare too favorably to other deluxe hotels. It was okay, but for the cost, you can really do much better at far better hotels - e.g. Ritz Carlton and Waldorf Astoria. We stayed in the main building which is considered concierge. Check in was very confused, with a young lady insisting that we had to stand on line at the front desk, even though we were told someone would meet us and take us directly to our room. After clearing that up by finding someone else to help us, we were led to our room. The rooms are okay, but pretty standard. The bathroom and plumbing fixtures were quite old and hardly what one would consider deluxe. The room had a very musty smell which we asked them to address, but never got taken care of. In general, guest services was pretty poor. Rarely was a request responded to and when they majorly messed up our room service order they could hardly care less. The concierge staff was generally kind and helpful, although we did encounter one woman who was awful about following up with reservation requests. The food offerings were nice, but I would not stay here again simply for that reason. Just was not enough for enough hours to justify the expense. Understandably you pay a premium to stay on Disney property and we have stayed at just about all the deluxe resorts (some more than once) over the years. We are finding it harder and harder to justify the cost as they are really not providing a "deluxe" product. I think the rooms could use a good upgrading and then you really need the service to match. When I recommend these properties, it is with a "buyer beware" disclaimer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay with family”
Reviews.Author: Mills93
Reviews.Content: Another great stay at the Grand Floridian. Four nights in the Conch Key building, clean rooms, excellent service, attentive staff. Food was consistently good at the restaurants, but we often ate elsewhere on property. Enjoyed the larger pool as well as the zero entry pool with water slide. Didn't have time for the health club, but was recommended by friends of ours. This is our second stay here, and I am sure we will have a third. Proximity to the Magic Kingdom was the clincher. There may be other nice hotels near WDW, but the convenience of the Grand Floridian was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Charming public areas. Convenient...sometimes.”
Reviews.Author: Edgingin
Reviews.Content: The main salon is grand and well-appointed and the live music each evening (alternates between pianist and orchestra/band) is enchanting. If you're not staying at the hotel - this is a great option for evening cocktails. We stayed in one of the club-level rooms and this felt like a good value as our family of four was able to enjoy breakfast, afternoon snack/cocktails, and dessert in the club lounge. Beds were very comfortable and bathroom area (with double sink separate from marble shower/tub and commode) larger than average. Our first evening, we returned to our room to find balloons and personalized welcome cards from Cinderella and Woody to our children. Our daughter held onto her card from Cinderella for hours. GF is very convenient to the Magic Kingdom which is a nice walk or a short monorail or boat ride away. The view of the castle from GF in the evening is lovely. It takes some time to get to the other parks (via bus or transfer monorail). It's just a little frustrating that it'd take 1/2 hour or more to get to/from parks when we've decided to stay on the property. In the past, we've stayed off-property and, with the exception of the Magic Kingdom, we didn't save much time by staying at GF. The magic hours are nice (although we missed all of them because there was just so much our children could take) and, overall, we really enjoyed the hotel (none nicer at Disney) but the transportation situation just seems like it needs a complete redesign. Service at the hotel was fine but not spectacular. Everyone is extremely pleasant and warm but the concierge staff was a little inefficient and there were some questions, I thought pretty basic, that they weren't able to answer without consulting this enormous bible of park information. There was no offer to help us with check-out, etc. Also, be sure to carry a credit card with you even if you think you'll use the park-issued card. Our park-issued card didn't work for a day or so and we heard several other people complaining their card had been declined, too. Finally, our children attended the "Mousketeer Club" one evening and we were pretty shocked by the lacking facility. Our kids have been to kids clubs like this at many hotels and while there were many activities available, it's all housed in a small-ish, windowless room at the back of the hotel. Of the three "cast members" on-site when we dropped our children off, only one exuded any warmth at all. Really just not what you'd expect at Disney.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER HAD BETTER SERVICE...”
Reviews.Author: claudia v
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th consecutive stay at this hotel. We come yearly for our daughter´s birthday. This year, she was recently diagnosed with some allergies, and we almost canceled the trip due to all this new way of eating and all the things she has to avoid... Of course, you think Disney is a place for kids, that they should do well in that area... well PREPARE TO BE AMAZED... As a mom, I was moved to tears many times. Every single meal, the chef in turn of the restaurant or fast food cafe, came out and spoke to me, noted everything down and sometimes even prepared her meal right in front of me, helped me along the way, assuring me everything was safe... all this with a smile in their face, be it CHEF ROBBIE from the Netherlands, or CHEF ANTHONY at 1900 Park Fare and Private Dining, or CHEF ROBERT AT Narcoosee´s. Their service was amazing, super professional and most corteous and accomodating. They made gluten free pasta specially for her, which she devoured, instead of mashed potatoes, roasted some smal potatoes, arranged beautifully a small fruit plate so it would look apettizing for her (she is 6), had gluten free hamburger buns, walked me through the entire buffet mentioning what was safe and what was not (ingredient wise).
