This, I did not expect. I thought it was going to be a very difficult trip due to all this new stuff for her and for us, but it was ALL SMOOTH SAILING, SMILES, EASY GOING AND ULTRA GREAT HELP. Everywhere else at Disney World, was also very careful (Allergy fries, they called them, where they only fry potatoes, not nuggets or onion rings, so they don´t get contaminated, they even radio in the order with a number and bring them out special...),But at The GRAND FLORIDIAN... Boy o boy...All 4 years, have been a great experience, that is why we keep coming back, but this year, THEY TOPPED EVERYTHING... I AM A VERY GRATEFUL MOM, AND A SUPER HAPPY GUEST. REALLY THANKS EVERY ONE OF YOU FOR MAKING THIS AN AMAZING EXPERIENCE IN AN OTHERWISE DIFFICULT TIME HEALTHWISE. TO ALL THE CHEFS, MANY MANY THANKS FOR ALL YOUR KINDNESS.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed Jan 18th for 4 nights. We arrived via Magic Express bus. Upon walking out of the bus, there were check-in castmembers standing with clipboards and headsets checking your name off the list and talking into the headset which guest was walking in to the hotel. A lady met us in the lobby and gave the castmember a folder with our room number, room key and itinerary. We were walked to our room on the 4th floor. We had room 4406 which is a club level room with a Magic Kingdom view. The lady showed us around the room before leaving asking to please let them know if we need anything. What a welcome! I have never had this kind of service at any hotel. The room is very comfortable and spacious. Our room had 2 beds and a balcony. This was very nice to step onto and overlook the grounds. People walking around and of course, we enjoyed watching the fireworks from our room surrounding Cinderella's castle. Room was very clean with plenty of towels in the bathroom. Made good use of the bathroom hamper. We received turn-down service every night. Nice size fridge under the tv. We were celebrating a birthday. Two nights in a row, we came back to our room to find gifts. One night was a box of truffles with a nice birthday card from the hotel and the 2nd night we had several birthday balloons and a Mickey Mouse stuff animal! The club level food was nice. Every morning, there was a continental breakfast with variety of pastries, cereals and oatmeal. Nice big Nespresso machine where i made a latte every morning to get me going. Beverages throughout the day. Service in the hotel is top notch. Live band plays big band style music every evening. Very lively atmosphere. Huge lobby with several gift shops. Daughter had a nice haircut in the salon on the 2nd floor. $25 price for haircut not bad considering she really needed a good washing due to all the hair gel and hairspray put in her hair by the Bibbidi Bobbidi Boutique!! The monorail access on the 2nd floor is invaluable. We really appreciated the quick access to and from the parks. Pool was nice and clean. Restaurants in this hotel are not that great. We tried Citricos and Grand Floridian Cafe. Very mediocre food. The night before we left, I checked in to our flights online and a couple hours later, our boarding passes were hanging outside the door. How did they know??? We had a fabulous time and enjoyed the hotel very much. This is the kind of place where you come to enjoy the atmosphere and not just sleep. So yes this hotel is very expensive but if you are wanting the comforts of luxury on this very active vacation, it is wonderful to walk into the hotel every day!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back there!”
Reviews.Author: Tennisfan93
Reviews.Content: We just came back from our first Disney Vacation. The Grand Floridian was simply amazing - we got an upgrade to the club level and had drinks and snacks available throughout the day (next time I will just book club level and not get the dining plan - both of these together is way too much food). The property is beautiful, the rooms are nice, the concierge service is great (they even found a screwdriver for us - we neeeded it for one of our kids' toys)! The hotel is right on the monorail, so getting around to MK was a breeze, plus, we never had to wait too long for a bus to go to AK or HS. The restaurants are nice, too - we loved the GF Cafe, Citricos and 1900 Park Fair, but Narcoosee's was a little disappointing (service wasn't great and neither was the food). The grounds at the GF are breathtaking - we filmed the fireworks from the boat dock - awesome! The main building lobby was excellent - great place to relax for a few minutes and listed to some live music (there is a piano player and also a band at night). To sum it all up - this is a beautiful hotel at the happiest place in the world and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Service at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: GLee1125
Reviews.Content: My husband & I stayed at the GF for a weekend. We have stayed at the Wilderness Lodge a couple of times. The GF & WL have the same size of rooms, basically. The Floridian is convenient to the Magic Kingdom & the Transportation & Ticket Station which allows you to hop on a separate Monorail to take to EPCOT. We stayed on the top floor, which gave us a private balcony. It was a smaller room, but very quant & cozy. Amenities in the room are very nice, i.e. bath towels, shampoo, conditioner, soaps, etc. The room was very clean, which includes the bath/shower. My biggest pet peeve is the shower curtain & it was spotless. We were able to get a good rate because of a Conference, which was helpful. Otherwise the rooms would have been twice as much per night. Choosing this room depends what is most important to you. If the cost does not faze you, the convenience to the Parks is very helpful, especially if you just spent 10 hours in a park & you just want to get to your room & sleep! If you have children, make sure you do not stay on the top floor, those rooms tend to be smaller. Oh & one more thing, we have taken several trips in the last 3 months & this is the first bed that has not hurt my husband's back. It was an extremely comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “It is Grand at Disney's Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: gardentourgirl
Reviews.Content: Returned to Disney after many many years & thought it would be great treat to stay in style and this is style. We got a special rate for a Club room at the Grand Floridian which was well worth the extra cost. Included restricted access to our building, breakfast, afternoon tea, appetizers and drinks including alcohol before dinner and dessert and after dinner drinks in the evening. Lots of attention to detail and more service than you could want. Our building was located near the quiet pool which was wonderful for an evening swim. Dinner at the Cafe in the hotel which was very good and gave huge portions. They treat you well when they know your a club member. Give it a try.

Reviews.Title: “The Holidays were Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: losangelesjeremy
Reviews.Content: We spent New Year's at the Grand Floridian and had an amazing time from top to bottom - the room was wonderful, the Club Level service was perfect and the monorail is super convenient. Overall, we highly recommend this hotel. Also, great food all around - eat at Narcoose's, California Grill, San Angel Inn and Bistros de Paris. Perfect holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for family trip!!!”
Reviews.Author: Jorgedearuja
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Floridian resort and Spa for 21 days. It was perfect me my wife daughter and soon enjoyed every second since the beginning. The localization is amazing and the staff is always gentil. I have read in others avaluations a lot of people complain about lack internet access but nowadays the access is free and unlimited. We stayed at Conch key building in front of the seven seas lagoon and we can see the Cinderela Castle from our balcony it was magic. In sumary we just loved.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice Grounds very Small Room”
Reviews.Author: BetterWay2Stay
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 days and it was our first trip to Disney. Everything was great until we saw the room. The room for the price was very tiny. The carpets needed to be cleaned. There was no water in the fridge. The location was awesome. The Pools were well staffed and very clean. There should be a better map made for the grounds. I had to call and ask lots of questions and I did not like doing that. When we go back we will try another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families but not for conferences”
Reviews.Author: Leslie K
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is a beautiful property. Disney does such an amazing job with their grounds, and just walking the grounds at the Grand Floridian is a treat. Location You can't beat the location of this resort. Right on the monorail, next to a pretty lake, 3 minutes from Magic Kingdom and a bit further from Epcot. The location is a huge advantage. Rooms The rooms here are dated and below average. They use old bedspreads and the pillows are small. The beds are not very comfortable. For Disney's highest end hotel, the accommodations should reflect the room rate. Food Generally speaking, Disney prices on food don't match the quality. There are several restaurants on property. The Grand Floridian Cafe was good for a quick sit down breakfast. There is a quick service place called Gasparilla Grill by the marina that has decent options for drinks, bagels, etc. We dined at Citricos one night and had great service and delicious meals. We did not try Victoria & Alberts, Narcoossee's, or the 1900 Park Fare restaurant. Transportation Disney's Magical Express is convenient. Use it. The monorail is great too. Conference Facilities The conference building is pretty standard -- nice conference rooms, comfortable chairs, rooms that don't get too cold. We also had a formal banquet in one of these rooms - it was kind of small for that. If you're traveling with a good sized business group, there is not much to do on property past 9pm. There is one small bar and that's about it. If you have a conference group, I think the Boardwalk Hotel is a much more fun place to stay. Staff The staff was incredibly outgoing and friendly. Five stars. Overall a beautiful hotel with decent food - I'd stay here in a heartbeat with family. Just not for a conference.

Reviews.Title: “where's the water???”
Reviews.Author: llcmygirls
Reviews.Content: let me start by saying that this is truly a beautiful hotel and the staff is wonderful. our room was clean and spacious. great shower and towels. we had egg benedict which was delicious. the grounds outside were well groomed and clean. great pools. love the fact you can take the monorail right to the magic kingdom and other parks. here comes the bad part. where's the water?? the frig in the room had nothing in it. not one bottle of water. nothing. for the price of the room and two all park two day passes, we should have water in the frig. that's it! please stay here. you will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely GRAND!!”
Reviews.Author: KansasHummingbird
Reviews.Content: Our family of ten stayed at the GF four years ago and it was perfect! How could that happen again? Well, it did! Our family consists of my husband and me; our two sons and daughters-in law; and our four granddaughters, ages 13, 12, 10, and 9 – perfect ages for Walt Disney World. Our five-night stay was from January 13 to January 18. We arrived at the resort around 9 a.m. after traveling on the Magical Express from the Orlando Airport Hyatt Regency. We were the only ones on the ME that early in the morning. Check-in was a breeze! We were so pleasantly surprised to find that our rooms were ready, and that we had been upgraded from Garden View rooms to Lagoon View! What a wonderful way to begin our magical trip. We were in first-floor, adjacent rooms in Big Pine Key. The rooms were fantastic. Each room had sliding glass doors and a small balcony with chairs and a table – large rooms with two very comfortable Queen Beds, a sofa bed, robes, a console w/ TV and a small frig, ceiling fan, a safe, coffee maker, plus lots of mirrors and a make-up mirror in the bathroom. There was also a desk area with four outlets. (I didn’t need to take the power strip!) There was an iPod charging station next to the bed and free wi-fi. This was great as we could use our Nooks to get on the Internet. The rooms were quiet at night and spotlessly clean. The bathroom was also large with a separate room for the toilet and excellent shower. There were double sinks and lots of amenities. In fact, we received new soap, shampoo, and conditioner each day. The towels were huge and luxurious. There was a turn-down service each evening, and two chocolates were left on the bed. (The girls thought they should have gotten four chocolates.) The staff in the Big Pine Key were all friendly and helpful. Our rooms were always refreshed when we returned in mid-afternoon to get ready for dinner. The Victorian atmosphere at the GF is ideal – very low-key and elegant. We enjoyed the small band, the piano player, and the comfortable seating. There’s not a lot of “Disney” decoration, but that was fine. (It’s nice to get away from that at the end of a busy day.) We also enjoyed the beautifully maintained grounds and walkways. The family even enjoyed the pools on the two “cool” days – the water was heated, and the pools were not crowded at all. It was a wonderful way to unwind and relax after park-hopping all day. The transportation system is ideal for getting to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. Even though we were there over MLK Day, the waits for transportation were not bad. We especially enjoyed the ferry ride to MK. The bus rides to Animal Kingdom and Hollywood Studios were also very fast. The Grand Floridian is not a resort one would choose if a yearly trip is planned to Disney, but for us, it could not have been better. Staying there helped make this a truly memorable, family vacation. Pros: Atmosphere, monorail, ferry, two heated pools, beautiful landscaping, large rooms with balconies, a marina, restaurants, friendliness, and service. There were no Cons.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: ProfandMom
Reviews.Content: We've stayed here several times, and the reason we keep coming back is that we love it. The Grand is Disney's nicest resort, and we've stayed at several of them. Our most recent stay at the Grand Floridian was from Jan. 2-7. We had been at the Fort Wilderness cabins over New Year's, where we were not entirely happy, but coming to the Grand was like coming home. I think it's because we've been spoiled here on our last few stays. The castmembers here are the best. Rooms are nice. Location is excellent. Transportation is great. The grounds are beautiful. We stayed club level at Sugar Loaf (the outer lodge), and it's really worth it when you have three kids. The money we saved on breakfast alone nearly paid for the upgrade, and when you consider convenience and the other goodies, I'm sure we got our money's worth. I guess the only "issues" I have is that self-parking is way across the street, and the quick service restaurant is loud and crowded because the arcade games are in the seating area, but those are fairly minor complaints. We will be back at Disney next year, and we will go to the Grand again.

Reviews.Title: “Close, clean, friendly, relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: Georgia2maine
Reviews.Content: Easy access to the parks and downtown Disney, beautiful resort, helpful staff, food was good at all the venues, very relaxing, huge heated pool open 24 hours, hot tub till midnight. Check it out.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Club Level is a Must!”
Reviews.Author: Jenna181
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property, with the monorail right at your door. Beautiful pools, and beautiful grounds. Restaurants were great. This hotel does a wonderful job or providing great service, despite its very large size. Our room was super clean, a little older, but still had the Disney Charm. The club level was great, because it offered mid day snacks, breakfast, drinks, and tons of goodies and wine in the evening. Very convenient. Loved it. Worth the $.

Reviews.Title: “So glad I chose the GF”
Reviews.Author: Missy23_12
Reviews.Content: I went back and forth trying to decide between the Grand Floridian and the Polynesian. I am so glad I chose the Grand Floridian!! From the moment you arrive, the staff is there to greet you and help you in any way they can. The lobby is breathtaking, and the beautiful scent that surrounds you immediatlely puts a smile on your face. The hotel was bright, cheery, and immaculately cleaned. It was perfect. We did walk over to the Polynesian for dinner a couple of times. It was a neat hotel, but so different from the Grand. I felt like it was very dark and needed some updating. I was glad when we returned to our bright room. The only negative was the walls were thin. We could hear the alarm go off in the room next to us every morning. Fortunately, we were on the same schedule as the family next door, so we were fine. After staying here, I really don't think I could stay anywhere else. It made our trip so magical and special. I can't wait to return!!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best”
Reviews.Author: Shawn O
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is probably Disney's fanciest resort and really is beautiful. From the lobby, to the common areas to the pools - it really is very nice. Perhaps the best part is the location - about 2 minutes via monorail to the Magic Kingdom. The rooms themselves are nice and we had a park view which allowed for beautiful sunrises and views of the electric boat parades at night. I was disappointed that the walls were VERY thin. I could hear conversations from neighboring rooms which isn't ideal if you are on a different schedule than your neighbors. The only very negative I had from my experience was that the knowledge of the staff varied a great deal. I was literally told different answers (in regards to the golf courses) by 4 different associates. That was very disappointing. That said - they were all nice - just 3 of the 4 were wrong it turned out! Overall stay here if you can for work or if you can splurge. If you can't - I recommend Port Orleans as a moderate resort.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND FLORIDIAN RESORT..BEST RESORT EVER, BEST STAFF EVER.”
Reviews.Author: ninalinda1023
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at this resort many, many times, I guess around 6-7 times...It is slightly expensive..but what you get back it worth more than anything, you get a WONDERFUL working staff, they are the best...when we ask for anything it is there within 5 minutes..they pick up my parents at there building immediately...they ALWAYS have our rooms ready..The resturants are WONDERFUL. A trip to the Grand Floridian Resort is the perfect vacation..We have stayed in many other hotels, and NONE of them can compare to the resort.. IF anyone says anything wrong about this resort, is because they just want to start trouble, these are people who cannot be satisfied with anything..I truly feel sorry for them...As for my family and myself we LOVE THIS RESORT. And are looking forward to going back for May, July, Sept. & December 2012....

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: familytravelsall4
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Club level in the main building of the Grand Floridian. I had so much anxiety before our trip b/c it was costing a lot and there were some lukewarm and bad reviews. We decided on the GF b/c of the proximity to Magic Kingdom and we have a 2 and 4 yr old that need naps during the day. We asked for a deluxe room for a small increase in $ and weren't disappointed. The room was a good size for our family of 4 with a spacious bathroom, a fridge, and large wrap around balcony. My parents stayed in a standard Club room and it was small, but nice, all the same. I WISH I HAD BEEN MORE RELAXED ABOUT THE WHOLE THING! Everything was perfect!! First of all, the Club level has ruined me for life. The food was non stop and delicious - and in the evenings we had great wine and if it wasn't out we just requested it and would be brought a glass for all four adults. We ate breakfast there every single morning - oatmeal, cereals, pastries, FRUIT galore, and I even made the kids sandwiches out of ham and turkey that was out with croissants and cheese spread. The people that complain about this spread must live lavish lifestyles compared to us - b/c we thought it was divine to have contant food offerings. My 2 year old has complained at meals since arriving home that she wants to "go back to the hotel!" :) The staff was helpful and kind. The luggage was handled so smoothly and efficiently it was amazing! I think that staff is two things - SUPER helpful and accomadating but I can see how some people could be turned off b/c they can act a little superior....kind of like shopping in a fancy store. That aside - everything was perfect. One night I walked by some food that was out and said to the girl setting it up "that looks so good, too bad we are on our way out" and she asked if I wanted her to set some aside for me for later! I said no thank you, but what an awesome offer!!! Can't beat proximity to MK by boat and monorail. We typically monorailed TO MK and then boated HOME b/c the monorail goes through several stops on way back but MK is the first stop after GF on the way in. Gasparilla grill was convenient and good. 1900 Park Fare was the best character meal all week. The step sisters were a hoot! The housekeeping staff ROCKED. We asked for early room make up b/c our kids nap in the afternoon and they did it all but one day. They also set up our kids toys every day so cute!!! We did leave a few dollars each day in envelopes our girls decorated before our trip. I think the best compliment we can pay this hotel is that we are already planning our next trip. To be honest, we really splurged on this trip but now hubby says it's the only way we will ever go back so we are already saving for another trip. He won't discuss staying anywhere else! I knew I could turn my midwestern boy into a snob someday.....HA!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully central spot for adults”
Reviews.Author: smutprotector
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been to Disney World before, but always with kids. This is the place to stay when the kids are not with you. Exoensive but extremely civilized. Also, we were there in the last week of January, which only seemed to be vacation time for Australians. The hotel and the theme parks were less crowded than we've ever seen. Weather was great, too. This is sort of a formal hotel, so kids wouldn't like it. Therefore, we didn't feel like we were outsiders or too grown up. Most guests were couples in their 30s, 40s, 50s and 60s.

Reviews.Title: “Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: Adam R
Reviews.Content: Went here for the second half of our honeymoon. We told them we were there for our honeymoon and the cast members very quickly offered us an upgrade to our room. It was an extra nice touch and this is day 1 Beautiful grounds, very clean rooms, the main restaurant offered big (and very good) portions I've been to Disney many times and this was one of my favorite resorts I've stayed in Being on the monorail line is also a nice plus

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds, relaxed feel”
Reviews.Author: dweedledee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a long weekend at the Grand Floridian recently and had a great stay. The resort is beautiful with expansive outdoor areas for lounging. I could've spent a while sitting on the huge wrap around porch but we had plans. Our room was located in the Pine Keys building which was a great location. We were close to the quiet pool, hot tub and restaurant, Gasparillas. The staff was very friendly and helpful and the room was spotless. I would return to the Floridian. The only negative issues were the distance between the self-parking lot and our room (it was over 1/3 mile) and the somewhat confusing valet/bell services issue we had upon checking in. In addition, the ihome in our room was an older model that didn't charge our iphones. I didn't have this issue with previous stays on Disney property and didn't bring my iphone charger. Housekeeping was able to help me out.

Reviews.Title: “OK-Not amazing”
Reviews.Author: NCtraveler2012
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our family of 5 last year. We chose The Grand Floridian for its location and accomodations. I booked it through Travelocity. Arriving we were greeted by a friendly staffer who showed us to our deluxe harbour view room. Sooooo tiny. We had 2 doubles and a nice size sofa,but it was close quarters. I learned from here on-we get 2 rooms. The best part of our trip was the beach on the resort. Great to escape our cold NC winter. Parks were great-kids loved them. Service at the GF was unacceptable. Even renting a DVD from the desk for our kids to watch while we got ready for dinner was frustrating. I just didn't get a "we're here to help" attitude-just a "your are bothering me" one. If/when we go again I will definitely choose another hotel. Hope this helps. I don't think we are picky, just like nice manners.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not Grand”
Reviews.Author: RadlerGreatNeck_NY
Reviews.Content: Very nice property, but not worth the expense. You are paying for location. Rooms are a bit old and the pools are nothing special

Reviews.Title: “"It still hasn't changed?"”
Reviews.Author: TheBraueFamily
Reviews.Content: Last Spring, my family and I went and stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian Resort in Disney World. I was not pleased at all. We stayed on the club level in a Magic Kingdom View room. The room was very old. It looked the same as it did when I stayed there with my mother and daughter in 1994. Although the lobby was beautiful, once you get upstairs it feels like your in a nightmare. The floors creak when your walking up and down the stairs and the concierge is rather small. The staff there is horrible. The nicest one I met took my bags into the hotel. The lady at the front desk had an attitude and the waiters were just god awful. The pool and grounds, I must say, are very nice as well as the spa, but its not worth the $1000 a night fee (March). Stay at the Contemporary or even the Yacht Club. Much nicer than this old dump.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: cabinfan2
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful relaxing comfortable classy resort. From the wonderful smells as you first walk in to the rooms and food and ease of access to the park this is top shelf. If you have the cash splurge so worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Disney ever after :)”
Reviews.Author: ChrisW10811
Reviews.Content: I have visited this hotel and stayed here since I was a little girl!! From this minute you wake up until the minute you hit the bed its an AMAZING experience. I Have stayed at many many other places in Disney but this is one of my favorites and very clean! The help is great. I found out the help throughout alot if Disney is great! Im looking foward to going back in a few years when i have children and if not ill be their before that!

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the Grand”
Reviews.Author: AlexConst
Reviews.Content: Quality and service is what Disney is known for. Prices keep going up and yet the place is always booked. The only reason I didn't give "The Grand" an 'excellent' is the fact the prices go up every year (yes, we keep going back) and some simple services, like a waitress/waiter strolling through the lobby asking if any of the guests need a drink or anything. The live music in the lobby is wonderful and inviting. As in any Disney hotel, if you ever have a problem or concern, the staff will bend over backwards to make it right.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Grand”
Reviews.Author: jcc1962
Reviews.Content: Stayed on the club level in the main building, pricey but worth every penny. staff was second to none and there is no limit what they will do to accommodate your needs, while there my wife got a cold and while dinning she could not find something she wanted, the waiter asked what she wanted and she replied a bowl of chicken soup and a BLT sandwich he said let me check a few minutes later he returned saying no problem, a few minutes after that the chef came to our table and asked my wife if she would like mayo on her BLT I was blown away with the service We also had the platinum dinning package which allowed room service dinner at Vicky and Al's or whatever you could think of , unlimited choices and the tours made the price worth it. I am a self confessed mouse junkie but now have been ruined because I will stay no where else. One tip would be to have some cash for cab fare instead of waiting on the bus to go anywhere but the MK

Reviews.Title: “First class”
Reviews.Author: MediaLadyMN
Reviews.Content: This was our first time staying on a WDW property and definitely won't be our last. From the moment we arrived we were greeted with friendly faces and offers of assistance. Every employee even those in the parking lot greeted us. We stayed in the Big Pines with a room overlooking the lagoon. We were treated to a nightly view of the night water parade complete with music and were able to view nightly fireworks from the pier a short walk away. There was live music in the lobby and we were able to catch the monorail from here. Highly recommend the afternoon tea in the Garden View Tea Room. It was very reasonable and there were several options available. The free wifi in our room and lobby was a definite bonus. Complimentary airport transportation was great. We thought the bathroom was large enough as there was so many seating options in the main room. There were 2 sinks and the shower/toilet were in an adjoining area. Looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “nice but needs a few updates”
Reviews.Author: beach_mom_leesburg
Reviews.Content: The hotel is grand for its location to the magic kingdom. We had a room in the conch key building. I have stayed at this hotel before and don't remember these problems from the first time. The walls seem to be very thin, can hear talking and water running from next rooms. The sheets are crunchy and loud. I do not like the bedspreads on the beds. Most upscale hotels these days have down comforters and not bedspreads. The room is immaculately clean and the service is wonderful. The beach and spa areas are all under construction and closed. We were disappointed there was no campfire on the beach and roasting of marshmallows like we had done before. I still prefer the wilderness resort or the animal kingdom lodge especially with children as it has a more whimsical decor and not so victorian.

Reviews.Title: “The walls and adjoining doors are paper thin. You get to experience others babies crying and parents yelling. :(”
Reviews.Author: Leeanddeb
Reviews.Content: Too easy to hear other guests. The walls and adjoining doors are paper thin. You get to experience others babies crying and parents yelling. :(

Reviews.Title: “So - So and not what I expected of Disney”
Reviews.Author: beccagenna
Reviews.Content: I have visited neumerous places in the Disney area. I was very excited that my husband and I were going to spend Valentines day at the Grand Floridian. It was our first visit. My reservations specified a room that can see the Magic Kindom Fireworks. The Hotel is BEAUTIFUL, we check in (all good so far) we get to our room and it was not dirty, but not really clean. We had a ground floor (not excited about that) and the patio door would not work, the TV did not work, there was no coffee, and the room safe was closed (we needed to put stuff in it) from the previous people so it needed to be reset by the staff. I called all this stuff in and they said they would be right down. 1 hour later I called again, they were a little snotty and said to go ahead to the parks that they would be there to fix it. I let them know we were not leaving till the safe was reset as we needed to use it before we left. We waited another 1/2 hour and someone came. They got the safe reset, the TV working, but did not bring coffee and could not fix the door and said maintenace would have to send another person. They asked if we really needed to get outside (yahhhh, if there is a fire or if we want to view the fireworks which I had to pay super extra for!). Door finally was fixed and had a great day at the park. Came home to watch the fire work. While standing there we notice the grounds were littered up with trash. Since we were on the ground floor, when the fireworks started there were people walking right in front of our patio as they had not got a room where they could view the fireworks and were milling around our patio (not a romantic set up for valentines day). When the fire works started, we had to lean out and over our railing just to see them. We could not see them sitting on our patio. WHAT A JOKE! I did complain to disney and never got a response. This hotel was an expensive stay and I really expected more. Normally Disney is such a great experience, but I was just discusted with this one. We also did not find the site resturants to be very friendly or accomidating. Many people seemed to have an attitude. So disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but not the best Disney property”
Reviews.Author: j1m3bo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a number of Disney properties and never been disappointed, whether it's a velue resort (the All Stars Movies and Music), a moderate resort (Port Orleans, Riverside) or Deluxe (Animal Kingdom Lodge). It all comes down to what is in your pocket, what you're willing to fork out, who you are travelling with and what you are looking for. On this occasion, we were stayed at Disney's AKL for a fortnight, but decided to try out the GF for a couple days also. It looks beautiful; from a distance and close up. It feels quite elegant on entering the huge, bright, airy lobby area. Service was a little stuffy (not a warm welcome, but still professional) and it was a little bit of a job finding our block (this is a BIG resort; be prepared to walk a little...no problem for us, but might be for others). The room was lovely (when we found it!), with a lake view, small balcony and all was perfectly in order. Having just come from a 2 bedroom Villa at AKL (Jambo house), we noticed the difference in size of course, but I think the studios at GF are of the largest in Disney (with the exception of the Contemporary I believe). There are lots of products in the bathroom and a bathrobe/slippers too...nice touch, but you are paying premium prices here, so to be expected. The pool areas are clean, spacious and inviting. The hammocks on the beach are a welcome treat and the grounds are spotless. The range of restaurants is good and the food is good. The quick serve food court is very small however, and on our stay, not well organised or particularly clean. Choice was more limited here than in other resorts. Of course, it is convenient to Magic Kingdom and the luxury of travelling by boat or monorail is fantastic. So wht 4 stars and not 5? Well, value for money for one thing. Slightly stuffy service for another. And the fact that I wasn't made to feel particularly special (whereas the service at AKL is top notch in my view). Would I stay again? Yes, definitely. Would I recommend it? Again, yes. Would I recommend you to try out other hotels at Disney? Absolutely. It's all about personal taste at the end of the day.

Reviews.Title: “Close to the parks, don't leave anything out while not in room”
Reviews.Author: travelbug317
Reviews.Content: Very close to the parks with easy mono rail access on premises. Great dining options, multiple restaurants on site, but a little pricey for dinner. You must have your breakfast menu on your door filled out by 6 pm the night before or they wont collect it and no breakfast for you, but when they do serve you the Mickey waffles were awesome. Also the cleaning staff took my bag of souvenirs when they were doing the turn down service when reported to the manager they said they will ask but were sure that I just missed place it, I don't think so! A report was filed and I have heard nothing back from them yet. I was very unhappy to an otherwise pleasant stay. All front desk staff was very eager to help with any touristy questions. The parks Are close by this hotel is actually in Disney and provided transportation to all parks and nearby attractions. Overall good hotel with not so honest cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: pabsSydney
Reviews.Content: My family of two adult and two children (aged 6 & 8) stayed here for a week in October. We had booked a Theme Park View room. Due to a special including a dining package starting 2 days into our 8 day stay we had two separate booking. Unfortunately we were not able to stay in the same room for both bookings. For our first room we upgraded to a club room in the main building. Breakfast was included and a small buffet of pastries and cereals. I am glad I did not pay for a club room, the were no great benefits that we would of utilised other than breakfast. The view was great looking straight out to Cinderellas castle. We were then moved to our next room in Big Pine Key. We were placed in a dormer room on the top floor, although the layout was the same, the room felt smaller and the children could not see the castle unless they stood on chair and hang over the balcony. Because we had asked for a theme park view room I asked to be moved. They then moved us into Sago Key onto the 2nd floor. It was perfect. The room was identical to the club room we had stayed in in the main building however the view was probably better. It was magical being able stand on our own balcony each night to watch the fireworks. It was very easy to travel to each of the theme parks. Magic Kingdom by monorail or boat was by far the quickest and easiest. We loved taking the boat, it was just as fast and very scenic and relaxing - perfect for putting you in the right mood. Epcot was probably the longest journey time with two monorails. The other parks were easy with a bus ride. I never had to wait more than 10 mins for a bus during peak periods, however once I tried to take a bus to Hollywood Studios mid afternoon and had to wait close to 1/2 hr. We had hired a car, which was probably more of a waste of money. The car park was a good 5 min walk from the main building, and often had a hard time trying to find a parking space. It was easier to use Disney's transport to move around the park than use our own car, unless you wanted to visit another resort, where you would need to take multiple buses. In fact if you did try and drive within Disney you would still need to take a bus from the parking lot. It would of been cheaper for us to take taxis the few times we ventured outside Disney. As part of our package we received the standard dining plan. It was more than we needed. We usually liked to dine in full service restaurants, so these credit ran out rather quickly and it turned out we had snack and quick-service credits left at the end of the trip. But because we received the dining plan as part of a special and never paid extra for it, it didn't bother us. I would never of paid for the dining plan as I don't think it allows value for money, especially if you want to dine outside Disney occasionally. I did make advance reservations at many of the restaurants months in advance. Despite this two restaurants did not have a record of my reservation. Thankfully I had the confirmations saved on my phone for proof, otherwise I doubt the restaurants would of let us in. We were far to busy at the parks to spend much time at the resort. We never used the kids club. We used the pools a few times and the kids loved the waterslide, although it paled in comparison to any ride at the parks and waterparks! We loved spending time at the Grand Floridian and glad we did for the convenience of location. It was everything you expect from Disney and a 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the extra”
Reviews.Author: travelledhere
Reviews.Content: Just went November to December 2011 and decided to spend a little extra for what seemed to be a smaller and more intimate location. It's just as crazy-busy as all the others and we had varying experiences with the desk staff. Most had no idea how to help when it came to transportation, times, locations, etc. and some were down-right RUDE! I have never spent so much time requesting the services of the House Manager to either get the help we needed, or to complain about our experiences. Each time, the Manager was great, but we didn't appreciate having to get to that point when we're supposedly on vacation! The self-serve snack is a little lacking and small. There's a kids arcade right there amongst the few tables they have set up, so it's extremely loud and tight with all the kids running around. A few times there was no where to sit and we had to take things back to our room or find a spot outside with the smokers. On a positive note, the pool staff/activities were fun, my kids enjoyed the pool slide, the location was ideal and Narcosee's was delicious. Overall, I'm not sure I would recommend staying at The Grand Floridian to anyone...For the extra cost, you might want to stay somewhere else off-property and visit, or chose another resort and save $.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: McHaggis69
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian for 3 weeks over christmas and new year 2011-12. The hotel is simply stunning and maintained to a very high order. The public areas are beautiful. Our room was pretty much a standard double queen bed garden view room and was very well maintained with daily room service and nightly turn-downs. The pools were both very good, and although we didnt try all the restaurants, they all appear very nice. One nice touch is gasparilla grill, which is a very reaonably priced self service cafe open 24 hours. The hotel is as close to magic kingdom as is possible. Minor criticisms include price... It is VERY expensive for room only at this time of year. Super-expensive really. Self parking is remote from the hotel with the nearest car parking dedicated exclusively to valet parking... $12 per day plus of course tips for dropping car off and collecting. Multiply that by 21 days and its pretty expensive to have your car parked. We self parked mostly and strolled to the hotel. The bathroom needed updating... I know its supposed to be an old fashioned resort, but the shower head wasnt great at all. Overall though, minor distractions from a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “5-Star Pricing, Use to be Truly Grand, but getting Very Old”
Reviews.Author: BonVoyageFamily
Reviews.Content: We have gone to the GF numerous times, tried everything from connecting rooms to suites, main building and adjacent ones. We strongly recommend booking in the main building. For access to Disney parks, this is still the best place to go. For service, it use to be great but frankly they lost a lot: our private boat driver "Dave" told us to take the monorail because we were waiting too close to the fence! Our sofa bed in the suite was never done despite numerous times asking for it, they just seemed to have lost their magic. For pricing they still charge 5-star prices for everything but clearly they have never travelled to other 5-star properties worldwide now offering so much more for the same money. They are getting obsolete and its time for massive renovation and a new spirit for the staff. Our dinner at Citricos was great. Character breakfast at Park Fare was OK. The small personal boats on the lake is as always one of our kids favorite activity. So its well located, its pricey, its outdated, service lost its magic, but where else can you go to be that close? Our overall stay was exceptionnal not because of the GF, but mostly because of the incredible VIP private guided services of Suntastic. If you plan to go and you are ready to shovel the GF prices, call Suntastic. That extra is more then well worth it. They are amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Experience”
Reviews.Author: Niamb
Reviews.Content: My expectations were high. My husband had surprised me with the Disney Christmas I'd always dreamed of as I was preparing for retirement. Our honeymoon was to Disney World and this was to be a 2nd honeymoon. When we were first married we could not afford to stay within the park. This time we were staying at the premier resort, The Grand Floridian! I made our reservations eight months in advance of our stay and specified a king size bed. My husband is 6'6" tall. He is a king size guy and sleeping together in anything smaller than a king is very uncomfortable. At every step along the way I specified we wanted a king size bed; that this was a 2nd honeymoon. We also went for the park view room as it was a special occaision. When we arrived, however, we were told there were no king size beds available! A reservation made 8 months in advance and the Grand Floridian was unable to accomodate my request for a king size bed!?! This is a very, very basic request. I have NEVER had difficulty securing a king size bed at any hotel within the US or Canada when I made a reservation a significant time in advance. Instead of the romantic start I had anticipated for our second honeymoon, we were given a room with 2 queens and park view, if you didn't mind having to hold onto the rail of the balcony and leaning out to see the castle. Separate beds is not my idea of romance. The Grand Floridian did arrange to get us a king size bedded room for the next day, but I was livid over how my request for a king room had been ignored. Our long anticipated, romantic get-away was off to a very bad start. We couldn't unpack and move in as we were moving rooms the next day. While the valet staff was very courteous, moving cut into our time and I was so upset over this that it took a lot of the joy out of the first day of our 5 day stay. We were told they could not guarantee king size beds, no matter how far in advance a reservation was made. You have got to be kidding! This is Disney's most adult and luxurious resort. A king size bed is not an unusual request. A king size bed is pretty standard fare in every quality hotel or motel in the nation. Fail Disney!!! Once we were moved, our vacation became the experience I had anticipated. We were given a lovely king room with a marvelous view of the Magic Kingdom. Watching the fireworks over Sleeping Beauty's castle from our balcony was a thrill. The staff could not have been nicer and from then on out our vacation was what I had expected of a Disney vacation. While I realize my expectations were high, that is what Disney is selling...a magical vacation. They market their vacations to couples and a king size bed is not an extraordinary request.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Christmas Visit at Grand Floridian - Disney World”
Reviews.Author: Polarbearbeauty
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd visit within an 18 month period to this hotel. This time the week before Christmas. The weather was fantastic unlike the sweltering heat we suffered thru in June of 2010. The hotel lobby was festively decorated with a life size Gingerbread house and a huge tree as well as holiday decor thru the resort. Loved the planted poinsettia's disbursed through the entire property. The orchestra that plays nightly entertained lobby guests and those passing thru with holiday selections. This is an expensive hotel (room rate around $600 a night for a superior queen room) but you get immaculate housekeeping, quiet rooms and hallways and a beautiful property. I also feel very safe at this property. Two nice pools with complimentary towels poolside. The queen beds & pillows were comfy. Love the ceiling fan and the quiet A/C. Balcony faced the Magic Kingdom. I paid extra for this view but it was worth it to see the nightly fireworks during our 4 night stay and the 7 Seas Lagoon light show. We had high tea the first visit and went back again and was equally enchanted. The tea choices are numerous and the sandwiches, scones and pastries delectable! The monorail leaves off the 2nd floor of the hotel from the lobby so that makes transport to MK and Epcot very easy and can also use the boat transport. Bus service to the other properties. If you have not purchased a disney park dining plan even a coffee and cereal is pricey. I found the dining plan to be worth the $. The Bellman service is A+. You can park in the self park and it's only a short walk to the main entrance. Check in and then have a bellman take you back on a golf cart to retrieve your luggage. Of course if you only have a couple bags it's also easy to just wheel them over yourself. Excellent WiFi service. The only negatives were the room is showing slight wear in the bathroom and some of the room furniture seemed banged up. If you go during the holidays PREPARE FOR LARGE CROWDS at the parks but the extended hours for resort guests help to balance out that issue. We definitely will stay at The Grand Floridian anytime we visit Disney in the future.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian continues to exceed expectations”
Reviews.Author: AimeeMichele
Reviews.Content: This is the third year in a row that we have stayed at the Grand Floridian. However, this time my older brother, his wife and their youngest daughter (3 yrs) accompanied us (the previous trips our group consisted of myself, my mother, and my 2 nephews now aged 9 & 5). This year our travel dates were 11/25-12/01. Everyone in my party LOVED the Grand Floridian! We booked Theme Park View rooms (my present to my brother and his wife since they were celebrating their 10th anniversary) and we had fabulous views of the Castle, monorail, Main Street Train Station, Space Mountain, the Contemporary, and the boat dock at the Grand. The outer building we stayed in Sago Cay and had rooms 5342 & 5343 (connecting rooms). I love how bright and airy the rooms are! There is plenty of room and we never felt cramped. I slept on the pullout bed from the couch so that my older nephew could have a bed all to himself. Tip: call housekeeping and ask for them to bring up a king bed sized egg crate cushion. They will fold it in half and re-make the pullout bed with this which makes sleeping on that mattress very comfortable (I would not be able to sleep on it with the added cushion). My only complaint about the rooms is that we could only see part of the Electric Water Pageant from our room as the boat dock cut off the other half of the water parade and my nephews LOVE that show. Our rooms were immaculately clean, housekeeping always had our rooms cleaned by the time we returned for our mid-day break from the parks to swim and lounge around. Turn down service was always done before we returned to the room except for one night (no big deal). Our housekeeper always left extra toiletries, towels, brought up extra toothpaste as well as toothbrushes. Once I mentioned to her how my nephews and niece loved the little chocolates that had a picture of the Grand Floridian on them, she always left us extra ones each night after that. I do not know the scent that is piped into this resort but my goodness it smells wonderful! The little lobby areas of our outer building had its own Christmas tree, decorations, pointsettas and various other flowers. To those commenting on the "dated" look...the Grand Floridian is supposed to look like it's from the Victorian era. Nothing is dated i.e. old or needs replacement. There are no stains on the rugs, everything is sportlessly clean and shines. Obviously the Victorian look isn't everyone's cup of tea. If it's not yours, then there are plenty of other resorts to choose from. Granted, the Grand isn't a Ritz Carlton...however that's comparing apples to oranges. Remember, you are paying for location first and foremost at Disney World. I do believe that the Grand Floridian lives up to its flagship status. This will be the resort I return to time and time again. Their top notch customer service, spotlessly clean resort and fabulous views have made a lifetime customer out of me (my nephews and niece tell me how they wish they could live here...I tell them I wish that too!). The staff here truly go above and beyond. If you have an issue, you must walk to the front desk. If you call from your room the call goes to Disney's Central phone lines (not the actual front desk of the resort). I have no idea why Disney has it set up this way and unless you really research everything about Disney the regular guest would have no idea about this. The staff here really want you to have the best possible experience and will do whatever they can to ensure it. My brother and wife were celebrating their 10th anniversary, so I mentioned that to the front desk staff. One night they sent up a bottle of champagne, signed card from Mickey and Minnie, as well as a fruit and cheese basket wishing them a happy/magical anniversary. Another night they sent me a white chocolate mickey surrounded by tuxedo chocolate strawberries since I'm a return guest. These treats were completely unexpected and made quite the impression on everyone in my group! We didn't find the main lobby to be mobbed by non-guests and we were there at all times throughout the day. Of course, their beautiful 30-foot Christmas tree and real gingerbread house bring in guests from other resorts....the same goes for their fabulous restaurants here. All resorts are visited by non-resort guests for various reasons. Plus, this is Disney World! Of course there will be kids everywhere! If you are looking for a kidless vacation, Disney World is not the place for you. I am floored that people on this site are complaining about this. Non-resort guests visiting happens at every Disney deluxe resort. At least the Grand Floridan doesn't suffer from all of the non-resort guests that use their pool like the Polynesian and the Beach/Yacht Club encounter when they are not enforcing the pool wristbands (something the Grand Floridian doesn't have a problem with). Anywho, back to my review. The 2 pools here are never crowded and you will never have a problem finding a lounger. We rarely saw people on the beach. My nephews love playing in the sand, making sand castles, digging and playing catch. I think one time there were 2 other kids playing on the beach. Talk about relaxing and totally tranquil. Staff at the pool bars are extremely personable and very friendly. Heck, every staff member I encountered here was super friendly and very welcoming. If you want to participate in activies then the themed pool is for you! If you would prefer to relax and not hear the music or games being played then the other 24-hr "quiet" pool is for you! There is really something for everyone at this resort! On property, we ate at Narcossee's (one of Disney's signature restaurants), 1900 Park Fare (character breakfast) and Gasparilla's Grill (their counter service restaurant). No matter what was ordered by any member of our group was eaten and fabulous! Service was quick and always with a smile. The most we waited for any of our reservations here was 10 minutes. I definitely wait longer to be seated for my reservations here at Chicago restaurants. Transportation here to the parks cannot be beat! When taking the monorail to the Magic Kingdom, you're there in not even 2 minutes since the next stop is the Magic Kingdom. We never had problems finding an empty car on the monorail or having to squeeze in going from the Grand to the Magic Kingdom or to the Ticket and Transportation Center to transfer monorails to Epcot (this cannot be said when leaving the Contemporary after having dinner at Chef Mickey's to get back to the Magic Kingdom...we waited a good 20 minutes before boarding a monorail due to how many people were in line as well as on the monorails and we had to squeeze into a car with a bunch of other people). On the way back from the Magic Kingdom, hop on the ferry as the Grand Floridian is the first stop back and the ride is pretty and peaceful. Bus service is fab here as well! If you wait for more than 10 minutes, the bus attendant will ask you which park you're going to and will call in for a bus on their walkie talkie. For those of you that do not like the Grand, try out one of Disney's other resorts! There really is something for everyone. Me, I'll be coming back to the Grand with my mother, nephews and niece every chance I get! To me, it doesn't get any better than this

Reviews.Title: “The best of Disney!”
Reviews.Author: phillysam
Reviews.Content: The GF is really the best hotel in Disney. When the bus pulls up at this hotel.....everyone is in awe. It certainly is Grand. We were here right before Xmas- no crowds! All the decorations were up and it was a site to see.

Reviews.Title: “Great if your not looking for a pool for kids under age of 6”
Reviews.Author: Mommy-Traveler-1967
Reviews.Content: Okay read and read reviews about going to Disney during Xmas thru New years...busiest time of year. I have 2 kids under age of 6. So needless to say the pool needed to be at the very least heated. This pool here was said to be 80 degrees..which I can tell you won't cut it when the temp is below 80 degrees. It felt colder than that to me. I couldn't go in it and both kids had to wear 3M shorties to not freeze in the water. Mind you we had just stayed at a Marriott and had been playing in their outside pool for 3 days wearing regular bathing suits and water at 80 and 84 degrees (2 pools). Also the pool is centrally located and very open..so if you are feeling a bit self conscious in your bathing suit..well everyone walks by the pool. I didn't care but it was strange. The best part of the pool is the ducks that swim in it too. They were here before Disney so they let them stay. My daughter jumped in the pool with them. Okay..next our hotel room was in the Sugar Loaf bld. Very nice as they had food out most of the time and cookies and liquor in evening. Everyone was nice and David the guy that took our whole family to their rooms was outstanding. We had 13 people and everyone arrived at different times. Personally as far as location of the hotel to everything other than magic kingdom..I would suggest you keep a rental car. My in laws shelled out thousands of dollars for this 70th bday with grandchildren trip and I think the frustration from tram & bus travel was almost too much. Example it takes almost 1 hour to travel from Grand Floridian to Animal Kingdom via the tram and then getting on a bus. We ended up taking a cab and paid 20 bucks to get there quicker. Getting to downtown Disney bus wise takes as long and usually suiting in the same traffic you would have in a car minus the extra hotel stops. So I personally would not suggest you stay at the Grand Floridian if you are staying because you think you will get to the parks quicker...

Reviews.Title: “Loved this place”
Reviews.Author: Momof2lilboys
Reviews.Content: We stayed here when I attended a business conference in June. What a nice place. I should disclose that the rate was like $275 and was paid primarily by my employer, but I did pay for a few extra nights out of pocket since that was a discounted rate. I am not so sure I would pay $450 a night typically. Thought I should disclose that in case it biases my opinion of the place. Nice grounds, nice room. We were able to fit a pack and play in the vanity area to give a one year old some private sleeping quarters away from the rest of the family. My son, who was 4 at the time, loved the water slide. He and my husband rode it constantly. I was very pregnant and didn't get to ride. Loved being on the monorail line. That totally spoiled me. This was our 4th trip to Disney and we typically stay off site since we own a timeshare. The hubs and I personally think if you don't stay at a monorail resort or the Dolphin/Swan (very close to Epcot so you can get on Monorail there), you might as well stay off site. The buses took forever to take my husband and son to the Water Park one day. We went to the dock one night and watched MK fireworks and loved the boat parade at night. We would love to stay here again if the price was right, but would consider other MK resorts as well. Did I mention the nightly turndown service? Those chocolate were excellent to a 32 week pregnant lady!

Reviews.Title: “High expectations were exceeded!”
Reviews.Author: The_Global_Citizen
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at other Disney Hotels in Orlando on 2 previous vacations, my family and I had always hoped to be able to stay at the Grand Floridian because it seemed so "picture perfect". Travelling with my wife and 3 youngsters (17,14 & 9) we arrived for Christmas week (21 Dec - 28 Dec) with high expectations and I was worried that we might end up being disappointed. However every aspect of our stay was fantastic and all 5 of us would rush back in the blink of an eye. The ambience and decoration of the main lobby was truly magical and the smell of the gingerbread house (made from real gingerbread) was fabulous. Every evening a small "jazz band" played great music and the customary "Disney Photographer" was on hand to take group shots around the big Christmas Tree. Admittedly it did get a bit busy at times (with the occasional wedding and also lots of non-resident guests who popped in to have a look - just like we did on previous holidays) but it was never a big problem. The cost of staying at the Grand Floridian is clearly higher than other hotels but my view is that you DO get a better all round experience and, most importantly, they don't try to rip you off with too many "extras" like some hotels do. The rooms are great and seemed slightly bigger than other rooms we have stayed in before (at other Disney hotels). We opted for a room with a view of Magic Kingdom which was great but we weren't often in the room to really make full use of it so I might not bother with that another time! The facilities (pools, restaurants, small speed boats etc..) are all excellent and the whole property is kept in immaculate condition. The key differentiator for me was the quality of service and attention to detail. Anyone who has been to a Disney resort/park/hotel will know that all staff are pretty well trained to try and help everyone have a "Magical Day" but at the Grand Floridian the staff don't just pay lip-service to the idea but they seem to genuinely try to provide a very high quality of service. From the Car valets, reception staff, concierge, bar staff, pool attendants, cleaning staff, gardeners .... they all helped to make ours a truly wonderful holiday and we hope to be back someday soon!

Reviews.Title: “The not so "Grand" Floridian”
Reviews.Author: cruiser32952
Reviews.Content: My husband booked the Grand Floridian for our 26th annivesary at $815.00 per night, I'm sure the rate was a bit higher than usual as it was New Years Eve. As this was our first trip to Grand Floridian and our 16th resort stay in a Disney Resort, We was very excited. Checkin went very smooth. Upon our arrival in the Boca Chica building with a Lagoon view the excitement mounted. We entered our room and immediately stepped out on our balcony to view the lagoon.. Great view,however, there were multiple brown widow reclous spidernests and droppings all over the balcony. As we are Floridians we know our spiders and the brown reclous are very dangerous. We immediately called the front desk. Most of the nests were removed, but the balcony remained dirty with all the spider poop, Needless to say we spent little time out there. Also, the room was very rundown. A definite need for refurbishment. Promptly at midnight we saw the most beautiful fire works ever from our room. This took the edge off our previous experience with the spiders and rundown room. The next morning I went to the concierge to upgrade our park tickest bought with a WDW package to a Florida residence pass. Everything was going smoothly, however I needed my husband's FL Id for the rate. No problem.. They told us to stop by anytime to upgrade the ticket. Later that afternoon we returned to the concierge desk to update the tickets. The new clerk had no clue what we were talking about, unlike the morning staff. Very long story short, after 45 minutes the task was done. The Floridian staff manager on duty said it could not be done to the concierege clerk. She was quite stressed. The disney travel company told us as well as the morning staff this upgrade was okay. After the ticket mix up was settled, we rented a Boston Whaler and cruised the lagoon. Wonderful experience! The highlight of our stay. For a special treat we went to Citrico's, one of the upscale resaturants for dinner our second night. The bar tender was wonderful. We were seated promptly at a window table. Lovely. Unfortunately, our experience went down hill from there. Our waitress was slower than a snail. We had to seek her out for silverware and beverage refills. When the chef brought our food, it was fabulous. It is amazing how a poor waitress can really put a cramp into what should be a great experience. To sum it all up, I'm glad to have experienced the Grand Floridian. It was not what we expected for the price even if it were off peak pricing. For our next visit we will return to another deluxe or moderate hotel. My recommendation for future travelers is to save your money and stay at another resort.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Travelforbiz2011
Reviews.Content: By far the best location of all Disney resorts. One monorail or ferry ride to magic kingdom. It is also the most upscale of all resorts so the other guests are all very high class and friendly. I was a little disappointed with the food. Not much for casual dining. You either go all outq or settle for fast food style with an arcade. Food prices are outrageous, but that is Disney as a whole. A simple breakfast for 2 adults one child and infant will cost you $70. If you do a character buffet be prepared to spend $35-$60 per person. Overall very nice, upscale resort. If you don't mind spending the money this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Fun for Kids and Adults”
Reviews.Author: pman383838
Reviews.Content: The top aspects of this hotel when compared to other Disney properties, particularly the polynesian and contemporary, is the laid back elegance. The live music in the lobby was very festive, either a piano player or a 5 piece jazz band. Much of an improvement over the 24 hour tiki music at the Polynesian. The monorail is very close to the rooms in the main building and the pools are close as well. We stayed in the main building on the fourth floor which is part of the club level. Our kids loved the pool with the waterside and loved searching for the characters in the wallpaper, floors, and furnishings. The club had a good selection of snacks, however completely failed expectations for our family member with a food allergy.

Reviews.Title: “WOW!”
Reviews.Author: KellyinKaty
Reviews.Content: Visited during the Christmas holidays, it was breathtaking. From the Gingerbread house in the main lobby selling gingerbread, the nightly live music (bands and choirs), ducks and bunnies running around and the nightly movies at the pool - all added to the wonderful experince we had at this hotel. Magical !

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: rmgjr3
Reviews.Content: The accommodations are typical Disney resort, however the difference is in the level of service provided by the staff. From the check in process to the room service the property really goes out of its way to provide excellent service. The room was spotless and the dining on site was great. Also the direct connection to the Magic Kingdom via the monorail was a great perk.

Reviews.Title: “Always wonderful”
Reviews.Author: pmorlab
Reviews.Content: I have gone to the Grand Floridian three times in the last years. I always found it awesome. Just a monorail stop or a nice boat trip to the Magic Kingdom and very well connected to the rest of the parks. Very helpful service and great rooms, especially in the club level in the main building. The swimming pools and common areas and are very nice, clean and enjoy to have a break in a hot day! We have always had a great time there and we hope to come back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Grand Floridian So-So”
Reviews.Author: Jeff L
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel...it goes without saying. However, compared to other Disney locations (theme parks, cruise line, etc) we found that the Grand Floridian didn't really live up to Disney Standards. The hotel was not dirty, but it wasn't clean, either. The service was so-so. Our balcony was grimy, bug-infested, and had lots of spiderwebs everywhere...a statement that it wasn't clean. The room attendants were spotty, forgetting to restock the in-room coffee, ice, and etc. Room Service was very expensive. In-room coffee was $6.99. Then, there was a $3.00 trip charge, tax, and $2.00 gratuity, bringing the entire bill to $13.90 for a pot of coffee. Not to mention the $27.00 cheese burger (with $2 tip.) We didn't think the hotel was "awesome" like others on Trip Advisor. However, don't take our review as "the one source" as others obviously loved it.

Reviews.Title: “"Grand"? I don't think so.”
Reviews.Author: lovliv
Reviews.Content: *The first half of this review is of the resort itself, and the second half is about how we got sick at the resort. This review is mainly based on the property, not the illnesses.* We've just returned from a pre-Christmas, nine-day trip to Disney and the Grand Floridian Resort. I will say that visually, the hotel is beautiful and the grounds are well maintained and quite lovely. Transportation everywhere was a breeze - we barely waited for a monorail or a tram. Being decorated for Christmas, which was another draw for us, the beautiful tree in the lobby and the gorgeous gingerbread house that doubled as a baked goods store were fun, even if they made the lobby insanely crowded at most times of day. We were traveling with a party of 18. We were all put up in the Conch Key house, one of the last on the property, and from our side, it faced the bay, the monorail, and if you looked to the right off the balcony, you could watch Magic Kingdom's fireworks every night. However, you run the risk of a spider the size of a quarter landing on you - spider nests, webs and dead bugs absolutely covered the porches facing the bay. It was disgusting. The rooms, however, were average. As in, where you shrug and say, "Yeah, it was nice." Not grand, not worth the price. Scratchy bedspreads, tiny toilet closets, unvacuumed floors, undusted furniture. There is nothing on t.v. most of the time, which gives the impression that they don't want you to be in your rooms! The price seemed to be wrapped in the packaging - as I said, the grounds are beautiful and immaculate, the two pools are lovely, they are expanding the "beach" area and even though there was work with heavy machinery, they did seem to stop using it early enough in the morning where you didn't see or hear it. The groundskeeping is constant and the smell of mulch is always in the air (which I liked). The spa was closed for reno, which was very disappointing as we were looking for a "girls' day" there. The hotel at this time of year is crowded, but not as crowded as it is starting on Christmas Eve through New Year's. However, this seems to be the week when the hotel is not super interested in keeping you happy. The bar by the children's pool, on the day my entire family chose to use it, was closed. "Joe" called in sick that day, and the bar remained closed all day. The resort would not send a waiter/waitress over from the other pool to accommodate our drink requests. They suggested we order from room service! On top of that, someone in our party wanted to rent a cabana for the day. The staff member in charge of that started noticing we were taking up a lot of lounge chairs and came over and mentioned that before we get the cabana, we needed to know that we had to "pick" six people to use the cabana because that was the maximum, and we seemed to have a large party. I had been to the pool three times prior that week, and NO one had rented any cabanas, but they're discouraging us from renting? Finally he came back over and said, well, you're not a rowdy group, so if you still want it... we took it because we had infants that needed to get out of the sun, but truly it was ridiculous if this is supposed to be a top-shelf property. Restaurants: We ate at Citricos, which was wonderful, Narcoosee's, where you can watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks while you dine, again was wonderful and had nice architecture, and we had a good breakfast in the Grand Floridian Cafe. Every restaurant we tried on property and at Epcot were truly excellent meals. Gasparillas is the "quick serve" restaurant where you went for hot dogs, burgers, fruit, yogurt, salads, etc. Because it is open 24 hours and because you need reservations at all times everywhere else, you end up running to Gasp's a lot. The food is okay, and quickly gets tiresome. The variety of snacks and drinks is quite decent. **** Now to the serious part... this has to do with the hotel and the parks as well. I had the sneaking feeling after the second day that housekeeping was minimal - wiping and swiping here and there - there were things still on the floor, a dead fruit fly remained on the vanity until I cleaned it off... but many of us contracted a violent 24-hour stomach flu. We knew that at least one other family on our floor - whom we did not know - had the virus, and several in our party witnessed people actually vomiting in the park and outdoors on property. The front desk had a runner go and get Pedialyte for our children, forgot, and gave us another family's bottle, which meant that someone else was sick as well! Miraculously in the next two days it was in stock in the gift shop. We alerted a manager whom we ran into (he was courteous and inquiring about our stay) and he hand picked a specific cleaning lady to clean all of our rooms. Her name was Marie Claire and I must say that was the only day I felt our rooms were sanitized and clean. The manager let us know that the properties use industrial cleaner (concentrate, which gets mixed with water - ha) so we couldn't use it personally. No Lysol or Clorox is available. He sent large tubs of sanitizing hand wipes, which really came in handy. No one had gotten sick until we were there at least 72 hours, so it wasn't something we had when we got there. I have read at least two other reviews of people complaining of the cleanliness here and I must say that it is on my mind to call the Health Department in Orlando and see what they have to say about this. Disney cannot expect to accommodate such enormous amounts of people with children and not have cleanliness be of the utmost importance. While we made a lifetime of memories on our Disney trip, the most memorable thing about it was surviving "The Grand Floridian Stomach Bug." It followed us onto the plane and home to ruin Christmas day. Two-thirds of our family became ill, including infants. A couple we sat near in the airport staying on a different property got it as well. This Christmas, Disney goes on the naughty list.

Reviews.Title: “Made me a Kid again!!!”
Reviews.Author: Washingtonf09
Reviews.Content: For my 22nd birthday, a VERY SPECIAL someone surprised me with a trip to Walt-Disney World. I was told the Grand Floridan is the flagship hotel, and after my trip there - i do not contest that claim... The valet, check-in, and bellmen experience and everything in between was MAGICAL!!! The hotel lobby with the balcony views were stunning. The rooms were very clean, and the dining was second to none!!! Both pools are pools like no other, and the hot tub was simply amazing. Words simply cannot explain the experience that I had at the Grand Floridian Resort, but I will say it is an experience that i'll never forget!

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay at the GF”
Reviews.Author: mewosery
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Sugarloaf, where there was concierge service. I was originally hesitant to book othe outer building, fearing we would miss a lot of stuff being away from the main building, boy was I wrong. We loved the small, cottage feel of the Sugarloaf, where it was quiet, away from the main building, which we found noisy (I know it was Christmas season). This worked out great for our family with the youngster, as we wer able to keep them in one location, without having to run around. Service was great from the concierges, to the wait staff to housekeeping. Very efficient. I did find the rooms a tad small, especially at the price point you paid, not very big overall. Would definitely stay there again next time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Needs Some Updating in Outer Buildings”
Reviews.Author: cynthiahays
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand Floridian. Overall a lovely property. We did enjoy our visit and will likely return. Main lobby and grounds are gorgeous. Service is outstanding, a step above the other deluxe Disney resorts. The one thing we love about Disney is that 99% of the hotel staff seem to truly love working there and are motivated to make your stay a memorable one. It makes for a magical experience. The rooms at the GF are nice but not remarkably better than at Boardwalk/Yacht&Beach Club. Certainly not to the level of other hotels in that price range, but we understand going in that we are a captive audience. One pet peeve of ours is the flooring and finishes in the outer building reception areas. If you are in the main building everything is top notch. In the outer buildings (where the majority of the rooms are located) the flooring and finishes are painfully outdated. Come on Disney, pink tile?? Miami Vice has not been around for 20yrs and neither should that flooring, yuk. The elevators were pretty beat up too. We stayed at the Boca Chica, Garden View side. First floor offered a lovely view of the grounds, we liked it. But room could have used some deep cleaning. The patio did not look like it had been touched in months. Tons of mosquitos and just dirty. The bathroom had some serious dust on the light fixtures, the grout needed a good bleaching and the paint to be touched up. Really all the room needed was a deep clean...the furnishings, etc were all just fine. You would think at the GF prices each room would get a deep clean every month. We have stayed at the Boardwalk Inn 6 times and have never had a problem there. And the beds at GF are awful. Boardwalk updated their beds/bedding about 4 yrs ago but GF has not, at least not that we could tell. We all know Disney's "5Star" version of a resort is no comparision to a Four Seasons, etc but when a Westin $149 room gives you a superior bed/bedding that is unacceptable. Room service was excellent. Citricos was very good although they undercooked the risotto. Narcossee's had bad scallops (even the second round the chef personally delivered were then overseasoned, we gave up) and overall a forgettable meal. Grand Floridian Cafe was surprisingly good....not great but a fine meal for $25 per person. Overall we will return as the GF does give you that magical feeling....but we hope by then they will freshen it up a bit. Maybe competition from the Four Seasons completion in 2014 will be motivation.....it will be "on" Disney property and will give the GF a run for their $$, I know we will think about giving them a try.
