Sure, no Mickey lamps but THAT is luxury :)

Reviews.Title: “So not worth the price, trust me.”
Reviews.Author: Skylane_Dave
Reviews.Content: Maybe, I had my expectations too high, but I really don't think so. We stayed in October over Halloween. The service and hospitality were much lower than what I have experienced at other Disney resorts. The rooms were just okay, nothing special. Even after making dinner reservations months in advance, we still had to wait 30 minutes to be seated. If you do stay here, make sure you get a room facing Magic Kingdom, so you can see the fireworks. By the way, the Not So Scary Halloween Party at Magic Kingdom is fabulous! Highly recommend it to everyone. Have a magical day!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, magical, and refreshing - but perhaps not worth $500/night”
Reviews.Author: naturalogg
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been loyal Disney fanatics our entire lives, averaging about one trip to Orlando per year from Philadelphia. I've generally always stayed at a Disney hotel when I visit, and by this point I'd pretty much hit them all besides Grand Floridian. We planned our 4-night Disney trip with two nights in Port Orleans French Quarter (at $220/night) followed by two nights in the Grand Floridian (at $550/night). French Quarter was just fine and dandy - nice ferry to Downtown Disney, easy access to everything. From the moment we arrived at the Grand Floridian, it was clearly a cut above the rest. Everyone magically knew our names. We were escorted to check-in right away, and despite the slightly creepy receptionist at the desk, everything was smooth and easy. The entire property is truly beautiful. One of the pools is open 24 hours a day - what a treat! Restaurants and bars were generally not booked during our mid-December visit - also a nice treat. But frankly...I just can't justify a 2.5x jump in price from French Quarter to Grand Floridian. The bathroom had two sinks but it wasn't exactly anything special. We were given two double beds to sleep in. The balcony was nice to have and our view of the property was lovely. But I probably could have found a few better things to do on Disney Property with my extra $330 a night. I might go back if the nightly rate ever goes on special...but I've stayed at some other $550/night hotels in the past, and this one doesn't quite make it worthwhile.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful resort december 8-12”
Reviews.Author: bkp326
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian December 8-12 with our 3 kids, ages 4, 3 and 7 months old. We were nervous about cramming ourselves into a standard room with the kids but it worked out. I requested a room with a day bed so that each child had their own bed and also got a crib for the baby. We had a garden view room but could still see the fireworks every night from the balcony of our room. We spent most of the day enjoying the convenient accessibility of the monorail from the GF, going to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot during our stay. We had a few character measl at GFs Park Fare restaurant. We also had a few meals at GF Cafe and Gasparilla Grill. Overall, the food was pretty good, though expensive. We visited some of the other disney resorts....Polynesian, Contemporary, Fort Wilderness....they just did not compare to the Grand Floridian. The GF truly is grand.....the main lobby was gorgeous with a huge christmas tree and the beautiful gingerbread house. My husband was a little hesitant to stay here at first because of the cost. However, after staying there, he said he doesn't think he could stay anywhere else...I have to agree.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat for Christmas at Disney!”
Reviews.Author: wonderfulshana
Reviews.Content: The first thing I noticed at check in were the roasting chestnuts out front and then the doors opened to the smell of Christmas and some beautiful trees. The staff was very friendly and helpful, we stayed in the concierge building of Sugar Loaf and loved it. In the room were my 2 year old, my Mom, and myself. We had 2 double beds and we setup a toddler cot and still had plenty of room. Although expensive we felt that it was well worth every penny as the staff was great and the resort beautiful. If you can't stay you should at least treat yourself to a tour of the awesome lobby, you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest properties in MK area”
Reviews.Author: BIGtraveller66
Reviews.Content: We just had our third stay at WDW in a year and stayed at this hotel in teh Sugarloaf concierge building. It is a nice property, great amenities and nice, older but clean rooms. Our only downfall was some of the concierge staff not being helpful or friendly when requesting things they should do (we pay for it!). Food at concierge was excellent. WE did Polynesioan club level previously and this is far better standard. The only thing is some of the other guests thinking it is an all you can eat buffet. A bit more, there is a cow bell rang! Check-in was not the smoothest and had to change rooms and get our requests (bedails_ etc) due to the lack of organization. This would have been nice to run smoother considering how late we arrived. One major thing that left us questioning the quality of the resort is due to a specific lady working as a hostess (Diana) at the Grand Floridian cafe who was rude and refused to give us a cup of water for our crying baby to drink. We were clearly guests and on our way out to the monorail and only wanted a cup of water since our baby was thirsty. She refused telling us we have to walk over to the self service area to do that. That was unacceptable considering the standards of this hotel and especially when we are guests staying there, she should have accomodate our simple request. We went to 1900 park fare and a very kind lady was glad to help out. Other than that, staff was great, rooms cleaned well by mousekeeping, close to other MK hotels and restauratns. Did Citricos one night. Most likely will never go again. Overpriced, poor service and mediocre food. Go to the Wave where food is so much better, service is outstanding and cheaper! 1900 park fare is a good buffet diner. One of the best for character diners. We will be back but not sure if we will stay at the GF.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Resort”
Reviews.Author: Patricia S
Reviews.Content: We stayed in early December. We were in Sugar Loaf, on the first floor, and on the Concierge level. The pool was wonderful and everyone treated us like we were special, including housekeeping who met every request we had. We watched the fireworks from the pool at night and the movies and other activities pool side were a special addition to our vacation, although it was a little chilly out at night. The portable crib was the best gift of all..the baby actually slept! It had a real mattress and the couch that made into a bed was very comfortable. The only two drawbacks, the bathroom area is a little small, and other than the desk with one chair, there is no place to sit down and eat in your room, unless you sat outside on the little patio area. Oh, and the dryers - they need to do something about the fact that even after $4.00 your clothes are still not dry! Nobody wants to spend their vacation doing laundry all day and when traveling with kids it is inevitable you will have to do wash, especially with the weight limits on luggage. Other than that the rooms were quite large and extremely comfortable and clean. Traveling with a family is difficult, but Disney properties always makes your vacation an enjoyable one. Thank you to all the Disney staff for making our family vacation an enjoyable one!

Reviews.Title: “Yet Another Magical Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Beryl F
Reviews.Content: We first stayed in the Grand Floridian in 2005 and have tried staying at other resorts but once you stay at the GF, you're hooked! We checked at around 8:00 am on Sunday, November 27th (Thanksgiving weekend) and were pleasantly surprised to learn that we were given a complimentary upgrade to a small suite and also that our room was ready! I was with my husband and we were celebrating our 30th wedding anniversary. We were checked in quickly and went to our room to unpack. We were on the 5th floor of building #9. Great view of the gardens and pool. The staff was knowledgeable and kind. Nothing beats staying on the monorail line! Sadly, I have to include a few negatives to give a completely honest review. My husband wears out quickly in the parks and loves to return to the resort in the afternoon for a nap before dinner. We requested that the housekeeping of our room was complete by 2 pm. On a 7 day stay, this request was only honored one time. Also when they came to do the nightly turn down, it was often after 9 pm and we were already preparing for sleep and had to turn them away. We have stayed at the GF many times and this is the first time we ever experienced anything like this so we shrugged it off but it was disappointing. The other negative comment I need to make was about the lobby of the hotel. What has happened to the beautiful and peaceful lobby?! The large Christmas tree has become a "tourist attraction" and now includes a photo pass opportunity. The gingerbread house is another "tourist attraction" too. There were many more people in the lobby who weren't guests of the GF just to snoop around. We had to fight crowds to get through the lobby no matter what time of day it was. We were very sad that we didn't get to enjoy the lobby even one time. There was nowhere to sit down and enjoy the band and it was so noisy and chaotic! There were unsupervised children running wild. I will of course return to the GF again but next time we are looking at going in January, after the Christmas decorations have been taken down. It is a shame because we always loved the holidays when a guest at the GF but now that it has become such a tourist attraction, we're hoping that choosing a quieter time to vacation will be better. Everything else about our stay was well, GRAND!

Reviews.Title: “An unDisney-like Disney resort”
Reviews.Author: Wan2Scream
Reviews.Content: Other than a lot of Mickey shapes in the wallpaper, nothing in the Grand Floridian rooms was Disney-like. My husband and I knew we were on Disney property but it didn't really feel like it. The resort was luxurious in the style of an early 1900s Victorian hotel but certainly not worth $500 a night. We went in late November and a 10-foot-tall gingerbread house adorned the lobby, along with a 30-foot-tall Christmas tree. Live music was provided by a pianist and by a four-piece combo. Ducks and squirrels and a few little rabbits roam the property. We've stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge and Wilderness Lodge, both of which had much more charm than the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas decor, beautiful holiday”
Reviews.Author: Braziliantravelers
Reviews.Content: Beautiful decor, fantastic holiday!From the moment you arrive to the last minute it was all fun!

Reviews.Title: “This is the best of the deluxe hotels”
Reviews.Author: Nelle_1234
Reviews.Content: I have fallen in love with the G.F. I use to stay at the Contemporary but the last two times I was at WDW I stayed at the G.F. It is a great location (last stop before Magic Kingdom on the monorail OR skip the monorail completely and hop on the boat shuttle). It has several dining options (high class, character, casual and super casual). The pools are clean/large and well maintained -- they never seem to be too busy either. The layout can be confusing but if you get a room with a park view it is so much nicer to sit on a balcony enjoy your beverage watching the fireworks and listening to the audio then sitting some where in the park and then having to deal with the rush to get out. The spa is EXCELLENT. I found this hidden gem the first time I stayed there and now I make a point to have a few treatments while in town.

Reviews.Title: “Seriously, this is the flagship property?”
Reviews.Author: nwh7928
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Floridian for 4 nights over Thanksgiving on the Club floor. We were there with our daughter and another family for the holiday. A recent review was titled "Is this really the best Disney has to offer?"--a view I could not agree with more. I don't know how Disney continues to levitate. The Grand Floridian is a mediocre property in need of a remodel. The much vaunted Disney staff was okay at best--not what I'd expect on the Club level at the premier Disney property. The rooms are small, old, and look like you are at your Grandma's house in 1980. The bedspread was threadbare...something I have not seen at a hotel in years. The porch was gross with mold and bugs. The food service on the Club level bothered me. We have only stayed at The Wilderness Lodge previously on a Disney Club level, but the food and offerings were lame. I don't know if Disney has cut back, or the offerings are simply different between the two properties, but the fare was limited and about the same quality as the crap you'd get staying at a Hampton Inn morning buffet. I must say, though, I did like the evening deserts. If you have ever stayed at a Ritz Club level property done well, you know how you are supposed to be treated at a premier property. This is not even close, yet you are charged even more than most Ritz's. I see no reason to stay here again. So, save yourself the money and either stay at a less expensive Disney property and expect a mediocre experience (if you must have Disney transportation), or better yet stay off property at the Ritz (or whatever) and take their transportation in to the park.

Reviews.Title: “A Disney Favorite”
Reviews.Author: allseas1586
Reviews.Content: We've been staying at the Grand Floridian for over 10 years, and it remains a favorite. Some of my favorite things are the music played in the lobby in the evenings, the 24 hour courtyard pool, and the overall relaxed feel of the resort. Service and attention to detail have suffered over the years. We had a few issues in our room, stains on the wallpaper, beds missing decorative pillows, rust on the bathroom door, a dirty balcony, and a TV that wouldn't turn on or off at random times (even engineering was perplexed by it). Extreme waits at Mizer's bar no matter how busy was another consistent issue - at a four star resort this shouldn't happen. Fine dining at Citricos and Narcoossee's generally still meets expectations though. Overall, we'll be back, but the lack of the small details just make the place not what it used to be.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: drymartini3
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our stay at the Grand Floridian. My daughter and son-in-law took my wife and I, along with the grand-kids, for a four day adventure and my first trip to Disney. I must admit that in the beginning I really did not know what to expect, but would like to return to Disney again. The frosting on the cake was the Grand Floridian Hotel. It is an elegant hotel with employees that give great service. Loved being there!

Reviews.Title: “A must stay!”
Reviews.Author: mumerk
Reviews.Content: Warning - if you stay here, you will be spoiled! Nothing else will ever measure up! It is beautiful, clean, staff is friendly, food is excellent, the ambiance is perfect. Absolutely, eat at Narcoossee's - the Grand Floridian's waterfront restaurant. Also, don't forget to watch for the Magic Kingdom fireworks every night. They can be seen from some rooms, and almost anywhere on the property. They also have a nightly water parade that is cool to watch as well. Also, you can't beat the convenience of getting right on the monorail from the resort. It saves so much time. 1900 Park Fare (a character buffet in the lobby) is also delicious, but it fills up super fast, so make reservations early!

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Fraser1972
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for a couple of weeks in August and it was excellent in all areas. This marked our third straight August stay here and we look forward to next Summer. Great service!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian or Animal Kingdom Lodge”
Reviews.Author: Vwhitecpa
Reviews.Content: When planning our vacation to WDW I struggled between the Grand Floridian or Animal Kibgfom Lodge. Ultimately I decided on Grand Floridian because of reviews I read and the GF was a beautiful Victorian style hotel but it was just a high end hotel. The monorail was great for getting to Magic Kingdom but everywhere else was no different than from any other hotel. I chose the GF because it was supposed to be top of all WDW hotels. I paid extra for a lagoon view because I thought we would be able to see the fireworks from our balcony but not all lagoon view rooms have a view of Magic Kingdom - ours did not and that was a bit of a disappointment. It was nice but my parents chose the Animal Kingdom Lodge and I wish I had done the same. Their room was smaller like the reviews said but it was plenty big and the savanna views of the free roaming animals was great The Amimal Kingfom Lodge with all of the foliage was very relaxing and the service was great in their room too. All things considered both hotels were great and I would highly recommend either. Make your choice based on what atmosphere you want. Travel to the parks and room size shouldn't sway your decision The best advice of all I can offer is to use the VIP tour services. It is worth every bit of the $300 per hour. If I had to stay in an economy hotel in order to be able to afford the VIP service I would

Reviews.Title: “Fall of the Grand House of Mouse?”
Reviews.Author: frequenteater
Reviews.Content: Overwhelmed, poorly trained and disconnected staff with lack of follow-up of inquiries. Upon arrival at 10:30 PM with 3 12 year-old girls and 2 adults our bags were taken by staff at this Disney's "top" property. We were told they would be sent "right up". I tipped the guy $5. After check-in I gave the ticket to bell captain who said "this will be a while." I inquired how long is a while? "I do not know - we are really backed up I if you need them now I suggest you carry them your self." I said OK - and moved toward trolley behind her and she said "you can't use trolley for the safety of other guests". Room was located in another building on opposite side of large complex and she is telling me I have to carry 5 suitcases, 2 briefcases and 3 knap sacks myself without trolley and that is safer for other guests? I asked for manager - captain disappeared and after 15 min I left as no one came back. So we were stuck- for $5 we got our bags at midnight. Room condition was poor. Broken door on dresser fell off when we opened it. OK, so we called to get it fixed first night.Was not repaired until morning of checkout. Bought tickets for parks in advance online to try to save time at park entry. After waiting 30min at gate of Magic Kingdom next morning we were told tickets were "processed incorrectly by hotel staff", so we were shunted to end of long guest services line. We explained to an employee and she said sorry - you need to get in line. I asked for manager, she disappeared for 30 min and just as we were coming to window she reappeared with manager. He took our certificates ($800 worth) and I asked him for his card. He handed me a "guest services" card with no name! Managers at Disney are handing out cards without even first names. Yup. Anonymous managers. The phone number on the card is the general number. When he returned he had proper tickets. When I asked if we could get a any sort of "fast Pass" as rides waits were increasing he said "No - not our fault - talk to hotel." But hotel is owned by same company, Disney, right? Hotel processed using Disney system, right? To no avail. We then were able to get into park 120 min minute past when we left on-property hotel on monorail. Hotel rooms were located next to elevator. Noisy bells, kids and strollers. We called and asked if elevator bell could be turned off, down or moved each of three days. Each call we were assured someone would get back to us but each shift manager failed to follow-up until I went to front desk on third day of stay where I met manager John who did follow-up. He said cannot turn bell, can move rooms for last night, but after discussion of above he offered us credit for one night stay. The real question is why at Disney's Flagship hotel does it seem there is lack of follow-up and no personal responsibility? Credit was due, but I would rather pay full fare and get what I was looking for at Grand Floridian - service.

Reviews.Title: “Is this really the best that Disney has to offer?”
Reviews.Author: WrldtrvlrBH
Reviews.Content: We are used to first-class accomodations, and went "for the best" in booking this flagship Disney property for our 4 day stay. We paid top dollar, the overall tab being in excess of $12,000 for 4 nights in a 2-BR suite. Regreattably, what was advertsied in the reservation process as a "concierge level" suite ended up being on a regular floor of one of the outbuildings (Big Pine Key). We did have access to the concierge lounge in the main building, but it was two elevator rides and a 5 minute walk away....not suitable for saying to the kids "go ahead, I'll meet youa t breakfast". When we complained upon checkin a swap was offered for the next day, but the mangers did not follow through and the promised swap (which would have cost me another $1,000) never materialized. Overall, the feel is more of a Marriott Courtyard than a Four Seasons. The one bright spot in our stay was room service which was better than average luxury hotel quality: warm fresh food, served promptly and politely.

Reviews.Title: “Best Disney Hotel I've Stayed At.”
Reviews.Author: DimeStoreSaint
Reviews.Content: This place is beautiful. It is well worth the cost and if you are torn between this and any other Deluxe resort in Disney, I suggest you stay here. The entire feel of this hotel is luxury. The staff is warm and friendly. The amenities (especially if you stay at club level) are superb. You can't beat the easy access to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot with the Monorail and it seems like the buses run quicker here too. This hotel may have spoiled me to every other Disney property...

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort with great service”
Reviews.Author: Aleahburg
Reviews.Content: Our family loved the Grand Floridian. Beautiful resort, from the gorgeous grounds, to the magnificent Christmas tree and Gingerbread house in the lobby The service was outstanding. Someone was there to greet us by name at we got off the bus and checked us right in. We will definitely stay at the Grand Floridian again

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Alicnwondrln
Reviews.Content: Just returned from another amazing stay at the Grand Floridian Resort. We had a club level room in the main building. The cast members were very nice and helpful and the food was wonderful. We were able to secure a wonderful rate thanks to Kelly at Travel with the Magic and we had a wonderful view with a view of the castle. We had dinner one night at the Grand Floridian Cafe and it was very good and breakfast at 1900 Park Fair with Alice and Mary Poppins. There is construction going on at the back of the resort and the spa is closed but that did not bother us. We just did a 3 night stay this time but I love this resort and look forward to going back in the Spring.

Reviews.Title: “beyond deluxe!”
Reviews.Author: TravelAgentCT
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is the best of the best! We were greeted as we got off the bus and escorted to a spot in the lobby where they went through our information and package. We were booked in a lagoon view and our room was in Boca Chica, first floor. The property is gorgeous, everything was SPARKLING CLEAN and staff was extremely friendly. The "mousekeeper" was outstanding and we appreciated the towel animals and turn down service every night. Our room, 8137, was facing the Contemporary Resort and if we looked to the left from the balcony we had a beautiful view of the Castle. Sound proofing is amazing and you don't hear anything. If you're looking for the ultimate in accommodations, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Hope to return”
Reviews.Author: BeyondCastles
Reviews.Content: We have stayed one time at Disney's Grand Floridian. It really was a great time. The hotel is incredible. The lobby is breathtaking as are the grounds. The rooms seem to be a little smaller than the rooms at other deluxe resorts but since we don't spend too much time there, we didn't mind. My biggest complaint with the Grand Floridian is the quick-service restaurant-- don't get me wrong here, it has great food....seafood macaroni and cheese, anyone? But there isn't good seating-- not a lot and too close to the arcade games. We LOVED the music in the lobby each evening. Whether it was the grand piano being played or the live band, we could have stayed there all night! The pools are very nice. We did not spend any time at the bigger pool with the slide because my kids just loved the secondary pool. I would definitely recommend this hotel and I hope that we can return some day!

Reviews.Title: “Can I just say Awesome?”
Reviews.Author: Hillenburg96
Reviews.Content: This is by far one of the best hotels i have ever stayed in. I have been coming here ever since I was a little kid and every time we have been, we have had a wonderful time. Great staff, fun activities for kids and adults, good transportation to and from the park, good location, beautiful view. Even though some people may say that Disney is just a kids place, they have so many options right within the hotel! While you are there, go to the Victoria and Albert, you will not be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Superb quality and service at this Disney Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: longtimeresident
Reviews.Content: We were very glad that we chose to pay extra and stay at the Disney Grand Floridian. The location is fantastic, one of three on property hotels right on the Monorail which is a big plus. We are two adults traveling without children and this hotel had a nice mix of family and couples. The lobby was gorgeous and reminded us a bit of the Bellagio in Las Vegas with gorgeous tile, very nice public space and a jazz band playing in the late afternoon. The hotel is very upscale, has a fun atmosphere and very good energy. Our room had a view of the lake and beach and it was quiet and relaxing. Because we were on the third floor, it had high ceilings and a ceiling fan, a real treat in a hotel room. The room was spacious, had a frig, and a nice sized bathroom with all the amenities. The hotel is very well run. The staff were very attentive to our needs for a quiet room. Everyone at the hotel seemed to genuinely enjoy their job and were always friendly as we walked thru the hotel. We would like to personally recognize John Moss, General Manager for his attentiveness to our dietary needs (vegetarian and wheat allergy) and helping us understand the Disney Dining Plan, which we found confusing. Also Tyler, the chef at the Grand Floridian Cafe met with us to discuss our dietary needs and prepared a special plate of risotto, vegetables and a salad that was absolutely mouth watering. We have no complaints about this hotel except note that the Spa is undergoing renovation as they are expanding and it's closed, so don't expect a spa. You will very disappointed. But it is noted on their web site. Buying the package that includes the hotel, dining plan and hopper passes is definitely the way to go if you like an easy vacation with no hassles. We bought the Dining Plan that included one snack, one quick service meal and one full meal and we never went hungry during our entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “outstanding family trip”
Reviews.Author: tfmjr
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is an fantastic location for families (with kids of all ages) visiting Disney. Close to magic kingdom, great transportation to all other disney parks, near golf courses, great service.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our family of five including 3 toddlers”
Reviews.Author: Westchesterfamilyfun
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Flo for a week during the third week of October 2011. We booked two adjoing Deluxe Parkview rooms and ended up on the first floor with decent views of the castle and fireworks. We also were treated to the nightly mermaid show on the lagoon in front of the resort (can be loud!). The staff were very accomodating and accustomed to asssiting families with small children. We have three year-old boys and a twenty month old girl. Whenever we travel, we set up their room a certain way to ensure everyone sleeps well, including a pack and play. The housekeeping staff seemed to be aware of the importance because they never disturbed our special setup. Room servcie was delicious and prompt. The hotel has the best location on the monorail, along with the Polynesian and the Contemporary. Great pools and a nice beach. The resaturants are the nicest in Disney, with great menus and lots of options, including vegetarian. The last two weeks in October are the best times for weather, few lines, and few crowds. We almost always sat in front during parades and performances. Using a good Fast Pass system we never waited more than fifteen minutes in a line, and most of the time breezed right through. Also, although our kids were a bit young, the Not So Scary Hallowen party goes on almost every night during this time. All in all a terrific stay and great hotel. We also avoided the Magic bus or whatever from the airport and arranged for a private van to and from the airport- definitely the way to go.

Reviews.Title: “Another outstanding stay”
Reviews.Author: Geraldine N
Reviews.Content: We just got back from another oustanding vacation at the Grand Floridian (10/29-11/5/11). I can honestly say I have no issues. Our greeting upon arrival was friendly and they escorted us right into the lobby and check in. Room was ready and clean (I LOVE the beds). I work in a hotel so I look in the usual and unusual places and it was spotless. The view overlooking the pool was absolutely heavenly and when you close the glass door you don't hear a sound from the area. Resort grounds were kept quite clean and I did not see one piece of trash or anything lying around. There was someone constantly pruning, cleaning, sweeping something. My kids felt safe running back and forth from the pool to the room on their own and the staff were friendly and quite attentive. This is our favorite resort and our family won't stay anywhere else, we'll definately be back. I can't say enough good things, honestly it was great.

Reviews.Title: “Very "Disney" Hotel- Great Service and BEAUTIFUL property”
Reviews.Author: momwith2boys_10
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian, end of October 2011. This hotel is very beautiful!! The lobby was absolutely georgeous, big, roomy, I felt as if I was transported back in time to a huge plantation home. The rooms are quite spacious We had a room with double bed and pull out couch (family of 4). The disney characters on the wallpaper, and the towels on the bed shaped like Mickey's face were a very nice touch. All of the staff were very pleasant and very helpful. I loved their period costumes. The main pool is large and lots of fun, it was heated so we were able to enjoy the water even though it was cool. The pool with the water slide was fun for the kids but it was quite cold so I didnt see any adults in there. This hotel is very clean. You can see the fireworks (at the Disney Castle) from the hotel and that was a very nice option. Also, the on-site transportation made getting around to the parks very easy. I would absolutely return.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been more disappointed.”
Reviews.Author: AndyW1976
Reviews.Content: I've looked at this hotel from afar many times. I always hoped it would be the best hotel i've stayed in. It's not even in the top 10! This place looks great but it's an unorganised mess. Not enough room for all the guests, too many visitors to the hotel. Not enough exclusive facilities for guests only, Pool, Boat service to the Magic Kingdom. Getting a table to eat in your own hotel appeared to be beyond the staff of this hotel, you could only book with the Consierge, not the front desk of the restaurant. Many times we were unable to get a table as Disney Dining Plan participants from other hotels had booked tables months in advance. When unable to get a table we had to eat in the Fast Food restaurant Gasparilla. Stay away! Dreadfull food, pathetic service. It is the complete opposite of everything you have come to expect from Disney. Plus points, you can see the fireworks from the hotel. The monorail and boat service are pretty good. Just expect to share these facilities with people who didn't pay for them. Save yourself a fortune and stay somewhere away from Disney. Compared to this "five star" resort you can stay in Hilton Bonnet Creek, Waldorf Astoria, JW Marriott, Peabody and Ritz Carlton for much less. Much better hotels which look after their guests. Don't let the mouse win!!!

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: SSA40
Reviews.Content: You can't miss with staying at the Grand Floridian! It is absolutely grand from the grounds, to the largest pool I've ever seen (open 24 hours!), to the buildings themselves. I'd stay here over and over again.

Reviews.Title: “WATCH YOUR CREDIT CARD...”
Reviews.Author: OhioMom2three
Reviews.Content: Upon returning from a 5 night stay at the Grand Floridian I was going to write a review concurring with the other reviewers about the lack of cleanliness of the hotel, desperate need of updating, etc. Instead, I will warn you that the day after we checked out of the hotel someone put through three separate fraudulent charges from the hotel on our credit card in the sum of over $2,000!! Kudos to our bank for immediately catching this fraud. Not a magical experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Beautiful Property. Staff was great. Convenient Location!!”
Reviews.Author: TammyCandDaughters
Reviews.Content: Stood at the Grand Floridian in March 2009. The hotel is beautiful. The grounds are beautiful. Its location cannot be beat. Would definitely stay at the Grand Floridian again, but only with a discounted rate. We took advantage of buy 4 nights get 3 free. Without a special rate the prices are a bit much.....$500 - $600 per night for a standard room. If you can experience this hotel at a discounted rate please do. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Don't know if we can go anyplace else after this!”
Reviews.Author: epwcw
Reviews.Content: Years and years of Disney. We have always looked at the Grand Floridian and always said we would not do due to the cost. Yes....you can spend your money for 3 nights as we did or spend it for at least a week and a half in the Caribbean. But this was on our bucket list...and we did it! OMG! We stayed in the Sugar Loaf Concierge building. The building is all concierge, locked down ....and wonderful. When we pulled in, we were met and then walked to our building (very early I might add...we got there around 11 am...well before official check in time) by a personal assistant. She explained everything to us. We had done the express on line check in available thru Disney 10 days prior to arrival. The constant food in this building and service was well worth the money. We have been to Disney at least 25 plus times...but never stayed here. It will be hard to go back to someplace else. For breakfast there was an ample supply of fruit, cereals, pastry, cold cuts, breads. Much outside of your ordinary continetal breakfast. We were not there for any lunches. Who would be in Disney? Afternoon at 5 pm brought wine, champagne, beer and snacks. Definitely worth it! We were there during the Food and Wine Festival. We will review that at a different time...but we really enjoyed it. We arrived on Sunday, Oct 23 and went to the Market Place. OMG....so crowded. A lot of locals...and lines that you could not imagine! We tried to get a sandwich at one of our favorite places...Earl of Sandwich...but wound up leaving due to the lnes. The Golf Tournament was also in town that day...could have had an impact. That night we went to Citrico's at the GF. It was fantastic! Not too many kids (a good thing for us!)...and great food. Next day we went to the Food and Wine Festival at Epcot. Don't miss the cheddar cheese soup in the Canadian kiosk and the lobster/scallops pie in Ireland. Both to die for! I also loved the Scandanavian kiosk with herring, etc. My husban...not a great lover of that passed. The shrimp tacos in Mexico kiosk great. Longest line...Germany beer. Of course both being from Germany...we had to do it. The sausage/beer pretzel was ok. Not out of this world like the others. We also had Lobster roll in American kiosk...very good. Space yourself...it's all fantastic. Taste the wines from the countries. Also very good. Went to Fort Wilderness that night for a haunted carriage ride. Excellenet! We had our own carriage/horse buggy and it told the story of the headless horseman. Will not ruin the end...but worth the $60 per couple. Ended with Magic Kingdowm that night. Still very crowded...more so. than we usually have seen. We only did two rides in about 1 1/2 hours. Retired into bed around midnight Next day...of course we went to Hollywood Studios. Do not miss...Lights, Action, Motor. Great show that I have been waiting years to see. It was worth it. The first show was not unitl 1:30 pm...but this time we waited...and it was worth it. Ended with dinner at the California Grill at the Contemporay at 8 pm. Get there around then. You can see the electrical water pageant and the fireworks without moving. We hated to leave the next day. The service was fantastic at the GF! It will be sooooooo hard to go someplace else after this!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Experience and public spaces. Worth a splurge!”
Reviews.Author: MiTraveler33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for a quick five-day trip to Disney World. We had a standard room with two queen beds. It was nice, but tight for three people and was showing signs of wear. It was clean and well-maintained and the service was excellent from start to finish. The best part of staying here was having the monorail stop on the hotel's upper level to go quickly to the Magic Kingdom. We were able to go back and forth several times a day as we wished. It was wonderful and we felt we got the most out of our trip. It was an easy monorail trip to Epcot as well. We also had tea one afternoon. It was absolutely fabulous. I would have given it five stars had the room been in better condition.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Perfection”
Reviews.Author: iGareth
Reviews.Content: I had the absolute pleasure of staying at this resort for two weeks in September 2011 for our wedding and honeymoon. This hotel pushes service beyond the extremely high Disney levels with large luxury rooms. Also spent one night in the main building club room which was equally amazing - access to lounge with good selection of nibbles with alcoholic drinks for 2 hours in the evening and canned soft drinks. We stayed for most of the vacation in Building 5 (Sago Cay) and I must comment on the lovely lobby smell which they must pump into the lobby. I miss the smell! One negative point. Each building has a lobby however it also had rooms on the same level. Many guests (and loud children) tend to gather in these areas late at night and make a large amount of noise - ONLY a problem if you are on the ground floor. The whole resort and room was perfectly clean. Did find the resort tended to be rather busy in terms of staff working to keep the hotel looking fresh from around 9am to noon.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat Disney Hospitality”
Reviews.Author: Bellatrix420
Reviews.Content: This is one of those places where you just simply have to have stayed at least once...the flagship resort of Walt Disney World, Orlando. The staff were extremely friendly and hospitable, and I really don't have any complaints. However, from my last visit about 15 years ago, I don't see many updates. They could renovate some of the rooms, it would make the hotel more modern and fresh. It would also make the place more competitive, since there have been an abundance of newer 5-star hotels springing up all over Orlando. Still, if you're going to Disney, I recommend staying either here, the Polynesian, or at the new Bay Lake Towers at the Contemporary Resort. Transportation is convenient and free to the parks via Disney's monorail, which is a huge plus. You can also go from one resort to another via the monorail, and you'll definitely want to, since each place has a lot to offer even if you are just browsing through.

Reviews.Title: “We'd stay here every time...if we could!”
Reviews.Author: potosalinas
Reviews.Content: As the title suggests, we'd stay here every time we visit Disneyworld if we could. The problem is justifying the cost when there are other hotels that serve just a good a purpose, but just don't do it in as much style. We (Me, wife, 2 daughters aged 3 and 2) stayed here September 21 - 28, 2011 and had a ball. I must stress though this is our opinion as there are other reviewers who quite obviously haven't enjoyed their experience here. Everything was Grand for us from the moment we arrived till the moment we checked out, from the lobby to the room. Our room was in Boca Chica, overlooking the lagoon and we could even see the Magic Kingdom from our balcony. We could have seen the castle too but for the restaurant in the way. No complaints here though as our girls loved looking out from the fourth floor to the lagoon to see the water parade and also the fireworks each night. We were given a heads up about the noise from the boats and the fireworks at night but it wasn't loud at all if all the doors were shut. Plus it was fun for us as it reminded us when things were happening! Didn't hear a peep from the neighbours or from the hall so it was soundproof for our standards. The room also seemed a little larger than others we've stayed in at the Polynesian, Wilderness and Animal Kingdom Lodge. It was clean, lovely and most of all comfortable so we were more than satisfied. With the length of our stay we chose to take it easy and actually enjoy the hotel and we did. Short walks to everywhere in the resort and not even that long a walk to the nearby polynesian - if our daughters could do it then it's really not that far especially with their little legs. If they couldn't see the castle we probably would've spent every day at the hotel either in the pools (there were 2 but we spent most of our time in the zero entry pool where the water-slide was) or just lounging about. When we weren't dining off-site Gasparilla's was great and it also kept the girls busy with the arcade. The last point we want to make is that you're really NOT just paying for the convenience of the location at this resort as it is very luxurious (short monorail trip to Magic Kingdom and short boat ride back). I won't complain about the fee for the internet because when we were in the room there was plenty to keep us entertained besides that and the kids only let me watch the disney channels so when they were asleep the variety of channels was ample as I was able to get my sports updates! We didn't know what to expect in terms of "Grand" but were nevertheless blown away by it and if not for the price would stay here every time. Worth it at least once and if things go well savings wise for us we will stay here again in 2013.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but not 5 star”
Reviews.Author: AAaaaaaaaagfd
Reviews.Content: We have just spent a week at the grand Floridian with our three children. Fantastic location for access to magic kingdom. Rooms are way below a 5 star standard - shabby and in need of updating without some of the expected comforts. Service is of course excellent - overdone possibly. But child friendly for sure! come without the expectation of luxury! Dining limited as restaurants booked up months in advance so as a first timer you are disadvantaged

Reviews.Title: “Great Experiences!”
Reviews.Author: amanor409
Reviews.Content: I must say that this has got to be the best stay in a resort I've ever had. The turn-down service at night was a pleasant surprise. Also the view from the rooms are all good. The only thing that I would say that I didn't like was the parking wasn't convent as it was across the street from the resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for your family Disney vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: jhollinger_11
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is perfect for a family vacation. The hotel is located very close to the magic kingdom(only a monorail stop away). We stayed at the hotel for three days and never left! I have two children(ages 4 and 7). The kids loved the beach pool and all the wonderful activities. They also participated in the pirate adventure excursion, which they both loved! The hotel also had a wii party every night followed by a movie by the pool. The kids were in heaven! The dining is also very good. We ate at Citricos, the grand Floridian cafe and gasparilles grill. All restaurants offer good choices and are fairly priced for Disney standards. My only advice is to research restaurants before your vacation and book before you get there. We did not do this and could not get a character dining reservation. If you are flying into Orlando, book a car with Florida Town Car. JC is awesome and the cost is only $85 roundtrip! Very reasonable and convenient!

Reviews.Title: “A good compromise between adult comforts and kid appeal”
Reviews.Author: Stateomaine
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian in Jan 2011. This was our 3rd trip to Disney in 2.5 years, and we are admittedly monorail junkies, having stayed at the Contemporary and the Polynesian previously. We now feel like we may never stay anywhere else on Disney property. The Contemporary was fine within our room, but public spaces there are noisy at nearly all hours and it was just hard to navigate around. The Polynesian was a sentimental favorite of my husband's, and the proximity to the TTC and the monorail makes it really convenient, but the endless tiki music got grating and it, too, was a bit much to get around. The GF was just fun -- we had very pleasant valets when we arrived to park, and the lobby is just visually stunning -- huge but somehow not nearly as noisy as the Contemporary. The piano player was great -- even altered his song mid-tune to fit the situation around him. The hidden Mickeys are everywhere, and that alone will keep kids occupied for a while. Our room was in the concierge building away from the main building, and was nice with a view over the lagoon, but one night we went to the main building concierge just to see if they would let us into a room and the rooms in the main building do seem sizeably larger. The food in the concierge area was no better/no worse than what we had at the Polynesian, only perhaps slightly more variety. Ate at Narcossee's for dinner one night with a really nice waiter and watched foggy fireworks over Cinderella's castle. They pipe in the Wishes music for a nice touch. Never did get to the pool as the weather was bad, and skipped the spa this time as I had a bad massage there on our prior visit, but for style and location, the GF is tough to beat!

Reviews.Title: “Top Quality Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Suse_otter
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 6 nights from Oct 8th. Everything about this hotel is top class. Being met off the magical express by a member of staff. The check in process the room was clean and comfortable. Monorail going through hotel made travel to Magic Kingdom and Epcot easy. Buses to other parks were regular. Overall excellent - would stay there again in a shot.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty cool I guess”
Reviews.Author: TheElGriff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here two nights recently as part of our honeymoon. We reserved a club level room with concierge service, and we were greeted by a member of the concierge staff in front of the hotel upon arrival with our itinerary and room keys. He informed us that, despite our early morning arrival, our room was ready and we could check in immediately so that we could go enjoy the parks. Our room, although hard to access, was nice and had an excellent view of the castle at Magic Kingdom from the balcony (from which you could watch the fireworks at night). The various food and beverage receptions on the club lounge level throughout the day were nice. My only complaints are as follows. First, when trying to use the jacuzzi tub in the bathroom, an odd black substance shot out of the jets. Second, our morning housekeeper left a lot to be desired, as she left a bag of garbage from various rooms on our couch one day, and the next day proceeded to throw away the case for my wife's hair straightener. Overall, though, this was a great hotel, with a great environment and good staff. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: cindymindy
Reviews.Content: We had such a glorious time at the Grand Floridian Resort and Spa. Everything from the grounds, to the room, to the spa was impeccable. Disney is known for really playing up themes, and I for one love it! The resort really takes you back to the Victorian era with the costumes and decor. This was a much calmer resort than others we have stayed at on Disney property, mostly because there were far less children running around. We loved being on the monorail stops so we could hope over to Epcot and Magic Kingdom. We did not use the boat access, but I have in the past and it is very convenient as well. The spa was extremely relaxing from a long day at the park! I cannot say enough great things about The Grand Floridian and cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Family Fall Vacation at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: toodycat
Reviews.Content: This is actually the fourth time we've stayed at the Grand Floridian. Somehow, I've never written a review before. Disney's flagship resort is a beauty and I would recommend it highly. Grounds: The grounds of the Grand Floridian are modeled on the Hotel Del Coronado in Coronado, CA with its white exterior and warm red roof. Disney actually improves on that landmark in the sense that all the public spaces at the Hotel Del are very dark whereas the Victorian style Grand Floridian maintains an atmosphere of light and airiness throughout. The grounds are beautifully landscaped with perfectly manicured, colorful flower beds and shrubs. The roses are especially lovely. The property is located on the Seven Seas Lagoon with views of the Magic Kingdom and Cinderella's Castle. The GF has its own marina, two swimming pools and a faux (not for swimming) beach. It is on the monorail to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot and has boat transport from the Magic Kingdom. Guests can view the evening Magic Kingdom fireworks from the beach or the dock. Another special treat is the evening Electrical Water Pageant in which barges covered in lights parade on the lagoon. This is 40 year old Disney tradition and a pleasure to watch. Check-in: We drove in past the security gate. The cast member there greeted us with "Welcome home." The car valets helped us with our bags and parked our rental car. Then, we checked in. The cast member at the desk was efficient, friendly and professional. He would neither confirm nor deny rumors of Disney Vacation Villas being constructed at the GF. Everything went smoothly and our room was ready, even though we arrived three hours before check-in. The Room: The Grand Floridian accommodations are in the main building and several outer buildings. Each of the satellites has its own lobby. We were in Sago Cay #5201. It was our first visit to the GF in which we stayed in a room that wasn't club level or theme park view. We had booked a plain, garden view room with a discount of 40% off or $285/night for weeknights and $315 for weekends. At those prices, a garden view was fine. The room had a spacious bathroom with one area with double sinks and another with a WC and tub/shower combination. There were two queen size beds with bedspreads that seemed to be adapted from Waverly fabrics with Mickeys, Minnies and other characters in the print. Wallpaper features several hidden characters as well. The lamp, which is available for purchase, is a sculpture of Mickey's face. The room had a flat screen TV, sufficient drawer and closet space,a desk, a daybed, chair, small refrigerator, iron, waffle robes and coffee maker. Our balcony faced Gasparilla's and the marina. If you really craned your neck, you could see the theme park. The room also had an excellent view of the Mousekeeper's morning Parasol Parade which was fun. The downside of this room is that it is adjacent to the loading dock. You don't really see the loading dock because it wears its Disney disguise, like most unattractive things at Walt Disney World. However, you do hear the weep-weep-weep of trucks backing up early in the morning. We were traveling with our 17 year old, so all of us were old enough to just notice the noise, roll over and go back to sleep. However, if I were traveling with an infant or toddler, I would not want this room. Housekeeping was excellent. We received turn-down service with towel animals every night. Dining: We dined at Gasparilla's, the counter service restaurant, which has an excellent breakfast called the Bounty Platter. (You can eat inside at Gasparilla's, but I would eat outside because the inside also has arcade machines. If you eat outside, you are sitting on white wrought iron chairs and looking out on the marina.) Two of these fed all three of us each morning. We also had lunch at Gasparilla's twice. I would definitely order the lobster salad again. Likewise, the roast chicken salad, the lobster macaroni and cheese and the flatbread pizzas were very good. We also ate dinner at the Grand Floridian Cafe one evening. The service was excellent and the mahi-mahi special was delicious. Public spaces: The lobby of the Grand Floridian is excuse enough to stay there. It is stately and inviting, yet not stuffy in any way. You can sit on one of the comfortable, overstuffed sofa and listen to the pianist in tails play Disney tunes as little girls dressed as princesses play games. The floral arrangements in the lobby are beautiful and fragrant. The room is well-lit and features a whimsical "birdcage" elevator. There are several shops on the first and second floors which feature souvenir merchandise as well as high end clothing and accessories. Pools: The GF has two pools that could not be more different. The Courtyard pool is a quiet and expansive pool that is centrally located and never seems crowded. The feature pool has a water slide and a waterfall. It is a zero entry pool which is great if you have small kids and it faces the lagoon and the beach. While the courtyard pool is quiet, the other pool is busier with attractions like ongoing children's games. While we were there, little kids were doing the Macarena and YMCA dance. There are also private cabanas for rent at that pool. The bottom line: This is my absolute favorite resort at WDW. It is chock full of Disney magic and I will definitely be returning. However, I do want to warn you that although this is a luxurious property, it is missing some qualities you might find at a Ritz Carlton, a JW Marriott, Waldorf Astoria or another upscale resort. For instance, when you go to the pool, no one gets you towels, sets up your umbrella or takes your drink or food order. You have to do that stuff yourself. Likewise, no one takes drink orders in the lobby. The rooms are nice, but the linens are nothing extraordinary. What you are paying for is the proximity to the Magic Kingdom and the friendliness, excellent service and Disney magic this resort exudes. I am not criticizing the Grand Floridian, but if you want that super-deluxe pampering experience, this might not be your resort. If you want all the magic you can only get at Walt Disney World such as viewing the fireworks from the beach, watching the Electrical Water Pageant, getting your wake-up calls from Mickey and Stitch, traveling by monorail or via a vintage style wooden Chris Craft style boat or having your car valet wear knickers and a cap, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “The Only Choice for the Refined while at Disney”
Reviews.Author: Travelathon
Reviews.Content: Please, trust me, if you are a hotel snob, and you need to stay in the Disney area, stay here. This is by far the best kept hotel of the Disney properties (I've stayed at the Boardwalk, Port Orleans, Caribbean Beach Resort, the Contemporary-- all their rooms are truly ground down, less than sanitary, all this in addition to being grossly overpriced). Unlike the Boardwalk, the Grand Floridian is not just a beautiful facade and lobby. ROOMS: The rooms are comfortable and clean. We had a room on the back side of the hotel that overlooked the lagoon. You get a nightly fireworks show and a boat show that's sweet and brief. Tip: We stayed away from the overcrowded jacuzzi at night. FOOD: It was fine, the restaurants are all busy and the fare better than Disney average. STAFF: Well trained and seem to enjoy their jobs. LOCATION: It's about a 10 minute drive from the Boardwalk. That's a plus in my book-- liked the additional protective barrier from the throngs. OTHER: If you don't mind being about 15 minutes away from Disney, stay at the Ritz Carlton. It's where the discerning travel would feel most comfortable. Quiet grounds, far fewer families and kids having sugar meltdowns, excellent rooms and a beautiful setting. We stayed here for the Disney Half Marathon and while it's a trek to the starting gates from almost anywhere in the park, this was as comfortable a setting as we could ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet and comforting”
Reviews.Author: Ramona O
Reviews.Content: After I checked in, there was a Birthday surprise chocolates and a Bday Card signed by Mickey in my room! I loved the sweet smell of spa in the main entrance after walking off the Monorail and through the entrance. Beautiful decore is a peaceful atmosphere. The front desk cast members were very friendly and welcoming. The beds were very comfortable. I enjoyed the smell of fresh linen! I stayed in the room with the view of Magic Kingdom and sat out on the balcony to watch the fireworks. The pool area is very clean and I enjoyed the little walk on the sand by the pool. The price for my stay was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest hotel ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: maggie1111
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridian from 23rd September for 6 nights. When we arrived at the airport we used the free trasport the magical express bus which was included in our package holiday and it was well organised. Then we arrived at the Grand Floridian and could not believe our eyes how beautiful and clean this property was. The staff greeted us as soon as we got off the bus and escorted us to the front desk which were more than helpful. We all thought wow. Then we were escorted by a golf buggy type to our room. The room was neat and with everything we needed. The pool area was great and opened 24hours which was wonderful. The monorail was very handy expecially if you have small children not that we did, our boys were teenagers so it probably wouldn't of mattered where you stayed because all the bus transportation was well organized to the parks. Our teenage kids loved the pool area and the waterslide. The staff were extremly helpful in assisting you with your needs. The only complaint I would have was most dining areas were booked out as most people who go there book them 6 months in advance. When you go to eat at Down town Disney it was so busy it took the fun out of finding somewhere to eat. We did end up one night at a buffet dinner with cinderella which was delightful. We mostly ate at gasperillas which had quick service meals such as hamburgers pizza and sandwiches etec.They also have a laundry facility which is great to use. The parks themselves were good fun, my favourites would have been Railroad Thunder, Fast track at Epcot and the aero smith rollercoaster ride at Hollywood Studios. We also went to the waterparks which were alot of fujn. I would definely recommend this hotel from our experience but do remember that service is only as good as the people who are employed their at the time.Staff change all the time so no matter where you go even though we found this property fantastic doesnt mean that you might have the same experience and it probably matters what time of the season you go whether is in peak or non peak. Cheers to The Grand Floridian maggie1111

Reviews.Title: “Club Level Main Bldg.”
Reviews.Author: people2people
Reviews.Content: My family has stayed at the Grand Floridian many times. It is a lovely hotel on the monorail and a direct transfer to the Magic Kingdom - 1st stop. Book early enough so you can secure a room in the main bldg. We were greeted outside by a cast member and taken directly to our room - no waiting on line at reception. There are many "outer bldgs." - my opinion, feels like you are staying in a different hotel on the GF grounds. Club level is an excellent choice if you are not interested in many character breakfasts - grab a quick bite and off you go. The food selection is limited but plentiful, enough to hold you over till lunch. For a once in a lifetime treat have dinner at Victoria & Alberts.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian is truly Grand!!”
Reviews.Author: Tricia T
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney and the Grand Floridian. I was impressed the minute we pulled up to the valet! We were greeted immediately and directed to our room. It was 1:00 PM and our room was ready even though check in is not until 3:00. Our room was clean and spacious enough for a family of four. I cannot say enough about the cast members and the service....truly top notch! We were greeted everywhere we went within the resort and the our daughter was always addressed as "Princess" which she totally loved!! :-) The food was great as well. 1900 Park Fare offered a very full buffet and Gasparilla's was great for quick service meals for both adults and children. The pools were neat and clean as well. Not once did we ask for any type of assistance and not receive it. Only thing I would suggest is free internet. We were able to get it but at a cost of $9.99 per day and for what you pay to stay here it should be included. Highly recommend this hotel for families with and without children!

Reviews.Title: “Not the grand floridian”
Reviews.Author: Shaeheen H
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand this time as we have two young kids and thought the monorail would be perfect.The monorail was only the good thing. 1. The buses took a very long time sometimes upwards of 45 mins. 2.the paid Internet connection did not work 3.front staff were not knowledgeable 4.I called upfront the day before too get a pack and play and microwave were not in the room For the amount I paid it would have been better to stay at a moderate resort the service was not what we expected.

Reviews.Title: “I expected more in the best hotel inside Disney”
Reviews.Author: cucuruchito
Reviews.Content: It s not so close to the parks, it s not a five star but it costs like one, it s noisy, crowded, and the most incredible thing is that it has just one disney cartoon channel on TV that loops and loops again, so the children see the same cartoons at all times every day... and they are in Disney!! It is suppossed to have all the cartoons in the world...! Unbelievable! Even more, I ve been there three years ago and when we went back last year... we saw the same cartoons looping!!!!!!!! The late Walt must be really displeased to have created so many and the hotel shows just a few, and the same every day! The Disney family and associates are not making too much effort to sustain what was once the great idea of Walt Disney. He wanted a magic kingdom and now it seems his family just want to make money. The monorail is good to go directly to magic kingdom and epcot but it doesn t work for the rest of the parks. So the advantage is only for these two parks and it s easy access for strollers and small children and it feels great when you are tired to arrive just inside the hotel. I ve been to the sugar loaf section of the hotel and to the main hotel and the executive level is quite convenient to take snacks for the kids.. and so.I found the sugar loaf building a lot more quiet and private. The character dinner restaurant is always full so book in advance, and the best character breakfast is at The Disney Beach Club Hotel. The Grand Flroidian has very good restaurant but children are not allowed..!!!!!!!! so, we didn t go!!! The rest of the restaurants are standard and the princess tea room is lovely. Pools and slides are ok but not much pool service available but lifeguard where always paying attention to the kids in the pool. I mean, please don t expect a 5 star hotel service, it s a 3 star the most, just expect to be a llittle closer to the parks in a nice, noisy, expensive hotel. Rooms are ok, clean, some have views of the castle and the fireworks, loved to find details such as mickey mouse blankets or lamps, or wall papers.... but bathrooms especially showers and bathtubs which small children use a lot, are definetely outdated and need renovation. I ve been to the Disney Animal Kingdom Hotel which I disliked ...a lot.. and also to The Disney Beach Club Hotel which is quite convenient, this one is the best hotel in Disney... the building is nice... valet parking is good, hope the service was better... Please fix the cartoon loop issue...!!!! that should be easy... and would show respect for children who do notice it s the same cartoon every single day... and add more choices...! Children should be the special guests... at least that would have been Walt s wish!!

Reviews.Title: “Comparison review for your consideration”
Reviews.Author: drlearn
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in the concierge rooms previously at the Grand Floridian but as this was a birthday trip for my grandson, he wanted to stay in "the toaster" as he call the Contemporary. As most travelers have already given you great information, I'll focus on the differences between the 2 on the concierge level. Rooms larger (by far) with more storage at the Grand Floridian. We have always booked Magic Kingdom views and found the Contemporary room "appeared" closer and the fireworks better from our balcony. Food is definitely better at the Contemporary concierge spread with more choices for children and closer to all the concierge rooms. We were across the hotel at the Grand Floridian and a floor up and it was a hike. Concierge service itself better though at the Grand Floridian. Brought a cake back to our room one night and asked if one of the 3 concierges sitting around could store it for us and was told to walk it down to the bell services ourselves! Restaurant definitely better at Grand Floridian as is the pool areas for children and adults. Aside from the views and the concierge closeness and great concierge food choices, I would still stay next time at the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Club Level is a treat”
Reviews.Author: brydic
Reviews.Content: Hotel ls a bit pricey but it was a treat for the family. You are pampered. They gave us a complimentary upgrade to a one bedroom suite. Much appreciated. Also recommend the Polynesian if you wish a more reasonable price but less elegance. Love them both. The pool with its slide was much used by the children.

Reviews.Title: “Bugs Us”
Reviews.Author: vrosen
Reviews.Content: We just return from a fabulous cruise of Disney new ship, The Disney Dream. Unfortunately we cannot say the same for our pre-cruise stay at Disney Grand Floridian Resort – their flagship property. We flew into Orlando arriving close to 11 PM and we utilized Disney Magical Express to transport to the Grand Floridian. After 2 stops we finally arrived and were somewhat stunned that there was no bell service or anyone available to help with bags. We managed to get to the front desk with our bags and we waiting to be helped. There were 2 people manning the desk and the woman was helping another person so the gentlemen assisted us in checking in. I cannot remember his name but he indicated he was new and he was Hawaii. We had utilized the on-line check in and we were booked in a concierge level however he was having difficulties locating our reservation. After he spoke with the other agent he was able to locate and proceed with the process. I was amazed that it took 15 minutes for this to accomplish this as that is out of the ordinary for Disney. He then came out from behind the desk and proceed to escort us to our room which was located in the Sugar Loaf building a short walk from the main building. He did ask if he could help with our bags but he had no bell cart or anything. Once we arrived we were taken to the floor of our room, he opened the door and gave the room key to my husband and proceeded to the leave. My 11 year old son yelled “gross” as he pointed to a 1 ½ inch cockroach crawling on the nightstand between our beds. I yelled at my husband to go get the agent who had not even made it to the elevator. The agent entered the room and observed the roach and then another one crawled out from the headboard of the bed. We quickly were escorted back to the main floor lounge area and he apologies and asked us to wait there he would get another room. He returned about 10 minutes later with another room key and we followed him to our new room on another floor. He entered and checked the room first and he was very apologetic. The new room looked drab and dingy and there was peeling paint over the tub in the bathroom, the walls had scuff mark beside the window and the balcony had dead flies, dead lightning bugs and debris. The balcony stayed that way until we checked out on Sunday. Since we paid additional for concierge service we assumed the level of service and cleanliness would be superior (it is at other Disney properties) but that was not to be at the Grand Floridian. The lounge was dingy and dirty and there were fruit flies around the counters and juice station. I do have to commend the recreation staff at the main pool as they were very good at organizing the activities on the pool deck and my son enjoyed himself immensely as well as the movie by the pool on Saturday night. In closing we will not be staying at the Grand Floridian as it was a very disappointing and were not impressed by the cleaning standards nor the quality or overall appearance of the rooms or lounge areas. We will be returning though but staying at our favorite resorts, Beach and Yacht Club and the Polynesian. If The Grand Floridian is the Flagship resort, Disney really needs to bring up the standards as we have never encounter cockroaches in any of our stays and we usually visit the Magic Kingdom 3 -4 times per year.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Stay...but has always been great for us!”
Reviews.Author: MatthewandSarahE
Reviews.Content: This is our 4th stay at the Grand Floridian..we call it our 'home away from home'. I disagree with the reviews that say it's not for kiddies. In fact, we stay here BECAUSE of our kiddos! One stop access via the Monorail to the Magic Kingdom is amazing when you need to get back and forth quickly (it's the 4th stop on the way back to the hotel) for naps or whatever. It makes going back and forth so efficient. The staff is amazing...we hope you get John from the front desk manager team..he makes you feel so welcome. Food is great..can't say enough about Citrico's, Norcoose's and Victoria & Albert's. And more kid friendly, great food at the Grand Floridian Cafe and the 1900 Park Fare for Character Meals is really great. Gasparilla's is the quick service location and is serviceable with some decent offerings. Best Building if you aren't in the main is Building 5 for convenient access to most everything. Great pools and amazing fun. We love this property and Visit 5 will be coming soon. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “elegant”
Reviews.Author: 35749Aaaaaa1
Reviews.Content: We stayed in fall 2011 and loved it. Great location for kids but sophisticated for adults. Lobby is beautiful with live music in the evenings. The pool is next to a sand beach. they provide buckets for kids to make sand castles and have group games for kids while i had a cocktail. Spa is not open due to remodeling now, with kids was not interested anyway. Internet was available. Monorail to epcot/MK much quicker than buses if you want to park hop. The maids pretended our dolls were naughty and put toilet paper draped over the beds-- my girls thought it was hysterical

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian is grand!”
Reviews.Author: ChicagoMom_of_boys
Reviews.Content: Had been to Disney World many times with the kids. Always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian. Just did for our 30th wedding anniversary. The room was gorgeous. The service was great. Everyone was very friendly and helpful. Only problem was connecting to the internet. And they had someone come out to fix it asap. Would definitely stay there again and highly recommend it - especially if the kids are not with you.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel and great location not for kiddies”
Reviews.Author: Mikey5277
Reviews.Content: Just returned home from a week stay at the grand floridian. This hotel is gorgeous and is in a great location. We had a room located on the first floor right in front of the pool. There is nothing special about the rooms little outdated but how much time do u really spend in the room. The food there was pretty good but very little things to do for the kids . Wasn't a big fan how they just let the ducks swim in the pool . Overall not to bad but will probally stay at the Polynesian next time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful grounds and conventient to parks”
Reviews.Author: ct-cruisers
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian Resort while attending a business conference being held there. As with Disney, the grounds and immediate area are impeccable. Everyone on the friendly staff there wears Victorian era style outfits. The inside lobby/atrium of the main building is amazing with several floors with balconies overlooking the lobby area. At night there is a jazz band playing Disney classics and songs from the American Songbook on the second floor. The main building has a monorail stop that connects to the Magic Kingdom, the Contemporary Hotel, and the Polynesian Resort as well as the transfer station to other monorails. There is a 1/4 mile or so path that takes you past a white sand beach and the wedding pavilion on the way to the Polynesian Resort. There is a large pool area and from the grounds you can view the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom across the lake. As a resort, it had limited free space outside to relax, but who comes to Disney to hang out at a hotel? The room (5209) was just OK with two queen size beds. There is a spa/fitness center building, but I did not have a chance to visit it. This hotel is the most expensive one on Disney property. If I was to come back to Disney, I would stay somewhere else and just visit the resort instead.

Reviews.Title: “Had a "Grand" time at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: OneThird
Reviews.Content: I have stayed numerous times at the Grand Floridian and I have been impressed every time. The staff are all very helpful, especially at the Concierge desk. And the rooms are spacious and clean. The room we had (in the Boca Chica building) had a wonderful view of the fireworks in the evenings so my husband and I could sit out on the balcony and watch while the children slept inside. It was a nice moment. And the kids really enjoyed all of the children activities at the beach pool in the afternoons. They would have entertainment and animators to play games with the kids. There were also outdoor movies at night and evening "WII" games for the kids. They really do a great job of making sure that everyone is having a good time. All in all, I would definitely recommend this hotel to others!

Reviews.Title: “Our "Grand" stay in Disney”
Reviews.Author: alice913
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian 9/10 through 9/17/11. It was our thirs stay at this beautiful resort and we couldn't have been happier. We stayed in the Conch Key building with a marina and Magic Kindom view. We had an adjoining room to our daighter, son in law and 2 garndsons. The rooms were very spacious and had been updated fairly recently. New carpeting and drapes and bedspreads. We had a good sized balcony that comfortably sat all 4 adults after the kids were in bed. Our gradsons loved the fact that the monorail ran within view of their room. The bathroom and vanity rooms had also been updated since our last visit. Very very clean and appealing. We love the idea of being a monorail ride away from the Magic Kingdom, the other resprts and the ticket and tranport center. We did utilize the bus service right outside our hotel to go to Blizzard Beach and to Downtown Disney. There were 2 noght while we were there that the Magic Kingtom closed at 6pm so the monorail stops at 7pm in those cases. That just meant we had to use the buses or boats. You can always get from one place to another without too much trouble which is what we love about Disney. We had dinner at Narcoosses ( Grand Floridian), Citrico's (GF) Victoria and Albert's (GF), Yachtsman Steakhouse ( Beach and Yachtclub) Artist's Point ( Wilderness Lodge). Every meal that we had without exception was wonderful. My two favorites are Narcoosses and Artists Point. Superb! The views from Narcoossees are perfect as is the food and service. Artist's Point is exceptional also. A must try is the Cedar Plank Salmon! We discovered a very nice Chardonney from Fourteen Hands vineyard there several trips ago that we still purchase at home! All of the restaurants wines are specific to their cuisine. We did several Character breakfasts. I think our favorite was the Lilo and Stitch breakfast at the Polynesian. If I had to say anything bad about our trip it would have to be those darned "love Bugs". They were everywhere! We seemed to hit it in time for their prime season...that said, we would do it all again. I do have a concern about the building that is going on at the Grand right now. They are building a Disney vacation Club property situated between the Grand and the Polynesian. I just can't imagine what the property in general or the pools in particular will be like with those added guests. Our check-in was flawless ( met us at the Magical Express and addressed us by name as we came off the bus) and our checkout was the same. We used the resort airline luggage checkin and that is the way to go! We traveled to the airport on the Magical Express with only our carry-ons. I am sure that I am missing some details and will address them later. I just wanted to write while things were fresh in my mind.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel, but...”
Reviews.Author: DJA1972
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is one of the most beautiful hotels in world. When you walk the grounds it looks like a post card everywhere you look. The lobby is incredible and the attention to detail is typical for Disney. The service is good. The location is perfect. You can take a quick monorail or boat to MK or Epcot.
