The bus service to other parks is excellent. So what is the problem you might ask. The rooms are decorated in a "Victorian" style. This is nice at first but it quickly seems like a visit to your great aunt's house. The furniture and decor was actually quite tired and really needed an upgrade. The pools are nice but aside from being large they are not very interesting for kids. We stayed in the Concierge building which gave us a dedicated concierge staff. Although friendly and helpful Disney gives them no preferred access to dining, events or tee times. They want to help but they can't. The restaurants in the hotel are mediocre at best (we did not eat at V&A since we had children with us). I do believe that value is an important factor regardless of how much something costs. To say that a luxury hotel can't offer value is wrong. Value is a relative term. Based on the cost of a week long stay at Grand Floridian you need to compare it with the top hotel brands in the world. Is it on par with Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons, Omni, et al? Not even close. If you are visiting Disney and feel you need to stay at the Grand Floridian for the experience do it for a night or two. For the rest of your trip move just outside the park and get a much better value at the Ritz or the Omni. You, your family, and you wallet will love it.

Reviews.Title: “The nicest hotel room I've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: BSBgirl337
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel a few years ago, but I have yet to stay in a room this nice, so I thought it deserved a review. The room was clean, spacious, had nice natural light, a balcony and a good sized bathroom. The resort is very well kept, and has nice views. You can also take the monorail from this hotel, and that is always a bonus! You can see Cinderella's castle, and the fireworks at night. This was a great perk because everyone leaves at the same time after the show, and it takes awhile to get back to your hotel. We got to enjoy them right outside our own building :) Disney World is pretty much closed at 8pm except for Magic hours and Downtown, so we ate dinner most nights at the little cafe's in the hotel. We weren't too thrilled with the one at the Grand Floridian, and preferred Captain Cook's over at the Polynesian. It was not hard to travel over there though. The monorail is very convenient, and can be fun! I have attached pictures. Any questions, feel free to ask!

Reviews.Title: “Great Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: letstravel52
Reviews.Content: Exemplary service from the moment we stepped off the bus. The room was spacious, clean, and comfortable. Air conditioner runs quietly and without excess noise. Helpful, courteous staff. Convenient transportation to other parts of the park. Especially like that before you leave for the airport, you can check your luggage right at the front desk. It's taken care of from that point on and arrives at your final destination.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place!”
Reviews.Author: disneybuff
Reviews.Content: Walt Disney World's Grand Floridian Resort is "luscious"...yep, that's my definition of it. The resort is beautiful, the rooms are impeccable, the lawns are beautifully manicured, the service is great and the Resort staff (cast members) are superb. My husband and I have stayed at the Grand Floridian 3 times and we can't wait to go back. Walt Disney World is an amazing place and staying at this Resort is the icing on the cake. We've stayed at other Resorts at Disney (Contemporary Resort, Coronado Springs Resort, etc) and the cast members are always friendly and helpful, and yes the Resorts are also beautiful, but there's something about the Grand Floridian that defines Mr. Walter Elias Disney.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is not cleaned properly”
Reviews.Author: Aaron D
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Floridian on September 11, 2011 for my daughter's 5th birthday. We choose this hotel because of the convenient location to and from the Magic Kingdom. Although this proved to be convenient the negatives far outweighed any positives. I have two children ages 6 and 5, so when it was time for bed they needed to take a bath after a long day in the park. However, to my dismay I found a dirty bath tub with a lot of long human hairs still in the bath tub. Thus, I can only conclude that the bath tub was never cleaned prior to our check-in. Another major issue was my wife found an Advil gel pill on the floor near the main phone. I can only think that the room was not cleaned properly because of my experience with the bath tub. Additionally, Disney knows that little children will be present in these rooms and a more thorough cleaning of the room should be done. Therefore, I was highly disappointed with my stay at the Grand Floridian. It should be noted that I am an ex-Disney employee while I was in college and I enjoyed my experience while working my way through college. I always thought the Grand Floridian was an exceptional hotel and now my view has been highly deminished. I hope the Grand Floridian can take this review constructively and begin to do a better job on cleaning the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Magical in Everyway”
Reviews.Author: joloughlin
Reviews.Content: I've put a lot of thought into coming up with at least one constructive criticism. This is it...the complimentary hair conditioner is too hard to get out of the bottle. Now for the good stuff... Three generations stayed at the GF for 5 nights: me, my daughter, and two little grand-kids, ages 4 & 2 1/2. Our stay was magical; just as expected. We reserved a Magic Kingdom view room and were booked into the 4th floor of the Boca Chica bldg. When the bellman escorted us to the room we were instantly disappointed in that the view of Cinderella Castle, from the balcony, was completely obstructed by a huge tree. Straightway, my daughter got on the phone to request another room. Immediately sensing the problem, the bellman also got on his cell phone. As my daughter hung up the phone the bellman said, "I have another room for you". The new room was perfect; perfect view of the castle; perfect view of the fireworks; perfect view of the lagoon; and perfect view of the nightly electric boat parade. GF is conveniently located to the Magic Kingdom, first stop via monorail and the return to GF is the first stop via boat. Two years ago we stayed at the Boardwalk Resort...very nice, but the transportation via shuttle bus was horrible. The little extra you pay to stay at GF is well worth it for the convenience. The staff was very courteous. Most took the extra step to offer a greeting and a smile. We didn't encounter anyone rude or grumpy as other posters have stated. Friday & Monday mornings at 8am management stages an umbrella parade of maids. They select a little girl guest to lead the parade, of course giving her a little pink umbrella too. This scene is very sweet and an added touch that makes your stay of GF magical. Also, we made reservations for the Alice-in-Wonderland character breakfast (you definitely need reservations). Nice variety of buffet selections. The characters were so "in-character" and really good with the kids. I definitely will recommend the added expense to dine with Alice and friends. I rated the VALUE as 5 because we went during the off-season and received a discount. The food is much overpriced, but that is true for all of Disney World. Yes, I will agree with previous posters that the GF is showing her age. I did see damaged woodwork that had received its 20th coat of white paint and the dressers in the rooms could use some refunishing...but...GF has not lost her aura of turn-of-the-century-grander-days-gone-by. The magic is still there. We are going back to the GF for Christmas 2012.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Spa”
Reviews.Author: grizzhunter59
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian three times and had a wonderful stay each time, five star restaurants, gorgeous grounds and beach, on the monorail for easy access to the parks,the launch to the parks docks here also. Wonderful view of the Magic Kingdom Castle and fireworks right from your balcony. Loads of activities for the children including campfires and movies on the beach each evening. Hotel staff is amazing, anything you need is a phone call away.A totally relaxing 5 star resort, you will love it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Beautiful Resort”
Reviews.Author: DAR1660
Reviews.Content: I visited the Grand Floridian in late August 2011 with my teenage son for 5 nights. I am a long-time Disney fan, and typically stay at their top hotels such as the Yacht Club, Beach Club and Polynesian. This was our first trip to this hotel. It was a fabulous experience from top to bottom. What a beautiful place. The hotel lobby is impressive with an open atrium ceiling which must be 150 feet high, ending in stained glass domes. . Just beautiful. Lots of room to sit there and listen to the musician playing the grand piano there, generally late afternoons into evenings. On the second lobby level, a 6 piece orchestra plays at night, everything from classic to jazz to disney movie themes. The is a lovely bar- lounge behind where they play. The music is such a pleasure it would be hard to explain. The hotel has several excellent restaurants including Victoria and Alberts, Citricos, and Narcoosies, as well as an "everyday " restaurant ( which I think was called 1900 Park) and a quick serve place called the Gasparilla Grill which serves excellent burgers and salads. We ate at Citricos, Gasparilla and 1900 Park. The food was uniformly excellent as was the service. The hotel is on the monorail system, which is always fun, and also has boat service to magic Kingdom. As at all their hotels they also feature bus service to the various other parks. This makes travel to and from this hotel as easy as it can get...its nice to have all those options. We enjoyed our room on the 5th floor, no complaints at all about the maid service which was excellent, or the decor, which was charming. Our room had a beautiful lake view. The grounds of this hotel are just amazing, and they employ an army of workers who keep it spiffy. Beautiful landscaping, lovely pools ( one with a slide) a sandy beach and a gorgeous lake view. A few cute ducks quack along the property near the lake or pool, as do a number of small chamealions which must be native to the area. You can see the fireworks over Magic Kingdom from the Marina at night. A final word on the staff... As are all Disney employees, they could not be nicer. From Check-in desk to concierge to hotel maid, bellman or bartender, I had no complaints at all. They were fabulous, and I made sure to tell them so. be aware that the general atmosphere of the hotel is somewhat more formal than some. I saw a lot of women in nice little sundresses and dressy sandles. I believe this is the big place for honeymooners and couples, although we did see families too. But in the main it appeared ro draw an older more sedate or "grown-up" crowd. Most of the restaurants are upscale too. And there is an expensive "Princess Tea" featured in the afternoon for the little girls and their Moms and one of the restaurants. It worked great for my teenage son and I. We loved the location. Frankly, as much as I love doing the parks, I would have loved just bcamping at the hotel a few days and enjoying the pool and the views. One note, construction may be starting there in the next year. A new building of some sort of is planned between the wedding chapel and the Grand Floridian, according to what an employee told me. Purpose of the building unknown, but obviously it will involve some noise to build it. Be aware to ask about it if you book this hotel in the coming year, and if noise ( or sleeping in late!) is an issue for you. It will be a great shame if they put in another building as it will ruin the lovely curve of their white sand beach. Overall, I LOVED LOVED LOVED this hotel. Would return in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “GREAT IN SOME RESPECTS, JUST 'OK' IN OTHERS”
Reviews.Author: LongIslandMommy042
Reviews.Content: The lobby is beautiful, there is a great beach and pool that the kids really enjoyed, everyone is very friendly, meticulously clean, and you can't beat the location on the monorail, but . . . once you get to your room, it's just ok. The room looks like it's tired and worn. Bits of the wallpaper were coming apart at the seams, the bedspreads have seen better days, the kids' sheets were a little tattered (had two holes in them!), the desk was gouged, the refrigerator cabinet was showing signs of a lot of wear and tear. On the flip side: it was a large room, plenty of space with 2 queen beds, a couch, and had a desk that has a table that pulls out from underneath on wheels (that we dragged over to the couch and then pulled over the bench at the end of the bed for breakfast dining in our room). The bathroom consists of the tub and toilet, and outside the door is a double vanity, so the first person can get in the shower, come out and start shaving/putting on makeup outside in the vanity area, and the next person can get in for shower, so this design does speed things up if 4 people are all waiting to shower. We got a discount through Priceline, but I'm not sure I would consider paying full price if we went again. Excellent location for Magic Kingdom, and if you want to get to Epcot you'll just have to switch trains. Food was fine at the quick service location, things like eggs and bacon on a croissant, etc for breakfast, and hefty sandwiches and salads for lunch - just wish that they wouldn't put an arcade in there as it's hard enough to get the kids to sit down and eat sometimes! We always have a great time at Disney no matter where we stay, but we stayed at the Yacht Club last year, and my overall impression was better at the Yacht Club.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay while in Diseny”
Reviews.Author: Asr1974
Reviews.Content: If you go to Disney World you must stay at the Disney's Grand Floridian Resort and Spa! Request the main building! Great experience. Once you stay there you will not want to stay any place on Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Our best Disney stay by far”
Reviews.Author: familyof7_nj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Grand Floridian for the first time in the Sugarloaf Building. We felt like royalty. From the moment we pulled up to the moment we left, it was magical. There is NOTHING stuffy abouth this resort. Take time to enjoy the pools and activities. And being 2 min by monorail and 5 min by boat to the Magic Kingdom with small kids is great!!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Crown Jewel”
Reviews.Author: ShhNewYorkCity
Reviews.Content: This was our fifth trip to Disney. We always stay at one of the Disney resorts in the Park but it was our first time at the Grand Floridian. It really is a fabulous hotel with great service. We were met at the entrance and guided to our room. Whatever we needed was a phone call away. Besides the great service and wonderful surroundings, the Grand Floridian is on the monorail system and is close to everything. We would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Resort Ever, This Resort is wonderful......”
Reviews.Author: ninalinda1023
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian Resort & Spa is the best..The service they give us is the best ever..we try to stay there all the time..Last year we went with the Mother's for Mother's Day Week..It was wonderful, this resort made everything BEYOND PERFECT..My parents tell everyone they meet how wonderful their vacation at Disney's Grand Floridian Resort was. This resort saw my parents had problems getting out of my SUV and they immediately brought over a golf cart to take them to the room.. the rooms are wonderfully big, and the smell is WONDERFUL...We all love this resort and HIGHLY recommed it to everyone..Some people say it is pricey, but if you want to stay in a really nice place you have to save a little bit more...TRUST ME IT IS WORTH IT....SEE YOU IN 12 DAYS.

Reviews.Title: “Worth it due to location”
Reviews.Author: dinanicj
Reviews.Content: My family spent a week at the Grand Floridian over April vacation week as a celebration for my son's 10th birthday. We knew it was going to be really crowded so we wanted ease of travel around the parks so staying on the monorail line was important to us, and, it was a good move -- the monorail access made getting around much easier and also made it so easy to dine at the neighboring hotels (we had stayed at the Wilderness Lodge before and it took a lot longer to get anywhere). We also booked a park view room because my kids have medical issues that would prevent them from being in the parks at night (so the only way they could see them was from afar). The hotel overall was very beautiful; people say it's stuffy and fussy but I didn't feel that way; I stomped through in shorts, flip flops and casually dressed and felt right at home. But, the hotel decor is more dressed up than most of the other ones. So, upon checking in the woman at the front desk was spending a lot of time checking us in and going back and forth to "the back room" so I could tell there was an issue. Finally it was brought to my attention that our room in the Boca Chica building had an obstructed view of the Magic Kingdom and the only thing we could see in the park was Space Mountain. Given this, we wouldn't be able to see the fireworks from our room. We also found with the Boca Chica room at night there is a water parade on the lagoon, which is very pretty, but, it's very loud (so if you have little kids who go to bed early, as I do, it will wake them up). The room there was, however, large and pretty. But despite this, I was very unhappy about the room we were in. So, after 3 nights in that room they moved us to another room (it had just become free) and it had the view we had originally requested, which was in the Sago Cay building. This was a smaller room but a fantastic view. I wasn't thrilled about packing up and moving halfway through my trip but we were able to see the fireworks from our room, which was the only way my kids would see them, so it was worth moving. And, the water parade was much quieter. So, I would highly recommend a park view in this building, if you can get it. In terms of other things at the hotel: Pool: the beach pool was fun and had lots going on but it was loud and there were no chairs, I ended up having to sit on towels on the sand. The courtyard pool was quieter but didn't have any features (so, it wasn't that exciting, but, it was less chaotic). It too was impossible to get a chair -- we literally had to keep circling and circling until we found people who were leaving. It was annoying to be paying that much per night and not be able to get seating at the pool. Kids club: nice to have and we left our son there one night, though, it was much smaller than the one at the Wilderness Lodge (quite frankly, I was surprised how small it was, but, it did the trick). Restaurants: We ate in WDW each day / night but in the GF only at Narcoosee's & Gasparilla Games. Both were ok, nothing special. The game room could've been improved a lot. Narcoosee's wasn't the best I had at WDW but wasn't the worst. (My favorites: 'Ohana, California Grill & Artist Point). Decor: Rooms: not bad, not great -- they could use an update. Lobby: beautiful. Service: everybody was very nice & pleasant; wasn't the type of hotel where they know your name, but, everybody was very nice and nobody was remotely arrogant or unpleasant. And when they realized the issue with my room, they really did work hard to get us into a better room, which I appreciated a lot. All in all: the location does make it worth it, but, there are different definitions of what constitutes a certain view, so, be warned on that. I would recommend calling back often for the several days prior to arrival next time to try and secure the room you want.

Reviews.Title: “Magically close to the Magical Kingdom!”
Reviews.Author: fish_and_chips6
Reviews.Content: It doesn't get better than this for proximity to the MK. Just a short hop on the monorail. Our room was bigger than I expected, and had a view of the MK, which meant we could watch the fireworks from our balcony - worth the extra pennies. We truly appreciated the 24h food store - everything from soft serve to wine to flat breads - very handy for tired bodies! Two pools - the kid's pool was very full and fairly small - we didn't stay long! The large pool was well-suited to our 8 year old's tastes, and there was plenty of space. Excellent service - no complaints. Will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel with bad service.”
Reviews.Author: Natlovestravel
Reviews.Content: Very beautiful and clean hotel/resort. No pool service. The pool bar does not have any food, so you have to room service it to the pool. Can't get any useful information from service desk.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this 10th Anniversary Stay. Worth it to stay here.”
Reviews.Author: Brygida_2008
Reviews.Content: I have too many good things to say about this resort! I loved the perfectly appointed rooms. The "mouse"keeping was excellent. The nightly turn-down service was great, not just because of the chocolates, but the towels were refreshed and trash taken out just after our daily afternoon swim - very convenient. The resort is gorgeous, arguably the best resort at Walt Disney World. The convenience of being on the Disney monorail line cannot be overstated! We picked the "Sago Cay" building. When you stepped out, on your right was Gasparilla Grill (24hr food court) and on your left was the marina with a great nightly view of Cinderella Castle and the fireworks. Also, on your right there is a "sneak" path to the Disney bus stop and valet parking. We never used the Disney buses though because this resort is on the monorail line (just 1 stop from Magic Kingdom). We did use valet parking (which is a bargain at $12/day) and drove to all the other Disney parks ourselves (where you can park for free with your resort parking pass given to you at checkin). My son (7 years old) absolutely loved!!! the beach pool with the water slide, a zero entry from the beach, and all the organized games each afternoon (Name that tune! Dance Party! Swim Party, etc). They do randomly ask to see your room key to get to this pool, so bring it. (I hear it is a favorite for locals to try and crash this pool). We also used the courtyard pool, which is warmer and near the outdoor spa. Also, walking through or just relaxing in the hotel lobby is fun in the evenings with a piano player or a band playing out soothing Disney classic tunes. This is a wedding hot spot and you are likely to see a wedding taking place. We saw one on the "Gone With The Wind" staircase in the main lobby and another at the marina perfectly timed with the nightly fireworks. The resort is known for its restaurants, but we did not eat in any except for the the food court on this trip - all our reservations were at other Disney restaurants. At the food court, I liked their shrimp over rice dish and my son loves there soft-serve ice cream and video games. If I had to nitpick, I would say that each of the buildings does not have enough washing machines to do laundry. Twice I had to go around other buildings to do my laundry (You can't pack enough with a 7 year old and an 11 day stay - you WILL need to do laundry). If you are up in the morning, about 8am, you will see a parade of the mousekeeping staff appropriately attired in pink stripe with pink parasols going off to work! At 915pm, you will see the nightly Electrical Water Pageant. The service at this hotel is impeccable. We never waited for checkin help, valet service, anything. The staff is perfectly trained and their to see that your stay is magical. I thoroughly loved this resort and would stay again any time! This trip celebrated our 10th Wedding Anniversary and it was just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but some of the amenities were excellent”
Reviews.Author: StephandJohn32244
Reviews.Content: The bell service is exceptional. If you don't mind paying about $1 a bag, use them to haul your luggage. The property is quite large and you really don't want to be toting luggage in the Florida heat. You can valet at $12 a day or you can self park. If you self park, you have a long walk from across the street. As usual for Disney, everyone is friendly. Check-in was quick and efficient. If you don't want the hassle of coming to the desk for checkout, get the express checkout. The receipt will be placed on your door the morning you leave. Spend the extra money to have bell staff come to your room the day you check out to haul your luggage. No matter where you park, they will drive you to your vehicle in the golf cart. The rooms are nothing spectacular, especially at the rates they charge. You are paying for everything else. The beds are not that great. I have had far better at Hilton and Marriott properties. The shampoo, conditioners, and soaps are exceptional. The supply of towels are exceptional and you should have two nice robes in your closet. The in room safes appear to be fairly new. Be careful of the refrigerators. Ours did not have a thermostat control and froze our drinks solid (good though if you are taking bottled water to the parks). The worst part of the room- the TV! it looks like the whole place is on satellite. at least two rooms in our party had TV reception only about 50% of the time. Even then the screen would freeze up or was 'blocky'. We found this to be quite 'un-Disneylike' in quality. We didn't use the pools but they were quite popular. Even the ducks took swims in them. The Spa and Health Club was a gem. The gym is 34/7 with your room key. The real exceptional piece was the lounge and locker rooms. It was quite peaceful with a sitting room, fresh fruit, water, and tea. The locker room had nice showers with shampoo, soap, conditioner, slippers, robes, and endless towels. There is also a steam room, a sauna, and a whirlpool. I spent two hours each day in there. Overall, the hotel itself is nice but it's not worth $400 a night. Just remember that you are paying for everything on the property and that is a lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Eastcoastfun
Reviews.Content: Cannot say enough great things about this top drawer hotel in the Disney complex. Rooms were spotless, the pools were fun, with great games for the kids and wonderful views. We had the best housekeeping staff who went out of their way to make us comfortable. The restaurants book-up quickly, so plan ahead. We won't stay anywhere else, worth the extra money in my opinion. Oh, and the live band of jazz players on the upper balcony includes some legends who played with Louis Armstrong and other greats back in the day. They alone are worth the cost. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Very Organized!”
Reviews.Author: Juicyld
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! very organized, you didn't have to take care of anything they did it all for you! For the amount of guests arriving and departing every minute they certainly have everything under control. It made it a stressfree vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “The Closest Thing to 5 Stars on Disney Property!”
Reviews.Author: Mattsaab
Reviews.Content: If you are going to Disney World and you want to stay near the Magic Kingdom in Disney’s most prestigious hotel – then the Grand Floridian is your clear choice. This wedding cake of a hotel has many things going for it: it’s on the monorail; the food is fantastic; the spa is top tier; the pools are lovely and the employees go out of their way to make every wish come true—the cast members should really be commended! That being said… the hotel stumbles on some very important elements that should be corrected to make this 4 star hotel a true 5 star property. First off, the guest rooms are in need of a major rehab. The bathrooms need a complete re-thinking and need to be started from scratch. They are small, dark and poorly designed. The shower room is very “motel” and the space is poorly used. The room décor is also all over the place and needs to be carefully designed anew with a top interior designer that can bring Victorian décor together with five star details and non-institutional feeling designs and materials. Also, is there a reason the TV is so small? The piece of furniture encasing the TV is substantial and makes the small TV seem even more minuscule. Next up, there are some questionable design choices that bring the hotel down. While the whimsical marble newly installed in the main building is spot on, the cheap, garish-colored new carpeting is way off! It is poor quality and has the feel and look of indoor-outdoor carpeting. This is also true with the off-design carpeting just installed in the Café and the truly terrible carpeting in our guest room. The guest room carpeting belonged in a retirement institution, not a top tier resort hotel – AND it clashed with every pattern and color in the room. In the same theme of bad taste, the spectacular pastel lobby is littered with ultra-cheap and tacky brown leather high back chairs that have nothing do with the theme or place. They are downright ugly and cheap looking. Maybe someone delivered them to the wrong address. They are that bad. Has Disney lost its level of taste? There is also a shortsighted decision regarding store hours in the hotel. The gift store and sundries store closed at 10 pm – a full hour earlier than the other hotels on the monorail. And since this is a place where families are regularly up till midnight, this seems like a huge oversight and bad decision. People want to shop, need items they have forgotten, and shouldn’t the most exclusive hotel have the stores with the longest hours and best merchandise? Well, it doesn’t. Why focus on such detail, because five star hotels stand above the rest because all the right choices are made – and they are not being made here. More reasons for choosing this hotel? You can walk to the always kitschy-yet-wonderful Polynesian; the turndown service with chocolates is a nice touch; the lakeside pool is relaxing and just the right touch; the marina offer great boat rentals; and the great employees. Confused? Don’t be. There simply isn’t a 5 star hotel on property. But this is the closest thing by far, and being on property, with the resort-guest benefits is well worth imagining the firth star on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Losing its touch, needs significant renovation, staff losing their smiles”
Reviews.Author: Globaltaster
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms connecting facing the Magic Kingdom. All down hill from there. The carpet seemed damp / moldy and smelled "old". The furniture was beat-up. Felt like a $150 / night room not the $500 we were paying. Also many of the" cast members" while not necessary rude were clearly not as cheerful and helpful as years past. Even our 9 year noticed it. What's happening to Disney?

Reviews.Title: “We have been to Disney many times but never like this!”
Reviews.Author: Pegnorm
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Disney without the kids in over 25 years. We had never seen Disney at Christmas time. They gave us a free upgrade when we checked in so we had a conceirge level room with a view of Cinderella's Castle. It was truly a magical trip!

Reviews.Title: “Great time with family.”
Reviews.Author: pedidik
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a trip to Orlando Disney World, had the pleasure of staying at the Grand Floridian. I just say enough about the service and the beauty of this place. Will definitely, return to stay there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!”
Reviews.Author: m1tch4
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two nights, this is a beautiful resort with very elegant décor. Our room was very comfortable, decorated beautifully which partially overlooked the pool and the lake and although it was next to the elevator, we were not disturbed by noise. A lovely experience, we were made to feel special especially as we were celebrating birthdays and gifts were left in the room. The staff were polite and attentive and transported our luggage to the Animal Kingdom Lodge, our next destination. Ate at the Grand Floridian Cafe. The food was good but not outstanding, it was a pleasant environment and the desert platter was especially delicious. As the hotel was situated on the lake, it was enjoyable to see the fireworks from Magic Kingdom in the evenings on the pier. It was also useful to have the monorail and boat services to transport us to the Magic Kingdom Park, as well as being able to rent out speedboats. The pools were beautiful. The family friendly pool with the slide was good fun and the large pool never got too crowded and suited us as a family with teenagers. Wished we had stayed longer and we cannot wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Pure magic! Convenient and beautiful.”
Reviews.Author: capecodmom77
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the grand Floridian for a weeklong family trip with two toddlers. Its proximity to Magic Kingdom cannot be beat. Riding the monorail to Mk and Epcot was so convenient; so was the Magic Express to and from the Airport. (we did not have to deal with car seats at all - what a treat!) We stayed in the Sugarloaf building which had breakfast in the lobby each morning including fresh fruit and pastries. We could not ask for anything more convenient. The rooms were nicely decorated in a Victorian style. While the room is a bit small, it has a lovely balcony where we enjoyed sitting each evening. The Christmas decorations in the main building are just breathtaking including a life sized gingerbread house from which they sell gingerbread cookies. There is either a pianist or orchestra playing each night; we enjoyed watching all the young children (ours included) dance in the middle of the enormous lobby. There are many couches and lounge chairs where people can sit and enjoy the atmosphere. The grounds are spotless. There are views of Cinderella's castle from the hotel. There are also wonderful shops in the main building that I enjoyed milling through in the evenings. We enjoyed the pool located closest to the beach. It was a basic pool but it is surrounded by such grandeur that it was enjoyable to sit. It also had zero entry which was great for our learning swimmers. At night they had a fire for roasting marshmallows on the beach which was so much fun. Overall we loved everything about this trip. It is fairly expensive for the size of the room you receive, but factoring in the overall experience we thought it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Disney Experience Near the Magic”
Reviews.Author: raylab
Reviews.Content: We have visited the Grand Floridian every year since it opened in 1988 and the hotel still sparkles. The facility is maintained to the highest standard of excellence and the staff is friendly and knowledgeable.The marble floors shine, the floral arrangements are magnificent, and the live music each evening in the lobby provides a quiet respite from the Disney theme parks just a short monorail ride away. After a day in the parks it is great to return to the oasis of relaxation found at this hotel. Easily accessible to Magic Kingdom by monorail, GF guests have the added option of taking the private launch which crosses the lagoon and also stops next door at the Polynesian Resort. This is always a nice way to beat the crowds exiting Magic Kingdom after the fireworks when the monorail can often be crowded. With two large pools, a spa, afternoon tea and a full service 24 hour a day take out restaurant that caters to young families, the Grand Floridian offers the best of all things to multi generational guests. Also on the premises are my two favorite Disney restaurants: Narcoose's and Citricos. If you go to Disney, do yourself a favor: stay at the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “truly grand indeed”
Reviews.Author: smaya1993
Reviews.Content: stayed here 2 nights in July just to be close to disney and was not disappointed. This resort is truly grand indeed from entering and looking at the beautiful lobby to entering your room and the lovely view of cinderalla's castle you know you are close to the magic kingdom. The monorail service was really awesome can't believe it took us 2 minutes to arrive at magic kindgom it was the first stop and another great service was the ferry coming back from magic kingdom was only 3 minutes it was the first stop also, absolutely loved here would stay here again my number one reason because of the monorail service. My only complain I had but did not make a problem the monorail was down until 8.15 the morning we had an adr at crystal palace but my day at disney turned out great you can read my review on it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, although...”
Reviews.Author: maggieb12123
Reviews.Content: We came here in October, and it was a very nice hotel. The pool was nice and the food that they served was great! The only thing that we didn't like was that most of the people around us were very high class, and we felt rather out of place. The rooms were HUGE! They were so comfortable, and we had a great week there! It was a ton of fun, and we would definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but beginning to rest on its laurels”
Reviews.Author: aerin-sol
Reviews.Content: I just spent five nights at Disney’s Grand Floridian. Was it such a magical experience that I feel I’m spoiled for any other Disney hotel? No. But was it nice enough that I’d really have to think hard about picking another Disney hotel over it? Yes. Best part? I celebrated a birthday while I was in Disney and was greeted in my room by a prettily displayed complimentary box of chocolates and a card. Very, very nice of them. Now the nitty gritty. I’ve read some write-ups sayings saying the staff was snooty, but I didn’t experience that. I did feel the two people at the front desk that I dealt with weren’t the warmest people. Polite, did their job, but they seemed diffident more than anything. However, all the other staff I dealt with (waiters, maintenance, the guys in knee pants who walk around, room attendants) were extremely nice and very personable. I will say that I did see other guests being escorted to their rooms on day one, whereas I got some vague directions and a map. At other times, guests were really getting the extra mile while I was left to sit and figure it out on my own. I’m not sure if it was because they had kids with them (I didn’t) or if I happened to see those with concierge service and their boots were being licked. It did cause some “hey” moments for me though. I stayed in room 3722 in the Conch Key building. The lobby there was always quiet and I only ever had to share the very fast elevator twice during my entire stay. The room was pretty with comfortable beds, great a/c and a marble bathroom. But it had obvious signs of wear (the round part of the Mickey lamp’s nose was broken off, scuffed wall paper, cracked sink vanity, frayed carpet edge going into the bathroom, black stains on the sofa and bedding) that were not consistent with the hotel’s reputation or price point. Plus the mini fridge never worked and when I complained to the room attendant, he seemed unsure how to go about fixing the problem (uh, replace it). I assumed it would be taken care of while I was at the park the next day, but for my entire stay the fridge was out of order. I spotted cracker crumbs behind the chair while searching for a way onto the balcony (they weren’t from me so they had to be from a previous guest) and they weren’t cleaned up during my visit either. Are these huge problems? No. Should a hotel this expensive have them at all let alone not correct them asap? No. The room was relatively quiet. The main noises I heard were the flush of surrounding toilets (they are extremely loud), the honk of the ferry as it came to the dock and the noisy guy across the hall who seemed to have loud conversations with his numerous guest every night at 11. That only lasted 2 nights and he either checked out or was spoken to. While there, I ate at the Café and Gasparilla Grille. On my first night I ate dinner at the Café and it gave a good and bad impression. The food was outstanding: tasty pork chop with roasted corn, snap peas and tomatoes that were obviously farm fresh; followed by the dessert sampler (which they say feeds 2, but each dessert is two bites so if you have a big eater with you, don’t plan on sharing). Trouble was my waiter was incredibly slow. It took forever for him to take my order and forever for him to bring anything out, especially dessert. Meanwhile, the other servers were flying around and people who arrived after me were out the door well before me. I ate breakfast there twice (much faster service) and can recommend the french toast, but not the pancakes. I had one full breakfast at Gasparilla with a not so hot (in temp) breakfast sandwich and gross fountain drink (they suck park wide as they are part of the dining plan, avoid them) that was WAY over priced (the gross fountain drink also cost a fortune, which I didn’t know). However, the next time I ate there, I bought a pint of milk from their fridge and a large cinnamon bun and it was both tasty and cheap. I also did tea in the Garden View Tea Room. I’ve done high tea before and would rate this tea experience as a 5 out of ten. Dry bread on the sandwiches and they don’t tell you what the sandwich flavors are until they are served (one was shrimp salad and I hate shrimp). The scones were good, but you only get one. You also only get two tiny desserts. Now the tea blend I had, Princess Breakfast Tea, was the best hot tea ever as it had strawberry and vanilla tones to it. However, for $24 I didn’t feel the tea was worth it and wouldn’t do it again. I was expecting a tea set up out of a fairytale and I’ve had better at a local tea house. Transportation was the biggest issue. While I never had that long of a wait for a bus or the monorail, and only had to stand once, the Floridian is the last stop on any mode of transportation except for the ferry from Magic Kingdom where the hotel is dropped off first. Which means before you can go to bed at night, you have to endure three monorail stops and if you are trying to get to Epcot from the hotel, you have to get off at transportation, go down the long ramp and walk up another ramp to wait for the monorail taking you to Epcot. And then you have a very long walk through the park if you want to get to the World Showcase. Or else you can take 1.5 hour bus ride and then a ferry to the World Showcase. The trouble with the buses is that while it may say it has stops at two places, it will also unexpectedly stop at a water park and two other hotels along the way, making for a long ride. Now this is a Disney issue and not a hotel issue, but if you are looking for quick commutes, the Floridian really isn’t that quick. The monorail stops at the Contemporary, transportation and the Polynesian first on its way back to the Floridian from the Magic Kingdom and a stop at transportation before reaching the Magic Kingdom if departing from the hotel. The easiest way into Epcot would be to stay at the Beach Club, Yacht Club or Boardwalk hotels where a five minute ferry ride or a short walk has you at the World Showcase. There needs to be an easier way to get from the Floridian to the World Showcase, like a bus that drops you at the ferry by the Epcot hotels or something that picks you up at the Epcot monorail depot and transports you to the back. Not to sound lazy, but the hotter it gets, the longer that walk becomes. Right now the only easy way is to stay elsewhere. I only used one of the pools, but was grossed out by the ducks swimming in it so I got out quickly. Not sure how they'd keep the ducks out, but something needs to be done as they leave feces in the pool. Ick! Tried the hot tub, but it was practically scalding and not what you want during August in Florida. The one outstanding thing I saw happened to another guest, but deserves note. The piano player was doing modern songs, but spotted a little girl walking through with her family and broke into “It’s a small world” for her. When he was done, the little girl ran over and hugged him. He then played two other children’s songs from Disney for her, receiving a hug for each and then she brought over her Cinderella gown to show him. The guy was wonderful to her and it was really heartwarming to see. There is also an oddity in the lobby that I couldn’t figure out until an internet search explained it. Every time I went through the main lobby, I’d see an older woman sitting by herself, staring into space. Because of her heavy make-up, basket of stuffed animals and odd clothing, I thought she was a character out of a movie, but she never interacted with guests, just staff. I speculated that she was homeless or a crazy, but hoped the hotel wouldn’t allow someone like that to hang about so I chalked her up as an odd guest. Turns out she’s neither a character or a guest, just an odd person who goes there every day with a basket of teddy bears to listen to the music. It’s nice that they allow her to do that, but it’s also unsettling. Yeah, anyone can visit the hotels, lobbies aren’t just for hotel guests, but it is weird behavior and there are children around. I’m not saying she’d do anything, but why take a risk? She made me uncomfortable before I knew what her deal was, and knowing it now, it still weirds me out a bit. Check out was a breeze, they had my boarding pass on my door knob before I was even up on my last day. All I had to do was make a call to pay my baggage fee and take my checked suitcase to the front and I was done. Not sure if this is a Floridian thing or a Disney thing, but it rocked. All in all, I liked the Grand Floridian. I loved that there were minimal children, rare in Disney, so that would give me pause before booking another hotel, but the Floridian is really only convenient for Magic Kingdom. There was nothing that ruined the visit, but there was nothing that made me swoon either. The hotel is supposed to be Disney’s flagship resort and I’m not sure it lives up to its reputation any longer. I’m afraid it’s going to be one of those fading dames where guests wind up paying more for its name than its experience.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but....”
Reviews.Author: SamiParty
Reviews.Content: If you don't stay in the main building, it is really like staying in a regular hotel. The main building is beautiful and well taken care of. The outer buildings are nice, but are in need of some updating and the rooms are a bit small. The main building rooms cost more, but are probably worth it. Plus the lobby of the main building has live entertainment daily in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel but overpriced food”
Reviews.Author: Ovalworld
Reviews.Content: Got back from GF a week ago. Trip duration = 10 nights. Party = 2 adults & 1 teenager. What a beautiful hotel this is. I have read many reviews regarding the need of a refurb. I think the hotel is styled on the victorian era so the wallpaper etc is old fashion style but its brand new as it was changed when we was there! The hotel is kept to a high standard regarding cleanliness. The staff are a credit to the place. I would love to take one of them home with me in my suitcase!!! The resort is quite extensive with a good programme of entertainment & amenities. I have to comment on the ducks(9 in total) in the main pool. Some of the staff had no problem with them being there but others were very quick to chase them out. The ducks try not to come near you. The worst thing about the having the ducks in there are the children that chase them round. I feel its my duty to mention the price of food. Obviously we are staying is a disney hotel so it's not going to be cheap. In the evenings we ate at: Narcossies, Citricos, Grand Cafe(1 night only), contemporary hotel(Californian Grill) & downtown disney. The food was to a very good standard but i don't think the price warrants $45.00+ for a main course! For the reason i mentioned above, it will be at last a couple of years before i visit again. I cannot think of anything else negative about this hotel so if you don't mind paying these prices daily then i would highly recommend staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Very attractive, not bad”
Reviews.Author: beerbellyhillbilly
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 days and 2 nights, and never had a problem. The room was very nice, and had a balcony. The staff here though acted like they had never seen someone with tattoos before lol. They never said anything to me, but i got lots of looks, one might say disapproving looks. The place is a victorian style and very attractive. This is a more upscale resort, and not all but alot of the staff struck me as if they were caught in a rain storm, they may drown. That would be due to the position of their noses lol. I will say this though, for such an uppity establishment their not real thorough with the cleaning and bag transport. We extended our stay, but at another resort and had our bags transferred over, which took an entire day. Had we known that we would have just taken them with us ourselves. When we arrived and showered the first night my wife located a few very unattractive boogers on the shower wall. What with the snootiness of the place, and the price, you'd think you wouldnt have to worry about running into a nose goblin in the shower.

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT SERVICE BUT IN NEED OF SOME REFURBISHMENT”
Reviews.Author: PARENTWITHKIDS
Reviews.Content: stayed for a week in a garden view room in sago key. Room was spacious with 2 double beds and a single sofa/bed (a bit too hard for my liking) but a bit smelly so obviously needed refurbished. Ideally placed for the bus stop, and gaspirella's 24 hour cafe selling good child friendly food and cakes, with excellent views of the fireworks. Service was outstanding - at entrance security took our details and someone was waiting to greet us personally in front of the hotel and take us to check in, which was very efficient (always seemed to be plenty of staff free on the desk to deal with people). Bell service took us to our room immediately in a little cart. Check out was very easy and quick (an invoice left on our room door handle). Maid service was outstanding, oodles of towels and toiletries and even sculptures of mickey and other animals cleverly made from towels. pool and beach were lovely but close during rain storms so you are left in limbo as to what to do. Bus service was good and shared with polynesian and sometimes contemporary/wilderness lodge meaning a good 45 minute journey to/from the likes of downtown or animal kingdom. you cant walk to Magic kingdom but its a very short 2 minute monorail ride. you can walk to the polynesian. the tennis courts were being refurbished but we could use those at the contemporary free of charge. breakfast/service in the restaurant was good but the menu was limited (and theres no buffet). narcoosees the restaurant overlooking the lake has excellent but expensive food and views and fast efficient child friendly service in contrast to citricos. boat service to MK goes via polynesian so suggest you only use if not in a hurry or on the way back from MK.

Reviews.Title: “Only 5 stars in Disney's "Make Believe" World”
Reviews.Author: cpwife
Reviews.Content: It is not a 5 star resort by usual standards - think Ritz, Four Seasons, etc. The hotel is showing its age with torn wallpaper, chipped paint and overall tiredness. The staff is so-so. Housekeeping can't even see that in-room coffee needs replenishing. I know this is Disney, but screaming toddlers in the hallway after 11 PM is not acceptable. The restaurant choices are not great. For a resort this large 2 pools is not enough. The small pool has a "waterslide", but very small for any other swimming. The other pool is large, but has practically no shade. The Beach/Yacht club pools are much more fun. Wouldn't select this hotel again. Sadly, Disney is letting its quality go downhill, but they will always make money regardless how shabby they become.

Reviews.Title: “Even better second time around”
Reviews.Author: leprauchan
Reviews.Content: 2 years ago we stayed at the Floridian and loved it. So when we decided to return I was a little bit apprehensive that it wouldn't live up to the fabulous image I had of it . How wrong I was ,we loved it even more the second time. As soon as you turn into the drive and see the hotel close up for the first time you know you've made the right decision. We were greeted off the magical express and walked directly to the check -in and within 15 mins of arrival we were off to our room. The lobby is beautiful ,try to remember to take note of the beautiful smell as you enter for the first time. The grounds are gorgeous and as with the entire property are spotlessly clean and well tended. We had a garden view room in Sago Cay which was very comfortable,had a fridge and we loved the little towel animals that mouskeeping sometimes left for us. The pools are great with an endless supply of towels and we were always able to get a sun lounger no matter what time of day we went to the pool. We rented a cabana at the beach pool and that was a lovely treat. The attendants were marvelous and while we lay relaxing they brought us lunch and drinks and a steady supply of water and anything we needed. We ate at Narcoossees, Citricos and the Grand Floridian Cafe and would recommend all of them. We had afternoon tea at the Garden View tea room and thoroughly enjoyed that experience. We loved Gasperilla's for the times that you want something quick and don't want to have to go to a restaurant for it. It was great for picking up snacks ,drinks cups of coffee. Transportation to the Magic Kingdom is so easy either by monorail or boat . We had no car and used Disney transportation to get to all of the other parks and found it to be efficient ,clean and so simple. In the evening once it gets dark you can watch the Electric Water Pageant from the beach and then settle down to watch a movie on the beach. You get a great view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks from the boat dock or get dessert from Gasperillas and sit outside and enjoy them from there. The Floridian never seemed crowded ,all staff were really friendly and helpful. Genuinely I could find no fault with it after our experience and will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Location”
Reviews.Author: Vitara-1
Reviews.Content: For a trip to Disney World this is simply the place to stay if you're a couple. Superbly kept property with wonderful facilities. Rooms are not the best for a 5 star property however they are more than adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Spa Mani Pedi at Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: idrawart
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the mani pedi, but have a comment: It's done is a skinny claustophobicly small room with no view. The smells hit you and your technician has to keep moving if others walk behind her. It was a good job but not a good experience. My technician was nice, and the job lasted several weeks but I wouldn't go back because of the overall experience being just ...meh! You have the beautiful white beach just feet away, palm trees and breezes and you stick the patrons in a renovated closet? I was the only one there

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but expected the room to be nicer”
Reviews.Author: JMP0711
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian. We are relatively frequent Disney visitors (at least once a year) and have stayed at many other hotels there before, including the Wilderness Lodge, the Contemporary, Saratoga Springs, etc. The Grand Floridian looks absolutely fabulous from the outside. The pools, landscaping, scenery are all beautiful. We had a standard room with 2 queen beds near the pool. The lake view from the room was wonderful. The room was very clean, but I was struck by how worn the furnishings seemed. For the top hotel at Disney World, I sort of expected the room to be nicer, but it was very much like the rooms we have stayed in at other deluxe Disney hotels. In addition, since the other rooms we've had at Disney deluxe hotels have always appeared recently re-done, the extra price we paid for this room at the Grand Floridian seemed questionable. Aside from this "nit," we enjoyed our stay very much. The pool was very nice, and we had a nice breakfast at an outside table. We did not have time to try the spa or other dining opportunities. As we've come to expect from Disney hotels, all of the staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “The boy done good :)”
Reviews.Author: LizzyJohn
Reviews.Content: My husband chose this as our honeymoon hotel - he knows I love Disney and I'd never seen the Florida park before. He splurged and booked us into the Grand Floridian. The room which overlooked the pool was just beautiful and the accessibility to the Magic Kingdom by both boat and monorail was fabulous. It was the luxurious and romantic experience of my dreams. With one exception we ate the cafeteria rather than the restaurants which were a bit too pricey for us. The cafe food was of a decent quality and reasonably priced. But the ambiance was oddly downmarket since you eat in the middle of a games arcade... hmmm. Moreover, allow time for any business you need to do at reception/concierge desk which, despite being well staffed is almost always very busy with a long queue.

Reviews.Title: “best of the best”
Reviews.Author: 506er
Reviews.Content: the grand floridian is a top noch hotel that makes you feel like a king and queen. very clean ,great food,very helpfull to guests.citricos resturant is the best place i have eaten in the usa. everyone is so pleasant and the music in the great hall is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Best Location for Magic Kingdom and Families with small children...”
Reviews.Author: LEGJCG1
Reviews.Content: Have to say I expected stuffy Victorian Resort Hotel...but was pleasantly surprised by the layout and great location. Grounds were emaculate and rooms spacious and clean. We were amazed by the Christmas decor and extras all around. The resort offers good restaurant choices and quick transportation via monorail or boat around the Maguc Kingdom Resort area. The only negative comment would be the counter service restaurant Gasparilla Grill ... Tried it twice but all around bad. Loved the club level in Sugar Loaf and will return as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service Beautiful Hotel Fantastic Spa”
Reviews.Author: deanna306
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked this trip and I decided to go "all out" because I figured I only had one shot at getting him to DisneyWorld. The hotel is unbelievably beautiful and the convenience of being in a hotel on the monorail system is phenomenal. When we checked in and headed to our room I was a little dissappointed. THe main "house" is breathtaking. BUT the other mini-hotels that surround that main house are not so spectacular. They aren't bad per-say, but they are underwhelming at best. The room had a view of some constuction they were doing to a wetland area and it smelled like someone dropped an entire gallon of room freshner. I could hardly breath it was so bad! We decided to go back to the desk to see if we could switch rooms, since the smell was intolerable. The front desk people couldn't have been nicer or more helpful! Not only did they switch our room, but they gave us a complimentary upgrade to concierge level! I was absolutely thrilled! the room was amazing and we were on a floor that you had to use your key to get to! Soooo Snazzy! there was free breakfast, free afternoon tea and snacks, and even a free early evening wine-cheese-dessert buffet. The room was beautiful and we even had a balcony-but the view-THE VIEW! we got a straight on view of Cinderalla's castle every night! I couldn't have been more pleased with the service of this hotel. For a once in a lifetime trip it was definately worth it. However, if we had to stay in our original room, I would be writing a different review. If you have the money or the opportunity to upgrade DO IT!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it, worth every penny!”
Reviews.Author: Bandres
Reviews.Content: the grounds were very well kept, the locale can not be beat,the staff is incredible! you definitely get what you pay for. Every day they are cleaning and pruning and taking care of the grounds and building to every last detail. this is a monorail hotel so you are Accessible to magic kingdom epcot buses to animal kingdom, typhoon lagoon and downtown Disney. You are not waiting more than 10 to 15 min. Staff is friendly and go out of their way. I give credit to Brent who helped my family find lost pictures and he just went over and beyond in hospitality. The crowd or I should say mentality of the people are different when you go high end. No matter how busy the place gets,it's still clean,safe,and quiet. I walked through the Polynesian although pretty looks like it's always busy ,too crowded, and too loud. As for theme park view.... Conch building is better locale. Close to the ferry boat and direct view of Cinderella's castle watched the fireworks from my room a couple of times and the electric water parade.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Unbelieveable!”
Reviews.Author: bhall236
Reviews.Content: My husband, seven year old son, and my elderly parents and I recently stayed at the Grand Floridian and it was an incredible experience. The hotel is luxurious, beautifully decorated, and immaculatley kept. The restaurants were fabulous. The staff was gracious and helpful without exception. My experiences with the staff were uniformly excellent, however it was my mother's experience that is the most telling. My mother is disabled and uses a wheelchair. My parents had a beautiful and spacious handicapped room. Each staff member we came in contact with made sure that she was accomodated in every way possible. Moreover they did it in such a natural way. That means more than many people can imagine. A lot of folks are uncomfortable around someone in a wheelchair and while they accomodate her they do it an a way that she is very aware that they are doing something out of the ordinary for her. She gets what she needs but is made to feel like a burden in the process. That was not the case at the Grand Floridian, or at any of the Disney properties we visited. When we approached a table at a restaurant there was never any scrambling by waitstaff to remove chairs or reposition tables. It was taken care of before we were seated so she could just roll up to the table. Restroom attendants reserved handicapped stalls and when we went into the restrooms there were always clean facilities available for her. Walkways were extra wide so she could manuver easily. The housekeeper checked on her and my father several times daily to see if they needed anything. The bellmen went above and beyond by helping my father park their car (with wheelchair trailer). I could go on an on but you get the idea. We travel a lot and this was by far the best service I've ever seen at a hotel. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Floridian is Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Deathbytatertot
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 nights. Just a Magical experience. Enjoyed watching the 4th of July fireworks while relaxing in the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Our second trip didn't disappoint!”
Reviews.Author: wqh
Reviews.Content: I can't say enough about this hotel. The service is amazing, and the grounds are impeccable. The pools are fantastic, and not too crowded. My kids absolutely love this place (even at ages 10 & 11)...it's a great place for families!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bulglish
Reviews.Content: This was our first family visit to Disney. We stayed a week at the end of June 2011. The hotel without question is absolutely stunning and the public areas are breath taking. We had a standard marina view room. Perfectly adequate for a family of four or five. To be honest you are not at Disney to sit in your room. We did hear a bit of corridor noise but nothing dramatic. What is an absolute must when staying at any Disney resort in my opinion is the Disney deluxe dining programme. This entitles you to eat anywhere across the entire resort. I was dubious about this at first but after the first day I did my maths. My savings were in four figures (dollars, euros or sterling). We were entitled to a character breakfast every day which we did plus we ate at Narcossees or Citricos every evening plus free sodas all day long in the resort and several snacks per person per day. If you timed it right you can sit and watch the fireworks while you eat The only extras I paid for were the gratuity and a bottle of wine. Absolutely fantastic value and it made our holiday. In my opinion your hard earned cash pays better dividends on the dining plans than upgrading your room including conciege levels - paticularly at Disney when you use the room to just sleep and wash. Cleanliness of the hotel is good and the staff in general very helpful. The hotel is extremely close to the Magic Kingdom so even if you are late getting up you are still in before the ride queues become too excessive. Transport to the other parks is also fast and efficient. The only complaint I would have is the fastpass system. Basically everyone has it. Therefore do not go with the assumption that its a perk because it is not. Particularly with the popular rides, I found out that on Space Mountain for example it was better to queue in standby than use the fastpass. Some of the fastpass times to come back were 5 hours. Better still use magic hours particularly late at night and the queue times dwindle to 20 minutes at most. In summary if you can afford it this is the place to stay and don't forget the pre purchase dining plans.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True!”
Reviews.Author: Torsie24
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Floridian for 4 nights on the days surrounding our Disney Wedding. We stayed in the Main Building (Royal Palm Club) and from arrival to departure everything was amazing. Our room overlooked the marina with a direct view to the castle, a perfect site to wake up to. :) The room was well appointed, and the jacuzzi tub was a nice touch (although a little noisy) we also loved the offerings in the lounge, if you're only a light eater (as I was being so excited for the big day) then you can certainly make 3 meals out of it if you want to. Sadly I don't think we'll be able to afford a longer trip there for a while (at over $1000 per night) but I think during our next trip we may well steal a night there - we'll be staying back at the Animal Kingdom Lodge!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful buildings but...”
Reviews.Author: MrsHindson
Reviews.Content: There is no doubting that this hotel is stunning. The reception; is breath-taking and the grounds, as you would expect at Disney; immaculate. Its like walking into something out of Gone With The Wind. I loved orchestra on the balcony, the fantastic pianist tinkling on the grand piano... Every inch of the place white and colonial in style. However; my 4 year old son and I stayed 5 days here and 14 days at The Polynesian and I have to say the only tangible bonus of paying the extra was a nightly chocolate on my pillow! The rooms at the GF are the exact same size and layout as at the P (only on a different theme). I found the staff at the Polynesian to be much warmer and the atmosphere at the Polynesian more 'homely'. The walls are very thin at the GF and we were disturbed by crying babies in the room above and the sound of sliding wardrobed doors (directly behind our bedheads) in the neighbouring room. Apart from the thin walls I have no critcisms of the GF but on reflection - if I was returning to Disney - I would stay at a cheaper hotel and visit the GF for dinner. (Their signature restuarant Citricos was OUTSTANDING). The added expense of staying at the GF is not justified. It wont enhance your stay - just deplete your wallet!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded my expectations of a Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: AdamK_11
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed this property. It has an old world feel but is neat, clean and modern. It's also large enough not to feel too crowded. I really did feel like I was on a wonderful old plantation back in the "good old days". This was my family's first visit to Disney World and this was the perfect way to do it. Transport to all the Disney parks was a breeze by monorail, boat and bus and is extremely well organised. Like any resort, the food was pretty expensive. $190 (including photograph) for 2 adults and 4 kids for a "Character Breakfast" kinda woke me up a bit!! I'd look into those Disney Dining Plans if you're planning on eating while at this resort. I'd highly recommend going the suite option with access to "Level 4" where free food is available pretty much all day and there is enough to feed yourself if Australian size portions will suffice. The staff were all very helpful and our stay was most enjoyable. Without any experience of other hotels in the area, I would definitely return to the Grand Floridian if I were to return to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Anniversary celebration!”
Reviews.Author: krimsy
Reviews.Content: My husband & I spent our honeymoon here 15 years ago & splurged for our anniversary this year. It was worth every penny!! Room was clean & spacious. We were with our 2 girls and the location right on the monorail made getting to the parks a breeze. We beat the crowds every day which was wonderful as we headed back to the hotel pool for lunch & a swim when the parks were at their busiest. Went back to the parks after dinner to do more rides & the fireworks. The staff there were so great. It was a breath of fresh air to check into this hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Not the Best Disney Property”
Reviews.Author: adamsaintlouis
Reviews.Content: Although marketed as their top resort, I would not place the Floridian in the top 3. The Contemporary (with walking distance to Magic Kingdom and monorail through the center) and Animal Kingdom Lodge I vote are definitely better. Especially given the price of the Floridian is often double or more other deluxe resorts, it simply is not worth the money. The quick service food was one of the worst at Disney (walk to the Polyneasian for better food). The main pool is okay, but nothing near other resorts (think Beach Club or Animal Kingdom). The rooms are dated. We stayed in a domer room, had a TV from the 80s, and the bathroom was showing its age. I would say the room is equal to a 1990s Marriott or Hilton quality. The lobby is awesome, especially at christmas, but you can visit that anytime for free. Overall - go with a different deluxe property.

Reviews.Title: “Big kids in a big playground...”
Reviews.Author: Bigphil82
Reviews.Content: Wow. That pretty sums up our experience in The Grand Floridian Resort & Spa. We've stayed here on 4 occasions now (not including my now wife, she had never stayed before) and in all honesty, this recent trip has to be the winner. We visited to celebrate my parents 30th wedding anniversary. May seem a little childish - 5 grown ups heading to Disney for a week but in all honesty, there is no alternate reality like it. It was the only place to go. After the long and frankly disappointing flight in Premium Economy - Virgin, take note from Emirates, you've a lot to learn - we arrived at Orlando Intl to then be ripped off by the Alamo car hire. The term of which stayed for the rest of the holiday - if something proved expensive, you'd been 'alamo'd'. Safe to say not a great start to the holiday but it's very difficult to wipe the smile off your face when your next location is Disney World. We drove our minivan and pulled up to the Magic Kingdom gate to be waved on through, continuing to follow signs for The Grand Floridian. This marks the beginning of the experience. The road signs have already changed, there are Disney buses, and you see the monorail for the first time. Our arrival at the hotel was greeted by the old chap who's greeted us every time we've visited. We were amazed he was still going! But however amazing he is, nothing compares to the smell, sights and sounds of that first walk in. The pristine lobby with the new marble floor, the band playing up on the balcony or the pianist sat doing his thing. It's incredible - a full multi sensory experience. Check in was smooth, rooms were ready on time and we were in, unpacked and heading The Magic Kingdom in the space of an hour. This is where a bit of Disney magic took place. We had arranged prior to our arrival for the Disney Florist to head into my parents room and decorate it with one of the room decoration gifts. When we finally got back to the hotel that night, my parents were blown away (not literally, but there were tears). The room looked spectacular and the gifts were stunning. Highly recommend getting in touch with the Florist if you have a special occasion. They will arrange something truly magical. The rooms were as usual, stunning and super clean. With big beds, a big bathroom with double sinks and a great shower. Only thing missing this time was the mini bar which had been replaced in all Disney hotels with a simple but empty fridge. The housekeeping service was top notch, as was the evening turn down. Not much better in this world than coming home form a long day in one of the theme parks to a nicely turned down bed, a tasty chocolate and a very Disney good-night note. Lovely! We were staying in the Boca Chica building, just behind the bar area of the central pool. It is this main pool that is actually the Disney's Imagineers least favourite. Apparently, it is too plain/bland. I have to say, I disagree. The nearest pool was the this very pool and it was fantastic. Big enough for a long swim, right next to the bar and bizarrely, full of ducks and the odd Disney character. We didn't get to use the spa - too much rollercoaster riding, but from other reviews, it sounds fantastic. Food - The Grand Floridian Café was wonderful. The menu had changed a little since our previous visit (5 yrs prior) but it was still great. So great in fact that i would go as far as to say it's the best food in Disney in that price bracket. The steak was cooked to perfection and the Parmesan frits were possibly the most addictive food i'd ever eaten. On top of the food being lovely, the service was impeccable too. My wife had a moment where the maitres d' had realised she was wearing a black dress. He ran off and reappeared with a black napkin to match, rather than the usual white. Nice little touch. The 1900 park fare character meals are ok. There's a fair bit of choice in the buffet but in my opinion this is much better for kids, not 5 adults. We still enjoyed it but would have perhaps enjoyed it more if i was 8. The Gasparilla Grill was a fast food place. We had most breakfasts in there as we were always rushing in the morning - long days in Disney World mean a lot of sleep if you can get it! We didn't eat in there any evenings or lunches. We did partake in ice cream most nights for the fireworks. Self serve - winner. Citrico's is nice if a little expensive. The expensive part goes hand in hand with the hotel and being in Disney but it was a bit much. The food was lovely but we didn't go out of our way to eat there a second time. We would also tend to go and grab an early evening drink at Mizners Lounge. Great ambience in there and some very nice drinks available. The monorail never faltered and in all fairness i could probably listen to the guy on the audio system all day. "Please stand clear of the doors...". Not only that but the air-con is mega and always welcome! Same on the buses. All in all, the Disney transportation was always on time and always comfortable. Check out, like everything else was smooth and easy. The bill was posted under the door the night before our departure (that bit wasn't too much fun) and that was about it. I won't bore you with info on the parks. I'll save that for another review on another day. What i will finish on is this. If you have an opportunity to go and stay at The Grand Floridian do it. While The Contemporary and The Polynesian look great, The Grand really takes the biscuit. Yes it's expensive but aren't they all? If your willing to let yourself go and immerse yourself in all things Disney, on top of having some extra fun in the parks, look no further. This is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Magical but normally overpriced”
Reviews.Author: DutchPete1
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at many Disney resort hotels but the best value for money is at the Wilderness lodge. We love the lobby and ambiance in the GF, but as Europeans we agree with many here that the normal prices at the GF are hugely overpriced. Location and service excellent, but transportation can be a nightmare sometimes and busses run more frequent to AllStar resorts! How is this possible when you pay five times more? There should be a normal European style breakfast restaurant. Absurd that you can't find this in a deluxe resort. We were lucky to stay club level and somehow there they do manage to offer a healthy breakfast and healthy snacks, so why not for everybody? Even if we can pay for this, not everybody is interested in eggs, sausages, pancakes and other fat things. So far the negative side, because believe it or not, the hotel is something special with the pools, the spa, the marina, the beach, grounds, lobby etc. So please add a decent buffet breakfast, add free wifi and offer fast and luxurious transportation and it's worth the price you're paying for now! And something else if Disney is reading this: please allow free tables at table serving restaurants for guests without reservations. Both in the parks as well as in the hotels a nightmare, as everybody seems to reserve and plan their dining 6 months in advance.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best, but...”
Reviews.Author: jMarg27
Reviews.Content: Okay, so you're talking to a person that absolutely LOVES this hotel. I have been coming here since I was very little. I will go through exactly what happened during my stay from July 1st- July 5th, 2011. Check-in: Since we already were in Disney, we didn't use the Magical Express service to get from the airport to the Grand Floridian. We used a taxi from the Contemporary (gross) to here. Boy, was it a breath of fresh air! At the guard stand, a woman greeted us, asked for our name, and told us someone would be there to assist with luggage at the Porte Cochere. When we pulled up, the bell captain opened the door and had one of the uniformed-bell boys take our luggage. Then, a cute girl (can't remember her name) asked if we were the "Smith" party and welcomed us back. At the front desk, there was no wait. We were lead to someone who was training (oh, great.) However, she was efficient with the whole process. She did honor our request of being in Boca Chica on a high floor very well (we were in Conch Key... not my favorite.) She gave us our welcome packet, and we were lead off to another bellman on a trolley. Okay, this is service. While driving us to the room, he told us about the history of the resort, where everything was, and about the future addition to the Grand Floridian. We pulled up to Boca Chica (an excellent building, by the way) and went up to room 8406 on the 4th floor. It was a dormer room, which I had never stayed in. The bellman (Jim) was absolutely wonderful. He brought our luggage up and even brought us ice and bottled water (the real feel temperature was 106.) SUCCESS!
