The Room: Okay, here is where we start having a few minor issues. From first glance, everything looked great; however, that night when we returned, I noticed that some of the furniture was in bad shape, the moldings were chipped, the balcony was dirty, and we were missing a day bed! What the heck! I never complained about these things because I figured, "Everything is not perfect, is it really affecting our trip?" No. It wasn't. But, for paying close to $600 per night, I want my room to be pretty spectacular. Also, the first two nights, we didn't receive turn-down service. I even asked one of the maids if every room received turn-down service, and I got a clear "Yes." Whatever, just another thing to tick me off. The bathrooms were always clean, and the shower was typical... low pressure. Overall, the room was nice. The Building: Ah, Boca Chica. My favorite! Well, used to be... It still is, but I noticed a couple things wrong this trip. For one, there was always a sign in the middle of the foyer that said, "Watch your step. Wet floor." even when it wasn't raining. Also, there were a few instances were there would be a bottle of water, or plate, or something on one of the tables in the little lobby that would rot there overnight. The worst thing though was the dirty carpets. Almost every night, there was a straw wrapper, clothing tag, napkin, or other form of small garbage on the carpet! Now, on the second day, there was a maid vacuuming each floor, but it should be done everyday! Restaurants: We either dined at on this vacation or have dined at the following restaurants: 1900 Park Fare, The Grand Floridian Cafe, Gasparilla Grill and Games, and Narcoossee's. 1900 Park Fare is a silly buffet style breakfast or dinner with characters. The Grand Floridian Cafe is good for breakfast, okay for lunch, and bad for dinner. Gasparilla's is a quick service place. In my opinion, it's the best quick service on property. And then we come to Narcoossee's... oh, I just love it there! They have excellent fish and meat selections, and it overlooks the Magic Kingdom! It's divine! Shopping: There is a Basin White store (great for little gifts for people back home, or even yourself...), Summer Lace, which is an upscale store for women, Commodore Porter's, which is an upscale store for men, M. Mouse Mercantile, which is the typical "Disneyana" store, and Sandy Cove, which has sundries. All the stores are nice, and I always like going in them. Spa: The spa was excellent! I had a 50-minute massage along with my son. The Band: The band is perhaps the main reasons that non-Guests of the Grand Floridian come to visit. They are excellent, and they play every night! Overall: The Grand Floridian is still the best, but those problems definitely need to be fixed. I really think Disney is suffering from the economy, and it is starting to show. It would be nice if they could get back on their feet and preserve one of my favorite places in the world for years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding at The Grand”
Reviews.Author: amyn1438
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights for our wedding which was at the wedding pavilion located on property. There were both pros and cons to this resort. Pros: Decor, grounds, atmosphere, pools, dinning, views. Cons: Service, rooms. We arrived and were taken to check-in, which was a nightmare. I had done online check in, but the other guests in my party had not, and it took forever (like 40 minutes), and the man who checked us in was rude. Myself and my husband got to our room and it was horrible. We figured we would have gotten an upgrade since we were getting married here, but instead were given what had to be one of the worst rooms on property. It was on the ground floor with a patio right out over the noisy pool. Unfortunately, because of the fact we booked through our wedding room block, we could not even pay for an upgrade, and we also had to switch rooms three times, including the day of the wedding. These are related to problems withing the Disney Wedding system, not so much the Grand's fault, but the staff was not very helpful. We did get moved to a different room in the same building, which was slightly better but still not great. Our second room was on the concierge floor in the main building with an AMAZING view of the castle. If I were to stay again, I would stay on this floor. Although it was much more expensive, IMO if I'm already spending that much to stay here, I would splurge for the better room. Our third room was again just ok. We loved both pools at the resort, the one with the waterslide on the beach was nice during the day, and we liked the other pool for night swimming as hardly anyone was in it at night. The beach is very nice, the lobby beautiful. We diner at the GF Cafe and Citricos, and enjoyed both very much. I would love to stay here again, it is definitely a beautiful resort, however, I do think it is overpriced. We stayed the second half of our trip at the Wilderness Lodge, which was half and IMO almost if not just as nice. I love the Grand, and if money is no object, stay here, but I just don't know if it's worth the very expensive price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian Made Disney Magic Shine”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie D
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand Floridian and we LOVED it. We were originally going to stay at the Wilderness Lodge but it was only a few hundred more to stay at the GF, so we upgraded and it was the best decision we made for the whole trip. It is such a beautiful hotel. Excellent staff, service, cleanliness, pools, drinks, food, events, and location, location, location. It is so convenient to the parks. Can't say enough about this wonderful hotel. Rooms were clean - NO PROBLEMS whatsoever - it was a Disney dream. Cannot wait to go back. My children want to live at the hotel. LOVED it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel but the housekeeping needs to be improved.”
Reviews.Author: Wise-E
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful however I am disappointed in their housekeeping services. Due to allergies, I requested VIP cleaning. I didn't want a major overhaul just an upkeep of dusting and freshly washed bedding. When I arrived, there were cheerios on the floor. I notified a supervisor and it was promptly cleaned. However the bed skirts were dirty and even had, what appeared to be, mud spots. The bed frames and desks were dusty as well. If the housekeeping were better I would highly recommend this hotel. However, cleanliness is important to me and I would rather stay at a hotel that is cheap and clean than a place that is over priced and the housekeeping is poor.

Reviews.Title: “GF is our preference while staying inside the park.”
Reviews.Author: KESinNJ
Reviews.Content: Have been to Disney fifteen times in the past ten years, generally stay inside the park for accommodations and usually at one of the Luxery accommodations (e.g., GF, Polynesian, Contemporary, Yacht & Beach Club). Generally accommodations are very good, first time we stayed in club rooms (Sugerloaf building). With two growing children (13 & 16) who grew up on Disney vacations, we did enjoy having food and drinks whenever (generally from 7 am until 10 pm). If you work your agenda right, you could limit the outside meals and have breakfast, snacks and occassional lunch/dinners it really is cost efficient. The only complaint I have on the trip is if you stay for a week or more there are few places to wash/dry clothes - literally one washer/dryer for two full buildings. While we are positive on GF over all others we have stayed at, you really need to consider the cost versus off property accommodations. Other than the "park experience" and convenience of monorails, unless you have small children (< 5 years), I beleive you get way better value outside the park and a lot more room/comfort and extras. We still lean towards staying inside, but as the kids get older we find less reason to pay such a premium for hotels that would be considered good (not great) relative to off site accommodations. Lastly, if you want a decent meal inside the parks consider Liberty Tavern in MK, home cooked food and a calming environment in the midst of all of the crowds!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort if you like Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: kathyboa2
Reviews.Content: We travel to Disney at least once a year and stay on site. This past March my husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian, primarily because I was presenting at a conference being held there. We were offered a conference rate and stayed 10 days. Our room overlooked the water and we could see the fireworks at Magic Kingdom every night. The downside was is that this resort didn't have great access to all of the parks and the monorail is overrated(broke down regularly). The only way to our favorite park -Epcot was by monorail. The parking can be free but it's awful- long walk. I prefer Animal Kingdom Kidani Village and/or Saratoga Springs-better value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Club level is the best”
Reviews.Author: BuySellAZHome
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to have planned the trip early when they were having specials. Booked Club level room in the outer building. Was the best for the family. The location you can not beat close to everything. Short walk to the lake, main lobby, and right in front of the pool. Loved staying there because you did not have to rent a car to get around. The Buses took you where you needed to go or the monarail. Club level was so nice to have. Just love not having to figure out where to have breakfast book reservations, wait to be seated, wait to be servered, then wait for the chk. Club level you just go get something from the Buffet sit eat and get on your way. It is definitely worth the extra dollars for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Gracious and Grand”
Reviews.Author: WIsil
Reviews.Content: One of our favorite hotels on Disney property. Probably considered their grandest hotel, it is modeled after the original Breakers hotel in Palm Beach. Rooms are very comfortable, but our favorite part is the main lobby of the hotel. Late afternoon jazz in the lobby, followed by drinks and dinner is our favorite way to spend an evening here. The Victoria and Albert restaurant is by far one of the best restaurants in the world that we have been to. Narcoossees on the water is our favorite place to eat and watch fireworks. Always enjoy spending time at this hotel. Their spa is fantastic as well, if you don't want to go into the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay”
Reviews.Author: AKGL
Reviews.Content: We decided on the GF because it was so conveniently located on the monorail, and we knew we would be making at least two trips to the parks each day. Also, the club level sounded amazing, especially since they offer a daily breakfast. We were not disappointed at all! We were met directly upon arrival and led directly to our room-which was, to our happy surprise, upgraded to a suite! The lobby is breathtakingly beautiful, and while I have read that some reviewers think it needs to be updated, I believe the part of the charm of the Floridian is its "old" feel. I didn't notice anything looking shabby or worn. Our rooms were fabulous and very clean and comfortable. We had a beautiful view of the bay, beach and the pool. Each staff member I met was very nice and accommodating. We have small children (ages 2 and 4) and many staff members went out of their way to talk to them and help with whatever we needed. The club level access was the icing on the cake. At any time, we could go get a drink or yummy snack and they set out a nice assortment at breakfast, as well as happy hour and appetizers. The club level staff was awesome as well-very willing to help with anything we needed. I LOVED the live music in the lobby each day, it really adds to the atmosphere. This was my first stay at Disney, and I have to say that the hotel was one of my favorite parts. I am somewhat shocked at some of the negative reviews, because we didn't experience any rude (or even indifferent) staff.

Reviews.Title: “GRAND IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: disneydiva42
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here the 2nd week of june. we were lucky enough to stay in the main building. it was awesome. we were celebrating our 4th anniversary and were treated like royalty by everyone. we had a room on the 3rd floor with a perfect view of cinderella's castle. we watched the fireworks from our balcony while having a glass of wine and a beer from the royal palm club level lounge. we also received champagne with a rose and a signed card from mickey and minnie. it was a wonderful surprise. as for our room it was clean and neat and mousekeeping was spot on everyday. we only had and issue with the loud toilets. disney should really work on this. but it did not spoil our vacation. the club level cast members were friendly, helpful, and attentive in every way possible. the ground were beautifully groomed and the resort had many quiet places to relax and unwind after a long hot day at the park. on our last day we had an anniversary massage at the spa on site. it was out of this world. we are frequent visitors of disney and and have no kids, we are the big kids. this resort was not stuffy as others have stated, and kids are welcome as at all disney resorts. we are a military family and are glad disney is generous with its military discounts. we would not be able to afford the luxury of the main building without this. thanks disney.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Disney experience!”
Reviews.Author: pdxfamily3
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Disney World but our first time at the Grand Floridian. The Grand Floridian exceeded our expectations in every way! The room was spacious and beautiful as was the rest of the hotel. We splurged on a Magic Kingdom view and had the pleasure of watching the nightly fireworks from our room. We stayed on the concierge level (this is another little splurge that was well worth it to us!). One of the wonderful features of the Grand Floridian is the close proximity to the Magic Kingdom. Just hop on the Monorail or boat and you are there in 5 minutes! We dined at Citricos for my husband's birthday...they went above and beyond to make his night special. The Grand Floridian is also home to 1900 Park Fare which has a wonderful character dinner (not to be missed!). Fabulous pools and wonderful lobby with ongoing musical entertainment. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but not sure it is worth the price”
Reviews.Author: staceye2003
Reviews.Content: The hotel grounds and lobby are beautiful, grand and look like everything you would expect from a 4 or 5 star property. There is nothing Disney about the hotel and you don't feel like you are even at Disney, which is up to you to decide if you like. However, the rooms are not what you would expect, are not luxurious by any means and certainly not 4 star. Our room and bathroom were clean and functional yet basic and while I do not have any major complaints, next time I go to Disney, I will not stay here. We did had the convenience of being on the monorail with close proximity to Magic Kingdom, seeing the fireworks from the lagoon area of the hotel and enjoying a beautiful pool area, however, the high expense is not justified. We also ate dinner at 1900 park fare's buffet in the hotel b/c our daughter loves Cinderella and all things princess- the food was mostly greasy and fried as it is everywhere in Disney and although it bothered us to pay 40ish$ per person for the buffet salad, the experience for my daughter was incredible.

Reviews.Title: “We Felt Like Royalty for Six Days”
Reviews.Author: Dale2011
Reviews.Content: My dear friend and I were celebrating a return to Disney World after 39 years. We went to Disney World and stayed at the Contemporary Resort back then in 1972 when we were 18 years old. We always said that on the 40th anniversary of Walt Disney World, we wanted to return,celebrate, and stay at the Grand Floridian. Well, celebrate we did!! The rooms were wonderful. We expected our luggage to arrive about 3 hrs. after we did on the Magical Express, but when we entered our room, our luggage was there. It beat us to the room. Now that's magical!!!! We had a lagoon view room and enjoyed seeing the light displays on the water each night. We were there for 5 luxurious nights. The beds and pillows were fantastic and each night our beds were turned down, and we received chocolates on our pillows. Everyone was very nice and so helpful. They greeted us each morning and evening. We also got a snack at night at the resort and sat outside and watched the beautiful fireworks, and the lights of Cinderella's Castle in the background. We certainly did feel like we were in a magical place and we were. We enjoyed sitting in the grand lobby and listening to the beautiful music. The shops were nice and the transportation was very convenient. We were picked up from the airport by the Magical Express, and never had to worry about transportation. We went to all four parks during our stay. After a long, hot, tiring day, we had a luxiurious place to return to for a relaxing night's sleep. We drove one of the little boats in the lagoon on our last night and oh what fun! The only thing that we found wrong with the resort was the voicemail that we received the night before we left. They told us what time to be downstairs for the return trip to the airport to catch the Magical Express. We knew that when we arrived home, our beds would no longer be turned down and chocolates would not magically appear on our pillows. How sad it is when a gorgeous resort says that you must leave and return to reality.(Ha...Ha...) We plan to return to the Grand Floridian again next summer for a magical, fun-filled, relaxing vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to play as adults”
Reviews.Author: dogwoodlady
Reviews.Content: This is only our second time to Disney in 12 years. The last time we had 6 and 8 year olds in tow. This was teens and adults and it turned out to be great giggling fun. Our stay at the Grand Floridian was awesome. I cannot say enough about the staff's attitude and responsiveness. Everything from the first person greeting us at check in to the valets holding our luggage on check-out day was first rate. We stayed in club rooms in the Main building and were very content. Our balcony had a view of the Magic Kingdom and fireworks at night. We ate at Citricos and in the Grand Cafe and enjoyed the meals we had there. We had a traveling companion not actually make the trip due to a death in the family and the staff at Disney really went to great lengths to refund as much of her travel package as they reasonably could. We had gone through an outside agent and did not have travel insurance but even so, we recovered about half of her total package. Awesome! The only criticisms I have of this wonderful hotel pertain to the pool bar and the spa. The staff at the bar did not make it clear to us that this area does not participate in the Disney Dining Plan. So we had to pay for our snacks when the check came....maybe a small thing but an annoyance and why would snacks be covered on the hotel property in the take-out cafe but not at their pool bar?? Makes no sense to me. The spa we used on check-out day to shower and change before airport departure. This spa is dark and in need of updating. There are not many amenities and poor lighting for make-up, no counter space, etc. I've been in much better digs than this. There's great potential here but this facility needs a facelift. The white sand beach is lovely to look at BUT you are not allowed to swim in the lagoon water or even go in....so who wants to bake on the sand when there's no way to cool off except to shower and head to the pool? Yes we would go back to this hotel and would recommend it to friends. The location can't be beat if you're doing Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Having the Right Expectations Helps”
Reviews.Author: Chicagolikes2travel
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian many times thru the years and twice this spring. Much of what has been written in these reviews is spot on (both good and bad). It is in our opinion, the nicest of the Disney properties and enjoys an extremely convenient location to the Magic Kingdom. We have twins --double stroller age children. There isn't a more convenient place to stay -- you can roll the stroller onto the monerail and/or ride the boat back. We stayed at the Animal Kingdom Lodge earlier this year and while it is a nice property, my husband vowed never again to stay there until we move out of the strolller age -- it was too much of a hassle with the bus. There is plenty to do -- the pools are great and the kids love the beach. The restaurants are excellent -- we have tried them all. They are a nice alternative for dinner before the parades/fireworks. In terms of expectations, it is expensive and like others, we have stayed many other places at a similar price point that are nicer. The rooms are a little dated, but they are very clean. Service is generally good given the volume of people they move thru the place, but there are a few hiccups you wouldn't expect for the price. All in all, we very much enjoy staying here and if they could improve the consistency of service a tad, would give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Still the Best”
Reviews.Author: FPodesta
Reviews.Content: Disney has thrown up a number of new hotels lately. None compare. The Grand is a beautiful and luxurious masterpiece. It is an improvement on the Hotel del Coronado, upon which its design is based. The restaurants are without compare. The golf courses are spectacular. The rooms are large (despite the legend that they are small) and well appointed. The service is spectacular.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Stay and Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Lunnpolylil
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for two nights as part of a two holiday to Florida. we stayed here to celebrate our 13th Wedding Anniversary and OMG was it worth it!! Upon arrival we were greeted in the car-park by a young lady asking if we were checking in. We said yes, she took our name and said I can assist you with that and told us we had been selected for a free upgrade (WE DID NOT MENTION OUR ANNIVERSARY) to a suite. It was amazing and a total surprise. The rooms were large spacious and very welcoming. We had two seperate bathrooms a large living area and a large bedroom with queen size beds. A small balcony that looked out onto the 24hr pool. We also had access to the free consierge level and did not have to pay for food or drink either. I did cry a little as this type of thing never happens to us. The hotel is very grand and perfectly Disney-fied we loved it. It is pricey but we olny used this for a two days treat, we would not anticipate staying longer as hotels are usually just a comfy base for a holiday. Thank you so much Disney for a trully wonderful stay. PERFECT x we were really sad to leave and perhaps another anniversary will be spent here!!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Disney property!”
Reviews.Author: Blondechick32
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at The Grand Floridian from May 28-May 31. This was our first time to take our son (age 6) to the Magic Kingdom, and we wanted to experience a Disney deluxe resort. First off, I have to say that this resort is beautiful! Everything from the service to the grounds at this resort were incredible. Positives: Pool games at the smaller pool closest to the beach. My child LOVED this! In fact, he didn't want to leave the pool one afternoon to get ready to head to EPCOT. The staff did a wonderful job of entertaining the children and even had prizes for the winners! They played bingo, limbo, sang YMCA and several other games. More positives: Short boat ride to Magic Kingdom. Watching fireworks from the Magic Kingdom from the resort. Boat and watercraft rentals, which we took advantage of and loved it! 24 hr. counter service to grab a fast bite. Concierge service was very helpful and even secured dinner at Le Cellier--you must dine at this restaurant at EPCOT in Canada if you ever get a chance. Incredible steakhouse! with superb drinks/desserts!! Everything was divine. Our concierge told us it's very difficult to get in there. We lucked out on someone's cancellation! A few minor snafus: Upon check-in, I did request a microwave and didn't receive one. I called to inquire about this the next day,and it was promptly delivered. Our shower didn't drain very well, either. Those are the only real minor complaints that I could see, and to me these were not really that big of a deal. It certainly didn't affect our trip in any way. Unfortunately since we were there for such a short stay we didn't get a chance to dine at Narcoossee's, 1900 Park Fare or Victoria & Albert's. We did have dinner one night at The Grand Floridian Cafe, and it was average. Not a horrible meal, but nothing spectacular either. We did enjoy their sampler platter for dessert. It had a chocolate Mickey on it, which was a cute surprise, My son thought that was neat! Overall, I loved this resort and would definitely return in a heartbeat. Probably the only huge drawback to this resort is the price. I think it's a little too expensive, but it's right next door to the Magic Kingdom, and you know what they say.....location, location, location!!

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Yorkshire Dales National Park, United Kingdom
Reviews.Title: “Perfect family holiday!”
Reviews.Author: Cusick
Reviews.Content: Our second trip to Disney but first staying on resort. If you want a luxurious, relaxing yet fun filled holiday, the Grand Floridan is a must! It has great service, great food and our magic kingdom view room was very clean, comfortable and had plenty of room for 2 adults and 3 kids( ages 3-7 years). The transport to and from the airport and all the disney parks was quick and hassle free, although we did take a cab a couple of times late at night, you really don't need a car. The food was much much better than I expected although the kids choices were sometimes limited. We had a deluxe dining plan and had over 50 meals and 30 snacks left and we did eat loads and loads!! I would just get the basic plan next time. The kids went to the Mouseketeer club a couple of nights so we could go out. They loved it (playstation all evening!!) but the staff were probably the only miserable faces I saw in the whole 2 weeks in the whole of Disney world. It was worth every penny of the extra cost to stay there as this was the best family holiday we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Greatest Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Familylover1212
Reviews.Content: Me, My mother, my nephew,a nd my daughter stayed at the Grand Floridian for 5 days. I say it was excellent we were at the Magic Kingdom and five minutes(monorail) and came back in ten(boat). the rooms were clean, decorated, and nice. Service was great. I say this hotel is great, and well worth $400.I say my daughter and nephew had a great time, they acted like their were siblings instead of fighting with each other. I have been to the Animal Kingdom Lodge, Saratoga Springs, But out of the 3 deluxe resorts the Grand Floridian was the best!!

Reviews.Title: “Was it perfect? No. Was it amazing? Yes!”
Reviews.Author: cindieloohoo
Reviews.Content: My 5 year old and I returned from a stay at the Grand Floridian yesterday. We booked and stayed in an outer building Theme Park view room. We were in Sago Cay, room 5139. Our room was a corner room with 2 full patios. What a nice surprise that was! We had a beautiful view of the Seven Seas Lagoon and of the fireworks at night. Okay, so the room was not like new nor did I expect it to be. It was clean, tastefully decorated, large and the beds were very comfortable. There was an issue with the satellite so some of the TV stations did not work. The internet was out for about a day. There were other small issues, but they were just that, small. I don't look for perfection when traveling to Disney. I look for fun and relaxation and that is just what we got. The resort is lovely, the pools are refreshing, the food is good and the service is adequate. The guests were friendly and of all sorts. You had upper class and you had familes that had saved money for a long time.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: Depplep
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian as a guest of my mother who was attending a conference. I spent 2 days at the hotel and I have to say for the $400 plus per night that they are charging it should be illegal. The hotel is clean but to me seemed very outdated. I know this is Disney but kids were running and screaming throughout the property at all hours from the hotel lobby to the restaurants, bar none. I encountered indifferent bar staff who not only couldn't be bothered to get my drink but had no interest in answering my question as to how often the boat ran over to the Polynesian, which by the way is even MORE outdated. There was a problem with our hotel bill which when the night desk manager Carol had to get involved acted as though we were inconveniencing her by asking for help. The grounds are very well kept and the ROH room was big, but at $7 for a beer and unfriendly staff, I would not choose this hotel if it were for my leisure vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel was very nice,cast members were great”
Reviews.Author: binky149
Reviews.Content: The employees at the Grand Floridian were just great. The room was clean and in good repair. We were put in a 4th floor room overlooking the lake and the view was wonderful. The hotel is very quiet at night and sleep was undisturbed. Our only complaint is the Grand Floridian Cafe. The decor was nice and we anticipated a nice lunch on our first day. We ordered chicken noodle soup and strawberry salad. We were having an early lunch and the restaurant was not crowded. We waited 20 minutes before our lunch was served. I took one look at my chicken noodle soup and knew immediately what it was. Our grandkids like canned progresso chicken soup for lunch at home and this was exactly what I was served. I tasted it to make sure and it was indeed canned soup. The strawberry salad was sour and inedible. We did not return to that restaurant. Some of the food at WWW was ok but most was less then stellar. We ended up going off site for most of our meals. We had a nice time but for the price we paid, canned soup, come on!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Perfection!”
Reviews.Author: Hicks23
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Grand, and oh boy, it was just spectacular! We were in the Big Pine Key building in a dormer room overlooking the pool. What a beautiful view. Took a picture and keep it on my cell as a reminder. You can definitely see the Wishes fireworks right from the balcony. My 15 year old boy was thrilled. I chose to listen to the Grand Floridian Orchestra in the lobby with a glass of wine. My husband was with a convention group at Epcot and had a blast! In addition, you can hear the train whistle when the rope drops at MK every morning! The pool was warm and you could swim in the evening after a long day of walking. Even the ducks joined us. Ping pong at the pool was fun too. Service is exceptional and everyone there says "Yes." Boy could I get used to that real easy! Really nice being on a monorail! They even have a covered waiting area with seats while waiting for the buses. Really nice walk over to the Poly as well. Only drawback that I could see was the price. We were soooo fortunate to get a convention rate in February. We wouldn't be able to do it otherwise with kids in college. It was truly a magical treat and I hope everyone has a chance to try it once. Thanks for the great experience, Disney. Just Wow!

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travisanti
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked up to the resort we were treated like royalty. We were celebrating my moms 91st birthday. They upgraded us to a deluxe room in the main building at the Royal Palm Club. All I can say is WOW! Our room was immaculate, our housekeeper Samung was amazing. Brent who brought our luggage was incredible. He made sure we understood everything before he left so nothing was foreign to us. Richard greeted us as we walked in. He is a greeter that has been here a long time. We were chosen as the family of the day and had our picture taken. Shortly after they came up and gave us an 8 by 10 copy of the picture in a frame. Our room overlooked the theme pool and lagoon. We could see Epcot in the distance and could see illuminations. They have a boat parade in the lagoon at night that lights up and has music. The food in the concierge area was excellent. All of the concierge employees were so pleasant. Taking the monorail to the Magic Kingdom was so convenient. I honestly have not one complaint. I would give it ten stars if I could. This is my new favorite resort at Disney and will be glad to return!

Reviews.Title: “Disney Magic At it's BEST!”
Reviews.Author: kenzielou1
Reviews.Content: We have been to Disney World 7 times the last 7 years. We have had the pleasure of staying at 3 of the resorts in the deluxe catergory...Grand Floridian, Animal Kingdom Lodge and Polynesian. The Grand is our favorite. The location cannot be beat. We love the ease of the monorail and the layout of the resort. Staying in the Main Building, Royal Club Level is the way to go if you can swing it. We book our trips with Kelly Russo at Travel with the Magic. If you are planning a trip to Disney World she is a gem to work with. Trust me. If there are discounts she will find them and apply them to your reservation. She will schedule your dining as well. Working with her is just nice way to start your trip. This trip to the Grand Floridian we were blessed with some Disney Magic! We were upgraded to the Grand Suite!! I consider this to be one notch down from getting to stay in the castle! It has a paino (which we were told Elton John has played) and Princess Di stayed in during her visit to Magic Kingdom. It was lovely. It has a view of the castle, and we were able to watch the fireworks from our balcony at night! There are flatscreen tvs throughout and 5 balconies! I think I enjoyed staying in our room more than going to the parks! I have to say we were treated just as well as when we have stayed in other catergory rooms at the Grand Floridian. The staff, we have found, has always been very helpful. The concierge in the main building club level is first class. Overall this is our favorite Disney World resort on property. Our kids love it too!! Great pool, great location, plus monorail and boat access to the Magic Kingdom. I have to give it 5 stars because we keep coming back!

Reviews.Title: “Still a GRAND place to stay - with a few service hiccups”
Reviews.Author: Mouseturtle
Reviews.Content: First let me say this will be an overall POSITIVE review. The Grand Floridian will be the ONLY place I stay when visiting Disney. This was my 3rd visit. It is a visually stunning property, the rooms are light, airy & clean and the location on the monorail is so convenient.. They just need to "connect the dots" a little better when it comes to providing truly Outstanding Service the first time. My examples of this follow. We stayed in Sugar Loaf, the outer concierge building. We arrived early and were greeting by Nadia who took us to a changing room, gave us our keys/park passes and explained we would receive a text when our room was ready (I love that). I asked if they were able to honor my request to face the pool and she said "Yes, you are facing the pool." We spent the day at the parks and received a text message a few hours later with our room number. Our luggage was waiting for us in the room thanks the to Magical Express Service (love that!) but I was really disappointed in the room location. They gave us 6328, the last room at the end of the hall, and it had a view of two large trees facing the very end of the courtyard where the pool was, but it was not a pool view. As a matter of fact, I really couldn't see anything but tree branches. Also, the room was smaller and had a dormer ceiling and a smaller, enclosed balcony. I called the front desk to see if it was possible to move (and let me say the I DO understand a request is a request, as I work for a hotel here in PA) and I was told there was nothing available poolside but I could get a marina view. I hate the marina view because of the noise from the boats. They said they would call me back in 5 minutes. After 10 minutes I called and spoke with someone else who said THEY would help me and call back in 5 minutes, but 5 minutes later the original cast member (Chris) called me and said the marina view would not be ready for a few hours. I again pressed for a pool view and after several minutes was told I could get one the NEXT day - voila! Problem solved! I told him I would take it. Just wish that was offered initially - when we did get our new room my son actually said "Wow, this is perfect" - it was smack in the middle of the building with a perfect pool view. Room 6216. Full balcony, sleeper sofa, larger room, perfect pool view. Satisfied customer. Just took some persistence on my part. Minor issues: The monorail was down our 2nd day and we were told we could take a bus to Epcot. SO we went to the room to change and hang out for a few hours and when we came back down we asked if they were working. The cast members in the lobby said not yet. So when we got to the bus stop the driver said they WERE working and had been for over an hour. Bad communication. The movies on the beach were changed to movies by the pool which was kind of a bummer because I like the marshmallows by the campfire - but they had a huge event tent set up on the beach so that wasn't available. It was nice - but the Cast Member did a "trivia" Q&A before the movie - we had not yet seen 'Tangled' and it pretty much gave away the whole movie. Maybe they should do that AFTER the movie...? Especially if it is fairly new...? I received a package from work and when I called to retrieve it I was told there was a $3.00 "handling fee" - huh? For GETTING a package I didn't expect? I asked what that was for and he kept saying "handling fee" and I said I didn't think it was right to charge me for getting a package (it was a gift from my coworkers!) and he said " I will waive it this time but normally we charge." As a hotel manager I NEVER surprise my Guests with hidden fees and I just thought this was shady. I am staying the the premier resort at Disney! Don't charge Guests for packages please! We slept in one day until 1130 and arrived at the Grand Floridian Cafe at noon. I asked if I could still get breakfast and was told "No I'm sorry it's lunch." I asked politely if there was any way to just get some eggs or something and Loren said "No we normally have a limited menu until noon but we can only do lunch." I said "Are you sure?" (because I just didn't believe it) and she got the manager Lindsay - a smiling woman who accommodated me right away and allowed me to order off of the limited menu. On my way out I told Loren to never tell a Guest no until she was sure and her response was "I hope you come to see us again." It was kind of not-polished service and they would have lost my $53 sale if I hadn't persisted. My son was getting eaten alive by mosquitoes. I had seen some Off in the gift shop but when I went to get it, it was gone. SO I asked the concierge at Sugar Loaf if he knew where I could get some. He called over to the Polynesian, they said they had it, and he asked them to hold it for me. Well, it was 820 pm and I wanted to catch the 9pm pool movie, so I waited for the boat to the Poly, ran up the steps and no one at their gift shop knew what I was talking about - as a matter of fact, they said they sold the last can last night. I told them my concierge had just talked to someone and they spent 5 minutes trying to figure our who that was to place the blame. I really didn't care and they were not concerned about fixing my problem so I left, and by the time I got back I was in tears from frustration and spoke to my concierge Kent who was very upset he was misinformed. He then came out to me while I was at the movies and said the manager was going to get me a can of bug spray for all the trouble and have it delivered to my room. Now wow, that is outstanding service, right? After the movie I got a knock on the door with two cans of bug spray. Although I had an initial problem I was glad they made it right. It's a shame they don't have better communication between resorts. When I got my bill at checkout there was a "Paid Out" amount of $10.45 that I didn't recognize. When I called the front desk and questioned the charge, they said it said "Guest requested bug spray." Oh no they did not! I told her I did not realize I would be charged for that and explained the situation and then they talked to Chris who said it would be taken off. Which was fine, and it fixed the problem - but again, they need to have the foresight to provide the "extra service" at the first opportunity. OK so perhaps this review sounded negative, but I am sure you can identify the "service opportunities" here. All in all, my stay was great, and I am coming back again in November, because I just love this place and how it makes me feel. It's early in the season and I hope they can tighten and polish their service a bit, it would truly make this the shining example of hospitality that Disney is known for. The bell staff is phenomenal and never took more than 5 minutes to get to the room. The turn-down service at night is a nice touch and the snacks throughout the day in the concierge building are an added plus. There are also movie rentals available for the DVD's in the room - they have a nice selection of 100's of Disney titles. I did visit the spa which was the best part of my trip. The waiting area got a bit crowded but it was FANTASTIC and I had the best massage of my life (note" the essential oils they let you smell are a $15 upgrade) I saw a sign at their desk noting them as one of the top 25 spas in the U.S. Well deserved. Their pool is huge and never seems crowded, and I love the quick service meals at Gasparilla's. The Basin White gift shop is AWESOME and I love the smell of the place, there are fresh flowers everywhere, and I have never had trouble with housekeeping. My favorite quote at work is "Excellence is in the details." - If they get the details down pat this resort will be even better.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: Alicnwondrln
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand in April and it was lovely. There is nothing like staying in the main building at the Grand. I was able to secure a great discount on my room thanks to Kelly and Channing at Travel with the Magic, they really know everything about the Grand, check out www.wherethemagiclives.com if you want to learn about the Grand. The staff is awesome here they really go out of there way to make your stay special. The room was clean and had an amazing view of the castle at the Magic Kingdom, it was spectacular at night. The food offerings in the main building were good and we had room service one night and it was very good.

Reviews.Title: “Noro Virus alive and well in this Hotel......”
Reviews.Author: Kiwiholidays
Reviews.Content: Day three I awoke at four in the morning with that all downhill feeling of stomach cramps and the inevitable session of vomiting that I knew would all be here all to soon. Just 48 hours earlier on our check in we were led in to a vomit infested room and the aroma that hangs around post cleaning. The stench was overpowering and brought my my wife to dry reach. Obviously we insisted on another room and one was quickly organised however in hindsight now the fact that we touched and were subjected to the room may of also heightened our exposure to the Virus. As I lay over the toilet bowl for the next few hours playing tag with my six year old son who was in a similar state in was decided by my wife that i should take possession of the bath instead. This is were we both stayed for the next four hours with only a fleeting glance over my shoulder every so often to ensure my Son was doing as well as he could. As he held back his tears after my response to his question about "can we still see Micky Mouse today" when I said probably not. To hear he little voice crying in between the sounds of his vomiting added another unwanted dimension to the "place were dreams come true'. Wow what a Christmas break this was turning out to be be, having travelled almost solid from Auckland New Zealand, direct to Orlando for over 18 hours this was one of those holidays you may see of a Television Documentary but never think it will happen to you. We spent the rest of the day being Ambulanced to the hospital were drips fluids and medications was administered. After contacting the Disney crew the following day I was met with surprise and amazement that I and my young son had been ill. I reflect on Watergate and the then denials by president Nixon well Disney has nothing on him. Front desk through to supervisors did little apart from apologize for my situation, they denied their had been any issues with the property, nor did they acknowledge that on check in I had been led into a room infested and cleaned with a lingering smell and aroma of Vomit. They offered to refund my unused meal vouchers and the unused park vouchers, after some debate but fell far short of offering any type of service recovery in any way or form. The fact I reside in New Zealand and the subsequent cost to get to the US one woul;d of hoped that the Disney machine may of at least offered some degree of park access and or accommodation to be used at some time int he future. I was bed ridden for the balance of my stay at bot this property and the next property for some days prior to returning home. Disney it is sad you wont return phone call you wont even acknowledge your own in house issues but what really gets me is you let down my now seven year old son who still hasn't met Mickey and doesn't understand why it isn't that easy to get back to the US. I hope someone can forward this to somebody who cares at Disney to ensure that when and if a situation like this happens again a more positive outcome can be gained for all interested parties. Disney shame on you, you DO NOT represent what I have to come to expect of tourist operators within the United States or of business within the US. A sad and disappointed traveller with a sad and disappointed seven year old boy

Reviews.Title: “Long time visitors, Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: avamania
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at Disney’s Grand Floridian Resort & Spa – and probably the most disappointing. From check-in, to not cleaned rooms, to following up on reservations, there were a lot of misfires. As we checked in, I asked for a room not near an elevator. The cast member at the front desk gruffly said our room was indeed near an elevator – and that’s there’s nothing they could do because the resort was booked to capacity. That seemed like an excuse. They could get away with that level of service because they had plenty of customers. The cleaning staff was very friendly and polite, but understaffed. Many times, they couldn’t get around to cleaning our room. They were embarrassed they couldn’t get to it. Not their fault – they just needed more help, so I don’t blame them. The resort was packed. However, the college students they hired for the boat and pool area were absolutely unprofessional and inattentive. Our level of poor resort customer service wasn’t universal. Pete, the bartender at the Floridian pools was wonderful and gregarious. The same could also be said about our pontoon boat driver. It was 50/50 – half of the people we met were great. We had an amazing contact at Guest Services, but trying to get in contact with Disney PR, or the hotel, to discuss other ideas to explore on our trip – was virtually impossible. They didn’t respond. Listen, Grand Floridian is the best resort to stay at on the Disney property. Being close to the monorail, to the beautiful grounds, it is a magic place. However, if you’re like us, travelers to the Four Seasons and Ritz—you will be disappointed with the tiny rooms and lack of customer service. As mentioned, our past experiences were much different. We remember being greeted by name before check-in, and the friendly, helpful faces. As mentioned, I noticed a trend on this visit – some cast members are just not the right fit for the hospitality industry. I think Disney is making some hiring misfires.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for our 1st visit to the Magic Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: TheRelaxationClinic
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week long stay at the Grand Floridian, and had a lovely time. We already realised we were paying top dollar for the convenience of the hotel to the parks. Slightly disappointed that the room had two beds close together so had to creep out to the balcony to chat with a glass of wine so we didn't wake the kids. Surprised that Disney isn't more kid-friendly in terms of the room layout but I was told the rooms are all the same. Are the other resorts like this? However enjoyed our lagoon view. Yes the decor is a bit twee but it is Disney! The staff were great, couldn't be more helpful. We used the Mouseketeers Club for child minding in the evening a couple of times and the girls really enjoyed it. Pretty good value for the 2 of them with dinner thrown in and flexible hours too. The bar was good, nice staff, and drinks weren't as expensive as we thought they would be. I read the review recently about non-guests using the pool. The management seem to be on to that already as we were given coloured bands to wear round the pool. Our girls spent a lot of time in the kiddies pool, perfect size for them. All in all, we would be back, even with a little niggle about room layout, it was a great fit for us.

Reviews.Title: “Tired, overpriced. Great potential but.....”
Reviews.Author: pinkrules123
Reviews.Content: WOW Such beauty from the outside - Such a disappointment from inside! This Grand Dame needs a FACELIFT - PLEASE! Top dollar gives you great service and location but nothing can disguise the dowdiness of this hotels interior. The pools and gardens are great however and the breakfasts are divine! And of course entrance to the parks could not be simpler. Keep an eye on this hotel. I have it on good authority that renovations are in the works but until they are completed I will not be spending my hard-earned cash on THIS particular Disney Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed -- it needs updating and housekeeping is lax”
Reviews.Author: 1veritas
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the club/ concierge level as we always have. However, this time was a disappointment. We had two rooms and while one was clean, the other was not! The carpet was obviously not vacuumed, as there were crumbs and even a doll's tiny shoe found on the floor. Hair was found on the sheets, and some table surfaces were dusty and/or sticky. Additionally, both rooms were beginning to look a little worn. I heard from a staff member that the hotel has continued to enjoy high occupancy rates despite the high cost, so unfortunately, this does not give them much incentive to change their deficiencies. The concierge area where they keep a selection of foods throughout the day was amazing and very clean. The lobby is also gorgeous - but they've done that at the expense of your actual room.

Reviews.Title: “Top of the Line - Treat Yourself”
Reviews.Author: MommyLinda
Reviews.Content: There is nothing like staying on the monorail line at Disneyworld. The Grand Floridian, while pricey is the best. Sit in the lobby at night and listen to the music! If you get one annual pass, you almost get half off the room. Well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Check your Credit Card after you check out - In-room Internet never worked.”
Reviews.Author: TexasTwin
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Grand Floridian for a conference. While many aspects of my stay were great (smooth check-in, very clean lobby and rooms), I felt that I had been duped after my departure. Upon check-in, I inquired about a late check-out on the day of our depature to due an evening flight. I was told to inquire again the night before departure to see if it was possible. As instructed, I asked the front desk clerk the night before check-out. We were told we could check-out at 1:30 with no additional fee, but any time after that would incure a $195 charge. We checked out the next day at 1:25PM. Thankfully I saved my statement, which showed a ZERO balance, and time-stamped at 1:25 PM. I just happened to look at my credit card statement a week later, and saw a charge of $195 from Walt Disney Resorts. I called and they told me I'd been charged for a late check-out. They removed the charge after I disputed it. The communication from Disney regarding my reservation was excellent, with the exception of this fee. I feel they make the late check-out charge and hope that guests don't notice it on the credit card bill. The hotel is lovely but much smaller than the photos lead you to believe. There is not much to do here. The bar above the lobby is nice, they serve great wine. They need to have better coffee available for this level of hotel. The food is very expensive, as are the spa treatments. If I can to Orlando to go to Disney, I'd stay somewhere less expensive and easier to access. If I came to Orlando for a Spa Vacation, I'd look for another resort.

Reviews.Title: “The place to be for first time to Magic Kingdom with little ones.”
Reviews.Author: Travelbug0008
Reviews.Content: Ok, so we had a last minute opportunity to head to Disney to take my niece and daughter to the Magic Kingdom for their first visit-they are 5 and 4. Grand Floridian is pricey this time of year but could not have been more relaxing or convenient. We arrived to have the girls greeted with flowers and welcomed as "princesses". The bell hops were great tour guides and we got to our room super fast to get th girls to the pool after 9 hours in the car. Poolwas great for kids and adults-margaritas for me and sis, great fun for the girls at the pool. Character breakfast on site-so much fun, and all dining was kid friendly. We took monarail to Magic kingdom and boat back home--ultra convenient, and we could see the castle from outside our hotel room--awesome. GF is so close but so relaxing to come home to. Rooms are very nice-not lux, lux, but you definately feel special here and staff is such fun. No bedbugs, very clean-I read the other reviews but that was not my experience. My advice, look to come when rates are lower, but definately worth the price. Great time-we'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jamesadventurers
Reviews.Content: We escaped from the embassy suites international drive to here for two nights. It was expensive, but we paid rack rate and booked it from the car park at animal kingdom over the phone! The room was a decent size and beautifully decorated however. Everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Was Expecting Sorry to Say”
Reviews.Author: SamanthasDad
Reviews.Content: I had heard the Grand Floridian was Disney's top of the line. As another reviewer said, if you are expecting Ritz, Four Seasons, etc. you will be disappointed. Rooms need to be redone. Peeling paint on balconies is not a luxury property. No wi-fi nor is it free. TV channels seem to be mostly ABC Disney product. My room was on the second floor facing the pool which had lots of kids in it. I do realize I was at Disney but attending a conference should have been a clue to assign a room away from the pool racket. Staff in main building was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible service for a flagship hotel”
Reviews.Author: mymickey2011
Reviews.Content: I am writing this review to express my dissatisfaction for the services we received at the Grand Floridian. We were there for a conference at another resort, but opted to stay in this flagship resort since much have been said about the magical experience here! My friend and I arrived with high expectations but was disappointed from the very beginning. The check in process took a long, long time and we waited to get to our room for several hours. Finally given our room keys, and walked all the way to our building to find out that we were not given the right room as requested. There was no explanation as to why we were not told on check in that our requested King bed wasn't available.Being tired from our early travel, we went back to the room after being assured they will move us the next day. And guess what, after coming back at the end of the next day, we were told again at the front desk that there was no available room with King bed!! It was not until we spoke with the manager that a room mysteriously is now available. GF should train their staff to cater to their clientele who chose to stay in this expensive resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Leonmew
Reviews.Content: We booked a garden view and got a park view. So nice to watch the fireworks from the room! We were in Boca Chica, and I couldn't complain at all for the room and service we got. Value is up to you, we have 2 teen girls that we let take the monorail into MK for one day so we could rest. We felt very safe with letting them run amok while we relaxed our very sore feet. I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel with Great Location”
Reviews.Author: JSScott
Reviews.Content: Last time we went to Disney, we vowed to stay here the next time we went so when they offered 40% off room rates, we booked at the Grand Floridian. We were not disappointed. We asked and got upgraded to a conceierge building. We would have skipped the Dining Plan if we would have known what great breakfast foods they had for us in the lobby. All the staff was very helpful and friendly and the location to the parks could not be beat. Hardly any waiting for buses or monorail. Only complaint was that the bathtub was slow in draining and there could have been more counter space in the bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “Another magical vacation but...”
Reviews.Author: DVC23
Reviews.Content: This Disney vacation was our second staying at the Grand Floridian. Yes, it's quite opulent but if we stay here again, we will definitely stay in the main building. We chose to stay at the Sugar Loaf building on the concierge level (where they provide food & drinks 4 times a day). It's was nice but the concierge level at the main building is so much better. There seemed to be more people at Sugar Loaf who were let in by other guests just for the food. So, there was less seating for the rest of us who actually paid to have that amenity! At the main building there is more exclusivity. You have better views of the entire hotel & also have the live orchestra during the evenings. My son totally loved watching the monorail go by while having his breakfast. Overall, we still like the hotel due to the convenience of the monorail, the pool with zero-entry & the view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks every night from our room.

Reviews.Title: “Extremely overrated!”
Reviews.Author: Yesthem
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at the Beach Club for years but wanted to change it up. From the moment we checked into the hotel, it was a disappointment. They sent my family of five to the wrong building with all our bags. Our room keys did not work at parks for ticket entry, huge nuisance. Some other guests at the resort are so snobby, everything people warned me about! Traveling with two other families, they had same issue with room, walked into someone elses suite! They were given no special service for first tome guests. The pool is very nice, service is not so great. Compared to beach club, this place doesn't do a thing for me.

Reviews.Title: “Time to Up Your Game, GF.”
Reviews.Author: kehct
Reviews.Content: The GF has a reputation for being the nicest hotel on Disney property. That may be true, but Disney's attention clearly is elsewhere these days. The rooms were decently appointed and the staff was generally friendly, but that's the bare minimum I'd expect for several hundred dollars per night. While we were at the GF we had a day of really severe storms, with hail, high winds and tornadoes in the area. At 7 am I called to the main building to ask the concierge what activities they could suggest, on or off Disney property, to keep my five-year-old busy for the day. I was told the concierge could only help me in person, and was advised to walk to the main building. I pointed out that there was thunder and lightning outside in addition to sideways rain. My plea did not move the front desk clerk to offer any alternatives. When I did make it to the main building, I asked if the hotel had any activities planned for the day. The GF has lots of games by the pools on most days, and I was hoping they were planning to move the games inside to help occupy the kids. Nope. Maybe a story hour in a lobby nook? Nope. How 'bout a screening of a Disney film? Nowhere to do it, they said. (They have two restaurants that operate for dinner only; I imagine they could push some tables aside and set up a screen for kids to watch while sitting on the floor.) What about a scavenger hunt through the main building and huge lobby? No, nothing there either. They did offer to open the Mouseketeer Club (babysitting room) so kids could do crafts and play video games. That was a nice option, but the room itself is extremely small and parents needed to stay with the kids, so the club could accommodate only a handful of kids and their parents at one time. I was profoundly disappointed not only by the staff's lack of Plan B options for severe weather days, but by their whole not-my-problem attitude. GF does bill itself as a "resort," not just a hotel, after all. Furthermore, their in-room TV options are negligible. No pay-per-view channels, no Disney movies running on a loop, nothing like that. Finally, I did a socks-and-underwear load of laundry in the coin-operated machines in our building. The washer was functional, but two dollars and 45 minutes after I put them in the dryer, my clothes weren't even close to dry. I had to take them back to my room and hang them all over the place. Some of them still weren't dry the next morning. I called a housekeeping supervisor to tell him the dryer was broken. He apologized and said he would call "engineering." I suggested that perhaps it was time to spring for a new dryer, and he laughed as if there was *no way* the hotel would do that. Clearly, I wasn't the first guest to report a problem with the laundry facilities. If you want WiFi, be prepared to pay for it. And not just once, either - if you want web access in your room and in the lobby, you have to pay two separate fees. Disney is a corporation, and that feel has really spread through all of Disney World. They don't even make a pretense anymore about trying to make you happy. They gouge guests for every last cent, and that overall attitude leaves an unpleasant taste when you've spent thousands of dollars for a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Where once upon a time happens once upon a day.”
Reviews.Author: mouseketeer11
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the comments on here I felt I needed to give people an accurate description of this beautiful hotel that makes you feel like you've stepped back in time to a more peaceful, kinder world. We've been staying at the Grand Floridian every year for the past 11 years, and I wouldn't dream of staying anywhere else. We've gotten so spoiled that in 2007 we went back for a second trip during the Christmas season and couldn't get reservations at the GF so we ended up staying at the Polynesian. The difference in service between these two resorts was so great that we don't make reservations if we can't get in at the GF. Staying at a Magic Kingdom resort has so many advantages over staying outside the parks. The early and late hours afforded to resort guests is just one. I can't express to anyone who hasn't stayed at the GF how wonderful it is to have a relaxing evening at the resort sitting out on the lawn in view of Magic Kingdom and Cinderella's castle across the water or watching fireworks at night over the castle from your balcony or the resort grounds. During the summer you can even watch movies on the beach at night. The resort is truly a vacation in itself. The spa at the resort is incredible with massages, exercise room and hot tub and sauna. We have always found the staff incredibly helpful. That's not to say that everything at Disneyworld runs smoothly 24/7. ( if you've found a place that does, let me know) I will say that anytime we have ever run into any problems, the GF staff has been quick to do whatever it took to fix the problem. I've read on here that some people think the rooms are dated...ummm, this hotel has a Victorian theme, they're SUPPOSED to be dated! The rooms are always clean! The food choices at this hotel are incredible too. We've eaten at some of the finest restaurants in the world, and I can honestly tell you that Narcoosies ranks #2 on our list, second only to a restaurant in Paris. If you're looking for a once in a lifetime experience, the food and atmosphere at Victoria and Alberts should be on your list, and don't forget Gasparillo's. Now for one of the main reasons I'm writing this review. I read an earlier one from someone from Ohio who evidently feels more comfortable outside the parks. DO YOUR HOMEWORK!!!! Disney makes it easy for you by providing all the information they can to make your stay as enjoyable and trouble free as possible. Unfortunately you will not be the only person staying at the parks and they honestly do try to make EVERYONE happy! If you intend to dine at Disneyworld, check out their food choices. They state very clearly which restaurants you may need a reservation get into, and I'm telling you from experience, if you want to SIT down and eat, it's most of them. Also, if having a cocktail or any other alcoholic beverage in the middle of the day is what you're looking for, maybe a family theme park isn't your thing. I've stayed at more expensive hotels in the country, including The Plaza in New York and the GF is my favorite. I'll end this by stating that no matter where I've been, I have never found a place where the attention to detail and customer service comes close to the level of that at the Grand Floridian or Disneyworld in general. I hope this helps anyone who is thinking of staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Stay at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: Viking78
Reviews.Content: Before I talk about my six night stay at the Grand Floridian, I want to stress that if you are a traveler that is used to the pampering at the Four Seasons, Ritz Carlton, Westin, you will find the Grand Floridian disappointing because your expectations not only will not be met, but one cannot fairly compare those three hotels with the Grand Floridian. The Grand Floridian is Disney's flagship hotel, but you are paying for the convenience of the transportation to Magic Kingdom Park and EPCOT, and seclusion from most of the Walt Disney World Resort. There are a variety of amenities offered at the Grand Floridian (television channels are limited, but you are not going to Disney World to watch TV 24/7 either), but I strongly suggest being realistic of what the Grand Floridian can provide for you. I booked my room through a package with AAA/Walt Disney Travel Company. I would strongly recommend booking your room this way than trying to do everything ala carte. You save some money in the long run, and this is the only way you can make some room requests. Although my initial room request was not initially granted (i.e., No dormer room), my family and I subtlely asked whether there was another room avaiable. After the front desk called the necessary people, we were placed in Boca Chica on the second floor, which provided an excellent view of the Contemporary and Space Mountain. There were no traces of bed bugs. Housekeeping changed the bed linens every day, and other than the usual wear and tear that you see in the hotels rooms, our room itself was very clean. The staff at the Grand Floridian was very friendly to my family and me; often going out of their way to provide insights to any questions that we might have had. After reading some negative postings, the only advice I feel I can fairly make is to encourage you to do your homework and work with a travel agent that you can trust. I would suggest pricing out your own package first on the Disney World website, and presenting your findings to a travel agent to see if you are getting the best deal. This was the approach I took, and I was very pleased with the end result. We ate at Gasparilla Grill most mornings; 1900 Park Fare for the Character Dinner on our final night and Grand Floridian Cafe on our final morning for breakfast. The food was very good. Be prepared for high food prices across the Walt Disney World resort. Disney's Dining Plan might be a worthwhile option, or there are a couple grocery stores in the area if you want to plan ahead that way. The only minor issue was the availability of the Monorail...especially to EPCOT. The monorail itself was efficient, but the waits were longer than usual. Bus service can be hit and miss, which depends on the timing on the day. In both cases, patience and flexibility are good attributes to have. I would return to the Grand Floridian in a minute. Just do your homework to find a reasonable deal.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT??? $700 for one night?? for what???”
Reviews.Author: travelmom803
Reviews.Content: Well...we have stayed at this property several times before - we always stay at one of the 'concierge' buildings - conch key i think it was this time. we checked it at the required time - 3 pm - and NO restaurants were open to have a quick lunch. Now, I don't mean a 'grab and go' lunch at the self serve restaurant on property, i mean a proper - sit down have a glass of wine before you head into the madness of the magic kingdom lunch - NOPE - no restaurant is open for that! SO we went to the pool, they had prepackaged sandwiches (ok for the price) and drinks. the problem was that we went to charge the drinks and food to our disney account, that the 'concierge' had taken a LOOONG time at a table in the lounge explaining to us how 'special' it was, and WHAT? they did not work! Even BETTER they actually said 'no charging privileges' on the front of the card!!! and this after the 'concierge' had just spent at LEAST 20 minutes of our precious vacation time explaining all about the charging....so i walked back to our 'concierge' desk and showed them the keys (meanwhile the bartender is holding our drinks and food hostage behind the bar in case we can't pay for them) and they 'fix' the keys with no apology (this is a different 'concierge' by the way) just the explanation that they said no charging allowed on them. OK so walk the whole way back to the pool bar, give the bartender the NEW key and now the computer says 'over limit' and we are still NOT allowed to charge our drinks and food. While the bartender made a feigned attempt to pick up the phone and 'call' SOMEONE - after about 2 seconds he gave me the cards back and asked me to walk myself back to the 'concierge' desk and fix the problem myself. SOO back I went - by now the husband and kids are super unhappy (and not loving the MAGICAL experience) I am met by YET another 'concierge' who assures me she will get to the bottom of this. After about 10 minutes of phone calling and keyboard punching she informs me that the ORIGINAL concierge had failed to input my credit card number i gave for incidentals....in fact....she lost the paper she wrote it down on, could i show her my card again? WHAT!??? no sorry for your inconvenience, no why don't you go get your family at the pool and then we'll take care of it - NOTHING.... We have had great service at this hotel before...but alas - not this time! Finally we got the charging taken care of and headed off to the magic kingdom - when we came back for dinner the maitre d' at narcoosies ACTUALLY told me that they had no space for a party of 4 for the ENTIRE EVENING! are you kidding me??? do they actually expect people with kids that are ages 7 and 4 to be able to make exact time reservations every single night at disney? this WAS a MONDAY evening! We were relegated to the room service in our 300 sq ft room which was horrendous. I have had better food on airplanes in coach. And the cost of the room service?? OVER $200! I think disney is really missing the mark here. It is 2011! they need to realize that people with kids want and need to be flexible AND they want and need to have nice food and dining experience. This is not rocket science! Please! what about seating at the bar?? What about having AT LEAST one restaurant that doesn't close in the middle of the day - that - DARE I SAY it - is open from maybe 8 am to 10 pm every day? where you can have a server and a cocktail and not have to sit with your plastic tray full of crappy food on your lap outside on a park bench? this IS vacation by the way! I am so disappointed and would LOVE to point out that we checked out of the grand floridian after one night and headed to the parc soleil by hilton that for a one bedroom suite only cost $99 per night. Great food, room, washer/dryer, kitchen, 800 sq ft - and - wait for it - a restaurant that was open from 8 to 10 EVERY DAY!!!!! Disney could learn a thing or two....

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful resort...100% Perfection”
Reviews.Author: ninalinda1023
Reviews.Content: Please do not listen to any negitative reviews on this resort (especially if the reviews are from New York).. This resort is beautiful, the staff is great, sweet and very helpful.. And there are NO BED BUGS. (MAYBE THEY BROUGHT THEM FROM HOME)..I have traveled to many, many resorts and hotels. And this is the BEST...the smell is so relaxing and the whole resort is great. From the moment you get out of your car to the time you leave...Hope this review helps you....Enjoy this beautiful resort.100% PERFECTION..

Reviews.Title: “Best resort at Disney”
Reviews.Author: funandrelaxation
Reviews.Content: Have always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian and I was not disappointed. I was a little worried after reading some of the reviews here, but let me tell you that if you are looking to stay on the Disney property and have a few extra dollars to spend, stay here. Let me address some of the negative reviews I read before going. First, there were no bed bugs or any signs of them. I thoroughly inspected the room. The room was not dirty, the shower curtain had no mold. The service was delightful. Check-in and check-out were smooth and easy. This is not a five star hotel, but it is the closest thing you will find on the property? It is pretty close though ... 4.5. It is a great retreat from the parks, especially at midday for a pool break. Very relaxing... Unlike the Contemporary or other hotels. Loved the convenience too. I would not hesitate to return.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing stay: monorail is great, but poor service and noisy rooms disappoint”
Reviews.Author: mumbaimaven
Reviews.Content: Our experience at this resort was mixed and contrary to the positive reviews we read here, and based on which we booked the hotel. Overall, we felt it was disappointing for the price tag, and the poor experience left a bad taste in our mouth. It was our first visit to Disneyworld. First, the pluses: 1. the convenience of having the monorail access which takes you straight to the magic kingdom was wonderful. That is a huge convenience as you don't have to take the parking shuttle to the parking lot, and then walk to your car and then drive home at 11.30 pm after the fireworks and show, when you are totally exhausted. 2. The resort is very clean, no musty smells, very very hygienic. 3. Some of the staff is truly outstanding: Scott and Kari at the Front Desk; Ilina (or Ilia) in the Casparillo; Sarah, our server at the GF cafe; Maggie at the Concierge desk; to name a few. The Bellhop staff is all great, as are those who work Housekeeping, who made witty towel sculptures and cleaned meticulously. 4. The heated 24 hr pool, and the second zero-entry pool with a small beach attached was a big hit with the kids. The property is well manicured and beautiful. The food options are very limited at this property to meat-oriented American fare, and we ended up ordering in from local restaurants after two days. The minuses: at $600 a night (for a 300 sq ft room approx), one expects a more comfortable and luxurious in-room experience, at least comparable to the Ritz Carlton or even Westin. However, the walls at the property are very thin, and we were woken up late at night as well as early hours with the noise of people above and next door who were flushing, showering, etc.!! When we complained, the staff member Tatiana was very rude and unhelpful. She asked us to pack up our luggage and put it in storage at 11 am, and told us that we could check into a different room “whenever it became available: it could be 3 pm or 4 pm or later.” Travelling with a small child, I did not appreciate the suggestion that we should hang out “homeless” in the lobby for 5 hours, when we are paying $600 per night! The distinctly unhelpful and inconsiderate attitude was both surprising and disappointing. Fortunately, a manager we spoke to apologized for this, and fixed the problem. Such a poor service experience unfortunately repeated itself. At the Casparillo café, on day 3, the two cashiers cross-questioned us loudly and repeatedly, about whether we had “really” paid for cheap, plastic $2 drinks mug we were carrying. Turns out, although we had purchased it on day 1 there, the cashier then had neglected to cut off some plastic bit on it which they are supposed to on sale; we didn’t know this, so when we went for breakfast on day 3, the cashier we were about to pay asked us, “You already paid for this?” Shocked, I said yes, you can look it up in your record, because we had paid with our room credit card. Implying that we might be lying, the cashier working behind her, and serving other customers, shouted out loudly to us, “Are you sure you paid for this? When you buy this?” As other customers stared at us, we were both shocked at this implication that a guest who is paying these exorbitant room rates would steal a $2 mug, and the complete disregard, lack of courtesy and disrespect accorded us in this interaction. At the time, we were too stunned to take up the issue immediately with the manager, as we should have done, about this nasty treatment. Also their check-in is 3 pm, and although we arrived at around 11.30 am, no effort was made to get us into the room earlier; we waited till 3 pm in the lobby! I did not appreciate being forced to check out at 11 instead of the customary 12 noon. Overall, the nasty service experiences overshadowed those when staff was excellent. I did not feel valued and respected as a guest at this property, and would not return, or recommend it: at $600 per night, I think I'd get a more high-end, spacious and luxurious experience elsewhere, with consistently top-notch, HELPFUL service and minus the cross-questioning about whether you might have stolen a $2 mug.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service..OK rooms”
Reviews.Author: mtlfamily4
