Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian for the 1st time for 4 nights...rooms were OK, very CLEAN but a little dated...STAFF WAS AMAZING in the concierge wing of the hotel, helped us with various issues not related to our time at disney and always with a smile and a solution! Pools were very clean and well organized!

Reviews.Title: “Needs new reservation staff”
Reviews.Author: misty54
Reviews.Content: I booked four rooms back in August for our "dream family vacation". We paid over $9800 for four rooms for five nights. It took years to save for this vacation. At the time of the reservation and then again three days prior to arrival I requested at least two rooms be adjoining (traveling with a 3 year old and an 18 month old) and for all four rooms to be on the same floor. When I arrived it took over 2 hours to get checked in. Our four rooms were not anywhere near each other and I assume that is what took so long to get checked in. I didnt start getting upset until the second hour. I had 2 small children who were running around and two upset senior citizens that couldnt understand what was taking so long at this nice fancy resort hotel that cost so much money. The supervisors who were trying to get our rooms together never made any eye contact with me, the front desk clerk kept going in the back for 10 to 15 minutes at a time. Finally I did get a manager (Erin) who actually made eye contact and was straight with me telling me our rooms were not going to be together or even on the same floors. At this point I just wanted our rooms. She did offer us the opportunity to move two of the rooms in two days (but still no adjoining). We ended up with all rooms in same building, one room on 1st, one room on 4th and two rooms on 5th (not beside each other either) At least we had rooms but it got our vacation off to a terrible beginning. It was very inconvenient not having a room next to the room with the small children. We picked the most expensive hotel at Disney thinking we would get what we paid for. That was not the case and a very expensive lesson. The hotel was beautiful and rooms were average and clean. But the reservation/front desk department caused us so much frustation and the experience was very stressful for all of us. Erin did buy us dinner the first night for the inconvenience and I did appreciate that but would have much rather had our rooms together as I requested several times before arrival. As I stated previously, a very expensive lesson, stay at a cheaper hotel if you have any special requests, this hotel cannot accommodate them!!

Reviews.Title: “Disney's flagship property for a reason”
Reviews.Author: Jonny99
Reviews.Content: Worth the expense. Supposedly, when Disney’s board of directors gather, this property hosts the event. If true, the reasons are apparent and abundant. A gorgeous setting, suitable for weddings, houses two great heated pools, a beach, shops, entertainment and large well-maintained rooms. Florida’s natural beauty makes the short walk to the large, well-appointed convention center a pleasure. Monorail service available to Magic Kingdom and Epcot gives this an advantage against most other Disney properties. Inside the main building, sit the two best (if prohibitively expensive) restaurants in Orlando and the resort hosts the character breakfast tourist staying at other sites come to. In short, combine anything you could want in a resort with white-glove Disney service and you have a truly great destination. The only issue encountered during this most recent stay was the loss of luggage by Disney’s Magical (well not so much) Express for all three parties traveling with us (given we arrived at different times this may be more than just a fluke).

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cine1957
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location, very good food, beach and pools, relaxing. We would like to see the rooms get a remodling. They need to be updated. And there is a charge every day for internet, plus if you don't use valet parking the lot is about 3 blocks away across a busy street, not two things you'd expect from a hotel that is over $500.00 per night. Next time we will ask if rooms have been udated, and if parking is easier to get to. If not we may find another place to stay. I did say I "would recommend" this hotel but a more accurate statement is I "Might Recommend"

Reviews.Title: “Not the Luxury resort I was expecting!”
Reviews.Author: reviewer259
Reviews.Content: We checked into the Grand Floridian and we were expecting a top hotel along the lines of a Four Seasons or Ritz Carleton. Maybe we were expecting too much. the first rooms we were given had a distinct odor to them. We asked to be changed and had to move to a outer building. Fine, until the toilet overflowed one afternoon. It took them 35 minutes to get someone out to stop the flow (there was no shut off). The water was in the hall, all over the room, under the carpet...and all over our shoes as we had to quickly move all our belongings to our second room. It took about 2 hours to get everything sorted and new rooms given to us. We wasted time that could have been spent in the Parks. Admittedly, the front desk took 1200 dollars off our bill and gave us a 1-day park hopper pass for all of us to be used at a future date. That was good customer service but I would rather it had not happened. The toilet was old, the rooms not maintained. Everything looks dated and showing it's age. The resort needs an update. The service was fine...not top-notch but fine. Being on the monorail was great since we have small children and often came back to the room in the afternoon. The restaurants were good. The pool and beach were nice. But the overall feeling was smelly and dirty. Not a good impression. We will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: jam05Ontario
Reviews.Content: Just got back from our trip to disney and stayed at the Grand Floridian. I won this hotel/trip from a contest and wewere treated like royalty. The room itself accomodated our party of 5. It was clean and very well taken care of. They have lots of pool-side activities. We were travelling with a 9 year old, 13 and 16 year old. Everyone had a great time. Being on the monorail was super. I'm not sure if I would pay $500/night for this hotel but for the convenience I would pay around $200. If you get a great deal go for it!

Reviews.Title: “Bed Bugs are here! Disney Grand Floridian has Bed Bugs!”
Reviews.Author: driveallnightlong
Reviews.Content: It is a great hotel but none of that matters when they have bed bugs. They have them and we have them now. Avoid at all costs! Bed Bugs are here! Disney Grand Floridian has Bed Bugs!

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed the Sugar Loaf concierge during our first time at Grand Floridian.”
Reviews.Author: MKM595
Reviews.Content: The hotel was beautiful, just what we expected. The monorail to Magic Kingdom in less than two minutes, about four mintures by Ferry. We stayed in Sugar Loaf, and the concierge level was worth the price. The view of the Palace was a neat feature of staying so close to the park. This is a great place for young children because of the pools, and not having to take a bus to MK or Epcot. The staff was great, and we really enjoyed the stay. I would have liked to stay in the main building, but Sugar Loaf is quitier, and more relaxed.

Reviews.Title: “Not Getting what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Aceeg
Reviews.Content: The rooms are overpriced for just a regular room. I don't mind getting what you pay for but not here. Our room had 2 queen beds and just a chair. Bathroom has disgusting shower curtains, for a hotel this classy it should have glass doors not cheap motel plastic curtains. What the hell is up with the Concierge? I always thought they book your dinner reservations and excursions etc. Not here , my wife and I made several phone calls only to be asked what level room we are? What does that matter we're paying a high price for high service and to be asked that is insulting. Than we were told they don't have a number for Concierge it was ridiculous . I spoke to a manager and he offered me dinner ,I told him I don't want a free dinner I have the deluxe meal plan I just wan't to make God darn Reservations. No wifi no PPV in room not even HBO. Just basic cable , wake up Disney this is 2011, when I told the manager about that he told me the design of the building can't accommodate it, and no other hotel has it ,Hello ever hear of Fios? Not worth the headache, only good thing about this hotel is the lobby and pool which I hardly used. The rooms were noisy , being you can hear others next door and in hallways, and my room sounded like a fish tank a weird bubbling noise and buzzing sound.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD OPTION”
Reviews.Author: FLOSA
Reviews.Content: Good hotel, excellent services, such as transfers from/to parks, airport. Very good spa. The pool was open 24 hours, which was a great thing. I expected to be decorated with disney stuff, as it is a disney hotel, it was a little disappointing that although it had some disney shops inside, it wasnt a thematic hotel. I booked a room with park view, and it wasnt worth it, i could just see the top of magic kingdoms castle only if i was standing outside, in the balcony. Anyway, it has various restaurants with great service!

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the bad reviews, this is the place you want to stay @ Disney!!!”
Reviews.Author: TeamLR
Reviews.Content: My family of 4 (2 boys, 9 & 5) recently spent 7 nights at the Grand Floridian. After reading many reviews on this site, I was a bit skeptical thinking, "will this hotel live up to the hype?, is it worth the extra money compared to the other Deluxe resorts?" Well the answer is a BIG YES!!! I can only think that some of the poor reviews left by others are people who are comparing this resort to other big high-end hotels like the Four Seasons etc, remember, this is Disney, so if you want the best in service and amenities, not to mention location, don't stay anywhere else, and don't second guess yourself, this is where you want to be. We stayed in a concierge room in the Sugar Loaf building which was great. We had a room on the ground floor just steps away from the concierge lounge. At first I was thinking this might be noisy, but to my surprise, it was extremely convenient being able to step just outside our door to get coffee early morning or late night snacks. They actually have big heavy doors that they keep closed early in the morning & later in the evening, so if you have young kids, opt for the main floor, just outside of the lounge. Our room was well maintained by housekeeping, lots of room for a family of 4, we had 2 queen beds & our youngest son loved having the day bed to himself. Concierge was always available, and definitely helpful. We stayed at Bay Lake Tower last year and I thought I would miss having the separate bedroom, kitchen facilities etc, but the Grand Floridian delivered and I didn't miss anything. We dined at the Cafe which was good, also at Narcoosees which was delicious. Highly recommend putting your kids in the Mousekateer club & enjoy a nice quiet/un-rushed dinner. This will be the only resort we stay at from now on, pools were great, beach was lovely, and one thing we really noticed, coming home from the parks, or coming from other resorts, this place was so much more quieter. As soon as you stepped off the monorail and entered the grand lobby, there was a noticeable peace and not the hustle/bustle/loudness of other places. You won't be disappointed. Oh, one last thing, got a manicure/parrafin/foot massage at the SPA, so nice!

Reviews.Title: “Never thought I would fall in love with Disney”
Reviews.Author: dtinker0129
Reviews.Content: 1st trip to disney with my family, originally expected to only stay 4 days 3 night, got extended to 6 days and 5 nights due to weather flight cancellations. Everything well exceded my expectaions except for the conciege at the lodge we stayed in. Anything we needed help with especially when we found out our flight was cnecelled they pointed us to the front desk and main lobby conciege. Why would i hve paid extra money to have my own conciege inth ebuilding I was staying in if I had to go to the main building anyway, I wouldn't .

Reviews.Title: “Magical the best vacation!”
Reviews.Author: disneyplease
Reviews.Content: We have had the opportunity to stay at the Grand Floridian, for our annual family vacation, the past three years. We love staying in the "sugar loaf" building with concierge service because with three very young children we had access to milk and snacks most of the day. We enjoyed all of the snacks actually! We would visit the park in the morning and then return around lunch time, swim in the beautiful pools in the afternoon and return to the park for a bit at night. The monorail is so convenient with a stroller and you have perfect viewing of the wishes fireworks right from the hotel and you don't have to fight the crowds at the park. They also have movies on the beach at night. This is a great vacation for a family with three boys under 6.

Reviews.Title: “Victorian Respite and Blissful Setting”
Reviews.Author: krlylox
Reviews.Content: Step into a setting which is a retreat from your world, a step-back-in time, a reproduction of a hotel from the early 19th century. The hotel is surrounded by a lagoon with beach and boating available. NOT the loud power sound but the quiet sounds of a waves and the aroma of pine trees and flowers. We stayed in the #9 building, facing the lagoon and the beach. This was a suggestion of another tripadviser. The balcony is the place you can put your feet up and enjoy relaxing with out the usual hotel racket. Watching the sunset over the lagoon is one sensational experience. There are rooms which face the pool and the boat dock. We dined at "Victoria and Alberts" which is a 5* restaurant that requires the men to wear jackets and the women are dressed in cocktail dinner style. There are other fine dining restaurants which allow casual clothing. The monorail stops at the hotel which moves you to the parks easily and effortly. There is a pga gold course, spa, and health club on the property. The Cast (disney term for employee) offer world-class service to their guests. We decided that we were not hotel guests, we are residents who live in this resort. Think about that!.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Londonandrew007
Reviews.Content: It was really clean. The location is great, and the staff are great. But... Wifi isn't free, it's $10pd, not that much in the scheme of things, but most hotels that charge a fifth of the price have free internet. Then the receptionists were terrible; I asked one to confirm my flights and he told me he can't access the internet. The room maid knocked on every door at 8am to wish you good morning, but this was actually quite disturbing, and you could hear her loud voice in your room. The furnishing isn't becomming of a hotel that charges £480 a night. And although you felt like you were somewhere posh, you didn't necessarily feel like you were in a Disney resort. The Car park is miles away from the main entrance, and once parked, you have to cross a busy street to get to the hotel. Citricos is nice, but not worth the cash. 1900 park fare is great, but your table is never ready at the time you booked.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dolphin_Eek
Reviews.Content: OVERVIEW: This is the best Disney hotel in Disneyworld - BUT people should not have expectations that the Grand Floridian is comparable to 5 Star hotels by other chains such as Shangri-La, JW Marriott or Conrad. It isn't! CHECK-IN We arrived via a private Disney transport from Port Canaveral [we had just been on a Disney Cruise]. Arrival was pleasant enough. Our luggage was handled immediately and we were escorted to the reception. Check-in was quick and handled efficiently by personable reception staff. The lobby was quite impressive, large, light and airy. Certainly throughout our stay, it was a welcome relief to walk through the lobby doors after a long day at the parks! ROOMS The hotel is very large and comprises the main block which includes the main entrance and restaurants and separate accommodation blocks lining the lake and forming enclosed courtyards. It creates quite a successful, enclosed and private atmosphere for hotel guests. We were located in Sago Cay, a separate block. This comprises a central entrance that leads into an small, unmanned, multi-height lobby, dressed with comfy seating and fresh flower displays. It follows a similar interior design to the main lobby, but on a much smaller scale. The flooring and elevators are of inferior quality. Our room was located on the third floor. All rooms on all floors are either off the lobby area or to the wings, left and right of the lobby. The actual room was large, accommodating 2 queen beds, a desk, cupboards and dresser with built-in flat panel TV. To the end of the room was a 3 seat sofa and lounge chair and stool to the side. Sliding patio doors opened up onto a balcony with a pleasant view of a courtyard and lake. The balcony and floor was a bit grimy. Something had been spilt but not cleaned. To the immediate left of the entrance was an opening that led to a carpeted area with a marble vanity unit with twin wash basins. Off this area lies the bathroom, housing the bath with wall shower attachment and WC. The decor was in a faux victorian style, nothing too luxurious, but perfectly acceptable. However, the bathroom was a different matter. Here, it was obvious that things needed upgrading. It just looked dated. The actual bath and fittings were old. The cheap marble square tiles, whilst perhaps chic at the time, just looks cheap. They only covered the bath area, with wall paper covering the rest of the room. The bath had a cheap, plastic, utilitarian hand rail fixed to wall - think of a disabled WC grab rail!. The shower fittings also did not work too well - not enough pressure. The bathroom phone was also in a 1970's/80's style - quite horrible and the wall paper was trimmed badly around this fitting. Note, the drying line was dirty! Just to recap, the bedroom area was fine and very clean. The washbasin area was ok, but the bathroom left a lot to b e desired. SERVICES The courtyard pool and jacuzzi was heated and open 24hours but unmanned. Towels were available freely. The second pool had a water slide and waterfall, was manned but had limited opening hours. Overall, very good to have the variety and choice. We dined at 1900 Park Fare - It was OK, a buffet with limited choice, but what do you expect at a Disney Park? Room service/turn down was bizarre and random. The people were friendly, but if we left the iron board out or the tv was left on during the day, we would come back in the evening to a clean room, but the board or tv still left out/on! SUMMARY People pay the premium on this hotel because of its unsurpassed access/transportation to the Magic Kingdom and bus tranport to other parks further away is very good aswell. It's convenient and quick. If you have high expectations based on other 5 star hotels, it would be advisable to knock off a star. Other than that - it's a good hotel and if you want the best hotel with all the convenience, then there is no other alternative than the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: tjenkins12
Reviews.Content: Staying at Grand Floridian was the best decision we made with regards to our entire Disney Vacation. Our two children are 4 and 6, and they would have rather spent time at the GF than Disney Parks. The pools are amazing. We would spend 3-4 hours at the park in the morning and come back to GF after for lunch and swimming. It was perfect. We had an early check-in and a gorgeous room with view of MK and Lagoon. The room and entire hotel was SO CLEAN! Especially the grounds and common areas. Gaspirillos was great, and we also enjoyed Grand Floridian Cafe for several dinners. Excellent food! All in all, we highly recommend Grand Floridian and it was such a pleasure to walk into the resort after a tiring day at the Parks. It's worth the extra cost through and through!!

Reviews.Title: “Magical Time”
Reviews.Author: pkalo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GF for 6 nights and every night was perfect. We arrived at 9 am on our first day only to be greeted at the front door by three people who showed us to our room. We booked the basic garden view room and was upgraded to a concierge room in the sugar loaf building. What a treat this was! Depending on the time of day, you could get food, coffee, beer, wine or cordials. We were located on the third floor at the end of the hall and our room was very quiet. We traveled with our 3 year old daughter and everyone called her princess. Everyone we met was very friendly, both at the hotel and at all the parks (except for one person at Hollywood Studios in the parking lot - no magic in her day I guess!). The location of this hotel is great. The monorail to Magic Kingdom is less than 2 minutes and the boat from Magic Kingdom to the hotel was about 5 minutes (faster than the monorail back from the park). Everything was perfect at the GF and we can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “GF is amazIng and worth the extra money. Fine for small children!”
Reviews.Author: Nicole.1976
Reviews.Content: Hello, My family went to Disney for a week and stayed at the Grand Floridian in November 2010. When we went our daughter was 22 months old and our nephew was 3.5 years old. I was a bit worried about some of the reviews I read that claimed it was not a place for small children but was happily surprised. The hotel itself is absolutely beautiful and we upgraded our rooms to Club Level which meant that we got access to the Sugarloaf Club. (this meant that we had a Lounge with beverages,Continental breakfast, midday snacks, afternoon tea, evening wine, cheese and hors d'oeuvres, late night cordials and desserts). This was PERFECT for everyone as we could just walk downstairs and eat breakfast (sometimes kids still in their PJs). They had a flat screen tv playing cartoons and little tables and chairs espically for them. It was also nice to just have a drink before dinner or pick up a snack on our way back to our rooms for nap time. ROOM - adequate space with nice ammenities. The crib is not full size but slightly larger and nicer than a pack n play. Depending on where your room is you will hear/see the fireworks at the MK and can also see the electric water parade. Everything in the room was clean and had no complaints. We ordered room service for breakfast on two days when the kids wanted pancakes and french toast. Food was and service were both above average. RESTAURANTS - Some of the best lunches we had during our stay were from Gasparilla Grill. They had several food options for children (burgers, pizza, nuggets, etc) and above average options for adults (club sandwiches/paninis, salads, etc.). Their other meal items looked good as well and it was a great place to stop and pick up a snack. We also had dinner one night at the GF Cafe. We were afraid it was not going to be kid friendly but it really was. The wait staff was very attentive and were really nice to the kids. Most of the adults at the table got the signature burger which was a Angus Chuck Burger, Lobster, Asparagus, and Horseradish-Chive Hollandaise - very tasty and one had the steak which was also cooked well. We did not try the other restaurants as we had booked most of our dinners out in the parks. (see restaurant review). POOLS/RECREATION - the pools were both very nice and we were happy that they were heated as it was a bit chilly. We really liked the pool with the slide because it had a walk in entry so the kids felt like they had more freedom to play without having to be held all the time. They have entertainment by this pool as well and the kids loved the music and games. The "beach" was clean and the sand was soft but it was still a lake and I found the water to be a bit gross. However, the kids did enjoy playing in the sand. Both kids were too young to participate in most of the activities/clubs but they still had a blast just running around the property and playing in the grass. I was a bit concerned because this resort does not have a playground but we did fine without one. LOCATION - can't beat it! Was so WONDERFUL to be on the monorail line with children in strollers!!! I really think it made the stay so much more stressfree. We took the buses to Animal Kingdom, DHS and to downtown disney and was so much more of a hassle with the strollers and diaperbag. The kids also really loved the mono. Hope this review helps! Just don't dismiss this resort if you have small children. It is a beautiful resort for anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your time. Poor quality, over priced, staff has an attitude”
Reviews.Author: vicepresidentsales
Reviews.Content: Bad beds, bad food, bad service. Don't waste your time and money stay outside the gate.

Reviews.Title: “Missing something”
Reviews.Author: jonkrakower
Reviews.Content: As a frequent traveler for business purposes to the Disney area, I have had my chances to stay at many of their hotels, and when I tried out the Floridian I had some high expectations. Upon checking in my room was not ready, and after waiting 2+ hours I was still unable to get into my room. At around 5PM I made it into my room. The room was quite nice and I had a great view of the Magic Kingdom from my balcony. I was also staying in the main building, club level and got some really good treatment there too. Upon checking out my travel documents, provided by Disney travel, I noticed that the dates were wrong on all the docs, including some of the tours and special events which I paid extra for. I immediately went to my concierge on the club level and pointed out the mistakes. Vonnie, her name was, happened to be very helpful. She contacted the ravel company and was told it would take 2+ days to get the corrected docs over to the hotel which was unacceptable. Eventually she got the situation handled. The following day when I returned to my room after a meeting I found a bag with all kinds of candy and other goodies waiting for me(pixidusting is what they called it). The room like I said was very nice, and yes, did have a coffee maker. I was still expecting a little more.. I think for the money spent I should have gotten more. This is a very pricey hotel, but kind of over the top at some points and at others lacking in some areas. Another issue I had was that at the end of the day I had the privacy notice on my door and yet the housekeeping staff and evening turndown service still knocked on the door. The convenience of having the monorail right outside the lobby was a nice advantage.... All in all a really nice hotel, but would not do it again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Service”
Reviews.Author: Bojon1
Reviews.Content: We checked in and they gave us the wrong type of room. We arranged to have it the next day, when we got back I had to wait 30 minutes for the front desk to get us the correct room. Went to eat at Narcoossee's. Waited again 25 minutes past our reservation, then was seated and waited 15 more minutes for a waiter. When I asked to speak to the manager, it took her 15 minutes more to come. We walked out very disapointed. Disney aint what it used to be, especially at the Grand Floridian. Buy the way, you have to pay for the internet and the free parking is very far away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, safe hotel close to the destinations”
Reviews.Author: JuniorBearsMom
Reviews.Content: Staff was excellent, rooms comfortable. Recevied a excellent "conference" rate. Would not pay "extra" for this premium hotel. Not worth $300 to $400 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Just Okay”
Reviews.Author: dvar
Reviews.Content: I had been told that this resort compared to a Ritz Carlton and it doesn't. I think travelers visiting the GF just need their expectations set appropriately. You are paying for the convenience to Magic Kingdom. While the hotel lobby is pretty, the building our room was in and our room itself were more like a glorified Holiday Inn. Our first night they gave another family keys to our room and while I was sleeping (husband and son still at park), a family entered our room with keys. I got them to leave but it was pretty unsettling and not only did the hotel not address it (they simply slid new keys under our door in the middle of the night), when I brought it to their attention, their response was that I should have put the safety lock on. There really was no apology. Also the walls were very thin and you could constantly hear people in the halls and other rooms like they were in your room with you. We probably would not stay here again. It wasn't horrible, it just was not worth it for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian - Top Notch Again”
Reviews.Author: falpros
Reviews.Content: My husband, 2 year old son, and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for 5 nights. I had stayed there a few times growing up with my family, but never as an adult with my own family. It exceeded all of my expectations, and was as good as I remembered, even a little better. We booked our trip with Lynda Hower of Dream Makers Vacation Services. She was so efficient in helping us with our reservations and provided us with all of the information to make this trip as wonderful as it was. This was the second time in 6 months that we have used this travel agency, and I am for sure going to use it the next time we book a trip. One of the best featutres of the Grand Floridian was the convenience to the parks. Within 45 seconds of boarding the monorail, you were getting off at the Magic Kingdom. Having a toddler and wanting to go back and forth to the parks and hotel more than once each day, being on the monorail line was crucial. We can't wait to go back and experience more magic! It was a fabulous time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay will be back!!!”
Reviews.Author: tj31
Reviews.Content: Fantastic hotel, as soon as you walk into the lobby you know you are in a five star hotel and it could be anywhere in the world you really would not know that you are 2 minutes away from the Magic Kingdom. Our room was very spacious with views over the seven sea lagoon and Cinderella's castle it was amazing. The room was spotlessly clean. The pools are fantastic never really very busy, we loved relaxing on the beach area they have there and seeing the brides arrive at the wedding pavilion. There are many restaurants that they have here and we tried Citricos and also afternoon tea in the garden view tea room. Absolutely faultless the staff are fantastic and nothing is too much trouble. I am looking forward to going back there very soon. I have also tried Animal Kingdom Lodge but this hotels wins every time.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: tmbmjo
Reviews.Content: After reading some of the more recent bad reviews I was worried about my upcoming stay. But after getting there I was amazed. The room was immaculate, the location was perfect and the staff courteous and helpful. I was extremely please with my experience, and if Magic Kingdom is the most important aspect of your stay you couldn't ask for a better hotel, we could see the fireworks from our balconies! Perfection!

Reviews.Title: “Frustrating and not worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: Medi8VA
Reviews.Content: First room not as requested. Had toilet paper holder that would not stay in place and suspicious brown stain nearby. Front desk said no king beds available for two days. Asked if there were any other options. Said: there are two beds in your room. Use one of them. Still asked for room change when king available in two says. Miraculously one was available next day. Every question asked of staff yielded at least two very different answers. Worst was five wrong answers until the sixth employee knew the right answer. Definitely not a magical stay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Disney Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chickie-b
Reviews.Content: Stayed here one night on a business trip and got a conference rate. Very friendly check-in process and cast members as expected. Lovely facility and shops. The room was spacious and quiet (not in the main building) with a comfortable bed. Liked the turndown service when I came back at night. I did not have time to use the pools or hot tub. They actually have two pools but one was not open during my stay. Ate at one of their restaurants, that was pricey, however good service and food. Upon check out I had to go to another hotel on Disney property for the following night and they took care of getting my luggage to the other hotel which was convenient. Wished I could have spent more time at this hotel to use their facilities.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian - "Not So Grand"”
Reviews.Author: travel_orlando_101
Reviews.Content: Checked into the hotel on the evening of January 11, 2011. Upon arrival the valet was efficient and friendly, check-in was a breeze, and navigating the property was not hard at all. Then came the room, upon first glance everything looked pretty clean but as I would soon find out this was not the case. When I went to pickup the phone to order room service there was a sticky "sap like" substance all over the phone. While I was ordering my wife pulled out the desk chair to find several large "dark colored" stains on the cushion. I thought to myself, maybe these two small items were overlooked during housekeeping service but at further inspection here is what was found: several large stains on the bench at the end of the bed, mold covering the grout between the shower tiles, small "food like" pieces littering the floor between the TV stand and the foot of the bed and the floor was so dirty that when I took a look at the bottom of my socks they had turned black. As for maintenance the room looked extremely dated compared to other similar brands that I have stayed at in the area (Ritz Carlton, Peabody......etc). In the closet the shelving was in desperate need of painting (chipping and where the shelving actually attaches to the wall the holes were cut too big so you can see the joists), wallpaper coming apart at the seams, sliding glass door lock not working, broken tile on the patio (also a safety hazard), paint on many of the hardware and light fixtures and the lamps above the headboard were falling sideways. On a smaller note, movie rental is not offered through the TV, I assumed that this was a standard in most luxury hotels these days. Needless to say after encountering these issues, myself and my wife decided it would be best to checkout to avoid further stress. Then came the overnight front desk staff. I checked out around 12:30am "Laura D" at the front desk was excellent, she showed genuine care and empathy towards my issues and tried to help me on all accounts. She was extremely proffesional and polite and showed the true "magic" that a Disney employee can posess. Unfortunatley also at the desk that night was an employee by the name of "Leah". Now I am not one to generally bash an employee for being rude as I think everyone can have a bad day, but to me "Leah" was astounding. It started when "Laura D" asked for "Leah's" help regarding my account as once again "Laura D" was trying to help me, and to my shock it appeared as "Leah" had no interest in helping at all. In fact, not only was she not interested but instead of walking what I would estimate as 10' - 15' to assist "Laura" she decided to yell across the front desk and told "Laura" to "Hold on", all while another family was at the desk as well. "Leah" then proceeded to tell me that she was not going to refund my night due to the fact that I was in the room past midnight. The funny thing is I never asked for any type of compensation in regards to my issues, not only did I not ask for compensation I actually told her that since my room and tax had not yet posted to the account I needed her to do so before I could check out, that way I was charged for the room. "Leah" then walked back to her podium where the phone rang and beleive it or not she actually answered the phone, and in exact words the greeting was "wassup yo" I couldn't beleive my ears, they don't even answer the phone like that at Holiday Inn. While I understand this may have been an internal call, the un-proffesionalism that "Leah" displayed was in no way, shape or form acceptable. In the end I would have "Laura D" working for me anyday but as for "Leah", the resort may want to consider some additional training or possibly relocation to a back-of-house position. So needless to say after my experience I will not be staying at the Grand Floridian again and in my opinion I would not recommend that anyone else do so either, at least until the hotel goes through a major refurbishment of there rooms and gets a bit more strict with there housekeeping staff.

Reviews.Title: “I am HOMESICK for the Grand Floridian!!!”
Reviews.Author: gretchensue
Reviews.Content: ROOM 9341 in BOCA CHICA building, AMAZING 4th floor corner "ON THE WATER ," view of CASTLE!! It was sooo quiet. I could here Mickey and Minnie talking during the Castle lighting ceremony. The beds are so comfy & the smell of the hotel is so fresh and clean. My parents were in a Deluxe suite on the Concirge level in the main building. They had a great room with a view of the main pool. They had a CHRISTMAS tree brought in by the Disney florist. WOW$$ , But beautiful and adorable,and they shipped it home. Food at the Floridian was fabulous EXCEPT for the rubber lobster we had at NARCOOSSES. They took good care of us! Every one took such pride in us,even VALET attendet! That was a Christmas vacation of a lifetime!!!!!!!!! Hope I can go back some day!

Reviews.Title: “Can not wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: pualuk95
Reviews.Content: Great location, great room and great service. This was our third year in a row at Disney, and this was by far the best hotel. The room was spotless and roomy. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Cannot wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Checkout couldnt come fast enough”
Reviews.Author: JDW07
Reviews.Content: For what the Floridian charge (around 5x the price of the Ritz Carlton Orlando), the hotel and service was beyond disgusting. Checkin was quick and easy, however the room we were in had two seperate beds after requesting a king bed, we were informed that the hotel doesnt have many king bed rooms, which is odd for a hotel catering to families...do they expect couples to sleep seperately? The room had a distincively odd odour which seems to be throughout the hotel. It smells as if the old smoking rooms have had their odour removed by using chemicals which form a strange cocktail. After complaining about the beds we were moved to another room with a king bed, only the light didn't work and the smell was even worse. A second complaint meant we changed rooms three times in a few hours with the promise of a "great room". This turned out to be the exact same room, on a higher floor - So basically a rubbish room with a better view. I can't begin to describe how horrible this hotel is. The decor, fixtures and fittings makes it feel as if you are staying at someone's grandmother's house and I was shocked to find that the hotel is only 20 years old. The lobby is extremely busy and the concierges rude and unhelpful, especially when asking about anything non Disney related. For instance, after tiring of the hot dogs and pizza available in Disney and craving a proper meal, I attempted to make a reservation at a restaurant in another off Disney hotel, only to be handed the phone by the concierge and told to do it myself. Never in all my years of travel have I been so taken aback. The restaurants in the hotel are disgusting and overpriced. If I ever go back to Disney, I will most cetainly stay in a hotel off premises and get the shuttle in. Avoid at all costs.

Reviews.Title: “Four Star Hotel at 5 Star Prices”
Reviews.Author: LASafer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 5 nights. You could not ask for a better location or a more beautiful hotel. The staff is friendly but not very well trained. The concierge is worthless. The restaurants are below average as one might expect in a isolated resort system without any competition. The room was on the small side. It's a shame they can't make this truly gorgeous hotel a 5 star since we are paying 5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Tino51
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the GF after Thanksgiving 2010. My wife had always wanted to stay there since she was a little girl and her parents told her it was too expensive. We travel a lot and most of the time stay in nice hotels (FS and St. Regis) so we have high expectations. The GF has great restaurants, its beautiful, great location, great views of the Magic Kingdom (if you have a view room), and nice rooms, but the reason I am spending my valuable time writing this is because of the service and care. I think the staff and management (especially Joey ?) really care about your time and experience. We had a situation where the hotel actually lost our luggage for 1.5 days. The combination of my wife without her nice clothes and expensive jewelry and our 4.5 year without all of his comforts, made for a not too pleasant experience, but I must say the hotel and again, Joey made it right and actually turned the whole experience into an unforgettable trip. Mistakes happen and it is how the staff here responded to those mistakes that make this place worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Truly Amazing but the concierge was worthless in sugar loaf”
Reviews.Author: JANEEN15
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel Could sit there all day. Room incredible. Stayed in the royal palm club.Ther concierge did absolutely nothing for me as far as reservations. I got those all on my own. They never contacted me. I always had to contact them. The food on the Concierge level was amazing. The view was amazing. It was cold so we stayed in one night and just listened to the band and looked at the ginger bread house. What i liked least was its a major tourist attraction and it gets crowded. We couldnt sit in the lobby at all no where to sit. People from other hotels go out along the marina and watch the fireworks and use the monorail. I think that is totally wrong. People pay a lot to stay here and we should be able to enjoy the benefits. I couldnt even get reservations for the tea room. My concierge couldnt get me in. They were no help at all to me.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated, expensive but not worth it. Won't come again.”
Reviews.Author: Travelstoplaces
Reviews.Content: My stay began with room accommodations not being as guaranteed. The Disney reservations online operator actually booked a king room with joining queens, upon arrival I was giving two joining queen rooms, therefore my husband and slept in separate beds. When I contacted the front desk I was told there is NO SUCH THING as guaranteed king and queens joining ( which did not seem to be a problem at the Portofino Resort in Universal) they actually have very few room with king beda that join to queens - which is strange considering Disney is mostly families and these requests are probably common. Please keep in mind, I could have booked anywhere considering my budget - which was unlimited - I choose the hotel because they assured me they could honor my accommodations. Nevertheless, they did not move us or even offer a credit - we we paid over 13k for our package and slept like kids in separate beds. This of course was not the only issue. On my second night I called valet service since I had left my DVDs in my car ( keep in mind this expensive hotel does not have movies on demand). Valet informed me they would bring movies from my car to my room - well about 45 minutes went by and I actually called back to find they had brought my car to the front of the hotel and did not bother to tell me it was there or that they were not bringing me the movies. But let me continue -- room service -- I called at about midnight, no answer, I was put on hold for 15 minutes until I finally called the front desk, I was informed that "they should answer the phone for it's 24 hour room service ".... I finally gave up and never called back... By far this hotel has the poorest customer service I have ever experienced, it's too bad because the appearance is beautiful and grand -- but that is all--- please be sure you read this review because I feel I was very mislead.

Reviews.Title: “Casual elegance-perfect for children and adults.”
Reviews.Author: lindanaples1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third annual stay at Disneyworld's Grand Floridian Hotel. We join our son, daughter-in-law and our 5 year old grandaughter for an early Christmas celebration. We always stay on the Concierge floor in the main building. The rooms are spacious, the bathrooms are luxurious, and you have the option of enjoying 5 food offerings every day. It is very convenient for my daughter-in-law to take my grandaughter to breakfast whenever she wakes up, without having to wait in line at a restaurant. And when we return from one of the parks, there is always a lovely display of refreshments available. The hotel is decorated beautifully, and live music is almost always being played. We enjoy the fireworks from our room's balcony while sipping cordials and sampling elegant pastries every night. We get adjoining rooms so when our grandaughter goes to bed, her parents can sit in our room to talk or watch TV with us . It is always a perfect experience. Little children are everywhere, of course, but they are all well behaved, and fun to watch.

Reviews.Title: “Staying Here Adds to the Magic”
Reviews.Author: travelmikeVancouver
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is the best place to stay if your trip will focus mostly on the Magic Kingdom. You'll be just one stop away on the (sometimes very crowded) monorail. You can also take the monorail to Epcot, but that will involve a transfer and will add at least a half hour travel time each direction. Other areas such as the Animal Kingdom are reachable via the vast and confusing Disney transit system also adding lots of transit time, so just grab a cab instead if you can. Hopefully your stay here will start as ours did, by being greeted by a marvelous older gentleman. We saw him frequently, out directing the buses and greeting as many guests as he could. He led us into the vast lobby and got the attention of someone at front desk. They were kind enough to find us a room that was ready to check into, as we were early. The room was in the Sago Cay building, which I would recommend for those who want some peace and quiet. One end of the building, however, is close to a service road and the adjacent Convention Center and therefore noisier, so try to get a higher-numbered room. Our ground floor room (described as 'garden view') actually looked out over a bit of the lagoon. The monorail track was visible as well, but we did not hear it. It was great fun to sit in the room and watch the monorails whizzing past in both directions. The location was surprisingly peaceful. Rooms have 2 double beds with very comfortable mattresses. Our room looked a little cramped with 2 beds and a sofabed, but I can't imagine a family being comfortable in one. The decor is somewhat fussy for my taste but it works well with the architecture of the hotel. There is also a mini fridge which is very convenient, though ours was a bit noisy. The bathroom has 2 open vanities and not one shelf or drawer to put things away. Closet space was fine for 2 but again would be tight for any more. We could hear noise from the hallways, which one would expect. Mornings when the park opens early were quite active, but who can't remember the excitement of their first Disney trip? We had an ongoing issue with hot water in our room. Every time we wanted a shower, we'd have to turn on both taps as well as the bath tub, and run them, sometimes for 20 minutes, before the water warmed up. This was most inconvenient when trying to stick to a schedule, as we'd waste lots of time waiting for hot water. It's a shame to waste all the water as well. I finally complained and when we got back to the room later there were THREE plumbers. They assured me they fixed the problem, but as it turns out all they actually did was run the water long enough to make it hot. Management seems quite aware of the problem and one would think it was fixable. We ate at the hotel quite frequently. The GF Cafe is bright and sprawling, and the food is okay. Ditto Citrico's upstairs, it was okay but real fine dining it is not. We were unable to get into Narcosee's so cannot comment on the food. We also did not dine at Victoria and Alberts, supposedly the best and priciest of all Disney restaurants. Generally though we thought all Disney food contains alot of sulfites to keep it fresh, so be mindful if sulfites or preservatives bother you. The Spa isn't really what one would expect of a "luxury" hotel, but you might enjoy a massage or facial there, if you ever have time! There is a pool and a stretch of bright white sand, which no one was using during our visit (the temperature was close to 80 most days). I would recommend the GF to families of any size, especially those with seniors in their group, who will get a kick out of the nostalgic design. The hotel lobby is lovely. Staff are really friendly, and you can't get much closer to the Magic Kingdom. It's expensive but we had a really grand time.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: deewearsgucci
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at most of WDW resorts. This was my first time at the Grand Floridian. We stayed at the Boca Chica, with a park view. Our view was amazing, we could watch the electric boat parade from our room. Every nite watch and amazing fireworks display from Magic Kingdom. The hotel had a very laid back feeling. We went over Thanksgiving weekend, and the hotel was decorated for Christmas. The gingerbread house was amazing and the huge tree in the lobby was beautiful. Our friends stayed in the sugar loaf building which has the concierge service ( which means they had free snacks all day). But their view was the hotels marina. I loved my room so much better because of the view!!!I would stay here again, my family loved it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Visit to the Grand FL”
Reviews.Author: EdChangDDS
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a wonderful experience this past Thanksgiving holiday at the Grand Floridian. Janet the evening Manager on Duty was extemely helpful in resolving a boarding pass printing issue. the night before our departure. Service at this hotel is 5 star.

Reviews.Title: “Our dream honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: marielynn724
Reviews.Content: Indeed an expensive resort - we saved up for a long time to stay for a week here on our honeymoon. In this case, you definitely get what you pay for. Absolute luxury. Immaculately clean, friendly and accommodating staff. We were actually upgraded upon our arrival - from a regular room (about $450/night) to a consierge suite (about $635/night) which was really amazing! The room had a lovely view of the pool and grounds, comfortable and plush furnishings. The bed was sooo comfortable too! Very light and airy atmosphere in rooms and throughout the hotel. Beautiful pool, architecture, and grounds. Also loved the close location to Magic Kingdom. I cannot say enough about all the staff we encountered. Also wonderful restaurants. I have stayed at other luxury hotels before and this was the warmest and friendliest of any of them. We were treated like a king and queen. Perfect honeymoon!

Reviews.Title: “Disney elegance, relaxing, but pricey.”
Reviews.Author: Islanders13
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian from 11/15/10-11/19/10, (a notoriously slow week at Disney), to celebrate my 40th birthday with my husband and four year old son. After reading a lot of guide books and reviews, I chose the Grand Floridian. I have stayed in all different classes of hotels when traveling from budget to top of the line. For our first trip to Disney, my priority was convenience, service, and relaxation while getting the full Disney feel. I wanted to stay at a hotel on the monorail where transportation to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot was not a hassel and for that, the Grand Floridian did not disappoint. It was nice to have the option of taking a boat to the magic kingdom as well. Our standard room was not in the main hotel but in the Boca Chica building. It was a quiet, comfortable room, could have used better tv channels, ( I like to watch at night before I go to sleep), and nicer quality blankets for the money you're paying. We had a great view of the lagoon, boats, the Magic Kingdom, nightly fireworks and electrical parade. I am glad that I specifically asked for that view when I made the reservation because my son really enjoyed sitting on the balcony and watching the action first thing in the morning and before he went to sleep at night. Because we had just celebrated my son's fourth birthday a week before we arrived, the hotel delivered a white chocolate mickey mouse with a plate of cookies and a happy birthday message on the day we arrived. It was a lovely touch and it's things like that that make the Grand Floridian earn its' money. I liked having two sinks in the bathroom, the shower was nice, nice organic soap and shampoo. Plenty of towels, liked the turn-down service at night with the hotel chocolates on the pillow. If you're a picky person the room could be considered a touch dated but we were very comfortable for the time we were in it. Not having wifi was not an issue for us but I realize it could be for others. My only complaint staying in an outside building was that you had to walk to the main building for any type of drink or snack. Granted this was not a concierge building and it's not a hike to the main building, but I'm just putting it out there. (We were on the deluxe meal plan and I didn't think we'd take full advantage of a concierge building but if we weren't I would strongly consider it.) We used both pools, the main pool and the beach pool and thoroughly enjoyed them both. We ate at Citricos the first night we were there which was good, character breakfast at 1900 Park Fare (thought Chef Mickey's at the Contemporary was better) and regularly went to Gasparillas which is conveniently open 24 hours. (Being a New Yorker I have to say that all Disney ppoperties need to improve their bagels but I don't know if anyone else even notices or cares.) The lobby in the main building is very pretty and elegant for Disney. Staff was very friendly and helpful. It was nice to return to the Grand Floridian after a long day at the parks or a late dinner. It was quiet, and comfortable, and relaxing. Not sure if it's always like that or this was a particularly slow week. But from having read earlier reviews, it seems like that is the general vibe. The golf carts and construction didn't bother us. We thoroughly enjoyed this hotel. For Disney, this is as high end as it gets and we had a truly magical vacation. If it doesn't break the bank, it's worth it. Having said that, if I went with a large group with a lot of kids or older kids, and the Magic Kingdom wasn't my main priority I may think about staying in the Boardwalk area which is by Epcot, at the Beach and Yacht Club, where there's a little more action and an awesome pool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Property Missing Expected Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Georgia L
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at this hotel. The room was large and comfortable. I was disappointed that there was no wireless in the room. Also, the computers were down so it was nearly impossible to make a dinner reservation. All the wait staff were wonderful. The hotel TV selection didn't include Fox News, which I also wasn't happy about. Overall I enjoyed the stay. It's a beautiful property.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey Hotel but Worth It for Convenience”
Reviews.Author: Natsfandc
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Grand Floridian. It was clean and quiet but our room was very small. For $450/night - I expected a little more space/luxury but I guess we're paying fo the convenience of taking the monorail to Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Disney at its best!”
Reviews.Author: Nawlins007
Reviews.Content: Wonderful service, coupled with a beautiful setting and great access to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot through their monorail system makes this resort one of the best to stay at. The only downside I'd give it is that they aren't shy about charging for it. But the service and grounds are almost...almost worth every penny. Which in this day and time is saying something! There were weddings galore, we saw Mickey and Minnie strolling through, plenty of other characters are readily available at events at the hotel, and the pools were perfect temps and a great place to swim and watch the evening fireworks. Oh, btw...no wireless in the room. But it's Disney, what are you in the room for?!?!

Reviews.Title: “EXCELLENT, TERRIFIC AND WONDERFUL!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: CRVQuitoEcuador
Reviews.Content: It was the first time in Orlando and We selected the Grand ´s Floridian Resort and Spa because is the best of the Disney, the people and all the service was fabulous. I was with by husband and my baby 2 years old an we enjoyed a lot!!. It is expensive but I promise you don´s spent your money. I want to send a great hug to Deonicio from Mexico ( luggage car), Scott the reception from EEUU, Gee our waitress and a lot people of this hotel. CONGRATULATIONES YOU ARE THE BEST!!!! MIGUEL GAIBOR MR. CARMEN VASQUEZ MRS. AND MIGUELITO JR. CH.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian is Truly Grand”
Reviews.Author: vickier
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with a friend from October 29th until November 2nd. I won a trip to Disney World through Essence magazine and this is the hotel that they put us up in. The Grand Floridian is a beautiful hotel and the service was outstanding. The rooms were big and clean. There were a lot of nice extras and the turn down service every night complete with chocolates that had a picture of the hotel on them was a good touch. We were in a standard room on the 2nd floor of building 8. Our room had a nice sized balcony that overlooked the courtyard pool area. The attention to detail at this hotel is very good. The staff were all very friendly. Both pools were very nice and the hot tub was very large. This is a beautiful hotel and if cost was not a factor I would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “What a grand hotel!”
Reviews.Author: JMEGsmama
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at The Grand Floridian over Halloween 2010 weekend. Although almost all of our trips to DisneyWorld have typically been at the parks from sun-up to sundown, we typically used any of the Disney resorts to sleep in. Well, not this time! The Grand Floridian was so nice and wonderful to come back to, that we would only spend a few hours at the parks, and then come home for swimming, the hot tub, or the activities. I will admit that it is quite expensive to stay here, and we did upgrade once we were there to the conceirge level, and having food & drink available most of the day/night was a huge draw to us (we are a family of five) since we did not partake in the dining plan this time. The rooms are typical hotel style, although we could fit five comfortably, and the balcony was a nice touch! I think the rooms at the Polynesian may be a bit bigger, but the Poly doesn't have the elegance and cleanliness of the Grand Floridian. If our budget allows, we will definitely return here!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations and we'll be back!”
Reviews.Author: jmp1975
Reviews.Content: It's no secret that this is ranked as a top notch hotel. I'm writing to let you know that this hotel is everything it claims to be and more. I am thrifty and was unsure about spending the $ for this hotel. However the accomodations, the service and the location make this property worth every penny. I recommend taking the Disney shuttle bus to the hotel as it's simple and the second stop on the route. I was thrilled that there was a coin-op laundry facility in most every building. The food selection is good, the pools are very nice and the ease of access to the Disney parks is priceless after a long day at the parks. I will say that the resort is sprawling so sometimes is it's quite a walk from here to there. However with 800+ rooms you should expect this, and there are little shuttle carts that can be arranged if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Priceless Location”
Reviews.Author: RASG
Reviews.Content: You just can't beat being on the monorail with young children and the Grand Floridian is the most elegant way to be there. We stayed on the concierge level, worth every penny. We ate breakfast here everyday and a late lunch one day too. The rooms are clean, I didn't like the comforter, but that's more of a style preference. The lobby is beautiful, grand, filled with wonder, like disney should be. The staff is friendly, helpful. It's simply a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A Golf Resort or a Disney Resort?”
Reviews.Author: I_am_reviewing_you
Reviews.Content: Traveled for business, but I was really scoping it out for my first family Disney vacation next year. I have been to various Disney properties before and so I was really looking forward to this trip. It has an impressive resort entrance with an amazingly large lounge area that has the decor that would make my grandmother happy…my 5 year old girls, not so much. The large pools and outside areas were amazing open, fun, and clean. My room was located on the 4 floor of the Victorian building #5. It had the standard two beds, desk, and TV hutch, but the bathroom definatly had upgraded counters and tiles. I had a lunch and a dinner at the main resturant...super delicious, but expensive. My biggest observation was the notable decrease in customer service from the staff. One employee was making lunch plans on the phone with a fellow employee as she was ringing up my purchases at the Disney store. Also, There were an extraordinary large number of golf-cart-like vehicles on the footpaths for the guests (there were golf carts for employees, carts for maintenance personnel, golf carts eldery guests, carts for pool towel transport…well you get the picture…if not, check out the 2 pictures that were taken within 5 seconds of each other within 5 feet of each other can you spot all 5 carts?). While surprisingly numerous, all the golf cart drivers were courteous and never made an attempt to pass pedestrians. Finally, the internet connection was lousy and required a cable to connect to the wall jack…Hint: get WiFi. Finally a word about the conference hall amenities: The office center is strategically located at the front of the main hall (and the employee let me print my airplane boarding pass for free on my last day there…two thumbs up!). The food was way above par, as compared to other similar convention hall venues. In any case, I remembered when Disney was the pinnacle of service…it seemed to have lost some of that luster on this trip. But the truth is, none of my comments will prevent me from taking my kids there next year.

Reviews.Title: “Not that great. Save yourself some money.”
Reviews.Author: WyCyberGuy
Reviews.Content: First that me say it's a very nice hotel. But not worth the $$$$ and service is not 4 or 5 stars. The service is more like a good 3 star. The grounds and accommodations are 4. Food was good but very over priced. Just wasn't worth the $400 plus per night. Also ducks in the pool and spa is an issue unless you like swimming things they leave behind. Also had issues with room on check-in. Clerk was not very friendly or helpful. They did get the problem resolved. The bathroom could have been a little cleaner at check-in. Again, not a bad visit just not worth the premium room rate and over priced food.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not great”
Reviews.Author: BigDTraveler
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely, had a live band playing when checking in. Overall had a lot of pros, but when comparing to other local hotels I thought it was slightly overpriced. Having said that, I only stayed 2 nights, and did not use the nice pool or spa. The room was rather small and similar to a Marriott or Hyatt (not a 4 star), but nice to have a small fridge and a 24 hour snack bar on the property. Obviously being on the monorail it was easy to get to the parks. But with so many other hotel choices with much larger pools and kid friendly activities, and/or 4 star adult luxury accomodations, I'm not sure I would recommend it as a first choice. Very nice overall, but not amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, service varied....”
Reviews.Author: maryellenpa
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice. Beautiful building, nice grounds, room was a good size, beds comfortable & bathroom area large. AM maid service, PM turn down. With that said, I do not know that I would stay here again. We love Disney & have stayed at many properties. I think I would re-book at the Contemporay before going back to the GF. The resort is very nice, but as far as I am concerned it is the staff that make a resort 5 star & this is not a 5 star property. For it being WDW's flagship property - it was under par. I was told no several times at the quick service restaurant for simple things like chips instead of fries with my meal. Staff should not tell a guest no at a five start resort. Personally I think that this was due to the staff not speaking English as thier primary language. I understand that Disney is big on international travel - but the front line should speak and understand English enough to accomidate it's guests. I also have to mention the fact that our room was not ready upon our arrival - OK - we were a bit early - so we went & grabbed a bite to eat - but at 4:00 (3:00 check in) our room still was not ready. With a 3 year old in tow & 5:30 reservations at the castle - this did not make for a good start to our vacation & the front desk was not of any help nor was the fact that our bags were still not in our room. The resort is nice, it is clean, it is comfortable, but it is NOT 5 star. Disney should step it up for thier flagship property. I gave the resort a thumbs up - because it is clean & beautiful - but do not expect service with a normal 5 star resort.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian is the best resort to stay at while at Disney World.”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougewanderer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian a number of times over the last few years. The staff is extremely helpful. The hotel is very comfortable. The food is excellent, and the grounds are beautiful. The Magic Kingdom is only one monorail stop away. HInt: take the boat back to the hote from the Magic Kingdom. The Grand Floridian is the first stop. Frequently, we leave the Magic Kingdom during the day, enjoy the amenities of the hotel, and then return to the park for the evening. Staying here is expensive, but it is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Customer Service would make it excellent”
Reviews.Author: thetravelingbex
Reviews.Content: On arrival greeted by valet and bellman, both exceeded expectations. Checked in and everything was right on track for yet another perfect visit to see Mickey. After check in we went to the room in Boca Chica. Quickly greeted by bellman welsome with our bags. Hurried to the monorail for lunch at Chef Mickey's then spend the afternoon in Magic Kingdom. Arrived back at the hotel to rest and called front desk for information that led me to the gift shop, then back to the front desk because I was given the wrong information. When I discussed with the associate at the front desk, she had nothing positive to provide and the six others standing around pretended I was invisible. I had two other issues following this and my recommendation is Disney needs to send every person that works the front desk at GF on a 3 day Disney Cruise to learn true customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Wonderful Service”
Reviews.Author: VApuppy
Reviews.Content: I always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian and it was no disappontment when I finally did. The grounds are lovely and the rooms are beautiful. I stayed in Conch Key with a view of the castle and I could hear the Haunted Mansion at night. It is very expensive, but I enjoyed the easy access to Magic Kingdom and not having to fit the parking lot or bus crowds by using the monorail.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian is truly the most magical and wonderful hotels of all Disney properties!”
Reviews.Author: tinkerbell021
Reviews.Content: We are frequent visitors to Disney and have always enjoyed every one of our trips. This past October 2010, we visited and stayed at the Grand Floridian Resort and Spa. When we stepped off the Magical Express, we were greeted by Mike who called us by name and whisked us off to our room. Mike had one of the friendliest demeanors and greatest smiles!! Much to our surprise and delight, he informed us that we had been upgraded to the Conceirge club level. During our 5 day stay, we were treated like royalty. Our conceirge Joseph was absolutely the most helpful and friendly person. We were surprised by the amount of and quality of food we were provided during our stay. On our first night, we received champagne and a rose for our anniversary. Housekeeping was spectacular. This is truly the greatest hotel and every cast member who works there is so friendly and warm. We smiled the whole time we were there and did not want to leave. We thank every member of the Grand Floridian family for everything you do everyday to make guests feel special. We will always come back :)

Reviews.Title: “Once in a Lifetime: Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: ssh95
Reviews.Content: Our week at the Grand Floridian this past July was an absolute dream come true, once in a lifetime vacation. Every detail at the hotel is well thought out and enjoyable. We adored every minute of the trip and felt it was worth every penny.

Reviews.Title: “Best resort for families with young children”
Reviews.Author: KBrendel
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian was a beautiful resort just a quick trip from the Magic Kingdom, which was where we spent most of the week. The monorail trip to MK took a few minutes and the boat ride back to the resort was equally as quick. At the Grand Floridian we experienced top-notch service with the cleaning staff making rounds twice a day. The rooms were immaculate. Each day there were events for the kids at the pool and/or on the beach. The hotel lobby was lively and inviting. There are several dining options available at this location. This was our second time to the GF and we'll definitely stay there again next time. We were originally booked at the Polynesian as we wanted to try a different resort. After checking in and being displeased by the lack of cleanliness, we walked over the the GF to see if they could accomodate us. Fortunately, they had a vacancy and we moved directly over. When our bags arrived they showed up in our room at the GF with no issue.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: speaksmem
Reviews.Content: This hotel was beautiful, centrally located and very consumer friendly. The rooms are not extravagent or particularly large but are well decorated and CLEAN. There is a veranda also that is nice. The shops and restaurants are great also.

Reviews.Title: “noise, golf trolleys trying to run you down”
Reviews.Author: boro888
Reviews.Content: This is the 5th time we stayed at the hotel. Very nice and the staff are friendly it was so busy this time. The 'golf' trolleys seemed to have right of way on the walk ways and not much regard for people walking. So much exterior work going, painting and the equipment fumes and excessive noise. The gardens were re-turfed and again machinery really spoilt the holiday this time round. The hotel cannot justify the very high prices for a holiday hotel and next time we will rent a holiday home to have piece and quite. We also had the Disney dinning plan and never understood how its works and whats a snack, meal or dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: diasron
Reviews.Content: Each day like they use to say is a magical day!! All of employes are always smiling to serve you ... 24 hours a day !!

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Momdisney_10
Reviews.Content: Traveled with my teenage daughter for 1 week at the hotel. Had a great time-so convenient to the parks, great staff-they were all so helpful and friendly. Had no problems or concerns. Since it was just the 2 of us the room was fine. It could sleep up to 5 and if that were the case I would think it would be too small. The hotel was beautiful and we didn't have enough time to enjoy all the charms of the hotel. Would definately stay again and will be planning a return trip soon.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful as usual”
Reviews.Author: oodlesofnoodles1
Reviews.Content: I love love love this hotel. The staff are friendly, the hotel is stunning, and, unlike what others have said, the property was in immaculate condition when I was there. I was there at Christmas, summer and am returning for October. I do not visit the parks when I visit central Florida - the hotel is enough of a draw.

Reviews.Title: “Flagship hotel wonderful but AK still our favorite!”
Reviews.Author: tripladyboston
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian was a wonderful hotel. We stayed in Sugar Loaf which is a Club Level building. When we first checked in our room had a strong odor (Chlorine?) and we asked to be moved. They were very accommodating. The service is excellent and as with most Disney properties the buildings and grounds are well maintained. I have no complaints but don't think this hotel which is Disney's Flagship, is any better than some of the other deluxe hotels. We have stayed at all the deluxe properties, as well as many of the moderate and have found all the rooms to be comparable, just themed differently. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is still our favorite because at least there you get to see the animals. All of the other hotels are just nice hotels. I would probably not pay the extra money again for the Floridian, as the service, grounds, rooms etc are just as nice at the AKL or Polynesian for less. The AKL club level also has better snacks, food :)

Reviews.Title: “Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaB88
Reviews.Content: So convenient to all the parks with the monorail station at the hotel complex. Beautiful location on the Lake with cruises, lighted character floats, and night fireworks display. Many options for dining, shopping, and relaxing from quick and casual to sit down dinners and character events. Great customer service with poolside refreshments.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time Again”
Reviews.Author: dichma
Reviews.Content: I have read past reviews on this hotel and boy are they wrong. Nothing but Grand service from all the staff, always smiling and saying hello in the 7 days at the resort I had not seen one sourpuss in the bunch. Pool was spotless the grounds immaculate the food spectacular. Yes the food was expensive but Disney is expensive!! I would stay at this hotel anytime Disney has discounts posted on their website. We had a room right next to the elevator and still slept the night away. They did have some painting being done on the backside of the main building but it never interfered with the operation of the hotel operation was smooth and professionally run.

Reviews.Title: “We hope to go back in the future.”
Reviews.Author: LoveMyVacations48
Reviews.Content: We celebrated our 40th anniversary and our family came with us. The hotel is beautiful and the staff is outstanding.The concierge level is special and Citricos is tops-Jamie is the best waiter ever. There is work being done which caused some problems-the odor of oil-based paint, the noise of pressure washing in the main entrance and more painting, etc. but I guess maintenance is an ongoing process. They should buy new pillows-the ones they have are not up to standard and are small and lumpy.

Reviews.Title: “A simply magical stay and a simply magical resort!”
Reviews.Author: Jake100
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian for the fourth time and continue to be amazed. We were traveling with a party of 6 adults, my parents, twin sister and our boyfriends! We were planning on having 2 connecting rooms in Big Pine Key. When we got off the magical express bus we were greeted by an hotel employee who wisked our group away to a 2-bedroom suite in the Sugarloaf building! We were upgraded to conceirge level with no charge. It is the simpliest things that makes this resort the grandest their is. We would no stay anywhere else due to the amenties the resort offers and the convience in transportation to Magic Kingdom and the monorail itself! Disney is the happiest place on earth and cannot wait to reutrn again next year!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel, Marvelous Service”
Reviews.Author: Becky33
Reviews.Content: We stayed here September 02 - September 06, 2010 for a quick trip to Disney World for my son's 7th birthday and couldn't have been happier with our choice of hotel. The location is absolutely fabulous on the monorail with direct service to the Magic Kingdom and ease to Epcot. We arrived with our own arranged transportation. We used Legacy Towncar and paid $250.00 for a stretch limo round trip. This also included a 20 minute stop at a grocery store for anything we wanted to pick up for our room/holiday. They were very good, on time and we didn't need to sit on a bus waiting for other people and the same for the ride back to the airport.. We arrived at the Grand Floridian at 2:30pm on Thursday and our room was ready. We had reserved a Standard Room Club Level. We were in an outer building, Sugar Loaf, and it couldn't have been better.. We were directly across from the 24 hour pool which was great. The pool was warm. It was such a great way to end a busy day at the parks with an anytime warm swim. The concierge level includes snacks and drinks all day in the lobby of the sugar loaf building, all of which were of superb quality. Our room 6063, was not at all run down. It was very clean and the furniture in perfect condition. The entire staff is to be praised for their friendly attitude and kindness. Every level from the housekeepers to grounds keepers up to managers, bell staff and even the store employees. We did not run into one unpleasant staff person. We did arrange for the birthday package for our first night to be delivered to our room for our son. It included presents from 5 of the main Disney characters in huge boxes with amazing colored ribbons. If you are having a childs birthday at Disney this is a wonderful surprise. We walked up to the room and there was a big sash on the door, the room was decorated and then all the gifts. The cost is approx. $500.00 USD but what a fun time it was. The spa is very nice. It is a bit of a walk, but worth it when you get there. I had a spa pedicure for $65.00 and was expecting to pay much more. Very good value. If you are thinking about staying here, do not hesitate. You will not be sorry.

Reviews.Title: “a peaceful break from the Parks”
Reviews.Author: novalauren
Reviews.Content: what a beautiful hotel... The Grand Floridian is Disney meets elegant resort.
