Everything is beautifully maintained and upper class with a touch of Disney that sneaks in...like Disney character topiaries on the bathroom wallpaper. The rooms are nicely sized as are the balconies, complete with two chairs and a small table. It was a joy to sit on the balcony at night and watch the parkgoers return with a drink in hand. Yes, the bathrooms have tubs and not oversized showers but it is meant for children---who take baths! Previous reviewers seem to forget that---the main intention of this resort is to service families and mostly families with young children. The sink area is NOT small. It is a wide double sink in a separate vanity area. is it overpriced for what you get? Maybe. Look for deals. I received a pin code from Disney for 40% off so we splurged on concierge. This was great. We stayed in Sugar Loaf. There was always a food and beverage offering. What a delight. I have stayed at St. Regis New York, Ritz Carlton, Four Seasons...and no, it is not that. But it is not meant to be that. I would not feel comfortable bringing my 2 year old son to those hotels...but I felt perfectly at ease with him at the GF...yet still felt I was in an elegant hotel without Mickey screaming all over it. I also visited the spa which I would HIGHLY recommend.

Reviews.Title: “As good as it gets in Disney - but not the Ritz!!”
Reviews.Author: Fight4OldDC
Reviews.Content: Pros: 1. Incredible location on the monorail. First stop is Magic Kingdom. Take the boat back as it is the last stop back. 2. Beautiful property - with two pools, kid friendly restuarants with game room. And had a feel that both adults and kids could love. 3. Club level was worth it - had 24 hour drinks and great snacks. 5 servings per day. 4. Flight checkin available the day of your flight and they take your luggage to the airport for you. 5. Smells and ambiance were excellent - music playing from a piano and clean hallways. 6. Fabulous that if you are a hotel guest, you can go to the park early or stay late on certain days. Called Extra Magic hours. 7. Great check in process and Concierge. Cons. 1. Monorail doesnt run frequently - 7 minutes or more. Terrible that they dont run more as the park closes after fireworks and you wait 30 or more minutes. 2. Club room - was small. No more than an average size for a ridiculous price point. 3. Bathroom - was like a motel. Terrible bath tub. Low water pressure. Small sink areas. 4. Nice balcony - but paid for a park view of Magic Kingdom and mostly saw palm trees. 5. Bedding seemed a little outdated as did the carpet. Bottom line: I had a 8 year old and 7 year old. We had a ball but feel the price to value for the room wasnt appropriate. The grounds and locations and service cant be beat. Disney - PLEASE RUN MONORAILS MORE OFTEN - PARTICULARLY AFTER FIREWORKS WHEN EVERYONE IS TRYING TO COME HOME.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: dscott1989
Reviews.Content: We received a complimentary upgrade in the Sugar Loaf Building which is a concierge building at no extra charge. They greeted us as soon ase we arrived at the resort and escorted us directly to the Sugar Loaf where we met with the concierge. He took care of all our needs for the rest of our stay whether it was dinner reservations, park hoppers to the parks,etc. The hotel itself was magnificent. Great Pools, restaurants, spa. It was truly a wonderful experience

Reviews.Title: “Dream hotel that did not live up to our dreams.”
Reviews.Author: olivictor7
Reviews.Content: For 18 years we have dreamed about staying in this hotel and booked with friends in May 2009. It wasn't cheap but hey this was our dream! First impression very good, check in staff were helpful and the lobby was very impressive. Nice room in Sago Cay - spacious and clean but the bathroom was in need of a little updating. We didn't even mind the renovation work taking place as it was unobtrusive and we were aware before we arrived that work was ongoing. So where did the dream go wrong? Disney dining plan!!!!! Nice idea and can see the logic why Disney have done it but confusing for guests and staff alike. We found there was no consistency in charging- particularly when using the grill restaurant, where from 1 day to the next you never knew what the charge would be. To make reservations was also very "hit and miss" - when you are staying for 14 days you haven't necessarily organised every single day . Big mistake as we found out - you need to as you won't get your preferred choice. Also be prepared to have to wait for your table even when booked. Call me naive but as a Disney deluxe 5* hotel and being prepared to pay 5* prices, we expected to receive 5* treatment and experience the magic of Disney. Most of the time we just felt like a number in a very very busy hotel. Dont get me wrong - we had a good holiday and when summing up this hotel would say 5* location but that is predominantly what you are paying for.

Reviews.Title: “DISNEYWORLD ENGAGEMENT”
Reviews.Author: Butterflydc
Reviews.Content: I booked a room at The Grand Floridian Resort and Spa as I had planned to propose to my long term girlfriend there. I had been planning this for several months and was hoping for everything to be perfect and run according to plan. I had very high expectations having read reviews of the hotel and conducting research on the Walt Disney World website. However my experience was far from perfect and far from Magical. Upon opening the door to our room, we were at first very happy with everything. I had paid extra for the Magic Kingdom view and this is what I received. However after being in the room for about five minutes my girlfriend told me her shoes were sticking to the carpet. Upon closer inspection the entire carpet was sopping wet. It would seem the carpet had been shampooed but not dried afterwards. I could not believe such an oversight could have been allowed. I immediately phoned the front desk to make them aware of the situation and see how this could be resolved. After a lengthy call it was agreed we would be upgraded to a honeymoon suite and be given concierge access. I was guaranteed it would have the same view of the Magic Kingdom. With much excitement we went to the front desk to collect our new keys. Upon arrival at the room the first thing we did was to check the view. I was shocked to see that a tree was just in front of our room and virtually obscured all views of the Magic Kingdom. By his time we were over an hour late for our dinner reservation. Another call was made to the front desk to try and resolve the matter. However we found the members of staff increasingly difficult deal with over the phone so we left the room to continue the conversation with the front desk manager on duty that night. I was very frustrated at the way I was treated. My plans for the proposal by this time were completely ruined and I felt physically sick from the stress of the situation. I felt that the front desk manager was not sympathetic to our problems and really could not have cared less. She kept mentioning how I had paid such a low rate and how they had already upgraded us. She felt that was enough; however the fact was, I did not get the view I paid extra for. After much discussion it was agreed we would view another suite, this time with no Magic Kingdom view. We accepted the room, as by this time it was very late. Due to the great inconvenience caused to us, I requested some form of compensation. Treating us to dinner would have been sufficient; however we were advised that nothing like this was possible. After much bargaining we were offered complimentary park hopper tickets and water park tickets for the next day worth about $500. Having spent such a great deal of time planning this trip, for my plans to be destroyed due to the hotels incompetence just shocked me. I never would have expected this from Disney. Next time I’ll be booking a Marriott!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely stay at a lovely resort with little elegant touches”
Reviews.Author: ead979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian last weekend, and we had a wonderful stay. Our room was nicely decorated and featured some nice Disney touches like small Mickey silhouettes hidden in the upholstery and more. The room was soundproofed nicely, which is always nice when you need some extra sleep. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I even got a special little surprise in our room for my birthday. The nightly turndown service is a nice touch, and one evening we returned to find roses in our towels. We will be back when we're looking for a little touch of luxury and pampering.

Reviews.Title: “Really great, but expensive.”
Reviews.Author: GFHotel
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great experience, but was expensive. One restaurant, 1900 park fare, has good atmosphere, food was ok, not great, and it was too expensive for a buffet style dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Brazil/Smith/Charles Gather Oct 1-7 2008”
Reviews.Author: Bonnbon40
Reviews.Content: Smith Family 1st ever visit. ( I was here for 50th b-day). We had rooms on the water facing Polensian. 2 rooms w/balcony. Watched fireworks from pool 1st night as we got in too late to visit park. This hotel is great as you don't need a bus to get to 2 of the parks and it is a fast ride to them. Bus rides to other parks was pleasant. Children got to meet their Great Aunt who worked for Disney when they were building DIsney. She had storie to tell. Waterview rooms may cost more but view is marvelous. Saw hot air balloons a couple of mornings. Water lights parade was fun. We did "Not so scary Halloween party". The children loved getting up close and peronal with characters that are hard to get to.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rug101_07
Reviews.Content: We took the trip from July 25-29 with a 2, 5, and 6 year old. Make sure to get a disney express from the airport. The luggage service is fantasitc...no hassling with bags to and from the airport. Just make sure to pack shorts, bath suit, etc. in your carry-on as it takes 3-4 hours to get your bags. Upon arrival, 4 people greeted us at the bus...yes 4. Other hotels we stopped at first had no one meeting the bus. They escorted us to the check-in desk and announced our name to the clerk....nice touch. We arrived pretty early (10:30) and our room was ready. However, upon arrival, we noticed that the maid had yet to make a visit. Little bit of a bummer, but we just went to the pool. The room was a bit packed with 5 of us, but the couch changes into a bed so we all had a place to sleep. When visiting the MK, take the monorail as it's the first stop. Take the boat home as GF is the first stop...plus it's a nice way to travel after a long day at the park. If you take the monorail home, GF is the last stop. We brought metal water bottles to the park and it was a big money saver. Every drink stop at disney will give you a cup of ice for free. To say it was hot would be an understatement. Try to hit the parks early, take a break in the afternoon and head back at night. And find air conditioned rides / shows. We only went to the pool by the lagoon as it had a great waterside for the kids. It's a great way to keep them busy. Service at the hotel was great. I would stay here again, but make sure to look for the deals as full price is a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond very high expectations”
Reviews.Author: AlexGrace
Reviews.Content: We got a very good deal (40% off) by watching those Disney emails. We took advantage further by staying at their concierge level. Definitely a good move- and the Sugar Loaf was another plus ($1k less than the main bldg, but only 20 ft away from it). Concierge staff were amazing-- especially Robert. We comfortably fit 5 people in our room. The daybed was made up each day into a couch and at night into a bed for my 10 year old. 2 very well sized queens were extremely comfortable for the other 4 of us (grandma, 5 year old, hubby, and me). Extremely worth it to not worry about breakfasts, snacks, etc. All were included in the concierge level. Even made a dinner out of the "appetizer" one night. Heavy apps were enough for even a very hungry man. Wine and beer choices were very good. Pool was a blast and there are several extras that they don't tell you about- campfire, movies on the beach. Be sure to take advantage of the online check-in, magic express, and baggage service. (Just pack a swimsuit in your carry-on or you'll regret not being able to jump in the pool right away).

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel!”
Reviews.Author: NYGIA
Reviews.Content: Stayed here during wedding planning (we're having a Disney Fairy Tale Wedding). It was really close to the Wedding Pavilion, and monorail stops there so it's quick access to the parks. The rooms were nice and clean and loved the 'mickey mouse ears' towels they had on the bed, but didn't feel like a luxury hotel at all. The rooms are kinda small, and don't like any different than the Holiday Inn bedding that I stayed at earlier in the week. Room wasn't ready at check-in, they said they would send us a text message when it was ready but never did... :(. Still, a beautiful hotel, nice clean rooms, pools are nice and not overcrowded like other hotel we stayed at. Definitely not worth the $400/night+ price tag.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: CEL67
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GF in 2007 for my 40th birthday. On the basis of our experience we booked a suprise visit this year for my parents to travel with us. We were not disappointed. The service was excellent from arrival through to departure - yes, it is expensive, but you get what you pay for. One evening we went to the Port Orleans resort where we had previously stayed and enjoyed good service - in fact we went to see if 'Bob' was still doing the same act in the bar - he was! Anyway, going back to Port Orleans made us realise just how good the GF was. There have been some comments posted about the 'construction'. The GF is currently carrying out some repainting of the exterior - it is a wooden building, it needs to be done at some time, and though there was one day when the most convenient entrance to the main building was closed off, in general I thought that the handling of the work was done quite sympathetically. Last time we stayed we had a room in the main building. This time we had a 2 bed suite in the outer lodge - it was enormous. I have two very minor negatives - 1) the character dining has been switched to the Park Lane restaurant which did not have the same ambiance as the Floridian Cafe and felt a little too much like a production line and 2) the bar prices are extortionate compared both to other Disney locations and other 'expensive' Florida locations. I would recommend the GF to anyone who is looking for a special treat.

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Avp415
Reviews.Content: I love EVERYTHING about this hotel. The staff goes over and beyond to make you feel at home. The food is delicious and they have a great variety of restaurants. They have great character meetings. Afternoon Tea is a MUST DO. The spa is well.....ahhhhhh-mazing! You could plan a trip to Disney and never leave this hotel....boat rentals, great pool, little beach, spa, great food, arcade, movies under the stars.....ok ok ok you get it! I just cant say enough good about this place, and on top of all that the rooms are absolutely luxurious. YOU GET WHAT YOU PAY FOR- ENOUGH SAID :)

Reviews.Title: “Overall Disaster!!!”
Reviews.Author: SaraRothe
Reviews.Content: We just stayed here for our honeymoon! We spent four nights. I would have to say that this resort had the worst customer service. It was convenient being on the monorail but when it came to the bus transportation to the other resorts this takes about an hour or longer!!! They need more buses!! The rooms were very overpriced for what we got!!!! The room wasn't very clean. Fridge was broken and had to call several times to get it fixed. We will definately stay at another resort next visit to Disney! I was very disappointed with this resort.

Reviews.Title: “suprised by the lack of service”
Reviews.Author: disneyfanatic11
Reviews.Content: My husband and my two children and I stayed her for 8 days. This is the second year we have stayed her and last year, we loved it! Here are the positive aspects to the hotel: You are on the monorail, very convenient. The lobby is beautiful and smells wonderful. The pools are gorgeous. The rooms are not the cleanest. Our comforter had chocolate on it and was in desperate need of washing (or replaced). The curtains also had someting stained on them and the carpets really need to be either steam cleaned or replaced. I didn't bother to even tell the hotel this because when we checked in, I was told twice, "we are sold out". I had originally booked a marina view, called twice beforehand to check and it was confirmed but when we arrived, no marina view was available. Our room was in Boca Chica facing the pool. It was a nice view during the day however, since the pool is open 24 hours, it is really loud all hours of the night. I can deal with that, its vacation after all but what I was really bothered by was all the construction. From 9 am on, all you hear is drilling, beeping, sawing, etc. It was really hot so we decided to stay at the pool during the days. It was no relaxing. Pretty yes, but noisy. Here's the final disappointment, on Saturday, I slipped going into the pool. The stairs are extremely slippery. I fell and broke two of my toes and sprained one while cutting the bottom of my foot pretty deep. The hotel sent the paramedics up to my room, the examined me and said "no big deal, just a bruise". I did choose not to go to the hospital so that's on me. I spent the next two days in a wheelchair going around the hotel and the parks. NOT ONCE DID ANYONE FROM THE HOTEL CALL AND SEE IF I WAS OKAY OR NEEDED ANYTHING. In my opion, for the money it costs to stay at this hotel and the cost in Disney overall, a simple phone call or note would have really made a difference. I am huge Disney fan and we travel here at least every other year. I sit here today, with a very painful injury and a dissappointed feeling for the placed I love so much.

Reviews.Title: “Disney Grand Floridian not so grand!”
Reviews.Author: chocollette
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian on 7/29 in building 8, in a lagoon view room. We have stayed at your hotel, and many other Disney Resorts. I was sorely disappointed in the room and the service! The room looked no nicer than a Holiday Inn express with a need for a remodel. The main out door area was in construction, and we had to walk around equiptment.The bedding looked like it could have been from a Motel 6, old and scratchy.The bed was extremely uncomfortable, and the pillows were sub-standard. The fridge in our room didn't work. ( We called, and still no repair!)The carpet in the sink area smelled like urine. We didn't get our luggage til' 3 hours later, after several calls. Finally, I called the manager and explained that because of this, we missed our dinner reservations at 6:30 in China in epcot. They kindly made some other reservations for us in France at 8:30. So we missed the fireworks, which was our favorite part of Epcot!!! The extended hours at Epcot was a joke, the rides were still 50 min. wait, don't even bother! I am truly disappointed in your deluxe resort. The price for your rooms are at a 5 star price, and the rooms are definately 3 star!

Reviews.Title: “Grand!”
Reviews.Author: jMarg27
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian really is a good name for this hotel! It totally fits the bill. We checked-in on July 29th. We were personally greeted in the Porte Cochere and brought the front desk where Georgia checked us in. She was still "Earning her Ears," however she did a very good job and got us a ready room. We were in Room 8120 (Boca Chica, 1st floor.) I wasn't very happy about getting a 1st floor room, but I wasn't going to make her switch our room. The room itself was great! It was standard with two queen beds, day bed, desk, fridge, flat screen TV, separate vanities, and an okay shower. The room had a nice patio, however it was directly next to the front entrance of Boca Chica. Note: if you are staying here within the next month, know that they are doing major renovations to the exteriors of the buildings from 9-5pm. We had only two problems: one; the room was noisy due to the proximity to the entrance and elevators, and the fridge was loud; and two; the remote was awful. Other than that, it was perfect and very close to the pool. The first night we were there, a maid knocked on our door and introduced herself. She asked if we "wouldn't mind" if she turned down our beds between 7-9pm. We, of course, said sure! The turndown service was a nice touch (and free.) The beds were turned back, you were given high quality Belgian chocolate, and your TV was playing classical music similar to what you hear in the lobby every night. Oh yeah, that's another thing; a band or amazing piano player are performing in the lobby every night from 5-10pm. The pools were amazing as well. The Courtyard Pool, which was 10 steps from our building, was nice because it was open 24 hours and it was somewhat quiet. The Beach Pool was the themed pool. It was a little small, it was noisy, and crowded. It was only open from 10-10pm (probably because that pool needs the lifeguards.) This pool was home to the waterslide and a beautiful rock waterfall. Both pools had full service bars and served food. Note: if you go to Disney in the summer, don't plan on cooling off in the pool. They feel like hot tubs. Another thing that set the Grand Floridian apart from the Polynesian and Contemporary is that it was the only resort that was actually cool and refreshing to walk into. We ate and shopped at both the Polynesian and Contemporary and they were pretty warm inside. The monorail is probably one of the main things that jacks up the price at the Floridian, but it is SO convenient. There is really not a bad thing to say about this hotel! From the moment we stepped off the Magical Express to the moment we stepped on, it was absolutely perfect. Trust me, if you ever are planning a trip here and have a little extra money handy, STAY HERE! You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: spiegel75
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Floridian was very relaxing and comfortable. Hotel staff were very friendly. The rooms were spacious, always a plus when travelling with young children. There was also ample space to just wander around the resort and enjoy the lush greenery and views of the lagoon. Lynda Hower at Dream Makers Servies helped with the bookings and arrangements for our trip. She did a fabulous job and I highly recommend getting in touch with her to plan for a trip to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN !!!! disney shouldnt try to run hotels”
Reviews.Author: SAIMOHAN
Reviews.Content: i'm a gold member with starwood and marriott , have stayed in my fair share of good and awesome hotels worldwide and know when $ 600++ food ,etc is well spent and when i've been had with publicity !!!!! the rooms were damp and old . the bathrooms were small ... thier food was aweful ... the service - didnt exist the maids were sullen , to say the least . NOTHING was good at this property !!!!!! we had planned to stay here for 6 nites checked out after 3 went to sheraton vistana villages @$300 per nite and life was beautyful once again ...

Reviews.Title: “Location, location,location!!”
Reviews.Author: plaughter67
Reviews.Content: We reserved a castle view room on the bottom floor. The view was simply fabulous. We watched the fire works and water parade from our room. What a treat. Definitely worth the price difference to get the view. We had a group of 4 teenagers and they were able to hop on the monorail and go to the parks unsupervised and safely. That convenience was great. My husband is in a wheelchair and the hotel was very accesible however the room was a very tight fit for a chair. Housekeeping quickly came and removed some un needed furniture to make more room Only a couple of downsides...Our room was very noisy and dated. We could hear every sound in the hall as if it was in our room. The furniture was very dated and needed replacing. The counterservice food was pretty horrible. That could definitely use improving. Otherwise...just loved it!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SAC5286
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while my mother-in-law was on a business trip. We lived in Orlando but since she was staying there we decided to spend a night as well. We had an amazing Magic Kingdom view where we watched the fireworks from the balcony. The water sports are great, plenty of nice restaurants, and the pool is great. Being in a concierge building made it better because we had snacks, hor d'oeuvres, and great cast members to help with anything we needed. Great hotel, but I would rather stay at a Moderate (Port Orleans Riverside) or Value (Pop Century) and splurge the money in the parks and on dining as opposed to just a night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much I didn't want to leave!!”
Reviews.Author: mandmleal
Reviews.Content: We were ceIebrating our 20th anniversary and we were looking for a special place. I did research many Disney Resorts and we decided on the Grand Floridian. We definitely made the right choice. As soon as you walk into the main building, it takes your breath away. The Victorian style views, inside and out are amazing! Our room had a fabulous view of the lagoon and the Magic Kingdom caslte. At night we were able to see the fire works from our balcony. The way the fire works reflected on the lagoon gave it an extra touch. I will hold that memory dear to my heart. The entire staff ( bell hop, valet, greeter, house keeper, concierge, etc.) were helpful and friendly. They always had a smile on their face. They did everything possible to make our stay more enjoyable. If you can afford it, we recommend the concierge service. The concierge lounge had delicious complimentary snacks, drinks, desserts from 7a.m to 10 p.m. We enjoyed the views and the music while we ate. Your concierge can also help you with tickets, reservations, or any questions you may have. Our concierge was able to help us extend our stay without us having to make more reservations. Our plans were to enjoy the Grand Floridian then move to the Contemporary resort. But after one day at the Grand we didn't want to leave! Our concierge was able to cancel our Contemporary reservation and extend our stay at the Grand while we enjoyed the theme parks. We didnt have to worry about anything. We stayed for 5 days and I wish we could have stayed for more. I would recommend this resort for a relaxing or romantic vacation. Tip: Use the boat transportation to get to the Magic Kingdom. The views are amazing! Take pictures!!! Tip: If you like it tropical, pick the Poly Resort, but ask for the lagoon view. If you like it modern, pick the Contemporary Resort, but ask for a lagoon view. If you like a relaxing atmosphere, definitly pick the Grand Floridian, but ask for a lagoon view!

Reviews.Title: “Best DisneyWorld Resort”
Reviews.Author: TVWalker
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is by far the best DisneyWorld resort and I've stayed in most of them. I had made the mistake of booking us into the Polynesian but realised my error as soon as we saw our room and therefore requested a transfer the first day (see my Polynesian review). The Grand Floridian is a little bit more expensive but totally worth it. We stayed in a club level theme park view room which was lovely as you could sit on the balcony and watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks, you could even hear the music! The Grand Floridian Resort is beautiful and smells like fresh flowers. It always felt very relaxed and never hectic or busy and there always seemed to be an abundance of cast members around to assist you should you need anything. The restaurant choice is good and the lemon cheesecake in the bar is to die for. Having stayed at the Grand Floridian I would only want to come back to the Grand Floridian but if I were to recommend any of the other resorts I would say the Caribbean Beach and Yacht Club/Beach Club are also very nice. I'd recommend staying away from the Polynesian unless you get it cheap. HAVE A MAGICAL DAY! :-)

Reviews.Title: “A Magnificent hotel”
Reviews.Author: CTom23
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is exactly that, Grand. We stayed in the Sugar Loaf building at Concierge level and it is definitely worth the extra money with goodies available all day. The personal check in was a nice touch and when you enter the reception the Disney quality and Grandeur are evident everywhere you look. The facilities are excellent as well as the efficiency and friendliness of the staff. We were particularly grateful to our Concierge Bren for her professionalism and kindness which made our wedding anniversary stay very special. We would certainly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Hard to Sleep at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: alstonk
Reviews.Content: I have never stayed in a hotel that is so noisy. We stayed in the main building on the concierge floor. After a long day of travel we wanted to go to bed early (at 9pm) which was impossible because of the bass from the band shaking our room. We did not know a full eight piece band plays inside the main lobby (on the 2nd floor) that echoes throughout the hotel including inside the rooms I called the front desk and was told the band stops playing at 10pm. That was not good for us because we had a 2.5 year old that stayed up. The halls are vacuumed every night between 3am-4am and that woke us up every night. The second morning we awoke to the grass being cut and men using blowers at 5am just outside our room. When I called to complain I was told that is just the time the landscape crew gets started. The last morning we were there I heard a very loud noise coming from the emergency stairwell at 3:45am. It woke all of us up and my wife asked for me to see what was going on, when I went into the stairwell a man was using a high speed drill to clean the stairs. I asked him to stop and he did thankfully but it was tough getting back to sleep. While I love a clean hotel the maids had no problem running vacuums while we were eating breakfast in the mornings right next to us. Otherwise it was great but considering how much we paid each night for a room I do not understand how management allows for all the noise.

Reviews.Title: “A Dream Come True”
Reviews.Author: carribeanqueen25
Reviews.Content: This hotel is truly one of the best hotels in Disney. The Grand Floridian is right next to The Magic Kingdom which is good because all we had to do is hop on the monerail and we were there in a minute. The service was great and when we were out in the parks and bought soemthing, we were able to have it delivered right to our room. There are also a few stores there and a very convenient snack bar that had all night service for pizzia and a very nice grill that was opened to I think 11:00. There was an eating area with a small arcade. They had two pools. One had a waterslide, and the other one was very big and it had a hot tub. Overall this hotel was a great place to stay and the rooms were great despite the very small bathroom.

Reviews.Title: “A great quiet place for our family and our autistic daughter to unwind.”
Reviews.Author: Glenn1977
Reviews.Content: This resort was the most beautiful one I have ever stayed at. You are greeted by the wonderful smells, sights, sounds of the lobby. The actual room price was a bit high, but thanks to the room discount we could afford to stay there with a Magic Kingdom view. Mousekeeping was great and clean up everyday. My kids loved the turndown service because they left chocolates. We received a bottle champange and a rose for our anniversary which was a nice touch. The room was quiet and we got to see the Magic Kingdom fireworks every night. If you can afford it or get the room discount and stay here. The transportation was quick and efficient even during crowded conditions. We never waited more than a few minutes. Avoid the summer and the holidays if you can, we left just as the memorial day holiday crowd was gearing up and it was incredibly crowded at the parks. The cast members are extremely helpful. Our middle daughter wandered off and security immediately found here and brought her to us. She didn't even realize she was lost. Too many wonderful experiences to list in this post. A few tips, buy a good touring book like the Unofficial Guide to Walt Disney World. This will give you great tips and resources. We saved a lot of money and time just by reading and following the guide's recommendations. We also discovered extra things to help us have a great time. We recommend Kid's Nite Out for a private sitting service. The sitter was great and called anytime she had a question or concern. Do the advance reservations and a few character meals. We saved a lot of time getting autographs from them. Although, we still meet the princesses and Mickey & Minnie in toontown.

Reviews.Title: “A superb venue that hits your wallet hard”
Reviews.Author: familymummy
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian has 'it'. Superb imagineering makes it a very sumptious Victorian Venue. Staff were generally well informed and polite, facilities are good with 2 good pools, speedy access to magic kingdom on the mono rail and buses to all other parks ( Epcot is 2 linked mono rail journey's). But beware - food is expensive. Gasparillo's offers the cheapest deal, it is a 'cafe' with some loud slot machine games and tables overlooking a small marin. Best idea is to get a soda refill mug from there and soft drinks are free on tap for the rest of the holiday whilst in this resort. The ground floor Grand Floridian Cafe gave us a good meal, but at 115 dollars for a drink and main course each we found it tasty but expensive. Tipping is recommended at 18 - 20% on resort also. Towels are small but readily available poolside. The beach pool offers a lovely slide feature children will love as well as an evening of beach marshmallows or smores from 8pm ( advertised from 3 dollars but we found free) then sit on a recliner chair and watch a disney film on the beach in the warmth from 9pm each night. No time for jet lag, so much to do. We earnt this trip by Pampered Chef so did not choose the date, however schools finish in the US in mid June so from now til September the parks are heaving, packed with lots of people, hot in the extreme (98 on arrival and throughout the stay - stormy in the afternoon - beware water parks on thundery days, the close due to risk when there is lightning, same with pools!), so if staying in resort use the magic hours and get there ( any Disney theme park EARLY). Good hotel but only if you have a sizeable budget for food and drink.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect place”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan13
Reviews.Content: Okay, this is a very expensive hotel, but its worth the splurge. We stayed in a theme park view room in the Royal Palm Club (main building) and loved every minute of it. A cast member met us at the front and took us up to our room bypassing check in. The room was very clean and spacious and the view amazing. We sat on our balcony and watched the fireworks over the castle 8 straight nights. There are several very good restaurants on site. Narcooseees is our favorite, and Citricos and V & A are also nice. The kids loved the two pools and beach area. The Royal Palm Club was an excellent place to relax with a drink and listen to the orchestra in the evening. We also enjoyed the spa and the sea raycers that you can rent to drive around the lagoon. All in all a terrific hotel and we can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldnt think about staying somewhere else!”
Reviews.Author: LAURIELLN
Reviews.Content: I thought the "Grand Floridian" met & exeeded all my expectations. I took advantage of their 40% Off room rate, & opted to go with the cheapest room available (Garden view). I believe I was upgrraded for I had a view of the lake/river...but was not told upon check-in of the upgrade, so your guess was as good as mine. I dont mind spending $500.00/night for a hotel room, but figured I'd only be sleeping here, and there was no need to spend more for a better view. I stayed here to celebrate my 40th birthday. Upon check-in, I was given a "Happy Birthday" button to wear, which I do suggest wearing for every character & Disney employee would wish me a "Happy Birthday". It actually was fun for the first day or two, for I would also get free birthday desserts when I went out to eat on Disney property. The room was spacious, again, even though I reserved the cheapest room available. It had a couch, flat-screen tv, full-size balcony with (2) wrought-iron chairs...which were not too comfy to sit on for a long time! Every room at this hotel has a balcony....but the views vary with each room. The monorail (located on the 2nd floor of the main bldg) was convenient, not waiting anymore than 5-minutes for one. The monorail makes exactly (5) stops only: "Grand Floridian Hotel", "Magic Kindom", "Contemporary" Hotel, "TATC" (ticket & transportation ctr), & "Polynesian". Its just loops all day to those (5) stops. if you want to go to "Epcot", you have to get off at the "TATC" (tickets & transportation ctr) and change to another monorail there to the "Epcot" monorail. If you want to go to "Hollywood Studios (formally MGM studios), "Downtown Disney", "Typhoon Lagoon", or "Animal Kindom", you can only take the Disney Bus, for the monorail is not connected to those parks. The bus picks you up in the front of the "Grand Floridian" and runs every 15-20 minutes continously through-out the day/night. All free, of course! Getting back to teh hotel itself..........it is beautiful!! The pictures do not do it justice. I agree with other reviewers when they say they could get a better room for cheaper money if they stayed at a Hyatt or Four Seasons.....but the "Floridian" is the best Disney Property if you want the convenience of being on Disney grounds...which was perfect for us...for when it got too hot or if it rained, we were able to hop on the monorail or bus back to the hotel in a jiffy, and then back to the parks later in the evening, with little or no effort. So, if you want the convenience, then stay here. If that does not matter, and you want more bang for your buck, & dont mind driving your car & sitting in traffic to get to the parks, then stay off grounds. Our room was furthest from the main building, but, again, I didnt care...for the walk didnt bother me. The room was quiet, clean, and very big! We had an end-unit room, but never heard our neighbor on the other side. Around 9am, "mouse-keeping" would start cleaning the rooms above us, and we would hear the banging from the vacuum and such, but never heard a peep before 9am. Staff was 50/50...some were either very nice/friendly, others had miserable looks on their faces & wouldnt even match eyes with you...but, the majority of staff were wonderful!

Reviews.Title: “A Dream to Remember”
Reviews.Author: mommy7878
Reviews.Content: My twin sons made Eagle scout with the Boy Scouts so we decided to make this a memorable occasion and stay at this beautiful place. Hotel is not the word that does justice to this beauty of an establishment, let's call it heaven on earth. From the moment you step out of your vehicle you are transported into another world that envelopes you in luxury and beauty. Even walking to the rooms from the main lobby is a joy as there are fragrant roses and flowers everywhere and the place is impeccably clean and trimmed. There is not even a stray flower petal anywhere as the gardeners are in abundance. The rooms are spacious and lovely and the balcony looking outside your window is draped in lovely lace. You open your windows and can hear the yachts clanging their bells daintily. I felt I was in another era and even my teenage boys loved this place. It was our pleasure to stay here and remember walking in the rooms after a long day just to find the covers turned back and there on each pillow was a fresh chocolate that born the paper of the Grand Floridian. That is why they named this place that: it really is Grand.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, I love this place”
Reviews.Author: purplebarney
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great place to stay. So stunning in everyway. Our room was clean and well kept. The location was great to Magic Kingdom and Epcot. The bus takes you to all other areas of Disneyworld. The 2 pools were nice and there was around 5 restaurants to choose from. We did the delux dining plan which was great but too much food for us, next time I will just do the normal dining plan. We really enjoyed our holiday here.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful and Lovely Stay at th Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: marissad
Reviews.Content: My sister and I took our mom and our sons to the Grand Floridian for a 4 day vacation to Disney World. We stayed on the concierge floor and it was so great- totally worth the money because they give you breakfast, snacks, and drinks all day. The concierge was superb. The rooms were spacious, new, and clean, the shower in the bathroom can be updated, yet still was very clean. The lobby is magnificent, the room service was great and went out of their way to help us with "kid-friendly, and allergic food". Staff was extremely nice to the kids, from the bellboys to the lifeguards at the pool. There was absolutely nothing to complain about for our entire stay! Grand Floridian, we hope to come back! Keep it up!

Reviews.Title: “Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: CMonkey33
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay. The rooms were beautiful and roomy. Staff was so friendly and eager to help. It was very relaxing to sit in the lobby enjoying the décor and the orchestra playing each evening. Not sure how they do it but the whole resort including the rooms smelled SO good! Being on the monorail made it such a convenience to visit surrounding resorts and the Magic Kingdom. We will definitely return. Such a romantic atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel experience...ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: txmomo
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 4322 in Royal Palm Concierge level. We were greeted as we got off the bus and did not have to mess with any line at all (we checked in online in advance). Our view was of the beach and the 24 hour pool. Also, we had a private balcony. 2 bedrails for my 3 year old, were provided in a very short time, after we requested them. The hotel was clean and always had a sweet floral smell to it. I will warn some of you that at about 3 pm there is a small big band orchestra playing on the 2nd floor. We found the music kind of relaxing to to listen to as we put our son down for nap; and very pleasant to wake from nap. Others might find it as bothersome. Our room was nearly right above the band on the 3rd floor and we were impressed at how well the noise was muffled. Staying along the monorail route was such a timesaver, especially with a 3 year old in a stroller. We also used the boats and buses to get around and never had to wait too long. My only complaint was that there was not a self serve wahser/dryer in the main building. I had to walk to another building lugging our dirty clothes around. I was thankful I packed a laundry bag at that point. We will definitely come back to the Grand Floridian. Hopefully we can stay longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “Magical days at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: JuRezekRodrigues
Reviews.Content: I spent 15 days at the Grand Floridian and It was pure amusement! I was with my hole family (Husband, Son 1 year and 11 months, parents, brother, sister-in-law, sons 2 and 4 years old). As my father is a senior they gave us (all 3 rooms) upgrade so the room would be close to the main hotel building. The hotel is great, actually It is really Grand in every way. The restaurants are so good! The 2 swimming pools are right for what you want: one is for fun and the other is for relaxation(and fun too!). We could have our breakfast in our rooms, on the express restaurant, at the Park Fare (highly indicate) with characters or a la carte. The lounge, entrance always have good music: day is piano, and afternoons is a band that plays all Disney themes. The room service is the best! From the hotel we could see Magic Kingdom´s fireworks and after that there was a parade at the Lake. I felt like a princess over there! And everybody in my family felt the same way too!

Reviews.Title: “Dissaponted with Service”
Reviews.Author: DaisytristanB
Reviews.Content: My Family and I have recently returned to Wales UK after our trip to Florida. We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 3 Nights which we were very excited about especially as were were delayed for 10 days because of the volcanic ash. I have to say apon arrival we were very impressed with the valet service etc...But be warned they charge you $12 a day for this service. I was angry at this, we had spent so much money on the hotel alone not including the tickets and the delux dinning plan. We checked in and they were able to give us a room straight away which I was thankful for. However considering that we paid so much the room was tiny. There were two queen beds which was fine but hardly any space for my sons cot so we had to smush him in! I noticed some ants in the bathroom that evening after a long long day at epcot but ignored them as there were only a few. In the morning there were a few more so I rang down and was promised that the pest controller would come up. I then picked up a bag from the corner of the room and it was covered in ants. I was bitten all over my hand and arm. I was so upset at this point my one or 3 year old could have picked that up, not to mention they were all over my husbands shoes! I would have expected this from a $50 a night motel not a $400 delux hotel. I rand again and I dont know wether they couldnt understand my accent but there was no appologie and again just another empty promise of the pest controller. All of this made us late for a breakfast reservation at ohanas. Needless to say that day I was very ancixious and upon returning from the magic kindgom very hot a tired the ants were still there all over the floor. I called several times and finaly a very nice man came up and we moved rooms. I had very high expectations as you would when you are promised such amazing things and felt so horrid when my children had to see their mother upset at the happiest place on earth! I cant say that I will be staying there again. I know the ants were s fluke but they should be checked. That room couldnt have been empty for long its a busy resort someone must have noticed them. The price however is the main reason. We go to Florida every year and travel to disney for a few nights I cant say $400 a night is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Flagship Resort really is all that!”
Reviews.Author: AimeeMichele
Reviews.Content: Even since I first set eyes on the Grand Floridian when I was a little girl, I've always wanted to stay there. Well, I finally had my chance to and I couldn't pass it up! I took my 2 nephews (ages 7 & 3) as well as my mother. We had limos take us to and from MCO as my first and only experience with the Magical Express left a rotten taste in my mouth and made we want to say Magical my....well, fill in the blank. Seriously, save yourself the aggravation and rent a car or get car service (you will thank me later!). Now back to the glory that is the Grand Floridan. As soon as our limo pulled up, someone came out to unload our bags and direct us to the front desk. No on was actually in line to check-in, so right up to the counter I went. (Well up to the counter I went after we were dumbstruck by the awe that is the Grand Floridian main lobby during Christmas time...the tree...the gingerbread house..I don't know who was more fascinated myself or my newphews.) The lady that checked us in was super sweet and fast! I think it took us 7 minutes before she was telling me we had been upgraded and handed me our keys to the world. The man who took us and our bags to our room in his golf cart gave us a tour of the grounds since it was our first stay. We were in the Big Pine Key building. This building is closest to the main building, closest to the themed pool and furthest from the marina as well as Gasparilla's Grill. We had a lagoon view room and could watch the electric water parade from our balcony! The boys loved watching all the boats in the lagoon and every night we fell asleep to the sound of the boat horns. Gasparilla's grill was fantastic for a counter service restaurant. I could eat there every day and not get sick of it...plus you can sit outside and watch the monorails go around, look at the castle (watch it change colors), watch the fireworks and the boats in the lagoon. The food portions are large and everything was fresh! Sometimes it took longer then it should have for them to make the orders, but all you have to do is ask where your food is and then 5 minutes later it would finally be ready. 1900 Park Fare for breakfast was FANTASTIC! Great food and even better character interaction. Bus service was fast! We were waiting first thing in the morning to go to the Animal Kingdom for our before the park actually opens Donald's Safari breakfast...the man that works in the bus waiting area actually called a bus for us to take us there. We were the only ones on the bus! Now, how cool is that?!? Service really doesn't get any better than that! Plus, the monorail is right there and the first stop is the Magic Kingdom! Transportation from this resort was nothing short of fantastic! No complaints from this very impatient lady :) We would be out at the parks and the boys would stop and look at my mother and I, then ask, "can we go back home? "<--they were meaning the Grand Floridian! Of course, how do you tell them no??? So, back "home" we went! We would play in the pools, go down the waterslide, run along the beach and just be silly. The rooms were nicer than they come across as in pictures and spotlessly clean. The beds were very comfy. The walls are a bit thin though, and we never could find the Disney Channel that constantly plays old Disney movies. I know it's there somewhere...we used to watch it at the Contemporary. Anyways, we took advantage of the character wake up calls and the boys would switch off who got to answer the phone. (Disney, if you would put speaker phones in the room, it would save lots of fights over who gets to answer the phone!) Whatever they use that gives the Grand Floridian, the outer building;s lobbies, and the rooms that beautiful aroma is remarkable. I wish I could buy it, because it was a very fresh and happy scent. Not overwhelming at all; just very nice. When we were leaving, my nephews wanted to know why we couldn't just stay and live there. I told them, unfortunately Aunt Aimee has to go back to work so that we can return. If only I could live at the Grand Floridian, I surely would! We loved it SO much here, that we had to book a bounceback offer while there. We are going back in October for 7 nights/ 8 days (this stay was for 4 nights/5 days). When I told my nephews we were going back to Disney; their 1st and only question was, "are we going "home"?" I said, of course we are...where else would we stay?!? So, back to the Grand Floridian, or home, it is! Now, if only it were a bit cheaper...really that's the only problem I can find with this place...the price :) If anyone has any questions, please feel free to ask me!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but not for $400. And skip the "Disney Magical Express"”
Reviews.Author: Mddonovan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four days on a business trip. Lobby not bad, check in was fine. Room pretty dated, but clean. Old furniture, but TV is a new flat screen. No Wi-Fi. Couldnt believe it. Most disappointed with Disney Magical Express. That is the "full service" package offered by Disney whereby you put a sticker on your luggage at your departure destination and it "magically" ends up in your room no more than 3 hours later. The bus ride included to the hotel as part of this package was fine, but a bit slow if you are in a hurry. My major issue is that it took almost 5 hours to get my bag and when i called to check on it, i was told that 3 hours after i landed, the bag had just then left the airport. Being a frequent traveler, i went against my instincts and gave this service a try. Never again. Keep your bags with you at all times if possible.

Reviews.Title: “What more could you ask for?”
Reviews.Author: TwinDaddy129
Reviews.Content: Stayed at GF the week of Apr. 18th. We've stayed on Disney grounds before, notably the Yacht & Beach Club concierge. GF concierge takes the game up a notch. First, the grounds of this resort are breathtaking. I challenge anyone to sit at a bench anywhere on this property and not reach for their camera. Meticulously groomed landscaping add to the ambience. Restaurants on ground are all very good. Proximity to the Magic Kingdom can't be beat. The room we had was nice...nothing spectacular...but first priority at Disney isn't the room. You're hardly there anyway. The castmembers here were all extremely friendly & helpful. The 2 pools are very nice. I've stayed at 5 star & 5 diamond resorts and the GF is right up there.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Grand Floridian Hotel is spectacular!”
Reviews.Author: carcity2
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the Grand Floridian Hotel for the first time was the best experience! As soon as the Magical Express Bus dropped me off at the front of the hotel, there were greeters there to check me into our room. The other three women in my room, did not show up until later and they had a fantastic welcoming to the property too! In fact, since we were staying in a club level room in the main building, we were checked into our room by the concierge staff right in our room; we never even saw the front desk. In the main building of the Grand Floridian Hotel the club level rooms are only in the 3rd to 5th floors and you need a special room key to get to those floors. So it makes it pretty exclusive. The view from our room faced one of the pools with a waterfull right there and the sandy beach in the background, it was amazing! We loved everything about the hotel! The restaurants that we tried were suitable to their level of service, especially Victoria and Alberts! The hotel had great little shops to browse around, and the spa was out of this world! Also, the hotel had live entertainment every night in the main building to make you feel welcome! The only complaint that I had was the bed was not very comfortable and I did not sleep much the majority of the trip because of that. Also, one of the ladies slept on the daybed and the air conditioning vent kept blowing cold air right onto her face every night and we were not able to control the temperature of the thermostat! In fact, she had to sleep with a hooded sweatshirt just to keep her face warm, it was almost as cold as a blizzard in that part of the room! One of the concierge level staff, Vonnie was wonderful about cancelling a few reservations and getting us a reservation for breakfast at Cinderella's castle at the last minute!. Everything she did was great; most of the other staff were great except for one gentleman. Before Vonnie got us a reservation at Cinderella's castle, I had asked one of the other concierge level staff to work on trying to get us a reservation to dine in the Castle and he said,"Well, you can always call the Walt Disney World dining line to get a reservation. What did we pay extra money for to have club level service, if we have to do those type of things ourselves? I had already booked most of our dinner reservations far in advance so the staff did not have to do much for us the nine nights that we stayed at the hotel. I felt like I was imposing to ask such a question! All in all, everything was great! I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly surprised - would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: doublehoo
Reviews.Content: I don't usually write reviews but I wanted to review this property because I was so wary of it based on some of the other reviews I'd read on Tripadvisor. We came here with pretty low expectations and they were exceeded, which was a nice surprise. No one coming here should expect a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton. You will be disappointed. When you come here, you are largely paying for convenience. You won't need a car to see anything Disney-related and if money's not a huge object, you won't need to venture off the monorail line for food. The Magic Kingdom is not even five minutes away by monorail. We got a great deal on the room due to a sale and after staying here I'm pretty sure I would stay again if I could get another good price. I would not stay here at full (Four Seasons-comparable) prices. We found the resort itself - the grounds and buildings - to be quite pretty, and not in a cheesy-Victorian kind of way. There are two pools - one with graduated entry and a slide and waterfall (which was more crowded) and one which seemed to attract mostly adults near the hot tub (which was a bit quieter). We found them more than adequate for late-afternoon swims. We stayed on the club floor of the main building. The club lounge was large, pretty, and we were happy with what it offered. The continental breakfast was more or less what you'd get on a club floor of the Ritz Carlton - cereals, breads/croissants, fruit, cheese, yogurt...etc. The lunch offerings were more snack-like but the afternoon tea was pretty good (scones were tasty), as were the desserts at night. They are great with the beverages and you can take things with you to the room and to the parks (which sort of surprised me) - I was filling up a couple of glasses of water one night to take to the room and the woman who works there just gave me a couple of large bottles of water. Same with sodas. There's also a nice espresso/cappucino machine as well as brewed coffee, iced tea and juices. Also, any entertainment (there's a daily pianist and a band) is in the open lobby so you get to hear it. There are also kiddie tables and chairs with Disney movies playing and a sitting area with sofas and a tv tuned to the news. It was a nice place to relax. The service at the hotel, with few exceptions, was fantastic. The staff is exceedingly friendly, and even though the place is fairly high-end, there are a lot of kids running around and the kid-friendliness of the whole place was nice. In particular, the restaurants at the resort were great for kids; I have never seen a better children's menu anywhere (kid-friendly appetizers - what a great idea!). The concierges were knowledgeable and helpful with dinner reservations and other suggestions of things to do (at the resort and also regarding park hours, etc.). They were not as great as Four Seasons concierges but they served their purpose and were about on par with most Ritz Carlton concierges in our experience. My husband had some work to do while we were staying here and he noted that the business center was sub-par. Though I doubt most people stay here and need the business center, it's probably worth noting. We found the biggest "downside" (if you could call it that) to be the actual rooms. They are really nothing to write home about. Marginally better than your average Marriott, maybe. They are in dire need of a face lift. They were clean and had a refrigerator, they were nicely (though not lavishly by any means) furnished, and they were adequate. Not really on par with the rest of the hotel, we thought. The toiletries were surprisingly nice, however. One odd thing we noticed was the tv channels available in the room. Perhaps unsurprisingly, there was only one Disney Channel available in the way of kid's channels. No Nickelodeon, no Sprout. Bring your own DVDs if you've got little kids, because if you do, you probably know that the Disney Channel has a lot of programming for the older kiddie set. Fortunately, there was not a lot of time for watching tv (just one night when it was raining - after enjoying some dessert in the lounge). All things considered, we had a great stay. It was convenient, clean, and nicer than we expected. It made seeing the parks a breeze, and it was great to be able to come and go so easily (particularly to the Magic Kingdom, which you can get to by boat or monorail). Also, as a bonus, from the dock at the hotel, you have a great view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks at night. The club/concierge floor was also well worth it. We'll stay here the next time we plan a trip to Disney World.

Reviews.Title: “Can't be beaten”
Reviews.Author: kidslittledisney
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at GF 3 times now and have booked a 4th trip easter 2010. We love the location, the food and the atmosphere. Even when it's really busy we have experienced fabulous service. Our daughters favourite cuddly toy was taken by mistake with the bed linen. Although it was Christmas the staff at the GF searched for days to find it. In the meantime they gave her a bear to cuddle at night. After 10 days they found it, washed and pressed by the laundry process, and returned it to her just in time for going home. How fabulous that they cared enough to keep on looking and make sure it came back to her. What more can you ask for? They lived up to the promise that Disney makes sure their key customers are happy!!

Reviews.Title: “Best trip ever”
Reviews.Author: ojoey
Reviews.Content: when we stayed here it was the best i loved the itialian marble in our bathroom. every day i was there i felt like there was no end to my vacation.the next time i go to walt disney world i am definitly staying at the grand floridiand(best place ever)

Reviews.Title: “Lower your expectations -- and then lower them again”
Reviews.Author: travel141
Reviews.Content: Imagine paying Four Seasons prices for what is essentially a really nice Holiday Inn. That is Disney's Grand Floridian in a nutshell. The location can't be beat, but in every other way it's completely abysmal. Our club level suite was old, smelly, & outdated. So many things were broken or not working properly. The pool area was filled with hard-partying adults who seemed intent on getting hammered by 4:00 in the afternoon. The food was awful. We had to wait everywhere we went, despite the fact that I made reservations for everything 3 months ahead of time. Basically, we spent as little time as possible in the hotel and then checked out a day early. We spent our last day at the Ritz Carlton in Grande Lakes -- it was WAY cheaper than the Grand Floridian and worlds better. If we ever do Disney again we will definitely stay off-site. I'd rather deal with a 10-minute shuttle service than pay an arm & a leg for crappy service and crappy accommodations. Sorry, I really wanted to like it because I heard so many good things, but it was just horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: atisaran
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel, terrific service, perfect for family with 3 kids. The room had a "day bed", in addition to 2 queen size beds, so we could all sleep comfortably. The fireworks were visible from just outside our building and we saw the boat/light parade as well. The monorail got us to/from the parks with a few breakdowns. A bit annoying, but not upseting. The service was amazing...they got us into the 1900 fair dinner even without reservations!

Reviews.Title: “Best Property on-site in Disney World Resort”
Reviews.Author: SonnyCrock
Reviews.Content: I travel on business every few weeks worldwide and Four Seasons is my default hotel. This review is aimed for similar parents used to top quality hotels but who may be apprehensive about booking the Grand Floridian. My family and I stayed 8 nights starting 30 March. With three kids under 11 I wanted the convenience of the Disney theme parks but with as close to my Four Seasons normality as possible. I would rate the GF as a 4+ star hotel. Not dissimilar to some of the Hyatt Regency hotels I have stayed in but with a spectacular five star lobby. Actually the rooms are not far off five star. The beds are excellent and pillows great. Soundproofing is pretty good. The bathrooms are very clean but bath/shower had a curtain (not 5 star) and the toilet edge was around 2 inches from the door when opened. Double sinks were great. By the way the comment from another reviewer about wet carpets is a plus. They are steam cleaned every week or so. Carpets in our room were immaculate when we arrived, which judging by what my kids dropped and spilt is a good thing. All restaurants were great and Park Fayre character breakfast good fun but pricey. Pool areas were fine and beach good, although there were not enough sunchairs at peak time and apparently reserved. Obviously too many Germans were staying (joke!). The gym at the spa was adequate for my needs, although the equipment a little tired. So with some investment in the bathrooms I think the resort could make a play for a five star rating in the future, should it desire. We compared GF with the Polynesian and Contemporary. Neither were our cup of tea. In fact I saved a lot of USD by switching from Polynesian Club Floor to GF Garden Rooms and taking the disney deluxe dining plan option, which was fantastic. Parents wanting a glass of wine or two on the balcony in the evening but reluctant to pay USD10 per glass or USD40 per bottle on room service should order from ABC Wines in Orlando before arrival and who will deliver to your hotel via fedex. One final tip - take the monorail to MK but the boat back. Each is only one stop. GF honestly exceeded my expectations. I left agreeing with the family that we would come back again one day. Parents with high expectations of hotels will be satisfied.

Reviews.Title: “excellent service - best at Disney”
Reviews.Author: michaelrosenberg
Reviews.Content: By far the best hotel at Disney. The level of service is outstanding. We arrived late at night because of flight delays. We had used Disney Transportation from the airport so our luggage would not reach our room for several hours. We asked if our kids could get pull ups and toothbrushes so they could get in bed. Not only were the items in our room waiting when we got there, after grabbing a quick bite to eat, but items for us as well. During our stay one of our boys fell in the lobby gift shop and was hurt. Immediately the hotel called 911 and several employees kept him company with us as we waited for the EMT to arrive. Everyday after someone from the hotel asked us or him directly how he was doing. One night we stayed at one of the parks too late and missed our dinner reservation. We tried to rebook but there was no availability anywhere at Disney. There happened to be a character dinner at our hotel which was booked but somehow they were able to accommodate us. The bellman at the end of our trip was great with the kids letting them ride on the cart and sit up front with him on the golf cart. He engaged them and entertained them. Throughout our stay I was impressed with the customer service orientation of the entire staff. The rooms are beautiful, well thought out and very comfortable. Big beds with wonderful sheets and thick towels in the bathroom - unlike what's offered at other Disney hotels. Great porch right off the room with view across the lake to Magic Kingdom. The lobby is large and never seems crowded and smells wonderful. I am not sure where it came from but the scent in the public spaces was always fresh and slightly floral. The monorail stops right outside the lobby so easy access to Magic Kingdom and other parks on the monorail system. The restaurants are among the best at Disney and you can see the fireworks over the Magic Kingdom from your table. I must admit the California Grill at the Contemporary does one better by piping in the music and offering a viewing deck off the restaurant from which to enjoy the fireworks. Though not inexpensive, worth the rate

Reviews.Title: “Thank you Otis!”
Reviews.Author: hitmantodd
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is exactly what it states-Grand! We had a marvelous time. We really enjoyed the sereneness of listening to the orchestra each day in the grand ballroom. The rooms were very neat and clean. The staff went out of their way (especially Otis!) to make our stay complete. He was especially nice to my son. What a kind and professional person! Thanks again! :)

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience Here”
Reviews.Author: HollidayE
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in a garden view room for 4 nights at the end of March. There were two adults and two small kids in a Sago Cay room with two queens. We found the room to be very clean and the beds comfortable. Our bathroom was also very clean and well stocked. There was a fridge in the room that we could stock for the kids with juice and leftovers. The balcony was fine and gave us a view of the marina area. It was a quick walk to the great pools (also very clean) and to the lobby/food. We had no problems with the staff and found everyone to be quite friendly and helpful. It was great being right on the monorail here. We made ADRs early so we ate in many different places but here we tried 1900 Park Faire and the Grill....both were fine. I had read bad reviews of the food at the quick service grill but at breakfast it was the exact same thing that they serve at the character meals...mickey waffles/bacon/etc. Totally fine in my opinion. We loved the pool with the zero entry and the waterslide. There were tons of lifeguards and lots of kids acitivities each day. Plenty of towels and clean bathrooms. There are cabanas but we didnt see anyone in them. There are bars at the pool with drinks - pretty expensive but good ($10 margaritas, $6 beers). There is a large sand beach here but no swimming in the water. If your kids like the sand, bring buckets and shovels. There were none here so the kids were always playing with plastic cups! We would definitely stay here again. It is so convenient to the MK, only one monorail stop. The shops are cute and the food is fine. We didnt have trouble with noise at night and only heard the family next door a few times on the last day. You can hear a little bit through the door that connects the two rooms. This hotel is definitely better quality/more upscale than the other MK resorts, but great for kids and not stuffy. Much better atmosphere than the Contemporary. We'll be back. Kudos to Jose the belhop/valet for helping us with a taxi snafu on the departure day. A note: have Disney or the hotel choose a car service for you. We found one online and didnt have a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience!”
Reviews.Author: Arianna_G
Reviews.Content: My family and I have stayed at other Disney resorts twice, and this was our the first time at the Grand Floridian. What a wonderful experience. We made reservations to stay in Sugar Loaf. We didn't love the room, so we were upgraded to the Main Bldg at no extra cost! The concierge staff in both buildings were extremely friendly and helpful. My son enjoyed riding the Monorail to Magic Kingdom almost as much as meeting Mickey!!!! Loved the Character Breakfast! Cant wait to go back again!

Reviews.Title: “I Wish I Could Have Stayed Longer”
Reviews.Author: mat342
Reviews.Content: I had the privilege to be involved with a conference that occurred a the grand. Everything was perfect. The food was delicious, the views of the magic kingdom were magical, the pool was relaxing, the staff was friendly. The only complaint I heard of in my entire group was about the parking. I did not rent a car, but my understanding is that they charge $12 a day to valet. There is free self parking, but then you are not helped with your bags. Aside from that one comment the hotel was fabulous and I wish my conference was longer so I could have enjoyed the hotel more.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: VoyageFromNYC
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Grand Floridian with the family and had a great stay. Our room faced the lagoon, which positioned us perfectly for the light/boat show at night and for the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom. That is good and bad, as the kids had to stay up a little later than usual but it was worth it. The rooms are still nice (it had been a while since I was last there) but we spent very little time in them in any case. The staff was very nice and accomodating throughout our stay, with only a hiccup here and there. Good service from the front desk and concierge, although we were given wrong information regarding the meal plan prior to arrival from a centralized service person. Overall they did everything you would expect. The proximity to the Magic Kingdom and being on the monorail proved beneficial for us, as that is where we spent most of our time. That along with the early park hours worked very well. We didn't spend a lot of time at the two pools, but they did the trick (especially with the water slide) when we had the downtime. It was difficult to get chairs though, not a shocker. A few things that could be better were the food, television choices, and internet access. The food isn't that great, but we didn't eat in the higher end spots with the kids. The television channels are limited, with most of them being poorly programmed Disney World channels. No wireless internet, just wired on the desk. Other than those few items, it was a great trip and we would return without hesitation. Kids and parents had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Betsym55
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian three times and this was by far our best time ever!! We decided to stay in Club level and were booked at Sugarloaf we were so excited... When we arrived the concierge met us and took us to the concierge level of the Main building and told us our room would be on the third floor!! We were absolutely thrilled.. the Main Building is a dream of a lifetime there is nothing like it.. Joe the concierge who worked the evening shift is an asset to the GF he goes above and beyond for the guests!! I would recommend club level for anyone We will do it again in a heartbeat.. hopefully next year so be looking for us Joe! J

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!”
Reviews.Author: Canadianshey
Reviews.Content: We go to Orlando Florida every year, this was our second time we stay at the Grand Floridian, yes it's over priced, but you get what you pay for. Now that we have experienced Filet mignon, there's is no going back to just steak. We love it at the Grand Floridian, we love everything about it. We have also made a great friend who works at the Grand Floridian Cafe. We keep in touch all year through e-mails. Love it! It's Awesome. Looking forward to next year. (Weather could of been better this year, but can't do anything about it, mother nature is the boss).

Reviews.Title: “Above and Beyond”
Reviews.Author: aydenspoppy
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3/13/10-3/20/10, Our stay was great. It was our first experience at GF. What really made an impression with my wife and I was a mistake we made that was salvaged by Nick Contorno who works as a concierge at the Grand Floridian. We left our camera bag containing the camera,cash,debit and credit cards on a ride at Disney Studios. When we arrived back at the hotel we went directly to the concierge counter and advised Nick of our problem. He immediately attempted to contact the ride control room. After many attempts he was able to reach someone and advised them of the situation. A short time later he was contacted back and advised that the bag had been recovered. We were very excited that the bag had been recovered. Nick then told us to go and enjoy ourselves that he would arrange to have the bag brought back to our room. Approximately one hour later Nick knocked on our door and gave us our bag. Every item was in the bag and nothing was missing. We then learned that Nick himself had driven to The Disney Studios and retrieved our bag. For us this is a deal sealer with Disney and the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping in quality”
Reviews.Author: JATB
Reviews.Content: I was at Disney for a corporate meeting at the end of February and stayed at the Grand Floridian Resort. Quality has really slipped over the years and it wasn't as posh as it once was, however, it has weathered time well. For a family vacation (where you have lower standards), I'm sure it is fine. However, it's not really a luxury business hotel and isn't equipped for business travelers - the desks are small, the room is a little cramped. I was disappointed that they couldn’t accommodate my request for a king-size bed. On the upside, the bathroom amenities are fantastic! More on my business trip to Disney: http://justanothertravelblog.blogspot.com/2010/03/disney-world-on-business.html

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Disney magic.”
Reviews.Author: ALFRED99
Reviews.Content: Arrived from New York just before Christmas to a very warm welcome, lobby all decked out in festive decorations and Celine Dion singing live. Yes she was actually there filming a Christmas show for ABC television. On many previous trips when our children were younger we have admired this hotel which is located across the large lagoon from the Magic kingdom and promised ourselves we would come on our own one day and be children ourselves at the theme parks. The hotel and surrounding areas are neat and tidy and all of the staff are really pleasant and helpful-just as you would expect in a Disney resort. We had a spacious, light and airy lagoon view room with two king beds (good pillows), tea/coffee making facilities and plenty of crockery and glasses. The bathroom was small but adequate and everything was kept in good condition and very clean. Minor niggles that the shower head was not adjustable and the toilet flushing was very noisey. However housekeeping overall was excellent. Very little noise from adjacent rooms although there could be as our room had connecting doors with one other room so obviously used at certain times for families. Room had a balcony with a nice view across the lagoon towards the Polynesian resort and we could see the nightly lagoon light show on the lake. The hotel grounds are pleasant to walk in even as far as the Polynesian resort and the Disney transport centre. At night you can sit and watch the Magic Kingdom fireworks without leaving the site. The lagoon cruisers and the monorail connect to the parks from the hotel. We were here for the parks so did not use any of the restaurants but all looked good (but expensive) and you can have "in room" dining if you wish. We simply bought food from the fast food restaurant on a couple of nights and did our own dining-in arrangements. We did have a car so toured around as well. Do go and see the disney town called Celebration (it`s rather parochial) but has a great American diner (sit at the counter) and find the Cracker Barrel store(s)/restaurant(s) for great atmosphere, super service and great food. This was the finale to a tour of the eastern seaboard for us and the Grand Floridian did us proud.

Reviews.Title: “Had a Great time at both the resort and the cruiseship Wonder!!”
Reviews.Author: djiceman916
