Reviews.Content: the setting was very nice the pool area was my favorite it was open 24 hours a day you cuold also watch the firework from the park off of your balcony in your suite ! The service ammenties and transportation was veryvery good!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience”
Reviews.Author: Maryland104
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is old time elegant with a comfortable atmosphere. Arrived at Amtrak station and took the Happy Limo to and from the hotel. The day before arrival I checked in through the internet so when we arrived it took only about 10 minutes to be driven off to our room. From the bell hops to the housekeeping staff to the restaurant staff everyone was friendly and helpful. Monorail and bus stops were easily accessible. The "counter" service grill provided a good range of options from sandwiches to grilled chicken to pizza. The Magic Kingdom fire works are viewable from 3 areas of the grounds. Ate at the Grand Floridian Cafe for a breakfast and dinner. Both meals were excellent with very attentive staff. We stayed in the Big Pine building and the room was clean and comfortable with very nice amenities. Overall a very happy and pleasant stay. Would definitely recommend the Grand Floridian to any of our family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to Improve”
Reviews.Author: GetAwayHunter
Reviews.Content: We love Disney, and this is certainly Disney's nicest resort on the Monorail, but it is slipping, and has been for a while. The architecture, ambiance, landscaping and cleanliness are world class, but the rooms and guest experience are distinctly NOT 5 star. The food at Gasparillias Grill is a crime against hotel guests. Absolutely ATROCIOUS (and overpriced). We had the distinct honor of trying to eat the worst re-heated factory made frozen pizza that we have ever tasted. Actually, the pizza had no taste whatsoever. It was just a factory prepared shot of stale cheese and empty carbs. The bath products offered in this supposedly luxury hotel are low -end and have not been upgraded for 15 years. The TV selections in the room are lmited, sub par and focus on Disney Infommercials. Can't even get FoxNews, which we prefer to watch over spiels about Disney Vacation Club, or repetitive ;oops on what to do at Disney. The process of making a reservation has been and is becoming increasingly obnoxious. Disney now has a robot that asks you 14 unnecessary questions before allowing you to find out if a hotel is even available during your stay. What is really insulting and offensive is that even though we are frequent guests at the Grand Floridian ,spending thousands of dollars every year, they hassle us with confirming phone numbers, emails, ages of children, date of last stay, before even letting you talk to somebody who might know if a room is available. All of this would be unnecessary if their central reservation system could just look up our info by phone number (This is ignoring the fact that it is extremely gauche to badger your "guests" at the onset of their "magical" experience, with an onslaught of intrusive, unnecessary, rude and time consuming questions. How un-magical. What a hassle. No other hotel in the world has such an obstructionist process to make a reservation. We understand the difficulty of giving a 5 star experience to a large hotel full of children, but there are many little things that could be done to improve the experience for the guests. There is a constant parade of golf carts, maintenance vehicles, houeskeeping wagons, utility golf carts etc parading along the sidewalks during all waking hours. I counted 25 in an afternoon at the pool, and we are invariably assaulted by 3 or so as we transit from our room to the main building. It is impossible to catch a nap at the pool because of the frequenet trundling of these vehicles hauling laundry etc around the property. It did not used to be like this -- something has changed (perhaps a new general manger not interested in guest experience?) Pool side food service at this supposedly luxury hotel consists of an extremely limited selection of tasteless entrees carelessly prepared, served in plastic containers, admist a swarm of seagulls. No linenes, no silverware, no service. Just -- here is your high priced, processed, gross food. Hurry up and eat it. If you are a family with kids and don't care about price or quality, just convenience to the Monorail, this may be your place. However, if you are a discriminating traveler with higher standards -- especially at $500/night, you will be disappointed. We try to accentuate the many positives of the Grand Floridian while we stay here, but lately (the last 5 years), things are definitely becoming less tolerable. The food at Citricos is a strong plus to the hotel's credit. Gasparillas Grill needs a total, dynamite first and ask questions later, make over.

Reviews.Title: “The price is WRONG for sleepless nights!”
Reviews.Author: Mis_Adventurous
Reviews.Content: Let me begin by stating that the Grand Floridian is a beautiful hotel. The "check in" staff meets you upon arrival and preps the guest with all of the information needed for an enjoyable stay. We decided to spend a little extra money and take advantage of the concierge level for the benefit of breakfasts and daily treats. We were placed in the Sugarloaf Building which is a short walk off of the main hotel. Our rooms were located on the bottom level and were well-appointed. HOWEVER, if you plan to stay at this hotel and they book you in this building, AVOID rooms 6117 and 6119!!! What a nightmare . . . oops! that would indicate sleeping which was sadly stolen from us!! Those rooms are on the same end (and right across) from the eating area!!! If you draw the SHORT straw and end up in 6117, you'll get the added bonus of having the "children's tv area" just on the other side of your headboard! I'm amazed that the volume of that TV blaring at 7am with the sounds of Disney!! The outside wall faces a canal, which would be calm and inviting if this weren't also the path used by the facilities golf carts to deliver towels, food, etc. at the CRACK OF DAWN!! It's not that we would have slept until NOON, but with what this place costs . . . I would like to wake up on my own accord. We got to hear all of the voices of a family who apparently liked to "scream" with their EARLY breakfast each morning from the concierge area across from us. It's true! The other guests are not considerate of these rooms being so close to the "action." However, why would you place two connecting rooms in the middle of a circus and then charge an arm and a leg? On a separate note, Kent in the concierge dining area couldn't have been nicer and more professional. He placed some special treats in the room to help celebrate our son's b-day and really took his job seriously! Maybe they should let him design the room layout? Either way, the access to the Disney parks, and the beauty of the hotel did not override the terrible NOISE that we experienced for our 5-night stay! After all, it would be nice to have a good night's rest after visiting all those "Disney-related" offerings all day!

Reviews.Title: “nice, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: itspatty
Reviews.Content: The place was nice, great location, and when we first got there we were really excited, but after thinking about it, while I don't have too many complaints about the rooms, I feel like we simply paid too much money for them. The room we stayed in was also a little small I thought. I would stay at a less expensive hotel the next time I went to disneyworld. You end up spending the vast majority of your time in the park anyway, your really just need a bed to sleep in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Puddle_Jumper_2010
Reviews.Content: Rated it highly but was disappointed as this is Disney's flagship property. Preferred the amenities and location of the Polynesian, even though the Grand Floridian cost much more.

Reviews.Title: “Bait and Switch”
Reviews.Author: CariJill
Reviews.Content: This hotel can be a great choice for some and the worst choice for others. Like anything else in life, it is all in outlook. Clearly, it is the "best" Disney has to offer, the location is awesome, the pictures online are very nice, and clearly the prices it asks for its rooms match that attitude, but in my opinion this hotel falls majorly short if you are a family that is looking for luxury service and treatment. It took me a few days staying here to realize that Disney is not marketing to families like us- who are looking for the finer things- and we should take our business elsewhere; off disney premises. We actually stayed in a suite on the concierge floor boasting special food and a VIP concierge. I can't imagine these concierge suite patrons being happy as they are paying a fortune for terrible service; getting no more than regular patrons. First, I never saw the concierge once since we were there. When I did seek the " special" concierge down for a question by phone, they often wouldn't call back with my answer, and did not seem knowledgable about any restaurants or venues outside of Disney. It was like they wanted to keep us in Disney, spending money in Disney and kept referring us back to Disney establishments when we wanted to explore a bit more of Orlando. Once, we requested a babysitter, and they referred us a sitter who was not bonded. OMG! We had to pay her cash at the end of the night. So shady! Like the pp said, the maid service was terrible. Turn down service was almost never done, half drank diet coke cans and half eaten apples sat for days in our room, the lock on our door was broken and the worst part was that no one even cared. Every evening, we would have to pull out out couches and make up the beds for my daughters. I was changing the sheets! Begging for towels. The rooms are worn and sort of mismatched. Looks kind of like a Holiday Inn. Food at the hotel was terrible.... the Gasparilla grill was the worst! I am still sick thinking about the food at this cafe. The pool area was also very disappointing. Many days, one of the two pools was closed for repair. Another day the hot tub was closed for repair. There was no food or beverage service by the pool. You have to walk to the cafe to get food and bring it out to the pool. Imagine having to pull two screaming kids out of the pool to take this cold hike.... Fun, fun! So, my recommendations: Next time I would stay at the Waldorf Astoria Orlando. Beautiful, great great service, just opened, and connected to the new Hilton-- it has so much luxury and class and yet, the kids can use the pool in the Hilton- waterslides and a floating river. They provide Shuttles and first class service to the monorail (only 5 mins away) and things around disney too that (like Seaworld and Universal)... We hired a private VIP tour guide to take us through the Disney theme parks and were able to skip all the lines and get great seating for the parades, etc... That was awesome and well worth the $$. I would recommend the Royal Table at Cinderella's Castle for breakfast, and the Bibbity Bobbity Boutique. My 4 year old had a blast! At the breakfast, she met all 4 princesses (it would have taken us hours to stand in line and meet everyone separately) and I felt it was so magical.... Lastly, for dinners, I would recommend Flying Fish (Excellent!) and California Grill (wonderful view to see the fireworks). All of this requires reservations well in advance! Good luck! Have fun! Hope this helps!

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: iowadisney
Reviews.Content: Just got back from Disnney. Have stayed in the Poly and Contemporary several times so we thought we would try the Grand Floridian. What a waste of money. Yes, it is convenient with the monorail and the main building is stunning. But, other than that, this hotel is no better than a property like Hampton Inn, etc. Housekeeping is slow (left our room at 8:00 am and returned at 4:00 pm - room was still not serviced). Talked to concierge about the slow service and was told they were busy with other rooms. That's fine if you are paying $95 a night but not when you are paying close to $700 a night. Will go back to the Contemporary or Poly on the next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service but tired resort.”
Reviews.Author: mmcmap
Reviews.Content: This was our fourth trip to Disney and my kids have always asked to stay at the Grand Floridian so for our three night trip during President's week we did just that. The resort is very convenient to both Epcot and Magic Kingdom but plan on 45 minute and a bus ride to anywhere else. We booked outer club level so when we arrived we were greeted by a concierge and taken directly to our room. The room was very dated, not as nice as a hilton hotel and very small. The carpet and furnishings were shabby and we even found a dirty sock on the floor from a previous guest. The grounds of the resort and the lobby are beautiful but reminiscent of your great-grandmother's victorian decor with flowered carpet and lace. Again, upon examination this is showing excessive wear. The best part of the resort is the Disney service. Nearly all the employees were welcoming and helpful. The club level offerings were nice after a long day but not really necessary. If you buy the Disney dining plan then the club level food is overkill. If not, it is probably a good deal. Overall, we will stay off site next time.

Reviews.Title: “Grand - I dont think so”
Reviews.Author: DEE1120
Reviews.Content: I have so much to say, I am a single mom and took my kids on what I promised would be a trip of a life time... I know for sure I have gotten better service at the Value hotels then at this not so grand place. If you are going to pay just to be close to the monorail, I suggest you stay at a moderate or a value and take taxi's to the park. Much cheeper and much better service. Paid for Concierge another waste of money unless you like paying to be ignored and promised things that never happen. Stop at a store and pick up some crackers and cheese and a few bottles of wine and cans of soda and Bingo Concierge taken care of. Maid service was beyond Horrible, mutliple complaints did nothing, dirty dishes left in room, hairs found after maid left, obviously from Maid. If you stay here bring a vacuum,large hefty bag and pay big money to do as much for yourself as you you went camping for the weekend. When I complained I was told by a manager to call him and he would take care of some comps for my next trip. Well emails and phone calls to same person have yet to be answered...Nice way to get someone to leave thinking someone cared..Total cost of 7 days at Flordian on a buy 4 get 3 free 4400.00. Really was that not enough that I should of expected some 5 star services. I read trip advisors before I left and ignored what people said that was negative, I focused on the possitive ones. I said to my kids I think those people just expected to much...I went with very low expectations....that where not even closely meet. Shame on the Flordian for hiring such horrible service providers. I am going back to try to make up this disaster to my family but I will not be staying here.

Reviews.Title: “First stay at Grand Floridian....highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: Goldie3721
Reviews.Content: My 9 yr old daughter and I stayed from Feb 8 to 11 for a quick 3 nights...due to the hotel 35% off sale.....and great seat sale from Toronto...just couldnt say no! We had visited for a dinner the year before and loved the look of the hotel and decided we really wanted to stay if ever back at Disney....we werent dissappointed. Greeted by kind older gentleman upon arrival who went straight to my daughter and chatted and greeted us.....then walked us straight to front desk and said these ladies are staying for their first time here...was very nice! I had faxed a polite request for upgrade as I could only afford a basic garden view room....request was granted with a 4th floor lagoon view room....looked over at Polynesian...was very nice of them. We were taken by golf cart to our room and bell man described the hotel on our drive to our building in the Pines. The room was just lovely...very elegant and very clean. We stayed at Poly the year before....and although hotel was nice....the room there were dark and dismal in my opinion. During our stay, I was address as Miss and my last name whenever we called front desk or requested anything....it was all very friendly and civilized.....i loved it! We enjoyed staying in hotel lobby for a couple of hours for some down time( and to warm up as it was only 58 degrees!!) and really enjoyed the band, very friendly pianist and Daughter loved the mini furniture and Disney movied beside elevator. Oh...and she described the feel of hotel as looking like first class level on Titanic...(that being in a good way ;) ) Daugher enjoyed pin trading with staff for our visit and got some great pins from hotel cast members..who were so friendly with her. We also did Supercalifragilistic breakfast with alice, mad hatter etc.... she really enjoyed this and staff were friendly. The counter restaurant was decent...what you would expect....edible not amazing. You can view fireworks at night from here though....as a hint. Hope this helps everyone! goldie, toronto! I would not hesitate to recommend this grand hotel and its staff to anyone. It is exspensive indeed....but if it comes on sale....well worth it. The convieniance of the mono rail instead of buses is worth hundreds to me....just for sanity and time saved!

Reviews.Title: “Great service!”
Reviews.Author: bonniede
Reviews.Content: We booked a week at the GF for just my spouse and me. We had a great time. We were picked up by the shuttle at the airport, and arrived at the hotel in about 1/2 hour. The shuttle delivered us to the front of the hotel and as we were walking along the entrance towards the front door, we were greeted by a very nice woman who checked us in while we walked into the lobby. She told us we had been upgraded to the sugarloaf concierge building, gave us our keys, and walked us to Narsoosees restaurant where we had reservations for dinner. The restaurant had a great view and terrific food. GF has another restaurant called Citricos which was also excellent. We were happy with our room although we couldn't get the king bed we had requested in advance. Getting the upgrade to concierge overcame our disappointment with the smaller queen bed. We had a nice view of the pool area. We had a few minor complaints like: The lighting in the room wasn't very good, in fact the bathroom was quite dark even though they had about 4 lights in there; the shower head didn't work very well; we didn't like the bedding; also the walls are thin but the hotel wasn't very noisey. I'm surprised by the complaints about food in DW. We had great meals every day! Granted we had dinner every night at a "signature" restaurant. They were all excellent. I liked Flying Fish the best but Artist Point was also excellent. We had lunch at several restaurants and thought San Angel was extremely good. The only restaurant which we didn't think was good at all was Raglan's Irish restaurant in DT disney. It was really badly managed with slow confused service and mediocre food. The staff at GF were great. WE had a couple of complaints about the heat and the remote control for the tv, and they were quickly fixed. It's a beautiful hotel. Convenient to the parks, and some other hotels on the monorail. We visited most of the other DW hotels, and we were very glad we stayed at the GF.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: oodlesofnoodles1
Reviews.Content: I have been to Disney World too many times to count, and each time we always hit GF for breakfast or supper, loving the wonderful style and surroundings. We decided that this trip would be our last for a while, and as a result we would round off the trip with 3 days at the hotel. To be honest I wasn't expecting much, relatively nice but a little dated. This was completely opposite to the experience I had. We had a theme park view in Boca Chica - Lagoon view was wonderful, and the castle was clear from our balcony. Not only this, but I woke up to views of Space Mountain each morning - not too bad!!!! The room was beautiful, and very large. It was immaculately clean, as was the whole of the hotel, and when we arrived there was a white chocolate mickey, as well as a plate of chocolates and a birthday card. It was a great surprise. Each night we sat and watched the water parades which sailed right by our balcony. The fireworks were incredible as always and even better when viewed in pjs away from the crowds. When we were there we decided to try the spa for convenience. It was surprisingly well priced and the treatments I had (facial, massage, mani, ped) were beyond fantastic, and after the pedicure you get a little bag with a pedicure kit and nail colour of choice. We ate at Narcoosees and had a fabulous lobster supper which was only complimented by a view of the castle There were absolutely no negatives to the trip which was meant to be our last. Instead we are booked up for a couple of weeks in the summer. Not for Disney, but for the resort

Reviews.Title: “Not all it's cracked up to be.”
Reviews.Author: sharolzal
Reviews.Content: Our family had been to Disneyworld once before, and my girls wanted to stay at the famous Grand Floridian for the first week of our trip. The lobby is breathtaking. A victorian style lobby with huge fresh flower boquets, a grand staircase, and a victorian charm. There are also several shops in the main building that are very nice, but quite pricey. Upon arrival we went into our room which was suppsed to have a lagoon view, but was blocked by the large pool shed. Getting to Magic Kingdom was ery easy because of the shuttle, which was great. My main complaint about this resort was that our room was very tiny. Between me, my husband and three children there was barely enough room to move. We did not go to any of the restraunts, but we did go to the little game room/cafe for breakfast each morning, which was decent. The pools were beautiful, but we only went twice for a few hours because of the weather. The service was great as all disney resorts are. The following week we stayed at Disney's Saratoga Springs resort and spa, which was much better. Overall, lovely resort, except for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Cast Members but there were a few issues”
Reviews.Author: Alicnwondrln
Reviews.Content: I love this resort and stay there several times a year. I almost always stay in the Main Building which is called the Royal Palm Club concierge. I was in room 4327 which was not that great at first. The room had no hot water, no AC, the remote and the telephone also had issues. I didnt like the way the manager handled it at first but it was all fixed by the next day. I do love the RPC Cast Members at the this resort and got alot of great tips by checking out the website www.wherethemagiclives.com. It is a gf fan site and they have tons of pics and tips on it that were very helpful. I will continue to stay at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Service Isn't Grand”
Reviews.Author: Livs4Vaca
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Grand Floridian club level this January. The hotel is beautiful and if you plan to spend much of your time at the Magic Kingdom, the location can not be beat. The breakfast and afternoon tea offerings in the Sugar Loaf Club were great, however the evening offerings left alot to be desired (items that were supposed to be hot were cold, trays not replenished in a timely manner, etc.) and the late-night sweets consisted of a small tray of what looked like leftover pastries from the Garden View Lounge in the main building. The room was well-kept and cleaned. The first day our room was not made up until almost 4 p.m.. After that we caught the housekeeper in the hall for a few mornings to let her know we were leaving and from then on out our room was cleaned earlier. On the downside, other than the housekeeping staff we found the service here to be sub-par from almost everyone we dealt with -- from bell services to the concierge staff in Sugar Loaf right on up to the manager of Narcoossee's. The general attitude of the staff was cold and aloof. I felt the staff in the lobby of Sugar Loaf worked hard to avoid eye contact at all times--even when they weren't helping guests they kept their eyes downward staring intently at their computer screens. We were rarely greeted when we passed the staff and even the greeter on the upper level of the main building (near the monorail station ) never greeted us on any of the many times we came in that way and that's his specific job! Most times we passed him he actually had his back to the guests and was leaning over the railing to check out the action downstairs. The staff generally put off an air that they could not care less that we were there -- almost as if we weren't worthy of being in their presence -- and they subtly let it be known that when they did help you you were putting them out. It was really strange. My husband's birthday was during the trip and I'd asked the IPO to note that on our reservation but I'm not sure it was because it was never acknowledged during our stay. I wasn't expecting anything huge, but usually when that's on your reservation somewhere along the line you get a card or something in the room or at one of your meals. We also did not get the room-type we requested but were luckily able to switch rooms. The soundproofing between rooms was not great. We could often hear the children to one side of us and the tv in the room to te other side of us. All in all, I'm not sure I would stay at this hotel again (I've stayed at about a dozen different Disney hotels and know there is better service out there) and I definitely woudn't do club level here again -- not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Sublimely Kid friendly.”
Reviews.Author: Bicycle_Rider
Reviews.Content: Where else can you enjoy 4 star dining with 5 year olds seated at most of the tables? Kids are made to feel welcome at this world class grand resort. As you enter the lobby, a section is set aside with kid sized furniture showing old Disney reels. Just one monorail stop from the Magic Kingdom - of course there will be more kids here than your average grand resort, but parents can easily pamper themselves as if the kids weren't in tow. There's babysitting available, and a drop off center so the parents can enjoy the spa or dine alone (we didn't use these services.) I liked that the Gasparilla grill served a variety of foods, beer and wine 24 hours a day (you can bring the beer & wine back to your room). The entire resort is spotless - they seem to hose everything down nightly. Several excellent on-resort Restaurants, and bars by both of the pool areas. My daughter went down the water slide over and over. Liked the bathroom layout - 2 sinks in a separate room from the bath. Wide screen TV, but no DVD player as advertised. Internet was $9.95 for 24 hours, via a speedy wired connection. Dorm sized refrigerator was handy. Staff were wonderful, and we struck up many quick friendships with other parents as their kids hit it off with our kid. We can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Magical!!”
Reviews.Author: rtanner8
Reviews.Content: We went all out for our first trip to Disney. Theme park room at the Grand Floridian and Deluxe meal plan. All i can say is that it was worth every penny. The whole hotel was gleaming and gorgeous. The staff was super friendly and helpful at all times. Our room was spectacular. The bathroom was lovely and spacious. Beds were a tiny bit to soft but I won't complain. All the restaurants served fabulous food. The pools were great, and there were lots of activities for the kids. Really a gem. When we can afford to come back we will! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TripleDeckers
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian has a beautiful lobby, staff we met in hallways, etc. were always pleasant and one of the best features is the monorail right at the hotel - a real time saver, especially for travel to the Magic Kingdom. The orchestra and piano player were both a treat! A few bad points unfortunately........We had called the hotel directly before our arrival to request that our room not be on the ground floor and also to inquire about any special notice we might expect as we were celebrating a graduation and had noted that on our reservation. We were told that our request for other than ground floor was noted and that at some point during our stay a congratulatory card would be placed in the room. We were given a ground floor room - we called the front desk and were told to return to the lobby and then we were given a room on the 5th floor of another building. The day prior to our departure we had yet to receive the promised congratulatory card. I went down to the front desk and the clerk looked through the book and it had not been noted. I found this very frustrating! Also told the clerk a couple of things about the room that were annoying - no dvd player as was listed on website when we made reservation, light bulb out in lamp for 2 days, fire escape route on back of door had the wrong room (one at the nearly the other end of the building) marked on it (I had checked that one day when looking for stairs to exit rather than use the elevator). The clerk was very nice and said she would get someone to talk to me - went to talk to someone for about 5 minutes - but no one came to talk to me. I found this somewhat dismissive. The good news is that the items I mentioned were taken care of immediately - upon our return to the room that day there was a great card and balloons, dvd player hooked up, and light bulb changed. A housekeeper came to the door and put in a fire escape route. Overall, I think this is a very nice hotel, but the room was not worth the price. However, the convenience of the monorail, the beautiful lobby and grounds are worth spending extra for this resort over some of the others. I am disappointed in the staff at the front desk - when staying at the deluxe hotel at WDW, I expect something better than what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Noisy!”
Reviews.Author: lisalmusso
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is just the best that there is out there. However, the walls ARE PAPER THIN. Being a solo traveler, I had to move 2 times to avoid noise from the ajacent room. It was unbelievable how I could hear everything in the room next door. So much to the level that I felt like I was actually in their conversation. Rooms were a bit tired and need to be up-dated. It was quite pricey for the paper thin walls. The location was excellent though. PS. They lost my bags. All my purchases were lost. It sucked and the conceirge acted appathetic while I cried because I was so upset.

Reviews.Title: “Practically Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: bandit2804
Reviews.Content: Last year I geared myself up for this trip , knowing we were going to to kid capital of the world . Well to my surprise it turned out fantastic. The Grand from check in to check out was wonderful. We stayed in the Sugar Loaf building . Very neat and clean . Close proximity to the Magic Kingdom . It was very relaxing to sit out on the balcony to view the fireworks. Monorail system made getting around very easy. We did not do the bus system but it looked very convenient . The staff went out of the way to be helpful , always smiling . Before we arrived I had Disney florist do a Mickey welcome "kit" for my son. We we entered our room it was "magical ". Mickey foot prints were on the floor and pixie lights left flashing around the room .Then a huge box of Disney gear..blanket ..hats .pens..cookies and a autograph book and a huge Mickey . Very impressive ! We are actually packing now and heading back next week .

Reviews.Title: “Hate the services”
Reviews.Author: eekitty
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend take me to disney world stay at this hotel to celebrate my birthday, my room suppose to be a lagoon view with King bed, but the counter person said i just can choose either king or lagoon view, WHAT, thats not i suppose to have!!!OK, than we have no choices so we go to a standard king bed room, and THAT is not we suppose to because WE paid for BOTH.the GIRL are Rude and the other women is RUDE too, and the girl even say is not their fault, and this is a family resort, they only have 19 KING bed room, WELL.is that a 4 1/2 star hotel services?hate their services, in a room, the mickey light is broken, the table is broken, WELL, i will never stay in this hotel, i think they are discrimination.well the other person (a black girl is really nice though). and i was planning to stay at this hotel for my honey moon since i love disney world, but i need to rethink about if i want to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Made my Birthday Dreams Come True!”
Reviews.Author: DelilahsDestinations
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend took me on a surprise weekend to the Grand Floridian for my birthday. I could not have had a better birthday! I did not know where we were going, so when we turned down the street leading to the Grand Floridian, he really faked me out by saying we were lost and would turn around at the end of the street. Imagine my surprise when we pulled into the Grand Floridian! As a Florida native, it had always been my dream to stay at Disney's flagship resort, and he had made my dreams come true! Upon entering the building, the staff was so friendly and accommodating and everyone asked if you were having a good day and smiled. I had never received such warm hospitality at any hotel before; even other Disney Resorts. You should definitely go on your birthday, because everyone, guests as well as staff, were wishing you a happy birthday! I felt so special! The decor and surroundings were second to none, and as Grand as you would expect from Disney. There were fun hidden Mickey's all over the place; I had a blast seeking them out! Getting back to the actual room - our first room was over by the Lake and we were a little discouraged to see that there was construction in front and around our building - very LOUD cranes and diggers...yuck. We went into the room and the noise was unbearable. The bed was a Queen and it was supposed to be a King; I went out on the balcony and the crane was right in front of me. I was not happy. We went back to the front desk and the staff was very accommodating. We were then given a key to the main building elevator, which lead us to the concierge level! What a way to compensate! We had never been treated with such concern by the Mouse before! Our room was large and beautiful with a balcony facing the lake and beach area. The concierge made our dinner reservations and was extremely accommodating to our last minute requests and we were treated to extra hours at the Magic Kingdom through 2a that morning. At various times throughout the day, the concierge level presented desserts, sandwiches, finger foods and beer, wine and other drinks. The drinks were available 24 hours a day. Before dinner, I arrived to the room to change and there was a personalized pink birthday cake waiting for me! It was chocolate and yummy! I was very surprised. After dinner, which we ate at one of the restaurants on site, we arrived back to our room and there was a large white chocolate Mickey Mouse, a card, and cookies, and chocolate covered strawberries saying Happy Birthday along with beautiful flowers in a Minnie Mouse vase. The service and amenities at this hotel are the best I have ever experienced. I have never felt so special. I know that the staff at The Grand Floridian was all a huge part of this...not to mention my boyfriend, who made it all happen. Service is Number 1 at the Grand Floridian and I wished my time there would never end. It is, by far, the best hotel experience I have ever had. Kudos to Disney - their Flagship Resort is the Grand Floridian for a reason. Exceptional!

Reviews.Title: “a Magical experience”
Reviews.Author: allawi1
Reviews.Content: Spent new years at the Grand, came back yesterday. The resort exceeded my expectation with the quality of customer service. Dining experience, Room quality and over all ambiance. The outdoor pool was tempting enough that some people were using it with a 34F temp. Convenient access to the monorail from the 2nd floor and frequent fairy rides to the MK. It is a unique hotel in a magical place. Highly recommended. !!

Reviews.Title: “Great resort, great location!”
Reviews.Author: copygirl
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 13th stay at the Grand Floridian in 15 years. We enjoy returning every year to this wonderful hotel. We stayed in Boca Chica and had a fantastic view. The staff, as always was wonderful, especially William the housekeeping manager in Boca Chica. There are only a few negatives with the Grand Floridian - noise travels between rooms and for two nights our next door neighbor's child cried for most of the night. We also continue to be amazed that outside of Disney, there is a Starbucks on practically every corner but there is no where in Disney to get a good coffee and you would think that at Disney's premier hotel they would have a coffee bar. We love the convenience of the monorail and the boats. The Christmas decorations were beautiful - although it makes the hotel a lot more crowded with bus tours viewing the decorations. The new marble in the lobby is beautiful! Overall - I continue to recommend this hotel to anyone willing to spend the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's Still the Easiest Commute to the Parks for Young Children”
Reviews.Author: RockyTop
Reviews.Content: Dec. 12 – 19th was our third annual stay in the Grand Floridian near Christmas and it’s always wonderfully decorated. I can’t imagine going any other time of year now that we know what Christmas is like at the hotel and in the parks. Over the years, we’ve stayed at a variety of hotels on and off the Disney property. Since we get two connecting rooms and have two young kids (4 and 8) in our group, the Grand Floridian is now our favorite location. The monorail is at the Magic Kingdom in one stop, the boat is the first stop coming back and when the kids are tired they can easily return to the hotel for a nap and rejoin the group later. I read the recent Trip Advisor reviews before we left and was prepared for some maintenance work to be continuing while we were there and it was. The tile in the main building is almost done now and some other minor work was occurring, but that’s to be expected with a property as old as the GF so it can maintain its grand stature as the years roll on. Both pools were open, we were greeted with apple cider and roasted chestnuts upon arrival and the customer service was great which has been our normal. We have stayed in Sugar Loaf (club level) the last two years and the food and service there have been exceptional. All the staff we encountered were very dedicated and gracious with a very diverse customer base (lots of foreign visitors with limited English, kids getting into everything, spills, special requests, etc.). I’m surprised they weren’t pulling their hair out some mornings just observing what they had to deal with. Since we like the location, food, service, pools, decorations, convenience, etc. I’m sure we’ll be back again next year if the price is right . . . which it was this year. We did experience some issues that other reviewers described with the Magical Express, which was a first for us. Normally its organized chaos, but this time it was just plain chaos squared . . . no cubed. There was a line that extended beyond the rental car area and seemed like it was longer then a football field. We stood in it awhile, but when we got to the desk there was a different line and we were confused as to which one we should be in so we jumped out of the very long one we’d been in forever and stood in line at the desk only to find out we didn’t need to stand in either one of them (I bet you can guess our reaction). The guy at the counter told us that he didn’t know why everyone was standing in that long line and that we could just get in the line to the far right that was loading onto the bus, which we did. At one point in the chaos, I even priced a van to see what it would cost us to forego all the lines, but it was very high as I expected it would be. The crowd could have been easily managed with someone just communicating with people as they arrived and steering them into the different bus queues or directing them to the counter if there was an issue. The employees appeared oblivious to the crowds and we thought they’d let people back up in line until they ran right out the terminal doors on the other side without a care. Disney has to know they have an issue with the contractor providing this service and if they don’t deal with it before next year; we won’t be in the line to nowhere again. I’ll just check TripAdvisor up until decision time and find another way to get to the GF if the problem isn’t fixed. The only other issue I had with Disney is the one I’ve always had and it’s the online reservation process. It has improved somewhat, but it’s not best in class as if it should be. In my case, it won’t allow me to not put my name on one of the rooms I’m paying for which causes a cascade of problems with the Magical Express baggage tags, food vouchers, etc. (since my name is on both rooms, I get two sets of everything). The only way I can fix it is to call reservations and sit on hold forever while I’m paying for the call. I decided this year after a couple of attempts to call them that I was going to give up trying to fix their problem and let them deal with it after we arrived with luggage tags corrected by hand, messed up meal cards, etc. I shouldn’t have to work at getting Disney to take my money, it should be as easy as it is in the park . . . just swipe the card and they’ve got the money from the correct person. Our return to the airport wasn’t as eventful, but we knew from last year to get our bags checked in and boarding passes early at the hotel since they’re extremely slow and lines grow quickly. We were the only ones in line and it still took them a long time just to get our boarding passes. If I’d had access to a printer, I would have skipped that part since I could have done it in 5 minutes. If Disney doesn’t improve the overall Magical Express process, they’re going to have more people looking for other transportation avenues. Considering everything, we had a fun trip and will most likely do it again, but Disney needs to address the aggravation factors they’ve got growing in some areas. We also noted for the first time that two rides in the Magic Kingdom (Carousel of Progress and Pirates of the Caribbean) had maintenance issues and closed intermittently and we got stuck in the big “ball” in Epcot for about 15 minutes. We got very tired of seeing Rome burning after awhile and the kids were getting a little frightened being stuck in the dark on an incline. I hope this doesn’t mean Disney is skimping on routine maintenance in the parks. I guess we’ll see if everything is back to normal or not next year.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: 67corvette
Reviews.Content: We embarked on our family 5 day trip to Disney Oct 21-25th, 9 people in all, with 3 little girls ages 6, 4, and 2. Since we stayed on the property at the hotel, included was the magical express which brings you from the airport to the hotel. This was very organized, and a pleasure to bypass the luggage and go directly from the gate to the bus for transfers to the hotel. We arrived at the hotel and it was very nice, a large lobby with music in the background. The hotel staff was very accomodating and as our rooms were not ready, They said they would contact us via text message when are rooms were ready. we had brought clothes to change into and checked our carry-ons and proceeded to Magic Kingdom. It was very easy to get from the hotel to the MK via the monorail, located on the second floor of the hotel. We would always take the boat back from MK as it was much faster as opposed to taking the monorail back as it would have 3 stops (20 min) before the GF. We checked into our rooms and the luggage was already there and me and my 2 girls 6 and 2 went for a swim. Overall the rooms are nice but a little dated, but no biggee! We had a park view and that was nice as we were able to see the fireworks and water show from the room each night. Enough about the hotel Meals: Do the meal plan, we did deluxe dining which entitles you to 3 sit down meals, although we did the fast food in the park for lunch, we used those meals for the more exp 2 meal dinner restaurants. Plus the food is so expensive it pays to use the meal plan, for ex: buffets for bkfst are $36/adult. Avoid the crystal palace, we did this for dinner and it was horrible, food was a low end buffet. we chose this for the first night as to get the kids excited about the characters this was Winnie the pooh and tigger and friends but everyone all with reservation were waiting on average 30-45 minutes, The waiting area outside the front entrance was so crowded and tough to keep the tired kids entetained while we waited and waited (45 min). We then went from this restaurant to the spectromagic parade, this is a dont miss, we all enjoyed. Try to stand by the front entrance as this way you can bolt out to the monorail or boats when the parade is over. Character breakfasts were key, they were buffet but you cant really mess up pancakes, eggs, etc. Chef mickey in the contemporary hotel was great, meeting mickey and friends, Akershus in Norway at epcot was fantastic for meeting the princesses, although this was the worst food of the breakfast buffets. 1900 park place was great for alice and wonderland and mary poppins and in the GF and finally the hollywood and vine was fun and interactive for the kids, dancing with the characters of little einsteins. Make sure you buy the autograph books in the hotel lobby or in the park to get all the signatures. Subsequently we have printed out all the picutes of the characters and put them next to the autographs in the book. Dinners: the California Grille on top of the contemp hotel was fantastic, nyc quality at 2x the price thankful that we had the dining plan! seriously thou our best meal, followed closely by the Citricos in the GF. We also ate at the Brown derby in hollywood studios, way overrated food was like going to a sizzler. The Parks, We had a guide for MK and HS he was excellent, sunstate tours and reasonably priced. We were able to use the fast pass lines for all rides, a must. Magic Kingdom was great for kids our age, they really enjoyed the rides. Hollywood studios was good for them as well, my 6 year old loved toy story mania, we went on it twice, even us adults liked it. You definitely dont need a full day here. Epcot was a little tough for our kids, not alot for them to do. They had little interest in the countries. BUT dont miss the test track ride and SOARIN, we all thought it was great., get the fast pass for this before you even have breakfast and then go back after you eat and walk right on. We did not rent a car and were fine with taking either the monorail or the disney buses to the parks. Each night we would get back and put the kids to sleep and within minutes they were out as each day it was record hot 89-91 degrees. My wife and i were also exhausted each day, as we ran around with them, swam, went to dinner, it was non stop. Also checking the luggage the morning of departure at the hotel was fantastic, we didnt see it again until we landed back in NY. Overall, the hotel is centrally located and the pools, snack bar, restaurants, etc were great.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: mdl955
Reviews.Content: The Magical Express was more of a nightmare than anything else. Had to wait for 40 minutes for our bus, and almost had our car service guy pick us up instead. We didn't even use the return express because they had the wrong flight information for all three of us. We called our guy and got to the airport with no problem. The TV remote didn't work, which should not be for a resort of this caliber. The lobby bar is so small, and nothing else is open for adults to just sit an relax at with a cocktail. Not impressed at all. No shower cap, which is a minor detail, but, hey, for the cost of the room, please be sure all the amenities, however small, are in the room. My sisters, who left before us, missed their Magical "Nightmare" Express because they showed up, literally at 10:26am for a 10:25 call. If the bus was going to leave prior to the 10:25am call, that should have been stated in the paperwork they left hanging on our doors, ie 'be sure to arrive 15 minutes etc. prior to your departure time from the resort.' Calling the operator was a joke. Took forever for someone to answer, and then, when they did, they weren't even in the hotel! Lost and found, concierge, general info - they had to ask where we were staying in order to answer a simple question! I called about a lost item and was put on hold for 30 minutes the first time, with no one checking every now and then on me, 40 minutes the second time and 30 minutes the third. Unacceptable. I travel the world for the travel industry for a living. The staff I came in contact with were phenomenal, but as far as the basic as I have stated above, SUBSTANDARD for this resort. I would not recommend the Grand Floridian to any of my clients after this experience.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's Grand Dame (at a price)”
Reviews.Author: RodrigoHueb
Reviews.Content: I've stayed for 7 days at the Grand Floridian as part of a trip to Orlando. The good side: . Hotel's architecture's beautiful and location couldn't be better, you could go to the parks by monorail, bus or boat. . Rooms are spacious, elegant and quiet. Been upgraded to Club Room which was a pleasant surprise... although I didn't really use the concierge service, the snacks and breakfast were delicious. .Nice variety of fine dining... which is a real rarity in Disney parks. . Although the main pool was under maintenance, the heated adult pool was beautiful. The bad side: . Although the hotel is surely Grand, I'm not fully convinced it is worth the price, as there are many other nice resorts in the area at lower rates (including some Disney resorts). . We had to wait in a very long line to get the Disney bus from the airport, and the bus we travelled into was apparently much older then the ones to other resorts. I feel that, if you are staying in Disney's prime hotel, you should have a prime treatment, with exclusive line and transportation, and not the same kind of service you would get in a All Star Resort. . The same would go for the buses around the Disney complex. The Grand Floridian is the last stop of the buses. Doesn't an exclusive resort deserve and exclusive bus to parks? I have visited most of the other Disney Resorts during my stay and the Grand Floridian is far the most beautiful. I would probably stay there again in the future, but I think perhaps the Animal Kingdom Resort and the Boardwalk Inn may also deserve a try.

Reviews.Title: “More Fla., than Grand”
Reviews.Author: Dangank
Reviews.Content: I have no doubt that the Grand Floridian is the best resort on the monorail/Magic Kingdom loop: the proximity to the MK, the public spaces in the main building, the pool, the service, the effective bows to an era when service was smily and everything worked. However, my fiancee and I were in an outer building. Our room was antiseptic. It was, of course, Disney-deluxe-resort cookie-cutter in size and shape. But as much as the exterior of the hotel is splendid, the interiors of the rooms are meager. The health club is a walk, 10-mins, in the direction of the Poly. The concierge was great; she got us Vick's vapor rub from a distant gift shop(pe). We did not eat at the GF, excep once, and quickly, at Gasparilla's. Good chicken bits. My new rule-of-thumb is this: stay at a Deluxe resort ONLY if it is a villa or suite, or has Concierge/Club level access. I recommend GF for first-timers and MK fanatics.

Reviews.Title: “One of the most relaxing vacations ever, YES I said "relaxing!"”
Reviews.Author: SarahKNC
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent 7 nights at the beautiful Grand Floridian Resort and Spa. While I have vacationed at Walt Disney World several times in the past, this was my first experience with just my husband. Before going, I worried that it wouldn't be as fun since we weren't with a group or kids, but the trip turned out to be one of our best vacation experiences to date. Disney's Magical Express Transfer: We arrived at MCO and as the owner of a travel agency, I opted to try the Disney's Magical Express instead of renting a car or hiring private pick-up. I'm so glad that we did this because all you have to do is walk down to the baggage claim area and get in line to get on your bus. There are several buses that go to the various resorts. They handle your luggage so you can begin relaxing immediately. I would suggest bringing a few dollars to tip the driver as they make you forget that you are on a motorcoach with other guests. The ride to the resort lasts about 25 minutes and there is a cute movie shown during the ride. Our bus stopped to drop people off at the Polynesian resort, then dropped us off at the Grand Floridian and continued to the Contemporary. Dropping other guests off didn't take long at all. Check-in: We were greeted as we stepped off the Magical Express and a bellman took our luggage. We were supposed to have a garden-view room, but since we were celebrating our anniversary and my husband's birthday a few months late, we were kindly upgraded to an amazing room in the Boca Chica building and couldn't have been more happy. Thank you David! We were also given neat anniversary pins and my husband was given one for his birthday. We were them most of the week and I recommend doing the same if you are celebrating something special. The front desk staff were so kind and extremely organized and happy to answer any questions we had. The room: We were given a ride via golf cart to our room in the Boca Chica Building. It was on the top floor and highlights included the king bed, flat screen tv and incredible view of the Magic Kingdom castle and Space Mountain. We were right on the water and could watch the light show on the water each night as well as the fireworks from the Magic Kingdom. They pipe in the sound. For the most part, we had a quiet stay. The resort was about 50% occupied and the only time we heard anyone in our room was when a group of kids ran down the hall screaming. Mousekeeping did a great job and I loved the H20 plus shampoo. The bathroom was pretty standard, but served it's purpose. We had a nice little sitting area with a love seat and chaise. Two sinks in the bathroom with ample space for both of us to spread out our stuff. They provide robes and slippers as well as a safe. Oh, there is also a refrigerator in the room- very handy. There are 8 buildings (I think) that make up the Grand Floridian. I honestly don't think you could go wrong with any of them. The staff do such an incredible job and each building has it's own advantages. They are close together, but if walking is an issue, I recommend you stay in the main building since you are right at the monorail. Food: We had room-service daily for breakfast and the French toast is out of this world! We tried it for dinner once or twice and it was great too. Quick service. We also picked up things at the Gasperilla Grill numerous times. They have great turkey wraps! Also, Gasperilla has mainly American food: burgers, chicken nuggets, pizza, drinks, cookies, cereals. We had brunch at the Grand Floridian Cafe the day we arrived and the service was amazing. I tried the Mickey waffle, but the French Toast there puts it to shame. We also ate at Teppan Edo twice during our visit to Epcot. It was a fun Japanese steakhouse and we loved eating community style and the show the cooks do. Italian restaurant at Epcot was also very good. 9 Dragons at Epcot was good, but probably our least favorite in that particular park. To each his/her own. They had extremely fast service at 9 dragons, but we almost as if they were rushing us to eat and get out. Sci-Fi Restaurant at Disney's Hollywood Studios was fun. We always try to go there while at Disney. You eat in convertibles and the atmosphere is like an old drive-in movie theater. Shopping: We went via taxi (they sit at the GF door) and went to the Prime Outlets. So many stores and lots of fun for a few hours. GF also has a neat soap store, a golf store, and a fun shop on the first floor that offers cute clothing for women (think Lilly dresses, different Minnie Mouse shirts, bathing suits.) The parks also have Disney themed stores and will deliver your items to your resort at no charge so you don't have to drag them around the park. Allow at least 1 day for delievery. There is also a convenient shop in the GF that has snacks, books, Christmas ornaments now, Disney mugs, etc. Monorail: Easy to catch on the 2nd floor of the GF main building. We never had huge waiting lines. The cars were crammed at times, standing room only, but that wasn't an issue since it doesn't take long at all for you to get to whatever park you are visiting. Note- you have to switch monorails (very easy) to get to Epcot and no monorails go to the Animal Kingdom, Downtown Disney, or Hollywood Studios. You have to go to those parks via bus, but they have a very convenient schedule, were clean and comfortable enough. Parks: All amazing! Take advantage of the fastpass service. You get a ticket that allows you to come back during a certain time frame to be in a shorter line for the most popular rides. Also, we were very happy with the Photopass service. Instead of annoying other guests with "can you take our picture," there are many Disney photogs around to do that. They also have fun props at certain locations that make pictures more interesting and are easy to view online. Decent prices too. If you do go with the Photopass, I would recommend buying the package where you get a cd prior to getting to Disney. You save a lot that way if you are a picture person. Special events: We attended Mickeys Very Christmas Party and had a blast! The Magic Kingdom shuts down except for guests who have tickets (must buy in addition to regular park ticket.) The castle was completely transformed and gorgeous, there is an incredible parade, cookies and hot chocolate are passed out in various locations and the characters do a special show in front of Cinderella's Castle. Allergies: Forgot to note in the food section that Disney does an incredible job catering to allergies. At the restaurants, they asked if we had any allergies and when we told them our issues, they were totally accomodating. The managers of the restaurants came out and talked to us as we were ordering at each place, just to be safe. I appreciated that. Also, I was impressed at the Mickey's Christmas Party that they offered gluten free cookies and a substitute to the hot chocolate. Spa: I thought we would have time to take advantage of the GF spa, but we honestly were having too much fun in the parks our relaxing in our room. Weddings: The GF is right at the Wedding Pavilion and we witnessed a few seconds of 2 gorgeous weddings. The couples looked very happy. We have stayed at some of the most amazing places in the world, so when our friends who haven't stayed at Disney heard we were going they thought we were crazy. We have been home for a little over a week now and keep talking about how hard it was to leave and how much fun we had. I get sad talking about it cause I want to be back there. It was truly magical. Yes, it will be so much fun and a different experience once we have children and take them there, but it allowed us, as a couple to relax and just be kids again. Disney World truly has something for all ages. I know I am forgetting some details as it is late when I am typing this review, but please feel free to send me a message if you have any questions. I've also stayed at other Disney resorts and am happy to give you my opinions of those. I guess I should start posting about those experiences. I would recommend the Grand Floridian to the traveler who is looking for the most upscale Walt Disney World property. The whole property was just beautiful and the Disney cast members were incredible. The resort never felt "stuffy" although I personally think that it has the most elegant decor. You could still let loose and relax there. A few more highlights: The gingerbread house in the GF main lobby looks, smells and tastes amazing! They sell cookies from the house from 10 am - 10 pm (I think) in season. Also, the orchestra that plays in the evening was lovely. GF had a nice beach and 2 pools. We were busy with other things and didn't use them, but they looked great. Last tips: I can't tell you how many disgruntled parents and out of control kids/temper-tantrums we witnessed. We don't have children yet, but please give your kids a nap in the day if they tend to get grumpy. Also, expect lines. You are at Disney World and they are pretty efficient at getting you to a seat fairly quickly. The fastpass is genius. Make reservations at Cinderella's Table 180 plus days in advance if you can. It is nearly impossible to get in there if you don't, even with concierge service. For other restaurants reservations are recommended, but we found that we could walk up and wait 20-30 minutes for a table, which we didn't mind. We didn't want to have to plan our day around reservations, so it worked out nicely.

Reviews.Title: “SERVICE AND LOCATION”
Reviews.Author: gumbatony
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 11/1 t 11/6. Can't say enough nice people great room and great service. If your looking for "THE BEST" you found it in the Grand Floridian. Treated great everywhere on the Disney property. Felt right at home in the hotel. The staff should be commended on their willingness to give their guests the best service possible. Can't say enough !!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: NashvilleTNGuy
Reviews.Content: I stayed here November 8-10, 2009 in Room 5338. I was on business by myself so I can't speak for honeymooners or families with kids. This is a very nice hotel (and should be for the price). If Magic Kingdom is your destination, you are in the right place. If the other parks or Downtown Disney are your destination, the buses can be up to 25 minute wait outside. But it is worth is since they dump you right at the park gates. The food here is of course expensive except for the 24 hour snack shop. The website says there are DVD players in every room. There was not one in mine so call before you go to confirm. The staff is very friendly and everything is clean. Housekeeping gets going early though, about 8AM. The only negative is that you are not within walking distance of anything.

Reviews.Title: “THE place to stay”
Reviews.Author: ria428
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Grand Floridian. the hotel itself is wonderful. the servie is top-notch. We stayed in a 2 bedroom suite. Although spacious, it was just a moderate room. no frills. It need a face-lift, for sure. Dont get me wrong, it is not horrible, but i did expect more considering its a 5 star property and quite pricey. The lights were dimming on and off the entire time. Quite annoying. That aside, the service cannot be beat. The grounds are spectacular..the pools are amazing....restuarants are great. The location is just perfect. Although i didnt love the room, i still would return to this hotel on my next trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “great holiday feel”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVELWELL
Reviews.Content: stayed for 4 nights early nov. great stay.pools nice ,room nice ,great holiday atmosphere at resort ,food and service good.very well located for disney with monorail ,boat and bus shuttels.would go back anytime.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel..Grand Location...Grand Service”
Reviews.Author: AggieTraveller99
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian in early October with my wife, our two daughters (4 & 1), and my wifes parents. The hotel was great as we made reservations through Disney. They paired us in rooms next to eachother and reserved a crib. All accomodations were as requested when we arrived. The bellman who brought our bags up was more than willing to fill us in on every detail of the hotel and our stay. Words of advice, you can watch the nightly fireworks show at Magic Kingdom from the marina on the hotel property. It is a stright view across the lake to the castle. Perfect view, no crowds, and a 24 hour restaurant right behind you. Best seat in the house since crowds getting out of the park are crazy. The rooms were great although the lobby was goin through a renovation so we didn't get to fully enjoy it. All in all a great location (monorail stops at the hotel, or take a boat directly over to Magic Kingdom). I highly recomend.

Reviews.Title: “Looks good from outside, but not so good inside”
Reviews.Author: Ashiya
Reviews.Content: My daughter aged 14 and I spent 6 nights there during her October half-term. Arrived in the evening, found the room too cold. The room temperature was set at 70F, andt the thermostat was not working, and thus the engineer had to be called in. The toiletries supply was very limited, and there wasn't even a shower cap. I made a call and asked for one. Half an hour later, still waiting. I had to make another call to finally get one. The quality of linens and towels was mediocre. Wi-fi didn't work. Moreover, the telephone didn't work. My husband called from London, and my daughter picked up the phone, but it still kept ringing. He was told that we weren't there. When we explained this incident, the receptionist was very curt. All in all, poor value for money. I have stayed at many much better hotels, sometimes for much less. We will not be goind back there.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Caireann
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice - once in 2006, once in 2007. We will stay there again soon and I cannot wait. I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough. The hotel itself is beautiful, the regular rooms are not huge, but are very nice, we had gorgeous views of the lagoon both times, even though we had not paid extra. The kids did the Pirate Adventure, and we hired speedboats - both great fun. The pool is wonderful, 1900 Park Fayre and Narcoosee's restaurants are lovely and good value. The staff were great - I was very ill on our second trip and they were kind and helpful. Our chambermaid was lovely, and she left the kids cuddly toys beautifully arranged each night - they were so excited to see how they would laid out when we returned to our room! The hotel is so close to the Magic Kingdom, you can watch the fireworks every night. Fabulous experience. Expensive, yes, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Cant' wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: rtlaw
Reviews.Content: I made my second trip to Disney with my wife and six year old daughter and both times stayed at the Grand Floridian. I researched all of the hotels and when you decide based on all of the variables (location, food options, kid's activities, adults activites, rooms/property) the Grand Floridian is, IMHO, the clear winner. We were thinking of trying the Polynesian, Animal Kingdom or Wilderness Lodge, but in the end, although each of these others had their plusses, the Grand Floridian had this and more. It is truly the only 5* resort property. And if you can, stay on the Concierge Level, which will allow you to defray the high food cost at all of the Disney properties (since the Concirege level has about 5 food presentations a day-breakfast, snacks, tea, hors devors, and desserts-yummy! And although it has no Kid;s club, it does have tea with Alice , the character breakfast and the Pirates treasure hunt (takes the kids on a boat to a nearby shore), a tremendous pool with slide and who needs a kid's club anyway with the parks. I am going to reserve again at the Grand Floridian for the week of 12/3-12/9 to see Didsney with all of its Christmas decorations.

Reviews.Title: “We Will Be Back”
Reviews.Author: WestiefanNJ
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian three times in the past four years and at almost every other deluxe resort on property. It is my favorite for a variety of reasons. Location, Location, Location comes first to mind, especially the ease of wheeling your stroller right on the monorail and being at MK in five minutes. I also love the feel of the rooms with their light colored decor and the size. We love to stay in Boca Chica (although it took three room changes to get there...) and have a pool view. The restaurants are pricey but great. Narcoosees was surprisingly good and the view was great. The pools are ok (Yacht club better) but the view onto Bay Lake is wonderful. A nice perk.... we finally got to Boca Chica and on our last night stepped out back to watch the fireworks at the Magic Kingdon--perfect. You can't ask for much more than that. I also loved the convenience of Gasparilla Grill for breakfast and late night snacks (I think it is open 24 hours--I don't think any other hotel has this). Kind of hard to find, though and we missed it on our first stay. The only things I thought about on my most recent stay that lacked a bit was the service and make this hotel a four star instead of a five star. Most importanly, turn down was drive by: this is unacceptable as the room rates are based on paying for this. We would get ---"here are your towels" if we were in our room, and not ask if we wanted turn down. Yes, we probably should have said we wanted turn down, but I felt uncomfortable. We were checked into a room on the first floor next to an elevator which I asked to be switched (we had a light sleeping baby) and they complied, but put us in a dormer room, which I did not like. They eventually switched us to a room that was perfect, but it took two days. I have to say that they did try to switch us before but claimed no room. I feel that when I return to a hotel for a week every year and spend a lot of money in the restaurants at the hotel, they should recognize repeat customers as such, but I don' t feel that happens in the Disney machine. Also, I always read about people receiving upgrades, but in my 8 or so trips this has never happened. Service at the bar outside of Citricos was also weird: a woman who claimed she worked at the bar (which was closed at the time we were there) made excuses about how she normally did not work there and grumbled a lot, but, hey, we still enjoyed it, but again, not 5 star stuff. In totality, though, all this is probably minor stuff. To temper these complaints, they did change my room to make me happy, and, when I lost my daughter's favorite bear at Animal Kingdom Lodge, they went above and beyond to get it back and Fedex it to me. Also, we love the bar at the hotel (closed at the time we were their, though)--it is so awesome with the musicians outside playing every night and the music in the lobby (there is also a piano player most nights). You really feel you are in a special place. The lobby is great with the music and the shops and it extends the magic and fantasy of the parks, but in a more refinded way.

Reviews.Title: “Service lacking and construction”
Reviews.Author: Heard
Reviews.Content: Stayed here 10/7-10/10 before our 7ni. Disney Cruise. We generally love this hotel, but the construction kind of set us off this time. We booked Sugar Loaf building and construction was going on right next to it. Jackhammering all day was a little frustrating when we were in the room for a mid afternoon rest with our 4 year old. The concierge staff was not helpful to us at all. Stayed at Boardwalk after our cruise and the service was night and day. The concierge at Boardwalk called us before hand asking if they could be of assistance and were super friendly.....too bad I can't say the same for the Grand. We love the location of the hotel and the access to monorail but for what we paid I think we deserved better service. I understand construction must happen, but I don't understand ho-hum service. If we return it will only be for the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place - A little old fashion, but nice.”
Reviews.Author: windsova
Reviews.Content: I really enjoyed my stay at the Grand Floridian. The restaurants onsite seemed so-so and very very expensive for what you got (10$ for fries!!). Pool is amazing and I never had a chance to go in the beach, but I heard it was great as well!!! Overal it was a great experience and a great stay and minutes away from Magic Kingdom (1 stop actually!) No free wi-fi (very disappointed) but there were a lot weddings at the hotel, so it's definitely a romantic location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Disney Resort”
Reviews.Author: Utzgirl
Reviews.Content: We decided to spend our first stay on Disney property at the Grand Floridian and had a great experience. Originally we had wanted to stay at the Beach or Yacht Club because we had heard so much about the pool there, but since it was to be under construction during our stay, we thought the Grand Floridian would be a nice alternative. The hotel itself was very pretty in a Victorian way. The pools were lovely. The staff there was wonderful especially the front desk clerk who gave us a room in Boca Chica with a spectacular view of the Magic Kingdom and the Contemporary even though we hadn't reserved a Magic Kingdom room. We could even see the fireworks from our balcony. The room was kept very clean daily and our 10 and 8 year old girls especially loved the hand-towels shaped into ducks. The location was especially convenient and we took the monorail often. Our girls loved riding up front with the monorail driver who gave them their own personal monorail licenses. The buses didn't run as smoothly as the monorail system and one morning after waiting over half an hour for a bus to the Animal Kingdom, we finally gave up and took a cab. Other than that, the only complaint we had was the rather thin walls which made our extremely noisy neighbors that much more disturbing. Overall, we had an amazing time at the Grand Floridian and though I think we'll probably try the Beach or Yacht Club next time, we would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand time”
Reviews.Author: smile72
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel. The monorail to the magic kingdom passes by the hotel so it's easy access to the magic kingdom amusement park. You can watch the fireworks everynight from the hotel grounds facing disneyland. You can even see it while swimming in the pool at night. So my advise to all is not to spend extra to get a room that faces the park just to see the fireworks. You can enjoy the fireworks from the grounds of the hotel. As in any establishment there are a few not so good employees that can ruin your stay but in general most of the employees there are very helpful. Reserve ahead of time if you want to eat at any of their restaurants, they are expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Magic in the Kingdom”
Reviews.Author: sandman67
Reviews.Content: Just got back yesterday from Walt Disney World (WDW). Stayed six nights at the Grand Floridan Resort and SPA for a convention. Great resort with excellent service and staff. A lot of work going on inside and outside of the resort, maybe that is why I was upgraded to a better room w/o request. The interior is going through a total upgrade by changing the carpet to marble tile. Even with all the work there was no problems moving through the resort w/o problems. I have been to WDW twelve times, with each time I have enjoyed my stay on WDW properties. The Polynesian resort remains my favorite Disney property.

Reviews.Title: “Truly Magical, this upgrade and room choice was the best descision we made.”
Reviews.Author: 999_Magic
Reviews.Content: Although the Resort, grounds, and views are spectacular, for us, it was the staff that made our stay as special as it was! From the first step off the Floridian Bus from the airport and being greeted by our personal greeter who knew our names and our occasion, we were instantly impressed. She pleasantly described the amenities of the hotel and where everything was while casually escorting us to our room. Once at our room, she opened the door and pointed everything out in the room and then opened the curtain to expose of lake view of the Castle in the Magic Kingdom. She left us with a great impression of the staff and the resort in general. After she exited the room we took a seat on our balcony first thing to enjoy our view and soak in the experience after the flight from Boston. It's was then we noticed that from certain areas of our balcony, the view was obstructed by a rather large and leafy tree. Figuring we had nothing to lose, and the greeter did ask us if the room was acceptable and offered to check on other rooms if we weren't 100% happy before she left., we went to see the concierge. We had chosen to stay on the concierge level, so they were immediately available just a hallway away from our room. We had a seat and explained our concerns of the tree. Without having to say another word, our concierge immediately offered she look for compatible room availability and give us a tour of those rooms to make a new choice. It turned out, it was as simple as moving us two rooms down to a more center room with a perfect view of the Castle. She took care of all the details while we toured the grounds and when we came back an hour or so latter, we simply stopped by her desk for our new room keys. It was a easy as that. The personal tour, opposed to listening to her list available rooms from her computer screen made such a difference. From there, things just continued to get better and better. They Knew were we're celebrating our honeymoon, and when we came back to the room that first evening, we were greeting inside the room by balloons, Disney Photos, Champagne on ice with 2 glasses, a fresh rose, and special Customized Just Married Buttons which we wore our whole stay! If anyone has stayed on the concierge level in the main building. I know you've met at least half of the staff. Dan, Vonnie, MeJay, and Mr. Hardy are the staff we meet the most. From the honeymoon suite, we needed to pass by their desk to get to the elevator for the main lobby. Not a time would go by where whoever was working didn't stop for a minute and ask us about our day. A simple "good morning" easily turned into a several minute conversation. And that there was always 2 concierge working, you got unrushed, individual attention. By the end of our stay we felt like we were saying goodbye to friends. You could tell they truly wanted us to enjoy our stay and made it clear they would do anything in their power to accomplish that. After the treatment received on the concierge level, I'm afraid we are spoiled from making reservations any other way. For a special occasion, I would highly recommend The Grand Floridian and the Concierge level to any of our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing View and Exceptional Service!”
Reviews.Author: marisuz28
Reviews.Content: We checked in at about 10AM on a Saturday. We expected to have to check our bags with bell services, and return to check in to our room later.
