The staff was able to find a room to check us into and to our pleasant surprise it was a Magic Kingdom view room! (We had booked a Garden View). It was wonderful to be able to step out onto our balcony and see Cinderella Castle and Bay Lake. The room was what we expected. It definitely wasn't huge, but had plenty of space for us. The bathroom had plenty of room for all our things. We also unpacked our weeks' worth of clothing into the armoire and hung items in the closet without needing to keep anything in the suitcases (and I am not the lightest packer!) The pools were gorgeous. The pool by the "beach" had a waterfall and a slide. It even had personal cabanas you could rent. The large pool in the center of the resort was great too. The water was a perfect temperature, and very clean. The resort also had two pool bars, and the bartenders (especially Mark) were very nice and accommodating. We dined at Narcoossee's and Victoria and Albert's. Both were PHENOMENAL! The quick service (Gasparilla Grille and Games) was pretty standard. It seemed small compared to the quick service at the other resorts, but the food was fine. The only (slight) downside was that the main building and some of the other buildings are being refurbished, but it really did not impact us at all. Being on the monorail line was incredibly convenient to get to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. I was extremely happy with our accommodations, and would 100% pay the money to stay in the Grand Floridian again. I would recommend this resort over and over. I was glad to find out for myself after reading some of the negative reviews about this resort that people just like to complain. We had an incredibly magical week!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian Resort and Spa - Sugarloaf”
Reviews.Author: ffamily64Canada
Reviews.Content: As I read the reviews for the "Grand Floridian" I'm disappointed as I actually PAID for the upgrade to the Grand Floridian and Concierge level; and didn't receive any upgrades??? Nope...no free wine, roses not a better view....NOTHING. Maybe a larger room would have been nice...as the rooms are small and outdated. The Sugarloaf and it's staff are wonderful but I wouldn't spend the money again as it was crazy expensive. My husband and I planned on a romantic dinner at Citricos - the dining room was filled with children at 9pm, load and the food was not very good - I was expecting a fabulous meal which is not what we received.

Reviews.Title: “Way Overpriced For the Small Rooms”
Reviews.Author: Atozz1
Reviews.Content: I visited the Grand Floridian hotel during the week of August 23rd 2009. I drove up from West Palm Beach where we had spent several days at the Breakers (beautiful 5 star historic ocean front hotel) The price of the Grand Floridian was the same as the Breakers ocean front room - around $400/night for a concierge room which I booked through Oribitz and was a solid discount from what Disney had priced on their site. Rate included continental breakfast and snacks during the day (all of this was mediocre). I had high expectations of this hotel - espcially after staying in the past at the Disney Animal Kingdom hotel. When I walked into my ground floor Sugar Loaf (building) room I was shocked at how cramped and dark the room was - first impression was a big let down. This was not a 5 star or even 4 star room. Tiny bathroom and there was barely space for 2 adults to walk around - let alone kids. I asked to be moved to a higher floor since there was a lot of building work being done on the the lower floors. The higher room was a little better - espeically with the extra room without the sofa/daybed, but still not worth the money. Also - you can hear noise from the rooms next door - down to the sneezing. Pools were just okay -- the pool by the "beach" was not as cool as we thought it would be - the slide was geared for age 6 or under. My 9 year old didn't find it too fun. I stay in hotels around 50+ nights a year for work -most are 5 star. I don't care how close the hotel is to the magic kingdom - the room itself is only worth around $275/night tops. No wonder they were only at 40% occupancy - down 50% from the prior year. The room and hotel were clean and service was good - my daughter left behind her bear (we realized at the airport) and they found it and mailed it free of charge to us (thank you Disney!). However, in general at the parks and the hotel things just didn't feel quite as magical from a service experience as they have in past years. The only way I would even suggest this hotel is if your rate is under $280 and if you have a child under 5 that needs to nap during the day and would enjoy the pool areas. The closeness to the parks would be a benefit to this -- although some of the lower priced disney resorts might be a better value. I do recommend their Victoria and Alberts restaurant ($125/person - regardless of age - although kids are suppose to be 12 or older) 6 course menu. It was a fun experience and at par with the food and service I've experienced at top restaurants around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful, smiling staff and an incredible piano player and orchestra - all this minutes from the Magic Kingdom.”
Reviews.Author: DPJ79
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian was a terrific hotel choice for a recent visit to Walt Disney World. First family visit and have never stayed at other Disney properties, so means of comparison. The room was quiet and provided a lovely view of the nightly fireworks at the Magic Kingdom - away from the crowds.Great transportation choices - boat or monorail - both operated flawlessly. Staff was incredibly helpful, accommodating and always smiling. Grounds were neat and well maintained, as was the hotel itself. The pools were also clean and kept at an inviting temperature. Enjoyed meals at 1900 Park Fare and Citricos - the Park Fare character breakfast was crowded and loud, but to be expected. Lots of fun regardless. Service at Citricos was disappointing, although the food was good. A terrific piano player - and orchestra - plays in the lobby every evening. Great place to sit and relax after a long day in the Florida heat. It is low season (late Aug) so lots of renovation going on - not really an issue. All in all I would say a top choice for a stay at WDW.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian is the Best Disney World Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BatonRougewanderer
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of Disney World hotels over the last 4 years. All of them have been nice, but the Grand Floridian is the best. The grounds are beautiful, the staff is very friendly, and it is very close to the Magic Kingdom. I doubt we will ever stay anywhere else next time we go.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay, Wonderful treatment by cast members!”
Reviews.Author: chrispyNE
Reviews.Content: I have always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian. We have traveled to Disney World several times, but have never stayed in the park. This being our honeymoon, we decided to treat ourselves. We were not disappointed. At check in, we were told we were upgraded. While we were checking out our room, there was a knock on the door. There was a cast member with a congratulatory 'gift' of champagne and roses from Mickey! Our room had a wonderful view of the lagoon and Cinderella's castle. We sat on our balcony watching the fireworks and having our champagne that first night. We stayed for 5 days, and every day there was perfect. Because we were upgraded to concierge level, we had personal concierge service. All of the cast members/staff were great, but Vonnie was exceptional. She was very helpful, and very knowledgeable The location is perfect and convenient. The room was clean, and housekeeping was exceptional. The hotel does have a few minor imperfections (maybe showing it's age?), but to have a whole stay ruined over some peeling paint would be ridiculous. We are already thinking about our next trip back, and we will definitely be staying at the Grand Floridian, even without the upgrade!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort, nice location, Disney magic”
Reviews.Author: ProfandMom
Reviews.Content: We are Disney veterans, having stayed at Wilderness Lodge, Port Orleans Riverside, and the Polynesian. I had to force my boys and husband to try to the Grand Floridian because they always thought the Polynesian was great. This was our first stay at the Grand Floridian, and in my mind at least, it's replaced the Polynesian as my favorite Disney property. The theming is very nice, but do know that this theming is supposed to be sophisticated Victorian Florida resort. If you don't want that, this one is not for you. We did not find it to be stuffy at all. We booked a standard garden view room and were upgraded to lagoon view in the Big Pine Key building. However, we had to be relocated after five nights because there was an increasingly leaky pipe in the wall which caused the bathroom floor to be sopping wet. We were impressed with how the management handled this situation. They called my cell when we were at dinner, and then when we went to the front desk and talked to a confused clerk who could not find our reservation (because we'd already been moved out of the room number we told her we were in!), a manager magically appeared behind us, had new keys already made for us, and had upgraded us to a theme park view extra large corner room in Boca Chica. We could see the Magic Kingdom from our two balconies, and we could even hear the train whistle and music from Main Street. It's truly a magical location. I do believe the resort needs to maintain its plumbing better so that there are not future floods in this way, but at the same time, they were professional and prompt in handling us when we were obviously inconvenienced. Others have posted about construction. We did see work being done, but we did not find it disruptive at all. The inconvenience would depend upon your room's location. They're putting new tile in the main building, and the completed portions are beautiful, though there were screens up requiring us to walk around certain areas on the second floor. I'm also assuming the construction will be done soon because they're not adding any buildings, just working on the stairwells and roofs in the existing ones. We had dinner at Citricos and Narcoossee's (both very good), breakfast at Grand Floridian Cafe (good), and several meals at Gasparilla's, the quick service place. Really, Gasparilla's is not the best quick service. They should remove those ridiculous arcade games to provide more seating and a quieter atmosphere, and improve the quality of the food which is not quite as good as Captain Cook's next door at the Polynesian (and that's not all that great either!). Pools are nice, though the waterslide, according to my kids, is not as good as the Poly's. The Grand Floridian pools are not overly crowded, however, and we could always easily get pool chairs, unlike at the Polynesian where I felt like the pool was much too crowded for the size of the resort. Grounds are lush and beautiful and also peaceful. Castmembers were all very helpful and treat guests better than the castmembers at the Polynesian do overall. We dealt with bell services, food service, front desk, and management--and all were great. This is the only Disney resort with standard turndown service, and my kids really liked that. The rooms are bright and cheery and have excellent lighting in the bathrooms. Also, housekeeping provides lots of towels and toiletries, too. Of course, it's overpriced for the room and service, and I know we could get better price options off site, but part of what you're paying for here is location. For us, the location merits a bit extra cost. We enjoyed our stay so much that we're returning for nine nights in December, this time at the concierge level.

Reviews.Title: “We loved our stay at the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: disneyfan44
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disney many times. This experience exceeded our expectation from the beginning to the end of our stay. Our entire family loved the resort, service, environment, and food. Thanks for making our vacation so special! Never wanted to leave and can't wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Another Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: biggroofy
Reviews.Content: Can't really beat the Grand Floridian's location - monorail or boat to Magic Kingdom. Easy! This time we stayed in the Sago Cay building overlooking the monorails. The views are not too bad, and housekeeping did the job. This is really an excellent resort, with fantastic restaurants! Now, the downside - again it is with Bell service. One night, while we were about to leave a restaurant, the rain was pouring (terrible!). Since we have small kids, the waitress suggest us to call Bell service and have them give us a ride back to our building. I really appreciated that, but we ended up waited for 90 minutes and still no show! On the day of checkout, I called Bell service and claimed that we needed help with our luggages. Unfortunately they said they are too busy, and it will be a 30 minute wait. Fine, let me do the luggage by myself. However, when I ran into a bell captain in the elevator and I said "Good morning!", when he saw that I am moving my only luggages, he just ignore me completely - hmm...all Cast Members I met in this magical world were polite and friendly, except the bell captains :( Sorry, I would give service a 5-star if I didn't have issues with bell service.

Reviews.Title: “Magical from beginning to end!”
Reviews.Author: GrandFloJunkie
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Grand Floridian many times over the years, but this trip was extra special. We have mostly stayed lagoon view, and once in the main building concierge. On that one stay in concierge, we loved the room, but the concierge staff was useless. We have always, though, had amazing stays here. But, on this last trip, we were given a complimentary upgrade to Sugar Load club level, and we were incredibly impressed with the service we received, especially from Robert. Even IF we had paid for this level, we would have been incredibly impressed. By the end of the first day, Robert knew our names by heart, our dining itinerary, just about everything! Our room was beautiful, as always. Mousekeeping left roses tucked in our towels on most days, and always arranged our stuffed animal purchases in cute ways. Robert had champagne, roses and cards signed by Mickey and Minnie sent to our room twice during our stay. He even followed us around the resort grounds one night taking photos of us because he loved the way we dressed for dinner that night. He then sent an 11x14 frame to our room to frame one of the photos he took the night before. We got to know Robert and the lounge staff quite well during our 13 days there. We chatted one evening about a dinner at a new restaurant that opened, and while we didn't complain about it, we did tell him we didn't like the meal at all when he asked (which is rare...we love ALL of the restaurants we dine at in WDW). We paid with our room charge, so he immediately comped it for us. We were shocked and never expected it! The lounge staff was lovely, and would get me wine when cordials were being served because I don't really like them. So, each evening that we were there, Robert made sure a bottle of my favorite wine was available for me. We would then head back to the marina to watch the fireworks in the Magic Kingdom sipping wine. We love to dine in signature restaurants in WDW, and every night we came downstairs to the lounge before heading the dinner, the staff (especially Robert and Suzanne) would make us feel so special fussing over our outfits. We always love to dress up for dinner, especially Victoria & Albert's. The lounge offered a very nice and varied selection of Hors d'œuvre and wines/champagne before dinner. More than just snack food, some items were quite fancy and delicious. Desserts in the evenings were equally delicious! We are never disappointed when we stay at the Grand Floridian. Service is wonderful, the grounds are beautiful, two of our favorite restaurants are there (Victoria & Albert's and Narcoossee's), and the rooms are lovely. Overall, the Grand Floridian is one of the reasons we always vacation in Disney World, and look forward to staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “If you want a view from balcony - don't stay in bldg. 5”
Reviews.Author: NewJerseyDanielle
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7-22, 7-23 and 7-24 on business/pleasure. We loved the resort itself. The check in was somewhat awkward as I was told on phone I would be able to be located in main bldg. or at least a bldg. with view. We were told nothing else was available. We got someone new, who had to constantly go to ask someone what to do. This was frustrating, but we finally got our room. Our room was lovely except for balcony view. There was construction going on outside and the monarail was right there. That was honestly our only disappointment. If I had been staying a week there, I would have been disappointed but we stayed only 3 days; it was a disappointment but not a disaster. The main bldg. had quick access to monarail and we were able to go to different resorts for dinners, shopping, ect. The food everywhere was very good but a little pricey. Very small portions at Citricos, but the waiters were excellent and knowledgeable. The shopping at this resort was also pricey compared to even the polynesian resort, which we visited. Pools were clean (warm water-but it was afterall July). All the employees on the grounds were excellent - friendly and helpful. It would be nice if this hotel had internet as we did need it suddenly. However, the front desk was able to get us the information we needed. We originally were supposed to stay at Contemporary Hotel and plans changed last minute. We visited the Contemporary and were so glad we were at the Grand Floridian. This resort was everything we were looking for - AND MORE. I can't wait to go back and stay longer!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not Impressed At All!!”
Reviews.Author: SH2727
Reviews.Content: My family and I holidayed in Florida for two weeks in July. We decided to extend our holiday by 3 days to enable me to spend my birthday in the Grand Floridian. We stayed there for a week last year and had a wonderful time. Unfortunately, we did not have a repeat performance!! Having paid to change our flights we checked into our rooms (we had two interconnecting rooms as my mother was with us). I walked on to our balcony to see the place swarming with work men and we had two huge cranes just outside our window! As you can imagine the nose was awful too, crash, bank, wallop does not even go near to it!! Not exactly Disney magic! Anyway, we thought perhaps they had some urgent work that had to be done and would be gone by the morning. When we got back to the room that night the cranes were still parked outside the rooms. The next morning, my birthday, we were up early and I wondered onto the balcony in my dressing gown to be greeted by about 20 workmen arriving for work and two already in the cherry picker type crane which was being hoisted up to our eye level. Naturally I dashed inside, taking with me any hopes of sitting on our balcony. The banging and crashing soon started. We decided to go into the park and then complain later on the day. We came back to our room around lunchtime, for showers and to go for a swim. My mother had a shower and walked out into her room to be met by a workman on her balcony painting!! I looked on to our balcony and yes, we had a workman there too. Together with one on a cherry picker, and of course the crashing and banging. My husband complained and we were offered two new rooms, which were a huge inconvenience as we then had to pack everything up and wait around all afternoon for the rooms, ruining what was left of my birthday. My husband then demanded he spoke to the manager, after 2 hours we finally spoke him and he was very pleasant and we were given a night free for both rooms and a bottle of wine. He explained that everyone in the hotel had been written to, to say the work was going on and he was sorry we were not warned. The work was not confined to the rooms. In the casual food dining area, this too was being renovated and I walked past a very stinky work man one point. The main reception was also being renovated with crash bang wallop being heard over the pianist!! Throughout the whole hotel workmen with hard hats were walking around and this was particularly intimidating at the pool area!! It is such a shame and whilst I realise work needs to be done, surely Disney could think of a better way of doing it with no disruption to the guests. It has left a very bad taste!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice for a first visit:)”
Reviews.Author: ljm231977
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at a disney resort, and we LOVED it! The building is beautiful, and we were able to watch fireworks from the balcony of our room every night (we could see the top part of the castle from the balcony) It was nice to take a boat over to Magic Kingdom, and made it easy to get back to our room with 4 small kids after a hot day in the park. We ended up spending most of our time at the resort, and saving our park tickets for our next visit (we got the non-expiration tickets). The kids loved the pool and the waterslide was great. There were fun games by the pool on some days, and the kids (ages 7, 6, 6, and 2) all enjoyed it. The zero-entry made it easy for our youngest to walk just as far as she wanted before the water got too deep. Plan to spend a lot on food! The gift shops in the resort are really nice too, but pricey. The cafe was nice, and fun but a little too expensive for what you get- I'd recommend getting food from the quick service place with the video games, so you can sit and watch the fireworks while you eat at a good price. The other restaurants booked up fast, and the cinderella buffet was fun- but also VERY expensive for us. The beach was nice, but disappointed not to be able to go in the water. Probably won't be able to afford this resort again unless we get a good offer- we did the buy 4 nights get 3 free deal, and picked a good time to go. Very hot, and the rain in the afternoon shut down the pools for a couple hours each day, which gave us some time to clean up. Housekeeping was great. Nice clean room every time we came back from the pool- fresh soaps and towels constantly, and the beds were always made up and everything re-cleaned every night we came back from dinner. The kids didn't want to leave. For the view of the fireworks I would definitely recommend this resort. Especially if you plan to visit magic kingdom or epcot- the monorail goes right from the resort to the parks. The bus takes you to the other parks and takes a while- but then again that's disney world- every park is far from every other park (which is why the park hopper is not worth the trouble). We used self parking, which meant we had to pull up to some slightly pushy people trying to get us to use valet (10 dollars a day). And we ended up unloading our own bags and were a little unsure of where to go- we couldn't check in til 3. The only bad thing is that the self parking is SO far away! But I was happy to not have the hastle of getting a valet driver each time I needed something from the van! Very nice resort. Bring nice clothes to dress up for dinners if you plan to visit the restaurants. And some extra money for spa treatments- if we come back to this resort I am definitely taking advantage of some of the spa treatments!

Reviews.Title: “Grand in name only”
Reviews.Author: AGentlRose
Reviews.Content: We've spent our last Disney vacations at the Polynesian but decided to give the Grand Floridian a try for a change. We stayed club level, which we paid for, not freely upgraded, so my review is based on that. If we were given the upgrade to concierge for free like others were, I'm sure my views would be a bit more slanted. I was told by the Concierge at the Grand Floridian to let them know my approximate arrival time and someone would be there waiting to meet us when we got off the Magical Express and that in any case, the club level check in podium would be down the walkway near the parking valet/bell stand. We got of the bus, no concierge cast member, no podium for club level checkin either. So we walked into the hotel, and the greeter, a very sweet older man, asked if he could help us. I told him we were club level guests and that someone from the concierge team was supposed to meet us and he went to look for the person. We just stood and waited in the lobby, until finally our concierge CM came and said that she was sorry she didn't meet our bus, but that they were "extremely busy." Okay, I can accept that. She walked us to our room, which did not meet either of my two requests --- king bed (told me they were reserved for wedding couples), not ground floor (room was on the ground floor). I told her that I understand that requests are just requests and not guaranteed, but if I can't have a king bed, then at least give us a room that is not exactly in front of the 24-hour open main pool. So they switched us to a second floor room, with two queen beds facing the marina --- at least it was quiet. Concierge level does have some nice perks, but are they worth the cost? It's up to you to decide. We did use the club level lounge for coffee and bagels in the morning, and if we were there around 5 PM, when they put out appetizers, (cheese, crackers, chicken pot stickers, cupcakes, brownies, veggies) we would take something to tide us over till dinner. We don't drink, but if someone likes their beer and wine, it is free flowing during serving hours and you are welcome to take bottles of beer or glasses of wine to your room. We were at the parks in the afternoon, so we never had afternoon tea with cookies, scones, etc. or evening cordials and desserts either. We were at Disney to enjoy the Disney parks, not sit in the hotel. We didn't use the concierge for dining reservations, as I do my planning myself, but I do understand that sometimes, they are able to get coveted, hard to get reservations that an ordinary guest cannot. And there is a small refrigerator with soft drinks that are available 24 hours a day. They have an espresso /cappuccino /latte machine, that you could get with steamed or foam milk. I did have a latter and it was pretty good. The cast members who worked in the concierge lounge were the best, they were pleasant, and we had some great conversations to several of them. Housekeeping was superb, the room was also cleaned in a timely manner, and they always left plenty of toiletries and towels, no skimping there. Every night, there was turndown service, with chocolates and "sweet dreams" notes left on each bed, and towels were replaced and new toiletries were left if needed. I have no complaints about the hotel, although I think that since guests who stay at the Grand Floridian do pay a premium, when it comes to transportation, they get the worst service. It is the last stop on the bus lines to Animal Kingdom, the Studios and Downtown Disney, so it is standing room only by the time the bus gets to the Grand Floridian. I do think that the cast members who work in the shops and quick service restaurants at the Polynesian seemed much happier than those working at the Grand Floridian, and the Poly just seemed to be a more welcoming place. I had reservations for a return to the Grand in Nov./Dec, however, my husband felt as I did, that the Poly was just more like home for us, and I switched our reservations to the Poly. Note about self parking: It is free but it is across the road from the hotel. A long walk when you are tired from being in the parks all day. (valet is $10 per day unless you have a disabled placard, then it is free) I didn't rate the rooms very high because for the price paid, they were kind of small. However, the rooms were well maintained and very clean. WiFi internet instead of wired would be nice considered this is Disney's top of the line hotel, not to mention that Disney charges you $9.95 per 24 hours continuous usage. Final take: Grand Floridian is a nice place to try --- once, but I wouldn't do it again. As I heard two older couples on the monorail talking about their experience with different Disney hotels and the Grand Floridian, his exact words "nothing grand about it, except the price."

Reviews.Title: “Worth every cent”
Reviews.Author: JambaMarie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got off the Disney magical express to be greeted by a Grand Floridian cast member who walked us directly to our room (in the sugar loaf building). During our vacation my husband and I explored some of the other resorts out of curiosity and my parents were on vacation there staying at the Boardwalk. Everything Disney does is always with polite service and to try to make a great experience but for my husband and I we would have not had a great vacation if we had stayed anywhere else. The service at the Grand Floridian is over and beyond. The resort my parents stayed was a nice place and friendly service but no comparison to the Grand Floridian service. If you are looking to book a vacation and spend the bulk of your time in the parks and just want a nice hotel room and enjoyable environment and pool then you can book any Disney resort but if you are seeking to book a vacation and want 5 star service treating you like royalty then there is no place else to stay except the Grand Floridian. Some deem it as expensive but I will say the guests are different in comparison to what we seen in other areas. Money and expensive places doesn't always mean class and manners but overall the environment was much more our speed and the money for the resort was worth every cent. I would never consider staying at any other resort there. The Grand Floridian restaurants were fabulous! We dined at the Grand Floridian Cafe and I will admit I was surprised with how wonderful our meal was. Citricos was fabulous and Narcosses was just the BEST. We dined at some other places in other resorts and although they were nice again there was simply no comparison. I enjoy the little things when it comes to service such as turn down service. My parents who stayed at the Boardwalk did not have turn down service. Turn down service isn't important to my parents but I love those little things and appreciate them and that is where the Grand Floridian is more geared toward that extra service which you pay for in the cost of the room....but again I say it is worth every cent. I

Reviews.Title: “fantastic BUT YOUR MANGEMENT NEEDS LOOKING AT.”
Reviews.Author: crowdersLincolshire
Reviews.Content: My family and i stayed at the grand floridian in june this year and thought it was fantastic.The service in the hotel was 4 out 5 and that was due to mangement.When you stay in a hotel like the grand floridian you expect mangers to do there job right.I had to complain about the service we got in the polynesion hotel and no one even replyed to me . I AM SORRY BUT WHEN YOUR PAYING THAT SORT OF MONEY TO STAY THERE YOU EXPECT A SERVICE WHICH I DIDNT GET . It hasnt stopped us going back to disney but we are staying at animal kingdom next year . TO DISNEY CUSTOMERS SERVICES IN THIS CURRENT CLIMATE YOU NEED TO LOOK AFTER YOUR CUSTOMERS BECAUSE LIKE ANY THING PEOPLE WILL GO ELSE WHERE."

Reviews.Title: “Over Rated, Prefer Other Disney Resorts”
Reviews.Author: JRCB0709
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is one of Disney's priciest resorts. We visited the Grand because we have vacation club points and it was an easy stop over on our way up the FL state. Having stayed at many of the Disney resorts, when we visit Disney again, we will not be staying at the Grand. We feel that Disney has many other resorts to offer. When you pull into the Grand you have a choice to self park or valet. You are almost forced to valet your car, for $10 a day plus tip, because the self parking lot is across the street. If you valet, the bellmen will help you bring your luggage to your room. Anytime you need something from your car, or want to leave the resort you must get your car from the valet. To us, this is very inconvenient. There are several buildings at the Grand, which makes it a very busy place. We were in an outer building on the second floor. Our building sat on the lake. The room was clean and kept up, but you could hear everything that was going on in the room next door. The rooms have a small fridge and coffee maker. There are several restaurants at the grand. Many are casual dress, but there are a couple that do require jackets, for men. We ate at the Cafe for breakfast which was pricey but delicious. I suggest that you make reservations for all of your meals there because there were always people waiting. We waited at least 30 minutes to be seated for breakfast. We also ate at Gasparilla Grill, which is cafeteria style. The food here was average priced, but not that great. On Friday night we were able to catch the fireworks from the resort. Since the resort sits on the lake, you could see them clearly from the marina. The beach at the Grand, but it is small and you cannot go into the water. There are several pools that are big enough to accommodate all of the families staying on the resort. One day, we rented a boat to cruise around the lake. This was pricey but it was something to do. We did not visit any of the parks while staying, because we have been to them many times before. We did however visit The Boardwalk and Downtown Disney. It took forever to get to Downtown Disney and The Boardwalk from the Grand. Before you plan your vacation to Disney, I suggest you look at the resorts' locations in relation to the parks you plan to visit. You want to pick a resort that is closest to where you visit, so that you are not wasting your time riding the buses, ferries, or monorail. Do your research before going. If you are not familiar with Disney it can be a stressful vacation. I'm glad that we have at least tried the Grand Floridian, but it is not our favorite Disney resort.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED the Grand Floridian...AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: NYCgirl628
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian for the second time from June 21st-June 27th, 2009. We are a family with Mom, grandmother, and a teenager and we all were equally thrilled with our stay. From the moment we landed in Orlando and stepped on the Magical Express bus we were greeted by smiling faces and informative employees. It was 97 degrees and very humid so I applaud them for keeping their happy faces on. I cant state enough how much I love dropping my bags off at the airport and not dealing with them again till they appear in my room! And its very nice for us not to deal with renting a car or finding transportation to the resorts. The buses are comfortable, air conditioned, and we have never waited more than 3 minutes for to be boarded. Upon arrival, we were greeted at the front entrance by a nice man who escorted us right to the check in desk. Even though it was hours before check in time, our room was ready. This time we had a room in the Boca Chica buiding which is directly across from the main building and the pool. We had reserved a garden view room and what a great view it was! Looking directy on to the pool and the main building with side views of the lagoon was truly beautiful. Out the back of our building had front row views of the fireworks and the lit Cinderella's castle, Space Mountain, The Contemporary, and all the boats on the water. The room itself is bright and clean with the best beds of any hotel I have ever stayed. Housekeeping was wonderful, what a treat to have our beds turned down every night , chocolate on our pillows, and towel-made Mickeys. Another nice suprise, my birthday fell one day after we were leaving but I still received a white chocolate Mickey with truffles (yum!) , a card from Mickey, and a gift card for a 20% discount on my photopass pictures. We ate in all the restaurant that the GF has to offer. Citricos and Narcoossee's were the two best meals I have ever eaten in Disney. 1900 Park Fare is hard to get into, Cinderella & her stepsisters appear here, reservations are full for weeks in advance, but we walked up to the desk and were able to get in easily. The food is buffet style and okay but the show put on by the stepsisters as they walk around and pose for pictures is hysterical. Cinderella and Prince Charming also dance with a few kids. Another great meal at Disney, though REALLY expensive, was the California Grill on top of the Contemporary. What a view!! From that height you can see the whole park and the surrounding hotels. Food was delicious and a large wine selection but not really a place for young children. Transportation from the GF is very easy. You can get to MK by boat or monorail and the buses to all other attractions were very fast during this trip. We go to Disney quite often, we've been very happy at other resorts especially the Polynesian, but the GF is by far the best experience. We are totally spoiled now!

Reviews.Title: “Overall a Wonderful Stay, but a bit pricey.”
Reviews.Author: NYCDAD18
Reviews.Content: We checked in to GF for a week stay with somewhat mixed emotions, after reading several negative reviews. Our stay started with an easy check in to a standard/garden view room in Big Pine Key. We asked if any upgraded views were possible. The registration person told us she would call our cell. "Go have lunch and we will call you". They called with an upgraded lagoon view room, no additional charge. I have teen girls and a wife. They all loved the pools. Each pool had their own character. The larger pool was quieter if you wanted sunning and peace. The pool nearsest to the beach was where all the smaller kids stayed. The nice slide attracted them. The fitness club area was decently maintained and allowed us to unwind after tiring and stressfull park adventures. Housekeeping was excellent, including night turn down service. They were very accomodating to all our requests. The only gripe we had was lack of wirelss internet in the room and the $10.00 daily charge. You pay enough for room. Internet should be included. Overall the hotel with it's grand lobby and many amenities was by far the nicest part of our vacation. It felt nice to come back to a really nice hotel after a long & sticky day at the parks. I would recommend for anyone who wants the convenience of being on the monorail system and close to MK & Epcot and not concerned with room prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very friendly!”
Reviews.Author: nyctravelgirlnyc
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 (my husband and I, our 16-year old son and 5-year old daughter) stayed at this beautiful resort from July 4th to July 11th. No matter how hard I try, I CAN NOT think of a single bad thing about our stay. Everything was perfect! We chose Magical Express. Since we used it for the first time I was a little nervous about leaving our laggage at the airport, but it arrived safe and secure to our hotel room 10 minutes after we got there. Unbeleivable! After 30 minute drive we arrived to Grand Floridian. Check-in took 3 minutes (I used on-line check-in which is available 10 days before your arrival thru the Internet), we were the only people checking in at that time (around 11AM), we got an excellent room close to the pool, clean and good-sized enough for a standard room. Day bed was already prepared for my daughter. Everything was in place. Every morning they cleaned up our room and every night they turned down the beds leaving the small chocolates on the pillows. Every day we left some tips for housekeeping, but not a single time it was taken! We also bought Disney Dinning Plan and enjoyed it a lot. Every night we dined at the nicest restaurants, the food was very delitious, the service was very polite and fast. And we didn't need to count how much it would cost and could order the most expencive dishes from the menu. We also didn't rent a car this time - we decided to try it for the first time - and never regretted it. The Disney transportation system works like a clock. We never had any problems with getting wherever we needed to get. The only time when you would need a car is if you'd like to go outside of WDW, for example to Universal parks. To get there you do need a car. But it wasn't a problem for us since we decided to spent all our time at WDW this time. All-in-all our stay was even better than I expected. I'm a travel agent and since now would recommend this resort and WDW transportation and dinning to all my clients.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but Disney Magic! ^o^”
Reviews.Author: lubrew
Reviews.Content: You have to stay at this hotel at least once. I've stayed at the Poly and Contemporary in prior stays and enjoyed them both, I paid less for those stays. I just stayed here so I could say that I did. The Disney Service is great. The rooms were always cleaned to perfection. The beds were a little hard, but okay. Our room was in Big Pine Key Building. The view from these rooms were of the pool, I really enjoyed the views from the room. The rooms had alarm Clocks with an iPod Docks (really liked these) and Flat Screen T.TV's The Staff was friendly and always made small talk or said hello. The front desk was always happy to answer any questions we had. The pools were clean and refreshing and the hot Tub was a welcomed site after a long day in the parks. The Location was ideal and transportation was easy to use. You could use the monorail to get to Magic Kingdom and EPCOT. Make sure to ask to sit in the front with the driver. This is a great treat. They give you a Monorail Co-plot license when you exit. If you want to go to the Water parks or Animal Kingdom or Hollywood Studios Just take a Bus. The Buses come every few minutes so the wait is not long. We had the Mary Poppins Character Breakfast at 1900 Park Fare... The Food was great and got some pics with the Characters. They come to you so that's great! It beats waiting the the heat for them. Also Gasparilla Grill (Quick service) has great food for a fare price. I recommend getting those refillable Mugs... So worth it, Also makes a great Souvenir. If this is your first trip to WDW I would recommend staying at another hotel. Save your Money for the parks! A Great Hotel, Just make sure you spend a lot of time using the hotel grounds for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place...But Over-rated”
Reviews.Author: paradiseinNH
Reviews.Content: Our family just got back from another trip to Disney World last week. This was our first time staying at the GF. The only reason I decided to stay at Disney's most expensive resort is because of the 4nights/3 free special that they were offering. Even with the 3 nights lodging free, it still cost us an exorbitant fee for this trip. We were celebrating my 41st birthday here. To be as brief as possible, we were greeted immediately by a very friendly hostess as soon as we disembarked from Disney's Magical Express in front of the hotel. We were whisked away to our building, which was the Sugar Loaf concierge bldg. adjacent to the main one. We ended up being upgraded for free to concierge level by Disney, thus entitling us to some small food offerings throughout the day. Our rooms were two adjoining ones and they were very pleasantly appointed. Please keep in mind that, being that this is touted as being Disney's very FINEST hotel, I was expecting a touch of opulence. I was somewhat disappointed to find that, even though this hotel is beautiful and lovely, I would not characterize it as high-end. Marketing ploys lead one to believe that they will be experiencing an upscale, exquisite hotel -- however this is not entirely true. It is a very nice hotel indeed, but I do not feel it really and truly lived up to my expectations based on the reviews and the belief that this was the finest Disney had to offer. Nice rooms and lovely surroundings are certainly what you get -- but you are not getting even 4 star hotel status in my honest opinion. Here in NH we have a hotel up in the White Mountains called the Mount Washington Resort in Bretton Woods, NH. It is considered to be only a 4 diamond AAA hotel and it was far more magnificent in all aspects when compared to the Grand Floridian. So I rate the Grand Floridian as being beautiful, pleasant, comfortable, lovely, etc. but I wil readily say it was not even close to what it is purported to be. Also worthy of mentioning is that the concierge buffet offerings are not that palatable. On the very first morning, there were tiny black fruit flies covering the fruit offerings. It was truly disgusting a sight to behold, and it so turned me off that I refused to eat any fruit for the entire trip. I even discouraged my children from doing so as well for fear of what those squalid flies would transmit. I have not even seen this type of bug infestation in Hampton Inns, let alone finding that at Disney's Grand Dame. Also, the food was the same basically every single day. I am not complaining loudly as this was free for us as an upgrade, however I do mention it for those poor souls who are actually paying beaucoup bucks for this spread -- it is not worth paying for. Especially when there are flies all over the open food. One has to wonder how sanitary it is after all. The other thing for those of you who like internet access for email, news, etc. You are required to pay $10 per day access fee! I feel that is exceptionally high and I am by no means any tight wad. And the real kicker is that you need to pay $10 to access the internet in your room and then another $10 per day to access the web at the pool/lobby area. It was nice to have the all-night cafe Gasparilla Games for our teenage boys to go grab food and play games at all odd hours of the night. The pools on the property are quite lovely, as one would expect. The boat ride from the GF to the Magic Kingdom is alot of fun and a refreshing respite on those hot days. We rented the little Sea Raycer boats from the GF dock out back. Our family rented 4 of them for 1 1/2 hrs. utilizing the coupon that is provided in your welcome package. Boy, was that one of the highlights of our trip! We really really had a blast on those things! If I could recommend one must-do, it would definitely be to try these boats - a ton of fun. Last thing I want to mention is that housekeeping was mediocre at best, which came as a bit of a shock to me. We were lucky to get very minor straightening services once every two days. There was even one day where the housekeeping staff didn't even empty our trash! I was peeved to say the least, coming home from a long day of touring to find the room smelling of trash. We also found a few days where the beds had not even been made or the room straightened up. I found that to be really odd. I've never stayed in a hotel in all my years where housekeeping did not even come in the room to do minor bedmaking/trash emptying. I did not even bother to say anything to anyone, but I will say that when I go back to Disney World, I will not stay at the Grand Floridian again. We stayed last year at the AKL in a sprawing 2 bdrm. suite that was literally right on the savannah with the animals a stone's throw from our windows. I would rate the AKL as being a higher class hotel than the GF. Perhaps Disney should market the AKL as their ultimate luxury in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We love the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: WDWfan13
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for a week in June, and we absolutely loved it. We had a theme park view that was outstanding. The hotel was quiet, clean and the service was excellent. The hotel staff made us feel as though we were the only guests there. They attended to our every need. We also really enjoyed that the hotel was not "over done" with Disney things. The décor was Victorian, and yes, there were various characters, etc. in the room, but it was not too much. You had to look for the characters to notice them at all. The pool and the beach area were very nice as well. We spent one of our days there taking advantage of the great service at the pool bar and enjoying the Florida sun. Although this hotel is in the center of everything, it feels like a private oasis. I would highly recommend it to everyone. The only complaint I would have would be that the lobby is a bit loud when people are waiting for the character meals in the 1900 Park restaurant; however, it is avoidable and manageable.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand Floridian is practically perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: SGW125
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Grand Floridian was one of the best anywhere in the world. I have stayed at many Disney Resorts, from the all star movies to the polynesian, and I have to say that not only is the Grand Floridian my favourite hotel at Disney World it is one of my favourite hotels in the world! I just love the experience you get from staying at this hotel. The staff are always very pleasant, and always happy to answer any question you may have. Housekeeping was also very efficient, happy to come early while we were at the parks, as we would usually have a midday rest stop to relax in our room, before heading back out to the parks later in the afternoon. Our room was beautiful, we were upgraded from a normal garden view room (which was all we could get at the time we booked) to a Magic Kingdom view room. We had a great view of the castle and the fireworks. The rooms are spacious and comfortable. In regards to food we ate at 1900 Park Fare for both breakfast and dinner, and found the buffets to have a wide variety of good food. Then at Narcoossee's we had a great view of the fireworks, and I believe this restaurant to be one of the best seafood restaurants at Disney World, great food!!! The at the Grand Floridian Cafe we had light meal which was again very nice, with a good selection and not too expensive. Another good thing about the Grand Floridian is its location!!! The monorail goes straight to the Magic Kingdom with no stops, however of the way back it stops off at the Contempory, then the polynesian, then the Grand Floridian, so I recommend you take advantage of the boat service on the way back from the Magic Kingdom back to the hotel. The monorail also goes from the Grand Floridian to the TTC (Transport & Tocket Center) so you can then get on a monorail to Epcot. So the only two parks you have to worry about buses for are Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom. Although the buses are very reliable and if you miss one, you dont have to wait long before another one comes along which is very handy! I hope this helps anyone planning on going to the Grand Floridian...I'm going back this August and can't wait!!!

Reviews.Title: “a very good experience”
Reviews.Author: MARCIAFERREIRAGOMES
Reviews.Content: beautiful,charming and comfortable hotel. the cinderellas dinner was unforgatable to the young girls. alices tea was not good. very helpful staf. all transportations to the parks are comfortable . the shops are great.i just missed a night entreteriment to adults.

Reviews.Title: “Loved everything about the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: Sunshine4me2day
Reviews.Content: Location....Location.....Location......PERFECT! Everything about the Grand Floridian was excellent. Is it expensive, well of course it is, this hotel is the Flag Ship hotel of all the Disney resorts. All the staff was very friendly and you could tell that the staff would make attempts to go the extra mile if need be. The rooms were super clean, the bedding always seemed as if it was brand new linen. We had booked a castle view room. I must say for all that have little ones this was a great option that we took. I know it cost more to stay at, but there was many nights with children under 3 that we were back in our room before fireworks. The little ones loved sitting out on the balconies with us to watch the fireworks. Make sure if you do request a castle view, that it is not an ubstructed castle view, for there is trees in front of some of the rooms blocking the castle. The pools were beautiful and they even have a pool area for the little ones by there beach. The beach is small at the Floridian, but I don't know, when we do Disney I'm not there to sit at a beach. We took a walk over to the Polynesian and I will say it had a LOT more children at that resort. We think next year we will book there to see what we like better. Overall it was a great hotel, definately get the meal plan and do the character breakfasts. Remember you must book a lot of your reservations 3 months in advance for character meals in order to have availability. Otherwise if there is availability the times are much later. Whatever you decide.....i must say this is a beautiful hotel in a perfect location in Disney World for the ultimate experience!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Resort - a relaxing retreat from the parks”
Reviews.Author: CTvacationer
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying at The Grand Floridian in late May of 2009 for my husbands 30th birthday. We took advantage of Disney's Magical Express transportation, which I found very convenient and an added value to our vacation. Once we arrived at the resort, a lovely woman dressed in a Victorian costume greeted us and advised us that we had been upgraded to a concierge pool view room. She walked us to our room pointing out the location of the pools and restaurants. The lobby and the grounds are immaculate. We finished the check-in process in our room; a very nice touch. I was very impressed with the room - it had updated Victorian decor with two, plush queen beds, day bed, a generous balcony with bistro set overlooking the pool, as well as a flat screen TV and fridge for beverages. I was also impressed with the bath products - H20 Spa products and robes. They had peppermint foot lotion, which was fantastic after a long day at the parks. During our stay, Florida was experiencing monsoon-like downpours . Despite the weather, the property was beautifully maintained. As you walked the grounds, you could enjoy the serene setting and take in the sweet smell of fresh roses. Due to the weather, we only enjoyed the pool one evening. It was very clean and not crowded. I think that it is fantastic that the pools are open 24-hours. Each morning before heading out to the parks, we would go downstairs to the concierge lounge where they offered a continental breakfast. This included toast, bagels, pastries, muffins, fresh fruit, yogurt, juice and coffee. I loved their coffee machine - it made cappuccino's, latte's, espresso's to enjoy in the lounge or on the go. The concierge lounge offered light snacks throughout the day, an afternoon tea, evening h'orduerves with wine and beer and evening deserts and aperitifs. We found the concierge to be very helpful. We had booked several restaurant reservations before we arrived, but we were unable to book The California Grill because they were all booked up. The concierge was able to get us our much sought after reservations during the fireworks display! It was fantastic - I would recommend it! The concierge also helped us to book massages at the spa, borrow videos on a rainy afternoon and address any of our concerns. They were spectacular! The hotel has several beautiful restaurants that you should definitely try. We visited Narcoosee's, Citrico's and Victoria and Alberts. Narcoosee's overlooks the lagoon and offers beautiful views of the Magic Kingdom Fireworks. There was a substantial wait regardless of the reservations. Once seated, the atmosphere was resort casual. I had the most incredible raspberry mojito and key lime creme brulee. My complaint with this restaurant is that they do not enforce their dress code. When you call for reservations - they point out multiple times that the dress attire is business casual (ie: no shorts, sneakers, jeans, etc) When you get there, at least half of the patrons are wearing shorts, jean cut-offs and sneakers. This affects the restaurants ambiance and perhaps if they upheld their dress code, the wait would not be an hour and a half. Citricos offers Mediterranean and Tuscan inspired cuisine. You can also enjoy partial views of the Magic Kingdom Fireworks. The food was very good, but I was not impressed with the cocktails. Victoria and Alberts was an experience not to be missed. The restaurant is very intimate with seating for approximately 10 couples. We had a fantastic pair taking care of us. They did an impeccable job of explaining the courses and really made you feel at home. The dinner consisted of 8 courses paired with a beautiful selection of wines. There was not one course that I did not love. The attention to detail at this restaurant is second to none with customized menus, attentive staff, romantic ambiance and a harpist. My compliments to the chef and all of the staff at this establishment. By far the most amazing meal of my life. At the end of the meal, they sent us home with a homemade loaf of bread to enjoy for breakfast the next day. This may be an expensive option, but the experience is worth it. My husband and I do not have children and one of our concerns when vacationing to destinations such as Disney World is: will we be surrounded with yelling, screaming, obnoxious 5-year olds. This is not to be a concern at this resort. The atmosphere is relaxed and elegant. The children were all very well behaved. I really enjoyed our stay at Disney's Grand Floridian and look forward to returning on our next trip to Disney.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not worth the money for short stay”
Reviews.Author: backyarder1
Reviews.Content: This is a huge, beautiful resort but definitely not worth the money if you don't have time to take advantage of the amenities. For $343.00 per night (and that is a discounted rate) we had a rather small room with two queen size beds. The room smelled of cologne. Presumably from the previous guests. Hopefully not from the housekeeping staff. Our room was 62 degrees when we got there and we never could figure out how to raise the temperature. We had just come from the Renaissance Resort near Seaworld where we spent $111.00 a night for a room that was twice as large, with a sofa and chairs, dining area, wet bar and office area. Plus, everything in the Renassance is right there - restaurants, bars, pool. No long walks required.

Reviews.Title: “Could not have been a better resort, concierge style!!”
Reviews.Author: 88golf88
Reviews.Content: I am going to preface this by saying that we got upgraded to the concierge level with an incredible view of the Magic Kingdom, so my review may be a little influenced!! We arrived on a Tuesday afternoon and check in could not have been easier. I simply asked if they had any available upgraded views instead of our standard garden view. The cast member said that she would go and check. She then came back and said that she could put us into a conciege level room!!! We were amazed that she would offer us this room. We were then taken up to our room and given a brief tour of the resort by a very nice bell man. Every morning, the continental breakfast was put out at exactly 7am and was your basic breakfast foods, cereals, breads, bagels, and fresh fruit. There were misc. snacks put out from 10-5 and then hors derves put out from 5-7pm. These were usually different every night, but always very tasty!! We even skipped dinner one night and just ate there!! The pools were nice and never too crowded. The service at the pool bar was excellent and there were always plenty of clean towels at the pool. We took advantage of their marina and took out one of their little two person boats to go out into the 7 Seas Lagoon, which was fun. Now, this was the first time that we stayed at a property that had the monorail and god was it convenient! Im not sure that we will be able to stay anywhere that doesnt have the monorail from here on out! Only negative that I can mention was 1900 Park Fare, pretty dissappointing. The food was well below average both in selection and quality, even for buffet food. Now, it was just my wife and me (she really wanted to see Cinderella!), but there were some famalies that were going to have to wait over 1 hour and 45 minutes to see all of the characters at dinner. We finally left after 90 minutes and saw just Cinderella and Prince Charming. Now obviously we have a different outlook on the resort after being upgraded, but the entire staff was tremendous. People had no idea that we were staying on the concierge level except for the cast members that worked up there, but every single customer service person that we ran into, offered to help in anyway they can. From housekeeping to the bellmen, to the front desk staff, the Grand Floridian does it first class all the way. Our trip to the Grand Floridian was so magical, that we are not sure that we will stay there again because in no way shape or form, will any trip ever top this one!!!

Reviews.Title: “Major Disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: lmom4204
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for 6 nights over the memorial Day weekend, during which we occupied 3 rooms, as we were a party of 8. let me begin by saying we have been vacationing at Disney World for over 20 years and in that time have stayed at all levels of their resorts without ever having difficulty. I cannot say the same for the Grand Floridian. From the moment we checked in we had issues. We asked for an upgrade that we were willing to pay for but they didn't have anything and it still took over half an hour to check us into our rooms that were not ready for hours after! I was expecting a package of medicine and diapers for my kids that they never bothered to tell me arrived and when I asked for them to send it up, they said it would take at least an hour...at 10:00 at night. My husband offered to get it himself and they said instead they would send it up right away...it didn't arrive till nearly 11. I couldn't change my son and put him to bed and my daughter was burning up with fever thanks to the hotel staff. Another day we asked if they could directly connect us to Narcooses as the dining button on our phone was broken, they said they could not and instead suggested we take a walk over there ourselves in the pouring rain, flooding and lightning. On our final day I had a standoff with a housekeeper who basically told me he was horrified with the condition of my room and proceeded to chastise me in front of my children. Incredible!!! This was a splurge for us that we planned months in advance, expecting the best. In my opinion we got the worst. When I complained to management I was met with indifference. I travel very often, staying at everything from Holiday Inns to Ritz Carltons and have never experienced anything quite like this. There is no chance that I would ever stay at the Grand Floridian again. Nor would I ever recommend it to anyone. From now on we're sticking with the Polynesian which I believe is the BEST Disney has to offer, regardless of what they're trying to sell us with the Grand Flo!!

Reviews.Title: “The contradictory reviews had me worried, but....”
Reviews.Author: KansasTravelnut
Reviews.Content: My wife and I decided to surprise our daughter for her birthday (it is a week and a half before Christmas) by taking her to WDW. In addition to just going to WDW, we bought passes for two nights of Mickey's Very Merry Christmas Party, and on top of that we invited one of the grandmothers to tag along. We have gone 3 years in a row during the summer, but skipped this summer since we were already secretly planning the December trip. During our previous visits we have stayed at Disney's moderate and economy resorts and have had wonderful trips! We vascillated on where to stay this time: economy because of the added cost of an additional person plus the MVMCP; Contemporary/Polynesian/Grand Floridian because of the monorail and the number of times we would be going to the MK and Epcot. Once we decided we would be staying near MK at a deluxe resort, I started reading every review I could find on the Internet, especially the reviews on this site. WE SETTLED ON THE GRAND FLORIDIAN. To be totally honest, I did not know what to think about the Grand Floridian because of all of the reviews that seemed to contradict each other - - you know what I mean - - just read the ones posted here the past few days. Further more, I still don't know what to think because I have read the reviews since returning from the trip, and they are still contradictory. All I can do is tell you about my family's trip. We had a wonderful time at the resort beginning with a late night arrival. The check-in was smooth, a bell hop drove us to our building. He insisted that the birthday girl sit up front with him and even gave her a Happy Birthday balloon! On the way to our room, he gave us a whole lot of information about the resort and WDW; all of which was very helpful! Once we got to our building, he brought the bags to the room, got us ice, turned down the hide-a-bed for our daughter and asked if there was anything else he could do for us - - so far so good! Over the course of our stay, housekeeping did a fine job. They turned the beds down each night and left chocolates on the pillows. They even made little characters out of towels and washcloths for our daughter and left her a really neat balloon contraption in the room on her birthday! Many of the reviews stated that the rooms were not dusted and the bathrooms (toilet/shower area) were not well-kept. Also, there were several postings about having to take a cold shower. I would agree that the room was not clean as other hotels I have stayed, and I did have a cold shower one day (luckily the ladies in my family all had hot showers all the time) but I chose to not those things ruin my trip. In fact, I did not even discuss these issues with my wife until we got home since the trip was about having fun, not trying to find things to complain about. We found the room to be large enough for 3 adults and 1 child. Having a large vanity with 2 sinks separate from the shower/toilet was a plus. Both of these features (room size with hide-a-bed, 2 sinks, separate bathroom) were all reasons we booked the GF. In addition to the reviews of the rooms, others have stated their disappointment with Gasparilla's. I do have to admit that there was not as much selection there as at some of the other resorts and there wasn't much of a game room for the kids like at other resorts, but we really didn't each much at the resort and our child was not at WDW to play arcade games, so we made due. The Christmas decorations at the GF were amazing! From the thousands of pointsettias outside and the deer lit up at night, to the larger than life Gingerbread house in and the enormous tree in the lobby, it really put us in the Holiday Spirit just being there! The monorail and the boats made it easy to get around. We recommend taking the monorail to the MK in the morning, but ride the boat back in the evenings, especially if you are there 'til the park closes. Our check out went well. A bell hop picked us and our bags up and took us to the front. The seats on the car were wet, so he went and got a towel so that he could dry the seats. Overall, we were happy with the choice we had made. Thanks to the staff at the GF, we had a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Luxurious and lovely”
Reviews.Author: GeorgiaJaneite
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our first stay at the Grand Floridian, and my husband says he'll never stay anywhere else at Disney because he's spoiled. Previously, we'd stayed at the Wilderness Lodge (and loved it), but the GF is less a hotel and more a huge resort. The grounds are spacious and beautifully landscaped, so the crowds and noise of the parks seem miles away. The resort has two large swimming pools, a beach (no swimming), boat rental, a spa, and a fitness center. The main building has a beautiful atrium area where we spent several evenings relaxing after dinner. Live music is played every evening by a pianist or a band, and it makes for a lovely place to sit and relax before turning in. The room we stayed in was a garden view with two queens (aka-the cheapest rooms). However we were pleasantly surprised to find even our cheap view was lovely. We were in Big Pine Key where rooms on one side of the building face the grounds and one of the pools, and the other side (where we were) faced the lake, the beach, and the other pool, but we could also see the wedding pavillion, the monorail, and the Polynesian. I don't imagine there are any bad views there at all. Our room was MUCH larger than a standard room at the Wilderness Lodge. There were two queen beds, a sofa that converted to a comfy bed, an easy chair with ottoman, and a desk. The bathroom was large with marble floors, counters, and shower and a double vanity. There was also a big closet with two robes. (I used one every night. A nice touch.) The housekeeping service was great. They did personal things like use my younger son's blanket from home to make up the bed where he slept. They also have nightly turn down service where they turn down your bed and bring you ice and chocolates. The bell service at the hotel was great and very quick to respond. We also got great service at the concierge desk. The only down side to such good service is we found ourselves handing out lots of tips. I only have minor criticisms. On our first night, we had a huge roach in our bathroom. So we killed him and never saw another. We didn't fret since Florida is bug heaven. The walls to the hotel seemed a bit thin as we could hear more than we expected from the other rooms. We could hear voices, phones ringing, water running, and toilets flushing, which was disappointing in such an expensive place. Also the room had a rickety ceiling fan that seemed about to fall off the ceiling if we turned it on medium or high. It would have been nice to put it on high so the sound would drown out the hotel noises. And the armoire with drawers for clothes was too small to hold all our clothing. We stayed a week and didn't have enough drawers or hangers for a week's worth of clothes. But the armoire contains a fridge, so that's where the space for drawers went. The resort has five restaurants and various shops. All the shops are nice and range from selling sundries, to souvenirs, to expensive clothing. We ate at three of the restaurants. The counter service place, Gasparillas, has a nice variety, but we didn't want to eat in there because of the noise from the arcade games and the fact that there were birds flying around indoors. (I don't mind birds if I'm outside, but indoor birds landing on my table is too much.) The Grand Floridian Cafe was a lovely place for any meal with good food and service. And Citricos was pricey but delicious. So we enjoyed all three of the ones we tried. Having monorail or boat service to the Magic Kingdom was great for us as it's our favorite park. You take a bus anywhere else. But to sum up, my husband and kids are all converts to the Grand Floridian and say that's the only place they'll stay in the future. It's an expensive place but very nice. We used the "buy 4, get 3" special they were running, so our package cost the same as the identical package at the Wilderness Lodge 3 years ago. So I felt that it was a great experience that I'd hope to repeat in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous to celebrate grandma's 65th bday with her grandson”
Reviews.Author: Miss-you2
Reviews.Content: I took my mother and 7-year-old son in Sept. 2008. We were lucky to be upgraded to the concierge level in the main building. That gave us help to plan outings and a light breakfast/snacks. We ate at 1900 Park Fare --just OK, a basic buffet; Citrico's - excellent; Narcoosee's - very enjoyable in a great setting; room service- poor (just looked like food they took from the buffet at Park Fare). Great access to the Magic Kingdom and the buses to the other parks. We enjoyed the pool with the water slide. I tried the spa- decent, but not great, pedicure. The band that plays in the main building is enjoyable, and the lobby very comfortable with lovely floral arrangements. The hotel provided a chocolate "Happy Birthday" Mickey for grandma and a card signed by Mickey and friends. We found the staff to be very polite and accommodating. For the convenience and beautiful surroundings, we felt it was worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “The last reviewer said it all but ...”
Reviews.Author: stranieri
Reviews.Content: Dining at the Grand Floridian was just okay. We went on the deluxe dining plan and had a chance to eat at a number of restaurants. The character breakfast was definitely better than most but extremely chaotic. The café had just changed its menu and in my opinion was just okay. The service was terrific but the food was too ambitious for a café. Narcosese was at best a two star restaurant. I left most of the food on my plate because it was either overcooked, too salty, or just unappetizing. If I was actually paying for this meal and not on the dining plan, I would have been very upset. Love the hotel, not in love with the food. Saying that, we ate at the Flying Fish on the boardwalk which was excellent as was California Grill at the Contemporary. PS: I thought the hotel was very family friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Spend your money somewhere else!!!”
Reviews.Author: Amy012
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a lot of luxury hotels. There was a certain level of customer service I expected and did not receive. First of all they did not have my reservation when I tried to check in. Finally they found a room for me because I had a confirmation. Well it was clearly a reject room. I was in building 7 on the first floor by a door that opened and slammed shut 150 times a day. I called the desk after being there for a couple of hours and asked what the door was too and if it would stop slamming by the early evening. She said "I don't know where the door goes and it should get quieter." That was not the answer for me. I went to open the door for myself and it goes outside. It was the service enterance and any other guest could use it also. Well it opened and closed until around 12:30am. Keep in mind I have a 2 year old and we were not sleeping. The next morning I went to the front desk and asked to be moved and told them the problem. Did a manager come out to the desk and address the problem? You would expect that at a 5 star hotel. They take their customer service very seriously. No, the desk girl came back out and said we will change your room as soon as we get one available. I said OK we are going to the Magic Kingdom. She said they would call. We got back to the room around 130pm and I had not received a call. I called guest information and they said my room was ready. They sent a bellman and he did not know the new room number so he called to the front. They told him it was not ready. MAJOR COMMUNICATION ISSUES!!! So we waited in the room for a little while and I got a call at 3pm. This guy asks me why we haven't moved yet? I lost it then. You have got to be kidding me. He said if you are changing rooms, you need to do it by 11am. Needless to say when I was done with him we were on our way to a new room. The next morning we were leaving and it was pooring. They pick you and your luggage up in golf carts. The cart was soaked. I asked for something to wipe the seat and I was told he had nothing. I asked why they don't have covers over the carts, he, the bellman, replied " it is not in the budget." So, as much money as you are paying you could get better service else where!!! This is the best.......... Before leaving I went to the front desk to voice my complaints, I asked for the customer service manager. The girl, Joselen, looked at me like I was crazy and said they don't have one. I told her that was her first problem and proceeded to tell my story. I have emailed Disney a week ago to ask where I could send a letter of complaint and I have yet to get a response from them. Let me just make a suggestion. I know staying on property is great and having the monorail stop at your hotel is even better. However, there is a GREAT hotel right by downtown disney called Lake Buena Vista Palace. It has awsome customer service and much better staff. It has buses that take you to the parks. They have a spa, suites and pools. Hope this helps anyone trying to make a decision. I know it is not near Disney, but the Ritz Carlton in Orlando is also awsome!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort - worth the money”
Reviews.Author: tlh02
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Grand Floridian the week of May 16, 2009 and would recommend the hotel to any family who is looking for a more upscale Disney owned resort. My family (husband, two children ages 2 & 4) and I stayed at the Grand Floridian the week of May 16, 2009. We paid for and received a standard, garden view room. Our unit was in the Big Pine Key building which I requested due to its central location to the pool, monorail, and main building. The room contained 2 queen beds and a comfortable day bed which allowed my children to sleep separately. The room slept 4 comfortably, but 5 people could easily fit. Housekeeping did a good job and the girls loved the chocolate on their pillows each night. Housekeeping would even tuck the girls stuff animals in at night, which brought an extra smile to the girls’ faces. We never got a chance to eat at the high end restaurants or use the gym/spa so I can’t speak to their services but both pools were enjoyable with plenty of towels and seating. We dined at the 1900 Park Fare for character meals at breakfast and dinner, and the quality of food was much better than other character buffets in Disney World. The monorail and boat ride to and from the Magic Kingdom was incredibly convenient. Likewise, the bus transportation to and from Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom was convenient. We never had to wait longer than 20 minutes for a bus. Certainly a rental car would be more efficient but the free transportation was reliable. What travelers need to remember is that this is a Disney resort. You pay a premium to be near the parks. Certainly you can find a nicer and less expensive hotel somewhere else in Orlando. But if you want to be in the Disney complex and feel like you are at a resort and not a theme based hotel, then the Grand Floridian is the way to go. We have stayed at the Polynesian for leisure and Coronado Springs for work and neither can compare to this stay. The rooms are nicely decorated, the grounds are beautiful and the staff was very friendly in comparison to the other locations. For the few extra dollars between the Polynesian and the Grand Floridian, the Grand Floridian is the hands down choice. I have heard other travelers say that the Grand Floridian is not kid friendly and we did not believe that to be true. The pools were filled with families, Gasparilla’s Grill is filled with arcades and the musicians in the main lobby played princess music so the little girls could dance throughout the grand main lobby. We like to provide honest reviews and feel we learn the most from what others list as the drawbacks of a particular hotel. So here are the drawbacks: We asked at check in for one guardrail for our 2 year old’s bed. It never came. We called housekeeping for the guardrail and they said they would be right over with it.
