Again, it never came. We quickly realized we didn’t need it but still, it should have been brought to our room right away. There are birds flying around inside Gasparilla’s Grill. This is typical in most Disney World restaurants but still unappealing. The kids loved it. The resort restaurant, lobby and grounds are often busy with visitors dining or just checking out the hotel. While this didn’t pose a big problem it does make the restaurants, shops and transportation more crowded. I don’t believe these negatives should discourage anyone from staying at the Grand Floridian. Don’t expect the Ritz or Four Seasons. Instead expect the most elegant Disney Resort available and you won’t be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dtc917
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grad Floridian for three nights May 21-23. We stayed on the fourth floor of the Boca Chica building, which is right behind the main building and pool. It looked like the room had been recently updated, we had cathedral ceilings and a nice view of the pool. My husband and I, our 7 month old daughter and my mother stayed in one room with two queen beds and we had plenty of room. The hotel provided us with a small white metal crib for our daughter. I was a little worried when I saw the metal crib, but they provided us with Disney themed sheets and a matching bumper. Our daughter seemed to sleep very well in the crib. The pool was heated and stayed open into the late night - we actually went swimming at 9:30pm. We ate breakfast in the hotel's 1900 Park Fair resturant two mornings in a row because our daughter loved the characters. The first morning we lucked out and only had to wait about 20 minutes, however, we made reservations for the following morning. The food was good, but the best part was seeing our daughter's face light up when she saw Winnie the Pooh, Tigger, Mary Poppins, Alice in Wonderland, and the Mad Hatter. The hotel has a monorail stop right outside, which travels to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. During our last trip to Disney, we stayed at the Dolphin, which doesn't have monorail access. We had to use the buses and it was a big pain and took forever. Having a monorail stop right at our hotel was very convenient! The hotel staff was very nice and the concierge was able to help us with all of our questions. We will definitely say at the Grand Floridian in the future!

Reviews.Title: “Attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: NancytheG
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to WDW and we decided to "do it up right". Wow, did we ever! This hotel was fab from the minute we arrived until the day of our departure. The staff bends over backwards to insure a delightful stay and the attention to every detail is unbelievable. I will be back here at some point in my life and if you get the chance to stay here I urge you to do so. Narcoossees, the onsite reataurant is DYNAMITE as well.

Reviews.Title: “Service impeccable - decor and room size should be better for the money”
Reviews.Author: ladyssecret
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Grand Floridian with our children (ages 7 and 10). It was our first time at Disney and we decided to do it well. We loved that the hotel was on the monorail. It is very convenient to Magic Kingdom. A bit of a pain for Epcot, with a switch involved, but it was easy to learn. The service was as great as everyone said it would be. Each and every encounter with staff was pleasant and seemed genuine. They make everything into an event - the housekeepers parade in at the start of the day! My children loved the two pools, especially the beach pool with the water slide. The lifeguards did a great job of making it safe, but letting it be fun. There were many events and activities for the kids all day long. Riding the boat from Magic Kingdom to the hotel is a must do, although the monorail is faster. The room - we paid a premium for Magic Kingdom view and could only barely see it from a corner of our porch. We were assured we could see the fireworks from our room and we couldn't. The hall carpets were stained and a bit old. The halls need to be swept or vacuumed in the evening. It was dirty by around 9pm. The rooms are small for the price. The shampoo and conditioner provided by the hotel were so sticky you couldn't get them out of the bottle. The 24 hour "quick service" dining area is off the beaten track and the only place you can refill your drink cups. We spent time being thirsty at poolside. It would be great to be able to fill your refillable cups at the pool bars. Magical Express to and from the airport is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Expensive”
Reviews.Author: jfgrayson
Reviews.Content: It was easy access to Magic Kingdon but longride back at night. The boat sevice was not good after the park closed and going to other hotels not great either. Lots of fun for Princess that we had with us but very expensive to do all the extras (like tea with sleeping beauty) Not worth the price $250.00 for 2, but you did get a doll. Concierge service was great. Housekeeping was great. Food is OK but room service was fast with warm milk in the mornings and at late night. Would probably not go back but try Hotel in Orlando Ritz or Marriott and rental car next time.

Reviews.Title: “"Best vacation ever", raves my husband (and I agree)”
Reviews.Author: clarinuit
Reviews.Content: My husband, my 2 yr-old daughter and I stayed at the Grand Floridian in March 2008 for one week. We absolutely loved it. We got a top floor dormer room which was clean, luxurious (good beds, linens, and finishes), well-appointed, well-kept, but slightly smaller than I expected. That turned out not to be a big deal at all since all we did was sleep and shower there, but it was nice to come sleep and shower in a comfy room. Pros: We love the style of the place, the lobby is very pleasant, the grounds are lush and impeccable, the staff (cast) is WONDERFUL (but we do tip)(the cleaning lady made us a swan out of washcloths and put the soaps and lotions in it, a male employee gave our daughter a nosegay of flowers in the lobby and bowed to her, the porters were jovial, garrulous and helpful, I think every single castmember we passed smiled at our daughter and said "Hello, princess!" although she wasn't dressed as one, and all our inquiries, bookings, and arrangements with desk staff were handled with smiles and laughter), our 2-yr old daughter adored the white sand beach (you can't swim in the lake, though) and zero entry pool and waterfall, the luggage handling was seamless, and the dining was the best we have ever had at Disney (and I grew up nearby.) More on dining later. Cons: the room was slightly smaller than I would have liked, and I am not sure what the other room styles are like. It was expensive, but we knew that going in. Room service was very expensive and was elegant and tasty but not really worth it in such a small room (the tray was huge to accommodate all the little extras and separate serving dishes). I travel a lot for business, lugging my own bags, and it may seem trivial, but it was really nice not to have to handle our own luggage for this trip (it was heavy). We arrived hours before check-in and they made it extremely simple to check our bags straight from the trunk of our rental car to their bag-check area without us even touching them. They were taken to our room when it was ready and were waiting for us when we got back from the park later. We did the Magical Express for the return journey, and had the bags checked at the hotel, where they were picked up from our room after we called to indicate they were ready, and the next time we saw them was on a baggage carousel at home. They do this at the other Disney resorts, but the staff was just so friendly, helpful and pleasant at the Grand Floridian. I am somewhat of a foodie (or food snob), I think, but I could find nothing to complain about at the GF eating establishments we visited. In general, they were miles above the similarly priced restaurants in the parks. We planned our dining and made reservations for almost the whole trip before we went, which really helped. However, we found that we could walk right in to the Cafe without reservations most times when we found ourselves at a loose end. The food there was better than anything in the parks we have had, even at the "better" venues. (Their Tuna Nicoise salad beat the pants off the identically named product at the French restaurant at Epcot, for example - I couldn't even choke down the latter, thinking about the one I had had at the GF Cafe.) The service was prompt, pleasant, attentive, and friendly. We dined at Narcoosee's in the evening and got to see the light show on the lagoon. The food and the experience were excellent and worth the price, and service there was also stellar. The High Tea in the Garden View Lounge was a magical experience, with our 2 yr old daughter in a sundress and straw hat, sipping herbal tea from a gold-rimmed tea cup with roses on it almost bigger than she was, learning to use a tea strainer and sugar tongs, and eating sandwiches and pastries with us. My husband accidentally knocked over his champagne, breaking the glass into his mostly-empty plate, and the waitress was perfectly attentive and brought him a completely new meal while he went to the room to change clothes. For breakfasts, we usually ate at the Gasparilla Grille, so our daughter could have Mickey-shaped waffles with Mickey-shaped sprinkles (she was mystified and then thrilled that one could have sprinkles on waffles), and I could have eggs and my husband could have cereal or pancakes. It is a little crowded sometimes, because it takes three times as long for the cashiers to ring up the customers with meal plans because they have to figure out how to designate each item, I think, then type in codes or something. But overall it got us out to the parks in time for opening most days with something tasty and mostly healthy in us. Oh, and the valet parking was a pleasure (I usually dread it).

Reviews.Title: “good but not worth the price tag”
Reviews.Author: des112Ct
Reviews.Content: My stay was 4/27-5/08 the service was very good is it is at all disney resorts. MY problem is not with the cast members themselves, but the policys of im personal service that disney has. For instance they expect you to know where your going to eat for the entire duration of your trip or else it is impossible to eat anywhere. I think for the $5,000 price tag for 2 people and the so called deluxe dinning plan which was an extra $1,000 you should be able to eat where and when u want. This is not the case at disney but other than that we had a great time I would deffinetly go back if it were less expensive, also there were too many service carts speeding about the property in the walkways and such they a pain, this is NOT a 5 star resort, but deffinatley a 4 star . This is also not a resort for kids

Reviews.Title: “Experience not to be missed”
Reviews.Author: Tijaro
Reviews.Content: This resort might be expensive but it is worth it. The grounds are beautiful and the buildings well looked after. Two excellent pools and all staff very friendly and polite. Food good with plenty of choice of restaurants. Plenty to do without leaving the hotel. Rooms big, all with balconies. Would go back tomorrow if we could.

Reviews.Title: “3 Star Facilities 5 Star Magic”
Reviews.Author: sally11122
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in April 2009 with my husband and 4 & 6 year boys. We had 2 segments in our trip the first was a 2 night stay at The JW Marriott Grand Lakes and the second part of the trip was a 5 night stay at the GF. Check in was pleasant and I was impressed with the lobby and piano playing. There were positives and negatives to the stay: Negatives When I walked into my room in the Conch Key building (4th floor), I was so disapointed. After being in the luxury of the JW Marriott...the GF seemed average. Our bathroom had a shower curtain and our bathtub had one of those 80's style plastic crystal faucets. The worst part is that it had mildew inside of it! The rest of the room was clean except for spider webs on my door wall, which were never cleaned up the entire 5 days. I asked to be switched to a different room, but all they had was a first floor room so I kept my room. Their 2 pools are nice, but could use an update, the tiling around the pools are faded. The fitness area needs better equipment and a remodel. Positives, Disney Magic... I could see the fireworks from my room every night. Cute little girls dressed as Princesses all over the resort. The monorail..it was very easy and quick to get to Magic Kingdom. The service was excellent. The only 5 star facilites that I found in the hotel was the spa. Very nice! The flowers around the resort are really beautiful. I would never back to the GF. There is much better in Orlando for the money. I also stayed at Animal Kingdom Lodge last year and I would rate it higher than The GF. The Animal Kingdom Lodge is a quarter of the price of GF and has nicer facilities (the best pool in Disney). If you have a large vacation budget and want to be close to Magic Kingdom then , The GF might be for you. If you still want to be on Disney property and don't mind a 30 minute bus ride to Magic Kingdom then Animal Kingdom is a great choice. If you want real 5 star facilities in Orlando then check out the JW and Ritz Carlton at Grand Lakes (30 minute taxi to Magic Kingdom). They are still half the price of The GF. So even with $40 taxi rides it would still be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Only Want To Stay There!”
Reviews.Author: Spock4Pres818
Reviews.Content: I just came back from my second stay at the Grand Floridian. I first went in March then back a month later. Second visit I was with a friend and her two children five and three. It was the kids first visit to Disney World. I kept telling her how great it was. She was blown away when we pulled into the resort, and fell in love with it. I had went there for breakfast when I was a teenager about ten years ago, and my uncle got married there in 1998. I always wanted to stay there. The grounds are wonderful, and well taken care of. I loved just sitting in the lobby and listening to the band play. Every staff member I came in contact with was friendly and helpful. It is in a great location when you have young children with you and want to be close to the Magic Kingdom. The monorail was great to have. On my first visit I stayed in the Conch Key building with a Magic Kingdom view. It was very nice. I only recommend to ask for with a third or fourth floor room. Top floor rooms are nice, but they are dormer rooms, and the balconies are very small. The last trip we stayed in rooms in the Boca Chica building. We had a third floor room with a Magic Kingdom view. It was so great and beautiful view. Also the balconies were great, and large. Great for viewing the fireworks and water show every night. It has two pools. The Boca Chica building was right next to the pool. A short walk to get there. I am an early riser, so I was up at 5:30am and went swimming. The Grand Floridian Cafe was a favorite spot for meals for us. The staff was great, and remembered us from the trip before. We even made friends with our waiter, and still keep in touch with him. 1900 Park Fare was great for the kids too. The food was wonderful. The princess and friends came around to the table and took pictures and signed the kids autograph books. We had gone to the dinner show at the Polynesian the night before, and hated it. The show was horrible, as was the food. Definitely not worth the money they charged. Narcosses was my favorite. Great food and location. The rooms are nice, except the maid service doesn't seem that great for that kind of hotel. That was my only issue. Other then that it seems very clean and well taken care of. The Polynesian seems run down and dark, and has a smell of mildew and mold. Same with the Contemporary. We went over there for some drinks and were so happy we didn't stay there. The grounds are nothing much to look at, and the building itself is not that appealing. I don't understand how other reviewers didn't like it. I guess it is just a matter of opinion. This is the only place I would stay in DisneyWorld. I like being near the Magic Kingdom, and having the monorail. Another plus is the spa. I had a facial there, and it was wonderful. It is expensive, but well worth it. Already planning a trip in early December.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, didn't want to leave!!!”
Reviews.Author: Aparticulartguest
Reviews.Content: Was concerned after reading some reviews that I would pay my money then be at the mercy of less than perfect Disney service for the duration of my vacation...... let me assure you our stay was almost perfect. The Grand Floridian was everything I could have wanted in a Disney hotel and more. Reserved a standard garden view room (all they had available when I booked only 2 months in advance) but asked for a room w/ view upon check in and was given free upgrade to MK view room. The room had incredible view of MK fireworks and the boat parade that comes by at about 10 pm. Only disadvantage, my room was a top floor dormer, w/ no sofa bed, only 2 queens. But since we had been given the free upgrade, I didn't quite want to say hey thanks for the upgrade, but how about one w/ a sofa bed? Room pros: robes, fridge, very comfy beds (and I'm very picky), balcony w/view, quiet (we were there 1st week feb, i believe the hotel was not full) spacious enough, excellent housekeeping, lots of towels without even having to ask, View!, coffee maker in room. Room cons: No vending machine, no mini bar. have to walk to main bldg to buy drinks, etc. just plan ahead, you have a fridge (one tip- I'm not cheap but water was $2 for a 500ml bottle. Buy the 1.5 L size for just a little more $). The gift shop and Gaspirillas have pop, water, milk etc. Pools great, it was cold while we were there so only used them a couple times, but water was warm in pool, if you could stand the air. Used the exercise room in spa once, it was great .. a bit far from main hotel, but I got some exercise getting there! Hotel food: Citrico's - excellent, and I consider myself a foodie. Narcosee's- good, fireworks at MK could be seen from dining room. Grand Floridian cafe- good food there, too. 1900 park fare- even the food at the character buffett was decent Gaspirillas- Ok for what it is. pizza edible, decent healthier selections of chicken sadwich, cheese plate, etc You have to understand that at disney if you want a sit down meal, you must book in advance to guarentee a seat. Plain and simple. Having said that, we were there at a slow time and managed to have a non reserved meal at Narcosee's and non reserved breakfast at GF cafe twice. Did not use dining plan as we wanted to eat at the fine restaurants, and wished to be unrestircted. One tip, we came to Disney w/out car. I brought some cold cereal and plastic bowls and spoons, bought milk at hotel, and had breakfast in room each AM. Saved a ton of time, we had the in room coffee maker, cereal and juice early and were at the park for opening. On days we had no immediate plans, the GF cafe had lovely breakfast. Can't beat location close to MK on monorail. The one time wehad to take bus (to animal kingdom) it was abour 20 min wait for bus, then ride to other resorts before ariving at AK. Additional notes: Used the Magical express bus service from airport--- no complaints( a little hard to find in airport--no signs. ask somebody, then you will find it) We were immediately acknowledged at check in, taken to our room in a cart and given helpful hints by the staff on way to our room. There were few crowds, again, we were there at a slow time with colder weather. Due to bad weather, our flight cancelled and we arrived a day later than planned. I phoned Disney and they kindly accomadated taking one day off at the begining of our trip and adding one on at the end. The service of shops at theme parks shipping your purchase to your resort is very helpful, and free of charge. The fireworks at MK were crowded and the view of them was better from my room. Next time I will book early to make sure I get a guarenteed MK view..its worth the $$ Overall, great place. I will stay there time I go to Disney. Yes, you pay more than you would for a comparable room elsewhere, but this is Disney. You are paying for the experience and location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ameliabedilia33
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Grand Floridian every spring for the past 10 years with our boys and every time, it is outstanding. We started staying there when our boys were small because it is so close to the Magic Kingdom and as the boys got bigger and we thought of trying something new, we never could bring ourselves to do it! We stay on club level and it is wonderful - the people who work in the club are fabulous and willing to do whatever they can for you. Pricey, but well worth the splurge. We particularly like that it doesn't feel so "them park-ish" - its a little more elegant but the staff is never uptight. The spa is also great!

Reviews.Title: “A rather average, large hotel mill with superficial touches”
Reviews.Author: MTechSolutions
Reviews.Content: This is far from the 5-star luxury experience one might expect at this price point. The hotel is nothing more than a large series of long-corridor commercial style hotel buildings, with superficial architectural accents to distinguish it from its otherwise bland atmosphere. It has a very 80's feel to it - 1980's that is. It's ridiculous that guests who pay a bit of a premium to stay here have to compete so heavily to have breakfast at the theme buffet. We couldn't get reservations for *any* of the 5 days we stayed here because they were already pre-booked. Clearly you should book even your breakfast well in advance of your arrival if you want the theme buffet. Our lagoon-view rooms are very small and cramped. Had to pay a daily for wired internet access. I'm starting to get the "Theme" here - it's "Nickel and dime..nickel and dime..." - I think I heard Mickey and Minnie singing that tune as they skipped down Main Street USA. One thing that I feel is unacceptable in a hotel at this price point is the fact that the bathrooms had a tub with integrated shower, and a shower curtain. Very, very low-rent feel to that...I expect a glass and tile shower stall when I am spending over $600/day on the room alone! The staff is of course friendly, although I had almost no interaction with them. We dined in-hotel one evening at Citrico's - what a rip off. Over-priced, average, uninspired 90's type pseudo mediterranean cuisine...the French press-pot coffee however was good - it was the meal highlight. It shocks me what poor value Disney has become. You pay an incredible premium to get the Disney experience by staying right at the park...but that's really about all you get - you're there, but frankly I question the value beyond that, when I think of the myriad other luxury hotels I've stayed at below and well-above this price point that offer so much more for the money. Will try a villa resort next time and see how that compares..

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay!”
Reviews.Author: RachelMacDonald
Reviews.Content: Me and My Husband stayed here for 4 nights last August as we were getting married at the Wedding Pavilion. On arrival at the hotel we were greated by friendly staff who helped us with everything we needed. We even got our room upgrade to concierge. This include drinks and nibbles throughout the day it was brilliant. Once we got to our room we had a signed card from cindarella and Prince Charming wishing us all the best and a bottle of champagne! The rooms were pretty big we had one queen size bed and a balcony looking onto the wedding pavilion. There are several shops within the hotel selling disney merchandise, a bath shop, and salon. There are 4 restuarants and a canteen outside beside the boats which was great as you can charge everything to your room you didn't need to carry around money. There were too large pools and one had a small water slide for the children. A small beached area just down from the pool. At night you could gather round the marina to watch the night time fireworks from Magic Kingdom, this was great as you wern't fighting with anyone at the park to get a good space and all in all i think we got a better view at the hotel. We ate at Narcossee restuarant on the night of the wedding and it was brilliant i would highly recommend this.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Deep in the Heart of Texas
Reviews.Title: “Plan the Experiance”
Reviews.Author: jjimlemjim
Reviews.Content: First know that Disney Hotels are very popular. You do have to make some basic plans before your arrival. Just a little bit of pre planning make the experience most satisfying. Take note of the Disney advice on meal reservations and park hours. Make general schedules of you park and meal plans. The Grand Floridian is the flag ship hotel of Disneyworld. We have stayed there three times and had a delightful time at each stay. The staff pays attention and will work with you to make your stay memorable. If you make your reservations early enough you can get the Concierge service. It is an extravagant service but fun to have. Watching the Magic Kingdom fire works from the restaurant on the lagoon is spectacular and romantic. Live music daily in the main lobby is excellent. No hotel can boost of a real ginger bread house in the lobby. A real memorable experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Disney by far”
Reviews.Author: tcoop92
Reviews.Content: This hotel spells elegance the moment you walk in the door. A gorgeous, opulent lobby is the centerpiece of the main floor with siting areas and (in Nov a huge Xmas tree). The staff are extremely helpful with Park passes, etc. We had a two bedroom suite in an adjacent building but it was spacious and had a view of the Magic Kingdom! There are two pools, one for grownups and the other for fun (it has a waterslide!) The proximity to the magic Kingdom cannot be beat by monorail, first stop to get there and to go back. Restaurant wise this place is sure culinary savy, 1) Victoria and Albert's - Beautiful fine dining. Adults only. A true treat. 2) Citrico's - second nicest restaurant. Great Mediterranian food for dinner. 3) Narcoossee's - MY FAV! On the water, great seafood and so fun for dinner. 4) Cafe - Great for breakfast and views of the pool. 5) Garden View Lounge - such nice afternoon tea in a traditional Floridian/English settting. 6) 1900 Park Fare - best character meals! We had breakfast once. The spoiled children are annoying but it is fun. Buffet though. * All in all, a fantastic hotel which I would immeadiatly return to the next time I go to Disney Florida.

Reviews.Title: “Okay Trip... Not Sure if I would return”
Reviews.Author: LIKETOTRAVEL125
Reviews.Content: This resort is beautiful but I didn’t like it as much as the Animal Kingdom or Polynesian. This may be because I was traveling with a 5 and 1 year old. Enjoyed the character breakfast and the staff were pretty friendly. Had the meal plan so we didn’t spend a lot on food. I've stayed at the several Disney properties and this would be the one I would least likely return to. But again, it may be because of the smaller kids. I do, however, love the spa there and each time I go made sure I get a treatment. They have a kid's pedicure that my 5 year old loves, she has had it twice and it put her to sleep each time.

Reviews.Title: “Over promised and under delivered”
Reviews.Author: familyguy13
Reviews.Content: We took a family vacation to Disney over Christmas break and spent three nights at the Grand Floridian. We were expecting a high level of luxury and service given what we've heard and read about the property. Our check-in process was difficult. First, we were sent to the wrong rooms (our last name was similar to the last name of another guest, even though the first names and number of people in our party were different). Second, we were sent to other rooms only to find the rooms did not connect. At the time we reserved the rooms we were told the connection was guaranteed since we have small children. Finally, after more than and hour we got rooms that connected. We've stayed at other Disney properties and found that, other than being on the monorail, the Grand Floridian was no better than the mid-priced properties. Food options are limited and the service is spotty. We had a great vacation, but we were not impressed with this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great vacation”
Reviews.Author: Greenwaters
Reviews.Content: From check-in to check out we loved the Grand Floridian. We stayed from January 24th through February 1st. Check-in was a breeze and easy...room wasn't ready until 3:00. No problem she said it would be worth the wait.....boy was it. We booked a regular room and received an lake front room right in front of the boat launch to Magic Kingdom. I'm not sure if a better room existed. We had sent a fax to the Grand Floridian asking for a room with a few a week prior and it apparently paid off. We opted for the dining plan as well and found this was a fantastic deal We got a snack, quick service meal and a sit down meal. My wife booked all the reservation about 3 weeks out with no problems. The dinners averaged about 150.00 and all we had to pay was the tip. The quick services lunches were good too...except for Magic Kingdom....limited selection and usually junk type food. Better quick service lunch options at the other parks. The crowds were at a minimum and all of the good rides did not have much of a wait...approx. 15-20 minutes max. The Grand Floridian was grand and loved the Momorail service to Magic Kinigdom and Epcot. The boat service back from MK was terrific too.....and our room was steps from the boat launch. The price was right with flights and I have no complaints. I thnk it would be a good idea to sit down and listen to the vacation club early in on your vacation as I heard the kids like it and they make it worth your while...I think a Disnet gift card for a good chunk of money is given to listen to the sell story. I heard it is worth doing...after the fact. We had dinner all over the parks. Cafe De France, Mexico, Morraco, Grand Floridian and once at MGM...the Italian restautrant...forgot the name. All the meals were great and a little similar. The snack options were also pretty good...escpecially at the Bakery on Main Street USA. You can get a box of cereal and a milk for a snack voucher....good deal. They also had a enormous cinnamon roll listed as a snack option. I would definitely stay at the GF again in a heart beat. If we go again I would most likely try somwething different as we have stayed at the Contemporary the Carribean Beach Resort and now the GF. My wife was looking at the Boardwalk resorts and seemed to like to ability to wasily get to Epcot and Hollywood studios from that area.....I think you can walk to both. I went with my children ages 11 and 8 and they still had a wonderful time woth some great memories. Disney treated us right again. We also rented a car and drove around to many of the parks with ease. The new picture options were great where they just scan your card and you can go online later at home and decided if you want to purchase any of the pictures taken by the many photographers all over all the parks. We also stopped at a local grocery store and bought some milk OJ and cereal and snacks for the kids. The refridgerator in the room was nice to have. Each morning they had breakfast on the cheap as this saved a lot of money on not having to purchase breakfast.....this was a good idea.

Reviews.Title: “Another Magical Stay at The GF!”
Reviews.Author: LoveToTravel1129
Reviews.Content: From the time I was a little girl my family has always enjoyed spending time together by traveling to Walt Disney World and staying at our favorite Grand Floridian. After going again in the spring I was again satisfied and enchanted! Though pricy, the lobby is amazing, the rooms are beautiful, the pool is great, and the service is impeccable! Sometimes it was even hard to get myself to go to the great parks. I dined at 1900 Park Fare and it was so fun! With new character additions at dinner (ugly stepsisters & wicked stepmother) we had a great time. They were so funny! Also, the food is pretty good (buffet) and the dessert was fabulous. The pools, the lobby, Gaspirillas, make the GF just like home...except better. I'm so excited to be going back in March!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience at the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: ktregar
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice 3-night stay at the Grand Floridian. Everything was spotless, the service was consistently attentive without being overbearing or annoying, and the concierge was very helpful with everything from theme park tickets to dinner reservations. The hotel is right on one of the monorail lines, which made it very convenient to travel to Epcot and the Magic Kingdom, and the bus to Animal Kingdom was nice, although there was a bit of a wait both to and from the park. We also took advantage of the Magic Express airport transportation service, both to and from the Grand Floridian, and we used the airport check-in service at the hotel, which made heading home much more pleasant (until our connecting flight was canceled, but that's another story...). We enjoyed an afternoon tea which was very nice, and ordered room service one night for dinner, which came quickly and was tasty and well presented. We did not use the pool or jacuzzi, but they appeared clean and well-maintained. All in all, we had a wonderful stay at the Grand Floridian, and I would definitely be interested in going back. I will say that, as nice as it was, everything seemed overpriced, which is something I expect at Disney. We paid about $150-$200 less than the standard room rate because we were there with a wedding party, and I can't possibly imagine paying that much more to stay at the Grand Floridian- the price we paid seemed about right for the service and amenities we received.

Reviews.Title: “Still my favorite Disney Resort !”
Reviews.Author: Suzi02
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel when it first opened in 1989 and 20 years later, it is still a beautiful resort. Our room, which was located in a lodge building, was completely updated with new bedding and flat screen TV's. I believe this to be the best Disney resort. No complaints regarding anything at this resort. I have previously stayed at the Contemporary, Polynesian, Beach Club and Swan, all were very nice, but, The Grand Floridian is the best in Disney World to me.

Reviews.Title: “Great Vacation”
Reviews.Author: JakesMom05
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian from October 26 - November 1, 2008 and was there for Halloween. All I have to say is the rooms were clean, food was great. With the exception they need more of a variety for small children to choose from. We had an absolute great time. Unfortunately the weather was on the cool side (60's), but the hospitality of the staff made up for it. I would definitely stay here on my next vacation.

Reviews.Title: “An Average Joe's Review of the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: tjonch
Reviews.Content: If you are a hard-working American who has to work for the money you make, please read my review. As a teacher who only makes $35,000/year, I could never afford the Grand Floridian and was somewhat sickened by some guests there that complained about EVERYTHING. I was fortunate to find a great discount, so my husband and I spent 2 nights there in January for our anniversary. We were very impressed with the magic. When we walked into the lobby, a cast member immediately escorted us to an available person for check-in. Check-in was quick and easy, and they were able to grant us a king bed room, even though there are only 18 in the entire resort. I briefly mentioned that it was our anniversary, and they gave us the buttons to wear. The room was much larger than other hotels I've visited and had top of the line toiletries. There were white cotton robes for us to use during our stay, a flat-screen TV, refrigerator, and large balcony with a view of the monorail. We were pleasantly surprised to come back to our room the first night to the room being turned down for bed time. Lights were dimmed, chocolates were on the bed, and curtains were pulled. On day 2, a knock on the door revealed a cast member offering us champagne and a photo and signed card from Mickey and Minnie. What a special treat! The convenience to the Magic Kingdom is unmatched. Not having car traffic anywhere near the resort was so peaceful. Walking along the beach to the Polynesian was beautiful. The fireworks and water parade were extra treats. It was my impression that many Grand Floridian guests are richer than rich and don't appreciate any of the magic that the cast members give to the guests. These people wouldn't be content with any kind of service. But I was certainly very happy with the Grand Floridian! It is terribly expensive--but if you have the money, I think it's worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Always Great”
Reviews.Author: nydisneygirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for 4 nights for (a) my husband's running of the Disney half-marathon and (b) to celebrate our anniversary. We were married at Disney and held our reception and stayed at the Grand 4 years ago, but had been staying at other Disney hotels in our few visits since then. The Grand was everything we remembered. The service is excellent, the grounds are gorgeous, and the location is the best. The Grand is not perfect - the bathrooms could really use an update and it can be noisy - but it is the best on Disney property. That said, I will certainly try the Four Seasons if it does open on Disney property. We did have one wrinkle with the first room to which we were assigned. It was right next to the elevator, and the elevator bells and people talking kept me up all night. I should have asked for a switch as soon as I saw the location, but it was 2 am and I was tired so I did not, a decision I regretted within an hour. The front desk easily switched us to a better room the next morning. I would suggest requesting a room at the end of the hall, on a floor other than the 1st floor, for the best standard rooms. We have also stayed in the theme park view rooms - worth it - and one of the suites in the main building, which is wonderful if you can afford it. I recommend dinner at Narcoisses if you like seafood. The food was executed well and the service was perfect. The restaurant has a great atmosphere - go early and enjoy a cocktail on the porch while watching the fireworks. The Grand's pastry chef recreated the top tier of our wedding cake for dessert (pre-arranged by a simple phone call to the hotel's private dining staff), a very nice touch to end a lovely meal.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian ::: Home Away From Home !!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: jojomickey
Reviews.Content: After traveling to the Grand Floridian year after year, we are never disappointed with the quality service we receive. The staff does an excellent job in making it feel like home. The only problems that we have ever had at the Grand Floridian, was the other vacationers who complain about everything. They want everything to be absolutely perfect in a nonperfect world. Even though people do think it is pricey to stay here, it is worth the extra money to stay at this beautiful resort. We will continue to go year after after, with family and friends, to what we call our home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “fun with a resort feeling”
Reviews.Author: disneydancer
Reviews.Content: grand floridian was always my first choice.we stayed there from nov 7th thru the 15th..the place was beautiful.we had the magic kingdom view and boy was it ever magical.we watched the fireworks at night.my kids loved the slide pool, they had games for them every day.hair braiding and they loved it..this was my first real vacation in a long time and being so close to the parks really helped..my son loved the monarail and it was a joy to jump on and get to the parks..i found the food good..i just think they need a good coffee place..please....i already booked for this year and i cant wait..the only bad thing was the magical express..going to the hotel was ok..but going back to the airport was a disaster..they wouldnt check my luggage,people who werent supposed to be on my bus were fighting to get on....we almost missed our flight and we got on the "magical express' 3 hours earlier. than our flight..not so magical..save me a lounge chair ..ill be back soon...

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Concierge level in the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: ramblingirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 10 days over Halloween in the GF - staying at the Concierge level on the 3rd Floor in the main building. We loved the view of the castle from our room and the nightly fireworks. We had chosen the GF for its proximity to the MK and it can't be beaten in that respect. One stop on the monorail and a boat ride back in less than 5 minutes. The Concierge service was superb - Vonnie - in particular went out of her way to facilitate us. The breakfast and snacks/drinks available during the day were very good - few people were there and you could help yourself quickly and easily. The DVD's available from the Concierge desk was very useful in the evenings when our kids needed some downtime in our room. We ate in Victoria & Albert's and while it was enjoyable - we didn't think they quite pulled in off in terms of food quality/service. We had read so much about it - we really thought it would be incredible. Good but not that amazing. A disappointment was that there were not Disney characters around the hotel during breakfast etc - unless you booked the Character breakfast in the Park Fare restaurant and then only a limited selection of characters. We have stayed in the Disneyland Hotel at Disneyland Paris every Spring for the past 6 years and having a huge selection of characters just walking down the corridors or greeting you as your enter the breakfast area or available at photo points in the hotel has been a huge treat for our children. In needs of travelling with a special needs child - we have found Disneyland Paris more accommodating in the Parks - particularly for character photos and at the disabled viewing points. However, the Concierge service more than made up for any disappointments we found with Cast Members in the Parks. Perhaps it is because there are so many adults/children with special needs travelling around the Parks in WDW but we have certainly found it an easier and more friendly experience in Disneyland Paris. Overall however we would recommend the Grand Floridian hotel and the Concierge level. It was a quiet calm oasis in the middle of Walt Disney World that served us very well in terms of location particularly for the Magic Kingdom. If you are visiting the other Parks and Downtown Disney - it takes time to get to these Parks but if you want to be close to the Magic Kingdom this hotel is a great choice.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: S_oPaulo_BrazilVera
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Grand Floridian before, as at the Polynesian and Contemporary. This time I went with my family, including two children, for New Year´s Eve; As everyone knows, the place is very handsome, but surprise! as soon as we got there we were warned that we could not get a meal inside the hotel unless previously reserved. eVEN BREAKFAST! With two children, we decided not to submit them to long lines and had room service every day. For other meals, we had to go to another hotel or one of the parks.That seems to me absolutely ridiculous. The hotel was clearly overbooked andnot worried over their guests´well-being. For the sort of price you pay there, I felt definitely cheated. They should not fill to overflowing, making it imposible for their own guests to have a meal inside the hotel. And more: I asked once to use an internet, which I imagined I would have to pay at some business center. Front desk told me where to go - it was closed and I was told to use the one at the Contemporary, where we had had dinner three nights. Well, I will stay elsewhere next time...

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but first class the whole way”
Reviews.Author: chickles
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for our wedding in October 2008 and had an amazing experience. Due to the fact that it was for our wedding, we were upgraded for free from our standard room to the club level in the main building. The food was always really great on the club level and it was nice to have free sodas and water available at any time. On our first night we got complimentary champagne and roses in the room. Overall, the hotel was exceptionally clean and the recent renovations in the rooms are just beautiful. The bed was comfortable and the room was very quiet. The hammocks on the beach were frequently open in the evening and we got to use them a lot. The food was wonderful at all the different places at the resort: Victoria and Albert's, Citricos, and even the Gasperilla Grill. In summary, my husband said, "If you don't love the Grand Floridian, there's something wrong with you."

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, but overpriced”
Reviews.Author: bcuinohio
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is a beautiful hotel. The rooms are very nice and the grounds are immaculate. The pool is huge. It has a very large section that is 3'6" deep. It was perfect for my eight year old. He is not a strong swimmer and he was very comfortabale in the pool. The service was excellent. The room was a nice size and very comfortable. The hotel is about twenty years old and it is showing its age in a few spots though. Some of the outside rails had a little rust and the grout work in our bathroom looked like it needed a little attention. I was a little disappointed with Gasparillas. The lines were a little slow at breakfast time and the game room was too small to please most kids. As nice as the Grand Floridian is, I can't justify the price for future trips. Our room with the AAA discount was about $400 + tax a night and that was for the cheapest rooms they had. I think that I may look into a family suite at the All Star Music resort next time.

Reviews.Title: “The Magical Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: ksandvoss
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel from Dec. 17 - Dec. 21 and the place was decorated to the nines with beautiful Christmas decorations. We spent the majority of our time in the parks so we have nothing to review except how the hotel looked.

Reviews.Title: “Great! We had an awesome time!!”
Reviews.Author: BallroomDancer29
Reviews.Content: So my husband and I (and friends) first made a reservation to Disney's Yacht Club. But when we saw all the bad reviews, we decided to move our reservation to Disney's Grand Floridian. Anyway, so my husband, me, my 5 month-old daughter, and friends went to Disney World and we stayed at the Grand Floridian in July of 2008. One bad thing, SUPER HOT! The staff is very nice, the rooms are clean. We ordered a park-view room and we got it. The hotel itself was very clean...we loved it! The food was good, though we didn't dine a lot in the Floridian. The only place we dined in the Floridian was Victoria & Albert's (we loved it! great food) and then we dined anywhere else. We loved Disney's Grand Floridian Resort & Spa. We will surely go back again!

Reviews.Title: “Good to do once...”
Reviews.Author: rosimmom
Reviews.Content: We had always wanted to stay at the Grand Floridian but did not for budgetary reasons. We received a coupon for 40% off off peak stays so we decided to give it a try. We loved the convenience to the parks, the staff was really nice and attentive to us. We did not have any of the other negative experiences that other people had. After a long day at the park, it was nice to feel we were at a nice resort and not just a place to lay our heads down. We were upgraded to a lagoon side room. This is a very nice property and we enjoyed all the amenities and activities for the kids. The pools were nice. That being said, this is definitely not worth all the money they charge you. We have stayed at other "five star " properties and the Grand Floridian didn't have half the amenities that the other hotels had. The property feels slightly dated. The food choices are poor especially if you just want to grab a quick bite at Gaspirrilla's grill. thank god we had a car and we were able to go other places to eat. We have stayed at the Contemporary and Wilderness lodge and they were definitely worth the price being charged. This is worth doing once for the experience but if you want a good value for your money in this category of hotels at Disney I would go to the contemporary, polynesian or the wilderness lodge. They charge less and you still have a great location to the parks.

Reviews.Title: “Pass! Run While You Can!”
Reviews.Author: mitalux2
Reviews.Content: I have lived in Florida all my life and frequent Disney more times than I can even tell you. All my years, I had always stayed at Contemporary or the Polynesian and never at the Grand Floridian (mostly for budget reasons). Well, finally- the grand splurge!! I decided to give the resort a whirl and I was not happy. Save the hundred more bucks and stay at the Contemporary. The room layout is the same, but the people are nicer. Our issues started right at check-in. We reserved a concierge level, main tower room. We were promptly placed in a water view, non-concierge outbuilding room. When I pointed this out, they gave us a pass key to the external concierge building along with a big, huge- "Listen lady, we did all we could" attitude. I asked for the manager- got the same attitude. So- we checked in and I complained to Disney. Why would you want to start off your vacation with a confrontation, right? It's been 3 months and 4 letters later and I'm just being ignored. So- if you are staying on property- check out the Contemporary. It hasn't failed me yet!

Reviews.Title: “ROBBED IN MY ROOM!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Marlinman42
Reviews.Content: This hotel was not really all it is cracked up to be for the price, the food is horrible at all resturants on property other than Victoria and Alberts,and then on top of everything else I had $500 cash stolen out of my hotel room safe only to be told be the managment that there was nothing they could do other than call the sheriff's department. I was very upset with the way it was handled and will NEVER spend $600 a night to stay in this dump again. If i wanted to be robbed I would have stayed at the econo inn.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful trip and hotel!”
Reviews.Author: hmb313
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian Nov. 21st thru Nov. 28th. From the moment we arrived we had an amazing time. Penny at the front desk chose a corner room for us with 2 outside decks, one facing the Magic Kingdom and one facing the Polynesian. When she heard we were there celebrating my 40th birthday she made every effort to ensure our stay would be wonderful. With an amazing view of the castle, we watched the light parade on the water and the fireworks 5 out of 7 nights that we were there.She was worried because there was a tree to the right of the deck that faced Cinderella's Castle. I have no idea why considering it did not impair our view at all. The room was clean and extremely spacious. Housekeeping was polite and accomodating in every way. My kids LOVED the pools. We spent most of our pool time on the waterslide and under the waterfall. On Thankgiving evening we ate at Narcosees. The food and service were exceptional, 5 star dining, could be a little pricey if you have little ones. We watched the fireworks from our table as we ate our "Nemo" cupcakes. Being on the monorail makes commuting to the parks much easier. There are also buses that will take you directly to and from Hollywood Studios and Animal Kingdom as well. We took advantage of the early and late hours...mostly at the Magic Kingdom which paid off when we rode Space Mountain, Pirates of the Caribbean and Splash Mountain three times in a row each without even getting off the rides! I highly recommend staying at the Grand Floridian it is absolutely worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sadly, not so Grand anymore”
Reviews.Author: DRGWAGMOM
Reviews.Content: My family and I just returned from our third stay at The Grand Floridian within the last six years; unfortunately, this may have been our last stay at The Grand due to the extremely poor customer service we received on multiple levels. Our first disappointing experience was during check-in when they had our oldest son listed as a child on our reservation (which would have included him receiving "child" meals with the dining plan) despite my having confirmation of our reservation with him as an "adult." We were instructed to go to the concierge desk to have this corrected and the young woman who helped us suggested we simply go to the parks and "see how he does with the children's menus." I informed her that during our last visit, the child's menu was not enough food for him and now, two years later, it certainly was not going to work. Additionally, I paid for him as an adult and I expected this to be corrected. After 40 minutes of waiting, the issue was resolved and she was very apologetic -- stating that the system had uploaded our reservation incorrectly and could she make it up to us with free FastPasses -- we readily accepted and she returned with THREE FastPasses for a family of FOUR! She stated that was all they had. Our next disappointment was with housekeeping in our room -- Sago Key, Room 4511. Upon check-in, there was a large "glob" of toothpaste on the bathroom door that I cleaned up -- how someone could have missed it, I don't know. Within seconds we found a "razor guard" on the floor that would have easily been picked up in a vacuum sweeper had someone actually vacuumed. These types of oversights upon check-in can only make you guess what else has not been attended to! I did put a call into housekeeping and shared this information with them and a manager did come to our room to apologize but the service never improved and I stopped leaving a gratuity after the second day. Our shower was so slow-draining that, by the end of your shower, you were standing in water up to your ankles which is just gross. Why housekeeping did not resolve this issue with maintenance, I don't know. Also, our bathroom door kept locking on it's own ... go figure! We had to call maintenance twice and the second time was first thing in the morning when we were all trying to get ready to make an ADR for a character breakfast. Despite two phone calls and a 45-minute wait, we never saw anyone from maintenance and our boys resorted to urinating in two empty water bottles since they couldn't wait any longer. Call me crazy but I expect better service than this when paying in excess of $400/night for a room. I have received better service than this when staying at "chain" hotels. Lastly, on our last day when we were checking out, we resorted to getting a luggage trolley on our own as no one was showing up to our room. On our way to the front entrance, one of the porters actually stopped his cart with other Grand guests sitting in it with him and reprimanded us for taking the trolley. He had the gall to admonish us and tell us we better make sure we got the trolley back to our building! No offer of help, no offer to call anyone ... nothing! Nothing but disparate words for us in front of other guests! I stopped at the desk on our way out and told one of the desk personnel of our experience being admonished by one of your porters -- her response to me was that she didn't know what "admonished" meant. I have always left the Grand happily planning our next visit, but not this time. The value for the cost was totally absent and our stay was very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort for an Awesome Vacation”
Reviews.Author: gsully224
Reviews.Content: Of all the luxury hotels that I have been so lucky to stay at, the Grand Floridian is by far my favorite. From when you first set foot into the resort, there are always people ready to serve you. Right after a speedy check in with no line, a very kind bell-hop brought us to a golf-cart where he showed us a tour of the property and then brought us to our room. As for the rooms, I thought they were definitely five-star. Online, I didn't think that the pictures of the rooms looked too good. However, after seeing them in person, I thought that they were much more impressive. I had a standard garden-view room, but it still was very spacious, with nice touches such as a large day-bed, two sinks in the bathroom, a separate area for the shower and toilet, an iHome clock radio that works with your iPod, a plasma TV, and a large sized mini fridge. The beds were very comfortable with a good pillow selection that ranged from soft to firm. Another nice touch was the resort's complimentary turn-down service. Every night, another group of housekeepers would come and turn down your room. They would replace your linens and towels, turn down your beds (including the day bed), make a couple of towel animals, restock your ice bucket, and leave a chocolate on your pillow. The one complaint I have about the rooms is that they could be very noisy. If somebody was talking outside in the hallway, you could clearly hear it. Luckily, I was in one of the quieter buildings, Sago Cay, that didn't have too many children in it. The resort facilities were great. The two pools were very spacious, one of them had a hot tub and the other had a waterside. The white-sand beach was perfect for viewing the Magic Kingdom fireworks, but note that you aren't allowed to swim in the water. The hotel also was great for transportation, particularly because you could take the monorail to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot. I would recommend the Grand Floridian to anybody who can afford to stay there. Just remember that it is the fanciest of all the Disney World Resorts, and it does have a much more formal (and I must say classy) atmosphere that other Disney hotels. It is very expensive, but you definitely get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disney Hotel - Over rated and Over priced”
Reviews.Author: Ancon
Reviews.Content: I have visited Disney on 15 occasiones, stayed at most of their 4 and 5 star hotels. The Grand Floridian looks Grand and it is beautiful in its own way, but lacks some fun and Disney spirit for the little one. Great hotel if you are an adult or a teenager, but for the little ones, it was a bit disappointing. Its is very expensive by any standard - I paid $525 for each of 2 rooms - more than I pay at Four Sesons in Miami or close to Intercontinental in Paris. Anyhow, we were shown to our rooms at a hotel wing that was remodeling, nice boarded wall outside our balcony, lots of noise from compressors and the smeel of paint everywhere. After declining this horrific room - we were 5, my wife, our 11, 8 and 2 years old and I - were moved to a new building. This new rooms were besides the ice machine room, and therefore you can imagine the noise at night from the machine compressor, on and off, every hour. Did not complain again, too tired for that at that time. In all sincerity, I felt we were taken advantage us by the management, since we came from abroad, however as I said, these rooms were very expensive and in my opinion, very very overpriced. If you want Disney magic with your small kids, go to the Swann or Dolphin, or maybe other Disney location. Be sure to take an umbrella, since all building are apart and if it rains you will get wet. This hotel was not for me, did get to choose it from the great reviews here, but again, overrated and with little Disney magic for us.

Reviews.Title: “Superb Stay”
Reviews.Author: drybean
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our 1 week stay at the Grand Floridian and already miss it! We've stayed at other Disney properties before, and this one is by far the best yet. The rooms were large & comfortable for our family of 4. The in room fridge allowed us to have a quick in room breakfast every morning. The bathroom was large and the robes and coffee maker provided a sense of luxury. The heated pool was inviting, although we never had time to take a dip. There were plenty of people indulging, and even though the pool is open 24 hours and our room faced the pool, it was never loud. We were in the Boca Chica building, which was at the back of the property, overlooking the beach and the pool. Our daughter looked forward to the chocolates provided with the turn down service. The location was convenient. It was fastest to take the Monorail to the Magic Kingdom (no stops) and the boat back (no stops). The monorail from the MK back to the GF had 4 stops before the hotel. We ate at the cafe for breakfast twice, and it was tasty and had the wonderful friendly Disney Service.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: KUKatie
Reviews.Content: This is the crown jewel of Disney properties at the Walt Disney World Resort. The hotel is huge with a victorian era theme. The lobby is decorated like a large formal parlor surrounded by shops, the front desk, and the Concierge desk. We were greeted by a cast member the moment we stepped off of the Magical Express from the airport and were escorted to the front desk. Each cast member introduced us to the next person that would be helping us. Because we were newly married, our room was upgraded from a garden view room to a lagoon view room facing the wedding pavilion. We also were given "Just Married" buttons to wear through out our stay. Alex, who checked us in was wonderful and gave us an information packet about the hotel, explaining everything we could possibly need. We also got a follow up call from here an hour after check-in to make sure our room was alright and to see if we needed anything else such as dining reservations. The room was very large with a balcony with chairs, a flat screen tv, a refridge, a large bathroom with a vanity, double sinks, and a large shower. The room also had a sitting area with a couch. We had a nightly turn down serivce with chocolates left on the pillows and ice in our ice bucket. There are two pools on property as well as 6 resturants. You can also get to the parks by monorail, bus, or boat. This hotel is the best Disney has to offer but I would not recommend it for people with small children. It is more a hotel for an older crowd or people with older children. The service was 5 star and the htel quality and experience was one that is not soon forgotten.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantasic Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: nalad
Reviews.Content: We were going to stay at the Swan but was disappointed when we saw the rooms. I contacted Disney and managed booked The Grand Floridian. This is our second stay at this hotel and once again it met all expectations. I cannot think of one bad thing to say about this hotel. Staff: From the moment we checked in, to the moment we left on The Magical Express, (checked out of room at 11am - did not leave for the airport until 3.30pm) we were made welcome. All members of staff greet you in passing. Nothing is to much trouble, and in our experience they will go out of their way to help you. Room: We were upgraded to RPC and had a view of the Castle, The room had a King bed which was extremely comfortable, the room was very spacious, had relaxing decor and I could not fault the cleanliness. The food and drink offerings were delicious, varied and very welcome The grounds are always spotless which amazes me, and the Lobby is calm and relaxing. Before we booked the first time we stayed I was concerned that it may be a bit "stuffy" and formal, I was wrong, it is truly a majestic hotel and worth every penny that you pay...everybody should stay here at least once if you're on a Disney Holiday.

Reviews.Title: “The BEST Vacation EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: jonurse5
Reviews.Content: A really GRAND resort. I booked the reservation at the last minute and still got a great deal. The Crew members really exceeded our expectations. When we arrived at the resort we were taken on a tour, then to our room. No hassle with the luggage, all taken care of by the crew ( this was great, especially after being in the car driving for 984 miles from Ohio). The resort is beautiful, rooms are comfy & all have excellent views. We watched the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom from our balcony every night. The service is excellent . Even had Mickey Mouse fashioned from towels on the beds every day. Rosa G, our guest room attendant was the best, always had a smile!! The 24 hours snack bar was a welcomed suprise! Transportation system is primo. By monorail or bus every park is easily accessible. This was truly a GRAND vacation and we plan to return every year and stay at the Grand Floridian Resort and Spa. Thanks for the BEST vacation!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel -- deserves its 5 star rating”
Reviews.Author: VaTravel
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel only for 1 night in September of 2008. It was my third Disney visit and only the first time where I stayed in Disney property. Initially I though about staying in Contemporary, but they were sold out and I decided to stay in Grand Floridian since I needed to be on Monorail. I was very pleased that I got to experience Grand Floridian instead. Check In: We arrived on Magical Epxress at around 1 pm. Our room was ready and I got my keys and was on my way within 5 min. Moreover, when I called the bell desk to bring my luggage, I assumed that I would have to wait for about 15-20 min (at least), based on my epxerience in other hotels. Our bags were at the door within 5 min of my call. Room: If Victorian Style is your thing, you will love it. I am not big fan of that era, but decor was not too bad. What pleased me, however, was the cleanliness and the size of the room. It was spacious, very, very clean, bathrooms were immaculate, and bedsheets did not leave any doubts about their cleanliness. We had a garden view room, with extra sofa bed (we did not use it) and two queen size beds. Restaurants: We ate breakfast at the resort restaurant and found it to be adequate -- food was good, service was great and prices were high, as anywhere else in the touristy place like Disney. Resort also has a small convinience store that carries a lot of food items. There are nice tables and chairs outside, so it would be very easy to make your own breakfast. Grounds: Immaculate. Very well taken care of, buildings are nicely painted and flowers in the lobby are great. Pool looked very inviting, too bad we did not have time for it. Overall, I would say that I definitely want to come back to this resort on my next Disney trip.

Reviews.Title: “Virgin Holidays”
Reviews.Author: benjsurrey
Reviews.Content: I booked the Grand Floridian through Virgin Holidays as family holiday. We stay in Sugar loaf building which had conceige staff and buffet which was breakfast/lunch/afternoon snack/evening snack/late night snack this was excellent especially when you have got young childern who needs something sensible to eat after spending all day at Disney eating Junk food. The hotel for us was excellent the rooms where a good size and very clean. (The cleaners kept it very clean) and the staff was always helpful. I was so please with the facilities including the pools and leisure complex was my dream. The Grand Floridian is the first hotel for me that has kept up too my expectation of what a hotel should be like when you go away with your family. My children will always come back they were so please with everything that they are marketing it in the UK. I would recommend to anyone in the UK if they were going to Disney it was perfect the monorail was great and also you can use the boats instead of the monorail. My only complaint to conceige was that my balcony needed cleaning this was actioned sweptly. Thank you for making my holiday very special!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian is Grand”
Reviews.Author: Tenr2th
Reviews.Content: A recent Labor Day stay proved to be a pleasant surprise. We have been attempting to try all of the Disney World hotels on different occasions. We have to say, so far, this is the best. The property is serene and beautiful, much larger than it appears from the usual monorail fly-by. Monorail connection makes this resort excellent if you are visiting the Magic Kingdom and Epcot, although the bus transportation is good--not great--to get you to all the other facilities. The room was spacious, two queens and a twin sofabed, although the sofa bed was NOT mentioned in the Disney website when we booked this. It made it easier for the two kids (13 and 8), so each had their own bed. I think 5 in this room would be pushing it, however. The hotel shows a little bit of its age despite the upgraded flat screen TV. The decor is a bit garish, but acceptable due to the Victorian nature of the place; it is in need of some more stylish upgrading. A negative was the distance from the main building, and the lack of covered walkways, especially during inclement weather. Restaurants were good encompassing all price ranges. Overall, a lovely place and worth the extra you may spend to stay there. The grounds are to be enjoyed as well. We had a lakefront room that was quiet and scenic. Yes, we'd go back there.

Reviews.Title: “Room with a view”
Reviews.Author: martinstev
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. Everything we hoped for to start our Disney holiday. Room 7328 is to die for. Must have the best view from it's balconcy you could hope for. Directly onto Cinderellas castle over the lake, full view of fireworks etc. Small ferry to Magic kingdom from jetty just below this block of rooms was very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Got a Great Deal, Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: MaThreesisters
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay at the Grand Floridian resort. We are Disney "nuts", and have been there many times! Since this is one of the few Disney hotels that allow a family of 5, we were more than happy to stay here. I got a 30% off rate a few months before, so I automatically choose here. The room are huge, and they have 2 Queens and a daybed-big enough for my 15 yr. old (5'7") to be comfortable on. The monorail is a huge plus for us. The pool is fabulous, zero-entry, with a beautiful waterfall and slide. I would definitely stay here again , as long as I got some type of discount, because the rack rates are very high. My only complaint would be that when we returned home from the parks one afternoon, they had started painting the outside of our building. We had no prior notice of this, so we couldn't sit on our balcony that afternoon, because the trucks, cranes and workers were right outside our room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bahman40
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed. The location is amazing and the hotel itself is so amazing. The service is Unbelievable. Everyone is so friendly. I strongly recommend this hotel for everyone. The rooms are pricey but it does worth it.

Reviews.Title: “One of the Best Times of my Life!”
Reviews.Author: Ermo814
Reviews.Content: A girlfriend and I stayed here over New Year's 07-08. Not only was it the most fun I've every had over New Years, but since we visited Disney during the Year of a Million Dreams we were selected by the hostess to have our stay upgraded to the concierge level. We had a room right off the balcony in the main building overlooking the amazing lobby, life-size gingerbread house, and the New Year's celebration. Light sleepers might have a little bit of a problem with the conceirge level but the complimentary champagne and day-planning services on this floor were very much appreciated. The food was amazing, the grounds and views were stunning, and the convenience of being in the Park was great.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to stay in Disney!”
Reviews.Author: newyorklover123
Reviews.Content: What a great place! Amazing restaurants. Have been there multiple times, good proximity to other parks. Beautiful suite with lagoon/kingdom view. Wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Period Charm”
Reviews.Author: BonnieL0789
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three night Disney Wonder Cruise followed by three nights at the Grand Floridian. The hotel is very lovely and takes one back to the elegance of the turn of the century. Staff was exceptional to Disney standards. Multiple restaurants on the "pricey" side. This was a trip for our Grandson and although the hotel very nice, probably not overall the best selection of a Disney luxury property on the Monorail for a seven year old. The lobby is gorgeous complete with high tea and a full orchestra in the afternoon and evening. The grounds are gorgeous with multiple pools; one with a sandy beach. Great access to the Magic Kingdom; the first stop going on the Monorail and first stop returning on the boat. One evening we ate in the casual Grand Floridian Cafe where they have display drawings done by youngsters while waiting for dinner. My husband inquired if they would display our Grandson's for just a short time giving him the opportunity of being the "Artist of the Day". It was a highpoint in his trip. We were in the Conch Key Building on the fifth floor in a gabled room with balcony. The room was generous in size with a king bed and sofa making into a single bed, flat screen TV, clock radio/alarm with IPod feature and large desk and work table. The bath has first class amenity shampoos and lotions with double sinks and separated from the toilet and tub/shower combination. Each building also had a small laundry room with two washers and two dryers. I learned in Florida, since we shared our visit with Tropical Storm Fay, it is better to have a property mainly contained in one building rather than one with multiple buildings. One could get pretty drenched walking from the main building and the Monorail stop to the Conch Key building where our accommodations were located. Overall, we would return but probably not with a small child and would look at either the Polynesian or Animal Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Never Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: IslesGrl39
Reviews.Content: From the moment you enter the lobby you will be swept away with Victorian charm. There are always fresh elaborate bouquets of flowers in the lobby and depending on the time of day a live band or pianist. My family and I went to Gasparilla Grill practically every day for a snack or meal, the 24 hour service is more convenient than you think! 1900 Park Fare is wonderful, Cinderella, her prince, her stepmother and stepsisters come around to take pictures, sign autographs and even dance! Every night there was a turn down service which made me feel like a princess. And to sit on my balcony and watch the fireworks by Cinderella's castle completed the entire experience. I've stayed at the Grand Floridian 5 times so far and have not once been disappointed. I will certainly be returning. Helpful Tip: Standing by the dock or in front of Narcoossee's is a perfect spot for viewing Wishes, the nightly fireworks show at the Magic Kingdom.

Reviews.Title: “Grand stand at Disney's Grand floridian”
Reviews.Author: Beyondparadise
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. My room was right in front of the lake and it was wonderful to wake to a lovely sight. Room service was great everyone you encountered was helpful and pleasant. I do not have a bad word to say about this hotel... Oh!! maybe room service should not be so eager to clean the rooms, some people like to sleep in late. If you would call that negative.. LOL

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley Fab”
Reviews.Author: kemcho123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on Concierge level for 8 days in March and everything was wonderful.The rooms,food and service was great.All the staff were very cheerful and helpful,especially Joe on the Concierge level desk.Would definiteley stay here again.I would recommend to everyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “I had a good time but...”
Reviews.Author: ruthie123
Reviews.Content: The hotel was nice but when I requested an ipod for my new room the desk clerk acted as if she didn't know what I was talking about. The ice machine in building 5 was broken but after reporting it they fixed it promptly. I loved the turn down service. One suggestion, when one of the drivers sees a resident having problems walking they should stop and at least try to help by giving them a ride to their building. You could also hear what was happening in the other room. The water had to run quite some time before it got hot. The grand floridian cafe's roasted chiken was worth the price but the steak was bland.

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: SarahinOR
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 5 days in May. The location is fantastic: the hotel is 1 monorail stop from the Magic Kingdom. It is kind of kitschy but overall very nice and not overtly Disney (ie Mickey Mouse all over the place). We tried three of the five restaurants while there and all were delightful. The rooms are very nice - not five star but very nice . They have a spa on-site and two pools. It is pricey but realistically you are paying for location which is worth it. We're going back in January for 10 days!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Great”
Reviews.Author: pablik
Reviews.Content: Absolutely exquisite. Staff is curteous and are always greeting you. The hotel and room are impecably clean. Nothing else to be expected from the most expensive Disney Hotel. It's very reminiscent of the great classical hotels, so I'm not sure if families traveling with children would enjoy it as much as some of the Disney properties. It's also a great place to watch the Magic Kingdom Fireworks. For breakfast recommend the buffet more than the cafe which will be more expensive. Plus with the buffet you have the Disney Characters from Mary Poppins for those who like a character breakfast. Make reservations breakfast reservations early. Recommend it without hesitancy.

Reviews.Title: “Where Dreams Come True”
Reviews.Author: Disney-Addict1208
Reviews.Content: Went to Disney to celebrate my youngest daughter's graduation from High School. Upon arrival we were greeted numerous times by the staff before we even made it to the front desk. We were in a bit of a rush as we had dinner reservations that evening at the Hoop Dee Doo Review and knew it would take some time to get over to Fort Wilderness. Check in was speedy and the concierge had our tickets ready and waiting for us. I can't say enough about not having to worry about our luggage! Mousekeeping did a really nice job with our room. There were five of us all together and we had plenty of everything. We would leave our room in the morning for breakfast and a bit of whatever park we chose for that day, would head back to our room mid day to rest and then head back out in the evenings for dinner and more parks. When we would arrive at our room in the afternoon it was always spotless and when we would arrive back in the late evenings there was nothing like having our beds turned down for us. The main lobby always had some kind of activity. For instance, one afternoon there was a little parade of princesses that must have been at the Floridian for the afternoon tea party.
