Every evening there was a piano player and there was nothing like watching the little ones twirling around in their little princess costumes to the piano music. Park Fare also has character dining in the mornings and evenings. Although we no longer have little ones, we love character dining. There's no question that this resort is a little pricey, but it was well worth every dollar.

Reviews.Title: “The Floridian is stunning, but pricey”
Reviews.Author: sonicglitter
Reviews.Content: First off, I have to say that the Grand Floridian is stunning. It’s a just a beautiful hotel and has a great location. I stayed here with my mom and my boyfriend, while my mom was there on business. We had transferred from another resort because we came in for an extra day that was not part of the business trip. So when we arrived to our room that night, we expected our bags to have made the transfer and to have already been in our room – well they weren’t – at 10pm. So that was just something that should have been automatically done at a resort like this one. But our room had a great view of the lagoon and was a nice size – comfortable for the three of us. But it is really expensive. We did have a few disappointments here though. For such an expensive place, we thought everything would be perfect. One day we didn’t have hot water at all and we were pretty much told to deal with it. Although, someone did come up later and was very apologetic about the situation, so I guess that helped a little. We loved that the monorail and buses stopped here, but we didn’t like how long everything took. Since the Grand Floridian is close to Disney World – it’s not really close to anything else. So, the bus would go directly to a park on the way there, but on the way back to the resort it would stop at either one or two other resorts first – so a bus ride back could take almost an hour. That was really frustrating after a long day at a park or Downtown Disney. The same goes for the monorail. Going to the Magic Kingdom – it’s only one stop – but on the way back you need to go all the way around the lagoon. I recommend using the water taxi. It’s a nice trip and will go directly to the Grand Floridian from the Magic Kingdom. The pool and beach areas are really nice. We enjoyed both. There’s a hot tub on the main pool, which is really nice in the morning. Also, at night you can see the fireworks at the Magic Kingdom and the Electric Light parade on the lagoon right from the resort – so that was really nice. For a nice sit down lunch, the Grand Floridian Café is nice. They have good sized portions and a lot of options. We did make reservations for here though – just in case. We made reservations at a lot of restaurants just in case – because it saves a lot of additional waiting time. For breakfast – we just did the quick service Gasparilla Grill and Games every morning. But like everything – even cereal seems pricey. This is definitely a more adult resort. While the resort is beautiful, has a waterfall pool and has character meals – there are other hotels that are more themed that kids might enjoy better. This is a good resort for couples or families with older children. Overall, we enjoyed staying here. However, staying at the Animal Kingdom Lodge right before this put things in perspective for us. We liked both resorts but for the cost – we would probably do the Lodge over the Floridian if we had the choice again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: familygalChicagoIL
Reviews.Content: No denying the location speaks for itself. With a baby in a stroller and (2) 6-year olds, the extra money was well spent on the quick and convenient access of the monorail. Great afternoon fun and sun in the pool and at the hotel mini beach. Staff very helpful and accomodating to special needs.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: mcarp
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for one week in June, 2008 with a 6 year old child. We just booked a "standard room" thru AAA and wound up with a room in a great location in the Conch Key building. We had a view of the Magic Kingdom castle (and nightly fireworks) from our balcony and we were right above the boat dock. This was convenient for SeaRaycer rentals and our child's lifevest, loaned to us for the duration of our stay. This hotel is very convenient if you have younger children and spend most of your time in the Magic Kingdom. It's the first stop on the monorail and literally 2 minutes away. The hotel is very clean and staff was very friendly and helpful. I've read negative reviews of rooms on this site, but ours was very clean and well kept. I even smelled fresh paint in our building and room the day we arrived. There are several nice restaruants, but only one counter service facility. It is nice, but could offer more variety. The grounds are beautiful and perfectly maintained by a grounds crew that seems to work almost around the clock. I would definetly stay here again. It does cost more to stay here than at other Disney resorts, but in my opinion is worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Simply The Best”
Reviews.Author: TomStockport
Reviews.Content: We travelled to Florida for 2 weeks in August 07 for a Family Holiday and as it was our last one we decided to push the boat out big time!! As you approach the hotel you are blown away by the way this place looks, extremely elegant and beautifully presented. As you arrive at the Hotel the Valet parking guys will take your car and park it for you whilst concierge will take your bags to reception. Disney only seems to employ happy people and the employees of this Hotel were no different all of them going out of their way to assist you and make it really special from start to finish. The rooms were of a good size, clean and very well equipped with all the amenities that you expect from a Hotel of this class. The Hotel is right in the Centre of Disney and you can take the monorail from the Hotel to either the Magic Kingdom or Epcot and the busses run from the front of the Hotel to all the other parks, all of which are free. The Hotel has 5 restaurants and 1 24 hr Cafe. The food was simply amazing especially in Narcoose's - which over looks the magic Kingdom and at night you can watch the Fireworks whilst eating your meal. The Hotel has 2 main Pools and sun beds on the Lake, the pools were of a good size, very clean and spacious and the perfect place to chill for a couple of hours. The Faults with this Hotel? Well there are some minor issues, Firstly this is not a cheap Holiday and the cost rises still once your there, the restaurants are wonderful but can be expensive, and the Valet parking is $10 at time!!! Also the Bathroom in our room was Tiny and the decoration does make the rooms seem a little more dated than even the Hotel tries to be, the other main gripe was that as a guest of the Hotel you didn't get priority tables in the restraunts and if they were booked it was tough! To Sum up, if you want quite simply the best Disney Holiday then this has to be the one, it may be expensive but it is money most definitely well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury Hotel Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: UKFamily0608
Reviews.Content: We approached our booking at the Grand Floridian with a hint of trepidation. We had read mixed reviews about the hotel and were slightly nervous as Disney virgins. However the experience was wonderful. We were upgraded to a concierge room which was tremendous. The facilities were first class as were the staff. The location is tremendous for the Magic Kingdom and the bus service to the Animal Kingdom was swift and frequent. The top tip though is to take the boat to the Magic Kingdom. It is pleasantly cool in the humid conditions and not well used. On some journeys we were the only passengers. All in all, a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location but does not meet price standards”
Reviews.Author: miscastob
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian Hotel from 6 to 11 June 2008. I booked this hotel cos it was supposedly THE BEST of the Disney Resorts. I must say that the location was fab but honestly the room is just an ordinary standard room of 3* quality standard. The lobby staff was friendly and helpful. Housekeeping fell short. We had glasses from room service which were not removed from the room or washed. We had our pillows removed from our room ( Had to call housekeeping to replace them, why they would take away used pillows is beyond me!) Some nights we were not given soaps or shampoo, the sink still had toothpaste stains in it, no floor towel for the bathroom. I was expecting the towel animals since we had our 14 mth old with us but never saw one in our 6D/5N stay there. The monorail was convenient but it is also available at the Polynesian and the Comptemporary which is cheaper. For the price we paid, we really expected a whole lot more amenities & better housekeeping. We've stayed at the Shangri-la, Conrad, Hyatt, Ritz, Marriot, etc for a lot less a night and got a better deal for our money. So for you pple trying to decide where to stay in a resort near the magic kingdom, go to Polynesian or Comptemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: yeeminnie
Reviews.Content: We (4 adults)stayed from May 15-May 21st and it was our 1st time to WDW and to this grand hotel and worth every penny! We stopped by the Polynesian Hotel and noted that while it was festive it was also overrun by screaming and noisey kids which it should be since it is a family place but the Grand Floridian was a quiet, and peaceful reprieve to get away from all the kids and noise all day at the parks! It is clean, beautiful, and the piano playing and band at night was a real treat! The shops have alot to offer and the soap shop was wonderful....ate breakfast, lunch and dinner at the cafe there and it was great! Service was super! Monorail access is great and I would go again!! The grounds are well kept and everyone was friendly and they have a cafe-cafeteria to get meals late at nite! Watched the fireworks at the castle from from the marina and beach areas! Bus transporation was prompt and not long waiting at all maybe 10 minutes) and also the Disney Magical Express system was smooth and organized coming and leaving to the airport. If you can splurge I would recommend it indeed. My 19 and 21 year olds loved the hotel too and the quietness! Hotel robes supplied for use while there and also the beds are turned down at night and chocolate is left on the pillows unless you request this not done! Pampering is great! We had a garden-view ground room which was great! No complaints.

Reviews.Title: “A Fairytale Honeymoon!!”
Reviews.Author: nini-b
Reviews.Content: A tip for all future brides out there: if you're looking for a honeymoon hotel that will treat you like a fairytale princess then the WDW Grand Floridian is the perfect hotel for you (and for your Prince Chaming as well)! The key to this hotel's success as a honeymoon destination, in my opinion, is the little extra touches they provide for their newlywed couples. My husband and I had originally booked a Lodge Tower room (slightly larger than a standard room with an extra balcony and living area); however, upon arrival, we were informed that as we were on our honeymoon we had been upgraded to one of the octagonal honeymoon suites on the Concierge level (we later found out from housekeeping that our room usually costs around $2000 a night!) Also, 10 minutes after we'd arrived in our room we were presented with a red rose for myself, a chilled bottle of champagne and a signed card/photo of congratulations from Mickey and Minnine Mouse. As if that wasn't enough, when we returned from dinner on our first night we'd found that the lady who provided our turndown service had laid a thick carpet of rose petals on our floor leading to a huge rose petal heart on our bed! I cannot begin to explain what a wonderful tone all these little touches set for the rest of our holiday. At Disneyworld, the five-star treatment doesn't end once you enter the parks. Upon check-in we were presented with "just married" badges, which we were advised to wear at the parks. The staff at Disney are actually trained to look out for these badges and we were met with warm congratulations easily about 50 times a day! Also, every time we entered a counter-service restaurant we were given either free cookies, puddings or drinks. Again, little extras like this can help turn a great holiday into an amazing holiday. The Grand Floridian is home to some of the nicest, most sophisticated restaurants in the whole of the WDW resort. We were lucky enough to be able to enjoy two evenings at Citricos ( a southern European restaurant) and I cannot recommend this retaurant enough for the ultimate romantic dinner. Tip: ask for a table near the window so you can enjoy the Magic Kingdom fireworks while you dine). If shopping is a key part of your life, the hotel has some gorgeous boutique-type shops where you can buy clothes, shoes, bath products and the usual Disney merchandise. Another way in which you're spoiled for choice at the Grand Floridian is with the transport to the rest of Disneyworld.As well as the free Disney buses to everywhere, the Magic Kingdom can also be reached by boat (so romantic at night) and by monorail; this is also the only way to get to EPCOT from this hotel. My main piece of advice for anyone thinking of booking this hotel is to spend the extra money and go on the Concierge level: not only do you get your own private concierge (perfect for booking dinner reservations - the rest of the resort has to share a concierge in the main lobby and every day the queues looked huge) but you're also treated to free food and drink during the day, starting with a wide variety of breakfast goods to freshly-made cookies and canapes in the evening and wine, beer and spirits (including some very expensive cognacs and whiskeys!) Coffee, tea, water and soft drinks are also available 24 hours a day. Overall, I really can't say enough nice things about this hotel and its staff, who were all absolutely incredible. My husband and I had an absolutely perfect honeymoon and we cannot wait to go back!! The perfect start to our marriage!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and soooo convenient”
Reviews.Author: lucysluckey
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian and it was great! The accessibility of the monorail running right to the hotel and the parks made it worth every penny. The service at the Sugar Loaf lodge was great. Everyone was so helpful, it is impossible to name just one outstanding person. We will be back to Disney and we will return to the Grand Floridian.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Hotel Experience for the Little Ones”
Reviews.Author: LTownsendMD
Reviews.Content: We took our 6-year old and her 6-year-old friend and stayed on the concierge floor, facing the lake and the Magic Kingdom. What can I say...but it was magic? It was worth every single penny. Check-in was time-consuming and difficult, but once we arrived on our floor (only concierge floor patrons had access) we were transported to a genuine Disney Experience. There was round-the-clock snacks that were made all the more special by the absolute safety of the concierge floor, so our little darlin's could dress up in their nightgowns and go by themselves to serve themselves breakfast...a joy to behold. Each night we snuggled in bed and watched the fireworks over the Kingdom from our bed. My dad always said...this is what money is for....if you're going to do a vacation with the kids...do it right.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floidian Grand!”
Reviews.Author: BozieNy
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is grand but children friendly. Room was very clean and spacious with balcony. Can watch fireworks fron their dock if you are tired. Pool wtih water slide was great. Nice beach also. Main pool open most of night. The Deli was great if you weren't in to going out. Selections for adults and children (read...chicken nuggets!). Inexpensive for breakfast also. Staff friendly and accomadating. And do use Mickey's Magical Express.....removes all the stress from getting to and from the airport. And only one stop from the Magic Kingdom by monorail.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: RigsPA
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd year in a row staying at the Grand Floridian Resort and I had an even better time than last year. I will start off with only one complaint and that is the Disney transportation and luggage "convenience". When staying at this resort, they offer to pick you up at the airport and the staff will take care of your luggage and deliver it to your room. It is supposed to save time and make it convenient on the guests. It took us over 4 hours to receive our luggage and we had to stand in line for a long time while waiting for our bus to pick us up from the airport. Waiting with an excited and impatient 4 year old for a bus is not fun. Next time we will get our own luggage and get a taxi to the resort. That's it for the complaints. The resort is beautiful, staff is friendly, the rooms were spacious and clean. The bathrooms were updated, large and clean. We had a room with a view of Magic Kingdom and every night we got to watch the fireworks and a musical boat show from the lake. The lake view from our balcony was just gorgeous and relaxing. You can't beat the 5 minute ride on the monorail to Magic Kingdom either. We spent everyday at the beach pool. My daughter loved the zero depth entry into the pool and the sandy beach. My husband loved the water slide!! Having the bar right next to the pool was wonderful too. You can't get a decent lunch from that bar, but that didn't bother us. Just a reminder to anyone traveling to Disney, if you intend to have a decent meal, then make dinner reservations at the restaurants (in the resort and at the parks), or you will not be able to get a table. Otherwise, you're stuck eating burgers or hot dogs every night. The Gasparilla Grill (quick service restaurant) actually had really good food (sandwiches, burgers etc.) and a large snack variety. We ate our lunches there most days. The resort grounds were lovely too. We all cannot wait to return in the future!!

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: caleighsma
Reviews.Content: I was really excited to stay here. We stayed 2 nights at concierge level in the main building (Royal Palm Club). The room was nice, but showed a lot of wear. Lots of nicks and gashes on the bathroom vanity, the walls and closet doors. Some worn patches on the carpet. The dimmer/fan in the bathroom was worn and old looking. We paid $754 a night (that's with the AAA discount) and I just feel the room should have been in much better shape. The room was recently re-habbed too. New flat screen TV and DVD player (DVD players are in concierge rooms only) 2 queen beds. We had an awesome theme park view (thanks to a great Travel Agent). The hotel lost a gift basket that our TA sent us. (They gave it to the wrong room - staying on concierege level should have guaranteed meticulous service - it did not). Our TA did manage to call the resort manager and they sent a new gift basket to our room. (This was only after much arguing on her part she told me). The food offerings were nice and plentiful. Sodas, coffee, juice, and Evian water available in the lounge all day. Continental breakfast, afternoon tea, early evening snacks, wine and beer service, late evening cordials and deserts are offered. However, all the WDW deluxe resorts offer concierege lounge amenities, and all are priced less than the GF. There is another concierge lounge at the GF called the Sugar Loaf building. It is located on the grounds and not in the main building. Room rates are about $150 less than staying in the main building. I have heard the food offerings are the same, but the lounge is smaller and feels more cramped when fully booked. I am glad we stayed here, I always wanted to try it. I doubt we will be back again. Next time we will try the Polynesian or Contemporary.

Reviews.Title: “Lacking Expected Quality & Amenities”
Reviews.Author: toddms
Reviews.Content: Oddly, a "suite" with a rate of nearly $1,000 per night is what any other hotel or resort would call a standard room. Approximately 400 square feet with a single king bed, no work area or living quarters existed; a modestly decorated room with light bulbs actually missing were the traits of a Grand Floridian suite. The Grand Floridian boasts concierge service on each club level (one of the levels I lodged on). The concierge desks on my floor remained mostly unstaffed, and were not the concierge you may be accustomed to at a traditional resort. Concierge at the Grand Floridian are seemingly ticket & time-share salespeople for the park. My concierge was unable to provide directions to a neighboring park property, and for dinner reservations, actually indicated in-resort dining did not require a reservation. After being denied service at three of the resort's restaurants (because I didn't have reservations), I "treated" myself to the cafe. The only "24 hour" restaurant is actually a small arcade, offering pre-made sandwiches after 10:00PM. Not once during my stay was I asked how my stay was going. Even upon checkout, there was not a single question about my enjoyment. Certainly not a value; resort did not meet my expectations of a high-priced luxury property; poor service, inadequate facilities and great deceipt on the part of room descriptions ensure that I will not return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: PAS11
Reviews.Content: I took my son (20) and nephew (13) to the Grand Floridian and stayed for 12 days. The location to the disney attractions via a hired car was excellent and took no more than 10-15 mins to get anywhere we wanted. The hotel is stunning to look at and as clean as the day it was built. From the moment we arrived we were made to feel welcome. We ate at all the hotel restaurants which vary in both price and types of food served and would recommend them all. The room was large enough for the three of us and offered all the extras you would want and expect from a five star hotel. Anyone who questions the costs involved with any aspect of this hotel should come to London and stay at a similar hotel to see the great value offered by the Grand Floridian. Reviewers who are or were concerned by the cost of food,drink or other services provided by the hotel should stick to a camping holiday. Having stayed at many five star hotels around the world it was great to see a company like Disney live up to the standards laid down by some of the best known and respected chains of hotels. The Floridian is in a class of it's own compared to the other Disney hotels some of which we visited amd some we ate at. There will always be critics of even the best hotels but if they had a bad experience at the Grand Floridian, I would suggest it was unlucky and should not detract peolple from going there.

Reviews.Title: “I am not a Disney lover but this hotel is simply FANTASTIC !”
Reviews.Author: LondonParis&Roam
Reviews.Content: This is without doubt the best hotel I have ever stayed in to date. I was hesitant to stay at a Disney resort at first because although Disney do what they do very well, I am not a great lover of the Mickey Mouse ears and cheesey smiles, not at breakfast anyway. I need not have worried beacuse this stunning colonial looking hotel not only captures the look of a by gone era, but also a standard of service that is second to none. I sayed for five days at this hotel having booked a suite on the 4th floor. The place is so big it can be a little daunting at first but you soon settle in and the staff are very keen to ensure you get exactly what you want from your stay. The room was very clean, spacious and well appointed with LCD tvs, cd players and all the other mod-cons one expects. Breakfast was taken on the landing area on the 4th floor. These guest areas can only be accessed with a room key so you are not bothered by the crowds of photographers admiring the architecture. Complimentary food is served here throughout most of the day so if you fancy a light bite rather than a full meal this is a great and cost effective option. Dinner was taken in Citricos restaurant each night because the food was superb, the service was right on the button and I could enjoy a priviledged view of the fireworks over Magic Kingdom each night. The pool areas are well maintained and big enough to enjoy, even at busy times. It is well worth taking a boat around the lagoon, its great fun and you get some stunning views of the hotel and the surrounding area. I love this place !

Reviews.Title: “Beware the low reviews ring true”
Reviews.Author: supermom411
Reviews.Content: The hotel rooms are not thoroughly cleaned. The room fittings/furnishings are worn/show excessive age. The electronic door keys have known problems (extraordinarily inconveniencing after a day at park) - It defeats convenience of a quick return from the park to your room. No sound proofing between rooms. Only basic channel options for the television, the internet is slow, costs extra and isn't wireless. Food is standard Disney fare but at higher prices and even expensive meals have no table cloth. Finally, it seems to get higher ratings than deserved. The Gaylord Palm near Celebration could never have these issues and get its high rating. I think there were a lot of times when the desk/GF management/WDW management just didn't feel it was necessary to fix blatant problems. I strongly suggest visitors snap pictures of exactly what you find wrong and uncorrected and post them here upon return home. Unfortunately I didn't think to do that at the time, I kept thinking each thing would be the last and I should just focus on enjoying the trip as a whole. Finally, read through the recent 3 and 4 star review texts, the content is more accurate of the hotel and I don't see how people gave it 3 or 4 except maybe some categories brought the average higher than reality.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: josiegrammer
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned that this hotel was going to be a bit of a disappointment. I was completely wrong. My family and I (husband and two kids ages 4 and 6) really loved everything about this hotel and I think that although expensive, it really is very similar to staying in a high end chain like a Ritz-Carlton. We had two rooms overlooking the Magic Kingdom and they were completely spotless which I think is impressive given the number of kids that are staying in these rooms all of the time. The furnishings, bathroom, linens, etc. all great. I-pod docking stations were provided which I think is nice. And the rooms were spacious. We took the recommendations of some other people and made sure to get a second floor room as we were told there could be an issue with pigeons and that sort of mess on the balcony if you have a third story room. The only complaint I might have is that we were right by the dock for the boat that goes to the magic kingdom and I will say that it blasts this huge horn starting at something like 7AM. This of course woke my kids up every morning and they were tired b/c we were always in the parks late. Also, I would say that it is not necessarily worth the extra money for a Magic Kingdom view. There are so many places to watch the fireworks from the property and we were usually in the park for them anyway. The lobby of the hotel is gorgeous and we were there for the holidays so it was beautifully decorated. One night we put our kids in the Disney club that they have (basically just babysitting in a room - although my kids really had fun) so that my husband and I could have dinner at the upscale restaurant they have there (Victoria and Albert's I think) and it was a very special meal. Expensive, five-star kind of meal but very lovely for a special occasion. A nice grown-up break after many days of being in the parks. The pools were nice - our kids liked both pools but probably preferred the one with the slides. The main pool was really huge and had a great, huge hot tub. We rented a boat and took the kids out on the lagoon which they loved. We also saw a large group of kids going on a "pirate cruise" type of thing. Our kids did not do this but we spoke with some people who sent their kids on this and they really loved it. I think that might be another nice way for parents to get a few hours break if you feel like you need it. The boat leaves right from the hotel for a couple of hours and like I mentioned it looked like the kids who did it (maybe 20 - 30 at a time) had lots of fun. I think with young children being close to the Magic Kingdom is really invaluable - we could easily go for a few hrs. in the morning then hang at the hotel at the pool in the afternoon before going back to the park at night - we have stayed off property in Orlando before and also in Fort Wilderness and doing that just wasn't so easy. I would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “When you wish upon a star...”
Reviews.Author: Jonny99
Reviews.Content: On location alone, the Grand Floridian inside Walt Disney World is a must-stay. There is an onsite bus stop, monorail stop and boat dock which will let you get back and forth to the parks in minutes. The amenities are world-class: two large pools complete with full-bars, a true onsite gym/spa, some great restaurants and a beach of sorts. The rooms (and why you would be spending any time in them is beyond me) are spacious and the staff are solicitous and eerily well-informed. Likely the best property you’ll ever stay in.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: mochamocha
Reviews.Content: We loved it here. Ignore previous reviews. My daughter was called "Princess" by every staff member. There was PLENTY of Disney for kids here. We had dinner with Cinderella, Drizella, Anastasia, Lady Tremaine and Prince Charming. Beauty and the Beast playing in the lobby. Breakfast with Pooh and Tigger. I didn't see one kid cry with the Mad Hatter. My 3 year loved him. We walked to the Aloha Show at the Polynesian. We had a two minute monorail ride to Magic Kingdom. 10 min. to Epcot. We had a car rental, so we drove to Animal Kingdom. We had the Park Hopper so we finished each day back at Magic Kingdom. We had Deluxe Dining Plan which covered every single meal, show and character meal. If you can do it...do it. Don't complain people. It is Disney. You are paying to stay on site. The pool is great and here is the bonus to being at the Floridian. If you have small children just pop back for a swim in the pool and then head back out. You are so close to everything. No cafeteria food here. Delicious salads, fruit and might I suggest the Lobster Eggs Benendict for breakfast at the Cafe Floridian. It has a 24 hr quick service. Perfect for late night munchies. We were in the Conch building and upgraded to a large suite. Beautiful. It was the building I was hoping to get. We could watch the fireworks from the dock or our patio. To be honest every building is great and not one stares at a parking lot. ......and noooooooooooo there is no long walk to the Main building, unless 5 mins is going to knock you out. Be sure you make reservations for the character meals. We were seated immediately as I heard families being told there was nothing available. My kid loved it and the food was great. How nice that we were able to do this at our own hotel. Instead of the hour long wait in the heat to meet characters at the parks. The Floridian was wonderful. The staff is helpful and very cheery. Just what I want on my vacation. Even I felt like a child again. I can't imagine staying at any other resort there. So if you are wondering.......book it. You won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Loved 24 hour pool”
Reviews.Author: momyto2yearold
Reviews.Content: Grand Floridian Hotel We were supposed to be staying at the Port Orleans Riverside when we got a call from Disney asking us if we'd be willing to upgrade to the Grand Floridian. We accepted not really knowing what to expect. Since we were arriving rather late (11 pm) we were reluctant to let Disney's Magical Express Service because they promise the luggage THREE hours AFTER you arrive to the hotel and we knew we didn't want to be woken up at 1am by the bell boy. So instead we chose not to put the Magical Express tags on our luggage when we left home. We picked the luggage up ourselves in Orlando Airport then walked to the Magical Express counter on the other side of the airport to catch the free bus to the hotel. It worked out great. We had our luggage with us the whole time, we got a free ride (saved us $60 that we'd have to spend on the towncar/cab) and we didn't have to stay up longer then needed waiting for our luggage to arrive. For the ones that don't know what Magical Express is, here is a short summary: "Disney's Magical Express Service is an airport service that offers hassle free, complimentary transportation from the Orlando International Airport to your Resort hotel, and then back again when your stay is over, for both you and your luggage. The magical part of this service is that if you utilize the Disney's Magical Express luggage tags provided, you do not have to claim your luggage when you arrive at the Orlando International Airport. Disney's Magical Express claims your luggage on your behalf and delivers it directly to your Walt Disney World® Resort room. " Grand Floridian was beautiful. It consists of little buildings that each seem to have 3 floors. We were given concierge building and a room with a balcony. There was a free complementary breakfast downstairs in our building that consisted of muffins, bagels and fruit. There was a coffee/cappuccino machine downstairs as well. The view from the balcony was fantastic - what they call water view. The rooms were clean and spacious with two double beds and a large TV/DVD player etc. Both my husband and I commented however, that even if the room was nice it just didn't seem to be worth $500+ that they charge for it. For that kind of money we would have expected high thread count sheets, duvet covers, some kind of luxury that goes beyond just basics. There was nothing magical about the suite or the hotel. Just like most deluxes we've seen (Beach Club, Yacht Club etc) it seems to be targeting the adult population. We were traveling with a 3 year old. Although pools were very nice and the wall paper in the hotel had Mickey and Minnie on it (my daughter loved that!) there was really nothing there that would remind you that you are in a Disney resort. There were no walking characters. Even towels were plain white. By the way I have never seen so many towels circulating like in this hotel. The pool has a free towel pick up/drop off station and I've seen many parents use pool towels to dry off their kids once, then get new ones. I've seen a little train with 2 wagons full of clean towels arriving at least 3 times during our pool stay. Pools are the highlight of this hotel. There are two of them and they are beautiful and open 24 hours!!! When we arrived (in the middle of the night) people were swimming and enjoying themselves and we had to be very strong not to succumb to the temptation and go swim right away instead of putting our toddler to bed. What a wonderful perk it is to be able to swim whenever you want to, even after the parks have closed. Magic Kingdom is across the lake and the view is magnificent. However the hotel itself seemed rather isolated to me. We're used to staying close to the Boardwalk or Downtown Disney and walking around at night. If we stayed the whole time at the Grand Floridian I have a feeling we'd be rather bored. There are few stores in the hotel, but we were not interested in anything other then Disney merchandise. The upstairs toy/souvenir store is wonderful with some unique merchandise that I didn't manage to find anywhere else (hooded Minnie and Mickey towels for toddlers come to mind). We managed to get breakfast reservations at the 1900 Park Fare (review below) so we got to eat at the hotel too. It was very convenient for us even if we did have free concierge breakfast in our building. The hotel has a mock beach. What it means is that it's a beach on the little lake (in between two pools) with canopies and umbrellas but you can't swim in the lake. I suppose that's because the water isn't clean or maybe because they want to use the lake for the little boats and don't want liability for accidents.The smaller pool is still plenty large and 3 ft deep. There is a kids pool next to it that is knee deep. The nicest part of it is the large wall clock that helps you keep track of time your toddler has been in the pool :) . The sundry store sells rather cheap buckets and shovels for the little ones (94 cents!) so there is very little chance your kid won't enjoy the kid pool and the fake beach. The other pool is larger and it has more intricate design. It is more difficult finding a space/chair/bed next to it, especially in the shade since it seems more popular. There are large cabanas available for rent by the pool (I think they are $120/day) with TV and mini fridge in each. I have never seen cabanas being rented by the hotel pool before. Overall we loved the hotel (especially since we were paying the moderate resort price for it) but didn't feel it would have been worth paying full price for it. There was very little difference between the Grand Floridian and the Dolphin where we continued our stay. We actually liked the location of the Dolphin better and found their beds to be more comfortable then the Grand Floridian beds. The only thing we missed at the Dolphin was the ceiling fan that we've gotten used to at the Floridian. Also we thought that Magical Express provided a great value (well, since it was basically a free bus ride from the airport to the hotel). Also, since we do lots of character dining it would have been beneficial for us to have been able to get the dining plan which Swan and Dolphin don't offer. But overall, we're happy to call Swan/Dolphin our home in Disney. 1900 Park Fare at the Grand Floridian (Alice in the Wonderland, Mad Hatter, Winnie the Pooh and Tigger) Our breakfast reservation was for 8:20 which was pretty early for us considering we arrived at the hotel at 11 pm. But we managed to pull ourselves out of the bed and show up for breakfast. The food was great if you like breakfast foods. It was all you can eat buffet. I especially liked that they had lower stations so that the kids could see the food and pick what they want to eat by themselves. They had scrambled eggs, potatoes, bacon, sausages, Danishes, pancakes, Mickey waffles, fresh fruit, different breads, bagels, muffins and my favorite hot bread pudding with vanilla sauce (they must cater to lots of Brits). It was the only place in Disney that has scrambled eggs with cheese. And the only place that I've seen make omelets on the spot with ingredients of your choice. One corky thing was that milk and butter had to be ordered from the server. The service was great, the orange juice was flowing and the characters moved swiftly. My daughter was absolutely terrified by the Mad Hatter who screamed and acted a little too much for our taste. He stole the show but I noticed a lot of little ones crying when he walked by their table. Alice was nice and lingered for a bit talking to our daughter. Winnie the Pooh and Tigger were gone in a blink, but it was a busy morning and they had lots of tables to visit. We had a much more leisurely visit with Pooh and friends during our lunch at the Crystal Palace in Magic Kingdom. I would always recommend going to lunch versus breakfast since food is better and you manage to skip the worst Florida heat.

Reviews.Title: “My favourite hotel experience EVER”
Reviews.Author: Niamh86
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian hotel for a week over New Years Eve 07. The hotel is amazing, everything about it stunned me The room was very big, I stayed in the Bocs Chica block of the hotel with a pool view room. The room had two double beds with a flat screen tv, a seperate living room area with another tv, a big balcony and a seperate sink area from the bathroom. Just one thing, not a major thing was the car park. It was across the road from the hotel and quite dark of a night. If you did valet which was $10 a day,its much easier! The theme parks are really easily accesiable to all of the theme parks, but if you wanted to go anywhere else outside of Disney, taxi's are the only way out so I defitanly recommend car hire. There are plenty of restaurants that aren't too exspensive. The cafe was cheap enough, and had a great variety of food. Great for breakfasts. The Christmas decorations in the lobby were magnificent, the staff were all lovely and couldn do enough for me. I was just so pleased with my stay and I hope I get the chance to return.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Grand”
Reviews.Author: cokosmomma
Reviews.Content: I've been a guest at the Grand Floridian on two separate occassions within the past 4 months and both stays were wonderful. Each visit was 4 nights in length. The first was during the week prior to Thanksgiving and the holiday decorations were up, adding to the beauty of the property. My last visit was just a few weeks ago during the week leading up to the Easter holiday. My trips were adult oriented and the Grand fit the bill. When I first checked in I had problems with my in-room safe but maintenance came right away to fix it. In my room the carpet was a bit stained but overall the room was clean and well appointed. The beds are comfortable and I like the clock radios in the room (it worked perfectly with my IPOD Nano). You can't beat the convenience of transportation the Disney properties provide, and the extra magic hours is a bonus. The shuttles run frequently to the parks and Downtown Disney. The staff is great there and I only had one encounter with an attitude that was a little lackluster. (Surprising since everyone wishes you a "grand" or "magical" day!) Would definitely return to the Grand if my budget allows. Valet parking is only $10 per night (reasonable in my opinion). The self parking is across the street from the property and a small hike, so I say go for the valet if you can.

Reviews.Title: “Better than we expected!”
Reviews.Author: yoursuzanne
Reviews.Content: Having loved the Polynesian so much, I was fully prepared to be let down by the Grand Floridian. I’d been there a couple of years back for the mother/daughter tea with Princess Aurora, so I’d seen the lobby, which is in fact grand, and quite pretty. It felt a bit like an oversized Victorian bed and breakfast at the time, and I remember thinking that the hotel seemed better suited for older guests, but maybe not for our family – which is now a combined five adults and three children (8, 5, and 18 months). I am pleased to report that I couldn’t have been more wrong about the Grand Floridian. We LOVED it. Once we left the main building, I realized that it has much more of a marina/ yacht club feel than a Victorian feel. Even with the room’s heavy drapery and poster beds, it doesn’t seem stuffy or overdone. The rooms are large and bright and airy – and I love how they incorporate the Disney characters into the fabrics, carpets and wallpapers. Even the bed spread has Tinkerbelle hidden among the flowers. The patio was huge, and there was always this wonderful breeze coming off the water. The pool and slide were a blast – and may I just say that I have never seen so many lifeguards at a hotel pool. We visited the pool twice, and I actually saw lifeguards jump in twice to aid young swimmers who appeared to be struggling (not drowning). Hats off to them – they’re doing a great job and we felt very well looked after. And the food – OMG – by far, the best meals we’ve ever had at Disney were right there at our hotel. Whether soup and sandwiches or Tilapia and steamed veggies at the Grand Floridian Café, or gourmet cuisine and divine desserts at Citrico’s – we were extremely impressed with the food. I’m getting hungry thinking about it! Speaking of food – another place to try is the Yak and Yeti restaurant in Asia at the Animal Kingdom theme park. We were on a deluxe meal plan so I simply had no choice but to get dessert (ha!) and as crazy as it sounds – I had one of the best desserts of my LIFE – an extraordinary fudge brownie sundae – at the Yak and Yeti. The fried green bean appetizer was also a must try. So back to the Grand Floridian… it was wonderful. The grounds are beautiful and fragrant with flowers – and you can’t beat the convenience of the Monorail. And if you choose to stay somewhere else, at the very least indulge in lunch or dinner at one of its fine restaurants. It really is a treat!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but Pricy”
Reviews.Author: OhGreatOne
Reviews.Content: I had the opportunity to stay with my wife at the Grand Floridian as part of a convention and thus did not have to fork out $500-$700 per night to stay here. While everything is above average or just great about the hotel, the added price is the convenience that Disney offers guests to attend the theme parks. As this allows advanced entry at parks in early morning or late at night, chances are that you're not going to be at the hotel much if that's the reason for going. Think of it (or any of the theme parks) as a $250-$300 night hotel with the extra price for the convenience of not having to travel so far home at the end of the day. We were at the theme parks for two days and as each park is completely draining, having a room relatively nearby will be worth it if some kids want to go on every ride all day long, while another (or the parents) start having sore feet around 3 p.m. Also, the resort hotels offer free bus connections to and from Orlando airport. No need for rental car if you're going to limit your stay to Disney. And generally, the knowledge that if something goes wrong for you during your trip, Disney goes out of its way to correct matters. That has more to do with the price than the room you're staying in. My room was very comfortable but hardly spacious. But the beds, TV, information package, soap and every minor detail was better than expected. The food at the Grand Floridian Cafe was probably the thing we most appreciated there. We ate out in the Disney Village the night before and the food was attrocious. The food at the sitdown Cafe (on the first floor) is tremendous at a slightly lesser price. The dishes served were great recipes, was healthy, had appropriate portions and the ingredients were top of the line. Not sure if it would be the kids favourite food, but one isn't going to get better at that price in a resort. Ultimately, if you want a Disney experience with the family, I would recommend this hotel over the Polynesian or Contemporary Hotels. And the best advice I heard from a Florida resident who goes to Disney at least once a year - "Do your homework about the Disney experience before you go. If you don't know what you're doing, Mickey's little white glove will be in your wallet the entire trip". Truer words never spoken.

Reviews.Title: “3 star plus”
Reviews.Author: tupapi
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other reviews that this hotel falls short, considering the price. Arrived just before midnight, and even though it's a huge hotel with a beautiful gigantic lobby, there was nobody at the front desk. We had to get on a phone to call someone to come out. It's late at night and the rooms are pretty far away, and even though we had only carry-on bags, we did have two tired small children, we get directed to our rooms without even being offered a ride. Our bags never got to the room in the 1-3 hr. period they promised (Magic Express), but rather we had to make several phone calls before our bags arrived to our room past 9am the next day. You are pretty isolated so you're forced to depend on Disney for all your essentials, they count on that, but even though the parks close late, the stores at the hotel are usually closed by the time you return, with exception of one 24 hr basic food/arcade. The grounds and common areas are beautiful. The rooms are very nice but not quite what you would expect for the price. Rooms are sort of clean, but we even found belongings from a previous guest, so you can imagine what else could be left behind... Agree with bad choice of TV channels, pretty basic and most of it is Disney advertisement (which you are sick of after one day because is everywhere). For a hotel this expensive, you would expect pool-side dining. The main pool has a bar with drinks and basic stuff. No real food or coffee. If you want something else you have to either walk to a cafeteria on the other side of the hotel, or call "room service" and pay the hefty fee It's still a typical dysney hotel, good service, much nicer facilities, but not really 4 or 5 star treatment.

Reviews.Title: “Premier Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: Nina0329
Reviews.Content: Date: 2/26/08 Reviewer: Extremely pleased guest! Our family went to Disney World/Magic Kingdom for my daughter's 4th birthday a couple weeks ago. This was our 2nd stay at the Grand Floridian Resort. The staff went above and beyond to make my little girl's stay "magical". We returned from the Magic Kingdom on the night of her birthday to our room to find a bouquet of balloons, a signed 8x10 picture of Princess Aurora (her favorite), a beautiful platter of chocolates and cookies surrounding a white chocolate mickey mouse in the middle! When we made purchases at the hotel gift shop for her and my little boy, when they were sent up to the room, we would come in to find the toys/stuffed animals displayed for the children and ready to play! Our room was outstanding!! We were overlooking Seven Seas Lagoon and the Castle! Great to see fireworks from your own private balcony! Could go on and on! Can't wait to go back in June!!!

Reviews.Title: “Christmas at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: Mammothmtn_girl
Reviews.Content: This was my first stay at the Grand Floridian, and I booked our stay there specifically because I wanted a little christmas magic. My fiance and I came to DisneyWorld for a short get away before Christmas madness ensued our lives. We have stayed at other moderate properties at the Disney Resort, and I had felt them lacking and at the end of the day kind of a rip off. However we were only there 3 days so we opted to go for the Grand Floridian. Best choice we have ever made at Disney World! 1. We were enthralled by the towering tree in the lobby and delighted by the Giant Gingerbread house, which you can smell before you see it. 2. The staff was extremely accomodating, our luggage was lost by the airline and they offered to take us to town to get necessities, which was nice... especially that they didnt' force us to buy out of the gift shops. 3. This property has multiple places to eat, which, although some are more pricey, is more convenient than the Animal Kingdom (for example) which is so remote everyone eats meals there and you are stranded at the food court night after night because you didn't get a reservation.... Big Disney Tip... Reservations! 4. It is beautiful! 5. Yeah it is pricey, and we have spent about the same for hotels in Paris (not so nice) or Mexico (super nice)... so it really amounts to what you want out of your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed in the "Not-So-Grand" Floridian!!!”
Reviews.Author: deakoripp
Reviews.Content: Maybe it was because we had high expectations (for over $600 a night!), or maybe it was because we had heard such positive reviews, but we went to the Grand Floridian with a very optimistic attitude. From the minute we arrived things started to go wrong. Our first room was not a Magic Kingdom view, even though we had paid extra for it. The next room was barely a view, but we did not want to move again. The rooms are very modest, and the balcony was tiny. Then after all this fuss we were all thirsty, but the bar key was missing. We had to make several calls to the desk to finally get someone to come after close to an hour with a key so that we could spend some morre money on water! The room was very average...and not so clean. We found a pacifier near the bed, and gum on the bathroom floor - neither was ours (YUCK)!!! The front desk/concierge were never helpful or well-informed. We requested room service menus (again, to spend more money!) and they were never delivered. Once when we were coming home from the parks at 11pm the door to our part of the hotel was stuck. Our family, and several others, were stuck outside in the torrential rain until someone came to open it. We waited almost 30 minutes, after a long day in the parks, which we all felt was unacceptable. Breakfast was mediocre, and we never could get refills on our coffee! The shuttles took forever to come. The pools were O.K., albeit very crowded. Nothing spectacular. My husband and I have traveled extensively...both with and without children. Neither of us is particularly picky or high-maintenence Yet we both agreed that this was our worst hotel experience ever. This is unfortunate, as the Grand Floridian is very expensive! I wish I could go back in time and book a more moderate resort. Then even if there were some snafus we could more easily overlook them. I have never written a bad review/complained about a hotel before. Please head my advice and stay somewhere else!!!

Reviews.Title: “Expected More”
Reviews.Author: scaldar
Reviews.Content: Front desk was very helpful at check in. It is pretty spread out so I had a long walk to my room. Room was very clean and comfortable but for $400+ one would expect nothing less. Now for the minor complaints. First the TV station selection is very weak. I was here on business so I wanted a little more than the Disney channels. The high speed internet access in the room was pretty slow and it would not let you Virtual Private Network so I could not check my work e-mails. Also little to no wireless internet access thoughout this resort. Last the food was average but priced at above average prices. Minor stuff but nothing real exceptional. For the price I think one could do better.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: vanessamom
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel from 2/1- 2/5. I traveled with my husband and 4 year old daughter. Although I have stayed numerous times at 5 star hotels I had never spent so much on a hotel per night so I was hoping that this would be spectacular. The room was a very pretty traditional style room but was a bit small. The view at night of the fireworks was spectacular even though we were told we did not have a magic kingdom view. The grounds were our favorite. One of the pools were closed for construction but that did not matter since the other pool was really nice with a waterslide and cute bar and cabana area. Right beyond the pool was an area of sand and the lake. Really, really, pretty! You did not feel like you were in Florida, felt more like a tropical island. The lobby was a very open pretty space with an old world feel. Although we were happy with everything else the restaurants and room service menu need some fixing. The first night there we ate at citrico's with our daughter and another couple. The portions were very small and only one of us were happy with our food. When I asked for bread, oddly enough the waiters whole cheery personality changed to him almost having an attitude. We all noticed it and thought it was strange. It was also very expensive. We also ate the next evening in the grand floridian cafe and thought it had a very limited menu and was quite expensive for what it was. The grill that was open 24 hours was very convienent and had a nice variety although that was expensive also. Forget about the room service menu, the prices were ridiculous. The convience of the hotel was a huge plus it was only one stop on the monorail to magic kingdom and one boat ride stop away. Loved the boat ride back at night while the fireworks were going off. Overall I am very glad I splurged on this hotel, I am six months pregnant and felt I deserved it!

Reviews.Title: “left feeling really disappointed and ripped off”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelMiami
Reviews.Content: Having traveled to Disney about once a year for the past ten years and having always stayed at Disney properties (contemporary, animal kingdom, port orleans, boardwalk villas) I was really excited to stay at what I had always assumed was Disney's premier hotel. From the moment I walked in, I was disappointed. The lobby was lovely but did not have the Disney wow factor that my kids love (nothing Disney, childfriendly going on). The atmosphere was boring and dull with the band playing only sporatically and the bars dead. The room was not in the main hotel and was quite a walk away. Average hampton inn style room with pleasant view. The pool was under construction. The kid camp was depressing and not well staffed. The game room and cafeteria were small, dingy and actually the worse I have ever seen on a disney property. The breakfast in the buffet was cafeteria quality in both atmosphere and food and in the main restaurant a total rip off and again very institutional tasting. What was most shocking was how poorly trained the staff was. I had an important dinner booked at Animal Kindgom Lodge. I called concierge TWICE to confirm how to get there and I was told NOT to take monorail to Magic Kingdom then bus to Animal Kingdom Lodge a I thought but to take monorail to transportaion center. When I got to transportaiton center I was told no busses to the lodge only to the resort. ugh. I had to get back on monorail and go all around again. The mistake cost me forty minutes and I missed my meal. Also, DESPITE PAYING ALMOST 400 A NIGHT NO CABLE OR MOVIE CHANNELS. When I called to complain, they told me, and this is a quote, Disney wants you out enjoying disney amenities NOT watching tv. When I explained that it was 10:00 at night, I just drove for five hours, and I had two infant children, they didn't know how to respond. Apparently, the lack of a cable package is a common complaint because at my business meeting the next day I heard others venting similar frustration. (NOTE to Disney, if you are going to bill this as an adult friendly, business orientated hotel, you need to have cable) Finally, I think it is outrageious to spend 400 a night and not be able to book a dinner reservation in your hotel at any time for any night of your stay! The spa: outrageous prices, mediocre services In sum, not inspiring, not luxury, not fun for the kids, showing its age, a big disappointment. Not a good hotel for adults either because you can't even relax after a big meeting and watch a movie if you so desire.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sussilago
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights this january abd just loved this hotel. We were upgraded to concierge.level( first time in my life I have had an upgrade) Lovely breakfast just outside the room,afternoon tea ,late afternoon snacks and evening desserts with brandy Beautiful lobby with live-music,enormous room-best ever. Very nice staff.I could go on for ever and ever.We have travelled a lot around the world and this was one of the best hotels.We stayed previously in The Biltmore in Miami,but this hotel was so much better.Recommended also for the location. We loved the Grand Floridian and would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience”
Reviews.Author: CFTF
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our four-night stay at the Grand Floridian. The hotel is beautiful and extremely convenient for visiting the Disney parks. It was great to be able to hop on the monorail, bus, or motor launch to quickly get to any of the parks. That made it a lot easier to take mid-day breaks from the exhausting theme park routine. (FYI, the parks are insanely crowded on weekends, even in "low season.") I must say that a big part of our satisfaction is rooted in the fact that the hotel upgraded us to Concierge accommodations (Sugar Loaf building) as part of the "Year of a MIllion Dreams" promotion. The wonderful breakfast buffet saved us lots of time (and money) so that we could head out to the parks quickly. My husband and I were totally spoiled by the lovely assortment of liqueurs and desserts every evening! Our kids loved the beach and the pool. Every single staff member was extremely gracious and very helpful. Our room was lovely, spacious, and luxuriously appointed.

Reviews.Title: “Hated it - Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravelertn
Reviews.Content: We've been to Disneyworld a lot. Stayed at the Animal Kingdom and loved it. We also have stayed at Carribean Beach and Port Orleans. We really were looking forward to our stay here. First of all we reserved and put down deposit for a king bed with theme park view. We got to our room and it had double beds. Also, the view, if you craned your head exactly right, you could see a small sliver of Magic Kingdom's Castle. The "grand" lobby was under construction the whole time and had a picture of a Christmas Tree blocking the entrance. We were told this is exactly how the lobby looked around Christmas time. Gee, thanks for telling us that we wouldn't get the full experience once we reserved our room! Also, when it rains the grounds flood so bring your rain gear. This is not even a 3 star resort when the lobby is fixed. Save your money and stay at one of the other hotels. VERY UPSETTING!

Reviews.Title: “Decent Rooms, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: UTAustin
Reviews.Content: While Disney labels this hotel as their flagship, it's not a top-tier hotel. While the common ares are impressive, the rooms are average. However, if you're traveling to the Magic Kingdom, this is a solid - if relatively pricey - choice. After staying there for a few nights I realized that most folks who were there wanted to stay at the top Disney hotel but were still vacationing on a budget. Disney is, smartly, able to meet the demand for "deluxe" accommodations while still on a family budget by providing fairly nice common areas with fairly common private areas. The rooms in the Grand Floridian are slightly above average. They are on par with a slightly better than average Hilton, Sheraton, etc. My room had a flat panel television, comfortable beds, and a decent bathroom. The furnishings were a bit dated. Naturally this is a family hotel with extremely high occupancy. As such, don't be surprised if there is a crying baby next door or young children running down the hall. Moreover, if you're a light sleeper, expect to hear them. The walls aren't that thick. The bathroom is stocked with Disney style "resort" toiletries. There are plenty of towels and they are of acceptable quality. The maids do an excellent job. There's a nightly turn-down of the bed. Most of the rooms in the hotel aren't in the "main" hotel. At first I thought we were getting the short end of the stick being sent to a separate building. However, it turned out we were right on the water with a perfect view of the nightly fireworks, the Cinderella Castle at the Magic Kingdom, and the other resorts. If you need internet access, it's available via ethernet. They provide a cable in the closet, but I didn't see any signs of wifi. The access cost a nominal amount and was very reliable. The hotel is serviced by the Disney World Monorail. The Magic Kingdom is one stop away. Epcot takes a bit longer. Buses will take you to the rest of the attractions. Also, during warm weather the onsite attractions at the hotel are excellent. They have two great pools, a marina, reservable cabanas, a beach, etc. That aspect of the hotel is very well done. Eating at the hotel is a bit rough. Unlike most hotels, just about everyone staying at the hotel wants to eat there (or at some other Disney facility). ...and everyone wants to eat at the same time. As such, if you want anything other than quick-serve burgers / chicken strips type meals you need to make a reservation well in advance of your visit. The food is generally good, but nothing incredible. We took the youngsters with us to the character dinner in the hotel. They enjoyed it; but don't expect a glamorous event. It's like a zoo-like cafeteria atmosphere with characters stopping by your table. Finally, if you stay at this hotel don't get bamboozled into buying a Disney Dinning Plan unless you're a family of big eaters. The plan is complicated, cumbersome, and generally didn't seem to be a good deal. My back of the envelope calculations showed that we'd be better of just paying for what we ate.

Reviews.Title: “Girls New Years-No Children”
Reviews.Author: katiekaw
Reviews.Content: My friend and I decided to spend New Years at the GF and see how the parks were during the holidays. Here are the pros and cons of our trip: PROS: -Check-In-Because we were driving up from Naples (approx. 3 hours) we wanted to arrive early to get as much time at the Magic Kingdom. The GF allowed us to check in as early as 7AM and provided a secured placed for our luggage until the room was ready. Upon check in we were informed that we were being upgraded to a conciege level room. The conciege level rooms (levels 3 and 4 in the main building) allow you to have food, drinks, wine and champagne from 7AM to 10PM. Also, you have two full time private conciege desks to tend to your every need. If you can afford conciege level, I highly recommend it. -After we left for the Magic Kingdom (the next stop from the GF off the monorail) we recieved a phone call at 11:30 that our room was ready. -Our room was beautiful, newly renovated. Flat screen tv's, private bath seperate from marble topped double sinks, whamsetta bedding on two queen (not full) sized beds, private balcony, refridg., large ironing board, robes, dvd player, IPOD docking station, H2O plus spa products and couch. -The hotel had a private New Years Eve party with a live band and dance floor in the grand hall. At 12:00 they covered the room in balloons and gave out champagne (conciege guest had all liquor free). -The hotel sits between the Magic Kingdom and Epcot so you can watch both fire works at night like you are actually at the parks. It is much more comfortable then being in the croweded park. -The spa services were fabulous. Just add about $25 onto your normal spa services at home. Example: A $110 message would be about $135 at GF. CONS: PRICE: I called in September to make reservations for New Years. I was told that I would have to pay holiday rates for a standard room which was $700.00 a night for a $385.00 room during the regular season. I could not believe the difference in price. SERVICE: All the lower level employees were wonderful (valet, bellhops, maids and servers. The people I was most dissapointed with were the conciege and management level employees. Like many reviews before mine I found that they had a bit of a chip on their shoulders. I bit of an attitude was displayed. When I complained they just said, "well, it is the holidays"..........WTF? TRANSPORTATION: The GF does not have any private transportation. You must take either the monorail or disney bus to other resorts which can pose a problem. We wanted to go to Downtown Disney and it took 30 minutes to get there and 50 minutes to get back. I was so disgusted by this and if you are someone who does not like public transportation, get your rental or car out of valet and drive to other places. NOISE: If you are a sleeper make sure you ask for a more private room. Even though the best rooms are in the main building they can be the noisiest. You can hear all the activites from the main floor in your room and the maid even comes at 8:30. Just make sure you ask for a private hallway room if you are going to stay in the main building. I hope this review and our pictures help you make your choice of Disney hotels. I highly recommend the GF hotel to anyone, with children or not.

Reviews.Title: “Travel in style to Disney World at The Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: CharlesC
Reviews.Content: Just got back from 4 days in Disney World. Decided to leave the hotel we were at to have a more traditional 'Disney' experience and the Grand Floridian provided the experience. We travelled with 3 young children under 6 and they loved the experience in the hotel. It was very child friendly which was a surprise considering it to be one of the better places to stay WDW. Upon arrival you head through a security gate where they issue you with a parking pass. We decided to valet ($10 per day) or you can self park but the walk is across the street from the main hotel. The valet parking and luggage service is very efficient and we were taken care of instantly. Walking into the hotel you are presented with a grand high ceiling that is several floors up surrounded by open balconies. As it was Christmas they had a live band playing every night and the most enormous Christmas tree imaginable. The systems at the hotel are highly automated so if there is a glitch with your reservation be prepared to spend some time as they try to fix it. In my case, my two children were listed as adults so we could not get our Theme Park tickets added to them. A minor issue, however, I had to spend 15 minutes waiting for them to fix it which in the end they could not do so. I offered to just buy the Theme Park tickets separately but in their attempt to provide an awesome experience they spend too much time fixing a minor issue. The staff and very attentive and focused on service and everyone ends their sentence with 'Have a magical day'. In the beginning I kind of liked this, however, after one experience where we tried to order a movie from the TV in our room and were told by the guest services person that they do not have any premium channels in the room followed by the 'Have a magical day' - it started to ring a little hollow. However, this is Disney World and I am prepared to suspend natural cynicism. The room although pricey ($579 per night), was an average size but with 2 queens, a flat screen TV, double sinks in the bathroom and very nicely appointed. The beds had duvets and were comfortable if a little on the soft side. Our room was a 'garden view' which is an entry level option but it had a balcony with a very nice view overlooking the courtyard. The hotel has two great swimming pools that were nice and warm and at least one of them is open 24 hours * 7 Days a week which our kids were really happy about. The monorail is very convenient to get you to the park and our kids loved the journey. One of the nice things staying at a Disney Resort is that anything you purchase in the park gets charged to the room. Nice and convenient. I rated the experience as 'Above Average' rather than Excellent due to the 'automated' service (described above) but also for things like we wanted to know when the kids club operated, rather than provide a simple answer they spend 60 seconds looking for an extension where an automated voice provided the answer. The hotel uses technology well but I think it takes away from some personal service that it sometimes nice to get. The robotic nature of the highly programmed staff is sometimes annoying as they do not deviate from the standard even when things are going wrong. Overall this hotel provided the exact experience we were looking for and we really enjoyed ourselves. If the price does not put you off then we recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Magical Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: GAT#1
Reviews.Content: First, I am shocked that this Disney's Grand Floridian Resort is so far down on the list of hotels - DEFINATELY above the Disney Polysian Resort. This is an exceptional hotel. My family stayed on this property Dec 21-24, 2007. As soon as the Disney Magical Express bus turns into the driveway, my breath escaped into an awe. The driveway was lined with real pointesettas and greenery for the holidays. The beautiful driveway, then entrance was only outdone when I saw the most tasteful victorian holiday decor in the Lobby. WOW! The Christmas tree was great and the lifesized gingerbread house was fantastic! The large stairway to the second floor had garland draped with ornaments and flowers. Simply gorgous! All the grounds had lighted deer and various plants that were beautifully maintained. Fresh flower arrangements were throughout the property. Everything was a very nice site. Our room (9139) was nicely decorated (with those hidden Mickey's throughout!) and set up just like the room at Disney's Polynesian. The Grand Floridian has much nicer and newer decor. The best feature was that the toilet and shower were in it's own room - not just in the bathroom. More people can get ready for the day with this setup. Dual sinks and a huge mirror are available for others. Surprisingly, even a clothes hamper was supplied - a nice touch! Disney does offer nice soaps, conditioners and lotions, but I really like the smell of the soap at the Grand Floridian. The kids enjoyed the i-pod docking station/radio. The turndown service with the little chocolates can't be forgotten, either. Every Cast Member we passed greeted us or talked to us. Everyone truely made our family welcomed. My 12 year old daughter has a dream of having a fairytale wedding at the GF in the wedding chapel. This hotel is on the monorail line and you can connect with another monorail or bus, if needed with no hassle. This is easy transportation and well worth the time and aggrevation saved. I highly recommend this resort for a special stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian is definitely Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Mindengal
Reviews.Content: Although the hotel had no record of my room when I arrived to check in (my sister had proof that the reservation had been made; her room was available), the hotel found a place for me and moved me into a better room the next night for the remainder of my stay. My visit otherwise was flawless: the accommodations very very nice, the staff exceptional. The only meal we ate at the hotel was the breakfast provided each day in the lobby of our building. Great selection of food. Being able to get our boarding passes and check our luggage at the resort before heading for the airport was a definite plus since we traveled at a very busy time (just before Thanksgiving). Those Disney folks think of everything!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Birthday Present”
Reviews.Author: sarah_8765
Reviews.Content: We checked in on December 14, and checked out on December 17. My birthday was the 15th, and this was my birthday present from my husband. The hotel was beautiful. We stayed in Building 9, which was Big Pine Key. Our room was very nice, it had 2 queen beds. When my husband checked in they asked if we were celebrating something and he told them that it was my birthday. So on the 15th, when we came back from the parks, there was a plate with candies and cookies and a 10" tall white chocolate Mickey MOuse, along with a personalized card from Minnie. I felt that this was quite nice. We ordered room service, it was very nice, although it was over $50 for a salad, a fruit plate, a cheeseburger and 3 canned cokes. The monorail was very convenient, although it was crowded at times. The beds were wonderful. However, the walls were quite thin, I was not feeling well, so we stayed in the room all day, and we could hear people talking in the hallway. We had a lagoon view, we could see the Polynesian, but there was a tree directly in front of our balcony, if it had been summer, I doubt we could have seen anything, but all the leaves had fallen off the tree so we could see the hotel and the water parade, however if was hard to get pictures as the branches were in the way. Housekeeping was wonderful, as was the turndown service at night. I would have expected free internet service, but there was a fee. Overall I really enjoyed the experience, but I do not think it was worth 435 dollars a night.

Reviews.Title: “Returning to an old favourite”
Reviews.Author: IanUK72
Reviews.Content: Returning to Disney once more since our inaugural visit in 1997, we once again stayed in our Disney 'Home', the Grand Floridian, this our 6th stay, and quite frankly could not consider staying anywhere else when visiting Florida. The familiar excitement of the long driveway leading to the large Victorian styled buildings and unique coloured roof, on in to the expansive lobby, the familiar smell as you enter the doors, eyes turning to the huge Christmas tree, central stage, lit and decorated perfectly, surrounded by comfy chairs and sofa's that we have lounged in for many an hour (and dozed!) whilst listen ing to the piano man or jazz band, watching the world go by. Anyway, check in was fine with minimal wait. We had booked a standard room, but was pleased to be advised we had been upgraded to MK view. I asked for a room without an interconnecting door, which seem to be of a premium in this property. She disappeared and came back with a smile advising she had found one, which was great. Our luggage would follow as were picked up by the Magical Express, so knowing the way we made our way ourselves to our lodge building. Yes, the rooms are small (in saying that, last time we came here we were upgraded again to a magnificently large corner room, just outside Narcoossees, with 2 balconies and a lake/MK view), but well appointed and very comfortable beds. We had a new flat Plasma TV, writing desk and new cabinet/bureau. The bathrooms haven't been updated, with a double sink, an OK size, with a small-ish bath/shower and toilet. Nice dressing gowns hung up on the back of the doors for our use. The balcony was fine for all the use it got, although could do with a lick of paint. The lake was our main view, just able to see Space Mountain and parts of other rides, but not the castle. A bit noisy at night, but hey, this is Disney!! Despite being here before there are still things we have not tried, and Citrico's was one of them. I have to say it was one of the best meals of the holiday and one of the best in the overall Florida area. We were not rushed, we had a very pleasant server, the food was of high standard for all courses and we had a lovely view of the fireworks at 10pm. from over the lake. Nice atmospheric restaurant, quite busy, but we felt feeling very satisfied with our overall experience. Well worth the $175 price for a tasty and flavoursome dining experience, which included a cocktail and wine. We also had tea in the Garden Tea rooms. A feast of sandwiches, trifle, fresh cream scones and home made jam tarts, washed down by sparkling wine and a strawberry and of course loads of tea, with once more great unobtrusive service. The pool was popular, well kept and looked lovely by night, well lit and well used. Gardens immaculate, intermingled by reindeer that lit up at night. The flowers in the main building were just amazing, smelling fresh and changed every other day. Of course location is great, one stop from MK and a boat ride away on the return, although one day there were a few complaints on the return journey as some problem or other meant the boats were every half an hour or so, meaning long queues and no gurantee of a seat. We took the monorail back! Casparillos Grill was great if you wanted a snack, hot or cold, with seating inside or out, overlooking the lake and fireworks at night.
