Suiting all tastes, there was something for everyone, and whilst not our first choice of dining, this is great and serves a purpose of a quick coffee for breakfast with a pastry or a hurried lunch on the way to a park - open 24 hours a day. People complain about the stuffiness, poor attitude of staff, uncleanliness, noise etc. We never encounter any of this. We understand this is a busy international hotel in one of the worlds most popular tourist destinations - things do go wrong and people have bad days; kids scream, things get overlooked - remember where you are! We, as always, found the atmosphere relaxed, everything well maintained, all the service we received was of high standard, room was what we were used to, food just great, grounds welcoming right down to the same old man who has been welcoming us and wishing us a Grand Day for the last 10 years, still at the door!! The hotel overall is of a high standard, full of Disney Magic, set in an authentic Victorian era with modern day service and amenities. Great location, all the food in all the restaurants is of a good standard, some very high. We had a brilliant (I cannot say relaxing - we walked twice round the world it seemed!!) time and cannot wait to return once more to our Disney Home, in a couple of years!!

Reviews.Title: “Expensive but another good experience”
Reviews.Author: KESinNJ
Reviews.Content: We just returned, staying at the Grand Floridian from 12/1 - 12/9. You will be paying a premium over non Disney hotels offsite, but if you have younger kids being on-site really is special. We have now stayed at the Contemporary, Yacht Club and Grand Floridian and several off-site hotels (Grand Cypress Villas, Gaylord Palms, and the Marriott World Center). For all around value, the Cypress Grand Villas are the best. You basically have 2-3 bedroom villas on a golf course 5 minutes from Disney. They have been recently renovated and versus Disney deluxe hotels are 40% less and much more comfortable. The Grand Floridian was OK, but even my kids (12 & 9) are starting to see way too many changes in how guests are handled. First two weeks of December are supposed to be slow, this was not the case this time. They are always looking for ways to make money, we went to Very Merry Christmas parade twice and basically for 8 days for basic tickets and the two nights for the parades we paid over $1,500 just for tickets. When I totaled up the trip you find yourself spending over $10,000 for a family of four. I could go on a number of vacations for half that amount and stay in equal or better accommodations. You need to experience inside the park with your family and it is worth it one time. I think we are at the point where we just don't see the reason to pay almost twice what you would pay outside Disney since they really don't do anything special except provide the atmosphere. Disney Restaurant Food is getting more and more plain and just so overpriced. I don't want to single out the restaurants, but we ate at many of them and the food was just not anywhere near as good as outside the park and always cost more. The best deal we found with great food at very fair prices was Earl Sandwich in Downtown Disney. All of us loved the breakfast and found ourselves looking forward to each morning knowing the dinners at Disney were sub-par at best even though we paid $100-$200 each night for dinner. We ate at seven Disney restaurants this time and I have to say none of them were good - average food at inflated prices. I am not down on Disney, we will go back since the kids love the environment, but we are at a point if we stay inside it would only be at the Grand Floridian, but likely we will be staying outside the park since they just charge way too much for accommodations that are just OK. Last point to mention is we are fortunate to have the economics, but I have always been taught not to waste money. I don't mind paying a premium for premium food quality, but paying a premium and getting average food quality is just not smart. Disney should really change the approach on food. If you stay on property try to get the meal plan, we overpaid and people told us at least with the meal plan you control the amount you overpay. The staff really do try to help, you can just see the changes over the years from the Disney Magic to now it is really treated as business first and you see that at every turn.

Reviews.Title: “Liked But Didn't Love!”
Reviews.Author: Cori1124
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a 5 night stay at the Grand Floridian hours ago. This was my 7th visit in 3 years & after only staying in Value & Moderate Disney hotels in the past, I was looking forward to not just a deluxe Disney hotel...but THE ULTIMATE DELUXE DISNEY HOTEL. Unfortunately, i was a little disappointed. We started off on the wrong foot...we paid $551 a night for the "Theme Park View" and was given a room with a huge tree in our line of sight. We called the front desk immediately & managed to get our room changed. I was & still am furious that after paying such an astronomical amount per night for a view of the Magic Kingdom, the Grand Floridian tried to pass off a room that clearly did not have one. Regardless, the new room had an AWESOME view & we are so grateful to Nancy at the front desk for all her efforts to rectify the situation. Anyway...you know the old saying "be careful what you wish for." Despite reading complaints of noisy train whistles & ferry horns from others who had a Magic Kingdom view, we assumed they were being too critical. We learned first hand how noisy it can be. From the howling of the wolves at the Haunted Mansion to the sound checks at 6:30am in Magic Kingdom along with the ferry horns & train whistles, our room wasn't exactly peaceful. I will say that the view of the fireworks from our balcony ROCKED though a lot of guests weren't recognizing the new non-smoking policies & were smoking on theirs. Personally, it didn't bother me but I can certainly see how it could bother others. Regardless, the staff went above & beyond to recognize my birthday (no thanks to my mother) & even if it wasn't, I believe that the staff would treat you just as special. I found the monorail to be tedious considering we were the last stop when coming back from Magic Kingdom as well as for the buses to Animal Kingdom & MGM. Going to Magic Kingdom was quite easy though I wish I could say the same for the other parks. The lobby was beautiful, however, you're constantly dodging people who aren't even guests who are taking a peak at the hotel or have reservations at one of the restaurants. We had a pet cockroach whom we affectionately named Walter who would sometimes hold us hostage in our room while he hung out on our balcony. In addition, one of the sconsets that hangs over our bed literally fell out of the wall & narrowly missed my 7 year olds head....but, despite it all, it's still my favorite hotel & will probably go back.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable but not luxurious”
Reviews.Author: NG_2007
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 4 days over thanksgiving break in 2007. We had two toddlers (15 month old twins) with us and this was our first visit to Disneyworld. The cons : (1) The room was in building 7 and not the main building which is featured on the website. When we booked we were not told that there were multiple buildings, so we were a little disappointed when we found ourselves trudging to the end of the property and away from the spectacular main building. (2) Our room faced a small pond and the monorail - not what you would expect for the cost. (3) The room itself was just too small. We had a tough time fitting in the two cribs and two suitcases and had to end up putting one crib in the dressing room adjoining the bathroom and the other in the corridor near the entrance. The bathroom was tiny and basic. (3) The decor was quite unattractive and old looking -unmatching wallpaper, drapes, upholstery and a rough carpet - again not what I expected for these prices. (4) Housekeeping never refilled tissue paper, soaps, lotions, and tea bags. (5) Room service food was ridiculously overpriced and pretty bad. We ordered the fish of the day ($26) and the crab cake appetizer ($10). The dish consisted of a 3 inch long piece of salmon and 3-4 pieces of asparagus. And that's it. No rice, or any other accompaniment in a $26 dollar dish. They did give bread with the meal - which was cold, hard and inedible. The food choices were pretty limited too. (6) The bus ride to Animal Kingdom took about 45 mins including the wait and the multiple stops. So if you want to go to the other parks that are not on the monorail I would recommend staying near those as all the bus rides were hellishly long. Now for the pros: (1) The cafe had a good breakfast - i.e. not hideously expensive eggs etc. (2) You could buy wine and beer from this cafe and it was affordable. (3) You could watch the fireworks over the castle from the hotel. (4) The hotel lobby in the main building is spectacular (5) The balconies on the second floor overlooking the beach are a great hang-out spot. (6) Taking the ferry to the magic kingdom is quick and easy.

Reviews.Title: “My favorite hotel of all?”
Reviews.Author: SLOmom
Reviews.Content: Disney's Grand Floridian makes you feel a part of the magic throughout your stay. We had a view of the lagoon, the castle, and heard the park wake up and go to sleep each day. We have stayed four times and I feel like it's home when we go. A very nice home indeed!

Reviews.Title: “Oh, Mickey, Your So Fine !!!!”
Reviews.Author: jwsmd3
Reviews.Content: Glad that my conference rate made this a relative bargain. The Hotel itself is marvelous. There is nightly turndown and they do change the sheets daily. 9 washcloths, 7 hand towels and 5 bath towels standard, 3 pillows per Queen bed. Two sinks. Nice high def LCD TV. iHome radio clock you can connect your iPod to. My only quibbles.....if you list high speed internet service as an amenity along with the iron and in room safe that are included....then don't charge the 9.95 a day. Call it an extra! And the (it is very) high speed internet Ethernet connection is different from the WiFi (also 9.95 a day). I must say when I had trouble connecting the telephone assistance was superb. Housekeeping works really hard so it's forgivable that during this peak week my room wasn't ready until nearly 4 PM. Bring stuff to go to the pool and change in a bathroom or the spa (free lockers). I know it's Disney but the outdoor hot tub is frequently filled with little kids......the spa's hot tub and steam room were great to escape from the little ones. Massage was very good but full price for a guys pedicure seemed a bit excessive and it took about 1/2 hour. The conference amenities (including breakfast and snack and an afternoon reception) were superb. Victoria and Albert's rest was top notch and a nicer, more relaxed pace than all the other high end Disney restaurants where food and service were excellent but so efficient a three course meal never took more than an hour. And, be aware, reservations at the better restaurants need to be made way ahead!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: plucker001
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights at this hotel for a conference right after Halloween. We had a wonderful experience. We received great service. I needed my baby's comforter laundered-I called housekeeping at 7 am and someone showed up at my door 5 minutes later to collect the comforter! The room was very clean and the bed was quite comfortable. Whenever we plan to visit Disney again, I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Abqaiqtravelguy
Reviews.Content: Myself, wife and 19 month old baby pent 7 days at this hotel over Halloween 2007. Stayed in Sugar Loaf Key building which is a Concierge building. We took full advantage of the Concierge service before arrival. I must say I was very impressed with Denny our concierge. He took care of all of our requests, booked our restaurants for us, our Mickey’s not so scary Halloween party etc etc…. With each question or request I sent via email Denny would call to confirm everything and answer all of my questions. At the property the staff was fantastic, all questions were answered directions provided etc…. Food on Concierge lever was outstanding, limited but very tasty selections with drinks included as well! Area was very busy in the morning and evenings and it was difficult at times to find seats. It appears form overhearing conversations that a few “guests” were not actually guests. A family had checked grandma in to the concierge level of the GF and they stayed elsewhere but came over in the morning and evenings for the free food and drinks. I counted about 8 people using the facility who were not staying there but associated with “grandma” staff should have kicked them out! Pools at GF were great as were the restaurants and bars. We had a fantastic time. The room was newly renovated and housekeeping was top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: summerlover30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just came back from Disney World and we really enjoyed our stay at the Grand Floridian. The grounds are beautiful and the rooms are cozy and elegant (nice combo). The lobby really puts the word "grand" in Grand Floridian. A nice touch was an orchestra that played nightly. The staff was helpful and friendly. The pools were big and clean, and the waterslide was a blast! The Magic Kingdom is within view from "magic Kingdom view" rooms and the beach...these are great spots to see the nightly fireworks and water pageant. Our last night we went to the restaurant "Victoria and Alberts" in the hotel. It is a formal six course meal that was worth every penny. Delicious food, outstanding service, and romantic ambience was what made Victoria and Alberts an excellent dining experience. There was only a few negatives....their was only one hot tub which can get pretty crowded. The hot tub also needs a bit of a makeover with its old chipped tile. The rooms are very nice but I would suggest not getting a dormer (or attic) room. We were on the 4th floor in Boca Chica and we had a dormer room. The room has vaulted ceilings and is a bit smaller than regular rooms but the main complaint was the balcony was very small. If you plan to enjoy your balcony, do not have a dormer room. We didn't request another room because it was not that much of a problem...but in the future if we return to Grand Floridian (and I would), I will request not having the dormer room. We had a Magic Kingdom view room but we really only could see Space Mountain and a few buildings near that. Cinderella's Castle was blocked by palm trees and a building. So be leery of the Magic Kingdom view....you may only see a sliver of it. All in all, my husband and I really enjoyed our stay and I would recomend this resort to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “5 Star hotel with 3 Star Service”
Reviews.Author: Scoobydave
Reviews.Content: We were lucky enough to stay at the Grand Floridian and our room had a spectacular view of the Seven Seas Lagoon and the Magic Kingdom. Though rather pricey, the hotel was wonderfully elegant, with an amazing lobby complete with a live jazz band playing some vintage favorites from yesteryear. We even took the time to have dinner at the famous Victoria and Albert’s; the meal and service was exemplary. Though the hotel was luxurious, the housekeeping staff was very average. One morning, we accidently left the do-not-disturb sign on the door when we left for the day. When we got back, we noticed our mistake and called housekeeping to let them know. In typical Disney fashion, housekeeping said they would be happy to come up to clean the room at the time of the regular turn-down service. With our problem seemingly solved, we left for the evening. When we got back at 10:00PM, the room wasn’t cleaned. We called housekeeping a second time just to get towels, housekeeping said, “Don’t leave the sign on the door next time.” Now, I recognize it was our own stupidity to leave the sign on the door, and I might expect that response from a less expensive resort, but I certainly don’t expect that level of service from the flagship of the Disney Resorts. You’d expect some type of apology and something special the next day (like a towel sculpted in the shape of Mickey Mouse or something and few extra chocolates). The front desk and concierge were very efficient. They were able to make and change our dinner reservations right at the hotel and provided us with several time saving tips for our stay in the parks. The monorail made transportation to the Magic Kingdom and EPCOT incredibly easy. The bus transportation was about as efficient as it could be, but expect the trip to the other theme parks to take at least an hour. Disney’s Magical Express service to and from the airport was a real time saver. However, when you arrive at the airport, pick up your baggage yourself and carry it to the Welcome Center. There have been plenty of horror stories about lost luggage on arrival and you don’t want anything to ruin your trip. You’ll have to wait for the bus service to your hotel anyway, so it’s best to keep your bags with you. When we arrived at the hotel, we gave our bags to the bellman thinking they’d be delivered in a few minutes. When we called bell services there was no answer and we had to call the front desk. It took them an hour to bring our bags up with no explanation for the delay. If you can, keep your bags with you. On our departure day, we were able to check our bags in and get a boarding pass right at the hotel! This gave us an extra day to enjoy the parks and we had no problem with our luggage. The hotel and grounds are lovely. Aside from the uneven service, it’s definitely worth the stay!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect In Every Way!”
Reviews.Author: glasgow1231
Reviews.Content: I cannot understand why people under-rate this hotel on price and quality because like everything in life, you get what you pay for. Let's be clear, this is a first-class hotel in an excellent location and provides exceptional service. If you are considering a vacation at Disney you should book this hotel. I could go on and on about this hotel and how it exceeded our expectations but I would only be reiterating other reviewers. Here are some of our top tips. -Book restaurants (Citricos and Narcoosse) in advance to ensure a table (as non-residents take up a lot of tables) -Pre-arrange transportation from the airport to the hotel -Book & Pay Hotel in dollars if you live outside the USA -Always use Fastpass at the most popular attractions in Disney We had a magical time and if we went back, we would not stay at any other hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Thank gosh the Contemporary was overbooked!”
Reviews.Author: tacjam
Reviews.Content: We stayed here Sept 27 - Oct 7 and were very suprised. Having stayed at the other deluxe properties and always thought that this property would be too frilly and too victorian. To our suprise not at all. As you can see we found ourselves here by the Contemporary overbooking. But being Disney they had everything done and even better to make sure that your "magic" was not ruined. Not only were we upgraded to the Grand, but were given concierge service and a Magic Kingdom view. Service was exceptional all requests granted and everyone went above and beyond. Common areas vey nice, room always spotless, dinning very good and just an overall wonderful experience. If you have a daughter,a great place for your little "princess" to stay and feel like royalty. Keep in mind it is still disney and not a four seasons. Lastly, can not say one bad thing!

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded all expectations”
Reviews.Author: parentof2
Reviews.Content: Our family of four were fortunate to stay at the Grand Floridian from Sept 22 - Sept 27th. It was amazing! I had read so many reviews where people had made numerous requests etc and were disappointed that they were not honoured. I had only requested 2 queen beds, nothing else. I figure you get what you get and there is no sense stressing about it. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that we had been upgraded to concierge level as part of the year of a million dreams promotion. WOW. Disney really knows how to make a good first impression. We were in the Sugarloaf Key building, on the second level. The room was beautiful and we had a view of where the boats dock. We never heard other guests or any noise from outside. The continental breakfast that was complimentary each morning was delicious and saved us so much time. The expresso machine was wonderful as well. I was able to have my double shot latte with my fruit and pastries while getting ready to go. We didn't get a chance to try the lunch or afternoon tea offerings as we were never at the hotel during the day. The evening pastries and apperitifs were a very nice way to end the day. The hotel is clean, well appointed and the decor is stunning. Those big vases of flowers in the lobby are actually real. The staff were great. Our room was so nice each evening, no matter how messy we left it in the morning. The beds were comfortable and the bathroom spacious enough for the four of us. The monorail and boat service were both exceptionally convenient. In fact I may be spoiled for ever staying at a resort that does not have these. The one drawback to the whole experience was the bus service. The two times we had to take a bus (Animal Kingdom and Downtown Disney), the wait was 30 - 45 minutes. We were very late for our dinner reservations in Downtown, but luckily were seated within 10 minutes. I am already trying to figure out how I could afford to go back and actually book the concierge service up front. It really made our first Disney visit a vacation to remember.

Reviews.Title: “My 3rd stay!!”
Reviews.Author: sazy86
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot understand why there are so many bad reviews on this hotel. All the complaints about all the money grabbing, and commercialisation, its Disney World!! What do you expect?? And you should always check things such as refurbishing / building work before going anywhere. Firstly let me say after arriving at the hotel (after a long journey from West Yorkshire!) you're greeted with the most pleasant, attentive staff. On your walk in there's a great old chap, dressed up to welcome you or wish you a nice day - nice touch. The reception staff are the same. Each time we have requested a lagoon view room and have been granted one. Even the concierge desk cannot do enough for you, ringing you back promptly and checking you have booked to see everything you want to, from shows to dining in one of the parks. MAKE USE OF THIS SERVICE!!! If you leave it until going to the parks and try to get into a great restaurant at lunch - you'll more than likely have to wait. The rooms are good. Ok, they're a decent size. Admittedly there's nothing extra special or unique to give it the 5* class feel, but the beds...... they are without a doubt the most comfortable beds i have ever slept in. Everytme i stay here i have the best night's sleep of my entire life. I normally wake 3-4 times a night - here i sleep soundly. Maybe its due to the fact the staff come in and turn down the beds for you, dim the lights, leave chocolates on your pillow with a sweet dreams message. Also a good balcony. I found the room service great. Quick, the longest i waited i think was 35mins. And the best food......the infamous cobb salad, steaks....its amazing. And the table is all laid with tablecloth for you. Nice touch. I must also say i've dined in Victoria and Alberts restaurant 3 times now. And wow. It must be the equivalent of our 3 michelin star rating. I cannot begin to describe this place. The food, service, even down to the lighting, the rose they give to the ladies, and the personalised menus. It truly is an unforgettable experience. (although i'd recommend leaving the children in the musketeers club!) We had a 6 year old with us and the dinner usually lasts just short of 3 hours - a long time for a child to sit. Yes its expensive - but you get what you pay for - you must make this part of your holiday. The grand floridian cafe is also good - for breakfast or lunch. Or there's a quick grab and go place for those wanting to get out and about. I must say narcooses, the seafood restaurant is also out of this world.....as are their pina coladas!! Great seafood, fresh and with beautiful settings - try to book at night when the fireworks come on, there's an outside balcony you can go watch from - superb. Citricos is also a nice, less formal restaurant. The pool areas are fantastic, with the lifeguard for the children. And the great hot tub/jacuzzi. Must say though - one slight problem here. You pay a lot of money to stay in this fabulous hotel, and it's extremely irritating to be sat in the hot tub, with a group of loud, drinking men, boasting about the fact they've snuck in and using the facilities for free. Annoying. And intimidating. There should be more checks on things like that. All in all i must say its an unforgettable experience. Granted, the rooms and some decor is not all 5* luxury (although refurbishment is happening right now). I am returning at the new year when the refurbishment has finished so will possibly be changing this comment. Oh, and the afternoon tea - amazing. As is the spa. Oh there's so many things i've missed that are great; monorails, hairdressers, character breakfast, boats to hire on the lagoon.....i could go on. Don't be put off with the reviews - me and my family think it is amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Disney's best!”
Reviews.Author: cliff1788
Reviews.Content: Jst returned from a 5 night stay at Grand Floridian. this is the second time we have stayed there. We have also stayed at Yacht and beach Club & Swan and Dolphin. First off..this hotel deserves all of its designations and accolades. The hotel itself is beautiful inside and out. The staff is friendly and knowledgable. I was concerned that some things may have slipped by reading previous reviews...but here is my take. The Grand Floridian is celebrating 20 years next year so they are upgrading. There is some construction going on but nothing that bothered my family. The rooms were well appointed and decently sized. We had 2 adults and 3 kids and were very comfortable in the room. I think all rooms are very well located and convenient to one thing or another. For example...if you are really close to the mono rail you may be a little farther away from the pool. The entire resort is beautiful and clean. By next year all of the rooms will be upgraded. We stayed in a non-refurbished (older) room and found it to be of excellent quality. It was promptly and professionally cleaned each day. The GF is very kid friendly. the only thing that would not be considered kid friendly is Victoria and Albert's. The pools, lobby, gift shops, etc are all geared towards families. Overall, you get exactly what you pay for. This hotel is crisp in ambiance and amenities. GF is finely tuned for families who have a greater appreciation for nicer things. If you are spending your last dime to go to Disney you should not spend it on the GF. You will get the same "Disney experience" at other resorts for less cost. However, if you are accustomed to nicer things you will very happy at the GF.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay”
Reviews.Author: RunRunAway
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 5 days at the Grand Floridian. I cannot fault it - the service was fantastic. The hotel was spotless and the facilities were great. I was concerned that as it was at the top end of the scale it would not be as child freindly as some of the other Disney resort hotels. I needn't have worried; other than the signature restaurant (Victoria and Albert), which is formal dress and I would say more suited to adults, everything else is child friendly. We have stayed in many of the Disney resort hotels and all of them are good, but with the GF it is the most expensive, but you do get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: “rooms under constrution”
Reviews.Author: vfloto
Reviews.Content: We planned a Disney Magical vacation, you see 10 months earlier I was diagnosed with Leukemia; luckily I am in remission so we planned a blow out good time in Disney… It started off fine arrived on a Saturday afternoon took the magical express all is good we check in get the room and there is a letter on the desk stating that our wing would have minor construction while we where there. Sunday am all is fine. Monday awakened by people out side blocking hallways painting ECT. Not a problem except the construction guys leering at my daughters when they went out to the pool (very creepy). Tuesday at 8:00am my whole room awakened by construction noises hammer drills actually vibrating the floor. We go to the desk and complain and DISNEY says oh we will get you another room in another wing. FINE... about 11am another room is available for us. Maid service comes by and says you are supposed to be checked out we need to service this room NOW. we explain we are moving to anther room because of the construction and the head of the maid service says well there was a letter in your room telling you there would be construction and you should have expected this. Luckily my wife closed the door before I could tell this person exactly what I thought. Bell man comes by helps with the bags and we get an older room not quite as nice but still good we are not happy we have wasted over 3 hours by this time my children are crying because of everything that has gone on this morning. It was to be a Grand Disney experience. It was not over all the hotel is great but I feel Disney should not ask for premium prices and stick you in the middle of a leering construction zone it just goes to show Disney wants your money and they wouldn’t have changed our room if we did not complain. Disney is all about the money there is no Wishes or Dreams they ruined mine and my families

Reviews.Title: “Big let down”
Reviews.Author: awscal
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the GF for 10 nights in July. We were extremely disappointed int the level of service we got. We were expecting lagoon view and we were given a Pine tree view room. After much debate and changing our rooms they finally got it right. We also had a very unclean room. We had mold in our shower which I cleaned myself after looking at it for 2 days. We had handprints on the mirror in the main room. Handprints on the TV set. We had an extremely dirty sliding glass door that didn't operate correctly. The list goes on. This was our 3rd trip to Disney in the past 5 years. We have stayed at POLY, AK and WL. We loved all 3 hotels. We were very excited about staying at the GF. What a let down! The MGT and the staff didn't seem to really care. You would think for the amount of money we spent they would have been a little more responsive to our concerns. Even after I went and complained about how unclean our room they still didn't respond. We were told they were going to do a VIP cleaning. All they did was change the ripped shower curtain and make some towell animals. The hand prints were all still there as we checked out after our 10 day stay. To add further insult I sent an e-mail to the hotel upon our return and they have yet to respond to it. Don't stay at the GF. Stay at the WL. The best value on the resort. Great hotel not nearly as expensive as the GF

Reviews.Title: “Pros and Cons”
Reviews.Author: blueeyes71883
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for 6 days. It was a great experience. The pros: It was our anniversary so we got an upgrade to a lagoon view and champagne.Staff is more than helpful and will go out of there way to help you with anything. Restaurants are great, shops are great, salon and spa are great. Monarail service to MK and Epcot is a real time savor. 2 pools, one for kids and one for kids and adults...that pool is amazing...nice and big. The Cons: The bus service was awful. one bus every 20 minutes. So you could be waiting out there for at least 40 minutes for the bus u want if it does not come right away. We stayed at the all star resorts in previous years and the bus service there was excellent. Staff drive around in service carts and go very fast so just watch your children. Rooms are not worth $375 night or the $475 a night rooms we were upgraded to. Overall the experience was great, but i think the moderate resorts are just as nice.

Reviews.Title: “A decent stay at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: Biatty
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at the Grand Floridian from Aug 25 to Aug 30(5 nights). After staying at the Wilderness Lodge on 5 previous visits(All were fantastic visits), my family and I decided to try a new hotel at Disney and opted to go to the Grand Floridian. At check-in at the hotel, I made several requests to the clerk....A room in a quiet location...not near an elevator, not near an ice machine, not near a housekeeping closet, no connecting door to another room, etc. I emphasized to the clerk that my family and I were light sleepers and would really need a quiet location. Well, none of my requests were granted. The room was located in the back of the Sago Cay building. It was right by the monorail which was a short distance from the room, there was a connecting door, the room was in an open area of the building where all noise could be heard. We were assured by the baggage person and another employee that this would be a quiet room. Well, this was not the case. Much noise could be heard from the hallway, the family in the next room was screaming for about 20 minutes at 12:30AM(Could hear the entire conversation through the connecting door), At 3:30-4:00 AM we were awakened by the "beeping" noises of trucks going down a road. Turned out to be we were right by the main entrance/exit for trucks and other vehicles to enter and exit the property. Also, the A/C was not working properly after one feeble attempt to repair it in the late evening. The next morning, I angrily went down to the front desk to tell them of our problems and requested an immediate room change. The room change was granted but we had to go back to our room immediately, repack our belongings and wait for our luggage to be transferred to storage for the day. This was a major inconvenience. When we returned from the park at 3:00 PM that afternoon, we were advised that our room was still not ready. At this point, I finally encountered an employee that had some common sense and was helpful. Dana(Manager) deserves special credit. She immediately found us a new room in the Conch Key building which was a fantastic room. She also had some nice extras sent to us for our youngest daughter's B-Day(plate of chocolate, a large white chocolate Mickey, cookies) and our anniversary(small bottle of sparkling wine). Beautiful hotel. 2 nice pools, one of which had a nice waterslide for the kids. Easy access to get to the Magic Kingdom and Epcot by monorail. The bus service to MGM was horrible. The Grand Floridian shares bus service with the Polynesian and Contemporary Hotels. Had to wait a minimum of 25-30 minutes for the bus and had to stand on the bus also. Waaaaay too crowded. On one occasion, after 25 minutes the bus arrived and was too crowded to board. Had to wait an additional 25 minutes that time. Why in the world do 3 of the most expensive hotels at Walt Disney share bus service? Eating at the Grand Floridian is certainly not cheap. The only somewhat affordable option is Gasparilla's which is open 24 hours and has counter service. The other restaurants are extremely pricey.....Grand Floridian Cafe only has character breakfasts and character dinners, Victoria and Albert's has a prix fixe menu for $165 per person, Citrico's and Narcoosee's entrees average about $30 per entree. Overall, we loved our new room(nice size, newly renovated and in a nice quiet location, the pools were great, the health club(no charge for guests) was large and immaculate, the service was mediocre at best, very pricey restaurants at the resort, easy access by monorail to the MK and Epcot, poor bus service to MGM which really needs to be improved considering the price of a room at the Grand Floridian. Also, a word to the wise.....do not go a park when there are extra magic hours(nightime) in that particular park. Absolutely horrible and unmanageable crowds!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian Hotel - holiday of a lifetime”
Reviews.Author: Shonefamily
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Grand Floridian from checking in to checking out. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff. The rooms were beautiful and the food was excellent. We will defininately be staying there again. Shone family, UK

Reviews.Title: “A Magical Experience”
Reviews.Author: reaganskyesdad
Reviews.Content: Disney Cast Members end their calls with "Have a magical day!" I can honestly say that all the staff members I came in contact with believe in this philosophy. I have never experienced a group of individuals more committed to ensuring that their guests are cared for and their special requests taken care of than the folks at the Grand Floridian. We were upgraded to Concierge Level and this experience (8 nights) more than exceeded my high expectations. From the security officer at the gated entrance announcing our arrival to the front; whereupon, we were greeted by our own personal escort (Richard) who took us upstairs to the private registration desk to our housekeeper, everyone went out of their way to tend to our every need and pamper us. Joe Hardy, Concierge, is a master at his profession and at making guests feel at ease. This gentleman knows how to take the stress out of complications that can arise when one is away from home. I can't begin to thank him (and the other concierge staff as well) for the attentive service and arrangements he made for my family when a difficult situation arose. Even in our room assignment, the staff made sure this was a memorable experience and honored my room request. There is nothing like waking up in morning and looking out your french door to see a picturesque view of the Marina, Seven Seas Lagoon and right inthe middle of all of it, Cinderella Castle...breathtaking is the only word to describe it. We also dined at Victoria and Albert's and the 6 courses and the service live up to a 5 diamon/5 star rating. The personalized menu's and the birthday gift you depart with (obviously, it must be your birthday!) make the evening one you won't soon forget. The memories of the experience will last a lifetime. I am known to be "somewhat difficult" when it comes to service as service is a part of my profession. This team at the Grand Floridian passed every hurdle presented to them with flying colors. We did 5 tours in the theme parks during our trip and not only does the service level at GF rise to the occassion but all the Cast Members I came in personal contact with throughout the tours came close to the service I received at Grand Floridian. It is obvious that the Resort and the Cast Members know what the "basics" are and how to truly make dreams come true.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice property.”
Reviews.Author: ferdia35
Reviews.Content: This is one of 3 properties on the monorail service to the Magic Kingdom, which for our young family, greatly enhances a trip to Disney. We have also stayed in Contemporary resort - and for us, this is a better option, although a bit more expensive. Views from room were nice (onto Magic Kingdom) for the kids, and front office managed to change our room to a higher room to escape mosquitoes - however the very strong smell of smoke in the second room was a little overwhelming. Staff, despite Mickey Mouse waves etc, seemed a little over worked (one elderly lady in 24 hour restaurant/shop told us that she'd put in a 14 hour day) - that - coupled with the awful/warm/net uniforms on the porters could explain repressed road rage while driving carts between buildings. There had been a very large conference at the start of our stay which included many young recruits for one of the larger financial/accountancy firms - so between work - the pool took on a sort of frat party feel - with large cases of beer and lots of non- Disney language - not really suitable for the kids. (Access to our room/buiding was through this pool.) We noticed that the pool could do with a few extra umbrellas, but the policy of not booking sun chairs is a good one - and well enforced - however the policy of keeping deck chairs in neat rows seemed a little unnecessary? Room service was fine - between 30 minutes to an hour for delivery. Concierge expertise was mostly limited to Disney products, although we came across a really helpful guy (can't remember his name) who went to great lengths to book a restaurant. If the kids get us to return to Disney World again - I would probably book here again - it is very convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel In Great Location”
Reviews.Author: sdbyrd
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent 4 nights at Disney's Grand Floridian. The hotel was very clean and just about what you'd expect for a hotel in this class. Room service was on top of their game, and would often show up on multiple occasions during the day. The only complaint we had was more on the fault of Disney's Magical Express service (gets your bags from the airport & to your room when you arrive), but other than that, very nice stay. They have a 24 hour "restaurant" located on the premises where you can get drinks, pizza, sandwiches, etc. any time of the day. This was helpful on more than one occasion. It also had at least 2 different pools with nice lounge areas. Location is about as good as it gets, having the monorail right outside your room! A bit pricey, but location is everything.

Reviews.Title: “Beware if You Have Requests”
Reviews.Author: cindyOcala_fl
Reviews.Content: Hotel is lovely to the eye........but beware if you have any special requests, as room preference, bed size, view, etc. You can forget about it!!!!!!!!! No favors here period!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: vastel2000
Reviews.Content: First time staying at a Disney hotel, and it was wonderful. First of all, we were upgraded which was awesome. The distance to the Magic Kingdom could not be better, first stop on the monorail. The rooms were clean and comfortable for our family of 4. The pool outside our building was on the hot side, which was not refreshing at all, considering the heat wave that we had while visiting. We did not have to wait long for buses to go to animal kingdom and mgm. One of the trains on the monorail did break down and it caused a huge back up going to the MK. Had to wait a good 45 minutes for them to fix the problem. Also agree with the post about parking being so far away. It is not convenient, especially if you forgot something in your car and have to walk back and for a few times. Other than that we really liked our stay here and want to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect”
Reviews.Author: calypso1
Reviews.Content: Checked in to the GF for a 3 night stay at the end of our Orlando vacation, it was our second stay at the property and it was just as magical as the first time. My traveling party consisted of myself, 18 year old daughter, and 6 year old son, and our marina/ garden view room on the fifth floor was spacious enough for the three of us with two queen beds and double sink setup outside the bath. Nightly turndown service every evening was a treat to return to after a long day in the parks. Beds turned down with chocolates on the pillow, lamps dimly lit, and Disney music playing softly on the TV. The baths were cleaned twice daily, towels exchanged too. The room alwys smelled so fresh and clean, I don't know what they use but it was great. We ate breakfast at the Gasparilla Grill each day, not inexpensive but large portions and good quality. Didn't try any of the resort dinner options but there were 2 good choices. We were lucky enough to be squeezed in to the character dinner at Chef Mickey's over in the Contemporary thanks to the wonderful hostess Dulce from Mexico. We were treated like royalty with special placemats and a beautiful Mickey Mouse cupcake and candles because it was our last night at the resort. What fun and a complete surprise! I would definitely reccommend the GF for its location on the monorail, spectacular setting, beautiful pools, and wonderful customer service. Next time I will allow a few days just to stay and enjoy the resort amenities.

Reviews.Title: “Had our wedding reception here, very lovely”
Reviews.Author: FITCollegeBabe
Reviews.Content: Introduction: Before I begin, let me clarify that this is not my first stay at Disney. My review is of my most recent stay at the 5-star resort called Grand Floridian. We booked 4 nights here at the end of June for our Wedding/Reception. The wedding and reception are beyond the scale of 10, but my review of Grand Floridian is based on what I've experienced during my last few days as a Ms. and a day as a Mrs. _____ Overview: We stayed here (almost the whole wedding party) because this was where my reception was going to be located (at the Grand Ballroom). We were married at the Wedding Pavilion and were upgraded on our wedding night to the Honeymoon suite room. This review is not just based off the hotel itself, but the management and staff. _____ Pros: As many have mentioned already, this is a 5-star resort that is filled with shops and restaurants. If you want the complete "Disney magical experience" then this place will not disappoint. The children will love it and the parents will love the convenience of the monorail and proximity to Magic Kingdom. - This is by far the cleanest hotel I've ever been to. The hotel has several buildings filled with hotel rooms and every time we entered one it always smelled fresh and clean - The front desk was superb. They surely do treat you excellent here. The lady who handled all our room reservations (10 rooms) took the time to make sure everything was accommodated for us for my big day. - Everywhere we went, people were congratulating us. All of the bellmen, wait staff, front desk and maids would all tell us congratulations and best wishes. They did it with a smile too. Not many hotels have people that actually 'smile' at their customers. - Excellent bell service. They took care of our tons upon tons of luggage and packages for the wedding and everything was up at the room less than a minute after we got to our rooms. - The rooms were spacious and well-organized. We easily fit all my bridesmaids, our stylists, my mom and my grandmother and people coming in and out during the morning of my wedding with no problem. - We had an excellent view of the castle from our balcony. Fireworks were right there and we were able to see the magical lights parade on the water (I think they do this every night, they did it every night we were there, but I don't remember seeing it at the Contemporary Resort) - Beds were very comfortable. The only complaint is that I couldn't get people off my bed! :) - The perfect location for those wishing to visit Magic Kingdom. You just board the monorail and you are at MK. Very convenient. _____ Cons: Here's the part I warned you about. Keep in mind that this was supposed to be for our "perfect day." This is a 5-star resort and therefore they should have adhered to their "5-star" status. - If you don't valet park, you have to park across the street. It's a good 7-8 minute walk back to the hotel, and then you have to travel to your specific building, which for us took another 4 minutes. When you have to go back and forth several times it does get irritating. - The bathroom was average (our honeymoon suite bathroom was an exception, it was great)...for a 5-star, I was expecting something better than an ordinary tub. This didn't fit the theme of the Grand Floridian at all. - You can actually hear people in the next room. We heard our relatives laughing out loud at something they were watching and we were nearly shocked. The walls aren't paper-thin, but be prepared to hear people who either talk loudly or laugh out loud. - I've read other reviews on here about their food. I'm sorry, but for the amount of food you get, the prices are NOT worth it. A meal with 2 entrees and 2 drinks at dinner cost us over $120 after tip. And I was still hungry! It doesn't take a whole lot to fill me up, but even I was disgusted at the tiny portions of food. To top it off, the server didn't even acknowledge that we were getting married/just married at all. We were actually shocked as both times we had dinner at the resort they didn't seem to care when everyone else had been extraordinarily friendly about it. - Post wedding day we were at Animal Kingdom to come back to our room to find one of our wedding presents broken on the floor. No one was in our room (as we were the only two with the keys) except maid service. Apparently, she knocked over our wedding gift (which was a ceramic eagle statue that holds salt/pepper glass shakers, all were broken) off the table as she was changing the bed sheet. Was there a note? Nope. Did she bother to pick up the pieces off the floor, as they laid there shattered? Nope. Nothing whatsoever. I called down to the front desk and they connected me to management. Management asks what happened and I told her. First she didn't sound convinced, like I was lying. Then she asked how much it was worth. How was I supposed to know that? It was a wedding present, something that was given to us. She offered a $20 credit to our stay. That's all. No apology, no argument, nothing. I told her I didn't agree but she said there was nothing else they could do. As if that weren't enough, we were due at the airport the next morning to catch our flight from OIA to Hawaii for our honeymoon vacation. They lost our reservations for traveling on their shuttle. No shuttle for us. We juggled around, talked to the front desk, called their hotline, everything. Our reservations (and we even gave them the reservation number) were no where to be found. And since they were booked they couldn't offer us a ride on their shuttle that we were supposed to be on in the first place. And here's the third and the cake topper incident. My aunt was staying next door to us and already had her 5 nights paid. Reservation was set months ago (back in January) and she paid then because Disney requires it upfront. As she was checking out, they demanded that she pay for that fifth night. She showed them the paper with the reservation that said it was all paid for and they printed out a paper from the computer saying that she only paid for 4 nights. After an hour of talking with management and trying to figure out what went wrong, my aunt and uncle were so furious that they had the reservation all set and showed that it was paid for while management was accusing them of fraud. Even after my aunt and uncle returned back home, they continued to harass them by leaving messages on their phone about how they need to pay for that fifth night. My aunt was crying to my mom (who is a cast member for Disney) and they even threatened my mom's job over this matter! As of this day today (remember I was married at the end of June) the issue is still unresolved and still being worked on. A major inconvenience for me and my wedding guests. _____ Recommend? Yes and no. I recommend for those that want the Disney experience and want to be close to Magic Kingdom. There are a TON of kids running around so if you don't like kids or don't want to hear screaming everywhere then this is certainly not the place for you. I don't recommend the regular rooms at all for any romantic getaways or honeymooners. If you are here for that matter, then get a honeymoon suite. It is very expensive ($950) but if you are going to stay at Grand Floridian go all out on the extra services and amenities you get for booking in one of their prestige rooms. I am utterly and completely disappointed in the management of the hotel. The cast members and staff were great, but if you have an issue with the higher-ups, prepare for a lot of trouble. I've read earlier reviews here as well that this seems to be a norm for management at this resort. It was such a mess and disgust to deal with. Who needs the extra stress on what is supposed to be their best day ever? If it weren't for the fantastic wedding and reception I had, I would be tearing apart Disney for almost ruining my experience with my aunt/uncle and inconveniencing the bride and groom on some matters. Sorry this review is so long. I wanted to share my personal experience here so you have an idea. Of course, there are going to be those people that say oh! This is the best resort ever. It is a very nice one...but the management needs a serious reality check in how to treat their guests. My aunt and uncle are never staying at Disney again, and they travel a lot with their kids. If you have something go wrong during your stay, prepare for a serious feud that will not get resolved to your liking. Management doesn't care...they pull in enough money that losing a few guests doesn't inconvenience them.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: brandaniell
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with Hubby and 2 young children, ages 3 and 6 in July, after encountering problems at the Polynesian. Check in was quick and easy, everybody was wonderful. Room was great and clean, and nightly turndown service was welcomed. Pools were not crowded, and kids loved the slide. Food was good on site and transportation options were awesome. We will definitly be return to the Grand Floridian. They are in the process of updating their rooms, so that will be nice...

Reviews.Title: “THIS IS HEAVEN”
Reviews.Author: secondchancetotravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week the last week of July and was suprised to see that it was not really crowded. We were given one of the new renovated rooms and it was indeed lovely. Enough room for 5 easily. I even streched out on the couch/daybed and it was long enough for an adult. I can't say enough about this resort as even the painters were friendly and wished us a great day. Loved the pool as it has a deep end( a little over 6 ft.). Only wish there were a little more variety at the food court. No matter where you walk around here inside the main building, your own building, or outside there is this beautiful smell of flowers. Not overpowering. Like the fact that the wash basins are outside of the toilet area so it helps get everyone ready. LOVED IT!!!!!! Would go back in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience”
Reviews.Author: sweetgirlSt_Louis
Reviews.Content: Our family of four has just returned from our second visit to the Grand Floridian. If you are visiting DisneyWorld and can afford the price tag, there is no place better to call home for a week or so. The service is excellent - and spoils you for any other experience. Last year we had a suite and coincerge level accomodations which we didn't think was worth the extra bucks. This year we opted for one room and a Magic Kingdom view. Same building but on the other side. It was wonderful in the morning to overlook the lagoon and in the evening if we were in our room to see the fireworks while sitting on our balconey. The large pool is certainly sufficient for the number of guests in the hotel and is never really full. The kids pool is wonderful even for adults who enjoy the slide and the "beach." The 24 hour take out and snack restaurant is a lifesaver for something quick and easy. We have not eaten at the Victoria and Albert but every other dining experience in the hotel was exceptional. Because we have been to DisneyWorld previously, we spent more time at the hotel than last year. Even if you don't leave the grounds you will enjoy being at a first class resort (albeit with lots and lots of kids) with all the of the amenities one would expect from a five star hotel. A nice feature for families is that each lodge is equipped with a laundry room. When I couldn't get the soap dispensor to spit out the little box, I went to the coincerge who immediately had complimentary boxes of detergent and bleach sent to our room. While our family will most likely not return to DW for a couple of years,when we do, it will certainly be at the Grand Floridian

Reviews.Title: “Money well spent”
Reviews.Author: dph317
Reviews.Content: I traveled on this trip with a total of 5 adults and two children under the age of 2. We had requested ajoining rooms with a view of the magic kingdom. We were advised this would be fine not a problem. I also inquired well in advance on several occasions to ensure I would have a refrigerator in my room. Nonetheless neither of these requests were honored. My only complaint surrounds the customer service level of a supposed five star top of the line disney hotel. Upon check-in, a monday morning we arrived to find a conceirge working the check in desk and were not given what we originally were confirmed to have. Moving forward, the hotel itself is great in terms of proxemity to the Magic Kingdom the first stop by monorail. The rooms are large and well stocked with everything you would expect a hotel to have and more. Robes, turn down stop service, mini-bar fridge, though not quite the refrigerator I was told,(we were storing milk for kids & bottles), daily newspaper, twin sinks and a balcony overlooking the Magic Kingdom where we were able to sit and watch the nightly fireworks from. Overall we were pleased with the hotel and look forward to staying again in the future. Well worth the price, even as high as it was.

Reviews.Title: “Glorious!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dawg-7
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights in July, in Sugar Loaf building and it was bliss!!!!! On arrival we were greeted by a valet to park the car, someone for our luggage and a third person to greet and show us around the hotel, now that's service! Once taken to the buiding we were taken through every detail required whilst the concierge took care of all reservations we needed. The concierge service also meant we had food throughout the day in the lobby which changed every couple of hours as did the drinks including wine, champagne and soft drinks (all included in the price). The pools were excellent with the main pool open 24hrs and the kids pool with waterslide open until 10pm. For convenience to the Magic Kingdom it cannot be beaten, and all staff were friendly and really made our stay memorable. We have travelled extensively and I can honestly say I have never enjoyed a stay anywhere as I did here. Absolute bliss!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Magic!”
Reviews.Author: norwegiandude
Reviews.Content: Where should I start? I mean, this is a 5 star hotel and it's Disney?!? Lovely buidling and area with pool, beach, dining etc. It's very clean and tidy. The staff are wounderful and it was all so beautyful. Expecially the evenings where you can sit out and watch the fireworks that surrounds Cinderellas tower. I do wish that it was breakfast in the price and that you did'nt have to eat food with the "fast food feeling". They sure got a good restaurant there, but it's kinda exspensive and you won't drop inside with kids and in your sunbath outfit. But the place sure fits what Disney says: "Where dreams comes true". Because that's what I can say about this place - it's like a dream.

Reviews.Title: “Scabbies Alert!!!”
Reviews.Author: r106915
Reviews.Content: Long story short, we stayed on mothers day weekend for a family wedding and the second day contracted scabies. Our doctor agreed to this as well and prescribe appropriate medication for two weeks. Filed a claim with the resort and was denied. Also, after complaining with the BBB, we were told it was due most likely to our physical sexual acts which probably caused the outbreak on us. That was from the management office at disney.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely great, loved our visit”
Reviews.Author: scotty0910
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 9 nights from 21st June with our 2 year old son. The Hotel is fabulous with an impressive entrance and excellent staff. We arrived at the Hotel, tired and jetlagged but our spirits were soon lifted by the excellent staff and service and the first view of our room which although didn't have one of the more expensive 'Magic Kingdom' views overlooked the pool and was lovely. The staff were continually friendly and the maids did an excellent job of cleaning the room with a turn-down service in the evenings. In the mornings you can also see the maids doing a little parade through the gardens before they start work! The Hotel is across the lake from the Magic Kingdom and provides an excellent view of the Wishes fireworks from the jetty, or beach (or if you are lucky enough to have a view from your balcony!). There is also the monorail which is one stop away from the Magic Kingdom and is excellent with a little one. We dined at the cafe and at the grill with the food being very good and a variety for all. I would recommend this hotel to anyone and can't wait to visit it again one day.

Reviews.Title: “Disney's best”
Reviews.Author: OhioRon
Reviews.Content: This is a truly beautiful hotel. The lobby is bright and cheery and often has live entertainment (small orchestra or piano). Everything at this resort is first class, including the two swimming pools and the restaurants. I have stayed in all the Disney resorts but two (Animal Kingdom Lodge, Contemporary Resort) and this is certainly the fanciest, and the most expensive. This was my second stay at the Grand Floridian. I was originally booked into the Animal Kingdom Lodge, but Disney moved me to GF because of some construction going on at AK Lodge. I wasn't disappointed. The rooms here are larger than at the other properties, the bedding more plush, the towels large and fluffy. One great thing about staying at GF (or at the Polynesian Resort) is that there is an (unannounced) parade on the lagoon each evening just after dark. If your room faces the water, you can see it from there. Lighted floats head by the resort with brightly lit images. This time, the images were first from Little Mermaid, and then there were a variety of patriotic images and songs. Very nice! Getting to Magic Kingdom is very convenient from here (or from Polynesian or Contemporary) because the monorail takes you right there. Epcot has a direct bus or a monorail connection. There are direct buses to the other theme parks. There are two pools. I used the larger one, and it was much larger than needed for the number of people. There were also a kids pool and the largest whirlpool I've seen at a resort. After a long day in the parks, the swimming and the whirlpool were just what the doctor ordered! On a previous visit, I dined at Victoria and Alberts, the very expensive and very nice gourmet restaurant. This time we ate at the Cafe, which was still fairly expensive but very good. The service was impeccable. I got a special deal beause they transerred me from Animal Kingdom. I would have paid much more if I had booked there directly. Frankly, for me, other resorts are better from a value perspective. The Wilderness Lodge, Beach Club, Yacht Club, Boardwalk are just about as nice and much less expensive. Of course, the theme parks are the main reason to come to Disney. From that persective, the value resorts (All Star or Pop Century) are just fine. They offer transportation options that are just as good as the very expensive Grand Floridian, except that the cheaper places don't have the monorail to the Magic Kingdom. Overall, though, my favorite Disney resort is Port Orleans French Quarter. It's the smallest resort in the park and very charming. However, if you really want to splurge, Grand Floridian is very, very nice. You won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mgoodwin1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful place to stay. Family of 5 (including one handicapped using a wheelchair.) The staff were very friendly and helpful. THe hotel was immaculate and clean. The pools were great and service couldn't have been better. We had 2 queen beds and a day bed for the youngest. The tram and shuttle buses were easy to access (even with a wheelchair). The food was good (pricey). We were extremely pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Poor Service!”
Reviews.Author: mom23kids
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel the week of May 27-June 3. The rooms were well appointed, the grounds are lovely as are most of the people. The restaurants were also very nice. We chose this resort because of its location and what we thought would be good service (isn't that what makes a 4 star hotel?) First let me state that many of the cast members here were great, but overall there are some serious problems. There has recently been problems at the monorail resorts with theft near the pools (this was confirmed by a number of cast members at the resort, although management refuses to acknowledge this fact). When we had our camera stolen the management refused to comment, refused to help with anything other than filling out a "lost item report." We had another one overnighted to us and the desk assured us they would call as soon as it arrived. They did not. When we phoned the desk to see if it had come we were told it had not. We then called the delivery service only to find out that our package had been signed for by the hotel. When we phoned the hotel again they said that they would locate the package. This was a very stressful and time consuming event. I would think that a resort of this caliber would have had much better customer service. We had also booked a Disney Cruise and checked in with the cruise desk. The person there assured us that all would be taken care of. When we arrived in the terminal we found that nothing had been taken care of and had to wait in line to check in. When we said that we thought we had checked in at the hotel the cast member there asked which hotel. When we told her she was not at all surprised and commented that the GF was not one of her favorite hotels...implying that this was not an uncommon occurrence.

Reviews.Title: “We keep coming back for more...”
Reviews.Author: eas09ixo
Reviews.Content: We go to DisneyWorld every two years and are constantly more and more impressed with the indeed Grand service of this Resort. -The first of many things I must praise is the location. You could not have better accessibility to the parks. Only a short ( 5 minutes max) ride to Magic Kingdom and about 10-15 minute ride back via monorail, my favorite way of Disney transportation. You are connected with the Contemporary Resort, where I strongly advise you go for breakfast at Chef Mickey's, along with the Polynesian and the Transportation and Ticket Center (where you can transfer to a monorail that takes you to Epcot). I am spoiled and am not a fan of the buses, but you can take one to Animal Kingdom, MGM studios, the Disney water-parks, downtown disney and other Disney properties, including the Boardwalk (taxis are always magically waiting for your convenience, as well). -The ambience of the entire hotel is indefinately the most magical. The lobby is magnificant and always spotless, with it's memorable shops (including a woman's boutique, barber shop, huge Disney store, smaller Disney shop and i believe a salon for women). The hotel is huge and the grounds are beautifully, and wonderfully well kept. There is, along with the main building, a number of other buildings on the grounds. My family personally enjoys Boca Chica with views of the beautiful yet simple garden pool, and it's great poolside bar, in the midst of the property. There is a great sand-beach on the lagoon (overlooking the Polynesian) next to the beach pool, and it's poolside bar. The beach pool is accompanied with an awesome slide for kids also. -Dining amenities are unbelievable! We spend most outside-of-the-park-meals during our stay at the Gasparilla. A huge, 24-hour fast-food place that you have to see to believe. It maintains the beauty and cleanliness of the resort while being fast and serving up anything--and i really mean everything. Gasparilla is great for all meals and snacks. You can even sit outside on the deck overlooking the theme-parks for a great fireworks view! We love Narcooses on the lagoon, as well. We have enjoyed Citrico's in the past, along with most of their endless dining possibilities! -Service is phenomenal. Everywhere you go the employees are so family-friendly and welcoming! I am only a teenager but I do believe it is worth the money to stay at this resort. Completes my Disney experience and I would find it unbearably hard to stay anywhere else. I have 4-year old and 10-year old brothers and they are picky, but they love it here. WOULD NOT PASS UP!

Reviews.Title: “How could they lose the Magic?”
Reviews.Author: Qazxer
Reviews.Content: We first stayed at the Grand Floridian in 2002 and again in 2003, after being away for so long, we were looking forward to our 3rd stay in April 2007. We were again staying in the Royal Palm Club, and as before, we were contacted by their pre-planning office to assist with our plans. Unlike our other stays, when we worked with one person, we knew her days off and her hours of work. This time we ended up speaking with 5 diffrent people, and it would take days to get a call returned. Then my wife remembered how well we were taken care of on our last two visits by the desk concierges. We tried to call the Royal Palm Club direct, and after much debate from the hotel operator, who told us they did not take "outside calls", we were finely put through. What a relief to have Dan answer the phone, and to find out that Mejay was still there too. It just made our day! If you need anything, these are the one's to depend on. Other cast members assured us requests would be taken care of, to find out the next day, nothing had been done. Mejay and Dan always took up the slack. In general, the hotel is not as friendly as it was before. Lots of newbies, who have no idea what the Disney service method is. If you've been there before, you will notice the changes as soon as you arrive at the Security Gate. The day we arrived, the guard looked like a bum ! Hat not straight, collar not tight and his belt was rolling down the outside of the pants, and yes, we did see underwear. A young lady in the booth was expecting us, and after confirming our name, instructed us to the front of the hotel where we would be met by our concierge. Upon arrival, our valet did not have that sharp welcome and full family attention we remembered from the past trips. Once we met our concierge, we were told that she would be doing our in room check-in for us, but then were told the room was not ready and we sat in the lobby going over personal information, and she had to write down our credit card number. My wife asked if Mejay or Dan could complete the check-in since we were feeling a little uneasy about all this, and were told that they did not do check-ins anymore. We later found that to be wrong. The hotel operator did call us to let us know our room was ready before 3pm. All in all, someone needs to take over and get this grand hotel back in shape, Management must not understand whats going on. The good cast members who are still there will not be for long, and the newbies do not know how to give Disney Service! As much as my wife and I love, Mejay and Dan, we have no plans to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: aristophanesny
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GF 4 nights over the Memorial Day weekend. My wife and two young girls shared a room with 2 beds and a cot in the Sugar Loaf Concierge building. The room was very comfortable and well appointed. Very clean and the housekeeping staff always left little fun "surprises" in the room. We had a marina view which was ok - but most rooms in that building have either marina or pool view (no MK view). However, from my balcony, you could actually see the fireworks (we were at the very end so we had a decent angle). It was better to just take the very short walk to the marina for the fireworks. The food offerings and having the concierge in the building were both excellent. Nice to grab a snack, coffee, drink without getting nickle and dimed to death. Although we did the Disney dining plan, it still made sense to be in the concierge level and would absolutely do it again. The location of the property, is of course, ideal. One quick stop on the monorail to get to MK and first stop back by boat. Can not beat that when traveling with little kids. We took advantage of the "disney resort hours" both early and late and were able to come back to the hotel inbetween. The two pools were nice and the one pool with the slide was perfect for kids. I will note here how efficient the lifegaurds at this pool were. Unlike many life gaurds who passively sit on a chair working on their tans, these lifegaurds were very pro-active and watchfull and gave my wife and I a very high level of comfort while our kids were in the pool. Of course, the grounds were immaculate - very much an extension of the Disney experience. My wife did mention to me that the gym had machines that were not working and that overall the gym was disappointing. All other aspects of the grounds, restaraunts, etc.. were excellent, as was the service. We did the Hoop Dee Doo Review (a must) and the Luau (so-so). Overall, an excellent experience and will definitiely return. Yes it is expensive, so be prepared for that.

Reviews.Title: “Grand, Indeed!”
Reviews.Author: Josie630
Reviews.Content: First of all....if you don't want to spend a dollar, stay someplace else! For the rest of you...make your reservations, today! We love Disney and have stayed @ many of the resorts, including the Contemporary, Animal Kingdome Lodge, Polynesian and the Treehouses. The Grand Flo., is just that...Grand! We stayed in the consierge level, Royal Palm Club, in the main building. The room was huge and the balcony, overlooking the lagoon, could easily have held 15 people! It is was fun to sit out there @ night & watch the lighted boat show. For the 2nd time, we used the Disney Magical Express, which was excellent. Our room was ready 2 hrs. before checkin. We did not need anything in our luggage and went directly to the Magic Kingdom. When we returned, our luggage was in the room. Food in the Royal Palm Club, is upscale. My husband is a very picky eater and had a difficult time chosing amongst items he did not recognize. I, on the otherhand, love to try new food and loved the opportunity to try something different. The breakfast spread is more traditional w/fresh fruit, cold cereal, bagels, toast, cheese, juice. etc. The staff replenishes the food, constantly. It was so fun, to sit on the balcony @ night , drink a glass of wine and listen to the band play. The only complaint we have is the TV. After spending 6 hrs. in the parks, you return to a beautiful room, fall into bed and strain to watch a 13 inch TV! Come On! Upgraade! The transportation is wonderful. We never watied more than 15 minutes for the bus. Of course, transportation to the Magic Kingdome is less than that! We ate @ Narcoose's. The best steak & lobster I have ever eaten. Just make sure, you reserve your reservations in advance. This is a truly grand hotel with excellent service. You will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic They certainly know customer service”
Reviews.Author: Alvin&Tracy
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian - Fantastic does not do it justice !!!! We stayed here and because it was our honeymoon, we were upgraded. The room was fantastic, a wonderful balcony overlooking the pool area - we had free drinks (wine, spirits and soft drink) and nibbles every evening !!! The hotel is absolutely stunning as are all of the facilities. The photos do not really do it justice - when we go back to Florida, we will definitely stay here again. Lots of buses run to all the main Disney attractions. Due to it being our honeymoon, the first night we had a signed card from Beauty and the Beast !!! , the 2nd day we had a bottle of champagne and a red rose - they certainly know what good customer service is all about !!!!

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Suprise”
Reviews.Author: highest_expectations
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian was a nice treat. Upon checking in, we were upgraded to the concierge level. When booking the trip, we opted not to get the concierge level, figuring it would be just be a way to charge extra money for minor additions. However, when we learned we were being upgraded free of charge, we figured we would give it a chance. What a delight! Hot and unique appetizers prior to dinner (not the typical frozen things stuck in the oven), with unlimited wine, beer, and champagne. After dinner, desserts, more wine, and an entire selection of unlimited choice liquors. Breakfast wasn't anything fabulous, but after lunch there were snacks and sweets. We were even encouraged to take a glass of wine with us to dinner to keep from spending more money on drinks at the restaurants. The room was clean, although it was a little out of the way--we had to go to the fourth floor, walk down a hall, and get into another elevator on the second floor to get to our room. The bathroom counters were very spacious. The restaurants weren't anything special. Over priced meals for what we received. We chose the restaurants that were $30-$50 per person and we found that even those were completely packed with young children whose parents were unable to keep the children under control and using their "inside voices". Overall, we would definitely stay in this hotel again, and next time, we will book a concierge room. It was worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Magical”
Reviews.Author: windiealge
Reviews.Content: Just returned from Orlando after a week at the Grand Floridian with my wife and 4 year old daughter. This hotel is fantastic and has everything you (and your kids) could ask for - proximity to the parks, great atmosphere, great staff and service and good food. Victoria & Alberts is an absolute must. It was the best fine dining experience I have ever had and I thoroughly recommend it. For those reviewers who complain about the price, you know how much it costs when you book it so maybe you should go somewhere else. The Grand Floridian is worth every penny. Make sure you ask for a room with a Magic Kingdom view. Absolutely Magical!!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, service needs work”
Reviews.Author: boyzrus
Reviews.Content: We stayed at GF April 10-15th. Check in was not a problem and our room was ready on time. The rooms are not large, but four(kids age 5 and 7) of us were comfortable as the beds were queen size. I felt that the value simply was not there for $495/night - plus taxes. Basically you pay for location which simply cannot be beat. It is just one stop away from Magic Kingdom on the monorail and a transfer to another monorail to get to Epcot. We were able to get a small fridge upon request. The buses take you to MGM and Animal Kingdom directly. But beware on the way back, the bus stops at the other resorts and it takes a long time to return - at least half an hour . Take the boat back from Magic Kingdom instead of Monorail as it is a direct trip and monorail has to loop all the way around.
