We had issues with housekeeping as our room was not cleaned while we were at the parks. For example, we returned from MGM one day at 3:30 and our room had not yet been cleaned. Trying to get someone on the phone is ridiculous. Always a wait for front desk or concierge. Speaking of concierge, one guy was completely useless. He had no info re:dining. We were trying to decide between 2 popular restaurants and he had no idea how they were. The pools were unbelievably crowded at this time of year and frankly there were people there who were not hotel guests. You do not have to show your card to get towels or chairs and anyone can enter the resort from the monorail or parking lot for that matter, who is not a hotel guest and use the pool! The waterslide was under repair during our entire stay - the kids were really bummed. They also didn't clean up at the pool at all. We managed to get one cot (for 4 of us) for a couple of hours and the table next to us had dirtly dishes/cups/towels etc. on it for the entire time and the people had left. There is no shade at the pool. The umbrellas are for the dining tables and cannot be moved. This was surprising from a so-called deluxe property. We ate the the Grand Floridian cafe which was fine. Gasparilla's has lots of choice for snacks and sandwiches. We actually used up the rest of our snack credits from the dining plan on the last day and got bagels and cream cheese for our flight home. Beware of Disney's Magical Express. When I called to make our reservation they wanted us at the airport 4 hours ahead of time! (for canada) After many inquiries we discovered the busride is one hour from the airport. This includes the time it takes for the driver to load and unload all of the luggage. They won't let you off the bus till everything is unloaded. Plan accordingly. I eventually called back and told them my flight was later than it actually was and arrived 90 minutes prior to flight time as recommended by the airline. It is nice to be a resort guest as anything you buy in the parks will be sent to your hotel free of charge. That way it is easier to spend your money. In case you didn't know, all the rides in Disney (most of them) end in a store of some sort. You don't need to carry money because your room key is encoded with your info and all purchases show up on your hotel bill. It is very convenient. We would stay here again BUT only because of the location. I know it is overpriced but only because the convenience outweighs the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Stephlovestravel
Reviews.Content: Having stayed @ most of the Disney Deluxe Resorts, I was a little apprehensive about spending the extra $$ to stay here. turns out, totally worth it! We were checked in right away and upgraded to a better view. Upon learning that it was our anniversary, champagne and flowers were sent to our room. The service was outstanding everywhere. We had drinks @ both Narcoosee's and Citrico's as well as dinner @ V & A. All together, awesome! The 2 minute monorail ride from the MK was great and I loved laying by the pool and hearing faint MK sounds (the train, the parade etc) The beach is really great too, lots of cozy cabana's! It was easy to get a drink @ the pool bar too! Did I mention the beautiful live orchestra in the lobby each evening? Wonderful! Or how my husband forgot a shirt and had to buy one for dinner in the store and they quickly ironed it for him to wear that night? All in all, an amazing experience!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay but had some problems”
Reviews.Author: Christy8fan
Reviews.Content: I was there the week of April 1st, 2007 with my 5 yr old and 7 yr. old. The parks were very crowded and even had to close. Watching the Parade seemed impossible at 9pm because it was just too many people. You could not move. About the hotel, when I checked in I was checked into a dirty room. I called the front desk and they moved me no problems. But they moved me into a totally different building. I had to walk to the building next door to go to my other room not to mention back to the desk first for a new key. The kind of service they have you would have thought they would have had a concierge or someone bring me my new key no didn't happen. My new room was beautiful, nice stay and the maid was wonderful. Roberta has been there for years she works at the front desk and every year she helps me with my meal plan that not one employee seems to know how to work. I had a problem in Gasparillas Cafe with an employee who rang up one of my meals as two. Roberta looked it up and helped me the second straight year with the same problem. The 1900 park fare fit me in at the last minute when we changed our meal arrangements I had no problem being fit in. Monorail transportation is great, concierge is great and valet is good. I had no problems at the front desk and I found them very helpful. The staff in the Gasparillas was the only people who just don't seem to understand the meal plan there are some restaurants in the park too that don't seem to understand how it works. This is my second year staying at this hotel, my experience is of one I would come back because I like the decor and security the hotel has, but they need to work with the staff concerning the meal plan. Next year we won't be getting it. I also would not return over spring break the parks were just too full and too busy. If there had been a medical emergency during the parade I don't know how that person would have gotten help how full it was. Spring break definatly not a time to go.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: bkrpp
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floriidan Concierge-Sugar Loaf was a great experience. WOW, what service...having your name come up as a GF Concierge guest got us extra perks and superb service. The food presentations were nice, enjoyed breakfast and dinner hour the best. The Resort itself is very soft spoken, very quiet, upscale but not uptight. Spend a little extra, get spoiled for life, we will be back! Narcoosees is the best restaurant at the GF, totally fabulous. The sorbet with fresh berries, yum. Traveled with a family of four, two boys(8 and 12), wife and myself. Pools were nice and not overly crowded, unlike BC and YC pools. Spend the extra $ and you will be amazed.

Reviews.Title: “Spent with Tax $700 for a dirty room ..rude servie”
Reviews.Author: Dakota30328
Reviews.Content: We had the unfortunate experience of staying last week at the Grand Floridian. For starters .. 1. We book the hotel because we wanted to be near our children so we could baby sit. We confirmed 3 time and when we arrived they had put us in 2 different buildings. It took 3 hours to fix it and we never got as close as we requested. 2. We booked and were quoted a price for 5 nights and only got 4 3. Our $700 room was not cleaned until after 3:30 pm. 4. The noise in the halls was unbelievable the hotel has no sound proofing. 5. Do not buy the meal plan ..it is a fraud. they sold it saying you got breakfast, lunch and dinner..at the park or at the hotels.. it is really not a full breakfast lunch or dinner and we used up 2 dinners at breakfast before we realized what the package was. When they sell they do not send it to you or tell you what it is.. 6. The parks is overcrowded ..they seem not to have limit on how many people the let into the park. Little children need to wait on line for 2 hours for a 5 minute ride. 7. We waited on line for food as well. People were not smiling in the Magic Kingdom. 8. The service was generally rude and when people complained which they were..the hotel staff, park staff , servers all smirked.. What a vacation ? $1,000K for nothing ..repeating the same parade the same fireworks, the rides you cannot get on.. crowds since there are not limits. Thinking of Disney vacation.. take the kids to Six Flags..lots more rides, food and the staft is nice take the $1,000 's you save and enjoy a real vacation..The Ritz Carlton is cheaper..

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Amazing”
Reviews.Author: jgbballstar8
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Floridian resort and spa the first week in April 07. Though the hotel was crowded, we had a great time. This hotel is far and away the most luxurous hotel that I have ever satyed in. When I first walked into the lobby, I was blown away. Vases of flowers were placed on nearly evey table and gorgous chanderliers hung from the celings. The victoiran decor is truly charming. The hotel's grounds are beautiful and well maintained. There are two pools at the resort, the "quiet pool" with a pooolside bar and a pool with a waterfall and slide that is geared towards kids. While lounging by either pool, you truly feel that you are in paridise. The hotel also has a beautiful white sand beach that rivals many of the beaches throughout the carribean. Though you are not permitted to swim in the lagoon that the beach is nestled on, speedboats are avialable for use. I would highly reccomend renting one for an hour or two, as they are really fun to ride in. Though the hotel is home to many excellent restaurants, my favorite would definitley have to be Narcooses. The food is delicious, and the atmoshphere and staff are wonderful. If you are dining around the time that the firework show is going on, be sure to request a table by the window. Those tables have a direct view of Cinderella's castle . If you can't manage to get a table by the window, there is an excellent view of the show from the restaurants balcony. The grand flo's only counter service option is Gasparilla Grill. Though there are many negative comments about it on the site, we found it to be a great value. The food is generally good, and you can really make use of your counter serive credit. (if you are on the meal plan) The brownies and chocolate chip cookies are especially delicous. The grand floridian cafe was dissppointing, as the food isn't of high quality. The hotel's rooms are of average size, and are decorated nicely. I wasn't blown away by the rooms, but they were certainly a notch above your average hotel room. We were given a beutiful view of the marina, but if you cna swing a magic kingdom view, that is definitley the best choice. The one and only compalint I really have about this hotel is the front desk staff. They are slightly hostile and are not approchable. However, we did encounter many helpful Floridian cast members throughout our stay, so don't think that all of the workers are rude. I think that the hotels best quality is itts location. You are literally two minutes away from the magic kingdom, and the monrail service is great. However, when you are coming back from the magic kingdom, take the ferry instead of the monorail. It is quicker, as the Grand is the last stop on the monorail when returning form magic kingdom. Though the other two monorail resorts were also nice, they weren't in the same league as the Grand Floiridian. If you are unsure if you want to spend the extra money to stay at the grand, I would definitley recocmend doing so. The hotel is truly magical, and will certainly add something extra to your vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but...”
Reviews.Author: travelerwithkids
Reviews.Content: We stayed one night at the Floridian with our 3 young children. You can't beat the location! Jump on the monorail and you are at the Magic Kingdom in 4 minutes. The property is beautiful BUT for the price you pay, we felt there were some problems. At the front desk for check in there didn't seem to be any organization. A bunch of guests were waiting in a make shift line. There seemed to be enough employees behind the desk but they kept disappearing into the back. I don't know if they were helping others but I could tell the waiting guests were not happy. The room was spacious and well thought out. I did notice one of the balcony doors were left ajar, probably by housekeeping. We came back from the Magic Kingdom and were able to get a perfect view of the fireworks. We put the kids to bed and when my husband and I went to shut off the lights above our bed they would not go off all the way. Soon there were bugs buzzing around them (probably due to the balcony door left open by house keeping?). We finally unscrewed the bulbs and went to bed. Trying to check out we ran into the same problem at the front desk--a make shift line and employees running around. When we explained what had happened the night before he said there was nothing he could do and we should have called the night before to get switched to another room. This was crazy since we were not going to wake up our sleeping children at midnight to switch rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Just Amazing - UK Traveller”
Reviews.Author: trscarr
Reviews.Content: From the moment we stepped off the Magical Express Coach I knew this was going to be a wonderful holiday. The hotel reception is just beautiful and a wonderful sight after a 9 hour flight! The staff can't help you enough, they are all so friendly and helpful - such a difference from where we come from!! Our room was simply perfect and the maid greeted us every day with little animals made from the towels. Our cases were delivered to our room about 90 minutes after we arrived, and placed neatly in a corner. - The Magical Express Paperwork states it may take up to 3 hours so we thought this was very good service. We often had lunch in the quick service eaterie by the lake and sat looking out over Cinderellas castle. We also ate at Citricos and Florida Cafe and of course we had a character breakfast at Park Fare. Citricos was by far our favourite as the staff were even friendlier in there. Everywhere you go the staff make you smile with their friendliness - of course it is their job, but your'e not made to feel like it is just a job, you really feel special there. We did eat out at the Contempary, which was nice but a little too modern for me, although the view of the fireworks from the 15th floor restaurant were lovely! The Grand Floridian was the most spectacular hotel on the lake and we felt our disney experience was carried on after leaving whichever park that day to go back to such an inviting hotel. Yes it is expensive but as someone has already said you know the price before you go there, what on earth can you complain about? I cannot believe all the staff that helped make our holiday special suddenly turn in to rude staff when the high season comes in to action. The Reception staff and the information desk went out of their way to help us with any query we had at any time. If we can ever afford it again I would not hesitate to go back there, and I have and will continue to reccommend it to people.

Reviews.Title: “What's to complain about?”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningDC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian in early February and I can't understand why there are any negative comments on this site, although we did stay in off season. The hotel itself is fabulous and is far and away the nicest hotel on the WDW resort. We had dinner at several of the other 'luxury' hotels and all seemed much more 'commercial' in their orientation (mobs in the lobby mostly). The room was very nice and we had a great view of Cinderella's castle - magical for the kids. The best part was being so close to the Magic kingdom and not having to take the dreaded bus or even the monorail to the park. - the boat was a wonderful resource to have. As an aside, What kind of person complains about the boat horns? Obviously someone that doesn't live in a city! The pool area is great and the food was pretty decent too (although Epcot provided us with the best meals). All in all, decent value for money (by Disney standards) and we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Most magical trip for our family”
Reviews.Author: bigcPa
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our 4year old for his first trip to Disney. We stayed in the Sanibel suite and could see the fireworks every night they were put off at the Magic Kingdom. The rooms were clean and everyone was so very, very nice and they would accomodate your every want. We had turn down service and housekeeping would make our hand towels into little animals for our son. The conceirge were very helpful when we needed information, or to make dinner or breakfast reservations. We had breakfast and dinner in Park fare with the characters, and I was impressed with the service and how helpful everyone was with letting us know when the characters were coming in and our. I would go back and stay at this resort again, I do not know how it could get bad reviews.

Reviews.Title: “the most beautiful place”
Reviews.Author: luv2ash
Reviews.Content: I am not sure what people expect from hearing all these negative reviews. You know how much the hotel costs before you get there, so do not complain about it! Its disney, so there will be children and ferry noises and train horns! My experience was dreamy! I cannot wait to go back. We arrived via magical express. We stayed in the concierge level, but not the one that is in the main lobby, it is in a building by itself. Concierge service was fabulous. All the food was incredible. Breakfast, snacks, tea time, wine, beer, champagne, hot hor'dorves, cordials and dessert plus coffee, tea and soda available at all times. There was always food out! And it was displayed so beautifully. The staff took great care with the food rpesentation in concierge. we felt like Prince and princesses. Our room was perfect! The toiletries were to die for. Housekeeping gave turn down service every night. We could hear the train and the ferry, and I loved every earfull of it, thats a part of being in disney. The main lobby was something that I could not stop looking at. It is so beautiful, with either a piano or a band playing. So nice and bright. Our luggage arrived sometime after we arrived, but we were so busy in the parks that it did not matter. We were told to pack a carry on bag for some immediate things, and that we did, and so we could care less about our luggage arriving. All I know is when we were done that night and came back to the hotel, our lugage was there. I can not wait to get back to this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Left wanting more”
Reviews.Author: warriorlassie
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at allstars movies before and loved it, but wanted luxary on this trip. I came with my partner but without my children on this one occasion. We naively thought that there would be less young children running and noise than a value resort but were wrong. We were also annoyed at the long check in queue. We just didnt expect that in a 5 star hotel. In our opinion they should have been better prepared for it being busy and arranged more staff, especially with what they charge. We also assumed that the main building with the piano and everything else was the only building and we visualised staying in there. We were shocked at first to be sent outside to another building. However, we were glad of it in the end. It was wonderful with the magic kingdom view and the excellent view of wishes. Also, it was nice and quiet. I do think we should have been offered assistance to take our cases to the room, but we later found out this help was only offered to guests staying in the main building. When I booked the hotel I really thought that EVERYBODY would be treated like 5 star guests. I also have to add here that the customer service at the VALUE hotel, allstars, was much better. I got the impression that first class service was for those guests who payed extra to stay in the main building. I think the price of this hotel would be more justified if we were given the same first class treatment you would get in an ordinary 5 star hotel. The restaurants were first class and even the gasparilla counter service did nice food. The annoying thing would be that its difficult to get a reservatioin as they allow people to use the restaurants who do not stay on disney, which I think is wrong.Its also difficult to get a table in the parks without a reservation. Yet, Its impossible to decide 3 months in advance exactly where you want to eat. My way of getting round that problem was to overbook a few extra tables in advance at the hotel and parks then nearer the time cancel what you dont want. The room was very nice. I just think there could be room for improvement with the bath tub. It was small, old and shabby. I was told though, that all the rooms are going to be refurbished and will definetely return AFTER that is done. I noticed a guest complained about the boat horn, but I personally enjoyed that sound.It was nice being so close to the water and the magic kingdom boat. The hotel pools, shops, beach and evening entertainment was fantastic.The crowds were bearable, just. Never in a million years would I come here in peak season. I wont use the dining plan again because I often over indulged just so I would use all my credits. But I do recommend them. To get the best value, use counter service credits for breakfast and table service for meals.There are one or 2 restaurants that tske 2 table credits, but they are worth it if you are going to eat away from disney any days. Also, dont use the snack credits to buy drinks. you can buy sweets, fruit bowls or most things up to a value of 3.99 dollars. I will definetely return here, but will write to the hotel stating my concerns and hope they will take that in the friendly spirit that is intended.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed here 14 separate times”
Reviews.Author: lauren618
Reviews.Content: Since I was a little girl, I have stayed at the Grand Floridian Resort and Spa (although, at that time, it was the "Grand Floridian Beach Resort") many times. This hotel has literally been a home away from home for my family and me. Every single time we stay there, we are more than pleased- the service is impeccable, the rooms are very quaint as well as comfortable, and the Lagoon View is a MUST. One of my fondest memories of this hotel is getting up in the morning to the faint sound of the ferry horn, and walking onto the veranda in pjs and slippers and hand-feeding birds that flew to our balcony. This is no exaggeration- if you leave crackers on the ledge, by the second morning the birds know where the food is, and they are not afraid to take this food right from your hand. The main lobby is gorgeous- from the amazing chandeliers to the wonderful pianist and the small jazz orchestra located on the 2nd floor balcony. The shops are high-end, featuring Tommy Bahama apparel and Bally's leather goods, among others. In addition, there are also gift shops, one which includes mostly toys for children such as autograph books, stuffed Disney animals, and more. The restaurants at the GF are wonderful- Narcoosse's is relaxing and perfect if you would like to see the water pageant or fireworks show from your seat or from the outer veranda. My favorite restaurant in Disney is Victoria & Albert's, located in the GF main buiding. Although it is pricey, the food is outstanding, and the service is impeccable. Each female consumer leaves the restaurant with a complimentary red rose. While staying at the GF, I highly recommend renting the speed boats. They are so much fun for the entire family. I also recommend visiting the pool at night. My sister and I have often swum close to midnight and it is extremely quiet and peaceful, as there are no children there at this time at night. The balcony from a Lagoon View room is also a great feature for the night time. My sister and I made screwdrivers and sipped them on the balcony at night, wearing shorts and still feeling quite comfortable. I am from Long Island, and my family and I enjoy five-star hotels. We have stayed in the Trump International Hotel, the Waldorf-Astoria, The Plaza in NY, the Four Seasons, NY, the St. Regis, NY, and the New York City Palace, among many other fine hotels. While these NY hotels might be a tad more opulent, "stuffy," reserved and dignified, one must remember that the Grand Floridian is still in Disney and there are always going to be happy and excited children running around, as well as people dressed in shorts and sneakers. The Grand Floridian will always be my absolute favorite hotel, and in fact, my fiance and I are planning our honeymoon at this very hotel, and neither of us can wait to go. Please, if you are to listen to anyone's reviews, please let it be mine as I have stayed here many, many times and have always been extraordinarily pleased. I highly recommend this hotel to anyone of an age.

Reviews.Title: “It was Amazing!!!”
Reviews.Author: djs6949
Reviews.Content: It was amazing! The cast was very nice and all parts of the hotel were absolutely fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: GoSpartans
Reviews.Content: Okay, it's a bit cliche, but all I can say is it's the location! We just returned from a week stay at the Grand Floridian (12/29-1/5) It is a beautiful hotel with a fantastic location. We were in the Conch Key building, and while we technically had a "garden view" room, it was anything, but. We had a fantastic view of the midnight fireworks on both the 30th and 31st of December. These fireworks were shot off from the island in the middle of Seven Seas Lagoon, and it felt like we could reach out an touch them. We also could watch the nightly water parade from our room, if we wished. The rooms were very comfortable--especially the beds. The hotel has several very good dining options, shopping, nightly entertainment (usually a piano player or a swing band) two lovely pools, and a nice beach. It is beautiful. Yes, it is very expensive! But, you are really paying for the location. You can be in the Magic Kingdom in about 10 minutes after you leave your room by using the monorail or the water ferry. The water ferry is especially convenient on returning from the Magic Kingdom as only people who are staying at the Grand Floridian or the Polynesian use it, and its first stop is always the GF. The water taxis come every 8 minutes. This convenience also means that it is easy to get back to your room for a midday rest and return to the parks easily at night when they are less crowded. While the Polynesian and the Contemporary are also on the lagoon and the monorail, the GF is definitely more upscale with little touches like nightly turn down service and a fully stocked mini-bar. So, is it worth it? It just depends on what you're looking for--we certainly loved the "full experience." Would we stay here again over the Polynesian? I don't know, probably not for the additional $150 more per night. But, it was fun. I would not recommend this hotel for a vacation that does not involve the Disney parks--if you want to stay at a beautiful hotel for a relaxing vacation, you can certainly stay somewhere else just as beautiful, probably with a better view (ocean) and better service. But, if you are going to Disney and want all the conveniences that will make your experience as comfy as possible, this is a great place. Adults without children should note that despite the high cost, there are lots of young families with children (including mine!) You will not be getting away from that here.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms are good but service is poor at this price point”
Reviews.Author: Etravellers
Reviews.Content: I went with my 3 years and 8 months old son and my wife to Disney World and stayed there from 16th to 24th Dec. We spent a night at the Contemporary Hotel on the 16th, as we couldn't find a room anywhere else when my wife and I made the booking a month ago. Originally our plan is to stay at Polynesian Hotel from 17th to 22nd. However, my son and my wife felt allergic to the not-100%-clean aircon at the Polynesian. My son had runny nose (allergic rhinitis) and my wife coughed a lot at night while still recovering from her flu contracted before our trip. The Magic Kingdom views from our room at Polynesian were great but we decided to switch to Grand Floridian to avoid the allergy problem and the service is far below we expected for what we paid for (~US$450 per night). We also extended our stay for two more nights (22nd & 23rd) at the GF so that we would visit the Disney Park more thoroughly A lot of the negative comments about the Grand Floridian at Trip Advisor are very accurate. The biggest regret I had was that we had purchased the Premium Dining Plan. We spend plenty of our time worrying if we could utilise all the 45 coupons (1 cpn * 3 persons * 3 meals / day * 5 nights) for the 5 nights and justify the expensive price we paid (approx. US$2200 for 6 days). The good thing with Premium plans is the freebies (1) free use of activities centre and (2) free use of the boats/fishing tour, horseride, pony ride. Cost-wise, however, i'm not sured you end up saving real money in a big way and you lose flexibility. We believe we could have saved all the trouble/worries and probably money if we had forgot about the dinner plan and pay everything in cash. The meals in Disney are indeed rather expensive. Be prepared for that. Breakfast will usually cost btw US$60-90+ per 2 adults + 1 child at the restaurants with character. Dinner at $$$ restaurant will cost upwards of US$120+ and lunch somewhere in between these two. But we don't have that much appetite and so we end up not eating lunch some of the time and thus made it harder for us to finish all the coupons. Comments on Grand Floridian Rooms are good. beds are comfortable and feel like 5 stars. Service is rather poor. If you are lucky, you may bump into a staff who is extremely helpful (i came across a few). But most of them appear indifferent to customer complaints. Since we changed hotel 2 times and had to use new hotel cards every time, we had trouble asking the concierge/front desk to transfer all our tickets / premium dining plans onto the new cards. THey said they did it but it never seemed to work. So, there was once i went to a Disney Park only to find we could not get in with our new hotel cards and had to go to the ticket information, spend 15 mins explaining everything before we could enter. Same case with dining plans. Often, the servers forgot to deduct our coupons and just charged the bill to our room. It happened often enough to make us feel frustrated. In total, i guess i probably wasted between 90 to 120 mins unncessarily at the concierge. I think generally the service only lives up to 3.5 star standard. There may be understaffing problem b'cos a bell man complained to me 'I have five cars to park. if you are checking in, ask the people inside to help you get the bags' in fact, we have been instructed by the bell captain inside to go out and ask the bell man outside. In generally, don't expect to be pampered at the GF. You won't get that experience. But it's a very well-decorated (by disney standard) and very conveniently located hotel (5 mins by ferry from Magic Kingdom) and right on top of monorail. The food in the restaurants (even the cafe) is way better than elsewhere and of course, it feels more upscale. These are the main selling points, not personalised service. My favourite restaurant at Disney: Bistro De Paris. Narcoosee is not worth the price. Citricos is mediocre. GF Cafe and Park Fare are both good.

Reviews.Title: “Bring your cash, credit cards, lines of credit, and second mortgage your home!”
Reviews.Author: Fourseasondreamer
Reviews.Content: We are Florida residents and stayed at the Grand Floridian (GF) on December 14th (our anniversary) and 15th, 2006. Our rate was $340.00 a night plus tax. We have stayed at several of the Disney properties from the "value" at $64.00 a night to "moderate "room at around $200.00. All during different times of the year. THE BASICS: The room was decorated very nicely but certainly not "plushly". It had 2 queen beds, a day bed, a porch looking over the marina, a very nice bathroom, and a 22" t.v.. In keeping with the Disney standard it was spotless and had the touches one would expect with an expensive hotel, i.e. better soap and shampoo, turn down service with chocolates, bigger towels, etc. It also had a locked stocked refridgerator. THE GOOD: The GF has several restaurants, boutiques, a lovely lobby, a games room which is open 24 hrs, bigger rooms, mostly short walks betwen the rooms and transportation, room service, and bell service. THE NOT SO GOOD: The GF has boat service running from it to the Magic KIngdom. As a result the boats horn blows twice, loudly, every 10 minutes or so starting at 7:00 a.m. You can also hear very clearly the train from the Magic Kingdom which runs every 3 minutes or so. Pretty frustrating if you are exhausted. To eat in one of the restaurants you will need to make reservations 3 mos in advance. We prefer not to plan every single meal whilst on vacation! The 24 hour "grill" is available but has limited choices. The parking lot is literally 1/2 a mile away and as a result most people valet. Valet service is $7.00 a day and usually has a long line. The valet people do their very best but during busy times it is very hectic and time consuming. THE INSULTING: So you've already dropped AT LEAST $340.00 a night for the room. A one day ticket without park hopper is $65.00, a person. To eat in any of the average walk up service restaurants you've spent on average $40.00 a meal (for 3). Parking was $7.00. etc. etc. You think, o.k., I will enjoy a basic Recce's peanut butter cup from the fridge...$4.00! A basic bag of Lays chips...$3.00. To drink yourself silly after spending your kids inheritance...travel size of Jack...$5.00. TIPS: If you are there during a special occassion mention it when you are checking in.. They will give you a button and you get little perks throughout the parks. Le Cellier is the steak restaurant in Epcot for Canada. It books up 6 mos in advance.. They open for dinner at 4:00 but if you get there at 3:30 they will take walk-ins. It is ABSOULUTELY worth the money. You will not be sorry you spent the cash. Yummy! When you are leaving the Magic Kingdom take the boat rather than wait for the monorail.. The boat only goes the GF (first) and then the Polynesian (second). The monorail hits the GF last after going to the Contemporary and Polynesian, plus hundreds more are going somewhere other than the GF!! IN CONCLUSION: For the amount of time that you spend in the room pick the value or the moderate resorts. They are spotless, have food, excellent pools, comfey beds, better parking and are much less expensive. Even if you are on your honeymoon you will be pleased with the moderate over the deluxe because in the world of "Deluxe" hotels the GF is really just a moderate hotel. It just happens to be the best that Disney has to offer. Good luck and have a "Magical" day! :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, not great price”
Reviews.Author: bresu
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for our Honymoon. Checking in was smooth and easy and we appreciated the fact that no matter what questions you ask - they will have an answer. Our room was very clean and comfortable - great for a honeymooning couple. We apparently had an a-joining room and we could hear the family on the otherside quit clearly, so not the best in sound proofing. The fireworks at night do make it feel like a war zone, but for only 20 minutes and its pretty quiet at night. The turn down service was very nice. The maintanece staff was very helpful and quick to respond. While I think it's pointless to have the spa so far away from the hotel - it was quite a walk from our marina room - the spa was very clean and relaxing. The pools are very nice and I really enjoyed the private white sand beach. Complaint: the staff used the sidewalks to transport luggage, food service and so on with their golf carts, this was not only annoying but could be a bit of a hassle. It is difficult to to walk from one buidling to another without the fear of getting run over by a golf cart, stroller, or an elderly person's scooter. The restuarants were nice and the food was great - 1900 Park Fare was our only complaint, we think it made us sick. Tip: If you are not from the area, do not drink the Florida water - while we had a great honeymoon - it isn't fun staying int he hotel because you are sick! Tip: Do your research before going to Disney. The Unoffical Guide to Disney was the best book I ever bought! it can be found at most Barnes &Noble stores - you need it to understand the dinig plan systems - they are cryptic and even the staff has a hard time understand your dindig option - on the plus side, any dinig plan is MORE convienient than taking cash everwhere. Overall - we really enjoyed the Grand Floridian for comfort more than anything... We probably will not stay there again because it was not worth the price per night.

Reviews.Title: “Not quite 5 star standard”
Reviews.Author: tobytyke
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week in the Grand Floridan. Typical though its the "Little things" that matter which were lacking. Firstly we had two options to park our car one being the Valet service where you pay $7.00 per day & park on site or you use the "Self park". After paying the rather expensive rates to stay there in the first place I wasnt going to be blackmailed into using the Valet service but when I tried to self park I had to wait over an hour for a space to become available coupled with the fact the self park is "Offsite" & is a five minute walk from the lobby area. When you pay the kind of prices Disney charge to stay here parking should be free & on the door step! Secondly the main pool had Ducks floating around on it which were a nuicence when swimming & eating around the pool & their "Droppings" were all over the pool floor. Not very higenic we thought!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jmayr
Reviews.Content: Guests at Disney expect the best, because that is what they are told they will receive. I have stayed at numerous Disney resorts over the years, and the Grand Floridian is by far one of my favorites! The resort is pricey but definitely worth it. I loved being able to watch the fireworks from this property, without having to actually be surrounded by the typical Magic Kingdom crowds. Transportation is convenient to and from all the parks, the restaurants are top-notch, and the property is absolutely gorgeous. Would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: emschick9
Reviews.Content: We were located in building 5 with a nice view of the water. The main lobby was beautifully decorated for Christmas and the Gingerbread House was adorable. Our room was nice, very clean and comfortable. The staff was amazing, our vehicle got a flat tire and the concierge desk went above and beyond to help us. The wrecker service that is on the grounds of the Disney area sent someone to help, they arrived quickly and did not charge us to change the tire. My only complaint is they only have one self parking lot that isn't very large, it took us awhile to find a parking spot and we were one of many vehicles driving around the lot trying to find a space. We prefer not to use the valet services since they are normally impossible to get through on check out day but I did notice that their service was very quick and no one was left waiting for long.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Beautiful hotel but”
Reviews.Author: Buckeyefan42
Reviews.Content: some things (i.e. bed spreads,) in the room looked a bit worn for the price. We found the beds to be very comfortable. We could hear toilets flushing/tv from next room. This is a gorgeous hotel and we found check in and all service to be excellent. The location was great and the decorating in the main lobby and landscaping were stunning. I would stay here again, but again for almost $500 a night, a little face lifting I hope is in the near future.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed views about the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: DWT123
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for two nights from 19 to 21 November which was at the end of our holiday. We had upgraded to a Lagoon view room. First the not so good bits: Whilst we could see the lagoon from our window, there were trees growing outside the room which obscured the view (might be a good idea to check if the view is obscured when you book, we stayed in a room on the first floor); Waited 25 minutes for a bus to Animal Kingdom only to find it full and was told it would be another 25 minutes so we ended up driving there (OK it was Thanksgiving week but you think that they would put more buses on). The good bits were we got free parking in the theme parks with our room key; The staff were very helpful although the lady who checked us in overdid it a bit with the "Disney Magic thing"; the bed was really comfortable; The maid service was exceptional and we even got a half bottle of champagne left in our room to celebrate or wedding anniversary; Watching the fireworks from the resort was really good especially when we did not have the fight the crowds afterwards. Top tips: Don't worry about staying in the main building, I think that it could get noisy and concierge service prices are not worth it. Remember to make reservations for all the restaurants well in advance - Victoria and Albert’s take bookings 6 months ahead of arrival. If you have no children in your party don't be too embarrassed about booking a character breakfast, the food is great and the price reasonable. Overall we would go back but not when it is so busy.

Reviews.Title: “Treated Like A Second Class Citizen”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTraveler20
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Disney's Grand Floridian Hotel for three days the second week of October. We paid $1,600 for three nights, including park tickets, so this is by no means a cheap hotel stay. Although we have traveled extensively and frequently stay at 4 or 5 star hotels, this is the first time in many years of travel that we have been made to feel like second-tier customers deserving inferior service. Every single day of our stay, it was made obvious to us that good service was reserved for "concierge-level guests", those paying close to $500/night per room. A few examples: Day two of our stay we tried to make reservations for BREAKFAST. Nothing fancy here, we just prefer buffets for breakfast, and this was the only place in the hotel offering a buffet. We were told that the only tables available were for "concierge level guests" and that if we wanted a buffet breakfast we would have to catch a bus to the animal kingdom lodge. NOT! We were not pleased about this-- at $400/night we expect to be able to eat breakfast at our hotel. Another example: the TV in our room came equipped with a video player (but no pay-per-view). After a long day in the park, we felt that some quiet time in our room watching a Disney video would be a nice change of pace for our two year old daughter. We went to the concierge desk and asked if videos were available for rent-- the answer was not a simple yes or no, it was "what is your room number?". We were then told that videos were availble only to concierge level guests!!!!! Wake up, Disney! Concierge level service at other luxury hotels means bigger rooms, nicer views, a lounge with food NOT bad service to other hotel guests. My advice: the convenience of staying at a Disney resort is great, but unless you want to be treated like a second class citizen, seek out a resort with only one level of service.

Reviews.Title: “4-Star Hotel, 5-Star Service”
Reviews.Author: BeccaLinda
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a week at WDW in the Grand Floridian for our honeymoon (10/8-10/15). At first we hit a couple of bumps in the road. (1) We couldn't find where to drop our bags for concierge and ended up parking across the street only to haul our bags in with us. (2) Once we got in we were told it would be a half-hour wait for our room to be ready (ok, fine), but they also told us they'd let us know when it was ready (we sat near the desk in the grand lobby). So we waited ~45 minutes only to ask and find out our room had been ready for 20 minutes. At that point we asked if it would be possible for concierge to take our bags (and us) up to our room, since the place is rather spread out and tough to navigate on your first day, and they told us it would be another 20 minutes. We ditched that idea (after making us wait 25 minutes longer than we had to, I though it was the least they could do, but oh well) and dragged our bags up to our room. At least when we got there, there was a big bottle of Evian and a box of truffles waiting for us, which we later learned were part of our stay (in other words, no $10 bottles of water unless you pull it out of the mini-fridge). The room was pretty nice-- not as nice as some places I've stayed, but pretty close. The furnishings were really different than your average hotel, giving it a homey feel. After our check-in problems, service was top of the line from then on in. I forgot a razor, which was not available in the shop downstairs, and they brought up two with a can of shaving cream free of charge. The maid and turn-down service was impeccable, and we even got champagne and a rose from Mickey and Minnie (with an autographed photo). We thought that was sweet. The convenience of the Grand Floridian can't be beat-- it can only be matched by the Contemporary and the Polynesian. Being on the monorail line is the way to go if you're visiting WDW if you want to get in and out of the parks quickly (especially if you have young children with you). As far as WDW in general, here are our suggestions: *Go with a meal plan. We got the premium one, but even that can be a bit too much food. At least go with the standard one-- if you look at your check at the end of each meal, you'll probably find it was worth it, money-wise, plus you don't have to worry about carrying credit cards/cash at all, then, unless you want to buy souvenirs. *Pick where you want to eat each night (you may want this to coincide with the nights each park stays open late) and make reservations when you arrive at WDW-- before, if possible. We missed at least two restaurants we wanted to try because we couldn't get a reservation. *Eat off-peak if you can. We ate at the Grand Floridian Cafe for breakfast every day, usually after 10AM. The one day we went earlier we had to wait for a table, and people around us were snapping at the hostess because they weren't getting seated in front of people with reservations. Not a pleasant scene, but the staff handled it beautifully. *If you stay at the Grand Floridian, spring for a room with a lagoon view, as opposed to a garden view. At first I didn't think it was that big a deal, but within a day I realized it was worth being able to see Cinderella's castle and watch the Magic Kingdom's fireworks shows from our balcony. Generally the Grand Floridian was a very, very pleasant stay, with outstanding service (at least after our initial impressions). We would go there again in a heartbeat, of course, to see WDW again but probably wouldn't stay anywhere else but the Grand Floridian!

Reviews.Title: “Married at the Wedding Pavillion stayed at the Grand Floridian Concierge”
Reviews.Author: Woz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is absolutely amazing. Me and my wife got married at The Wedding Pavillion close to the Grand Floridian. Absolutely magical day. I will however focus on the hotel. Everyone has to understand there is always going to be a fast food counter service in most hotels. Now to say this food was excellent would be a lie, just normal pizza and burgers. It wasn't at all busy when we went in though. This resort is definately not noisy. If you want a noisy resort stay at the All Stars! The pools where amazing the beach was stunning and the staff where very helpful. Anything you needed they did there best for you. Getting back onto the food. The Grand Floridian Cafe was really nice. Not overly priced and very tasty food. Offered more than just burgers, in fact was the first place I've seen to offer mushroom soup. Citricos was superb the food was marvelous and the service was perfect. When we told them that we where getting married in two days they first of all congratulated us and made special deserts for us. The service was so good we had to get a picture with the waiter and we give him a generous tip. Now last but not least is the best restaraunt in all of Orlando. Victoria & Albert's. This place is quite expensive but it is totally worth it. The service out of this world and the food where works of art on each course. The block that we stayed in was the Sugar Loaf building. Again Concierge service very helpful and the room was very elegant. The bed was the most comfortable bed I've slept in abroad. The transport to the other parks is really amazing. Monorail to either Magic Kingdom or Epcot and the bus service to any of the others with a minimal wait time. Do not let other reviews sway your decision in staying here as this resort was truly magical and we are planning on staying here again for our Wedding Anniversary next year. Absolutely top notch!

Reviews.Title: “Grand is best Disney has to offer but not 5 star!”
Reviews.Author: dansuz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 2 weeks,Sep 21st until 5 th of Oct .We paid for lagoon view room and were given a castle view, wow what a magical view! Our 2 young children loved the 2 pools,staff were friendly and helpful, we didn't like the grill and arcade too noisy and food horrible. The cafe seved delicious breakfasts, dinner was ok. Narcoosees was nice, Citricos we felt the food was over salted. Afternoon tea was good. Transport to the parks was superb well worth staying on site for this On our sons birthday we booked the wishes cruise to watch the fireworks from the lagoon,wonderful!. We used Kids Nite Out babysitting service 3 times I would use them again, excellent care given by Nancy, we had a nice time and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “This place is simply Grand!”
Reviews.Author: krispeykremen
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the GF from Sept.25th-30th, this was our first visit here and we couldn't of been more pleased! The magical express service picked us up in the evening from the airport and took us to our hotel. No lines at the check in, got a 4th floor dormer room with an excellent view of the magic kingdom. We were pleasantly surprised to find a bottle of champagne on ice awaiting us along with a red rose and a card with a photo of prince charming and cinderella congratulating us on our anniversary! The room was very nicely furnished, clean and comfortable. Every evening we got turndown service which was nice to come back to after a long day enjoying Disneyworld. This is a good time to visit as the crowds are very small so we didn't feel overwhelmed by too many people. We ate at the Grand Floridian Cafe on one day for lunch, good service as well as the food. On two evenings we ate at Narcossess which were excellent. Again, the food and the service were so good... Mizner's lounge was ok but it didn't have the elegance of the rest of the hotel with it's service. It's not a really big place and if it got busy they only had one server on the floor and one bartender which could mean a wait for a drink at times. My husband and I came here without children and have to say it is a good place for couples who want to have a romantic getaway. I would never travel here tho in the summer or other busy times as I'm sure it would take away from the relaxing atmosphere.. One more thing, make sure you use the Magical Express service...very convienient!

Reviews.Title: “Do reservations no dinning, long Bus routes, will call personnel need training”
Reviews.Author: hast
Reviews.Content: Dinsey night mare. Buswait 45 minute to an hour No misting areas to cool off at theme parks No reservation for dinning ( Welcome to Mc Donalds Five miles away.) Has anyone heard of a buffets. Get training from the cruise lines on food management. Will Call personnel do not explain that a park may open at 9:30 pm but the fetures do not open until 11am or 3 pm or other to know items like extended hours Need to focus on education and not wasting customers time

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: maverick100
Reviews.Content: The hotel was great, first thing as we got there we saw a beutifull beach overlooking magic kingdom, between that beach was a very blue lake containing fish witch we could pay around $200 for a trip on a boat fishing. As we got closer around the land we saw around 4 main buildings, 1 for dining etc.. and the other 3 for bedrooms. At night you can go out to the 24 hour shop on site, which has beutifull breakfasts also. Also what i liked was the house made out of gingerbread, which you can get your own little gingerbread peiced from there. The christmas tree was absolutly massive! When i got upstairs right to the top in the main building i was neally sick! Also for expensive trips to the hotel you can ahve your own pass for the lift (overrides everyone elses trip up a level and puts yours first :P) Overall it wasa great holiday and the hotel made it worthwhile, i would realy recommend grand floridian the best hotel in disney!

Reviews.Title: “Disney with a Victorian taste”
Reviews.Author: Nurseratchet
Reviews.Content: We chose the Grand Floridan for a large family Christmas trip. Granparents, Grandchildren, aunts, uncles, sisters, in-laws....everybody was there. We selected 3 rooms adjoining with a view of the lake right off our balconey. The rooms were amazingling comfortable. Two queen beds and a daybed in each room. Featherbeds and feather pillows, beautiful decor. Very , very comfortable. A lovely view of Cinderella's castle was right there every evening. Also there was a little light parade on the water that I fell in love with. Watched it every night. Christmas is the best time to go. It is the most magical time. The Grand Flo (as they all call it) is on the Monorail. Has many restaraunts for all budgets. The lobby of the main building is just beautiful. You will not go wrong to stay here if you can afford it. If not, just come for an afternoon of old fashioned Christmas traditions.

Reviews.Title: “Over Priced”
Reviews.Author: dlareme
Reviews.Content: We had 2 rooms at a price of UD$800.00 per night. (for both) Stayed 3 nights = US$2400. Was not worth it at all..Staff was snobby in my opinion. Hotel and food over priced. Hotel was nothing out of the ordinary hotel room, maybe location was the best... Won't stay ther again, not worth it...

Reviews.Title: “With the Army Who Love This Hotel”
Reviews.Author: laabis
Reviews.Content: It's hard to imagine anyone not enjoying this hotel. I am a 46 year father of two little girls and I have put off going to Disney for years. Finally my wife said, "either it's Disney or divorce" rightly thinking of our children. So, I went as one goes into a Root Canal. Perhaps this explains my enthusiasm for the Grand Floridian and Disney as a whole--not a hole! The Grand Floridian is a spectacular hotel that appears like a grand Floridian mansion. Everyone in the facility appears happy and is friendly. You arrive to a spectacular lobby of top level pianists or a large band. Sometimes they play the disney songs and other times they play great jazz. We had a concierge suite which I highly recommend as they were always available and incredibly helpful. Our room was large and beautiful with lovely bathrooms. I have two girls ages 5 and 9 and they were in heaven with all the princess breakfasts and lunches. I was amazed at the high level of organization, efficiency and friendliness of both the hotel and the resort. In order to avoid the crowds, I recommend the following: Be at the opening of the resort at 9am and not one minute later. You'll have virtually no lines for 1.5 hours. Then at 11am when the main body of people arrive, use the fast passes to hit one or two more spectacular rides. Then have a lunch (must be pre-arranged) with the disney characters and take the afternoon off for swimming, tennis, golf or sleeping. With this system, we found the theme parks totally enjoyable and never faced absurd crowds. For golfers, Disney is fantastic. I played the Palm and another one that starts with a "C" and they were amazing. Again the Disney organization and the hotel, made this easy. I highly recommend a dinner at Todd English's The Blue Zoo. Again a complete surprise to find one of the nation's top sea food restaurants in Disney. We also went to the Grand Floridian's celebrated Victoria and Albert restaurant which was fantastic but not as exceptional as the Blue Zoo (a concierge recommendation). I had a disagreement about a taxi charge and within a minute a manager called and said, "no problem. Sorry for the inconvenience and the charge is already eliminated". For all you dads out there, Disney doesn't suck. You'll have a great time. Enjoy the rides, investigate and hit some of the wonderful restaurants and play some golf and tennis. I'm already planning our next visit to the Grand Floridian in January. I'm a believer!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian - worth every dime”
Reviews.Author: Gary_LA
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Grand Floridian for one week and thoroughly enjoyed our stay. I travel often for business and have a rather broad background for comparison. This hotel is one of the finest I have ever stayed. The rooms are very clean, service overall is excellent, and just a great experience. I recommend the main building, particularly room 4001. The view is great.

Reviews.Title: “Honest Great Review”
Reviews.Author: nikki2910
Reviews.Content: I have read these reviews with interest. First of all, the queues at disney are big BUT if you do your homework and dont go in peak season like some people! and use your disney fast passes, then its not a problem at all. the resort itself is upper market and i agree it is more of an adult hotel but only because it gives disney magic with the added benefit of an upper market stay. I have no hesitation of recommending this hotel, staff are friendly and go out of their way to be nice, its like everything if you are ruide to them then they will not go out of their way to help you back. Its worth having a lagoon view room though as the pool views and esp the marina view is always noisy. The hotel room was spotless and i felt it was a very magical stay, so magical that i intend to stay there again next year. Please dont believe the bad reviews, yes its expensive but hey! youre in disney this is what you should expect, well worth it though in my opinion! Monorail is best option, buses come frequently too for this hotel. Other resorts have crowded buses and you wait for up to an hour for a bus (if youre lucky enough to fit on one with all the other people being picked up first). the extra money is so worth it once you realise how convenient everything is at this hotel. Restaurants are expensive BUT this is disney there are hundreds of restaurants inside & outside of disney. The boat hire is so much fun too. Well worth going!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: gdakma
Reviews.Content: We stayed the Disney's Grand Floridian hotel and spa on July 25-29. Our whole family loved it!!! It was a bit pricey, but hey, we were on vacation! We stayed in a garden view room. It had two full sized beds and a daybed. It was a good size for all five of us. My kids enjoyed the activites they offered. My two girls (10 & 4) had a tea party with Alice in Wonderland and my son (6) took a grand adventure in cooking class and loved it! We all enjoyed going to the pool. The Grand Floridian has two pools. One is a regular pool with a small kiddie pool. The other is a zero depth entry pool. This one also has a waterfall and huge waterslide. My kids prefered the one with the waterslide. One night we did a character dinner. The characters included Cinderella, Prince Charming, The Fairy God Mother, and her mice friends. My kids loved this! They had a kiddie buffet and one for the adults. My husband and I loved the food! Be sure to try the strawberry soup! Yummy!!! My kids loved that the characters came to our table. All of them stopped by at least twice. Overall I would highly recomend this hotel. The staff was really friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Not Bad”
Reviews.Author: TRAVELLER-1989
Reviews.Content: This hotel is really average. We were expecting someting of a paradise in disney as this was supposed to be the best hotel, but unfortunately even this was the same chaos as all the other places in Disney World. I repeat previous comments that the hotel is too big for the facilitys available, the pool is always packed except at like 2am! The rooms were a good size, but our balcony was filthy and the bathrooms are in need of replacement. Our mini bar was really dusty, and the bathroom really smelt! Another problem was that we were put next to the lifts which gives you a defening night of endless screaming children and the movement of the lift up and down. Our sink in our room was also blocked. Another major problem we had was that the cards you get from the hotel to get into the park were constantly not working i think we changed them about 8 times in a 5 night stay! The staff printed the wrong names on the cards all the time which caused alot of confusion. And a word of warning do not let them deliver your luggage to your room unless you dont mind being stuck in the same clothes you have been on the plane on for about 4 hours! Restaurants are ok, but breakfast is hectic and the whole hotel needs a really good refurbishment. Disney is a horrendous holiday destination in my opinion, i mean we knew it would be busy but it was horrendous. even at 2 am for the extra hours we were queing for 45 mins to get on a ride. There are simply too many people and hotels for the resort facilities and Parks disney has available. Orlando Universal was a much better destination as there is only 3 hotels. If you think you will be getting a retreat at the floridian you are much mistaken!

Reviews.Title: “I wasn't impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ruby921
Reviews.Content: I've heard so much about this hotel and my sister was so looking forward to staying here. We went in late May. I wasn't impressed. It was nice, but a ripoff for the money. The room was a bit bigger than most hotel rooms but not by much. The bathroom was fancy, but I've stayed in nice hotels with nice bathrooms before. Other than the chocolates on the turned-down bed at night, I don't feel like we got any special treatment. Not even a free USA Today! The hotel is huge so it's a hike to go anywhere. The cafeteria-style restaurant was messy and the arcade is shoved in there. There were lines every time we needed something from the concierge or the front desk. We went to the pool late one night after the fireworks (it's open 24 hours) and there were no towels. I called for some and was told pretty much tough luck. The pool was packed with people most of whom were looking for towels and they couldn't be bothered to restock the towels? I just was very disappointed and will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Disney Resort!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from an 8 night stay at Disney's Grand Floridian Resort. Every little detail was flawless! From our room, to our view, to the food, everything was fantastic! The staff is friendly and courteous, the location ideal, and the rooms immaculate! The pool is open 24 hrs for those sticky Florida nights after a long day at the parks! Great for the kids! Character breakfast and dinner available. We will stay here every visit! Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutely loved this hotel!! I now call it my home. I can't wait to stay there again in my upcoming visits to Disney. The service and rooms were awesome and the food was amazing!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed at the Grand Floridian for three days. We received excelennt service. If you can swing it, stay on the Concierge floors. We were greeted by name by a concierge and were checked in, our luggage stowed (our room wouldn't be ready for a few hours due to our arrival time), and were in the park in about a half hour. Our stay was quiet, peaceful and luxurious. We had some treatments at the Spa which were wonderfully relaxing. We didn't have time to use the whirlpool within the spa, but it looked very inviting. The Grand Floridian is on the Monorail system which makes transportation easy within the parks, and having access to the park earlier and later than the regular hours is also useful for those really popular rides.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place To Visit”
Reviews.Author: Jollydodger
Reviews.Content: We have always stayed at deluxe hotels when we stay on property. We have always had good luck and this time was no different. We stayed in the main building, off on a wing that was overlooking the pool area. The hotel itself is very attractive and clean, as are the grounds. The transportation to the Magic Kingdom is one stop on the Monorail, and from the Magic Kingdom it is one stop via boat, very quick and easy. We were on the floor that had the food on it, in the main lodge. I have been told the whole main building is concierge level, and there is always something set out to eat, anytime of day up to 10 PM. Very good snacking and even light breakfast which makes things super quick and easy. Things were very quiet even thought it was a very busy time of year, spring break. There really wasn't any Spring Breakers staying at this hotel, so it was very relaxing. We have been to Cabo and Atlantis on Spring break and you never know what these little bone heads are going to do next, which is not relaxing. You might think that the GF is too expensive for Spring breakers, but think again. Rooms at Cabo and Atlantis are half again more than average rates at the GF. I think it is just not that cool a place for this age group, so if you want to kick back, here you go. If you hate kids don't go to Disney period, they are everywhere, all the time. If you want more action there are plenty of other good hotels in the area that are not quite so sedate and are more "fun".

Reviews.Title: “Will not stay anywhere else but Grand Floridian!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian in Oct 2005, with my 3 1/2 and 20 month old. I think it was I felt the location was most important for us, especially with little ones. We spent most of out time at Magic Kingdom and The Floridian is lterally a hop skip and jump. The hotel was gorgeous, clean and beautiful. I'am a clean and germ freak, so the hotel passed my expectations. We were in Big Pine Key Building on the 1st floor, which was awesome. Right outside the doors was the pool. Yes, the hotel is pricey, but if your going to Disney and plan to stay at The Floridian you should not complain about money. I feel Disney is all about choices, you can go and spend a little money or alot, depending on priorities. The Halloween party at the Magic Kingdom was priceless!! The parade itself was worth the ticket price alone! Very happy, and are going back this October 2006, and staying at The Floridian again!

Reviews.Title: “You Will Love this Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: First time I have visited Orlando with my wife and 8 year old daughter. This was without doubt the best way to show the magic kingdom. Only one stop on the mono rail ony 5 minutes on the private motor launch. This was the best and most magical place I have ever staed in. In the evening when you are all done in you can sit in the waterside resturant or the terrace and listen to the fireworkshow with the music being played around you. The character dinners are excellent my daughter is at that age where everyone should live like a prncess and for 5 nights she did. You are only here once so if you can afford it do it and do it right. Rooms very comfortable with views onto the castle and lake, there are small speed boats that you can take out and speed past the contempary resort on route to the magic kingdom, it was kinda wasted on a 8 year old but let me tell you for a 39 year old it was magical. Get into the partk early, go at lunch and sit by the pool play on the slides and relax afterall thats what holidays are for.

Reviews.Title: “A great Disney hotel”
Reviews.Author: j1mb0b
Reviews.Content: OK, so there are a lot of reviews for this hotel here: and an equally wide variety of opinions (ranging from the "bestest hotel ever" to the mediocre). But there's one really important things to understand about this hotel that - as far as I see - hasn't been mentioned yet... The 5* rating refers to the hotel's rating ** in comparison to the other Walt Disney World Hotels **. So the rooms per se aren't going to blow you away and the staff, while helpful and personable, haven't quite grasped the difference between world-class style and great-for-kids Disney-fied atmosphere. They genuninely wish a "magical day" and deal with problems quickly, but members of les clés d'or they're not. But don't let it worry you! There are some really good (sometimes excellent) things about this hotel. Firstly, its location at one mono-rail stop away from the Magic Kingdom couldn't be better. You can spend time in the park, come back for Afternoon tea or a Concierge-room snack, and then return later on for Wishes (or whatever) refreshed and ready for more action. There's an excellent ratio of staff to customer, the decor, beaches and pools are all in fine condition - the pool was heated even though the outside temperature was approaching 100! - and the kids are as well behaved as you're going to get in Disney World - even if some little Princes and Princesses bordered on the spoilt and / or precocious. This counts for a lot if you're not bringing children to the hotel. It is definitely a pleasure spending time in the hotel and most certainly isn't just a "place to stay". Overall, I would recommend this hotel and - from what I can see - it's almost all good so don't fret too much about the type of room or its view. The restaurants, the bars, the lobby and reception are all open to everyone regardless of what type of room you're in. So for that reason, do think carefully as to whether it's really worth paying for the Concierge room. Yes, there's food on demand but what price convenience? I wasn't necessarily convinced I'd got value for money. In the It is definitely a pleasure spending time in the hotel and most certainly isn't just a "place to stay". When you're sat on the sandy beach, sipping a cocktail, with the wedding pavilion in the distance and your view is like the photos... That's when you realise: yes, I made the right decision on where to come.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is a relaxing break from the busy parks”
Reviews.Author: jjfrenz
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian is a relaxing oasis amid the lines and crowds of the Disney theme parks! Conceirge level was the best money I ever spent! We had a room in the main building and access to the conceirge lounge where some type of food buffet was nearly always available--free breakfast, lunchtime snacks, afternoon tea, evening wine and snacks, cupcakes w/sprinkles every night for the kids. Wow! We only paid for one meal a day because the choices were so generous at the hotel. The room was very nice, not like a 5 star New York Hotel, but the overall feel of the hotel was so relaxing that I felt that I got my money's worth. Because the hotel is so close to the Magic Kingdom, we could return to the hotel for an hour or two rest and get backto the park in about 10 min. My daughters loved the pool and playing in the sand. Now I'll never stay anywhere else when I visit Disney.

Reviews.Title: “I was very impressed!”
Reviews.Author: GAnn
Reviews.Content: I'd heard the Grand Floridian was very nice, and obviously very expensive, but I must say it was definitely worth the money. The minute we got off the Disney Magical Express (which, by the way, was a BREEZE and we were there Memorial Day weekend) everyone was so pleasant and helpful. We traveled with my 4 year old which is never an easy task, but immediately upon checking in they gave her some disney stickers and some crayons to keep her busy. Our room was in Sugar Loaf, which is a fantastic location next to the 24 hour pool, close to the boat launch AND the monorail. The room was very clean, charming and comfortable. Again, the staff members were amazing, leaving little chocolates on my daughter's stuffed animals and turning down the room. The food at the grill is great. Easy to pick up and take with you. And AGAIN, every where we went the staff stopped us to check in and see if we needed anything. My only complaint was the 1900 Park Fare restaurant. I thought it would be neat to have dinner with Cinderella, but it's definitely not worth the wait. Food was only so-so, it's very crowded, and try as she might, Cinderella can't stay long with your child. We happened to run into Alice from Alice in Wonderland at the Magic Kingdom the next day and that was a much more pleasant experience! Checking out was a breeze. We didn't check bags b/c we only stayed 3 days, but the valet service arrived 5 minutes after calling them and they kept our bags for us all day while we visited the last park. The head conceirge also went out of his way for us when we returned to wait for our bus back to the airport. My exhausted daughter was cranky and crying and he found us a quite spot on the 4th floor to let her rest. It was extrememley helpful. The hotel is also a short ride by boat or monorail to the MK. I'd suggest monorail there and take the boat back. All in all, I'm glad I spent the extra money to stay there. I'd go back in a heart beat. LOVED IT.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Time!!!”
Reviews.Author: kdlkclmj
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay with three adult couples. The grounds are absolutly beautiful, everything was convenient. The rooms are clean & comfortable and the linens and pillows were outstanding. We had a pool view which was lovely..the lagoon view is even better! We dined at Gasperillos grill which has a great view and is open 24 hours. Citricos which is fine dining...great ambiance...the food was o.k. we had breakfast at the Cafe every morning and it was very good with a nice variety. The highlight of our trip was our dining experience at Victoria & Alberts...the food was out of this world and so was the price...but if you are celebrating and want to splurge this is the place to do it. Eight amazing courses, all done to perfection. It wasn't just a meal, but an experience. The men enjoyed a day of golf at the Osprey ridge...transportation was provided by the hotel. The women spent the morning at the spa which was very relaxing. Prepare to WALK!!! The monorail is great to the Magic Kingdom. we had to take 2 to get to Epcot, and you still have to take a bus to the Animal Kingdom and MGM which makes several stops along the way. We visited Pleasure Island one night and found it to be not very Disneylike, dirty, rowdy, big police presence, very young crowd. We preferred pina colodas by the pool and drinks in the hotel lounge!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 6th Anniversary at GF was fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: dcmartin
Reviews.Content: When we arrived the front desk wished us a happy anniversary and upgraded us from a garden view to a lagoon view of the castle. We had a dormer room with a balcony and a cathedral ceiling. IT was beautiful. The first night when we got back to the hotel there was a signed photo of Mickey and Minnie wishing us a happy anniversary, a bottle of champagne and glasses which we were told to keep. The room was wonderful and not too small. The view of the castle and the Contemporary were fantastic although the trees did sort of obscure the view........but I do not care! It was fantastic. And at night we could watch the water light parade off our balacony. This was by far the best vacation we have had at WDW so far. Being on the monorail system was a good perk too. I would highly recommend the GF to anyone. Oh, and the grounds, pools, beach....it all was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We travel often as we live in Florida and like to take advantage of the oppurtunity. We just spent the night at this hotel and a night at the Animal Kingdom. Lodge The Lodge was not great at all and we will not stay there again. No one did anything wrong to us but the hotel just did not fit us. The GF on the other hand was beautiful. The room was so comfortable and our view was of the pool. No noise, no dirty room, no dissapointments in anyway. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Flo”
Reviews.Author: sidlow42
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian Hotel for six nights in March 2006 with our two children (aged 6 & 7) and my parents. We had two rooms with inter-connecting doors which helped to add a sense of space (as the rooms are not particularly large). The rooms, hotel and grounds were kept spotlessly clean throughout our stay and the staff were friendly and helpful. Also the children's club at the hotel, although small (taking a maximum of 12 kids only) was very friendly and my children really enjoyed the three evenings that they spent there. This gave the adults a chance to enjoy eating at Narcoose's and the Grand Floridian Cafe at the hotel which were both excellent. We used the room service (called Private Dining) quite a lot as it was very convenient for an early breakfast before setting off for the park. The food was always on time and of a good standard. The best things about this hotel are the ambience and the location for the Magic Kingdom. We all had a wonderful time and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again if we wanted to be close to the Magic Kingdom park.

Reviews.Title: “It's the property you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SFBayMommy
Reviews.Content: The thing about this place is: it's the property and the experience you pay for. No doubt, ridiculously expensive - but by far, amazing extras: the pools are the BEST for families; the boat ride option to the park: GREAT; the monorail station, spa and 24-hour kids restaurant on property are all what makes it worth the dough. The rooms are really not that great. We stayed here two years in a row and neither room was that grand - but it was the PLACE that must make it ok to charge that much money. And the Spa wasn't that great either, fyi. I'd only stay here again if I didn't have to pay for it (again).

Reviews.Title: “Stolen diamond ring ... Poor WDW Security!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our visit to this lovely hotel was clouded by the theft of my diamond ring from my personal belongings in my hotel room. WDW Security showed little interest in pursuing an investigation. I got the Orange County Sheriff's Dept involved and the detective on the case has been most conscientious ... without much help from WDW Security. Another similar incident happened in the hotel around the same time. There are many emplyees who have access to the hotel rooms, so beware and be careful!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Ambience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
