Reviews.Content: Igive it 5 stars when we first checked in we were greeted by an array of charcters contuing our way to the pool we stopped in the conceirge lounge having a nice afternoon tea then entered are rooms with the clothes already unpacked from the staff our dazzling rate per night was $695 a great rate overall the resort went above and beyong to make our stay at disney luxirous!

Reviews.Title: “Triplecheck your spa reservations”
Reviews.Author: NewLondonCTAdrift
Reviews.Content: We called in January to make reservations at the Grand Floridan Spa for a massage and facial during our visit in March. My husband recalled the person he spoke to was sort of cavalier about the whole process. We arrived an hour early only to be told our appointments had been scheduled for the previous day. We were charged as a "no show" and since the spa is only affiliated with WDW, you are dealing with a different company so your recourse is limited. Luckily we still had enough time during our stay to be rescheduled. The staff was understanding about it. Oddly, the other reservation we made in January for the same day for dinner at Artist Point at Wilderness Lodge was correct. We frequently encounted other families at different venues arguing about incorrect reservations as well. Over all our stay was wonderful but as we all know in Disney World, time is money.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury at it's best.”
Reviews.Author: lcuibelloxo
Reviews.Content: Staying at Disney's Grand Floridian Resort and Spa was overall magnificent. The serivce was outstanding. I remember the first night, I called for extra pillows it felt as if minutes from when i hung up the phone, someone was knocking on our door. For people who have never stayed inside of Disney it's a MUST. All of Disney's Hotels are marvelous but the Grand Floridian is the most luxurious. You've got your values for kids and the adventure type but here, is a place were u enjoy yourself along with beutiful landscaping, guest rooms, pools, and lagoon beaches. Also, Magic Kingdom is only a monrail or ferry boat away. Also, sine you are so close to magic kingdom, it is unimaginable to get a room without some sort of view of the park. Fireworks are agreat to watch from the lagoon beach. Please e-mail me with any questions. You willl definitly enjoy your stay

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Convenient, Luxurious & Worth the Price!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back a few weeks ago from our stay at the Grand Floridian. We arrived late on a Thursday night, and we had reserved a garden view room. Upon arrival, they had upgraded us to a lagoon view room! (I had faxed them a few days earlier to tell them it was my husband's 30th birthday, I also called to let them know) So when we walked into the room, there was a birthday cake on the table! It said Happy 30th birthday amd it was SOOOO GOOOD! Our view was outstanding, the lagoon, the castle, space mountain, and the monorail! The room was beautiful. It isn;t huge, but it did fit a king size bed, a couch and table comfortably. We also had the room with the arched cielings which meant we had the smaller balcony, but it was big anough for the two of us to sit out there, eat our cake and enjoy the view! The staff was wonderful there, so nice and friendly. They were always helpful, even when my husband and I needed anew key to our room because we left it in the room when we went to go get a drink at midnight! The restaurants there are very good. We ate at the 24 hour Gasparilla Grill a couple of times, and they had pretty good food. We really liked the pizza at lunch and the chicken fingers. Breakfast was normally a quick muffin or chocolate croissant (yum!). We also ate at 1900 Park Fare for a character buffet breakfast and that was outstanding! I think it was 20 dollars for all you can eat. The atmosphere was fabulous, the staff was great and the food was delicious. (Try the strawberry soup!!) We also dined at Citricos on Valentines's Day and it was wonderful. Pretty pricey, but very good. They brought us free dessert, lemon cheescake and for a person who doesn't like lemon, I ate every bite and wanted more.My meal was just ok, I had fish and spinach risotto. Can't recall the fish but it was very good, but the risotto was too watery, I like it thick and creamy. So that was my only complaint. We sat in front of the Kitchen so it was neat to watch the Chef's. Again the staff was great. It was too cold to use the pool or beach area (it was literally a record low of 32 degrees while we were there) so all I can say is those areas looked really nice!! The lobby was grand and beautiful. Everything there is clean and spectacular. It's like walking into an 18th century hotel, with all the grandeur. There is a band at night in the lobby that plays big band music and a little restaurant that serves high tea with scones and sandwiches! Everything is so cute! There is also a hair salon (came in handy when my shampoo bottle exploded) and the monorail is one stop from the Magic Kingdom. Overall, I would highly recommend this hotel. It is highly priced, but if you go during value season (we did) and try to get a AAA rate, you may not pay as much (we had a huge discount) and with a free upgrade, it actually really made the stay worth the money. 6 nights of heaven! We were sad to leave!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grown-up hotel”
Reviews.Author: planningzone
Reviews.Content: I did not stay here but I walked the property, had a drink and listened to the piano and the Jazz band upstairs. The property is very nice. You can either take a boat across the lake to the Magic kingdom or take the monorail (it is only one stop). It is better suited for couples or families with teenage kids. There was also a big convention when I was there.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I absolutly love this hotel. The rooms are huge, the monorail is a must for conveincy, and the general atmosphere is amazing. The Victorian styling mixed with Disney charm will excite you. Disney's best hotel, hands down.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: sekhmetgoddess
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at the Grand Floridian and it did not disappoint. We were upgraded at check-in and stayed on the concierge level on the first floor. The room was lovely and spacious and kept very neat and clean by our housekeeper. The concierge food and drinks were awesome to say the least. The fabulous restaurant on site, Victoria and Albert's, is not to be missed. We ate there and it was hands down one of the best gourmet experiences we have ever had. The convenience to the parks was also wonderful. We definately want to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice, in a Disney sort of way”
Reviews.Author: IslandChief
Reviews.Content: Nice enough, but not a luxury hotel by any means. I had a reasonable conference rate, but I note that the Tripadvisor average price is $400+/night - the place is certainly not worth that. Has the same saccharine quality that all the other Disney resorts have. Had to lug my own bags to my (rather remote) room like a pack mule.

Reviews.Title: “Best Vacation Ever”
Reviews.Author: EJFudster
Reviews.Content: We researched this family vacation for months, and when it came time to decide, we knew we wanted to go all out and stay at The Grand Floridian. We went the week after Thanksgiving so we could take advantage of the slower time in the park plus the Holiday celebrations. We stayed in a Concierge level room in the Main Building. For our family of four, which includes our 3 and 5 year old, we found two queen beds in our room to be more than ample. We had plenty of room. The room was impeccably clean, and the maids were fabulous. The added touch of washcloth animals is one my children still talk about. They couldn't wait to get back to the room each day to see what the wonderful maids left. Tipping them daily was a pleasure for all the little extras they provided for my family. We chose to spend the money on a Concierge level room, and for us, it was a decision we have never regretted. We would do it again in a heartbeat. The daily food presentation made our lives much easier, especially first thing in the morning and the end of the night. And all the reservations the Concierge staff helped us with made everything so much easier. They assisted us with all our dining experiences, both character and non-character, so that when we arrived, our trip was completely planned for us. And once we were there, the modifications we wanted to make were handled with ease. The Concierge staff is superb. We requested a room with a Magic Kingdom view, which they were able to accommodate, so watching the fireworks at night from our balcony was perfect. And the bedtime stories on the TV was a great nightly event, as the kids were asleep before the stories ended. The turn-down service turns this channel on for you, and so the kids come in looking excited to hear a final story for the evening. Our absolute best meal of the entire vacation was breakfast at the Grand Floridian Cafe. And we ate quite a bit all over the parks and the restaurants, but this was the best! The pools were great, and we spent as much time as we could taking advantage of them as well. We will only return to Disney World and stay in a Concierge level room in the Main Building. It's a lot of money, but we felt we more than got our money's worth and don't regret a single penny. For a family vacation, it was perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Flordian - Sugar Loaf Key”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We loved the Grand Flordian but we lucked out and got upgraded to the concierge building (Sugar Loaf Key) Our only problem was the long wait for our room (two hours) Breakfast, lunch snacks and dinner snacks were served in the main lobby (daily) and cocktails were served in the evening. The room was lovely and the maid service was wonderful. I enjoyed it very much and I feel it was worth the $500.00 per night. I'm thankful we didn't experience some of the horror stories I've read on this review board .. I most enjoyed the quick transportation (monorail or boat) to MK and Epcot.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome, Awesome, Awesome”
Reviews.Author: DisneyFanNY05
Reviews.Content: We went to Disney on our Honeymoon, at first we selected the Port Orlens Resort but decided to go all out since it was our honeymoon. The price was high however EVERYTHING was GREAT, from the moment we walked in. They took care of us as if we owned the place. We had took advantage of the Disney dining plan which I must say you have to do. With it you don't have to worry about how much to spend on eating, we ate dinner at a couple of restaurants there where one meal was over $100.00 for my wife and I. Anyway everything was so gourgeous, from the decorating in the main building with the live band nightly to the actual room. We could not have asked for anything better. The magic kingdom was only seconds away on the monorail which made it great if you wanted to leave the park for a mid day shower or lunch. Anyway the price is a little restrictive however the service level is extraordinary, well worth the trip. It was a once in a life time trip for us and we were glad we did it!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Grand time at the Grand!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I normally do not write things of this nature, but sometimes an experience just touches you in a way you cannot forget. My recent visit to the Grand Floridian was simply amazing. The concierge staff especially was terrific. I would love to thank Robert and Sharon for making me feel like family while we were here. It was my husband and my anniversary. This year was very special to us since he is a recent survivor of cancer and this trip was a renewal of everything for us. Robert and Sharon provided excellant service. Each night there was a new magical experience for us. Champagne in the room, signed cards from Mickey and Minnie, and best of all their devotion in making us feel welcomed. Another person who I would like to thank is Manager DJ. His smile and personal attention made our tired toes and weary bodies happy by just hearing his hello. You really have amazing talent and I cherish all of them. And next time I visiting during Halloween with a costume. I never knew I could dress up and trick or treat like a kid again and at Magic Kingdom. Wow!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic time”
Reviews.Author: Londonred
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Floridian for 4 nights, (2 adults and 2 kids - 6 and 4). We had stayed at the Polynesian last year, and although the location was very good, we found the hotel disappointing. No such problem with the Grand Floridian! We stayed on the 4th floor of the concierge level in the main building. Check-in and check out were a breeze, anything we needed booked was taken care of imediately, the continental breakfast, afternoon tea and evening drinks and hors d'ouerves were awesome and well worth the little extra money. The room are nice, although a bit 'lacy' but that is the theme of the hotel. Bed linens and towels are changed every day, and the hotel itself is spotless - quite an achievement with all the kids around. The location is great for the Magic Kingdon - 1 stop on the monorail. The pools are excellent with plenty of towels at all times. I would really recommend the Grand Floridian to anyone - we will definitely stay there again. One small point - many other reviewers refer to the cost. Anything Disney is going to be expensive - they are a business with a monopoly. If you want to stay an hour away from the Magic Kingdom in a mainstream hotel for USD 120 a night you can do, but you will miss the magic of staying on sight, the extra park hours open to resort guests and the shear convenience of being so close to the parks, especially with young children who can tire so quickly.

Reviews.Title: “"Magical at Christmas"”
Reviews.Author: CANADIAN2006
Reviews.Content: Simply the marque Hotel property for the Disney Company. This trip (due to late booking) our Family Stayed at the Swan/Dolphin Hotel, the "excellent" Animal Kingdom Lodge (see reviews) and the Grand Floridian. I was expecting something simular to the Grand Californian at Disneyland, but I must say this was far more elagant, done in true Disney Style. This was our first trip to Florida and to a Disney theme park at Christmas time. For a family that has been to Disneyland over 10 times, going at Christmas time was very different and special (I recommend it to everyone). Pros: Don't want to spoil it -Just go visit you will see what I mean. Cons: Needs one or two more restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Not for the busy body”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i went to Walt Disney World for a week long vacation, it was her first time but my third. I decided to stay at the Grand Floridan because i felt that it would be the perfect place for the both of us to enjoy ourselfs. We stayed in the Garden View room in the Conch Key Building. All of our request were met except for the one for a king size bed. The room was very homelike and gave you a sense of comfort, the bed was very soft and the view was wonderful. The bad part about were we stayed was that when it started raining there was no escape and you are going to get wet. Being that we were very active the hotel really make you feel cozy when we returned from the park, which kind of made you tired really quick. Compaired to the Yacht Club were we visited a friend the Grand Floridan was sitting still, But all in all the hotel was very nice but it is not worth the price that they have the rooms for and I would stay there again but it wouldn't be my first choice.

Reviews.Title: “Top Drawer”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What Can I say........everything was perfect!!!!....I tried to find fault on our second visit (we went 2004.......yep we were there for hurricaine Charlie which they handled brilliantly...loved it so much we weent back in 2005) but alas could only find one fault.That was they forgot to leave the chocolates on the pillows one night...and thats it!!. Thoroughly recommend and so convenient for everything.Dont know why I am giving it such a good review because we probably wont be able to get in this year because everyone has booked it after reading this. Take no notice of the other reports I guess they are a one off.....and lets face it you cant please everyone!!!!! Try the burgers in the 24 hr cafe they are fab!!! ....and enjoy x

Reviews.Title: “Not that grand if you're not into lace”
Reviews.Author: Solange72
Reviews.Content: The layout: The splendor of this hotel is perhaps a matter of taste. It is ornate, busily decorated, lacy, pseudo-19th century. This, I realized as I arrived in the lobby of the GF, is not my cup of tea. It will be fabulous for those who enjoy Victorian style on steroids hybridized with mickey themes. The Polynesian resort seemed more natural, lively and interesting (we had b-fast there). The room: ours was facing courtyard pool and near a very noisy elevator (a very convincing rendition of the noise an early 20th century cage elevator would make in fact which amused us as we decided the horrid noise was in fact a magical disney touch). Day bed very convenient for 5th child. Room was spacious. Otherwise, the crazy queen from Alice in Wonderland on the bedspread, a nice balcony (not in January though), and a very very pleasant comfortable bed (thus we slept well despite elevator situation). Convenience: monorail on site is great but monorail is whimsical. It took us one hour at 11 pm to return from Epcot to resort (some kind of expansion issue) and thus we concluded that the plague of transportation inconvenience is unavoidable at WDW despite convenience of staying onsite. Will not stay there again, but mostly because of our lack of enthusiasm for the decor. Oh and magical express service was great: minimal wait, fast ride to airport, but I suspect it is alas whimsical as well.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasent, but not worth the cost.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand for our honeymoon. We had the platinum package add on, entitling us to concierge and "the best of the best". We were met at the door from our concierge, given a tour and taken to our room. It was a nice room, huge bed, wonderful balcony. And the grounds and lobby are fantastic. However, this is Disney, and children are abundant. We had a screaming 3or4 year old next door, who sounded as she were in the room with us. We could also hear conversations (not loud, just normal) from our neighbors. And if we could hear them, they could hear us. We called concierge because my husband had forgotten his comb, and requested one, forty minutes later, we recieved it. Our bathtub, while huge, had a clogged drain, 2 days after I called, it was repaired. We thought they took a little long responding to our requests. Room service is wonderful! Always on time, and prepared how we requested,however, on our plan all of our meals were free, and after looking at my bill we were charged, not once but three times for room service. We were also charged for our "complimentry" spa service, valet parking, (we had no car, we flew), and minibar charges that we did not use. Mistakes do happen, but to rectify those mistakes took days, I was still dealing with getting refunds 14 days after I returned home. The spa is great though! The lobby served wonderful snacks throughout the day, as well as coffees, teas, and sodas. We really did not recieve any special treatment from the hotel for our honeymoon, but the parks and other resturants made up for this. Victoria and Alberts is phenomenal! The $300plus price was included in our plan, but is WELL worth the cost! The grounds of the hotel were nice, but the fountain outside the main pool was out of order the full seven days that we were there, and filthy. Small detail I know, but for 14thousand dollars to stay there, you would think they would pay more attention to the "small" details. All in all, the hotel is nice, convenient to Magic Kingdom,(took less than 5 min most days) the Contempary, and Epcot. But for the money, I would recommend the Boardwalk or the Yacht club. Just as nice, if not nicer, and almost half the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Magical”
Reviews.Author: jenjen89
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my husband, son, daughter and mother. My mom is very hard to please. This hotel met her expectations and she will go back. The hotel was quiet and the beds were great. It is so magical there. You can hear the "Cinderallabration", the opening in the morning and the train whistle. We loved it. The Christmas fireworks and the Electrical parade were beautiful. The dining was over priced and the food wasn't that great, but it was still worth it to see the look on my 6 year old's face as she saw the characters at the meals. Is it overpriced? Yes. But it is Disney. I think the prices are probably in line with other resorts. The magical express was a disaster. We had to wait in line for quite some time until my mom pitched a fit. People were actually thanking my mom for speaking up. We felt like cattle in that line. The hotel was beautiful everyone but my husband agreed to go back, I guess when you're the guy paying the bills you think twice!

Reviews.Title: “Really bad service”
Reviews.Author: islesoul
Reviews.Content: Since we go to WDW every December we decided to go the Grand Floridian this December for our 40th anniversary. We booked the honeymoon room which is located on second floor of Main Building. I've heard many negatives reports but thought sour grapes. So off we went Dec 4th. Got at the resort at 9:30am & was taken up to 3rd floor to check in. The person was very nice & said he would have room ready as soon as previous guests checked out at 11am. So we went over to MK, had lunch, rode some rides. Then we called at 1:30pm and he said it was ready. We headed back over & no room. He said he would see when next room would be ready. He came back & said 15 minutes just relax & have something to drink. So far okay. After an hour no room. Another person asked if we needed anything, we said we were waiting for our room. He checked & said one was ready. The concierge manager took us to our room. He asked if there was a special event that brought us to the GF we said yes & told him. After relaxing we went to the Christmas Party & came back around 9pm to find a platter of chocolate covered strawberries which I ordered for Monday so I thought they made a mistake. That night the noise level was way too loud but we over looked it. I mentioned to the person I ordered the strawberries that they brought it to us a day early & to cancel that night's she said she would call. (We saw the manager who asked if we liked the strawberries he gave us on the house? I said yes but he should have put that in the note.) That night more strawberries. Ok, she did say she would take them off bill. Ha! That night noise was louder than before called down to front desk since it was after 10pm & said they would check into it. It got worse between midnight until 4:30am, sounded like they were doing work on the building. Also TV didn't work, hair dryer didn't work. While hubby was getting ready the next day, I walked down to talk to another concierge, told him about the noise & other problems, please note there was other people complaing about contruction noises during early morning. He said he would look into it & he said he would give me a credit of half that night room rate we paid $615 plus taxes. I said I wasn't looking for that but wanted something done about the noise & other problems. He said he wanted to give some of it back. Nice touch so I thought. Later that night, more noise so I went down & talked to yet another person who came back to room & he said he didn't know what the noise was but he had another room on same floor. Okay so we changed hoping for the best & all the problems would go away. After having some dinner we came back to room, hubby said no working TV even though we tried it before we left for dinner. When trying to use toilet it didn't flush. Plus hair dryer didn't work. So we called down & reported this. He had a man up to check out toilet, he said it needed to be replaced all together, try not to use toilet paper & flush twice but to make sure it didn't over throw. This is not funny. He did replace the TV & said he would replace hair dryer the next day along with a new toilet. Andy called & said he heard what was going on & asked if we could be out of our room by 9am the next day, said yes, he said he was sorry but this too can be fixed.Oh postive side no noise. Next day, we stopped by desk to remind them about putting in new toilet & hair dryer. The guy even called while we were still there. So we thought all was okay finally. Came back around 2pm & no toilet replaced or hair dryer. And toilet didn't even work. We walked back to the desk and said what was going on? The lady was shocked that they didn't do the work. I reminded her we wasted about a total of a day with working out these problems which shouldn't have happen in the so call cream of the top resort in WDW. She called the maintaince manager who came up to our room & told us he just got yelled at by his boss & now it was our turn to yell at him. I just looked at him & said I wasn't going to yell but wanted to know why after there was a work order to do these things. (A good thing we came back as we were going to stay at MK for late closing if we did that no toilet.) He said he would replaced it & he didn't know why it wasn't. He had the two guys that was suppose to do come up. He asked them why didn't they follow instructions on a work order. All they could say we thought they would save the resort some money. I looked at them & asked if they would like to pay me what I paid for a room that didn't have a working toilet for a day & half? They said no they wouldn't like that. The manager told me it would be replaced & he would stay to make sure. After 4pm it was ready & working. We had dinner & went back to MK though we were rather in a grumpy mood over how we were being treated. To make a story short, when we checked out on Saturday morning, we wasn't given a credit even though I had the paper work. I checked over the bill & saw that they charged us for two orders of strawberries. I said I wasn't paying for something the staff gave us. He said he would take both off & give us the credit that wasn't on checkout bill even though it was in the computer. He said he was sorry that knew we had a bad week there & hoped we would give them another chance. I didn't say anything but Andy was there & knew I wouldn't come back next year with our son & his wife. We lefted saying thank goodness that is over with & hubby said he was sorry that he didn't listen to me about how much it was costing after he complained about our trip to the USVI being too much like only $2500 beachfront at the Morningstar at Frenchmen's reef. We paid over $5400 for 6 nights at the GF. A sour taste was left in my mouth Sunday when I checked my Disney Visa online & saw a $300 room charge. I called back down & talked to a front desk manager who looked it up & saw what was wrong, when they gave us a credit they didn't punch in a code therefore a charge instead of credit so I was charged twice even tough my paper work said a credit due me. He said he work take care of it & call me back. He did but said the department that handles it was closed on Sunday, he would do it first thing Monday & call me back before he left at 3pm today. No call back & when I called, he left at 1:45pm. I asked the person to have him looked into the matter that he & I talked about Sunday & call me back on Tuesday. She said she would leave a note. I think I will have better luck with Disney Visa but they said to try to work it out before I put in a dispute. Now I know some of you all loved the place, I didn't I went with open eyes & wasn't expecting so many problems, yes they tried to fix them but a little too late. I will never stay there again no matter what. I will say it is a lovely resort but they need to tend to rooms & the way they handle problems. These are my views so you might want to say thing about my report. Do so but you wasn't in our shoes and we know what we experienced.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Hotel, but way overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: NonGratis
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Grand Floridian the first week of December. This was our first time staying at this hotel. We have stayed at the Polynesian & the Wilderness Lodge before and have always wanted to stay at the GF. So, we saved up for a year and splurged on our concierge room. First, let me tell you about our Disney's Magical Express (courtesy airport pick-up, including your luggage)experience. While it was great to get on the bus directly to our hotel and not worry about our baggage, our bus driver was "hinting" that gratuities were not included in the bus ride. I think that was a bit tacky. We were personally greeted before entering the hotel lobby and were whisked away to the Sugar Loaf building, where we were imeediately checked in. Our room was ready before 12 noon which was nice. This hotel is gorgeous! Absolutely stunning! Don't know why people say it is run down and in need of repairs - not so! We are huge Disney fans and are always amazed at the service we receive, both inside and outside the parks. However, I read that the maids at this hotel were extremely friendly, and I don't think I encountered one friendly smile or hello or good morning from any of them. Some days our room was not made up until it was turn-down service, and one time it was never made up. While most of the concierges were always friendly, there were at least two who never smiled at you or even said hello. Very unfriendly! Oh well! I noticed that when some of the food items were gone, they were never replaced. The thing that really bothered me is that although they tell you the Sugar Loaf building can only be accessed by your hotel key since it is concierge, this is not true. ANYONE can enter the Sugar Loaf building through their back entrance and help themselves to the offerings. The hotel was decorated for Christmas and absolutely stunning. The grounds were beautifully docorated with tons of poinsettias, huge pre-lit white grape-vine reindeer, flowers, Christmas trees, etc. The Sugar Loaf is very quiet and we never had a noise problem. Very convenient location to the Main Bldg., pools, etc. We decided to go to Disney the first week in Dec. because it is supposedly the least crowded time to go.....NOT SO!!!!! I don't think there is a "slow period". We went to the Magic Kingdom 4 times and it was always crowded. They have this new "finger scan" that you need to do when entering the parks. You slip your admission ticket into the machines, and then you have to line up your fingers so they can tell that is indeed your ticket, and you are not using someone elses. Complete waste of time since mine never matched my fingers even though I used the same one the whole trip. It backs up the lines and takes long to get thru the turnstiles. I hope Disney does away with this useless process. While I love DisneyWorld, and l loved staying at this gorgeous hotel, it was not worth $370 per night and Disney should be ashamed of the way they rob people with their outrageous prices. I am no frugal miser, but $5 for 2 bags of chips for the kids? $200 for my daughter to have tea with Sleeping Beauty? $5 for a pen? C'mon!

Reviews.Title: “We Felt Like Movie Stars!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife & I stayed at the Grand Floridian for several days in November of '05. Although we have been to Disney World many times & stayed at most of the resorts there, Grand Floridian is now our favorite! When I read some of the negative reviews for this awesome resort, I get the feeling that these people wouldn't be happy anywhere. In fact, I met a few while we were there...griping about stupid stuff...mean to their kids, etc. Was it absolutely perfect?...no...but is anything ever perfect? Was it an overall great experience? Yes indeed! We got a complimentary upgrade to a concierge room (rm 4309 in the main bldg) It was fantastic! The great smell upon entering this room was memorable! Our complaints are so minor they are not even worth mentioning! We will definetely go back someday! One of the managers there (DJ) could not have been nicer! The atmosphere there is beyond words! When the jazz band wasn't playing, a piano player was. The view was awesome...fireworks from our balcony...how cool is that? And the soft mattresses...wow! No backaches from these beds! We watched the gingerbread house being built...it was fun to watch the progress! The fourth floor amenities were such a treat! The friendly staff...the elegant marble everywhere... the Victorian style uniforms ...the two awesome pool areas... the beach... I could go on & on. Overall, are things overpriced? Sure...but this should be expected not only at Disney, but any resort area. If you're a tightwad, you have the option of staying home... right? Overall, I have no regrets about spending the money. My wife & I had a wonderful vacation at the Grand Floridian. We hated to leave when we decided to go to the parks. Thanks for the experience Grand Floridian...see ya again someday! You made us feel like movie stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “MAGICAL”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian in September for 7 nights. It is a magnificent hotel. Our room was in Boca Chica which is near the large pool. The room was in excellent condition and very clean. I had made some special requests for medical reasons and they were all met without any problems. Our room had a lagoon view and also looked onto Cinderella's Castle we had a corner room which means not 1 but 2 balcony's. Although we did have a car the transport to Disney Parks from the Hotel was excellent. The Monorail is regular and fast. We only dined in the hotel a couple of times. We had breakfast at 1900 Park Fare which was probably the best breakfast of our trip. There was a wide selection of food which was replenished regularly and the staff were attentive. Alice & Wonderland and Winnie and Friends were present and spent a lot of time with all the diners. We also had breakfast in the Grand Floridian quick service restaurant which was fine. There is a lovely atmosphere at this hotel and the staff are all pleasant and ready to help. I would have return to this hotel without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Lack of Attention to Details”
Reviews.Author: MMRDAR5
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at several hotels in the Disney family in the past few years, this property being the highest end of them all. I was disappointed in several respects at the carelessness and lack of attention to details. Disney is proud of this property; I think they should be embarrassed. Here are a few examples: (a) our room was not cleaned until 5:30 in the evening on one day during our stay; when we were out at the Park from 10:00 (on our way out my wife called housekeeping to notify them that the room was available for service all day)(b) "cast members" who fail to say "please" and "thank you" to guests, (c) life guard at the pool who yelled at me because I was blocking her view of the pool, I looked after my 5-year old as he was swimming. Don't get me wrong, this is a lovely asset, and clearly the finest in the Disney Brand, however, I expect more from a 5-star asset, and as a result I rate my overall experience as AVERAGE.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As veteran Disney World travelers, my new husband and I really looked forward to staying at the Grand Floridian for our honeymoon. I'm happy to say our expectations were either met or exceeded on every point! We stayed in the Sugar Loaf Building, which offers Concierge services, continental breakfast, light snacks and deserts, soft drinks, wine, beer and cordials, all included in the nightly rate. All the food was wonderful, there wasn't a single item I'd tried that I didn't like, and there was plenty of it as the food was frequently replenished. My one small quible was that they don't really have enough places to sit in the mornings when it is the most crowded. For the rest of the day it's fine, but I do wish they had a few more tables in the mornings. We found our room to be large, well appointed, clean and quiet. I cannot understand how people can think a room that is about 440 square feet (source: Unoffical Guide to Walt Disney World) is small! It's exactly half the size of my condo! I guess there are people who just can't be pleased. Anyway, we were there for 6 nights and never heard a peep from our neighbors. The only noise we ever heard were people talking in the hallway outside our door, and that only happened twice the hole trip, and only for a moment or two. We had no issues with our housekeeper, our room was clean and ready each day upon our return from the parks no matter when we came back, and the turndown service was a very nice touch. Our building and all public areas were very clean and well kept, all room service trays and dishes were picked up in a timely manner, if we saw a tray out as we were leaving, it would be gone upon our return. We saw no evidence of trash or litter anywhere on the extensive grounds, and the landscaping was wonderful. The Concierge staff were kind, polite, and very helpful with every request we had, from purchasing park tickets to helping us change our reservation, we decided to leave a day early due to hurricane Wilma as we could not risk getting stuck in FL. Every Cast Member (Disney employee) we came across greeted us with a smile and a "Good Day". Cast Members in all four theme parks were also just as friendly and helpful. We ate at two of the restaurants there, Narcoossee's and the Grand Floridian Cafe. We had dinner our first night at Narcoossee's and we both enjoyed our appetizer and meals, the service was just fine. Our breakfast at the Cafe was also excellent, and we were treated to a free glass of champagne since we were on our honeymoon. We also ordered breakfast for room service our last morning there, it was delivered at the time requested, the hot foods hot and the cold foods cold, exactly as we'd ordered even down to my special request on my egg order. If you're wondering why we ate out for breakfast twice when continental offerings were available for free in the lounge, it was because while the lounge food was excellent, every once and a while I crave a hot breakfast that includes eggs and hashbrowns. It is not a reflection on the offerings in the Concierge lounge, which were terrific! The transportation to the parks via monorail, boats, and buses were frequent, most of the time we waited less than five minutes, only once did we wait longer than 10, and that was because we had just missed the bus and had to wait the full interval until the next one came along. The parks themselves were wonderful as always, clean and well maintained with helpful and friendly Cast Members. Truly a magical place! We highly recommend the Grand Floridian to anyone with the means to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “horrible stay, money stolen”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel quite a bit for medical conferences and this was the worst hotel stay I have ever had from a service stand point. Stayed at the GF for a wedding in October. The first night there after getting back from the rehearsal dinner, I could not get in my room. When I went to the front desk, they suggested I had gone to the wrong room and drew me a map! Needless to say, I was not at the wrong room, key still didn't work, went back, got a new key, that one didn't work. I had to go back again, there was no one at the desk this time. I had to ask the guy polishing the floors if he could find someone to help me. Really awful experience. It took almost 2 hours to get into my room and I got tons of attitidue from the night manager. The next night, $200 was stolen from my room while I was at the reception! I didn't want to deal with the night manager again, so I waited until morning to call, no manager was available. I didn't want it to ruin my day, so we spent the day in epcot. Came back and reported it then. That manager was kind, but overall the experience was just very negative. When I went to check out early in the AM on the last day of my stay, I asked the front desk person if I could leave my bags with someone while I got a cup of coffee. She informed me the valet was busy and I could just leave my bags in the lobby! As if....And for all my troulbes, all they could do for me was take 20% the one night I couldn't get in my room, this amounted to $60. Never got an apology, anything.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed Floridian at the Grand Floridian!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My daughter was singing with her chorus class in Walt Disney. My husband, son , daughter and I decided to stay at the Grand Floridian. We paid 1200.00 for one night. When we drove up, we were greeted out front and taken to go check in. The service was nice. The door man was friendly and the fact that we were staying on the upper floors and had access to all of the extras. I am a Florida girl. Grew up in Palm Beach. However, the suite we received was obviously two rooms put together and there was not even a roman size bath tub. Everything about the hotel was it was a hotel, pretending to be a grand hotel in Walt Disney. My husband and I considered renewing our wedding vows there, however the wedding pavillion is not secluded enough. There was a wedding going on and outsiders were able to walk up and watch. Even one man in a speedo stood there and watched the couple taking their vows. For the price, I would not recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Grand lobby, poor overall.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What? Resort Review Where? Grand Floridian - Royal Palm Club When? September 17th - 22nd 2005 We had been planning our stay at WDW for many months. It was to be our first WDW trip together and a very special one at that as we got engaged whilst there. We'd made a number of PS reservations beforehand, some of which were changed due to extra magic hours. Several emails / phone calls later we had confirmation of what we expected to do. For our holiday we had planned to stay at the Polynesian followed by the Beach Club. In July we discovered that we would no longer be staying at the Poly as the concierge rooms were due for refurbishment in Sept. Unfortunately for us, we found out this information not from Disney but from a third party website. WE actually contacted Disney to discuss it. We had not heard from them and it was just two months until we were due to arrive. After much discussion on the phone (internationally - at our expense), we were offered a room at the GF instead. Initially we thought this was fantastic. For most people (including us) staying at the GF is but a dream - it looks amazing from the pictures and sounds great from the reviews. Did we set our expectations too high? Read on... Having arrived after a long flight, I was a little upset not to be met / welcomed by anyone at the hotel. Walking through the main doors, the grandness of the lobby and furnishings soon took my mind off this. We walked over to the main check in desk/area (still not welcomed) and explained we were concierge guests. After 5 mins or so of tapping away, the lady at check in confirmed we were concierge and that some one would come over to meet us. Whilst waiting we took in the atmos - the main lobby is very grand and has a welcoming feel to it. A concierge staff member came over to show us around the hotel, explain the services and show us to our room. We were asked if we could take our own bags with us! No offer for someone to come get them for us. So we trawled our bags around the hotel with us and finally headed up to L3 via the lift. I think the Concierge lady was trying to make a good impression because she'd chat to every guest we passed en route. On L3 we sat down with another Concierge staff member who talked us through the various services and what we'd booked. To our surprise, half of our PS reservations were wrong - despite having email confirmation of the various bookings beforehand. We decided to come back and sort this out later as we were quite tired from the flight. At this point we also realised that the Disney computer system does not link bookings - they had no idea we would need transferring to the Beach Club (BC) in a few days.... Anyway, we were led to our room and shown around - including the super long * :-) * balcony. We were in room 4209. Pretty standard room with an unusually large balcony. No fridge though - which we then asked for. The balcony was dirty - obviously not maintained. I could tell the Concierge lady spotted this too, but still left it to me to ask her to get someone to clean it. Looking out over the balcony I could also see the paint coming off in various places. Shortly after she left the room, we started to unpack. Despite the minor issues, we were still overwhelmed to be in the GF and were keeping a happy face on things. The next day we asked about getting a fridge and checked that the balcony would be cleaned. We also changed the PS bookings to what we were expecting (using L3 concierge). We returned at the end of the day to find that no fridge had arrived and that the balcony had only been half cleaned (I took a digital photo of what remained for proof). The balcony was still dirty. If we had children, we would not have allowed them out there - serious. In the end we decided to clean it as best we could - so we could at least sit down to enjoy the MK fireworks (of which we had a superb view!). This was an absolute disgrace in our opinion - remember this is a $700 per night room rate. We were expecting the best of the best, literally. Throughout our stay we found the GF staff to be the least helpful / pleasant out of all the places we visited or stayed. About 50% of the staff were helpful & willing to speak with us. The food however was very good - especially between 5 and 7 pm when various buffet style dinner items would be put out. There was also a good selection of drinks, including beers. My only gripe was that we had to keep asking for sodas - there never seemed to be any out when we were in the lounge (BC Concierge had plenty out). The day prior to check out started interestingly - with a Magical Express letter on the door saying we were leaving the next day and going back to the airport. Be VERY aware of this if you are staying at more than one hotel. We were told by a Concierge staff member that the reservations/booking system simply cannot cope with transfers (a mainframe system), even though we were told it would be ok before arriving. Bit more mess for us to sort out, but we did sort it out. On the last night in the GF, we were awoken at 12:40 am to a VERY loud sound - something that we can both only describe as some kind of power tool. This lasted for a few minutes on and off. We'd had enough and called the front desk at 12:55 am. After being on hold, we were told that someone would investigate and get back to us. Just a minute or two later we heard the sound of tools being dropped / moved from above us (it may sound wierd, but we actually heard a screw being dropped and roll on the floor above, so it was very close by). The noise started again shortly after speaking to the front desk, but this time further away. It would seem that they had simply made the decision to continue with works in another location - ie further away. It was the only conclusion we could come to. There was no way these noises were natural - we had been doing DIY at home before arriving and knew these noises oh too well (drilling / sanding vibrations). We eventually got to sleep at 3:30 am, deciding it was best to leave it till the morning. We were awoken again at 6:30 am by the same noises - which appeared to be getting closer again. I suspect we were so tired, that we just slept through it for 3 hours. No one from the front desk 'got back to us'. After 3 hrs sleep we were not happy and contacted the Concierge staff by phone that morning. We were very much awake by this point. They assured us that maintenance work does not occur during the night. We know what we heard and after explaining all to the Concierge staff, they said they'd speak to the hotel manager and get back to us. About 30 mins later they called back and again said that no works were going on. However, they offered us a 50% reduction for that night. So despite them saying that nothing was going on, they still offered us a refund....Yes. This reinforced to us that something was happening. Another guest we bumped into in the corridoor also confirmed hearing those types of noises that night, but they were much further away on the floor and were able to sleep through it (how I wish I'd got their contact details!!!). We arranged a late check out on this final GF morning but could get no more sleep as the day had started and works were now going on outside / in other buildings. Plus we still needed to pack in time for check out. We were shattered and annoyed to say the least. By this point, we were so looking forward to getting to the Beach Club and couldn't wait to check in. I never thought I'd actually want to get away from the GF. Our bags went across seperately a few hours later via the bell service (very useful - take advantage if transferring). Our stay at the Beach Club 5th Floor was 10/10. The staff were friendly, helpful and greeted us every time we passed, even if they had a guest with them. Even the bell man took time out to chat for 5 mins when bringing our bags up to the room. Customer Service is something the GF really seemed to lack in our opinion. The lack of sleep really affected our stay at the BC as we had so much planned and just couldn't do it all. My fiancee (Becky) stopped half way round the World Showcase at Epcot and just started crying because she was so tired but wanted to carry on and see it all. We also had to miss our 9.30 pm carriage ride at FW on our last day as we were just too tired to make it. So much planning and expense went into our holiday and we just feel that it was taken away from us - it made it feel pointless. The lack of sleep also made the overnight flight back home an absolute nightmare. We were not prepared to 'lose a day' just to catch up on sleep again - our 3 days left were just too precious. We are not going to stay at the GF again and are looking forward to a stay at the Poly / BC next year. The experience has not put us off Disney - everything else was just amazing. Based on our stay, we'd give the GF 3 to 4 out of 10. HOWEVER - please judge for yourselves, this is simply our experience. I know there are many out there that have had a magical stay and many others that will. I would hope that we're part of the 'unlucky' minority. We will be advising Disney of our experience and concerns. Roll on Poly next year. BC - can't wait to get back ;-)

Reviews.Title: “WONDERFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: akerue
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and our four small children,ages 9 mon.,3,5,7., spent 6 great days here in mid September. This is our second stay, the first being in October 2003. WE LOVE THIS PLACE ! We have stayed at other disney resorts, but none come close to comparing with the Grand Floridian. We arrived and our room was ready early at 12 noon. We had requested a view of Cinderella's Castle and we had a beautiful lagoon view room in the Conche Key building. It was convenient to the boat dock which had boats going to the Magic Kingdom. We had requested a refridgerator, microwave, and crib, all of which arrived within minutes to our beautiful, very clean room. The bellman who took our luggage was so great with our children! He gave them mickey stickers, told them jokes etc. Everyone from the front desk clerks, the housekeeping staff, the bellmen, the grounds crew were EXCEPTIONALLY helpful and friendly! The lobby is georgeous with live piano music the kids danced to , and huge fresh floral arrangements. The pool areas and the grounds were well cared for. We had a yummy character meal at the 1900 Park Fare, dinner included Cinderella, Fairy Godmother, Prince Charming and Mice from the movie. Room service was delicious and prompt. WE CAN'T WAIT TO RETURN!!!!

Reviews.Title: “GF - The Good and the Bad”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: THE GOOD: My husband, 20 month old daughter and I stayed at the GF Sept 16-18, 2005. We were in the Boca Chica building, 4th floor Lagoon View, private balcony with a view of Cinderella's castle! Boca Chica is right by a large 24 hour pool and close to the boat dock. The room was spacious and beautiful with dormer ceiling, two sinks in the bathroom (LOVE that) a desk, table and chairs on the balcony. Water pressure in the shower was ok. Cast Members at check-in and check-out were cordial and housekeeping was very polite and always said hello! The Boca Chica building was in excellent condition and did not show any wear and tear as others have noted... Character Breakfast was DELICIOUS, excellent food for the price! made-to-order omelletes, fresh fruit, pastries, baked goods, cereal, breakfast meats, the best OJ I have tasted in along time plus more! Pooh, Eeyore, the Mad Hatter and the Princess from the Hercules movie made their rounds and Mary Poppins too. THE BAD: We stayed in a room that averages $550.00 a night and we could hear our next door neighbor's baby crying very loudly thru the wall!!! NO Soundproofing in a luxury resort!? VERY disappointing! Could also hear people USING and flushing their toilets as clear as day! NOT pleasant. The faucets in both sinks were loose. I had requested a crib, a hi-chair and a frig and NONE of these items were in the room upon arrival. The balcony was not clean, chairs and table were dirty. Housekeeping did not replenish used shampoos, etc the next day, left some trash and did not wipe off furniture surfaces. Ate Dinner at one of the "moderately" priced restaurants inside the main building (cant remember name) - French Onion soup was delicious but waay overpriced! PARK TIP: DO NOT I repeat DO NOT go to the Magic Kingdom on a Saturday. It is THE most crowded day of the week. Sunday was MUCH better! All in all the GF was beautiful but NOT worth the money UNLESS you can request a room without babies nearby and flushing toilets doesn't bother you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel !!!”
Reviews.Author: saffron900
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Grand Flo during Christmas 2004 (my partner, 8 month old son and myself). Only one major flaw for this magnificent hotel, and that is, that it is not exclusive enough for the guests that have paid a small fortune to stay there and encounter a bit of luxury. Even though we were staying there, we struggled to get into any of the hotel restaurants and found ourselves queing for what seemed like forever, whilst other residents from other properties in WDW walked straight through. My personal opinion is that, as this is a 5 * hotel the guests that have paid to stay in a 5 * hotel should get some sort of preferential treatment (especially when trying to book a table in their own hotel!) We have previously stayed in the Wilderness Lodge, which was fab and to be honest we might as well pay less and stay there, then use the facilities etc at the Grand Flo like everybody else!

Reviews.Title: “Still a cut above the rest of Disney”
Reviews.Author: BigBobbyRay
Reviews.Content: Third visit to "The Grand Flo" in five years and enjoyed it thoroughly. Main plus points - VERY helpful and friendly staff; good pool area; excellent grounds; brilliantly easy transport to all Disney parks and resorts (monorail, boat or bus). Dined for the first time at Victoria & Alberts - $800 for four of us, but it WAS very high standard. Citricos, Narcoosees and Floridian Cafe are also good quality restaurants. Plus there's a 24hr grill for snacks, drinks etc. Hotel lobby area, complete with live pianist or swing band, is amongst the most impressive I've ever seen. On check-in my wife mentioned that this was our third visit and cheekily asked if we might have a room up-grade. Hey presto - the manager offered us a ground floor lagoon view room (worth an extra $80 a night) at no cost! Later we had a problem with theme park tickets not working (entirely the fault of our tour company). When we mentioned it to the hotel people they gave us complimentary passes valid for all the Disney parks which we could use for a day or two while it was all being sorted out. Main "could be better" points - Main restaurant for character dining (1900 Park Fair) is crowded and, with so many kids, is a bit of a zoo. Buffet food here is average only. Also the bedrooms are not fully sound-proofed. Noise has never been a problem on previous visits, but this time we were next door to a family that seemed to be training for the All-American Shouting Championships. Overall this is a very good quality place and a great refuge from the theme parks. As you'd expect it has prices to match.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Floridian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed the floridian! The service was good, the food was good at Narcoose's and Victoria and Albert's. The room was not a luxury resort room. However, the decor is unique and charming. I think you have to expect novelty at this hotel as opposed to adult luxury. The frequent traveler will find the room average and the theming extraordinary. Enjoy the hotel for what it is and don't compare it to many others as its purpose is different. This hotel is aimed at families who will spend the majority of their time at the theme parks and want to find the same type of theming when they return to their room.

Reviews.Title: “A Sentimental Favorite”
Reviews.Author: trinaunz
Reviews.Content: The Floridian means a lot to me. When I was a college student working over the summer at WDW in 1988, I was desperate for spending money and took an overtime shift at the Floridian, which at the time was being readied for its grand opening. One of my many jobs that night was to remove the 2x4s out of the gazebo in the back and sweep the place clean. Nearly ten years later, I hosted the cocktail hour for my wedding reception in that very same gazebo. Talk about coming full circle! The rest of our reception was in one of the GF's ballrooms and it went on until 12:30. I was pretty jazzed about spending the night in the honeymoon suite (value of $645 at the time, free for the exhausted but happy couple!) on the conciege floor. While my overall experience with the GF was marvelous - great party, wonderful food - I landed with a bit of a thud back on earth the next day. We asked to have our checkout time extended until 2 pm (I thought a reasonable request, since we'd gotten to the room so late after the wedding). We were told no. I was amazed and asked a manager to explain this to me (remember, we were on the conciege floor!) The story was that WDW was hosting a golf tournament and they needed to turn the room over someone involved with that. Now, you can guess that we spent a TON of money on the wedding (which I mentioned to the manager), and all we were asking for was another *three* hours in our (rather small, I might add) hotel room. Isn't check-in time 3:00? Still, the final answer was no. So the GF still has a special place in my heart, and I return there to visit every couple of years. Still love the lobby, the fireworks view from the hotel, and Narcoosee's (miss the yard beers, but they make the best Key Lime Martini you've ever had). But I have to admit I'll never forget them nickel-and-diming me on my honeymoon night!

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian Is The Best!!!”
Reviews.Author: castle701
Reviews.Content: We visit Orlando a lot. There is no finer hotel than this one. We travelalot and no other is close.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's a great hotel. It has great access to the theme park. It also has great rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A 'magical' stay at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the GF was "magical" from the moment we checked in. From the professionalism of the staff to the cleanliness of the grounds, this is one hotel I will return to. We were at Disney to celebrate our son's "Golden" birthday (he was 8 yrs. old on August 8th). When we arrived back to the room on the evening of the 8th there was a birthday cake and a signed photo by Mickey Mouse (see photo.) I am a person who likes change and when my husband asked if I would stay at the GF again, I said "absolutely." He asked "why" and I said "because when you find something so good, there is no need to change it." I will also be writing to "Guest Communications, Executive Offices" to praise the hospitality of a few staff members.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: brandyandbrian
Reviews.Content: As Disney Vacation Club Members, we are frequent visitors to Disney and have stayed at numerous hotels all over the property, but this was our first stay at the Grand Floridian. We were very impressed. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a concierge room in the main building with a direct view of Cinderella's castle without even asking. Our room (4303) was perfect. It was in the main building, concierge, and had a direct view of the lagoon and Cinderella's castle. We could see the fireworks every night right from our balcony. The room was similar in size to other Disney deluxe properties, but what really sets this hotel apart from other deluxe resorts are the beautifully manicured hotel grounds and the superior service. Both pools were great and we particularly enjoyed the beach cabanas. I spent an entire day at the spa with the Spa Escape package which included a secret garden bath, massage, facial, manicure and pedicure. Although I felt it was a little overpriced, it was a very relaxing day and the spa therapists were great. As for dining we tried the buffet character breakfast at 1900 Park Fare which was nice, especially if you have children, but it is a lot of food (much more than I would normally eat for breakfast). We had dinner one evening at Victoria and Albert's. Ther service was fantastic, but for what you pay, the food seems to have gone down hill in the past several years. Overall the Grand Flroidian is a wonderful hotel and I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Horribly overpriced and sorely in need of renovation”
Reviews.Author: nomoo
Reviews.Content: If this is one of the best that WDW has to offer then I'd hate to see the rest. The lobby is certainly "grand" in the strict sense of the word, and I'll give credit for the immaculate (if uninspiring) gardens, but otherwise this resort has little to recommend it and a host of reasons to avoid it. Superficially (in common with much of the rest of WDW I suppose) all seems fine at first glance, but on closer inspection all sorts of problems emerge. First, our room was horrible. For the price, it was really tiny, and was badly sound-proofed against noise coming up through the atrium and from the room next door. The decor was tired and the sheets were dirty, while the hinges on the bathroom door were rusted due to an extractor fan that worked but not very well. The bath and shower (all-in-one) were showing signs of age and the toiletries provided were cheap and nasty. Housekeeping was shoddy at best: our bedside lamps were dusty and had cobwebs on them, while our room wasn't vacuumed once during our stay. Nor was the balcony ever cleaned - the table and chairs were dirty and dusty. We sent about 2-3 days' worth of clothes for laundering, and it came back neither ironed nor folded, and one item was somehow stuck to a rather sticky hanger - for this we were supposed to pay almost $200 (when we complained the charge was waived). Overall, the room looked like it hadn't seen a makeover since the place was built, and probably hadn't seen a real clean for a similarly long period. As for the food, we found Citrico's to be okay but somewhat expensive for what you got. The character breakfast at 1900 Park Fare was entertaining for the kids, but a culinary experience it was not, and it was VERY busy (we only went once because every other day we tried to go the wait time was 30 minutes or more). The Grand Floridian Cafe was somewhat more sedate, but quality of service was very patchy, with some staff being somewhat less than friendly. Once again, the decor here was very tired, showing obvious signs of wear and tear in many places. As a general comment, we found eating properly at WDW to be a real challenge. Aside from portion sizes that could feed a small village, even the so-called "healthy" options weren't really. WDW is great if all you want is burgers, chips, pizzas and ice-creams, but if you're just looking for a salad or something simple that isn't covered in a fatty over-sugared sauce then best you pack your own. The pools were decent, except that poolside eating options were almost non-existent. A very limited menu was available and had to be phoned in (i.e. no waiters), or else you could buy a packet of chips at the poolside bar. Overall, I have to say that the Grand Floridian Resort is not a deluxe hotel. A "grand" five storey atrium in the lobby and dressed up doormen can't hide the fact that at its heart this is a very mediocre and tired hotel, worth no more than 3 stars max. If the price was more reasonable then I could probably overlook much of the criticisms above, but as it is I really expected much, much more and was sadly disappointed instead.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Resort”
Reviews.Author: tootles1
Reviews.Content: Stayed 5 days and had a marvelous time. They have the most pleasant staff I have ever encountered. The grounds are beautiful and there is plenty for the children to do. Went on the boats so the children could drive and you were able to go all the way to the campgrounds at Disney; it was a wonderful scenic drive in the boats! They have a pool with a waterslide and three lifeguards on duty. We could see the Magic Kingdom fireworks every night from the pool or our balcony and the light parade could be seen from the dock. The food was absolutely magnificent and you felt as if each dish was cooked especially for you. The rooms were very clean and beautifully decorated. After a long day at the parks it was nice to come back to your room and see that your beds had been turned down with a chocolate left on your pillow and fresh ice in the bucket. You have the buses, boats or monorail for your transportation and really don't wait long at all for any of them. They also have a spa which we didn't get to. Now that we've stayed here and have been so pampered, it will be hard to stay anywhere else at Disney! I can't say enough about this wonderful resort; they've thought of everything to make sure you really have a magnificent time. We can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “This resort is Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Triverswi
Reviews.Content: My family and I just got back from WDW. We stayed at the GF and absolutley loved it. We were in the Conch Cay building with a lagoon view. We saw the boats coming and going and at night we saw the boat with the lights and music. In the other reviews some people complained of the thin walls. Well There were people with children on both sides of my room and I didn't here them at all. The only thing I heard was when someone flushed the toilet because it has a loud flush. The staff were very accomadating and friendly. The only compliant I have is when my husband and I decided to go for a midnight swim at the pool, young children were in it. Other than that we really enjoyed ourselves and yes we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “We had a Grand time!”
Reviews.Author: gargamel
Reviews.Content: Ok, so I am a native Floridian from East Orlando, and the trip to Disney is just a 40 minute trek around State Road 417....but ever since The Grand Floridian was under construction, I've always wanted to stay there. I booked a 2 night stay, Lagoon view for 2 adults and 1 child. We originally wanted a concierge level lagoon view room but these were all taken. The only remaining choices were the lodge tower and a lagoon view room. Since the Lodge Tower rooms don't have a balcony area, we opted for the lagoon view. We arrived at the GF around 8AM, with plans to visit the Magic Kingdom and ferry back to check in at the appointed check-in time. However, after we were greeted at the guard gate of the GF and directed to Valet parking, the truly magical staff at the GF saw to it that we would get our room immediately. The very helpful staff quickly found us a lagoon view room in Big Pine Key, 4th floor overlooking the Polynesian. The bell hop, also serving as an impromptu tour guide, drove us over the grounds and explained each building. He also took the time to explain all of the new rides since I hadn't visited the Disney parks in more than 5 years. Another nice touch was that he also got us a bucket of ice and set the AC for us to an acceptable temperature while providing us with maps of the various parks. The appearance of Big Pine Key was disappointing throughout our stay. The entire bottom floor had seemingly become headquarters for the housecleaning staff who had vacuum cleaners, carts and loads of dirty laundry strewn all over the floor at all times, day and night. Right outside the door was a virtual parking lot full of golf carts belonging to the boisterous maintenance workers who frequently yelled through us to each other. The spectacular lobby that you see in the pictures will not be the lobby you are coming home to each night unless you stay in the main building. The room was a little smaller than expected--and I have had much larger rooms in hotels that cost 1/2 the price. There were two Queen sized beds with the Alice in Wonderland theme and wallpaper that supposedly was hiding Tinkerbell. (We never found Tinkerbell, BTW) The view was outstanding, even if it was not a view of Cinderella's castle. The beds were about what you might expect from a standard hotel - not comfortable and noisy. We heard other guests in the halls but never in adjacent rooms, so noise was not a big factor. The other thing that annoyed me a lot was a constant barrage of golf carts trying to run us over on the walkways in between the buildings and the pool. Every time I tried to walk anywhere I was forced off into the grass by these golf carts, sometimes carrying guests and sometimes carrying workers. I guess the only other complaint was the strong smell of what appeared to be feces or chemicals around the main building facing the pool/beach. That horrible smell remained there the whole weekend. I suspect they sprayed the foliage with some sort of fertilizer concoction. We reported it to the front desk and they were sincerely apologetic. Other than these things, everything else was wonderful. I wanted a smaller pontoon boat to tour the lagoon but the marina said they were under repair - so they gave me the 25' pontoon at the cost of the small speed racers. We spent about an hour in the lagoon which was well worth it. The price was still in the low $30's despite spending 60 minutes cruising around the lagoon. Perhaps they took pity on me and my boating skills. The pool by Big Pine Key was fairly large and nice. We got a chuckle since (to the chagrin of the staff) the local mallard duck population seems to have adopted this pool as their new morning habitat. The main pool (the nice one) is open from 10-10 and it was always packed with people. The slide was very nice for the kids. We went to the spa but quickly found out that, like the restuarants, you need Priority Seating for any of the treatments. In conclusion, I think our favorite part of the GF was the unbelievable staff and the excellent restuarants. This was an experience I am glad we were able to have. Prepare to walk long distances if you stay here to go between buildings and ammenities. The monorail service was quick and we never had to wait more than 5 minutes to catch one. The rooms are well-stocked - although you will pay dearly for any drinks or food in the room. If you are going to spend the money it takes to stay here, you might as well go ahead and upgrade to the concierge level and put in a request for the lagoon view. They will be reluctant to reserve such a room...but they will make note of it when you reserve. The GF front desk will accomodate you, I'm confident. If you are hungry, 1900 Park Fare has a breakfast buffet but Grand Floridian Cafe is much less crowded and has a highr quality breakfast for the same price. Narcoossee's was absolutely fabulous for our 8:30 reservation with window view. Citrico's was also fantastic. Just remember - if you plan to stay here and you are on any sort of budget, just add at least the price of another night's stay for the ammenities, tips and restuarants you will enjoy. I recommend this resort over all the other MK resorts, and I would stay here again, at concierge level and in a larger suite.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: dboss101
Reviews.Content: Just a beautiful, pleasant. perfect location resort. Just came back had the dining option to which I hightly recommend and hopper pass. for 7 nts it's really lovely especially in the lobby live music every mid afternoon. room was perfect had part lake and garden view we were on the 3 floor of the boca chica section and you can see the castle just above the restaurant which is included in the dining option (2) good food. they have a 24 fast food service there to which we didn"t find till the last day and you can use your counter service f/the dining option there too. At the park fare restaurant which is character themed is also included in the dining option all you can eat buffet.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful grand floridian”
Reviews.Author: dboss101
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 7 nts. Very pretty stayed in the boca chica section, originally had a garden view but upon check in I requested if possible an upgrade she said the hotel was full but she looked anyway and came up w/ a castle view above the restaurant so i had garden & lake view. The room was spacious 2 double beds and a daybed, table and double sinks. small balcony to sit out on, but it was too hot to stay for long the door to the bathroom was very close to the toilet bowl but it had a phone in the bathroom. hotel staff was nice. some didn't speak english or pretended not to be able to. I would recommend the dining option it was well worth not having to dig in your pocket for tips or cash it included it. And we ate grand. beds were very comfortable did not once wake up with back pain. ahhhh. the pools were heated the one by the beach had a nice slide. would also recommend eating at the park fare restauant it is buffet style all you can eat plus with characters and it's included in the dining option. I just love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Grand!”
Reviews.Author: Traveler720
Reviews.Content: The Grand Floridian was truly GRAND! We stayed in June and had a wonderful time. The grounds are beautiful, and the rooms well appointed. Because of the decor, they are much more "cozy" and comfortable than most other hotels. Our room was also perfectly clean, with no signs of any wear and tear at all (no scuffs on wall, stains, etc), which usually bothers me at most other hotels. The bed was extremely comfortable for a perfect night's sleep. The turndown service with chocolates was a nice touch, and even the small things like dimmers at the bed lights (which someone else mentioned) are appreciated. Several nights our housekeeper made animals out of the washcloths and towels which were cute. The staff was great -- they truly go out of the way to make everything perfect, even more so than at the other Disney resorts. Everyone always had a friendly "have a grand day!" or smile when you saw them. Some people have complained about the cost, and yes, this is a very expensive resort. We definitely thought it was worth it to splurge on this trip, and we enjoyed every minute of it! Even though we'd love to return every time we go to Disney World, we'll probably stay at a less expensive resort, until we can save up again for a special occasion. I would recommend the Grand Floridian to anyone visting Disney World looking for a beautiful, luxurious place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Grand Floridian was excellent!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were guest at the Grand Floridian from June 22 to 28th. We had a wonderful time. This hotel was more than we expected. We were upgraded and our accommodations were in the main building. We enjoyed most the paino playing in the lobby followed by the band on the second floor. I enjoyed seeing the brides taking their pictures. June is the month for weddings and I know there were at least three a day (more on the week-ends). The service was excellent and servers were the best!! When we visit again (maybe in the next three years) we will definitely live here. Some guest have rated the hotel low and I can't imagine why. Maybe they should live off-site and then they will see the difference. Thank you for a wonderful vacation!!!!

Reviews.Title: “A few spots away from spotless at Disney Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was eager to stay at the Disney Grand Floridian Resort and Spa upon receiving confirmation that we would be staying here for a work related conference. I just returned from 4 nights at the conference and was suprised how dissappointed I was with the quality of service and cleanliness of the room. First, we had been promised tickets and tags for the Disney Magical Express which did arrive once I returned home (actually they came in the same day I left). Once we arrived at the terminal and were directed to the Disney Magical Express, on the Disney employees wouldn't let us in without documentation. Once I explained, he still was insistent and required us to pull out our room confirmations. This was just to enter the line. Then once in line, we were promptly taken to a bus which was very nearly full. I'm glad I wasn't one of those that was first on the bus as I heard of 40-50 min. waits to get the bus full. In full Disney style we received a marketing video on the way on all the great things we could do at the resort. The Disney Magical Express bus was comfortable and clean with more legroom than the plane we had just gotten off of. Upon arrival at the Grand Floridian, we were checked in, but even though it was after 3pm, my room was not ready. Though upon waiting for about 2 minutes, I checked with another lobby attendent and he said it had been cleared. I went up to the room (5510) in Sago Cay and was pleasantly surprised by the decor and ammenities. The room had ample closest space to your right upon entering with two bathrobes hanging above the free safe for storage. The bathroom with two sinks was on the left and the marble countertop was beautiful. It was great to have 4 sets of towels without having to ask for them.
