Shower and toilet were in a separate room behind and there was a hamper for used towels -- a nice touch to have them out of the way. The main room was small (approx. 200-225 sq feet) but since I was on the top floor had raised dormer ceilings with a ceiling fan. There were two double beds that each had three pillows and several large accent pillows. The room decor was victorian in nature with pastels and several patterns between the walls and the bedding. Lace curtains were underneath the main curtains with a two deck chairs and a small table on the small balcony. I was overlooking the convention center, side lagoon, and the monorail heading off to the Magic Kingdom. The 20 inch TV was in a central wooden unit with multiple drawers. A wood cabinet held the mini bar and extras on the side. There was also a table with two chairs and a dressing bench at the end of one of the beds. Phones were on the table between the beds and in the bathroom. One big plus for staying onsite is the credit program, in which you can use your room key for all purchases (food, gifts, and park tickets) and then clear them up at the end. Also, package delivery is available from virtually everyone in the park and downtown disney (Ghiradelli's was excluded) Upon walking into the room, I did find trash (left over cigarette package in a non-smoking room no less, along with other papers) in the corner of the room, and in the drawer under the phone. I heard of others in our group having clothing left by the side of the beds. I did have a white stain (looked like toothpaste) in the bathroom on the carpet. I threw out the trash myself somewhat surprised, since Grand Floridian has been billed as a 4-5 star hotel and spa, but I can't think of the many times I have stayed at 5 stars - having to throw out someone elses trash. The bed was very comfortable in the evening and slept better than most room. I did not have a problem with surrounding noise, however, many of my friends did due to the thinner walls. One very comfortable feature was the lighting by the bed was on dimmer switches, so waking up in the morning was very pleasant as the lights didn't have to go up all the way. The alarm on the clock was a bit tricky to program (Sony's Dreammachine) since it had two alarms, but after several nights trying I got it working. Turndown service was offered every evening with chocolates left on the bed. The bed was double sheeted which was a great touch. Food is expensive, but the experience seemed worth it. We ate our first night at Narcoosee's for dinner, which lasted until the fireworks, which we watched on the outside verandah, then returned to our table for dessert. Our server was very friendly and accomodating. Once the conference started all I saw was the conference center, which was always well lit and comfortable. Food service was extremely quick and there was no waiting in line, even with a large group of over 300. Overall, I had a great stay at the Grand Floridian, but when I come back to Disney, I will most likely stay at some of the other resorts (Wilderness, Port Orleans, or the suites) as the room sizes are the same -- only the fixtures were somewhat upgraded, but for nearly double the price as some of the other resorts. I was concerned about the trash and while everything was taken care of once I mentioned it (slow drainage on the bathub, trash, etc.) Other hotels I have stayed at watch out for these things without having a guest having to bring them up.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, but WAY overpriced”
Reviews.Author: davegidd
Reviews.Content: We spent nearly two weeks in a concierge level room in the main building during the off season. The hotel itself is beautiful and refined, although there was no lack of screaming children even at $600 per night. This didn't bother us, but if you are expecting a quiet experience this isn't the place for it. We travel extensively and have stayed at top hotels all over the world. This is NOT a 5-star hotel by any stretch of the imagination. The room itself was spacious and comfortable, but we found the previous guest's underwear hanging in the closet upon arrival and partially eaten food in the refrigerator. Housekeeping was friendly, but never arrived before 3PM or later. Twice we had to push a large pile of dirty sheets out of the way to get to our door (no kidding!). We felt the concierge level was not worth the money service-wise. We had a dead-on view of Cinderella's Castle, but the room was very noisy with paper-thin walls. We could also hear the theme music from three floors below that started at 6AM every morning. Again, this didn't bother us, but is something to consider before paying these prices. The concierge staff was useless and sometimes downright rude. We asked where the laundry room was located and the reply was, "You walk right past it every day to get here." By the way, that wasn't true. It was actually one floor up in a different wing, something determined when I asked her to look it up on her computer. Otherwise, none of the concierge staff even looked up when guests walked by. The food provided in the lounge was gone within seconds of being put out and was never restocked that we saw. True this was the off season, but we were paying for this perk. All of the other cast members we encountered at the resort were friendly and helpful. The food served in all of the hotel's restaurants was outstanding, but the prices were astronomical! We arrived late on the first night and went to the on-site food court for snacks. A fruit salad, chicken fingers, a small pizza, and two large cookies cost us $35 and this was self-service. We would advise saving a few dollars and choosing any of the other deluxe resorts over this one. Although we had a nice time overall, we didn't feel we received anything close to what we paid for compared to "normal" hotels in this price range.

Reviews.Title: “The only way to do Disney”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 5 day vacation at the Grand Floridian. We used the Magical Express - which is slow, but convenient. When we arrived our rooms were ready and we received a complimentary concierge upgrade to the Sugar Loaf building. The rooms are nice, not huge. The surroundings are mostly serene, not rushed or crowded. The concierge was really helpful and arranged a last minute reservation for us at the California Grill -we also ate many snacks and every breakfast right there at the hotel during the refreshment hours. Being on the monorail is amazing - it's convenience can't be beat. The pools was nice and the restaurants were good (though the Park Fare 1900 character dinner was a big marginal). I don't know if this hotel really compares to a 4 star hotel in New York - but I've seen the other Disney resorts and for an escape and comfort - this is a great place - really the only place to escape when you are overloaded by the Disney crowds.

Reviews.Title: “Major disappointment!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Grand Floridian in May. It was a MAJOR disappointment. Most of the Cast Members could barely crack a smile and I have had 100% better service at some of the other Disney properties I have stayed at- including values and moderates. Two CM's were an exception to that out of probably 100 or more we came across. The hallways and some public areas were in need of major TLC. I don't think our room or the hallway outside it were vacuumed once. The monorail service was slow and inconsistent. We also were there during an athletic event- buses to Animal Kingdom and MGM Studios weren't running- but no one told us and we spent over an hour at the bus stop waiting for one. Our room was okay but I found it to be small and unimpressive given the price we paid for it. There are so many other deluxe cateogry hotels on property that even though pricey, give you alot more bang for your buck!

Reviews.Title: “Totally worth it!”
Reviews.Author: Swenska
Reviews.Content: We had two rooms on the Royal Palms concierge floors (in the main building). It was expensive, but worth it. We each got upgraded to one of the honeymoon suites (we were four adults, no children, so maybe that's what did it; we had only requested lagoon-view rooms). These suites were round, tons of windows, got to see the lagoon AND the monorail. Plus you can open the door to your room and hear the piano player/orchestra wafting up from the lobby. Food was divine. The wine snob among us said they served quite decent wines and liquers. I'm not sure we were ever there for the lunch spread, but breakfast was fine, the pre-dinner hour spread was fabulous, and they kept the liquer/desserts out until 10:30 PM so you could drift on in from the parks and grab a glass & plate to take back to your room. Ate the night we got in at Narcoossee's. Very good, but the real bonus is that you have a great view of the Magic Kingdom fireworks if you're in the restaurant at whatever time they go off (I think it was 9:30 when we were there). You cannot beat this for a "magical" start to a trip and, no, I don't work for Disney!!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a hotel! This hotel is true luxury. The service is wonderful. The dining is impeccable. The rooms are great. The view from my room was great. If you want a luxury Disney vacation, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “major disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I agree with the previous review... We have been Disney loyalists for 10 years visiting 6 times during that period and staying at many of the Disney run hotels. I think that the Grand is anything but grand..except for is cost!!! The grounds are multiuse for weddings and business events, so there is little "privacy" when you are on your balcony ant there are a bunch of corporate or wedding parites right out side your window. They also did not have my room choice available despite multple requests. There was no refig in the room inspite of claims to the contrary BUT they di have a minibar which was sickingly overpriced as usual. The hotel is stunning and the service was below avearge, with little interaction wiht the "cast members" except for the valet guys who park your car ..for $7 a day + tips ..if you want to park your car on your own without a fee, you have to park in a parking lot and walk about 200 yards back to the hotel..alot of fun when you are tired or its raining.. Will never go back to this one..a real ripoff and major dissaponitment

Reviews.Title: “My 2 cents”
Reviews.Author: KurtBoston_MA
Reviews.Content: After reading all the mixed reviews, I thought I'd give my thoughts. I travel extensively (mostly on business) so feel I'm a pretty good judge. I stayed at this hotel years ago on business and my first reaction was the same as many listed below. My expectation was high, so therefore I thought the hotel was overrated and overrpriced. But I did go back in May with my wife and 4 year old to celebrate Mother's Day and my daughter's birthday. Since I don't get to travel with my family much and this is where my wife really wanted to be - this is where we stayed. I must say I was pleasantly surprised. The entrance is beautiful and the lobby is bright and grand. Check in was very smooth and quick and we lucked out with a corner room facing the Magic Kingdom and watched the fireworks from our room every night. Room was spacious, well-decorated and clean. Never did get turn down service though. I thought the grounds and pools were beautiful and every employee we encountered was helpful and greeted you with a smile - without exception. I personally loved the fitness center and spa. Off in a quiet locale and had great equipment and many nice amenities. Thought restaurants at hotel were great. Thought the character breakfast at 1900 Park was so good - we went twice. Excellent breakfast buffet, good service and characters everywhere. Ate at the Floridian Cafe one night too and atmosphere, service and food was excellent. Had room serivce the last morning and that was done well. What really makes the hotel nice too is the type of people that stay here. Everyone is subdued and pleasant. We stayed at Port Orleans once and were so disappointed. Service was horrific, restaurants were uninspiring, and crowd was rough. Have stayed at Yacht Club twice before and did like that hotel as well but even then we were awoken by loud and unruly guests. We can be quite fussy - but reasonable - and I must say this hotel helped to make this one of our best family vacations yet.

Reviews.Title: “Some thoughts on Disney Magical Express...to the GF”
Reviews.Author: cold_co_2004
Reviews.Content: We stayed four nights in late May. Flew into Orlando airport at 10:25pm, and used the (Disney recommended) Magical Express, which is the Disney bus to your hotel (free of charge). However, we waited for nearly 45 minutes to actually leave the airport, and then had to stop at three hotels on the way to the GF. Our check-in was slow; the only clerk on duty (or so she said) had to escort some people to their room - took another 15 minutes. We then had to wait for our bags (it is now 2am) - which Disney is supposed to claim for you at the airport and get them to the hotel. Finally my husband went to find them at the front entrance - my bag was missing and not delivered until morning. Nothing magical about this. So this is my advice - don't use the Disney Magical Express is you want to get to the hotel quickly! The GF is the LAST stop on their route...even if your room costs twice as much as anyone else!! Get your own bags, get a taxi (about $60) and get on with your vacation! The Magical Express will add two hours to your trip! They also want you to check-in three hours before departure, which is a lot if you're making the most of a Disney day. We cabbed it and it took 1/2 hour - arrived at the airport in plenty of time. They will get a cab for you - they're ususally right there waiting...and of course will hold your bags after check-out. Other than these snafus (the GF clerk called them "technical problems") we really enjoyed the hotel! Beautiful rooms, clean & friendly service (other than our ridiculous check-in). One other thought: if the weather is nice, it's definitely worth taking the little resort shuttle boat BACK from Disney. During busy times, they leave Disney every 7 minutes or so - and then you don't have to go the circle route on the Monorail - which gets a little old after a few times! Much faster and very pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “ok, but not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were very excited to be going to the Grand Floridian. It was a vacation we had saved and saved for. Before staying there , we stayed at the Orlando Marriott Resort and Convention center, and I will say I would stay there again in a heartbeat rather than the GF. I will say check in was fine, our room was ready early, we had arrived at 8:30 in the morning. I will say I was dissapointed in the rooms. They were large and roomy, but were also in need of repair. Not worth the money at all! I spend over 500 a night and didn't feel like it was worth it. I loved being by the monorail, but other than that I don't think I would go stay again. Even my kids agreed they were disappointed with the hotel. The rooms have a motion detector for your AC so be sure to have them overide it or you come back hot from the parks to a hot room. The food was ok and the Character breakfasts were fun, but I just can justfy spending that much money when I had stayed at the Marriott that only charged me 218 with AAA and I felt like a queen and I was sad to leave it!!!!! The bathroom had a hole in the wall were someone had opened the door to the room to fast and the ceiling fan covers were missing. All in all not a very pleasing room to look at, maybe we will try the Polynesian or just stay at the marriott.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the GF from May 4th-7th. Considering the price of this hotel, we had high expectations! The hotel and pool area are very pretty. We arrived early, around 8am to find out that our room would not be ready until 4/5pm. It was rainy so we couldn't lounge by the pool and the clerk couldn't give us any ideas on what to do with the day. We returned later on that day and our room was ready, I asked for a room of the castle, but was told that we didn't pay enough for that upgrade. I had requested a room with a king sized bed, but was unable to get that also. We could have moved rooms the next day, but we would have had to vacate our room by 11am and it would not be ready until 4/5pm. So, we decided to stay in our room facing the monorail. For $400+ per night, I would expect to not face a monorail and at least have a room facing the gardens. The resort was fine, the service was adequate, but again for that price, it should be well above average. We stayed for 3 nights, but only received turn down service one night. On the night that we did receive the turn down service, our door was left open...not unlocked - open. I tried to call down to the reception area, but was put on hold for over 5 minutes. I then proceeded to the reception area where I was told to go back to my room and wait for a phone call. After finally speaking with a manager, I was told that if there was anything missing, he would be happy to fill out a report. He never apologized for my inconvenience. A motel 6 would even say they were sorry. There were nice parts of this hotel, the convenience to the monorail, the breakfasts at the hotel and the pool. This is my first experience with a Disney hotel. I'm concerned that if this is the best they have to offer, the other ones must be really lacking in service. I've read other reviews that say that this hotel is nice if you don't have high expectations. However, who pays this kind of money and doesn't expect what they pay for? We may bring our children back to Disney, but will definitely not stay at the Grand Floridian again.

Reviews.Title: “The Grand was Good.”
Reviews.Author: GirlPenguin
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Grand Floridian April 23-27. We arrived at noon but our room was not ready. We had requested a king sized bed well in advance, but they did not have one available in our room category, so they upgraded us to a room with a view of Cinderella's castle! It was really nice - we got to watch the fireworks from our balcony every night. The only bad part was that we had to wait until 4 p.m. to get our room, so we went over to the parks and came back and got our room around 5. We then called for our bags, and it took an hour for our bags to get to us. We were starving and wanted to go to dinner but couldn't leave because of the wait for our bags. That was annoying. The room did not have a fridge in it (I thought they all had fridges now) so we had to call housekeeping and request a fridge. However, they brought it promptly and there was no additional charge. We ate at Norcoocise's and it was our most expensive meal of the vacation (and we ate at many nice resturants!) We weren't really impresssed...the food wasn't that great and it seemed really over-priced compared to other places we ate, like Fulton's Crab House at Downtown Disney. The other major complaint I have about the Grand Floridian was that the water was HORRIBLE tasting! Thank goodness we bought bottled water at the grocery store before-hand, because it was hideous! You couldn't even rinse your mouth out without gagging. The good: The service was very nice (especially the gal at check-in who upgraded us to a nicer room without us even saying anything), the property was BEAUTIFUL and very clean, the pool area was quite nice, and being so close to the monorail was wonderful. Our beds were turned down for us every night and chocolates were left on our pillows. Overall, I'd reccomend the Grand Floridian, but it was our first time to Disney and staying on Disney property, and I suspect the other resorts would be just as nice without being as pricey.

Reviews.Title: “A Quiet Place to Rest”
Reviews.Author: nanicinema
Reviews.Content: We took our 3 year old for a quick two day trip to the Magic Kingdom in March. We were told that the Grand Floridian was the place to stay despite the high price because of the short trip to and from the MK - and our friends were right, it did make a huge difference to us. The hotel is peaceful and the food was okay. To be perfectly honest it isn't a luxury hotel - more like a cozy B&B version of a Marriot hotel. However, our daughter loved the pools and the friendly staff, and the adults did sleep well. We would go again - just keep your expectations low.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was compelled to write this after reading the trashing of this exquisite resort. I've stayed at the grand floridian about 5 times, since it's first year of operation. It is absolutely exquisite and the people complaining sound like old snobs who were expecting it to be a retirement community. YES, there are children, THIS IS DISNEYWORLD. I have never in my 10 or so visits to Disneyworld been rude to by staff...if anything the niceness is overkill. The rooms are spotless, no detail is forgotten. The restaurants are excellent- some are better for just breakfast or lunch, but Narcoosie's is fabulous for dinner. You can't come near the convenience and speed of the monorail by staying at the nearby Ritz. Only twice have I gone to Disneyworld and stayed at a "non Disney" hotel and it's simply not "the same." To get the full experience, the Disney resorts- especailly the Grand Floridian- are a must.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 5 star resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 9am and did not get my room until 330pm. Stayed in Big Pine Key which appeared to be one the older buildings with worn carpet and dirty walls. The building smelled like a cafeteria, most likely due to the private dining trays which were left in the hallway for most of the day. Poolside bar, by waterslide, remained closed for a day and a half, unknown why. The only staff that seemed friendly or interested in you are the ones working for tips. Bottom line, this is not a 5 star resort, nor is it worth the $470 a night they charge.

Reviews.Title: “Will not return”
Reviews.Author: Billiebob
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here on a business conference. We are 50 and empty nesters. We did not enjoy the property very much. The noise level is very loud with all the children crying and screaming and running down the halls. Our room was situated near the service area where we heard garbage trucks at 2:00a.m. and the monorail from 7:00a.m - 11:00 p.m. and the carts of towels and food being carted around. The room was nice and comfortable but we could hear our neighbors' children screaming through the walls. The food in the Floridian restaurant is average. We did have an enjoyable meal at the California Grill at the Contemporary Resort but make a reservation well in advance. The pools were nice. The health club and spa was also nice. It is not a place for people who do not like small children crying and screaming and misbehaving in restaurants, hallways, pools and bedrooms!!!.

Reviews.Title: “We Must All Be Crazy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As a fairly well traveled person, who has experienced many different resorts in regions throughout the world, I found this hotel to be the most pretentious and over-priced anywhere. Only because my daughter and her two friends wanted to experience the "Magic KIngdom" on the Disney property did we pick the Grand Floridian. Nothing there is worth the $550 per night per room (2) plus tax. I repeat, nothing. Valet, food, pool, room,spa, golf, service, attitude and overall feeling are all hype, no substance. And everything costs plenty. As I looked around at the huge crowds, I stopped and thought, "We all must be crazy" to pay this price for this bit of average amenities. These folks do a real good job of selling this experience as magical, but its not. We will never, ever return to a Disney property for this magical experience. For the same dollar, the Ritz or the Peabody delivers. We've even stayed at a 5 bedroom luxury house with swimming pool, game room and big screen tv's nearby for $350 per night. Forget Disney and their ripoffs; there are much better ways to enjoy Orlando than staying on the World grounds.

Reviews.Title: “SOOO Kind”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After planning our vacation. My family and I decided to have a Disney breakfast at the Grand Floridian. Just as we were about to sit down to breakfast my nephew had a Grand Mal seizure......It was very scary and unexpected, but all I can say is the staff at the Grand Floridian made the whole situation so much easier. I never have incounted such kindness ....My family and I were staying outside disney, but If given the chance again I would choose a disney property.....especially the Grand Floridian.....They could not have been kinder, they were able to get medical help faster then if we had been home and then proceeded to look after us including buying us breakfast.....It made our whole family feel so good and safe....especially the Manager of the restaurant.....He was wonderful !!

Reviews.Title: “Easter Disaster”
Reviews.Author: GVSBethesda_Maryland
Reviews.Content: After much hipe and wait, we finally checked into the famous resort and paid dearly for the room. The wait for check-in was worse than Las Vegas. We waited forever. Then we we finally got face-to-face with the desk agent, she turned out to be rude and uncaring, prefering to talk to her next-door agent. Then we waited five more hours to get the room clean. We must have gotten the worst room of all. The furthest from everything. The walls were peeling, the bathroom was dirty, the bedspreads were stained, the chairs were broken, the halls were unkept with dirty dishes all over. Not much pixie dust. The parks were crowded but that was expected because it was a holiday. Inside the hotel, because of the price, one would think the treatment would be different. Nothing special. I would have preferred to pay less elsewhere. We had a car rental so we could have driven into the parks everyday. I heard that the Grand Cypress was better and cheaper...and Ritz Carlton was the same price but more amenities. Maybe next time. The only so-called advantage for staying on property was the transportation of bus or monorail. The busses were always late and full and the monorail times were inconsistent and smelly. Cannot wait for our next real vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I found "Trip Advisor" helpful in selecting the Grand Floridian, so am going to return the favor by adding our two cents worth. We approached our trip to Disney World with a bit of apprehension. As former consultants, my wife and I have had the occasion to stay at many outstanding properties (including a previous weekend at the Grand Floridian). We were a little wary of the "Disney Machine", but in the end the Grand Floridian won us over. From the moment we checked in, I found the staff to be unfailingly friendly and professional. We were given a complimentary upgrade and had a very nice room on the concierge floor with a great view of the pool area. The room was not large, but exceptionally well appointed and very comfortable - even with a 3 year old running around. We greatly enjoyed the variety offered at the hotel. Our daughter loved the pool and beach (even though it was a bit nippy in early Feb), we got a take-out pizza one night and another night went to the "upscale" fish restaurant on the water. Both nights we were able to view the Magic Kindgom fireworks comfortably from the hotel's dock area, and one night the concierge set us up on a private balcony. As a former musician, I can tell you that the lobby band and the pianists are first rate. Set aside some time to enjoy them as they are really worthy of the attention. My big issue with hotels is this: they all have been caught in the same crunch as the airlines lately, but they still pass the same old BS about "we'll do anything to make you happy". My recent experience has been that they'll do anything to make you happy as long as it's exactly what they were going to do anyway. I wrote a three page mad letter to the COO of Marriott about the terrible experience we had the the loverly "Ritz Carlgon Laguna Niguel" last year because we were treated like cattle. Conversely, the team at the Grand Floridian seemed like they were having fun, and we had fun with them. Two suggestions: Skip the character breakfast, you'll have plenty of opportunities to see Characters at the park. My daughter cried because it took the characters almost 45 minutes to finally get to her. Second, you can get into the park early if you're staying on the property. If you get there early and take advantage of the "smart pass" option, you can pack in some additinoal rides before the park gets full around noon. Kudos to the team at the Grand Floridian. I don't know that we'll make this an annual event, but I would definitly spend the $$ to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Beach/Yacht Club Instead!”
Reviews.Author: WanderingAmerican
Reviews.Content: We are regular Yacht Club guests but we decided to try the Grand Floridian and were sorely disappointed for the following reasons: 1. Lobby, though elegant, has the ambience of Grand Central Station in NY 2. Short but SLOW (average 20mins) line at check-in and check-out. 3. Inconvenient self-park, lousy valet parking. 4. I had to get some things out of our luggages which was taken for temporary storage while our room (which did not get cleaned after 3 PM) was ready for us at check-in. I went to the bell captain who then gives me the direction to their storage room and tells me to check it myself. So I go in there and I am in between two rolling shelves trying to get my luggage out and then the shelf starts moving towards me! A porter, who had no idea I was behind the shelf started making room on his side to put a luggage in. I almost got hurt. He says sorry but never offered to help me! 5. One of the front desk employees was not only rude to the other guests in line but was also making insinuations to anyone within hearing distance that none of her colleagues was working as hard as she was. She said that they (her co-workers) should be taking in some of the guests instead of her doing all the work. I felt bad that I was being helped by her. 6. We made the mistake of going to the parks first and then going to our now ready room at 10 PM. Well, the luggages were not in our room. We called the front deak and for 1 hour could not get through! If you were to go over there (which is quite a distance), you'd have to be on line for 20 minutes anyway. The bell captain's phone line just kept ringing. So my husband had to walk back anyway to ask for them to bring in our luggages. After one hour of trying to get hold of the front desk, I finally got hold of someone. I told her I wanted to speak with the manager - she said he wasn't in. So I said, have him call me tomorrow. No one called back. 7. Room is blah. Pool is blah. You are better off trying out the Yacht Club where I never had any problem with service. The porters there memorize your name. They greet you by your name each day they see. The lines are shorter and faster. The pool is incredible. And it's less money. (Not much less but they give you more in return!) I would not consider going back to the Grand Floridian. The only positive I could say about it is we did enjoy Victoria and Albert.

Reviews.Title: “Wouldn't stay anywhere else”
Reviews.Author: RedCharleston
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from 3 nights at the Grand Floridian. The staff, the accomodations, and everything else were wonderful. In fact, when we return to Disney, this is where we will stay. We stayed in Room 4317 of the Main Building Concierge rooms. The room was very nice, not dated at all, with plenty of speace, and very very clean. The concierge service was excellent -- all of the food served was great. From 6-10:30am was breakfast, with plenty of food and beverage choices; 11-2:30pm was lunch; from 3-4:30pm was tea; from 5-7pm was wine, champagne, beer, and heavy hors d'ouvres; and from 8-10pm was desserts and liquors,etc. It was very easy to get to all of the parks from here. Everyone was extremely friendly. We could se the Magic Kingdom fireworks from our balcomy. The balcony was a good size and was very clean as well. This really is an oasis in the middle of a lot of activity. I highly recommend this property.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Place to Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Disney - stayed 5 nights at the Grand Floridian January 29th through Feb 3rd and thought the hotel was outstanding. We have stayed at a lot of other five star hotels in the US and this property is right at the top of the list. The location can’t be beat as we were traveling to Disney with a 3 year old - quick access via the monorail to Magic Kingdom, Epcot and the Contemporary. Bus rides to MGM and Animal Kingdom took about 30 minutes in total counting the wait time at the bus stop. With all of the over-stimulation of the Disney theme parks and the character meals – the hotel offered us a quiet retreat. The staff was extremely courteous and was prompt with all of our requests - bed rails, mini fridge, etc. At check in we even received an upgraded room and although we booked a garden view room we were given a room on the 5th floor of the Boca Chica building with a partial view of the Magic Kingdom. The rooms on the top floor have vaulted ceilings and thus we didn’t have that standard hotel room feel at all which was a huge plus. My husband and I were also pleasantly surprised about the size of the room after all of the negative reviews complaining about the small rooms at Disney. We have no complaints about the property we loved the fact that it had the pools, the beach and at night we could watch the fireworks from the property if we didnt head over to the Magic Kingdom. We would definitely stay at this resort again.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon, June 2004”
Reviews.Author: LRBarney76
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a week here for our honeymoon. This was my first time here and we couldn't have dreamed for a better honeymoon destination. Everyone who worked there was extremely friendly and helpful. The rooms were gorgeous and the hotel and grounds were out of this world. The amenities that were included could not have been better, from boat rentals to massages. We can't wait to stay here again the next time we visit Disney World. It was a magical time for us, and we could not have picked a more elegant and romantic hotel for our honeymoon.

Reviews.Title: “Fulfilled every expectation”
Reviews.Author: Beckalees
Reviews.Content: This hotel is gorgeous! I loved every minute that I spent there. I visited this hotel in June for over a week and even after 9 days I didn't want to leave. The decorations were so inspiring I went home and wanted to decorate with pinapple wall paper and humongous birdcages. We had a room with the balcony facing a lake. We watched the fireworks over cinderella's castle from our balcony every night. There were wonderful fancy restaurants and room service, or a grill to eat at. There was nothing missing from this hotel. It was perfect and I have no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “Everyday was a 'Grand' day.”
Reviews.Author: SJDB
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were married in Walt Disney World on August 28, 2004. We stayed at the Grand Floridian from Aug. 26 - Aug. 30. We wish that we could have stayed longer! The Grand Floridian is just that - Grand. We were upgraded to the Turret Honeymoon Suite, room 4030, on the 5th floor in the Main Building. Breathtaking views of the pool, Wedding Pavilion, and monorail were right outside our wrap around windows. The room was very well appointed, with a four-poster bed, and a huge walk-in closet. The concierge service was excellent as well. They had 5 food displays everyday, and each was great. They also had champagne and wine with the evening display. Both pools are lovely. While I was swimming around in the main pool, I realized that the Grand is probably the nicest resort around. You almost forget for a moment that you are in Disney. The elegance and sophistication of the resort is exceptional. Disney hit the nail right on the head with the Grand Floridian. Right down to the period uniforms! I can't say enough good things about this resort! I can't wait to book my next trip.

Reviews.Title: “First disney vacation with kids”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just came back from spending the last week of Oct 2004 at the Grand Floridian. We chose this hotel for the convenience of being close to the parks and for the most part it was. We have a 2 year old and an 11 month old. It was very convenient to get to the magic kingdom, but coming back on the monorail we had to go through the other resorts and it took 20 minutes to get back. The boat is MUCH faster going back to the hotel. We took the bus to disney/mgm and animal kingdom and we had to wait about 10 minutes but it was much more convenient then driving over there. The bus to downtown disney took forever - 20 minutes in mid afternoon - we took a cab on the way back because we didn't want to be bothered. I agree with others that the rooms are nothing spectacular for the amount of money you are spending. We've stayed in much nicer hotels for 1/2 this price. But it is disney so we expected it and we weren't disappointed. We got 2 adjoining rooms so that our kids could nap during the day without being disturbed and we had no problem getting the adjoining rooms which was a relief. Our room had a problem in that one of the sinks didn't have cold water but we didn't really complain about it because the other sink worked fine. The rooms are very baby friendly. My 11 month old was crawling around the room and we didn't have to follow him every second to make sure he didn't bump into things. The service was very good - we ordered breakfast every morning through room service so that we could get to the parks early and the food was delivered promply at the time we specified. Food - we did the cinderella character dinner at 1900 park fare. VERY, VERY BAD!!! I wasn't expecting much but the selection and the quality of food was horrible. I had read in the unofficial guide to disney that the food quality was ok but this was by far the worst buffet I had ever eaten! We ate at one other buffet(Hollywood and vine - disney/mgm) and that was so far superior in terms of selection and quality! My family also ate at Narcossees(I didn't go - ate room service with my infant) and they told me that the food there was very good. When we weren't sleeping or resting in our room - we were at one of the parks so we didn't get a chance to use the pool or the facilities very much so I can't really comment except to say that they looked really well kept. My husband did get a massage which he wasn't thrilled with. We haven't stayed at any of the other disney hotels so I don't really have anything to compare it with. Overall, the hotel met our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Grand Floridian at Christmas Time”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family visited the Grand Floridian last year the first week in December. Wow, what a beautiful hotel. My husband and I travel a great deal, and no one does it like Disney. We took our 4 year old son for his first trip to the Magic Kingdom, Animal Kingdom, Epcot, and M.G.M. studios. We had so much fun that we are coming back this year and joining in on the fun are my brother, sister-in-law and two nephews. I was pregnant with our second son at the time and it was so wonderful to be able to watch the fireworks over the castle every night from our balcony in our P.J.'s. I wish that every family could experience Disney at Christmas time. Disney is the most magical and happiest place on earth anyway, but during Christmas even more so. We went to Mickey's very merry Christmas party and it actually "snowed" on Main Street. If you're debating whether it's worth taking this trip at Christmas, it absolutely is. And you won't find a more beautiful hotel. Our only negative experiences where as follows: It took a good deal of time checking in, we did however buy additional tickets at this time so this did make this a little too long of a time to wait for a pregnant woman with a 4 year old boy. I would think that paying this type of money that we would have had bathrobes waiting for us, this is a little luxury I plan on requesting prior to our arrival this year. All in all it was an experience that we'll treasure for the rest of our lives. Have your picture made in front of the World's Largest Gingerbread house for your Christmas Cards!!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous”
Reviews.Author: emerald444
Reviews.Content: After 5 days spent at the Grand Floridian Resort & Spa I went back to read all the bad reviews posted on this web site and I really can't understand them. This place is paradise. Every single part of this hotel is perfect. The rooms are huge, extremely clean, beautiful and my room was what they call "standard room". My standard room looked more like a suite! I travel a lot and always sleep in 4 or 5 stars hotels everywhere in the world but I've never seen such beautiful standard rooms. Everyone is extremely kind and always ready to help you. Our room was in the Sago Cay building where all the rooms are non-smoking. If you can afford this hotel you must stay here, you won't be disappointed. Fantastic!

Reviews.Title: “'Very Grand' Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family of four had a grand time at this luxurious hotel. The check-in was smooth. The car attendants were ok. the freont desk staff was wonderful. The bellmen coming and going were very accommodating. Our room was meticulous. My wife was a former house keeping manager at some four star hotels, so her requirements are exacting. The maid made little towel beds for my children's dalmatians. My family loved the lagoon view room of the castle. The grounds are beautiful and are constantly being refurbished. The only negative is the long walk to the self park parking lot, but being on the monorail line we only used our car a few times so that wasn't that much of a hassle. We look forward to staying at the Grand Floridian again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Disney's flagship, the fabulous Grand Floridian Resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed here before the Disney Cruise in August and were treated like royalty. The hotel is absolutely elegant, beautiful, warm and friendly. Food was average, but the service was the best. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “It's all about Expectations...”
Reviews.Author: loveandhardwork
Reviews.Content: It is interesting to have stayed at the Grand Floridian some years ago (it was breathtakingly beautiful) and then to revisit recently. It has changed. Even though this is the so-called hallmark of the Disney hotels, this one is being neglected. The paint is peeling, the gardens looked shabby and the rooms are worn. Our balcony was so full of bird dung that we were appalled and had to ask for a cleaning, recleaning and a last *clean this or we're moving out* cleaning. The room had candy wrappers under the furniture and the bathroom floor wasn't clean. The restaurants were dirty and the floors coming in and out were littered. Profit has triumphed over pride at Disney. Sadly, all of Disney has gone downhill. It used to be the gold standard for hospitality and cleanliness. Not so anymore. The park itself is dirty and smoking is again permitted. And don't even ASK me about the abomination that they still call Tiki Birds, which has been perverted from a sweet experience to a New York street brawl. I used to be Disney's most vocal fan. Now I think I will never return. Truly, the magic is gone.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon at the Grand Floridian”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful during the holidays. My husband and I were there from Nov. 30th - Dec. 4th. When we arrived, no one helped up with our bags. This was a little disappointing....especially considering how much we paid to stay at the hotel. Once we arrived at the front desk, the staff was very friendly. We stayed in one of the honeymoon suites in the main building. The room was "hidden" on a wing especially for honeymooners. We had to ride the elevator up to one floor, get off, and then ride another elevator down a floor. It was very tricky, but worth the peace and quite. We had a great view of the castle. However, the room wasn't any nicer than the standard rooms. The concierge was very helpful in arranging priority seating for meals. However, I recommend making these arrangements at least 30 days prior to your trip. Some places, such as Cinderella's Royal Table (the castle) were already booked in advance. We purchased the Dream Maker Gold package (which is really too much food). Next time we will buy the silver instead. There were refreshments served in the evening along the balcony overlooking the main lobby. It was very relaxing at the end of the day to sit in the lounge area and watch and listen to the musicians in the lobby. I recommend staying at the Grand Floridian during the holidays. The beautiful tree and decorations will really get you in the Christmas spirit. This is also considered the value season. We plan on returning this year for our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “the hotel saved my sanity”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I actually gasped when I slumped into the hotel from traveling a HOT and tiring journey. I felt like I was going to cry it was so beautiful. All went well and my daughter was immediately off to the Alice in Wonderland Tea while we waited briefly for our requested room to be ready. The a/c was ice cold and perfect. No screaming kids anywhere and if they did, their parents were considerate and sane and attended to their needs. Our room was Pine Key and perfect as it was very close to the main building and both pools. Food in Florida is never anything great compared to our Hudson Valley restaurants so I can't rave about that area of our visit. Ok. Get the ten dollar free refill cups and get as much coffee, tea, soda, juice as you want FREE for your entire stay. Don't order food from the pool bar as it is much more that walking over to Gaspirilla's where you can get a 2.00 pb and j and your free refill. I ordered Coors light by the pool for 5 dollars a few times a day and said "screw it I am on vacation." The pools are Beautiful. If there are towels on the chairs but nothing else, look around and if no bidders, move them and take over. Actually personal items need to take ownership of the chair if they are to be spoken for, and I never had a problem. It rained once and I didn't feel like going to the outdoor "nonrefundable" Backyard BBQ. I was fully refunded upon request by the Guest Service. Very classy. Hoop de doo Revue was a blast. Highly recommened. I laughed until it hurt. If you buy anything from the parks, have it sent to the hotel so you don't lose it. It is such a perk. TUrn down service was so yummy. Dim lights, chocolates and beds turned down just like mommy would do...SPOTLESS clean. I loved this hotel better than the parks or anything else. People are lovely and after a hot day at the park, a quiet and very welcoming place to call home waiting was like warm bath after being in a bicycle accident on a dirt road. Fabulous. The park 1900 for Character Dinner is better than the breakfast, food wise. Listen to the piano player in the early evening with a glass of something or other, use the free samplers at the fancy women's store for great eau de parfum for the evening, they don't care...laugh at the ducks that swim in the gorgeous and spotless clean pool because they own that place, watch the fireworks from the pool at 10 p.m while you swim and eat pizza by the moonlight and feel your heart cry with happiness that the world is a beautiful place. Have a really great time and appreciate your children and family. Hey, Svetlana in the main building is an amazing artist and does pastel portraits of your children like you've never seen in your life...bring a photo or do it live... enjoy 10 stars.....

Reviews.Title: “Grand But Pricey”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had heard a lot of hype for the Grand Floridian and for the most part it lived up to it. This is one beautiful place, from the lobby to the pools all class, but class comes with a hefty price tag. For starters $18 per day to use the work out facilities, $7.25 for a 12 oz. margarita, $2.50 for a bottle of water, and the best deal $6.50 for chicken strips and fries. With 3 kids we went broke on chicken and fries. Some really cool activities to do at the hotel, first the small mouse boats are alot of fun for $33 per hour, also we took a bass fishing charter $210 for 2 hours which is just outragoues and on top of that they charged me $15 for minnows. On top of all the excessive charges be ready to tip at every turn. Overall we had a great time but, as I said in the beginning it came at a pretty hefty price.

Reviews.Title: “Our Honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for our honeymoon and could not have chosen a better place to stay. They treated us very special. We felt as if they were celebrating our marriage with us. They really made our honeymoon very memorable.

Reviews.Title: “A lifetime's dream”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: For our 10th Wedding Annivesary and our 6th Florida visit, my wife and I decided to stay at the wonderful Grand Floridian. We booked the Seven Seas Lagoon view and were fortunate enough to have a view of the castle at the "conch key" building. The room's decor was in keeping with the Victorian theme with heavy but bright wallcoverings and dark wood furniture, with Alice in Wonderland characters subtly embroidered into the duvet covers. It felt like we could have been in Wendy, John and Michael's nursery waiting for Peter Pan!. The bathroom was fairly standard but had special Grand Floridian packaged toiletries (gratefully received as souvenirs!). The lobby is breathtaking, as you walk in there is a live band playing from the 2nd or 3rd floor. The ceiling has wonderful coloured glass domes and there is a unique glass elevator taking you to the 2nd floor. There is a further elevator that takes guests to the concierge rooms. We had dinner at Narcoossee's Restaurant, which is an octagonal building situated on the edge of the Seven Seas Lagoon. The restaurant specialises in seafood and the atmosphere was good, although a little too loud to be romantic, and our waiter was excellent. The only complaint we can make was of the staff in the small gift shop on the 2nd floor. They were unhelpful and disinterested to the point of ignorant.

Reviews.Title: “Our overall experience there was only slightly above mediocre.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friend and I had a three-day stay in the Concierge building of the Grand Floridian back around 14 February 2004 and we'd have to say that the overall experience was only slightly above average considering the hefty $500+ price for a room in that particular building and the closer proximity to the monorail. The Pluses: Beautiful hotel architecture, interior design, and grounds. Very friendly, courteous, and well groomed staff. Prompt check-in and check out. More privacy. Complementary snacks/finger foods prepared fresh three times a day in the exclusive lounge/TV area (the pineapple chunks served were absolutely the best I've ever tasted anywhere in the world). Free musical entertainment in the lobby (jazz/swing bands and pianist) filled the hotel with sound in the evenings. Exclusive elevator. The minuses: The room is only slightly larger than your average medium-budget hotel room (even with the sitting area, wet bar, and double sink) and it had only one suitcase stand. A room with a view of the Magic Kindom was not available and could not be reserved in advance. Boarding the monorail is only permitted on the ones heading toward the Magic Kingdom (even though the monorails head in both directions)--therefore you must go the "long way" if you want to visit the other parks. To access your car you must wait for the valet which can sometimes be a long one. One bit of advice: Bypass the "Magic Wishes" feature for your travel package unless you and your traveling companion(s) can eat a lot of food, golf, or fish.

Reviews.Title: “looks nice but...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just got back from here 2 days ago, and let me tell you it left alot to be desired. It is beautiful, but the rooms are very small, the bathrooms are incredibly tiny, and the service is'nt all that great. We stayed in Big Pine hich is waterfront, but not facing Disney which was okay we had a view of the beach, and were right behind the pool. Unless you plan to valet park which is 6.00/ day reasonable, but every time you leave they expect a tip, and we were leaving 4-5 times a day so this can get very expensive just to park, but the alternative is parking so far away it is unreal. The kicker was 3 days into our stay they lost our car keys yes, folks the 5 star resort lost our car keys, so there we stood for 45 minutes while everyone, and their mother went through 200 little envelopes searching finally they were found someone had misspeled our name, but I was upset at the fact you wasted my time. They did however say that the valet was free for the remainder of the stay, but it was our lst night. Now onto the bugs, bring your bugspray, because they have a terrible mosquito problem. My poor little boy whos 2 is covered in bug bites. Huge welts, and I think they must be immune to deet, because even after an application we could'nt enjoy the view from the balcony, because we were getting eaten alive. These are not normal bugs they really hurt. For that fact alone I would'nt go back. Anyway everything is rediculously overpriced, and you are pretty much stranded there is nothng close you are a disney hostage, and must pay $2 for a small cup of coffee which is complimentary if you wake up before 7 a.m. There are no soda machines , there is a little shop open 24/7, but everything is marked up 100% On the up side they do have a nice pool on the beach with a water slide, but although it says they close at 10 p.m. the hours vary one night it was 8 the next 8:30. Our last night we spent eating pizza, and watching fireworks which was nice, but another good plan foiled again by the mosquitos. Bottom line if you have money to throw away, and don't mind bugs this place is for you, but to tell you the truth I'd rather stay at Days inn Suites it cheap, close to everything, and you service is not much better at the so called 5 star resort with the exception of the fact they address you as Mr. & Mrs.

Reviews.Title: “Even the flowers are prettier”
Reviews.Author: dfred
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our third stay at the Grand Floridian and were glad we remained loyal to the most beautiful of the Disney resorts. We checked out the others and found them to be either too congested (as in the Boardwalk and Beach Club areas) or too dark in their decor (the browns of the Polynesian and Animal Kingdom.) The Grand Floridian is very bright, and open with a spacious feeling between the buildings and along the beach. Even the flowers are prettier here as the grounds are meticulously landscaped. The staff was most helpful and the overall feeling is very relaxed yet elegant. Transportation to Epcot can be a bit time consuming since you will need to change monorails, but a taxi is always an option if you are in a hurry.

Reviews.Title: “when you wish upon a star.....”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i loved the grand floridian. we stayed there for 3 nitghs and i didnt want to leave. it was easy to get to the parks, and easy to find food. our building, the sugar loaf, always had food in the lobby. the staff was extremely nice and helpful, and there was so many shops and dining areas. i charged all my purchases to my room key, adding to the convience. the resort itself was beautiful. there was so many birds and plants, evrything was clean. i loved the pools and the veiw. the rooms were very pretty, and the room servace even folded up blankets we brought along!! it was a magical vacation, and i cannot wait for another chance to stay there. it was a wonderful trip.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: HawaiiAndi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I travel extensively. Comparitively, the Grand Floridian is overpriced. The grounds are immaculate & staff are courteous. Room is average though housekeepers are meticulous. I was disappointed that I was charged an additional fee to use the exercise equipment; most hotels have this as a free amenity. I wondered what happened to the coffee pot that I read was "supposed" to be in each room, only to learn that one could be provided upon request (I did not learn of this until the day I checked out). It stormed while we were there; our room was detached from the main building so getting soaked is not an option unless you buy an raincoat. The hotel should consider having umbrellas at the door of each building for guests to use. The staff use "golf carts" to transport between buildings. They "drove" us to our building the day of check-in but thereafter, they never stopped their carts to offer guests shelter from the rain. The pools were OK, felt discouraged when ducks flew in to join me in a swim & decided to do 'their business' in it; jacuzzi was lukewarm, not hot enough. Cost of food is expensive, with a 100%-200% markup (although this applies to all of WDW). After staying at the Floridian for 4 nights we continued our remaining Orlando stay at another hotel in the Lake Buena Vista area for a third of what I paid and it was most satisfying. Overall, for the price, we expected more than a beautiful looking resort.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had dreamed of staying at this resort for many years, having bypassed it while on the monorail and staying at various Disney resort properties with much success. We chose to stay at the Grand Floridian to celebrate our tenth anniversary. As a side note, we had been staying at Universal Studios Portofino Resort on previous visits, so we were expecting at least comparable quality and luxury, if not more. On the positive side, the grounds were quite beautiful. Now to the negatives. Our room was located in the boca chica building, overlooking the lagoon, and the side of Cinderella's Castle which was glimpsed through towering pines. The bathroom was miniscule, so much in fact that one could not close the door without scraping the edge of the toilet seat. The mattresses were uncomfortable, the shower head was broken, and the faucet handle was difficult to turn. Also, room service dinner was lukewarm, and nothing special. Overall, the conclusion we drew was that you pay for the name, and to say "I stayed at the Grand Floridian". We switched to the Contemporary, which though not as ornate, fits the bill: good food, monorail, better view from tower room, and less expense. This is just an opinion, perhaps we received a room that had not been refurbished, and we simply feel we've spent our money better elsewhere. After staying at the Portofino, nothing else quite compares.

Reviews.Title: “Wish Upon A Star Come True”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: As many times as I have ridden the monarail, I always dreamed as it stopped at the Grand Floriandian, That someday I will stay there. My dream did come true, and we spend four unbelieveable days. The weather was perfect, the service way beyond my wildess expect- tion. The hotel is beyond description, as far as beauty, service, the attention paid to guests etc. My only to sum up of how pleased I was is: I'LL BE BACK, WITHOUT A DOUBT!!!!! NEXT BEST THING TO HAWAII
